text: A friend  recommended this new place to try. I got the famous PBJ burger,it wasn't what I expected  it to be it was just that PBJ sandwich  with meat I don't know what all the fuss  was about. Let's talk about the waiter  it took him 10 min. before  he evan asked what we would like to  drink  and even longer to ask about our order. I guess  since this location  was in Scottsdale  he thought it would be better to attend the older ladies that were there alone rather than a  family. The service  for me means a lot about a place, but the food was ok. I would not be going there again.

Was in the Scottsdale, AZ area and heard people raving about this place figured I had to stop by and check it out for myself.

First of all definitely not what I expected, to be honest I was expecting more of a "Five Guys" setup but to much pleasure it was a more intimate, personal and relaxed environment.. The surfboard outside kind of hints at the environment inside.

But wait I was in basketball shorts cross trainers and a tank top normally I wouldn't wear this to a sit down restaurant just personal preference but the very nice lady informed me they do take out as well. Perfect. I paid after settling with "The Hangover Burger" which sounded amazing. It was about $14 not the cheapest but I'm from CT and that's what I would expect to pay for a good burger. 

I waited outside in my car since she said it would be 15 minutes, called a friend and in 12 minutes she came out with my food without me asking. That was very sweet of her to do so. I drove back to the hotel go to my room then remember I didn't ask for any utensils or condiments! To my surprise though it was all there paper plate, utensils, napkins and even an assortment of condiments. Wow, I was pretty impressed with the customer service and I haven't even tried the burger yet. 

Since I know this review is getting lengthy let me just say the above and beyond customer service was not let down by the phenomenal food. Cooked a perfect medium as requested with some sweet potato tots I have never tried that were simply put, addicting.  

I will definitely be recommending this place to friends and those who love to get lost in different cities and try great food. Bravo Rehab Burger bravo.

Quality of food combined with amazing service makes this place a new family favorite. We were out and about exploring Scottsdale, i told my husband I was in the mood for a burger and so we ended up here. The food is amazing and we will be going back for sure!!! I really wish they had a location closer but we will make the drive for this place!!!
I was very impressed, fast service, great food, friendly staff, unique menu.. The owner of this establishment should be very very proud. Keep up the good work!

This place has a great location right in Old Scottsdale. Cool menu with lots of different options for burgers, salads, etc. Went with the porkster burger, which pretty much says everything. Burger with pulled pork. Delicious. 

Really enjoyed the sweet potato tots with the different sauces. Favorite sauce I think was the pineapple teriyaki.

Overall great place to come and get some delicious food in Scottsdale.

My friends and I came here and we were blown away by the service we received. We were seated instantly, our server was great. I ordered the pb&j burger, I was pleasantly surprised how amazing it was! We were impressed by how well the staff including the hostess becca handled the rush of customers coming in. When we were paying our tab, a customer yelled at the the hostess. She handled the situation so well, and even tho the situation might of upset her she smiled and whole heartedly thanked us for coming to rehab. We will definitely be back because of the service we received! Who ever owns this place needs to give Becca a raise or a pat on the back for being so great at her job!

Decent burgers and adequate service. The burgers were ginormous so prepare to come with an appetite. Seems like a cool concept adding new flavors and making the burgers unique. I'm not a big burger fan but if you like burgers and are in the area, check this place out.

I have only been here once but that was enough to ensure that I never go back again.  The location and atmosphere were fine and a chirpy waitress provided hope of a good experience when she suggested the day's special of some kind of thinly sliced tri-tip burger.  The outcome however was disappointing as I bit in to my first mouthful of gloopy bits of meat with what I think were peppers, causing a river of grease to descend on to my plate.  The whole thing tasted of something soaked in oil and when I informed the waitress she simply smiled and replied with 'yea', as though I was simply stating the obvious and that was the intended result.

If you're normally a healthy eater and feel like treating yourself to a burger, you might as well buy one from a roadside burger truck and save the disappointment.

Service exceptional. Wait staff were nice. Food....on another level. I had the hawiann burger and even though I was so stuffed I HAD to finish it! Only thing is that it is tight spacing because it was so packed. They need to expand ASAP...but  Definitely coming again.

I've taken my Toyota's here for service ever since I became a Toyota customer 21 years ago. Rich Taylor has been my service advisor since he started working there, perhaps 15 years or more. I've never gotten anything less than profession, courteous, and friendly service, which is why I continue to return, year after year..

Happy hour 7 days a week from 11-6
ToDays visit is for a rehab burger Saturday nights can be tuff in the desert

I've been to Rehab (the restaurant!) several times since they opened and have left happy and full each time. The place is very cute and relaxed with a beach and surfing theme. Every server we've ever had was excellent and attentive.

I've tried a variety of items of the menu:

* Hawaiian Burger  - It was tasty, but the slab of Ham on the burger was a bit much for me. Personal preference thing.

* Veggie Noogie Sammy - I incorrectly thought this would be similar to Oregano's Veggie Wedgie. It is not, but that doesn't mean it isn't good. 

* Shelby's Shpinach Salad - This is my favorite with or without the grilled chicken breast on top. I love that you can get the mini size of this salad w/o chicken for only $5. It is a steal!

I've also tried the onion rings, french fries, and sweet potato tots. The tots are where it is at!

Most everything on the menu comes in two sizes - Rehab (small) and Relapse (huge). Even the small size is really big if you don't normally eat big portions. Be forewarned!
One of the best burgers in the Phoenix area. I had never eaten a pretzel bun burger unitl I ate here - loved it!

WOW! This place is awesome!!! First of all the selection of burgers will blow your mind - super creative for any palate...and gluten and lactose friendly which usually shy's me away from enjoying a burger. I had the turkey burger on a gluten free bun and it was mouth watering! Our sever was so fun and friendly contributing to the greatness of this place. We arrived just after the lunch rush and it was packed! You know they are doing something right! Next time we are in Old Town Scottsdale we will definitely be back!!!!

Tried the PBJ Burger on a recommendation from our server and wow. It was amazing I will definitely be back when I am in Scottsdale next time. Also the sweet potato tots are great as well as their onion rings. I was impressed to see a lot of the locals there as well as visitors like myself. Great burgers and cold beer.
The turkey burger with bacon jam was out of this world!  And they make a mean pricky pear margarita!

I was in the mood for a burger and thought I would give this place a try based on reviews and being in close proximity.
The atmosphere is good, but the hostess that seated me looked more like a customer and was busy talking to a friend.  I ordered the 5 oz Relapse Know Poblano Burger cooked medium wrapped in lettuce with the Sweet poToToes.  I was surprised how quick it came out and after my first bite, it was obviously undercooked.  Basically it was lightly browned on the outside and cold and raw in the middle.  I sent it back and it was replaced with no problem, but still more on the medium rare side than medium.  The sweet potato Tots were ok, but I think they could offer something of better quality.
I was not impressed enough to go back and prefer the burgers and fries at Red Robin over the Rehab Burger Therapy.
Rodrigo Da Vinci salad was amazing!  Be careful...very spicy!  Sweet poTOTs were as good as advertised.  Can't wait to come back to try something else on the menu!

Awesome burger joint. Fresh, super tasty, bread is fresh and moist.  Try the pretzel bread!!  I has the PB&J (no sriracha, please) and it was deliciously unexpected. Although my hubby had to go with the Blue Cheese and Bacon with ingredients on top (vs the 10oz original which has all embedded in the beef), it was definitely rehab worthy. The sweet potato tots are a bit greasy but great. Thanks to the reviews we chose this place and it was well worth it.  Note, it was packed at 11:45am...it is a popular place and the wait could be long. The tables outside were open yet the heat was unbereable (this coming from an islander).
Service was awful, order was wrong and we were forgotten by our server-will not be back as 3 shots your out will spend my money elsewhere
Absolutely AMAZING!! We had Kens Bbq burger rehab size and we split it... Perfect portion fort splitting!!! And sweet potato fries... YUMMO!! Wonderful service by Jeff!!!
Best burgers I've had in Phoenix! And a very very fair priced. This will be my burger spot every time I am in Scottsdale. Can't wait to come back!
Been here once great service awesome vibe and the burgers OMG get in my mouth I definitely recommend but be prepared for a wait

Great place for a meal.  Service wasn't bad, but not the best.  Food however is worth the trip!  Their burgers are very impressive! Order any of them and you won't be disappointed.  Fun atmosphere and lively.  Bring your appetite and be ready for something deliciously different!
Excellent service and outstanding burgers! Try the PB&J burger with sweet potato tater tots. We'll be back, but probably not on a Sunday.
Really good burgers , like the kind when you take the first bite and say," Whoa- this is tasty!" The service is also very peppy.

Well...it doesn't happen often but when it does its AWESOME! 5 stars easy! Killer burger, huge portions, sauces were amazing, and the entire staff was so fricken friendly dang! Arow you made my day 4sho! I had the Ghost Burger and it was phenomenal, with super delicious guacamole and just spicy enough to taste good!!!
Will be back if I'm in town!

Yum!! So many burger choices but everyone at my table went with the spicy mac n cheese burger. So much food, most of us ended up taking some home but it was delicious. Also tried the onion rings which were super crunchy and delicious. Hope to stop by again before leaving AZ.
Have the bbq sauce I've ever tasted.. It should be bottled and sold.. Definitely will be back
Good service. Always accommodate my being vegan. Love the roasted corn option instead of French fries. Although the sweet potato tots with the spicy ketchup are hard to beat.

Ghost burger is a MUST TRY! I ordered medium rare and came out just perfect, spicy grilled onions with the smooth avocado made an excellent combination. Friendly staff and great service, definitely will go back!

The food was Awesome the staff was awesome; In fact just about every waitress and waiter stopped by our table to say hi and ask how the food was. We had the Hawaiian burger  and the Bacon cheese burger, fries and the sweet poToTos. all of their Aioli sauces served with the burgers and sides were really tasty. Did i mention how great the staff was? We gave it 12 stars and will be going back for more!!!!!! I recommend it to any one.

Ok so I maybe a little bit biased because when I came here it was for my post figure competition cheat meal and I was literally starving!! I was craving nothing but a really good burger and heard that the PB&J burger here was the BOMB.COM so I had to have it. I arrived with a large party and was told the wait would be 2 hours!!!! I was so mad but set on eating that burger! After the horrible wait (which was more than 2 hours btw) I got to sink my teeth into my meal!!! I also had the sweet potato tots! My husband ordered the Poblano Burger with onion rings and subbed the regular patty for a chorizo patty!!! The food seriously doesn't get any better than this! Although it really isn't for health nuts, the food tastes fresh/in house made/not crap that has been sitting in a freezer! My new fav burger stop!!!!

The service was great, refills brought without asking.  First time, it was the perfect spot to eat while waiting for plane arrivals.  Much better to skip the parking and not be waiting in the cell phone lot.  The times after were meeting friends and enjoying the food.  Come for the food and try the outdoor patio that has plenty of misters to keep the temperature down.
We had fabulous sandwiches the service is great the Joe Montana was huge and the patty melt tasty. Will be back and send friends.
Astounding burgers. Never had anything like it anywhere else. We are from New York, and this was worth coming out to Arizona for.

I absolutely love the atmosphere. The service is great everyone is so friendly!  Calamari is amazing and enough for 6 people there is so much!  The Hawaiian burger amazing our server was Saira she is the best!!
Good atmosphere good decoration BOMB.com Thats all I need to say ! GO! Ask for :Robin !
We love this place! Incredible burgers and incredible atmosphere. The employees were really friendly and the service was prompt and everything was done well. Highly recommend in Old Town Scottsdale.

Great place. Amazing service. I just saw a waiter literally run after someone who left their food. 

This place has it dialed in. Xtra crispy bacon was delivered as asked, which normally is s risky bet. Great quality
Great food and service. Nicely nested at the back of the Old Town, I guess you have to be in the know to find it! Try the pulled pork. Period. Turns boys to men.

Had the Alfredo San Carlo! Awesome pasta from a burger joint. Perfectly cooked and lots of cheese and alfredo sauce with garlic tomatoes and it ha a little spice to it as well! So great job guys! If the pasta is that good I can only imagine what the burgers taste like!

I have never written a review in my life, but the service here was so bad enough that I got compelled to write a review to warn others. Our party of two arrived around 2 p.m. hoping to get a quick lunch, but what we received was quite the opposite, it took about 15 minutes after sitting to even get a server for drinks. We had been waiting so long that we went ahead and ordered our food as soon as we were able to flag down a server, 45 minutes later not the nearest sight of our food coming, to cut it short we didn't receive our food after more than 50 minutes of waiting, we had no choice but to leave at that point. Will not be returning here ever, or at least until they drastically improve their service.

If you get the PBJ Bacon burger, you will not regret it!!!!!! It also has sriracha, and I was hesitant to get it at first because it sounds absolutely gross, but you will be super surprised to discover how the flavors combine to create something amazing/incredible/mindblowing. I would have enjoyed just peanut butter on the burger, but the sriracha is a surprising balance to the sweetness of the grape jelly. I went with my family to Rehab Burger, and everybody else said my burger was better than theirs. I'm so happy I got it and I will be recommending it to everyone I know! I got it with a side of sweet potato tater tots, which by itself is enough for a second visit. The only thing I was disappointed with was the soggy onion rings but everything about the meal was worth it! I understand now why it was 45 minute wait.

Just tried this place for the first time and it was awesome. We had Rocco as our server and he was great; he made a lot of great recommendations and he was on top of everything. 

My buddy and I both had the BBQ burgers with sweet potato tots. Both of the burgers were cooked to perfection and with high quality beef. 

We wrapped it up with the "pot brownie" with Reese's peanut butter cups and I was literally speechless. This blows oregano's pizzookie out of the water. 

I definitely recommend this place!
burger was good and fries were even better. quick service in a casual place. pretty busy during lunch time.

The Porkster Burger at Rehab Burger Therapy is a monstrous creation. Featuring a beef patty and a healthy serving of BBQ pulled pork that is then placed between a pretzel bun and topped with cheese. The pretzel bun is the perfect platform to savor the flavor of meat. Unfortunately, the burger I enjoyed was more of a pork sandwich than a burger, and the BBQ sauce was just a little bit too peppery (making me miss out on the all the flavors of the beef). The beef was very flavorful and the bun was perfectly moist and tender. If the BBQ and pork were toned down just a bit the burger would be in elite territory.
Super busy and had a wait (not much room to wait so you stand outside): burger was excellent, milk shake was awesome. Just a little too packed in to the place.

Burgers are great, better than Cold Beer & Cheeseburgers. However, our server Jen was short and curt, at one point asking us if we were OK with our beers, then three minutes later asking us if we wanted our check. When I said, "No, we're probably gonna have another beer," she told me "OK, no rush." Really? Because now I feel like I'm being rushed. No personality, whatsoever. I'll come back, just not with her as our server.
Overrated. I honestly don't understand why this place has such great reviews. I don't think it's that's great. Service is awesome thou and so is the ambience, but the food is nothing special.

Great burgers, good music and genuine people. It's really all one could really ask for. 

Support a local AZ eatery that's bomb as hell.

Came here based on reviews and it was worth it! If I could give this place 4.5, I would. The only thing that kept it from a 5 was the onion rings because the onions were too wide...not enough flavor. Love their sauces and tater tots! This place may be known for their burgers but the pork was fantastic....it'll get me back here for sure! Would most definitely recommend this place.

Every time we have tried to eat here there is at least a 45 min. wait, so we usually just go somewhere else as the location in old town permits just walking 5 mins in any direction to find 10 other places to eat. Finally decided to wait it out on Sunday and had a 45 minute wait, which is awkward as there isn't actually anywhere to wait....people just kinda stand around in the parking lot between cars. Anyways we get seated at the end of a community table and the food was good. Not amazing, but good. The last third of my burger ended up being too underdone for me so I didn't finish all of it. Service was okay. I'd eat here again, but I wouldn't wait for it again.

Good burgers, not great. Sweet potato tots are super sweet, like they have sugar added, so it makes for an odd paring with the burger - imo. Service was friendly and overall I wouldn't mind going back.

Little disappointed in service and food. Sat at the bar and was told by bartender she would be right back. She was and I ordered a beer. She came back five minutes later and took the guys order next to me and then took my order. Guy next to me got his fish tacos within five minutes. I waited fifteen to twenty for my burger. I understand a burger takes longer than a fish taco but it was obvious they forgot to grab my order when it was done because when I got it, although it tasted good, the burger was luke warm as were the fries. The real kicker is the entire time I waited for my burger I was never checked on. That in itself will cause me to think twice before eating here again.
Skip RnR and walk 10 feet for a better burger, service and atmosphere! Hangover burger is insane! Actor/Comedian Brian Posehn was walking in as we were leaving.
My boyfriend and I shared the bacon cheeseburger... Delicious!! Thank god I don't live here otherwise I will be eating way too many burgers!
Sooooo damn good!!!! One of the best burgers I have ever had! Wings were superb too!! Great laid back atmosphere.
THE BEST BURGER IN TOWN, in the state, in the country, IN THE WORLD!!!! The staff are awesome too! Great place to come. Cant wait to return :-)

Wednesday lunch. 3 person party. Seated immediately @ noon. Waited on immediately. Drinks with the quickness. Atmosphere is chill. Has a Hawaii/So Cal beach vibe - like Islands but less corporate. 

Burgers are enourmous. Had the Jalapeno Popper Burger, medium rare and subbed in onion rings. Burger was alright. Had a charbroil-flavor overtone to it, which, unfortunately was the predominate flavor. Also, there's too much going on with this burger. Massive amount of guacamole, little fired pieces of jalapenos seated within the guac and well, you need a knife and fork to eat it. I never have a problem with the size of a burger - it's a beautiful thing. 

Going to try a more simple, straight-forward burger next time but if the overly-charbroiled flavor persists the second round, it'll be my last visit. I'm optimistic.

It's in line with Scottsdale Old Town pricing - $16 for a badass burger. Cheaper burgers are to be had, and for me, the next time will be less extravagant, which will obviously be better on the ole pocket book.

This place is over the top great :) The staff was some of the friendliest in AZ, and the food was amazing. For sure the Relapse burger was more than enough, can't even imagine the size of the Rehab. Love the option of not only picking a size, but also sub out the burger for turkey or chicken at no extra cost (which I forgot to do). And just a side note, this is a place that butters and toasts the buns, so if you don't want it too greasy ask for a bun right out of the bag. Decor is super fun. Would be a great place to take someone new to AZ. Happy hour every day until 6pm, can't beat that!

Dig this place! Liked the decor. Loved the food. My wife and I both had the hangover burger with the brioche bun, friggin yuuuum! She had the sweet tots and I had onion rigs. My Mom came along and she had the pork wings. 
Service was on spot.
Wish we could have stayed and tried more on the menu. Definitely will be back next time in town.
OMG! What a find this fun, yummy place! Fantastic food and our waitress Nicole was awesome too !

Exactly what the name says, perfect hangover food! I recommend the pretzel bun if you get the hangover burger-it will hold up with all that delicious, runny, yolk.  Great place to go for some hangover related day drinking in old town!

We here with a friend that had been there a week before. The way he described it put me in the mind set I was about to eat a piece of meaty heaven and a cloud like bun. So we went on a Friday night around 6 pm. The place has a nice chill atmosphere. The wait staff is very nice. We started with an appetizer of Pig Wings, which are little ribs on the bone covered in a sweet and spicy peach and hablanero bbq sauce. They were mighty tasty but took at least 20 min to come out.  Like most places in phoenix, they had Four Peaks beers on tap. This is fine with me. So we had a few beers, the ordered our burgers.

I ordered there specialty burger, The Hangover: Fried egg, bacon and a split green chili on it on a pretzel bun. As a side I choose the sweet potato tots. The burger was cook perfect to my order, but lacked seasoning. Even with a green chili on it I didn't get the heat I was expecting.  The bacon was crispy and the egg was cooked nice. The pretzel bun was excellent. It wasn't a bad burger but it didn't have that wow factor I was looking for.  The side of sweet potato tots was great. They even give you a side spicy catsup. This was good, but with sweet potato tots you need to serve them with a maple, or sweet sauce. 

So overall I would go back to give this place a second chance. My friend had a BBQ burger that I want to try. So check the place out. It is worth it.
I've loved my food every time I've come here, I love the "normal" burgers but have also branched out and had the mac and cheese and pb&j burgers, love em all.

I really like the beach atmosphere and our server was nice, but my food was mediocre. My fries tasted like they were reheated (blah) and the burger was ok, but didn't wow me. I had a bacon cheeseburger and I would choose 5 guys bacon cheeseburger over this places any day. They have lots of specialty burgers there, those may be better then the "average" one I got but I don't think I will go back to try it. Also, no kids menu which I didn't like because I have a family.

I've been here about 6 times in the last year or so. They have blown me away each time with their food, service, and cool vibe. Had the bacon cheeseburger last night with the pretzel bun. It was delicious, juicy, and huge!  

A solid "go to" place every time I am in town. Thanks guys!
I stopped by 2 days in a row for lunch not long ago. The bacon cheeseburger was more than perfect. One of the best burgers I ever had and the wings were superb. Very warming atmosphere.

What a great place! Our server, Rocco, was spot on~6 adults and 3 kids are hard to please, especially someone that has been in the service industry for over 18 years! ;) We will be back the next time we are in Scottsdale! 

Starters: 
Chili Con Fritos
Nelson's Verde Con Pollo

Burgers:
Ghost Burger x 2 
Know Poblano Burger 
The Porkster Burger x 2 
Pescado Borracho
Hot Dog Therapy (5 year old who never wants to eat, almost finished it)

**The wait is little long, so be prepared. (That's usually a good sign)
This may just be the best burger in the city. The sauces are awesome! I come here as often as I can.

What an amazing find! The hubby and I were in the mood for burgers and brew and happened upon this little gem! If there were a way to give 10 stars, Rehab Burger Therapy would absolutely deserve it! 

The burgers were inventive and delicious (we tried the Jalepeno Popper and PBJ and Bacon burgers- trust us the PBJ is WAY more delicious than it sounds), the brews were icy cold, the service was phenomenal, the restrooms immaculate......we seriously could find no flaw with this place. You have to come check it out for yourselves, and need some Rehab from your newfound addiction to Rehab Burger Therapy!

A good time was had by all. We had everything and split it and passed it around. Mushroom burger, pig wings? (Pig wings?) Great!  Tator tots really! Where else can you get tator tots. Mac & cheese, a blue cheese wedge, and a chili burger.
E erything was good and hot. We gave the server a run for her money - unintentionally but my group was needy.... so sorry for the trouble.

Burgers, etc.  Sounds like run of the mill?  Definitely not.  Creative menu makes eating here a true pleasure.  Burger on pretzel roll is my husband's fave, mine in the Di Vinci salad which is more like a casserole!  Delicious onion rings, too!  Funky music and decor, as well as GREAT service with smile, round out your night!  Open late, makes it a convenient stop for apres anything!  Make sure you share a home made brownie for dessert.  We met owner's mother while she was delivering a huge pan to the kitchen!  Delicious!  Real food, real people.

Excellent burger place! I was stopping by after a baseball game on my own and sat at the bar. The bar staff was very friendly and gave great food recommendations. I had the PB&J and Sriracha burger and it was delicious. The PB acts like a cheese and the texture was really good. As a bonus, fries dipped in the jelly is a great combo. I will be back here again soon!

Found this place off a living social deal months ago and absolutely fell in love with this place!! I'm surprised it has taken me this long to review.

I am addicted (no pun intended) to Rehab; think I've literally been there 3 times in a two week period. I have never had a bad experience or have had anyone I brought complain about their experience. The customer service is phenomenal. The servers and bartenders are awesome and give great recommendations. The regulars at the bar there are super friendly with great advice on what to order.

The food, phenomenal!! The burgers are huge and you get great portion sizes. You can substitute anything with no hassles! Their sweet tots, out of this world! And their sauces, absolutely amazing (pineapple aioli is my fave). 

Definitely a must try for anyone living here or just passing through!!

After walking around Old Town Scottsdale, we decided on Rehab and didn't regret our choice at all. The menu of burgers is very creative. Who's ever heard of a PBJ burger? My son was curious, then went with the 10 oz. jalapeño popper burger & fries. Burger was huge & fries were crisp. My husband went with smaller Patty Melt & onion rings. Both were very good. I had the chili burger with no bun & the sweet poTOToes with chipotle aioli. The chili was very meaty & had the right amount of beans. I would have liked it with a touch more heat, but it was still tasty. The sweet potato tater tots were quite crisp & good with the aioli.
The atmosphere is definitely bar-like, but I wouldn't have a problem taking young children there. While not haute cuisine, Rehab serves good burgers and a good selection of beer. The rest of the menu looked good as well. I would recommend it to someone looking for burgers in the area.

Waking up with a hangover from the night drinking before, my friend and I scoured Yelp to try and find some food that would catch our eye.  Upon seeing a highly rated burger joint with 'Rehab' in the name, we knew it was meant to be so off we went.  

I wasn't sure what to expect but on first glance it seemed like a restaurant I'd find on the beach, with colorful decor and reggae playing throughout.  Our waitress (and hostess) immediately greeted us with a smile and asked where we wanted to sit, and being how perfect it was outside, we chose the patio.  

The first thing that caught my eye was cheap beer for happy hour.  $2 domestic and $3 imports had me rethinking my hangover from the night before but I stuck with a soda instead.  Next thing was to peruse the menu.  Based off recommendations on here, I knew I HAD to try the Sweet PoTOToes with whatever I got (I love me some sweet potato fries whenever possible) so that was one less thing to worry about.  I ended up going with the Porkster burger (BBQ pork on top of a 5oz burger) and it was EXACTLY what I needed.  I ordered Chipotle Aioli with the poTOToes and, as always, that is a killer combination.  The meal was the perfect cure and it helped that the service was top-notch.  The waitress had a smile, joked and seemed to know the right things to say and was speedy as can be.

I can't wait to go back and give it a go again, as they have won a customer for life!
Awesome place! We classified it as a grand slam: 1st base - good location, 2nd base - quick, 3rd base - very good service, and great tasting food to send it out of the park. Should I say any more?
Great environment, had the most friendly waitress, and the PBJ & Bacon burger tasted outstanding! I would recommend this place to anyone.

Most of the time I rave about this place, but my last visit was dissapointing. The patty melt we ordered was over cooked and under seasoned. Their milkshake also tasted like McDonald's soft serve.  If this was my first visit, I'd never come back.

I have visited Rehab Burger Therapy several times.  Every time I have been there, I have been greeted promptly and with a smile.  The atmosphere is so relaxing! The music is so laid back with Bob Marley, Sublime, etc.  The service spot on and friendly!  The servers have always been great with their recommendations  The burgers are innovative and oh so tasty and juicy.  The onion rings are to die for and the sweet potato tots are a must!  I took my brother and his two year old daughter today and the server couldn't be more attentive and super sweet.  My only recommendation would be to offer a couple of options for kids meals, but other than that...  Try the Hangover Burger or the Peanut Butter and Bacon Cheese Burger on Pretzel Buns!  Yes, I said it!  Delicious!!! Top Notch

Wow. Excellent service, friendly, easy to talk to, and make you feel extremely welcome at their place! Food is wonderful, be sure to get the sweet poTOToes!! Don't expect to get in and out in a reasonable time though, this place is about relaxing and enjoying your time. This is my kind of therapy!

I have been looking in to this place for quite some time and finally got the opportunity to go it was by far the best burger I had in a long time from start to finish we felt very welcomed our  server Robyn took very good care of us and was very friendly to my son everything was served in a timely manner we actually got to enjoy our food and we where not ruched to leave like other places some of the burgers brought out where OUT OF THIS WORLD lol I'm definitely going back and I am recommending this place to all my fault and friends

My son wanted to eat at Rehab and I wasn't thrilled about going to another burger place.  I LOVED this place.  The food was amazing.  I had a poblano burger at our waiter's suggestion and didn't regret it for a second.  The sweet potato tots that my son had were awesome but those onion rings were unreal.  We watched some football while we ate which was a bonus.  Everyone that worked there was really friendly and very fast.  Our waiter brought out aioli for me without me asking because he said he thought I might like it and then brought me a lid in case I wanted to take some home with me for my left-overs.  Amazing!  It was great service and it was obvious that the people there loved their jobs.  We will definitely be going back there and I will be bringing friends.
Lovee this place! The mcgnarly burger is a tie for best burger in Scottsdale. The sweet potato tots here are amazing and it's a really place with great music and dos equis on draft.

Wow!! The food here is amazing! Extra big helpings and they will customize your order. Laid back atmosphere. We are outside. Be prepared to take food home! Chips and salsa and the sweet potatoes tots are a must! Every burger imaginable is there. Chicken turkey ham and veggie sandwiches options too

Two words: PINEAPPLE AIOLI. Also, my burger, the pulled pork burger, was DELICIOUS.

Our waiter was super friendly and attentive, atmosphere fun, casual yet still clean (read: no dive bar here!), and total bonus points for offering gluten-free buns.


Came with 3 co-workers, in town for work, but would come back again an surely recommend to people looking for a different twist on some junk food treats!

The service was great. Our server Caylee was very pleasant and really knew the menu well. You could really tell she loved her workplace.

The food was fantastic. All 3 of my friends were really happy with their food also. I will definitely be coming back soon.

Best burger ive had in a long time!

WOW!!! I never desired nor tasted a peanut butter and jelly burger, but it was the most wonderful experience I've ever had. Was last there two weeks ago. Been craving it every since. Going back this Friday. A MUST HAVE.

Sat outside tonight. We were seated quickly but it took awhile to get our drinks. We got guacamole on the special menu for cinco De mayo and it was excellent. I had the bacon cheeseburger with a pretzel bun. The chipotle ranch tasted great with the fries. My sister had the portobello  burger with sweet potato tots and loved it! The food and atmosphere were great. Service was slow but still a solid 4 stars!
LOVED it!!! Had the medium gold medal wings and they were perfect! Our BBQ burgers AMAZING!!! Can't wait to go back loved it

Had the PBJ and bacon burger with a touch of sriracha. It was amazing. Messy and tasty! A local place by me has a similar burger (I'm from out of town), but they don't add jelly or sriracha so when I go home, I'll suggest it for my burger. Also had the tots and they were savory and tasty. Sat outside which for us Michiganders is always a treat. It was busy and we were there for lunch. To be expected! Drinks were always filled.

We went here to try something different and we love it!!  The food was fantastic but our server was a little slow.  She kept on forgetting to refill our drinks when we ask, but it was also busy, so I am not to upset about it.  This atmosphere is really fun and laid back.  The decor is fun also.  My kids are already asking when can we go back.

Hamburger buoni, ma eccessivamente grandini ed elaborati. C'è cmq la possibilità di farselo fare solo con gli ingredienti che si desidera ed è l'unica soluzione se non si vuole un panino con 100 cose e super piccante.
Il servizio non è eccellente

We decided to give Rehab Burger a try when my sister told me that this place has the best burgers we would find in the Phoenix area. We luckily got the last table, and didn't have to wait on a Monday night. I couldn't imagine how busy this place gets on the weekends. I enjoyed the atmosphere. It felt like it was a little burger shack in California. I liked how diverse the burgers were. I decided to get the PBJ bacon burger. I'm a huge fan of sriracha, so I was sold when I found out that it came on it. I got the sweet potato tots for the side. To be honest I was a little disappointed. Don't get me wrong it was a very unique, and good burger. Unfortunately, it was just that.. a good burger. The sweet potato tots were fantastic though. But for how well known they are I expected a little more bang for my buck.

Had a fantastic time at this place. The service was great and very friendly people. The burger, sweet potato tater tots and brownie dessert was bomb dot com. 

I have recommended this place to family and friends already.

This is the place to get the best burgers in Old Town. Great location, well staffed, and awesome food. Never had a bad thing come out to our table from here. Will be coming back for as long as they keep their doors open. Keep up the great work!
Burgers are great, relaxed and casual environment and great service. Kaye our server was terrific! Great place for a burger and fries!  Also the Portabello burger really hit the spot.

Great burgers and great atmosphere...even better service. Nick our server was amazing and made our dinning  experience extraordinary...try the pig wings (on recommendation from Nick) the burger was huge and tasty especially with the pretzel bun...overall great experience. It sucked that we had to leave the next day back home to El Paso, Texas...
Just visited again and had the burger with the peanut butter and jelly!  WTH,  it was unlike any burger I've ever had and is now my newest favorite!  Freaken amazing!
Yummy burgers, fries & huge onion rings. Fun beach type decor. Glad to have found them on Yelp!
Super fantastic food. A must stop in Scottsdale.  Love the turkey burger and sweet potato tots!!!
Rehab burgers are the best in Phoenix,  period. Nice, casual atmosphere.  We love this place.

Very good place for a burger. Laid back and friendly yet professional and quick even when they were busy. 
Only reason not 5 stars is they plated burger wrong and my rare went to someone else at table and I got stuck with medium.  We were under a time crunch so left it as it was delivered. Still all four of us enjoyed everything we got.

First of all, the restaurant's A/C wasn't working properly since it was quite warm (even muggy.) The server welcomed us briefly and took our order a few minutes later. We waited for over 15 mins until we had to ask another server to bring our drinks and she apologized for her fellow server's mishap. While all of this was taking place we noticed our original server was having a laugh (flirting) with a fellow coworker.

The burgers weren't that good but the fries were very good, though. A tip, order the small version of the burger of your choosing since it's actually quite big. I wouldn't imagine having the large sized burger, unless I haven't eaten for a day or two.

Maybe I had bad luck with my server and the joint's temperature control, but who knows it could be business as usual at RBT. Will not be back in a while.
Got the hatch chili burger on a pretzel bun. SO GOOD. It's all about their pretzel buns for sure.

Top 10 best burger joint in town. The place is a bit small thus waiting is more likely to happen. Good location and good customer service. The burgers are awesome and the tater tots are out of this world. I took away a star because of the heavy smell that was in the restaurant last 2 visits...(sorry). Still a big fan

Be prepared to be in pain - food was good - services was good, we were in and out on a game day in a very timely manner. But my oh my,  even the small portioned burger is huge - couldn't finish even half of it. We'll split one when we go back!

I heard this place had some unique burgers, and do they ever.  I tried the peanut butter, jelly and bacon burger; I know it sounds weird.  I've only heard of burgers like this on Dinners, Drive-in and Dives.  Let me tell you it was one of the best burgers I have ever had.  The service was great and the decor is laid back.  It is a small place so get there early.  If you are in Old Town Scottsdale, this is the place to go for burgers.  You can also get any of their burgers changed to a chicken or turkey burger at No Extra charge.  Now that's awesome!

Just.....Amazing.....Big Double D-s in your face good. PB-J Sriracha burger is unreal. The taste of meat is on point, the buns are on point, good beers and vibe, unique burgers and sauces. Good waitstaff as well.
Delicious burgers and fries and onion rings with attentive service. You can order (and then actually receive) a rare burger, which is much appreciated! I would be happy to go again.

Burgers and portions were delicious. I had the bbq backyard burger in the small size and it was more than enough. Corona Rita's were also a favourite. Only let down was paying at the end. We wanted to split bills and in doing so they spilt the bills entirely wrong. Mild inconvenience, not enough to overwhelm how good the burgers are.

We visited this place for the first time on our honeymoon and when you walk in, you instantly feel like you are at the beach. Once we were seated, it was hard trying to decide what to order. We ordered pineapple bbq wings, BYOB burger, Jalepeno Popper burger, and had sweet potato fries with all the dipping sauces. The food was amazing but our waitress was awful! 15 mins before we got our check once we finished eating and it was not that busy mid day. I had to ask for Coke twice, my burger was cooked wrong, and she rarely checked on us. Go for the food not the service
Spicy Mac n cheese burger was the BEST ever. I chose the veggie patty option, and it still turned out to be super yummy!
The atmosphere is fun and the service is as well.  I had the calamari which is very different but great!.. I also love the wedge salad.  This place is a winner, I will be back.
l love this place, it makes you feel like you are at home!! devin, ryan, cheryl are amazing!!! the food is ridiculously mouth watering amazing!!!

Great burgers,good service and friendly staff.  Went with coworkers. I  had the jalapeño burger minus the cream cheese,it came with cheddar and cream cheese cheddar was enough. Delicious! .  My coworker asked for a recommendation between the PBJ and bacon buyer and the Pineapple burger.  Hands down the recommendation was the PBJ and  bacon. Both of my coworkers had the PB&J and bacon. Both said it was amazing. In fact one was going to make it that weekend with family at home. I highly recommend Burger rehab if you're looking for a great burger

Simply put - A GREAT PLACE. The hardest decision is what to order. My fav's are the burgers, wings, sweet potato tots with pineapple aoli and the cobb salad. Great owners and staff. Don't miss Happy Hour. There's parking along side, across the street and in the parking ramp behind.
:-)Greg

Great food, great server.. Couldn't believe she's a Grandma.  We were a party of 9, and she steered us in the right direction. 

Apps and Food were great.  Would come back again.

One of the best burgers I've ever had.  
I'm not typically a burger fan, but on whim I decided to try this joint out.
I was not disappointed!  Atmosphere was a big... busy, but the burgers are to blame!

I have been to the Rehab in Scottsdale and found myself in Tempe so I was more than happy to be able to get my fix. I love the Mac Gnarly burger.  The burger proportions are huge, and by huge I mean split with the family huge.  I am no small eater and can maybe get through 3/4 of the relapse size.  The chili con fritos are also excellent and brings me back to my Texas days.
The service is good and the wait staff provides great recommendations. The noise level is a little loud but you can still have a conversation.  But the taste and food quality is what sets this place apart.  I would say it is one of the best burgers I have had.
Great burgers and tots! Cool atmosphere which can fill up quickly. But the employees are great and helpful and generally cheerful. Cant wait to go back!

The burgers were phenomenal as were the sweet potato tots. The beer selection was lacking a little, hence the lack of a fifth star. I can go to a ton of burger joints anywhere, the beer and atmosphere need to earn my fifth star.

Came here for lunch. Had the veggie burger and was excellent really hit the spot. They have good drinks here including thirst quenching soft drinks. Love their pineapple sauce. They  have many different sources to choose from.
Great burgers great prices and wouldn't mind com by here again next weekend highly recommend

I was there last night with a group of 5 other ladies.  The burgers were very good and cooked just the way we asked BUT several of the orders were not done right.  I asked for lettuce, tomato and raw onion with my burger and got sautéed onions with no lettuce or tomato and then I was charged for those onions.  Another of our diners did not get the avocado on her build your own burger and had an extremely long wait for her drink.  A third diner received her French fries ice cold.  She did get some that were nice and hot but that took over 15 minutes to receive.  I'm not sure what was going on last night that contributed to so many errors being made.  I hope they get their act together because I would like to give them a second chance.

Heard a lot about Rehab burger Therapy and was dying to try it out. Maybe my expectation was too high, but I was not very impressed with this place. Had to wait for a long time, which is acceptable taking into consideration that it was a weekend. Ambience was nice, beachy type. Definitely a fun place to hang out - 4 star for that. Staff was polite and friendly - 4 star. Very few servers, and I found that our server was attending to almost all the tables, which made the service super slow (the forks/knives took about 15 mins to come to the table, the napkins took another 15 mins, the check took around 20-30 mins) - 2 star. Menu had quite a lot of options including vegan - 3.5 star for that. But the vegan patty comes only in 10 oz size, which is HUGE - 2 star for that. Food was ok, nothing extraordinary (I was bummed because I have heard so much about how great their burger was). I have had much better burgers - 2 star for that.
Props for the menu ideas but the burger flavor itself seemed average. The sweet potato tots moved this place from 3 stars to 4 stars in our books.
Great Burger!  I had the Hangover burger with the pretzel bun. Ordered medium. It was great!  I left full and satisfied.

Food was awesome and the outside seating was comfortable and cool on a hot afternoon. If you love the band sublime then the music will take you back. The esthetic is very long beach California so it made me think of where I grew up. It is a little piece of the beach in downtown scottsdale.
Great atmosphere, you just feel cool when you're there. Must get the PB&J, bacon burger on pretzel bun. BEST BURGER EVER! just go for it.

The service at burger rehab is very good. I ordered a mac and cheese veggie burger (I am vegetarian) and I loved it the decorations were great and is was a good time with the family at rehab burger therapy

Very very good food. I had the PB&J burger and it was cooked great and tasted delicious. Sweet potato tots were perfect. 4 stars because the service was kind of slow, granted they were pretty busy, but still not an excuse for empty drinks.

I had the Backyard BBQ burger. It was worth the wait. My dinning partner had the porkster, subbing chicken breast (at no charge) for the beef patty. It was d'lish.  I had the 10oz rehab this time but going forward I'll take the 5oz relapse from here on out. Bottom line Rehab Burger Therapy deserves its rating.
good poblano chili burger, very friendly service by every one who looked at you. owner was on premise, cool scene. just around for a visit would recommend to anyone with a burger jones.

Fogo's De Chao in Scottsdale is a great place to dine if you are a meal lover!  They serve varieties of beef, chicken, pork, leg of lamb, lamb chops, prime rib, filet, sausage, ribs and an extensive salad bar!  Dinner meals are $50 which includes the salad bar.  They also serve one fish entry if someone in your party prefers it.  Wine bottles start at plus $40.  The service is great, food in delicious and restrooms are very clean.  Do make reservations because they are busy on weekends. If you are celebrating a special occasion, do mention it during your reservation.  There is a surprise for the Birthday person that you can share. Can't wait to return.
Really surprised by the appearance to find good quality food and gluten-free options! Most of the sauces and dressings and the fries are gluten-free and they offer gluten-free buns!

Craving a huge, juicy burger cooked perfectly? Rehab is the place. Went here for my birthday and a month later was here again for my husband's. Fries are outstanding and lots of bun options including gluten free and lettuce wraps. If you arrive during dinner rush, be prepared to wait. Grab a drink, take a look at the menu and wait with anticipation. Service was friendly. This place won't let you down.

As per other reviewers and my servers recommendation, I tried the PB & J burger with sweet potato tots. I did enjoy the burger. I thought it might be too sweet but it wasn't and had a nice little heat. I guess I'm not a tot fan but I didn't really like them. Next time I think I'd get the corn as a side. Other people around me had it and it looked good. I felt it was way too much food for me.  It was one of those meals that started out great but by close to the end of it I was getting a little sick of it. Maybe I would go for the smaller burger next time.  Service was friendly and prompt.  Overall Good experience. I would recommend this place and would return.

They got it right!  This burger joint would fit in with the many Gulf Coast towns and cities in Texas.   

Felt like I was back home on the Third Coast kicking back with a burger, beer, and good company jamming to reggae on the sound system.   

Bugers were stellar, both the vegan and the Hatch Chile burger.  I grew up 30 miles north of Hatch NM and can say they did it right.  

The Red Stripe beer was fresh!!!  Something you don't see on a regular basis here in AZ

The real surprise was the sweet potato tots!  Usually not a fan of them, but their version just made me a convert!!!

The only thing lacking was the beach, so, barring California sliding into the Pacific,  it is something I will just have to deal with.

Awesome!  You can tell they really thought about the different burger combinations and dressings.  The sweet potato tots were awesome!  Our server recommended the pineapple aioli with the tots and it was delicious.  I had the Poblano burger.  Great flavors and just the right amount of spiciness!  The restaurant looks like a beach side bar.  the service was great and our server was full of great suggestions and was very polite.  They have options for people that don't eat red meat or need a vegetarian option.   I am definitely going back to try the other burgers!
My burger wasnt cooked the way I ordered it however they made me another one on the house. I loved the burger and I am definitly going back!

A must-go anytime you're swinging through Phoenix. Funky and fun burger combinations and bartenders that will shoot the shit with you all day long.

No matter what burger you order, make sure to get the sweet potato tots with chipotle aoli and pot brownies (brownie/peanut butter cups made in a cash iron pot with peanut butter and marshmallow). KILLER.
Great service and food, highly recommended.  Located in scottsdale.  Has large portions good burgers.
My friend recommended this place! Bartender was great! The Mac and cheese and burger was great! Sweet potato tots were amazing! Have to check this place out!!!

Service is absolutely terrible. My husband and I frequent restaurants and lounges and cafes pretty often and have had our share of unpleasant experiences. We were excited to have burgers after a spring training game, but our waiter didn't look like he cared whatsoever. He did not bring the correct order, misguided us about the happy hour drinks and my burger was not well done as I requested it to be. When i tried to tell him about it, he WALKED AWAY.  Manager came and started making excuses for the waiter. In the end he took our bill and gave us a 10% discount, which would not even start to make up for a terrible experince that we ended up having. Honestly, i would consider this to be one of the worst restaurant experiences of my life. We won't be coming back and i would not recommend anyone to visit rehab burger.

Ok, I don't review often, only either very bad or very good.  I'm sorry, I wanted to like this place, very cool vibe but lets get down to the heart of the matter.  They make burgers.  If you don't care about the quality of the burger and are easily distracted by add ons like poblano peppers, chili, mac and cheese and the like than this may be for you.  For a burger purist...um... no.  This is the second time I gave them a try, I order my double relapse burger medium rare so as to have a little juice and flavor....denied!!  I don't know how they get a burger to be pink inside with absolutely no juice left whatsoever!  I'm serious, I am eating a tasteless dry ass pink burger.  I show my GF as I squeeze the burger on the plate with a fork and.......nothing.  Not a bit of juice, no frigging flavor whatsoever.  This tasteless burger is hiding behind all the bells and whistles of the toppings. If you have to go, just trust me and try a piece of the meat without all the crap and sauce.  Bland, bland, bland.  As for the sides, not terrible, but the gf tater tots came out cold and soggy.  They were replaced with hot ones on request, but really!!!  For $40 plus for a beer, hamburgers and frys for 2, you would think it would be hot and fresh the first time everytime.  If you are looking for cool place to chill have a beer and drop $40-50 bucks on very average burgers, then come on in. Otherwise, check out Cold Beer and Cheesburgers, Smashburger, Habit or any one of a dozen places where you won't feel like you just got hozed and a burger comes out like god intended, pink and juicy.

With friends visiting, we don't usually try new places, but take visitors to our old favorites, but being that we are all new parents, out to lunch with the babies, some of the usual Old Town hangouts were off the list. We walked up, and there were quite a few other families inside, so decided to give it a try. The staff was incredible.  The 2 hosts were above and beyond. Having babies with you comes with a lot of accessories...diaper bags, stroller, shopping bags, and the crazy kids! They were unscathed by all of it, and helped us out. The hosts went out of the way for us, and made our whole experience terrific. They were attentive, made small talk, and played with the babies. 

The food was good.  The Bloody Mary's need some work. But the overall experience was above & beyond for us. Would highly recommend!

Another great find in Arizona! We will certainly come back when in the area. Informal beach/surfer theme but great food/fun. Bring a huge appetite or share

Like:
Four Peaks Pumpkin Porter!
Spinach Salad!
Pesto Spaccini!

Wish:
I had ordered the dressing on the side
They had crushed red pepper

Drove 45miles for a big disappointment. After so much hype around the web about their burgers we decided to try it. It wasn't close to what we were expecting! The burgers looked poorly constructed and didn't fit the pictures online, not to mention it took them 32minutes to serve us our food, and we went on a Sunday so there wasn't much of a crowd. The taste of the burger was 3/5 the fries and tots 1/5 the customer service was 4/5 except the wait time was horrible and gets 0/5 definitely will not be returning sorry!

Excellent burger and service. Sweet potato fries with special dipping sauce were awesome. Denise, the owner, was very welcoming and intimately involved in the business which unfortunately is very atypical these days and seeing this was refreshing.

The wife and I had dinner here tonight. The food is five star all the way.  The burgers were big, juicy, and cooked perfectly. Sides were done well. Beer Battered Onion Rings are awesome.  The only reason I take away a star is because it is a small space with horrible acoustics. This caused an almost unbearable amount of noise. However, they do have a patio area which I am sure solves this problem when the weather is nice.

Just ate at the Tempe location for the first time. The food was killer, the ambience was chill, and the service was top notch.  Our server Dominic was excellent...his recommendations were on point and he was super attentive.  We brought our 2 year old daughter, and although they didn't have a kid's menu, Dominic suggested several menu items that would be appropriate for a toddler. The portions are huge...some people in our party ordered the 10oz burger when the 5oz burger would have sufficed. Other than being too full, we have no complaints.  We will most definitely be back.

Great food - we tried a few apps. Loved the chili cheese fries and the spicy mac and cheese. Onion rings were just okay - a bit too much breading. Great burgers - mostly cooked to specifications (maybe a little closer to medium than medium rare).  The menu is large and difficult to choose which burger you want. I like the multiple bun options. Service was attentive.

This place is AWESOME!! First time here, atmosphere is great, lively m7sic and great staff. I got the Hatch Chili Cheeseburger, with onion rings and the Maui Coconut Porter. The burger came out perfect, well seasoned and the hatch chili very tasty. The onion rings were to die for. The wife got the Mac Narley on the pretzel bun with sweet potato tots..... all awesome. All in all, we just found a new joint when we come to Phoenix.
Expensive but good on the overall. Environment, seating, some crazy people were there but yet it's a college area, we had fun.

I've been to the location in Scottsdale and finally made it out to the Tempe location off Mill Ave. This is absolutely my all time favorite burger place. From the fries and sweet po"TOT"oes to the BLT's and AMAZING burgers, great beer selection, plus the extremely friendly staff at both locations...this place is the #1 burger spot. I still cannot believe my favorite burger that I now always order is the PB&J Bacon burger...yes, I thought it would have been gross...now I can't NOT order it! Try it!

We went to Scottsdale for a visit and chose this bar for lunch. I ordered a BBQ burger with grilled corn (medium) and my husband ordered one with onion rings. We checked in and had chips and salsa as well. My burger was super delicious. But I was a bit surprised by the size of onion rings here. Overall we were satisfied and this place worth a visit:
good food, good service, good vibe great place to eat at before a night in old town.

Love this place!   Laid back vibe, lots of options on different burgers & sauces, and great happy hour that starts at 11 AM on Fridays!   I love that they have an option of sweet potato tater tots as a side......try them with the Pineapple Teriyaki sauce!  So good!

Great vibe, pleasantly surprised by how busy it was. Robyn was our server and although she was busy, she hustled hard to take care of us. Hostess did a great job getting us watered before our server came over. Mushroom Swiss Burger with sweet potato tots was awesome.  Great Happy Hour specials, Thursdays all day HH.  Patron bucket is one of the best deals in town if you like Patron.  Bucket of ice comes with 4 Coronitas (the little ones) and a bottle w/ 4 shots of Patron for $28.  I don't know anywhere else you can get four Patron shots for that cheap, plus the added bonus of the Coronitas.  Definitely recommend.
Love this place for an amazing burger! Cool ambience, good service, good prices and close to home-what more could you ask for?!
Just when you think you've had just about any kind of burger, you stumble across Rehab Burger Therapy. The burgers were great, and the service was amazing!

We have been back several times and every time the service and food are great. but, tonight they totally knocked it out of the park. Fantastic friendly service, great food, and the wings were as good or better than any wings you can get in a dive bar back in Western New York. 

Great job!

I am cringing as I write this; My husband and I have a 1 year old so date nights are at a minimum for us. This being said, we try to sneak in a 'date lunch' here and there. After reading some stellar positive reviews, we decided to try Rehab Burger Therapy out. Parking was fine, we got into a good spot right away, but as soon as we walked through the door, we were disappointed. We stood in the doorway for a few minutes before anyone noticed us, were sat and ignored for at least 10 minutes. We finally ordered and the server returned 5 minutes later because she 'forgot to take drink orders'. 25 minutes later we were served our food... this is the only reason I gave this joint 2 stars-- the food. The Hawaiian burger and sweet potato tots were so delish, but still didn't make up for the super disappointing service-- after all we didn't lunch until 1pm so it wasn't swamped. We will try again, on an occasion where we have more time bc the food truly was yummy!

This place was really GOOD!  Great, quick service out on the patio.  The Margatini was perfectly chilled, the Bacon Cheeseburger was delicious (with all the fixins); even the Sweet PotTOT's were perfect!!!
Great lunch joint - huge helpings and the burgers are ridiculous! Come hungry, for sure.
Huge burgers super good quality meat love the sweet potato tots and how everything tastes like its grilled
Awesome place. Feels like a Southern California beach bar. Super laid back and great food. The ghost pepper burger is a must try!!! Will be back soon
Awesome!!!!! I ordered the pbj burger and it tasted heavenly! Service here is great, as well.

I have been to Rehab a couple of times, the burger place not the real kind, and each time I have enjoyed my meal and the excellent service.

The owners are always around and will stop by to chat, they really want the experience to be a good one for their customers.  The sweet potato tots are awesome, especially with the special dipping sauce that has some heat to it.  I always get the smaller sized burger, and with all the toppings and the tots, it is more than enough food.  My favorite one is the Hatch Chile Cheeseburger, just enough heat and they always cook them perfect (I like mine medium rare and I am always getting them overcooked!)  The Turkey Burger is also a solid choice with avocado and pepper jack.  And, unlike many of the other burger places, they have other stuff on their menu too, pastas, sandwiches, and salads.

If I need a burger fix in the Old Town area, Rehab is my top choice.

happy hour 3-7p weekdays. drafts $2 domestic, $3 premium. four peaks brews including peach. some other decent drink deals. 

at the time of this post hh is all day on thursday!

sunday is 11 til 4p. 2 bucks off frozen margarita which is just so damn tasty.

the food and burgers ive tried are all excellent. 

the pot brownies are ridiculous. add ice cream.

whatever you get you probably wont go home hungry.

I dream about this place in my sleep. Yes the wait was long but it is WELL WORTH IT. Food is delicious! Best wings and tots i'v ever had!

Robin (i think that was her name) is the most helpful and caring waitress alive. She recommended small alterations to fit our taste and she knew what she was talking about. Although she was very busy that night, she still sat with us while taking our order and helped us find the right mix to satisfy our hunger. GO SEE ROBIN.
Good bergers. Interesting menu. Be careful ordering the large Berger unless you are real hungry. Good margaritas.

OMG - such a funky cool place.  The waiter - David - was a super cool guy.  Stood there and chatted with us and made us feel super comfortable.  The food is really, really good - great burgers with different styles and toppings.  The sweet potato tots are awesome, as are the onion rings.

I've been a happy Rehab customer for a few years now. Today's combination was a real treat. Chips and salsa started if off (I prefer w/o the Mermaid Dust - just ask nicely, they'll gladly oblige). I don't know what they do special w/ those chips, but it makes me crave them more than is reasonable.   Then ... call me nutso.. I don't care... The Cobb salad. Piled high with all the goodies (I got it w/o the pecans, really). Half the salad is in my fridge right now daring me to hold out until midnight snack! 
First timer or long-timer, drop in ASAP and tell (owners) Denise or Ken "Dan told me to ask when Tempe grand opening is coming!!" Yes. Rehab 2, baby!
Yum yum yum! Fantastic burgers, delicious sides, and great service! Heard a fair bit about this place and I'm happy to say it did not disappoint. Will return without question :)

There were four of us who went here before a Giants game for our "pre game" meal. The highlight of this experience where the mac and cheese burger and the pb & j burger that I had. The pb & j was recommended by our waiter Ryan and it was unbelievably delicious. Our friend who had the mac and cheese burger said it was the best burger he had ever had. Ryan said we had to come back the next day for the Saturday special. 

We came back the next day and 3 people in our party of 7 had the special. It consisted of a 10 oz patty with cheese, bacon, ham, maple syrup, a fired egg and all of the fixing on a bun that was a glazed donut for the top and 1/2 glazed donut for the bottom. They loved it!  For me it was the jalapeño popper burger, it was fantastic. Our waiter, Devin, was a lot of fun, as was Ryan. 

The onion rings and sweet potato tots are the best. 

With 10 days left in our trip we plan on going back for more of this "health food".

I love this place. Great food. I strongly recommend giving the pig wings a try. The burgers are huge and and the sweet potato tater tots are addicting. Huge portions reasonable prices for the location and great service. Would like to see some better beer selections on tap but all in all this place is definitely worth going to when in old town.

Great place!  All four of us went and everyone loved their burgers.  Three of us had the McNalrly burger which reminds you of the old Bobs Big Boy but much better. Thank goodness I got the small size but it was interesting to watch my brother in law eat the full double burger.   One had the chilli burger which was great as well.  The fries are great as well as the sweet potatoe tots. I'm didn't care for the onion rings but everyone else did.  We came from Glendale and will most definitely be back!

Been there twice. First time would give it 3.5 stars. Was decent. Was there last week. Took forever to get our food and there may have been at most three other groups there ( of maybe a total of 12 people) so it was dead.  Finally got food and every order was wrong. When they finally corrected and got our food, it was below average.   There are far too many other places to go and get burgers, so this place needs to step up their game or they will be done.

This place has great burgers and our server was very chill and overall a rad experience! Seriously the food was unequally prepared, with fresh, high quality ingredients. Our glasses were always refilled and the atmosphere is very casual! Not cheap, but well worth the price! I had the Mac and cheese burger (5oz) which was perfectly cooked! I totally recommend this place, and the downtown Scottsdale location is cool!
Amazing burgers and sweet potato tater tots. They are big, too. My husband said his turkey burger was the best he has ever had. We will be back the next time we get to Phoenix!

Best Burgers I have ever had.

I know the PBJ + Bacon Burger sounds weird, but it is oh so good! Sweet and salty and spicy! 

I ate there on three different occasions and every time my burger was perfectly cooked.

Onion rings were awesome too!

Came here on a Sunday afternoon. This place has awesome specials!!! I ordered the "hangover burger" without bacon and without the hatch green chilli with the sweet POTotOES. Omg, you MUST have the sweet POTotOES!! Presentation, food quality, value and service were excellent. If I ever return to Scottsdale, this will be a pitstop! PLEASE OPEN SHOP IN SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA!!!! :)

We started with the Calamari which was very delicious and was enough that it could have been a meal in itself. My wife had a Veggie Noogie which is a Portobello mushroom/eggplant/sprouts on a bun and I had Backyard BBQ Burger. Both of our dinners were very good and we had enough leftover for dinner tomorrow night. The waitress was very nice and did a great job! We will be back!

Not only the best damn burger in Arizona, yes they were rated the #1 burger in the whole state, and it's in our backyard, but they have one of the best chefs who always has more than just burgers for options that are equally amazing. I eat here at least once a week, even though I live 30 mins away. The owners are always nice and striking up conversations, and the staff gives off a vibe of relaxation as soon as you arrive. And if the PB&J burger sounds too weird, it's definitely not. It's my favorite burger and I've had nearly everything on the menu, including weekend special burgers. Go get you some now!

I wad craving a burger and didn't want the usual chain restaurant type. I found this place on yelp and I am beyond happy with the choice. From the start service was 5 star--the server sat at our table welcomes us as first time patrons, went through detail about the menu options, introduced us to the "milkshake man" and gave great recommendations! The burger was amazing, tots excellent, and to our surprise the milkshake man gave us the very first glasses of the vanilla milkshake!!! This place is an A+! I'll def be back! Thank u rehab for satisfying my burger craving

On a Saturday afternoon we decided to come here. The restaurant was really busy but the servers would take a long time to come around and check on us, the burgers came out cold and the fries were also cold; from what I've heard about this place, I had real high expectations and they all came crumbling down.

Tried this little place out, on the advice of a friend......TOTALLY AMAZING!! I do believe its my new favorite place for a terrific burger! Sweet potatots are addicting and a delicious change from fries! Service was outstanding, everyone smiling and truly looking like the were enjoying themselves! We will be back!!!!! Soon!!!!

I have an obsession with fish tacos and since moving here 7 months ago, I haven't been able to find one that is even tolerable. I have now, thanks to Rehab Burger Therapy! 

I enjoyed every last bite of my fish tacos the other evening. We went during happy hour and they had cheap beers and pinnacle drinks. My husband had a chicken burger on a pretzel bun and he said the chicken was well seasoned. His fries were also delicious. 

We will definitely be back! I'm still searching for the perfect fish taco down here but I have renewed hope now!

Are you kidding me with this place? My server was fun, funny, and got everything perfect! She also brought out a ton of the different sauces for us to try without us even asking. 
P.S. I know it sounds terrifying but do yourself a favor and get the PB&J burger...it's like an "O" for your mouth!!!!
Ordered a bacon cheese burger tonight. They charged me an extra $.69 for cheese! The manager told me it was extra. Don't let them rip you off too!!! Double check you bill.

Service was a little slow but they got the orders spot on. The atmosphere was a little to Scottsdale stuck up for my taste. My actual taste buds were pleased though! Had the Hatch Chili burger with the pretzel bun = perfection! The fries had a chili lime seasoning for a great twist! I will certainly be going back to try the Chill Cheese burger.

One of the best burgers I've ever had!  Being very partial to the burgers, I sometimes forget all of the many other options available to order. They have appetizers, 7 different Salads for entrees, wings, Pastas (The Mac & Cheese is AMAZING!) and then...2 1/2 pages of delicious hamburgers!!  They have 2 sizes of hamburgers.  The "Rehab" is 10 oz of ground beef and the "Relapse" burger is 5 oz of ground beef - the absolute perfect size for ladies. My faves..."Mushroom and Swiss burger" and the "Spicy Mac and Cheese burger".  They also have a Veggie burger, Turkey burger, and multiple sandwiches.  The restaurant itself is a very laid back vibe. There is seating inside and outside and these beautiful Spring nights make sitting outside an even better experience. Wait staff are very friendly and seem to appear when you need them, yet don't hover at your table. All in all...GO! Go eat one of the best burgers in town. You'll be glad you did!!

Have a Backyard BBQ and a couple Coronas!
Not too much, not too little!
Great place!  Loved the decor!  Great service!  
Really reasonably priced, too! 
I will definitely come back!

Delicious!!!! I had the hangover burger which was so good and I could only eat half. The sweet potato tots were my fave with whatever yellow sauce they serve on the side. I topped it off with a chocolate lava milk shake... Yes please! This place gives a relaxed vibe, good food, decent prices for the sometimes over priced Scottsdale area & I will def be back to try the pb&j burger :)

Really disappointed after reading all the wonderful recommendations on YELP.   This hamburger place is overrated.  The burger was ok, the onion rings and french fries were not fully cooked and small size.  We struggled to find our waiter to get our drinks re-filled.  The atmosphere is nice but the seating is not super comfortable.  We would not go back there are too many other great burger places.

Waited 20 minutes to order.  Drinks forgotten. Pressured to purchase additional drinks. Food took 45 minutes from ordering. Tables that sat after us received food before. Server stopped bringing out our food to check with other tables. When order was requested to be canceled server rudely said it was already made a few times before finally canceling. Would never return worst service.

If you want a burger where the patty itself is the star of the show, you do not want a rehab burger. Here, the patties are overcooked, under-charred, and under-flavored. The menu offers a wonderful variety of fixins to add to your burger, including at least three different types of buns (brioche, pretzel, and gluten free) and lots of package deals like the Hawaiian burger I had last night (ham, pineapple, jack cheese [I think], and a mostly tasteless liquid claiming to be a teriyaki wasabi aioli) but the beefy taste, if it's there at all, is almost entirely buried beneath the rest. And I say this even though neither the ham nor the pineapple were very tasty. My wife had this problem last time with the PB&J burger, which tasted pretty much like a PB&J sandwich without the burger. I'm not telling folks to stay away, but I think they'll find the sandwich descriptions on the menu more pleasing than what they find on their plates.

This place is the BEST ... The food is amazing the atmosphere is wonderful i highly recommend this place it is the best burgers i have ever had and my daughter loves the fish tacos ... Keep up the good work

Not what we thought: My fiance and I were really excited to have a burger here since it was the #1 Yelp rated burger place in Scottsdale, but we were disappointed with our burgers. He ordered the Swiss Mushroom Burger and after I took a bite out of it it was really bland. The patty seemed to barely be seasoned and hardly had any savory flavors or high notes. I ordered the Backyard BBQ Burger, and the pineapple BBQ sauce was good as were the 2 giant onion rings, however, the patty was also quite bland and seemed to be seasoned the same way as the Swiss Burger. The Sweet Potato Tater Tots that Yelp users seemed to be raving about was just missing something. They were far too sweet. Maybe it was the batter? Perhaps we just caught them on a bad night. However, the SERVICE was EXCELLENT. Very pleasant and cheerful staff who checked on us frequently and we were also seated very quickly. Our food  arrived without much waiting. The ambiance is fun and inviting with a relaxing, casual beach vibe. All in all, it was ok, but not the type of burger place we anticipated.

Really good burger joints are few and far between and sometimes places try to mask their food quality with great service and a cool atmosphere experience. Old town Scottsdale has a gem in their midst that delivers on all three! These guys are not posers! They know burgers! I had the relapse (5oz party) hangover burger with bacon, fried egg and green chili peppers and a side of sweet potato tater tots. Almost worth killing for! Can't wait to go back into Rehab!

I've eaten here several times and brought friends and family, they all love it.  Trust me and order the PB&J burger and sweet potato tots, delicious!  Staff is friendly, food is delicious, and beer is ice cold.  You'll love it!

Food was great..but the wait for those burgers was long!! Our taters were cold, but the waitress did bring us hot and fresh ones upon request. Overall everyone enjoyed the food and would definitely return...but bring your patience.

A great place with an outstanding atmosphere, BUT unfortunately the staff and food need to be improved upon! I ordered a bacon burger cooked medium which I apparently didn't know medium means different things in different restaurants. My food was delivered and looked great , sadly my fries had been cooked too many times and there was no potato left in the middle. I explained to the waitress who wasn't very impressed and grudgingly bought me fresh fries.
