My burger was raw not medium ( before everyone shouts I eat blue steak) when I  explained this to my waitress she advised me that this is how they cooked their medium burgers and I should have been more specific on how I wanted my medium burger cooked!,,,, Really explain and be more specific! Surely medium means medium. Needless to say I won be going back

It's not often the BF and I find a place to eat we both enjoy. I'm vegetarian and gluten free while he's a Bacon, Bacon, Bacon, Beef, Potatoes and any other kind of red meat sorta guy. Anyhow, this place is perfect for us! He ordered the PB&J Bacon Burger (which he absolutely loved) and I ordered the Veggie Nuggie with a gluten free bun (very filling and delicious). We both enjoyed our meals and are planning another trip back before we leave the area. There are many great menu options for both of us to choose from, the service was great and the atmosphere was relaxed and welcoming. I highly recommend Rehab!

First I must say the food was excellent. Definitely a must try if you are a burger fan. However, service was lacking energy and familiarity with menu, hope to go back and possibly just sit at the bar!
I have only had the turkey burger and sweet potato tots, but it was great!

ummmm PBJ & Bacon Burger.... whoever the heck came up with this is a freakin genius!!! if you like pb&j and you like bacon, then you will love this. crazy a$$ flavor combination, but it works. Sweet potato tots are pretty dang good too. i'll be back :)
First visit on Saturday. Great burger and good service. Arrived at 11 and glad we did. Was mobbed by noon.
The mac & cheese burger is probably my favorite thing ever!!

Love finding different places that offer something more than the norm. We got there 20 after they opened on a Monday and it was packed!!! Was really tempted to get the pb&j burger but couldn't bring myself to do it. Went with the safe Mac & cheese burger! It was good but not amazing. I will definitely go back & try the other stuff at some point but it's just not a must have for me based on the first trip.
Great burgers and service.  Try the pablano burger.  Outstanding.   The fries are goid as well.  Great pkace with great food at a great price.
This is our favorite place in Old Town for a great burger.  The happy hour is fantastic as well.  I really enjoy the staff as they are very hard working yet laid back that makes for a perfect mix.
Yum!!! Best burger in Scottsdale. They have amazing pretzel buns and chili fries, I don't even like chili. The blue cheese burger is to notch! If you like burgers out of the box try this place

Awesome burger joint! Cool, relaxing atmosphere which goes with the theme so well. Always have had super friendly servers.  Ask for lettuce, tomato, onion and pickle if you're used to your burgers coming with them, will not be assumed that you want it. They got creative with the dipping sauces and are always happy to recommend which goes best with your order. Love the sweet potato tots with the pineapple sauce! My only negative is that when I've taken burgers to go they have always been overlooked. But then again when is take out ever as good as being served a hot dish you can dig into right away?! Definitely give them a try if you're in a burger mood...very accommodating burger options. The poblano and hang over burger are two thumbs up!
First time I haven't finished off a late of food in a long time and it was sooooo good!!
Burgers are delish... try one with a fried egg!  Tried the claims as well.  Good portions and fresh!  Service was outstanding!   Will return
Local, authentic, getting it done right. Friendly staff, great burger, great atmosphere.
Love this place.  The pig wings are a must!   They are sweet with a slow perfect burn.

Great lunch spot, enjoyed the vibe of the place and the food was great. Poblano burger with substitute of the chorizo patty, excellent. What really made our day was our top notch server who answered questions and provided some local suggestions for further fun. Highly recommend!

Well just let me say:  "The food  is amazing".   Great little spot with super, super service!   The bartender, John, was the best!  The chili was the best I have ever had.  Burger was on a nice brioche roll and cooked just as ordered. Chef send out several samples to try and everything was delicious.  Chipotle aioli and pineapple sauce were delicious.  Sweet potato tots were great.  Very nice frozen margarita and margarita on the rocks.  Several other options if you are not a burger fan. Tuna salad was very good.  Will  definitely be back!
they have great service, great burgers and phenomenal wings! we go here all the time, even for take out :)

This place was freakin AWESOME! Came here for the first time  after a baseball game and  was totally worth it! Burgers are delicious, corn on the cob was sooo good must have like crack in the seasoning cause I want more lol! Wish we had this in Vegas! I can't wait to come back down for spring training, definitely a must go to place!

I've heard about this place since I've been here so I finally got a chance to try it out for lunch yesterday.  First off you can't beat happy hour every day, $3.75 for a pint?  Dang, maybe that's just me coming from LA and expecting $9+ for a beer, but regardless, still happy to see that.  I got the Turkey Burger which was delightful and light enough where food coma was no that H(ard) Core.  It came with sprouts on top which was a first for me to have tasted on a burger and it was not poorly regarded.  I am also a big fan of TOTS!!!  I got the sweet potato tots in place of the fries which of course made me happy!  The plate also, much to my delight, came with 3 AWESOME dipping sauces, garlic aioli, chipotle mayo, & spicy ketchup.  Each sauce was just awesome!  I had to spread the sauce on my burger for each bite i took!  Man oh man!  It was definitely a very satisfying lunch.  I would recommend this spot to anyone, happy hour from 11a-6p :)

Cheers!
I expected a lot more from this place, but the burger was just mediocre.

We came here at the tail end of our "Spring Training" trip in Scottsdale. This could not be a better meal to end the trip. My friends and I all got the PB and J Burger because it was similar to the famous Jiffy burger in Chico, Ca and we were not disappointed! It was amazing and the service was great! Wish that we had one of these in SF.
Just got into town and had the hangover burger. Delicious. Get the sweet potato tater tots with it. Pretty awesome. Great service, fun atmosphere. Will be back.

Amazing food and great service! Everything tasted fresh and the sweet potato tots were a pleasant surprise of deliciousness- definitely recommend them! Our waiter forgot to give us the yelp discount on the brownies but no biggie because they were soooo worth every penny!

I happened to be in Scottsdale around lunch and discovered rehab burger therapy. I have never been before but I will definitely be back.  I ordered a chicken,  mushroom and Swiss sandwich and the first thing I noticed was that it smelled amazing.  That doesn't happen everywhere.  When I took my first bite I was so happy!  The flavor was amazing and the serving size was generous.  I will definitely be back.  I want my husband to experience this too! 5 stars for sure!

The food is super good. I went for the Mushroom & Swiss burger. I was hesitant to get the Rehab size since it is 10 ounces, but our waitress gave me a tip--they use the same size bun for the Rehab (10 oz.) and the Relapse (5 oz.) burgers, so I immediately took her advice and went Rehab. The last thing I wanted was a bad ratio of burger to bun. I also opted for the pretzel bun because I am obsessed with them, so any time I see them on a menu I have to indulge. I also opted for the sweet poTOToes, which were so-so. My husband went with the skin-on fries and I liked those better.
A wide variety of burger options and we're not talking about the run of the mill options here.  Large servings, great flavors and a friendly staff.  Would recommend.

HEY YALL...Thanks, but NO THANKS. I ordered the bacon burger. The worst burger that I have ever eaten. DRY DRY DRY....besides the Coolest Bartender and Worlds Best Corn on the Cob...This would just have been a waste of gas. I really really had my hopes up...oh well :-/
I really enjoyed the food is amazing and the people are better. I can't wait to return the next time I'm in Scottsdale.
Excellent Hamburger cooked the way you want it.  You don't realize how many times I have ask for a hamburger pink & warm & get a hockey puck instead.  This one was excellent!!!!

Our first visit here. Staff was very friendly. Salyna (pronounced Selena) was extremely nice, efficient, and checked back frequently to refill tea and water. Ordered the MacNCheese burger on pretzel bun. Since I am retired from a national restaurant chain that specializes in hamburgers, I'm discriminating in my opinion. It was an excellent hamburger - we order the relapse size and my wife had a little of it, and I was still full with my portion. The meat - cooked medium - had a little pink, which is what we wanted, and the MacNCheese was flavorful with a good kick from the sirachi sauce. Toppings were fresh, fries were tasty. The fry portion that came with the burger wasn't huge, so if you are a big fry eater you may want to add an extra order. Saw the onion rings go by to another table and they looked large and fresh. Had a frozen margarita which was well blended (probably a machine which we like) with a tasty margarita mix, lots of salt on the rim, and a large portion. We arrived at 11:15AM  on a Thursday morning and by noon they were on a wait. Just a note: we had a small medical service dog with us  and they were very accommodating and didn't hassle us. We will definitely go back and try other burgers and sides.

We read reviews and had some people talk to us about it... It was exactly what we expected!
We all loved it! I had the Rodrigo da Vinci said it was amazing, I had plenty of left overs for lunch. My boys had the Mac N cheese burger, it was good.
If you do plan on going, go with time because this place is busy! But well worth it

This was my favorite spot in town when I visit Scottsdale...until tonight. Just got in after a long day of travel, was told I could sit anywhere. Sat at the counter outside, such a nice spot on a wam night!

Was not greeted by someone asking for a drink order, but instead that they were closed. I asked if I could order take out at the bar and was told that would be fine. Walked up to the bartender who said, oh sorry, we're closed.  

I did have a chance to speak to the owner, who was apologetic and offered a seat and to keep the kitchen open for me, I'd lost my taste for Rehab Burger. 

Would I go again? Yes, if in the neighborhood. Would I drive all over Phoenix after a long day of travel like tonight? No.

I've driven past this place a number of times.  This evening my wife and I decided not to drive past.  Glad we did.  I have the Hawaiian Burger with Jamaican corn.  Fries are usually pretty hard to beat but the corn was a stunning surprise.   Wow.  And the burger?  Couldn't put it down.  Definitely a new favorite to add to the rotation.

Love love love this place! Let's start with the laid back beachy vibe and the fun service. Makes me feel like I'm in some surf town not Scottsdale. The food is really yummy. I love the mushroom burger but my favorite thing on the menu is the pig wings with a side of the pineapple aioli. It's amazing. This place gets really busy on the weekends so expect a bit of a wait but in my opinion it's worth it. Their specials are usually really delicious too so don't be shy to try them!
Great food. Really cool fun atmosphere. Kay was the best and gave great advice about the town to us. Thanks again.

We had a wonderful dinner here during spring training. The burgers were great and the service was amazing. We sat at the bar to have a drink and wait for our table, but the bartender was so good, we decided to stay put and eat there. Kay was hands down the best bartender I have ever watched work. She is super friendly, and VERY competent. The atmosphere is very casual. There are several tv's at the bar, which his pretty big. Even though it was crowded, I never felt smushed eating at the bar. We had a great time.
Whoa! PBJ and Bacon burger was unreal. Service was fantastic and the servers were extremely pleasant and helpful. I will definitely be coming back.

Awesome location in the heart of Mill Ave. This Rehab Burger location is more spacious than the Scottsdale location. The outside patio is very inviting and perfect for enjoying the mild Arizona winter. The staff and food are just as great as in Scottsdale. Been to Tempe Rehab Burger twice with no waiting.
Fun!  Great burger and beachy atmosphere..felt like Southern CA vacation.  No parking but good food!
I needed a cigarette after the No Poblano burger it was that good.

Very cute place. Not large by any means. We got there at 5pm and it was already pretty filled. There was a variety of people from seniors, to college age kids and families with kids. The burgers are AMAZING! (And beautiful to look at, lol.) Did you check out the photos? I had the onion rings as my side and I loved them. My friends and I were extremely happy to find this place and will be back. They have a small outdoor patio for seating as well, and a public parking lot next door which is convenient.

After making the move to the Scottsdale area from Indiana just a couple days ago, me and my dad were looking for a spot to grab a great burger and beer. Once I began my search the name Rehab Burger Therapy caught my eye. I read the reviews from fellow Yelpers and couldn't help but make the trip to try it out.

Most every review I read had something great to say about the PBJ & Bacon burger, which is what I went with. Now let me remind you that I had already had the best peanut butter burger on earth, the Duane Purvis from the famous Triple XXX in West Lafayette, IN. Don't believe me, just ask any other Purdue alum & they will tell you the same. Although it's hard for me to say it is better than the Duane Purvis, it was damn good. I was a little skeptical about the jelly & bacon part of the equation, but it was a great compliment. An unusual burst of flavor that most any would enjoy, especially if you're the adventurous type. 

As far as beer goes, I just had a simple Bud Light. I would like to see them incorporate more beers into their selections. Perhaps some beers from local micro-breweries, since that is all the craze at the moment. But it was nice a cold, just the way I like it.

Safe to say I'll be back soon to try out one of their other numerous burger options!

They are dog friendly on the patio and the happy hour is pretty good but unfortunately Im not a huge fan of the taste of the burgers or the heavy thick buns. I will definitely be back though as the staff and little patio is great!
Great experience! Food and service was great. We had the pig wings, sauce was amazing! Jalapeño popper burger with the pretzel bun and the sweet potato tots were great! Highly recommend!
Just wonderful! Can't say enough about the menu and overall vibe of this place!! Excellent service!! I recommend the Tuma Sammy! :)

PBJ and Bacon Burger was soooo good. Amazing. I'm usually blah on burgers but I'm coming back to have this again. And the sweet potato tots were equally as good. The server was awesome. Totally personable and attentive and cool. Great atmosphere. Highly recommend!

This being my first time in Scottsdale, I read the reviews and looked at the pictures and it was a must try. I get there about 10pm on a Saturday night and was attended to right away. The service was awesome and the food was also awesome. The time I got my food from the time I ordered was impressive. Highly recommended to anyone who has never been to this awesome area know as Old Town Scottsdale.

Cute little place.  Very relaxed "beach cabana type" atmosphere.  Burgers are monstrous.  I ordered poblano burger with onion rings.  Call me old fashion or just old, but I prefer a traditional juicy flame broiled burger, which this is def. not.  Too much going on with my burger that it completely took away from my meat experience. Patty wasn't moist (I ordered Med well) was lean, I give them that.  Onion rings were meh.  Wine burger has the best onion rings to date.  Kid and family friendly.  Glad I tried it.  Friendly servers.

This is the best place to get a good burger the fries are amazing and the suave selection is great, our server was very friendly and gave my girlfriend and I very good service. I left with my stomach full and didn't break the bank. I strongly recommend this place for any occasion. The setting is very creative and you can outside or inside. Will be coming back soon.
Beer was cold. Staff was attentive. Burger was a MAJOR disappointment.  The burger was Thin and dry as was the bun. Given the reviews.....Was I at the wrong burger joint?

If you and your family are looking for a quick meal that is reasonable tasting and in the middle of the road, this is the place.  I had one of their burgers which was Ok and my wife had a salad which included lots of greens but no special taste or character.  Service was fast and reasonable.  Ok for a burger bar but I have had better nearby at the same price range.

Some of the best service I have had in a while! Have had the same waitress on both visits -she is a rock star. Plus a great burger. Awesome sauce selections, secret menu / ghost burger & corn on the cob side.

Ok so I'm from out of town and wanted a big juicy burger !!! And I came to the right place. As soon and we walked in  we were greeted by both owners with smiles and hellos. It felt very mom and pop as soon as we sat down. We chose the the bar to sit at because the bartender looked like he was having fun with customers and a SHAKEWeIGHT !!!! Haha oh and it was happy hour!! He did not disappoint ..walking us through the menu and keeping our beers ice cold!!  We got the wings!! Yummy and split the BBQ burger with bacon!! Both fantastic.  This will be a great spot for spring training. Ask for Reno behind the bar. He will turn your day around!!!

Hit the spot on so many levels,  fresh ground chuck and delicious pretzel bun yummmm. 
Great ambiance, great service.  Really  feel the therapy working. Can't wait to relapse and come back :)
Good job.
Oreganos is missing out!   Rehab has one of the best burgers I've ever tasted and the sweet potato tots are incredible!

Live in the neighborhood and this is one of my faves that I frequent.  Burger and tot's joint with a tasty spin on burgers with sweet potatoes, dipping sauces and unbelievable portions.  I've tried the apps (wings are awesome), salads (they all taste great and are massively huge), several of the burgers (all good), and believe it or not...I can eat A LOT but I cannot ever eat the Venice Beach Club sandwich by myself.  Only drawback is they need more space because they get busy and you might have to wait a little during peak times but that's because the food is so awesome.
Oh my Goodness, absolutely excellent food and service! Our waitress Nicole really knew her stuff!

This place was good.  Not the best burger I have ever had, but it was good.  I had the PB and J burger, which is what my server recommended.  It sounds funky but it actually worked out pretty well.  I liked the flavors.  I had the larger size because, why not.  It was definitely filling.
Fun place, fun menu, good burgers ... painfully slow.  Careful if you're trying to squeeze it in a lunch hour.

A-mazing!!!!!! Loved it! Waitress kept my drink full and kept my husbands beers coming. Husband had burger with onion rings and I had the pulled pork on top of mine? will definitely making  the drive to come back again. Fries had just the right amount of spice to them

I had the Hawaiian Burger today:  Black Forest Ham, Swiss Cheese, Fresh Cut Pineapple and a side of Teriyaki Pineapple Aioli. I chose the pretzel bun.  

The place was clean, the staff friendly and attentive, and the food was really good and cooked as ordered (medium had pink in the center and was juicy).   I would return, and bring friends.
Tons of choices and lots of unique hamburger variations to choose from.  Awesome service from our amazing waitress.  Management is superb as well.   Looking forward to our next visit!

Not sure if it was just a off day or what not but...

Had to clarify our order twice with the waitress and it still got messed up. Not a custom order or anything, we just had never been their before so all the options for buns, sizes and cooking temperature were never asked so we never got want we expected. Slow and inattentive throughout our stay, really bad.

Burgers were really nothing special. Patties were tough and flavorless (ordered medium and rare respectfully). Toppings were ok but they seem to try to counter their mediocrity with huge portions. Fries were underdone and just... meh. I wanted to love this place based on its pictures, and the food /looked/ good, but just didn't taste good at all. With the lousy service it was a total fail unfortunately :-/

I've been to this establishment a few times, not sure what all the service complaints are about. The service here has never been shitty but it's possibly because I choose to eat at this pretty popular and tiny restaurant at non-peak hours or take my food to go. 

My personal favorite, the peanut butter jelly bacon sriracha burger, sounds gross but i've recommended it to people before and the daring few who have tried it, enjoyed it.
Their spicy mac n cheese is pretty good, not the best but definitely worth the price and if you like a kick of heat with your cheese.
I've tried several of their burgers and none have been a disappointment, so I feel this place is worth trying especially if you enjoy trying weird burger combinations or just want a tasty gourmet burger in general. 
They also have a good happy hour.

I wish I could have loved this place because it has a great location and inviting atmosphere.  I was too disappointed that when we ate there (on a Sunday) they were out of quite of a few items.  No avocado or gluten-free bun today?!?  I tried to look past that an ordered a protein-style burger instead.  It was good, not anything to write home about.

This is my 2nd favorite hamburger place I have EVER eaten at!... My food is always perfect! I love the pretzel bun! I would strongly suggest trying the pretzel bun! The sweet potato tots are amazing!!! All of the staff I have meet are amazing, the owners are awesome, and the Kimmy special drink is not only refreshing but almost guilt free. I practice out of a clinic close by so I have even had lunch meetings here! I couldn't recommend Rehab Nurger more!
Friendly staff, great service, phenomenal food! The decor and music gave a mellow vibe. If I didn't live so far away I'd be back on the regular!

It's been three hours since I finished eating at Rehab Burger Therapy and I'm still stuffed.  I had their Backyard BBQ Burger and when it came out with a huge knife through the middle of a soft Brioche bun and with two HUGE onion rings I thought I was in heaven (with a little indigestion).  The burger was cooked perfect and the Spicy Ketchup rocked.  The fries that came with were just ordinary (under seasoned) but the dipping sauces made it worth the calories.

My mother had the hatch Chili Burger which was equally great mainly because of the chili's, chipotle aioli and the incredible Pretzel Bun.  I don't think I would order another sandwich from here without the Pretzel Bun.  She also had the Sweet Potato tots which which were a great twist on regular fries.

We had a very small amount of room left in our tummy so we decided to split an Orange Milkshake. Great decision!  It tasted like the old Orangecicle from my youth.  It was nice and smooth and not so thick that it gave you a shake ache.

Place was fun, service was friendly and food was outstanding.  Will go back again soon!

Been here a few times now since it opened. Best burgers in Tempe, so many good ones to choose from!  

Great atmosphere, very attentive staff & nice patio. Cheap drinks for happy hour plus all day thursday. Always looking forward to returning.

Really solid burgers and salads. 

Everything on the menu comes in HUGE portions so consider sharing.

The wait staff is really nice! 

If you are in the mood for a burger - this is a good eat!

Poor customer service. Waited 45 minutes just to get a beer and water. Waited another 30 minutes to put in an order. During a slight rush, I still should not have waited that long. 

Chill vibe, doubt I come back to visit.
Seriously the best burger I've ever had! The atmosphere here is so awesome too. Everyone is so chill. When our family was in town, this was the first place we took them to try! They loved it too! ;)

Place is a joke and their portion's are hit and miss. You never get what you pay for it's more along the lines of if the cook staff are being lazy that day not giving the correct amount of food to everyone and the servers not caring enough to send back to the kitchen before giving it to the customer.

We visited based on rave yelp reviews, and now we can say we've been there. :/  we sat at the bar & service was fine, although they ran out of gluten free buns (on a Wednesday??) so I had to eat a burger patty with watery iceberg lettuce. There were many burger offerings, so that was kind of fun, if you don't care about how bad all the ingredients are for you . So if you are a health conscious person, you might want to pass on this place.

Awesome experience here! A little unsure about the PB and J Bacon burger when I saw it on the menu but it turned out to be an excellent decision when I was licking my fingers at the end. You got to try this one!
Very quick, respectful service. Tasty food, Liked the atmosphere. No complaints! Ian was great! I recommend this place.
so bomb! fries are solid too!  really cool environment and in a sea of burger places that all feel and taste the same Rehab is crushing it!!!!
Good burgers but rude service. Overall not very responsive and didn't seem to want to serve our table because we were here with a big group.

I am so excited about this location. I had an out of town guest come to town and I knew I wanted to have him try a Rehab burger. I was worried about driving to Scottsdale on a Saturday night, and having it be packed with a long wait. I was pleasantly surprised when I learned there was a location only a few blocks away from where we were! I called to ask what the wait looked like and was told they were busy- but there were a few spots at the bar open. Kassie at the bar was so kind on the phone, and since we were on our way, and two blocks away, she said she would hold a couple spots for us. I was shocked, that was so thoughtful of her, and it made me feel taken care of, and welcome before I ever stepped through the doors. This location exceeded my already high expectations, and it didn't disappoint in any way. The PBJ burger is my all time favorite and can't be missed. Amazing food! Perfection in the burgers all the way. The staff and vibe are so welcoming, and the customer service was simply awesome. Ian was our server and even brought us a small side of his favorite sauce to try for dipping the yummy sweet potato tots.***!! It's the little things that make the biggest impact. Special thanks to Kim, Ian, and Kassie- You made our dinner date perfect! We will be back- I'll be dreaming of pretzel buns, tots, and PB until we do:)

Outstanding service, excellent food, great atmosphere and over all one of the best ever. 

For those in town visiting, you will not be dissatisfied, you will walk away full, happy and wanting to go back. 

Enjoy, outstanding!!!!!!!!!
Love this place! Fantastic burgers! Great service! Dog friendly to boot! More detailed review to follow.
every time i come here i order the clams... the mushroom burger's yum as well as the sweet tater tots - surprisingly the PB&J burger is quite tasty

Great burgers! Great atmosphere! Vibe is relaxed and laid back! Had the bacon cheese burger, husband had the hangover burger. Perfectly cooked to medium as we requested! The onion rings were awesome! Definitely must for all you burger lovers!

Probably 2 1/2 stars.  Given all the 4-5 star reviews it is likely a bunch of college student reviews.  The burgers look great in the pictures.  They are just OK.  We had a Hatch chili burger, bacon bleu with pretzel bun and a chicken sandwich.  They were cooked as ordered but the beef, toppings nor bread had any great flavor to speak of.  Not bad, just not good. Service was timely and polite and friendly .  The atmosphere - specifically the menu design is very chain restaurant-like (hokey).  Looks like a good place to have a couple beers. 

The bigger issue was the staff dress.  The hostess was awful.  She was wearing an ill-fitting tank top and tights.  There was another waitress who was wearing a sleeveless t-shirt.  But she also had something tying the shirt back in such a way that her back was showing off a large tattoo but also ridiculous side-boob.  Trashy in general but disgusting as a food server.  Not sure if everyone got cold suddenly or the manager made them cover up as these two had jackets on when we left.

I will never forget the first time I ate the "porkster" burger here, mostly because never before had I had impure thoughts about a hamburger. 

the decor is fine, though i do wonder why there are so many damn bikes strapped to the walls/ceiling. the servers have been friendly and attentive every time i've been there.

I have loved this place for years and the fact that part of the ownership is from CORONADO helps. LOL!  Denise and Wiley are phenomenal people and know what the public wants or needs.  I love their vegan choices and my family loves the non-vegan choices. LOL  LOVE the atmosphere, wish it was bigger to accommodate everyone as there is usually a wait to get in. There is a reason for that.. they are GREAT!

My family and I liked this place. The whole restaurant is very small and cramped, but I do like the decor and theme. Our waitress was extremely nice and helpful and funny as well. I love how extensive the menu is. Our food came out pretty quickly and the favorite among my family was the spicy Mac n cheese burger! Very tasty and I would definitely come back for that burger! Also very well priced and even the build your own burger was pretty good. I wouldn't recommend this place for families with small kids, but I would definitely recommend to everyone else! The only really I'm not giving it 5 stars is because of how cramped and tight the restaurant was.

Great food and great service.

We parked next door and as we walked up, there was a bright and happy hostess to greet us. Everyone in the restaurant was smiling and said high to us. I felt like I was Norm walking into Cheers.

Our waitress was excited and knowledgeable, bright and fast. We had some really good burgers, but I would pass on the sweet potato tots next time.  I love sweet potato fries but I've tried SP tots at a few places now and they always seem to be bland.  But the burgers and the service make this place.

I wish we had one of these in the west valley.

I have been here a few times now, and every time, had a wonderful experience. So far, some of the best burgers in town in my opinion. I love the atmosphere, and the service has always been good. Great destination for a bike ride!

My friends and I set a goal of eating at a different restaurant each week. Each of us rate the restaurant from 1-10 on service, atmosphere, and of course the food. This week we choose the Rehab... all three of us rated it a solid 10, 10, and 10. We recommend the Rehab Burger Therapy in that it inexpensive and it will provide a lasting memorable experience that will bring you back again.
Yummy and hot  - good margaritas. Never had a bad experience. Love to sit outside. Calamari is better than you expect at a burger joint

Wanna start by saying this was a slightly better then decent burger. They're pretty large for the price and better then many places I've been in Phoenix but not all that amazing overall.

I had the Hangover Burger. It was a 10oz patty with cheese, bacon, a fried egg and green chiles with a pretzel bun. 

The burger looked fantastic however it seemed a bit light on flavor, slightly bland. Usually when I order a burger with a fried egg I don't need any type of sauce however I found myself dipping it in the ketchup they brought for the fries. The bottom bun became soggy pretty quick and it got annoyingly messy. 

The service was good and the ambiance was typical for a place like this however the beer selection was kind of mediocre. 

I'd probably come here again if other people wanted to try it but otherwise it was worth trying once I guess. Judging from the reviews maybe I just didn't order the right one or they were having an "off" day. It happens.

This is a solid burger place. Loved their brunch selections and patio seating area. The Turkey Burger that we customized was juicy and flavorful. I don't eat Red Meat so finding a good Turkey Burger is like finding gold. Nice variation of wine, beer and cocktails. Sweet potato fries were on point too. Go here and you will not be disappointed.

This place was great upon entering. Crowded, good ambiance, really nice and friendly staff. It had everything you'd want walking into a restaurant.

Unfortunately, it stopped there. Burgers were just ok. Asked for mine medium rare and it was more medium/medium well. I've had better burgers in lots of other places.

You know it's not a great experience when you go to a place with "an amazing burger" and the best part was the onion rings.

Fun time, great service, below average food.

Outstanding! Just came into town from Los Angeles and the servers went out of their way to take care of me! The pb&j burger was phenomenal so many depths of flavors, one of the servers (I think Jon?) even stated "you should close your eyes and experience everything that's happening right now!" Lol. They even had some tips on places I should visit while in town. I highly recommend this place, super friendly and great atmosphere!

The reason we picked out this place is because they have gluten free buns! Which is awesome, cause I still like to eat burgers even if I can't have gluten!

The burger tasted delicious, the fries were really good (and as a Belgian you can say I know a thing or two about fries) and the staff was super friendly! We'll return to this place.

I would suggest to make a reservation, since this place seems really popular..
Loved this place ,visiting from California and wish we had one there!! Great burgers and really great service by Rian!! Highly recommend, get the mac & chez burger on pretzel bun !! Insane!!

Love this place ! Mine and my husband's favorite burger spot in Scottsdale! (All it's missing is the ocean view!) We like to split the double Gnarly Mac burger on pretzel bun with fries which is modeled after the Big Mac  (burger is always plenty but might want to order a second basket of fries if you're sharing!) I'm pregnant right now and totally missing their frozen Coronarita's - they're better than anyone's in our opinion! Service is always friendly and they are always busy- tend to wait 5-25 min for a table of 2. Try to hit it up on a Thursday when Happy Hour is open-close  or weekday 3-6!

YUMMM! Was craving a burger and decided to take the 20 minute drive to Scottsdale to try this place and I am glad we did! Hubby got the PB&J burger which he says the flavors melded really well together and didn't taste like a straight up PB&J. I had the Poblano burger With their spicy onions on the side...so good! Atmosphere was fun and inviting. For sure will be back.
Excellent! Happy hour all day. We enjoyed the Bacon Blue burger and it was perfect. Save room for dessert. We had the brownie marshmallow fluff toasted with ice cream. And it was fantastic.

Probably the best burger I've ever eaten in my whole entire life. Out of all the burgers I've ever eaten in my life, this was the best burger I've ever had. The atmosphere is so welcoming and they have so many burger options to chose from. I really wish they had a rehab burger in Maryland. I would fly to Arizona just for the burger. I am in love

I LOVE this place! The burgers are always amazing, bartenders are friendly and make great drinks, and even when it's busy service is efficient. Sweet potato tots always, and you can't go wrong with any of the burgers.

This is a great place to eat!  My wife and I stopped here with outer two kids and we all found something to eat that we all enjoyed!  Service was friendly, attentive and prompt!  We will definitely come here again the next time we are in Scottsdale!

A friend from out of state and I went here last night for the first time. This is my first unsolicited Yelp! review. It was just THAT GOOD.

The service was excellent (Ryan)! We felt both very taken care of and not smothered at the same time, which is really remarkable and so so satisfying. The food was great - I had the turkey burger and fries.

I'm not a wordsmith and I don't think the review needs to go past: Excellent service, great food, amazing time! :)

Yummmmm! The peanut butter jelly bacon sriracha burger is not to be missed! It is absolutely indulgent. And go for the sweet potato tots! It gets rather warm inside with the door opening up and letting all the A/C out. And the bathrooms were like a sauna! However, I will brave the warm environment for that burger.  
The guys in our group ordered the bigger burger the first time and then realized quickly that the smaller size is just fine. With the side, you definitely won't leave hungry. 
I tasted my fellow diner's pork and, although tasty, would definitely order the burger.

My rating is more of 3.5 than a full 4 but oh well, its still good. Rehab Burger Therapy is maybe one of the worst names for a restaurant I've heard but still it didn't stop me from going in. Decor has no relation to name. Surfer looking joint. Which is fine. Menu doesn't relate to either concept, surfing or Rehab other than the sizing of the burger being "Rehab" for bigger and "Relapse" for the smaller.  Walked in on a February afternoon, restaurant is a bit on the warmer side, air's a little thick. Maybe just the day but still not perfect setting. Who cares about setting really, lets talk about the food. First of all the main reason I leaned to the 4 instead of 3 stars is mainly due to the waitress being pretty cute. That's a plus in my book. We started out with the calamari which was a great choice. Really good. They gave a really generous portion and we devoured it right away. Waitress brought us 3 different dipping sauces not sure if thats the norm, one was medium buffalo sauce that they put on the wings which she said "one of my favorites", 2nd was a chipotle something another, and the 3rd was the marinara that they give normally. All were fantastic! The buffalo sauce worked really well with the batter on the calamari and the other two were equally great. Like i said, we devoured it. Great start. We ordered beers, decent prices but not as chilled as they should've been. The three of us ordered all burgers, one had pulled pork on the burger but we were told they didn't have any pulled pork. Not good. We eventually ordered the bbq burger, chili cheese burger and the whatever the name was that had grilled pineapple, cheese and ham on this burger. BBQ burger went over really well. Pineapple ham burger also went over splendidly. My chili burger not quiet as good. The chili is good, would've been better as a side dish then on the burger. The whole plate when brought out was covered in chili. The bottom of my pretzel bun couldn't be found as it turned to mush from sitting in chili. Not good. The burgers are large but could use some kind of seasoning, a little on the bland side. Pretzel bun was ok, I've had better. You can buy better at Costco. Maybe they should do a daily run over there every day instead. The fries sucked. Barely ate any. The sweet potato tots were ok at best. Their sides need work for sure. Service even though she's pretty she was not the most prompt and kinda didn't show up for a while even though business was rather slow at this time. So there is some negatives but there was more positives so therefore a positive rating. I like the place but it does have room to improve. Hopefully if there is a next time, and it will be.
Ridiculously good burger, added the Chipoltle aioli sauce. Should have ordered the 5oz and not the 10oz as it was massive. nice bar atmosphere, can't go wrong here.

Overrated... Pretty good burger (nothing to come back again for) and non crispy tots! Also the place is filthy and has birds inside. My silverware was much less than clean and the napkins they gave us had sauce stains on them ew! Skip unless you like eating in filth.

My teenage son found this place when we were in Scottsdale & it was a great find!  I'm not a big burger fan, but even I thought it was great!  Both of my boys loved their food & were filled up by the portions (amazing with their seemingly bottomless stomachs!).  The service was good, the place was clean & had a fun vibe.  A great find that I would go back to again!

I LOVE REHAB BURGER! I'm in once a week for a regular order, and Courtney behind the bar always knows what I'm in for! Love the food, love the vibe. My only request is a dedicated to go service during spring break....I like to call my order in and pick up instead of mingling with the out of towners and that option isn't always available.

While the service was fine, the mushroom Swiss burger was completely overcooked and under seasoned. They also initially gave me the wrong order but as much as I tried to overlook it, the burger was just bland, dry, and grey.  I wanted to like this place but the food was just terrible. I can only stomach a few bites before I called it quits.
Excellent food.  One of the best burgers I've ever had.  Staff was overly nice, clean restaurant, and nice environment

Ordered the Know Pablano Burger, it was amazing. Cooked perfectly. I got the onions rings as well which were good, but probably just stick with fries next time. Their side sauces are very good, but the burger dint need them and I enjoyed it without.

This place is a lot of fun and the service is exceptional. The portions are YUGE! I've never seen so much calamari on a single plate. I'm a big guy and a big eater, but couldn't finish the salad that I ordered. I would definitely seek this place out - it's fun, a good value, and yummy in a part of Scottsdale that tends more to the pretentious. If you have to wait for a table there's a pawn shop next door where you can pick out your next guitar, gun, or power tool.

Great place for a great burger , my boss tried to talk me into the PB and J burger swearing how good it is , I stuck to a trusted favorite " mushroom Swiss . Popular place , so get there early for good seating . Good burgers !!

KICK BACK and enjoy a burger.  One of best places to come in, sit back and chill out.
The staff is really friendly.  The food is great.  You have a huge selection of burgers.  While, I'm still loyal to the Chili burger, they have been trying to get me to eat the PB and J burger.  95/5 quality meat.  Order with pretzel bun.  I recommend this place to everyone...even vegetarians.  Keep up the good work....

I went again yesterday, and had a totally different expierence. Everyone was awesome, instead of making my one I just ordered the huge rehab sized Mac Gnarly Burger with fries and had an infinitely better time/meal.

Absolutely love rehab burger! My family and I go every Sunday so we have gotten to know the staff and they always take great care of us. 
Amazing food and the best burger in town. Love the McNarghly burger! We are so excited to see them growing to more locations.

Came here in hopes of finding a gluten-free burger I could actually eat after being diagnosed with Celiac disease...and was pleasantly surprised! Not only was there a GF burger on their menu, but it was delicious! We had awesome service, and left completely content (and FULL)! Will definitely be visiting again soon.

Very friendly and informative staff here, got right in and seated... Prompt service and drinks always full!! Good job guys I enjoyed the food, burgers cooked great!! Great selection of buns and they have gluten free buns, which my wife really loved with the turkey burger cooked to perfection!! I cant wait for the Mill ave location to open COMING SOON!! I actually bike with the partial owner Wiley who let us know about their new burger concoction also COMING SOON!! See ya soon!!!

This is the best burger I've EVER had!!!    Fair prices, fun atmosphere and a very polite staff.  Never had a burger here that I haven't liked, but the PB & J bacon burger is on another level!  ONE OF the best if not the best burger you will eve have.  This is my favorite spot in Scottsdale and they just opened another location in Tempe.  I've MADE at least 10 people try the PB & J bacon burger (a few of them against their will and everyone agreed that it is one of the best burgers they've ever had.  I know it sounds like it wouldn't work, but try it.  I can't stay away!!!!

Just visited today for lunch. I can't remember the last time I saw a place with every single table full. Food was really good. My pretzel bun was my only complaint. The bottom half was a bit soggy. I highly recommend the sweet potato tots. Service was great even so far the whole place works off of team service. My husband thought that something was missing on his burger. The manager immediately noticed and came over to see if everything was okay. We were in and out within a reasonable amount of time. We went here based off of the thousand plus Yelp reviews. Glad we went :)

We got seated, near the front door, the other side of which had people smoking, and each time the door opened, we were hit by smoke.  Waiter seats us, gets our drink order, we receive it, and he vanishes, never to be seen again.  Waitress walks by, spills a plate of food, I get hit with some sauce all over my pants, and waitress vows to come back with something to clean my clothing with.  Evidently she vanished with our waiter because she never returns.  So..after all that smoke, wet clothes, no service, we walk to the cashier, explain what happens, pay our bill, and get nothing even resembling an apology.  So, we vanished too, not coming back, if we see the waiter and waitress out in the other dimension, we will tell them to go back to work.

We don't usually frequent the area, especially at night, but a meeting brought us in the area...  We searched Yelp for quite sometime trying to figure out what we wanted for dinner.... We landed here...

It was a great find.  While I don't usually find myself comfortable mingling with the Scottsdale crowd... makes me feel old... the crowd here wasn't too "typical".  The staff here was uber friendly and fun.  The decor was eclectic and amusing. They pour a mean drink and the Four Peaks Peach was the coldest I've ever had it poured. The menu was quirky and there were quite a few great choices on it.  The burger was delicious, the brownie was awesome.... definitely blow on it first... that peanut butter cup was a scorcher on my tongue. 

Definitely a fun place to be and plenty of free covered parking next door is a plus!
We loved it. A lot of food.  The pb & j burger was delicious   I would stick to sweet potato tots. Onion rings nothing to speak about
Turkey burger was excellent but didn't really care for the sweet tots. Other than that we loved everything!

This place rocked my palate. This I had the Philly burger. It was one of the best burgers I've tasted in my entire life. I don't like sweet potatoes but I saw every table in the entire restaurant had them so I went for the sweet potato tots. Epic. Highly recommended.  Eat here at least once.  I will definitely be back for more!

Looks like we had the same experience as a few otherS. Seriously fun food choices! Everyone liked their food, some of the flavor combos were a bit too weird for me- but I appreciated the creativity! Our only negative was the service, she seemed overwhelmed or under-trained??? Long wait for drinks, the check and especially returning the redit cards aftr we paid.

Great service,  The waitstaff is always checking on how your food is and are you having a good time.The burger was great the french fries were great and the sweet potato tater tots or unique and really good.

I love this place....  I can never decide what burger I want any time I go here because they are all so good.   Also the sweet potato tots!  Seriously awesome go try it.  One of the best burgers in Scottsdale
Today I'm having the pbj burger with sweet potato fries and like always great service and great atmosphere
Besides the burgers I really like the wings in rehab burger. They also have a good customer service, and the restaurant's atmosphere is very warm and friendly.

By far, favorite burger place in the valley. Burgers are always nice and juicy, and good size. Lots of great toppings, and their sweet potato tots are insanely good! (Don't forget to try one of they're many sauces, the pineapple BBQ is my favorite)

Friendly staff, nice decor. Always busy on weekends. I'd give it 4 1/2 stars, service is sometimes a little slow. Otherwise very solid burger place, worth the the money!

Tried the Hangover Burger on a pretzel bun. It held up to the hype. Excellent burger. My wife had their Hatch Burger? I didn't pay attention to what it was called.  Anyway, she loved it so much that she  considered  ordering another one to go. Lol. Great atmosphere, great service and excellent Burgers.

Small place with a relaxed beach feel to it.  

Not the best burger I have had, but it is definitely up there towards the top.  They have a lot of different burgers on their menu.  I have only tried two of them, but they were both great.

Not a good place to watch sports though, I think I counted 2 TVs in the whole place (including the bar)

Food is pretty good, but you made a poor choice with one of your servers. There's a guy who works there, best way to describe him is by what I believe is a half-sleeve tattoo.  He wasn't friendly, or at all accommodating.  It's frustrating to go out for dinner and have a server ruin your meal, when you're just trying to have a good time. Rarely do I ever comment on a server, as it takes a lot to really irritate me, but this guy needs some training and how to provide a basic good customer service experience.   

Our group could not figure out why he would act like that, when clearly servers should know that friendliness pays, and the tip could be affected if they treat our group like crap.

Please see that he undersrands how to better treat your paying guests. Thanks
The pbj burger with the pretzel bun it is to die for and great atmosphere and owners are awesome as well stop in for great drinks great friends and good times
Peanuts and jelly were amazing combinations. It was very tasty. I want to eat this again. I will definitely come again.

We waited 2 hours for burgers that we ordered. We finally asked how long it would be and were told we were still the third order in line. The rush for lunch was long over when we ordered. Maybe they were just too exhausted from the earlier rush. The bartender was very friendly! We ended up canceling our food order so we can't rate on it.

I love this burger place. When I tell people about the menu they give me a look like I'm somewhat crazy but I have tried at least 6 of the specialty burgers on the menu and they have not failed me at all. Especially the PB&J burger. From the peanut butter n jelly to the Sriracha sauce. It just works. The service is always good, beer n alcohol choices are good and the bucket of jawbreakers on the way out is just an added plus. Definitely a good spot to grab a burger n a beer

Had lunch here and the food was great!  The only reason for the four stars was the location and parking.  We had a heck of a time finding it and God was no help.  We persevered and it was worth it.  Even the $5 to park in the garage.  Burger was deliciously messy and the fries were scrummy!
This was a great, fun little place.  The whole family had great meals.  I had the Bacon & Blue.  I would highly recommend.

You probably have to be a lover of red meat to fully appreciate all that Rehab Burger Therapy offers.  I do not fit into that category but I'm a fan, nonetheless.  They have a pretty tasty turkey burger.  When you add all the 'fixin's', some fries and an ice cold beer; it makes for a darn good meal!

What stands out even more than the food, in my opinion, is the service.  I can't recall having more genuinely friendly service.  John is awesome and made sure I was well taken care of during my visit; however, everyone in the vicinity greeted me warmly and chatted me up as I ate.  I appreciated that, as I dined alone at the bar.  

The menu has a variety of items that sound tempting.  It is definitely worth a return visit.
Amazing food, service, atmosphere!!! Sit at the bar!!!! Reno will take good care of you! Ask him to do toothpick trick!
great place, love the atmosphere. Great food, only bad thing was they forgot the cheese on our Bacon Cheeseburgers. The waitress needs to relax a little and have fun. Would definately go back.
The burger here is one of best I ever had, my wife and son both had a salad which they raved about, service was excellent. Bottom line this is a true five star.

tried this new joint craving a good burger and it delivered! I had the turkey island burger and my girlfriend had the mushroom swiss burger. Both were juicy and cooked perfectly. It offers two sizes and the even the smaller portion is enough. The service was great and friendly and the decor had an "island feel". The bar had any and every spirit possible. Try the spicy ketchup with your amazing sweet potato tots. We are definitely going back to try something new!

Excellent.  Food is outstanding, fresh and oh so tasty.
New waitstaff, just as excellent as my last visit.

Great food, but the beer menu greatly lacks. No true craft beer - Four Peaks is owned by the massive giant that makes Budweiser. And what goes better with a handcrafted burger than a handcrafted  beer?

Hopefully the next time I'm in town, they'll at least have 1-2 options from their independent local breweries.
First time there and it was amazing. Our waiter David made sure we were 100% satisfied! That place is how customer service should be given. Love, love, love. We will def be going back.
Very creative burgers type, good service great food. The 5 oz was big enough can't imagine the 10 oz.
Needed a burger found a burger. Awesome burger and fries cooked perfectly. Full bar, TV for sports and relaxed atmosphere. Our waiter was awesome and food came quick and hot. Go for the pretzel bun!!

I love looking for the best burger in whatever city I find myself in. 'Rehab' fulfilled my wildest dreams. 

Think about the PBJ burger. I know I know, it sounds like a reach, but the flavors work very well. The sweet potato fries and the cold slaw (with a sweet base- as opposed to vinegar) round out the meal. 

The wait staff are awesome and friendly. 

Two thumbs way up.

I have been going to rehab burger for years! Funny thing tho, I don't eat red meat, but I get their Da Vinci salad every time! It's my favorite chicken salad and the portion is shareable! I have to take half home every time! Today a couple of my friends and I came in to grab a quick bite for lunch and ended up staying unusually long and ordering more food because we were enjoying ourselves so much. Kay was waiting on us and was exceptionally helpful, knowledgable of the menu and specials, friendly, and with a fun personality to boot! Always a good meal, great staff, and I love the beachy decor!

AMAZING FOOD!!!  

I got the PB&J Bacon burger...heavenly!!  My husband had the Porkster Burger...also great!!!  The Sweet PoTOToes were amazing as well.  The dessert just topped everything off!!

The servers were busy, but very attentive and friendly!! 

We will be coming back here again for sure!!

This place is great! It is by far my husband's favorite restaurant and we are here weekly. Serving sizes are huge! Even the relapse burger (the "small" one) leaves me with leftovers. Drinks are great and my favorites are the Margatini and the medium Bloody. For burgers I always go with the Spicy Mac and it never disappoints. 

I'm not always in the mood for a burger so sometimes I just eat my husbands tots and get extra veggies to throw in my Bloody. The weird part is they also charge me a couple bucks for the veggies, but $2 isn't bad so it doesn't bug me, it's just weird to me. Other times I get their pastas which are great or an appetizer. My favorites are the queso dip and the calamari. I'm from CA right on the beach so I'm used to picking out your seafood from the traps on the patio and I can tell the calamari has been on ice, but I still order it so it isn't bad enough to not go back for more.

It is deceptively inexpensive too. We brought my parents and a family friend here last weekend (5 hungry adults total) and ordered a burger each, the pork wings, and a cocktail each and it only came to about $100. I expected it to be more than that so when I sprung to pick up the tab I was pleasantly surprised. They also have cash back through Yelp which is awesome because I get paid to eat somewhere I'm already going to be.

We all were pretty let down when we went on a Sunday at 5pm and they were out of pretzel buns and onion rings. They blamed it on being busy and us coming on a Sunday saying that's the norm, but why not order enough materials to accommodate the weekly needs of your guests if that is the case? One complaint my dad had was that the burgers can be a bit overloaded and busy. I think it's just a millennial thing that we do to food and I agree, but as I watch my husband devour a maple bacon donut burger dripping with Swiss cheese and all kinds of sauces, I can't fault them for it. I swear he'd leave me for that burger if you made it a normal item on the menu, lol.

Come with an appetite and be ready to walk out with leftovers.

I went there for dinner with a coworker.  The waitress was very friendly and got use hooked up with her favorite items on menu.  

I highly recommed the burger with pineapple abd my coworker recommends the pablano pepper burger.  Fries and tots were really good.  

They even disclaimer that their portions are large.  They were right.

Highly recommend this place to anyone.  Save room for dessert.

Excellent food, the burgers were huge, the small pasta was a very full plate. Great atmosphere, a great beachy feel right here in Scottsdale. The prices seem a bit high but for the amount of food you get it's not bad. The pot browny was huge. Really a great meal, so large we ate half and are saving the other half for later. Definitely a good value and great tastes.
Delicious burgers and dogs! Atmosphere is cool! Been there several times. The mac & cheese burger is amazing!!!

This place is all hype!  I waited over hour for the driest burger I've ever had.  Service was marginal, they had nba on tv during March madness just shows how out of touch they are.
I don't get it???? Why such a high rating when this place blows!
Don't waste your time!  It's just hype.
Say it with me...I ain't going to rehab, l say no no no....

I went here for the first time yesterday, and it was the best experience I've ever had in Scottsdale.  The bartender was very friendly, energetic and passionate, the food was out of this world, I had the BBQ burger on a pretzel roll with fries.  The BBQ sauce was spicier than I expected for a "house bbq sauce", they really went on a limb for that, I enjoy spicy foods so this was a welcomed surprise for me.  

I had the smaller of the two burgers, which was huge!  I will be back anytime I'm in Scottsdale, I will send anyone who asks "where should I go in Scottsdale?" there.  Needless to say, I was impressed.

The food was quite good. I loved the burgers and the sweet taters, and the dishes were well crafted. The Spicy Mac-N-Cheese was not all that spicy by my standards. The service was the biggest issue-it was a busy night, but it took an hour to get our entrees and a good 15 minutes to get the condiments and 15 for the check. I wish they would hire more staff.

Go here, you won't regret it. The burgers were SO creative and delicious on top of it all. I got the Mac and cheese burger and my boyfriend got the jalapeño popper burger, both were to die for. The sweet potato tots are fantastic too. Don't have anything bad to say, great atmosphere too!

Greasy. 

Really enjoyed the patio. Would have preferred salad or coleslaw as tater tots were hard. Cool pawnshop next door.

I absolutely love this place, the food, the service.  Everyone is friendly.  Bartender remembered my drink upon my second visit without me asking.  I always meet friendly visitors and locals there and everyone is welcome.   Try the sweet potato tater tots and ask for all of the dipping sauces.  They also cook their burgers to order - not over like a lot of places here and the quality of the meat is very good.  It's my Sunday funday place.

In town from the East Coast - trying to find the best eats in the area. Decided to try this place out after seeing the reviews and who doesn't love a good burger.? This place really fell short for me - ordered the bacon cheeseburger - burger was just dry and had no real flavor. Def disappointed.

WATCH YOUR CREDIT CARD. After lunch, the server came by to collect my credit card. She had one other wallet folder (bill) in her hand and walks out of the gate of the business (seated outside) and around the corner of the building an meets a waiting blue van. She has both bills (my card), up in the window of the van with a female driver. Went back in and asked for a manager and a lady came up and said she could help. I said are you the manager, she said no but she has worked here a while and could help. I said I wanted a manager and she said it would be 20 minutes. Then a guy appeared who said he owned the place (Wiley), and said he could take care of the issue, but didn't have a card. I told him the story and he would speak with her. Then he told me that someone maybe forgot their credit card and she was running it out (NO WAY).  No by the owner to take my phone number or for me to get his. Thought it was a poor response from the restaurant owner.

A great true yelp find. I'm from out of state and tried this on a whim, worth every penny. Very good food - enough on the menu if you don't feel like the burger. I had the pulled pork sandwich - amazing! Fast & friendly service as well. Highly recommend.

The food is very fun and creative. 
Portions are large but perfect for when you have that hankering for a nice hardy American meal.

3 stars aka A-OK.

A-OK is exactly how I feel about this place. 

Happy hour ends early at 6:30- (Ra goes 'til 7 and they are practically next door).  Happy hour savings aren't exactly great.  $1 off an appetizer?  Thanks for covering the tax, I guess?

Decor is sort of a beachy stoner motif?  Um...cool?  There's a magazine rack between the stalls in the ladies room?  Um...awesome? 

Food was good, though I only shared some appetizers (fries, tots).  These came with an amusing (and awesome) amount of interesting condiments, which I enjoyed, considering my fridge is 2/3 full of dressings and sauces instead of actual foods. The "small" burgers are ginourmous, so that's probably why they don't have such good happy hour food discounts (they can't be making a ton of money on these).

Where this place shines is the service (surprisingly good), beer selection and the music.  Could've sworn they tapped into my iTunes...

I'll probably be back sometime, if friends want to go here.

Sweet poTOToes were amazing, piineapple dipping sauce...oh so good
Philly cheesesteak fries...yummy

I choose this place because I wanted sweet potato fries. Hubby ordered a chili burger on a gluten free bun with a side of corn, my daughter ordered a Jalapeño popper burger on brioche bun and I ordered a basket of sweet pototoes .  And all of this was to be delivered buy Door Dash.  Door Dash sends a text to say they are out of gluten free buns and brioche buns. So we changed to wheat and pretzel.  The buns came wrapped in the side, burgers and corn was tough and I ended up with chili Fritos instead of sweet potatoes fries. Disappointed!
Can't miss the sweet potato tots, onion rings, Mac 'n cheese & the Hawaiian burger. Definitely the best place for burgers and all the fixings
My hamburger was excellent cook just right. The burger was full of favor and the prices are not bad at all.

A nice large list of burgers to pick from although all us of thought they were just OK. Nothing was amazing and nothing was bad. The atmosphere was just like the food, sort of middle of the road. I am not sure we would be back.

I wish we had one of these in the SF area! The burgers are amazing!!!! I have a hard time paying over $10-12 for a burger but these burgers are so so good! Worth it, and the staff and manager are great with attention and hospitality!

When we got there the line wasn't too bad and we only had to wait about 20min. Ambiance is really chill and fun, good bar selection with decent service.  I got the jalapeño popper burger it was ok, too much cream cheese to burger ratio but the fried jalapeño were amazing.

I ordered a bacon burger in a lettuce wrap. The meat was seasoned perfectly with a great hickory bacon flavor. I do have a gluten sensitivity, and they were very accommodating. Most of their sauces were gluten free except the aioli. Their sweet potato tater tots were delicious!! Definitely recommend this place. Despite the fact that I got a lettuce wrapped burger, they do offer a gluten free bun. If you're looking for a great burger joint this is the place to go!

Oh burger heaven, how can I ever repay you?

I love my burgers.... and what can I say?? I am impressed... 

The Burger... the POBLANO buger.... man oh man, that burger has the right amount of kick, and the burger itself melts in your mouth... just typing this review makes me want to drive over there and get one. But they have a HUGE selection of burgers you can try, and the option to make your own burger. Get the pretzel bun, you won't be disappointed. 

The Fries... I believe they're called "Skin-On fries," well let me tell you about these fries... They're the perfect balance of soft and crispy, and that mermaid dust... I only dream about it. You're probably asking yourself, "What's mermaid dust?" Well my friends let me tell you, its this magical dust that they put on their fries... and it's best flavor you'll ever taste... I can't even describe how perfect it is. Not to mention that it goes great with the spicy ketchup. YUM
The Drink- I got a Dos Equis... and that was only because I was craving it. But I do know that they have a decent selection of beers, and other drinks. They have excellent daily drink specials... and that  is number one in my book. 

The Staff... I would have to agree with some of the previous reviewers, they're not in your face... but they're attentive. And they're up for recommending burgers for you. The service overall was impressive, and VERY quick. Super friendly. 

Will I come back? HECK YES. I might actually head over there right now. :)

The burgers are amazing. They can make most of them vegetarian and many vegan. The beer list, while not extensive, offers a number of great deals, especially happy hour. The service is quick and friendly, even though they were very busy when we were there. Most recommended!

The most stars for the Hawaiian vibe; cute fun place.

However,  I don't know what the fuss is about.  Yes there is a pile of Mac and cheese on the burger but that's it?  I personally didn't care for the texture of the hamburger meat.   It was too dense for my taste.   

I'm glad I checked it out but think the ratings are too high given my experience.  

Not to mention they ask you how are things tasting about 10 times while you try to eat.   Tip:  let people enjoy the place don't ask so much!!

Was starving and came in here for lunch. Cute little beach theme beatnik place. Well...Burger and margarita it was...and did NOT disappoint! Also bartender Cortney was friendly and sweet. I am allergic to high fructose corn syrup. I asked her if she knew what was in the mix. She right away pulled the mix and showed me the label. Quality ingredients and Patron was on special. Oh hell yes! Burger was cooked perfectly and fries were yummy not greasy. It is SO NICE to see a kick back place use QUALITY ingredients. The burger meat is a mix of balanced flavors.  Coming back for sure. Keep it up guys! P.S. the music is perfect mix of beach and mello reggae. Fab. The owner of this business is a genius.

Perfect spot before or after a spring training game seeing the Giants. The sweet potato fries are a perfect compliment to the pulled pork burger. Plus, the vibe is super laid back and is the perfect match for a toasty day in Scottsdale.

Holy smokes where do I begin? We were lucky enough to bypass the line and sit at the bar. 
The two bartenders that waited on us were super awesome sweet and chipper. Happy hour is very reasonable with pretty great options. The corn on the cob may as well be called crack on the cob I could have done a dozen.  This mermaid dust they put on everything is bananas good. The pb&j burger on a pretzel roll was indescribably good. Sweet potato tater tots yum!!!!
O  o  thenk 6nnn  .b  cgv  xx TV cvg  9 nvehxcfvvv3c nb b  c  y4  nb and the vghvhridd h 0d  c       v   3,  vv  4  ruddy
The Mac and cheese burger was amazing. Next time I will try the peanut butter and jelly burger, only heard good things about it! Sweet potato tots were an unbelievable side!
Chili cheeseburger was great and prepared just the way I like it.  Good portion size, friendly service and a relaxed atmosphere.  I will go back next time I am in Scottsdale.

My co-worker and I came here during our lunch break. We decided to check it out since it just opened. Their burgers were amazing and their fries have this mermaid dust (which tasted exactly like Lucas). I got the burger with the onion rings and BBQ sauce! I had their smaller burger and it was more than enough! The service was good and atmosphere felt like we were at the beach. There was a TV monitor that looked like they had an aquarium! It was so cute and probably low maintenance. Just remember they are closed on Monday!

First let me say that I don't think this place is worth the hype.  I had a BYOB today with bacon, hatch chilies, cheese on a pretzel bun with fries.  The meat lacked seasoning, bacon was a little under cooked and I thought that the chilies should have been diced.  The fries were cooked and seasoned well but the two dipping sauces where store bought, kinda lame in my opinion.  I will not be going back to Rehab! 

Food Guy Out!

A+ service. A+ food. Excellent way to start off out Scottsdale vacation! 

We came at a busy time with a 20 month old who was hungry,  tired,  and cranky from sitting in an airplane and then a car seat for hours. 

Even know there was a wait, they seated as quickly and one of the ladies, who later I found out was Denise, one of the owners, brought out a plate with chopped turkey, ham, cheese, and strawberries for our little one to start munching while we decided what to order.  So kind! 

I had the poblano burger on a pretzel bun with a side of Jamaican corn and my husband had p_b and see a burger on a brioche bun. He opted for sweet potato tots his side. 

The place had several children, but no children's menu. They were so nice to tell us that they could do a variety of different things for the kids and we ended up getting a taco with chicken and cheese for our son. We asked him to please bring it out as soon as possible even if our food wasn't ready yet. They brought it out very quickly and when the bill came, the even said the taco was on the house because they knew how hungry he was and they didn't bring it out fast enough for their liking. 

Such a wonderful place, a wonderful atmosphere, kind people, an excellent food! If this place was in my hometown, I would be there every week.

Not impressed with service at all. While they were very busy and have many good reviews, the place seemed severely understaffed.  We called ahead for reservations - and were told no wait and just to come down. Well, long story short, we got there and ended up waiting another 40 minutes until we decided just to leave.  If you have three hours to kill on a Friday night, then I guess this is the place for you.
Ordered Rehab Burger through GrubHub and was delivered fresh! Everything was fantastic! Highly recommend!
Really delicious burgers and sweet potato fries! Kudos for having gluten free buns as well :)

This place was pretty good, kind of strange servers and my tots were burned, so it doesn't quite make the five star cut.

I had the bacon cheeseburger, with the pretzel bun and cheddar cheese-- it was super delicious and really a big burger so I saved half for an after-drinking snack.

My boyfriend had the MacGnarly burger or whatever it is called, which is a double decker burger smothered in thousand island dressing, and he had it on a brioche bun, which was really good.

The fries were good.

The sweet potato tots would have been better if they weren't burned, and if they gave me some garlic aioli on the side instead of ketchup (sweet potatoes and ketchup? Ummmm no)

I also had a spicy bloody mary and that thing was DELICIOUS!

Parking can be gnarly around there, but if you park in the structure and take the super short hike to Rehab Burger, then you'll be fine.

Enjoy!

Absolutely the BEST burgers in phoenix! The mac n cheese burger is out of this world! The ghost burger will have your taste buds jumping! The decor will definitely keep your eyes busy and the burgers will fill you up! Sweet Potato tots are incredible!

Went on a Thursday at lunch. Place was busy and it's not that big. Service started out a little slow, but our waiter fixed that by the end of the meal. The Chili con Fritos was a good start. All the burgers were good and the hot dog my daughter got was the best hot dog my wife had ever tasted. Overall a good place to go and get adventurous with your burger.

We brought the Boys' Burger Club here today. I ordered the Ghost Burger with bacon and a side of onion rings. We've been doing the BBC for a while and I can tell you this is the best burger yet. Maybe one of the best I've ever had. Also, the service was magnificent. Looking forward to coming back.
Some of the best burgers around! Not a thing to complain about. Good service, great food. Little spendy but what do you expect in old town Scottsdale.

The food was great, however, when deciding what size burger to get, our watress (knowing I really wanted to try the dessert) suggested the bigger burger. Unfortunately after sharing an appetizer and burger, we were too full for dessert. I also feel like since we didn't want the extra food to go to waste that we over stuffed ourselves and couldn't really enjoy the meal as a result. Some day soon I would like to go back there and get a smaller meal so I can fully enjoy it. Over all the quality of food was great and I LOVED the "dive bar" atmosphere!!

Pretty darn good burgers with the not to be missed sweet potato tots! Happy hour will get you some nice cheap beer too :-)
Friendly service, great ambiance, stop in and you won't be disappointed!

This place is great!!! Food is awesome and the service is super good everyone was happy.  I had the "No Poblano" burger on a pretzel bun.  It rocked.. great paddy, manchego cheese, spicy grilled onions and a Poblano pepper.  If you check in you get a "Pot Brownie" sundae for $3.99.  Chocolate brownie stuffed with marshmallow cooked in a pan and topped with ice-cream!!!  Very friendly and helpful staff.

P.S.  Gotta try the sweet potato tots with the Pineapple aioli!

This is a fun burger restaurant with a beach you atmosphere. Very casual. We sat outside in February. There is an extensive choice of creative burgers. The fries and onion rings were delicious. The service was excellent.

I came here on Saturday 10/14/17. When Asu played Washington. The place was well packed and the atmosphere was upbeat and alive. I ordered some wings which were cooked amazingly and well seasoned. I was a little disappointed about the margaritas and how it did not come blended. My boy friend ordered a burger and did not even eat all of it because it came to us this raw. The only reason I would be back is for the wings and fries.

This has got to be the BEST dang burger I have ever had. You have to be open to trying a new/different type of your regular lettuce/onion/tomato burger. We tried the PB&J and bacon burger and also the spicy mac-n-cheese burger! A MUST TRY!!  The staff was friendly & quick at getting your food out as well. I highly recommend this place. The only thing the could do different, is open one in Tucson, AZ next. haha

Excellent service and food! It took a bit to seat us as a bunch of friends went together but they were very friendly and accommodating. Our server was very knowledgeable about the menu and did not make 1 mistake. His suggestions were simple - get the pretzel bun and add a fried egg on top of whatever you get. Needless to say, his suggestions were on point and we all had a wonderful experience! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!
Accommodated our large party of 13 on Thanksgiving weekend...great service and amazing burgers!
Probably some of the best burgers in Scottsdale. I always build my own. Great place to go watch a game, get a beer, and have a burger or just bring your family to dine in.

I came thinking I would get one of the unique burgers offered on the menu. Well I decided to have a "relapse" portion of the Mac & cheese and slowly decided to try the Cantina TaCODos (fish tacos). Everything was delicious. I even got a to go order of the fish tacos as well as the chicken wings with spicy pineapple BBQ sauce. I would definitely go if in town again.

I must've come during a group happy hour, at 7pm on a Friday, the crowd was LOUD but quieted down as the group dissipated. I had the Coco Nutty to drink (it's amazing btw, makes you feel like your on a beach) and felt compelled to get the Hawaiian Burger. Burger was great, but the fries were FANTASTIC. They have this chili-lime seasoning that makes the fries so addicting. Needless to say, my plate and glass were completely empty when I left feeling very full and satisfied. Definitely coming here when I need a burger fix.
Another gem in old town I have had all but 4 of the burgers on the menu, and have had nothing but great meals and excellent service!
The jalapeno popper burger is off the hook. Also, try the Jamaican corn.....so delish!!!!!!!

Absolutely horrible. From start to finish, virtually everything was a disaster. 

When we first arrived, we we're promptly seated and given our menus. Our waiter came over a few minutes later to take our drink orders.
