Upon receiving my drink, I noticed that the glass I was given was dirty. I informed the waiter took it back to get me another one. At this time my wife had ordered a beer as well. I received my beer fairly quickly, but she did not receive hers. We had then reminded him of this, he said he would get on this. 

We then went to ordering. We ordered a quesadilla for an appetizer, two hamburgers with veggie Patty's, and an order of their spicy Mac & Cheese without the bacon. After putting in our order, we reminded the waiter AGAIN that my wife hadn't received her beer. 

The quesadilla had came, and my wife still hadn't received her beer. We did not have an silverware or napkins, so we also asked for these. Finally, my wife's beer had arrived. She ordered a pint of Blue Moon, which usually comes garnished with an orange slices, but there was not one on it. This isn't the most important thing, but was disappointing. 

Our burgers and side of Mac and Cheese came maybe 5 minutes after getting the appetizer. This sounds like fast service, but we were expecting to have more time to enjoy the rest of the appetizer before our burgers came. So now our burgers had to get cold while we finished our quesadilla. I instantly noticed the Mac and Cheese had bacon in it, so we had to send it back. We also noticed that the buns we order on our burgers we're on the wrong burger. At this time we still hadn't received napkins or silverware. 

The waiter finally came back with the Mac and Cheese, and silverware! 

After taking one bite of the Mac and Cheese, we had realized that it was unedible. We had asked the waiter if they microwave their Mac and Cheese, he informed us that they don't, but it really tasted like they did. As far as the burgers go, they did not taste at all what we we're hoping for. For $15 a burger, these we're a HUGE disappointment. 

Overall, I do not think we will ever be back. We would try another location, since they have multiple in the valley, but at this point I would just have to say to AVOID.

The burgers are awesome and the sweet potato tots are even better! They do not have a very good beer selection and my burger always seems to come out overcooked (I request medium rare, always). But I will continue to visit, nonetheless.

OH MY GOD!!!! This place is amazing!!!
I will admit I was skeptical at first. I went on the recommendation of a few friends and when we got there the feel of the place was very laid back and more like a beach atmosphere than I would have expected from a place with part of the name being "Rehab".
The menu is very large and the options are plentiful for any palette. Secret... they have an amazing soup that is not on the menu. It is a bit spicy and the ingredients are very non-traditional but it is something you will crave after you have tried it once. I won't tell you the ingredients here... you will have to discover it for yourself!
Oh yeah... did I mention they have awesome sweet potato tots? Those are great with the soup and pair well with any of their burgers too!
Swing on by and try it sometime.. I have been known to show up after a good swim on a Thursday night... maybe I will see you in there! 
Cheers
Loved this place and the atmosphere!! The Mac and cheese burger really hit the spot! I also suggest getting some nacho cheese on the French fries that come with the burgers! Would definitely go back!

Great food, killer music, good indoor or outdoor seating.  Service was friendly!  Try the chicken and cheese appetizer dip with the fresh chips!  Its amazing!  I will be back next time I visit Scottsdale!
Lots of great burger options! I had the BBQ Burger and Fries. Great lunch spot for a tasty burger!

This may be the only restaurant where you can order and receive a RARE hamburger with no argument over company policy! That goes a long way with me. The taste of the meat itself is good but not quite as tasty as Red Robin's Angus beef. Two negatives: (1) The wait staff is so crazed serving drinks that they have no time to check on you once your food has been served. And (2) Like What-a-Burger, Rehab also has a strange and annoying FETISH about condiments. Like What-a-Burger, there are no ketchup bottles. Rehab gives you a little cup of ketchup which is not enough. At least What-a-Burger let's you take as many of their silly  ketchup packets as you want. At rehab, the waiters are too busy and the place is too loud to get their attention for more ketchup. Any restaurant manager who refuses to serve ketchup in bottles has a screw loose and should stop the childish nonsense. Do you hear me, Rehab??

Went with a group of friends from lunch.  Nobody tried the PBJ burger but we all left happy and would definitely go back.  Meat was very flavorful, rehab was a pretty big 10oz portion but cooked perfectly to order, and service and atmosphere were great.

Their burgers are messy and delicious! The PBJ and Bacon burger is unique, but the flavors really compliment each other. Be prepared for that burger to get all over the place. Same with the Mac and cheese burger, delicious and messy. The hatch chile burger was just the right level of spicy! Sweet potato tots are delicious as well. Large portions, delicious burgers!
Note that burgers ordered medium were still pretty pink inside.

We came here on the recommendation of one of the store owners and we enjoyed ourselves. I had the Mac and Cheese Burger and my husband had the Prime Rib burger. The waiter asked me if I wanted the regular size, which I thought meant the smaller size, but it was the bigger one. It was HUGE! The meat was really good and cooked well. The bread was good and didn't fall apart as I ate it. The mac and cheese on it was ok, but was a little bland. It had bacon and green chiles in it, but could have used some salt or hot sauce to flavor it. I got sweet potato tots with mine and really enjoyed them. My husbands burger was also huge, but due to all the toppings, he felt that the meat to bun ratio was not right and his sandwich was left falling apart from not enough bun to hold it all together. Both of us had enough burger left over to take home for dinner. Next time I would order a smaller burger. 

The service was friendly and our waiter chatted with us and provided us with suggestions. The environment was fun. Overall it was a good experience and I would go back again, but I might try something different next time, maybe a spicier burger.

Great bar & fun atmosphere! We shared the porkster burger which was awesome. Good thing we shared it. I couldn't have eaten it by myself. So many more things we want to try. Can't wait to have friends come to town and take them here.

I really liked the burger! The Backyard BBQ burger only whole wheat with onion rings! The meat was high quality and juicy the bun was as good as it gets... onion rings get 5 stars. Service was fantastic

Burger was good, nice big 10 ouncer with fries. Very pricey, but kinda worth it. Was a bit busy for the lunch rush so the food wasn't gonna come out sizzling. Service was good, bar tender was very kind and polite. It was a good fix. Gives off a Hawaiian/Californian vibe with the reggae music and interior decor. Appealing to the board enthusiast. Gives off the indication that the owner like skateboarding, snowboarding and surfing. Carry a few $20s in yer' pocket because a Heiniken in a bottle will cost you almost $6. Them Cali/Hawaii prices. Maybe when I come back on my next visit my review will be a bit more enthusiastic.

This is a great burger spot, I had trouble deciding between the Hawaiian and the Mac and cheese one, I was very happy with the Hawaiian.. Service was a bit slow at the outside bar top, compared to what people were getting around us, so I'd recommend getting a table if outside or sitting inside.. But everyone was friendly and the burgers delish.

so full it hurts I come not stop eating the burgers are so good I got the ghost pepper it 10oz meat perfectly cook medium super juicy   two slices of ghost pepper cheese and so much guacamole the onion rings are some of the best crunchy and think now the milk shakes are just OK had the orange sickle to sour and and crystals of sugar or something tried the strawberry one the the wife had just OK too tasted like nest quick the server was grate but she had to be super blazed because every thing was super good to her will definitely go back

I'd heard a lot of people recommend Rehab Burger over the last year and finally got to try it yesterday. It exceeded my lofty expectations. The burgers were huge, delicious, and a great price (especially considering the price of ground beef). Sweet Potato Tots are an amazing thing and I don't know why this is the first time I have heard of them or had them. Beer selection is standard, nothing too exciting, but our wonderful waitress Megan added some shots (with our permission) to our orders that made each drink order unique. Speaking of Megan, she is the most fun and outgoing waitress I have had in a long time.

If you haven't already, go try Rehab.

Stopped in here after reading a few reviews.  When out of town I always want to pick a place for a good damn  burger.   This place did not disappoint.   I had the pulled pork over a burger on a bagel bun.   The thing was off the hook.   I enjoyed  every bit of it.   Sweet potato  tots were lightly fried and very tasty.   Bartender was a cool dood and his recommendations were right on point.

This is my second day here in a row. All I have to say is WOW. First time here I had the Beefstro burger. Absolutely outrageous with Pineapples aioli on the side. The sweet potatoes tots maaaad good. Came the second day and had the Jalenpeno popper burger with the corn. Awesome as well. It's small so you may have to wait but it is so worth it. I'm sure they are going to expand even further. Stop reading my review and place your order.

Fantastic! We ate on a weekday evening. Staff was phenomenal and explained everything to us (gave us free samples). Pretzel buns are amazing. Sweet potato tots with the pineapple-based sauce were very good. Lots to choose from!
This place is the BEST burger is Scottsdale... I'm also obsessed with the sweet potato tots!
Ghost burger all the way. Hit the spot. Onion rings are deceivingly filling. This place belongs in Tempe, but I'm not complaining. Good food, friendly staff and chill atmosphere.
This used to a good place but wow the cook doesn't know how to make a burger that isn't rare lol. I had to send my order back twice because both times my burger was bleeding.

Yum I love visiting Rehab burger! These burgers are massive and SO good. I normally do the ghost burger with fresh avocado- it's quite spicy but the taste is awesome. Sub the fries for sweet potato tots & chipotle mayo, you won't be disappointed! The staff is always great and very helpful. Will always be back!

Have been seeing posts online for a while, and have wanted to give the place a try.  Disappointed to drive from across town to find out their specialty burger has sold out the day before, sounds like poor planning to me.  Anyway, we had the PB&J, Spicy Mac and Cheese and the Calamari.  Wife really enjoyed the PB&J burger, I wasn't as impressed with the Spicy Mac & Cheese.  The mac had a gritty taste, and was served lukewarm, and not the least bit spicy.  The flavor wasn't bad, but it wasn't a $14 burger either.  The calamari was surprisingly good, which is funny because it would seem the burger should be the star and not the appetizer.   Two burgers and a appetizer for $38, to me seems a little steep, but I'm cheap.  Kicker to the whole visit is when I check my bank statement the next day, the upped the bill by $3.  I guess someone wanted a little larger tip than the 20% we paid.  Not sure it's worth driving across town to not get what you want, but I can now say I have been there.

UPDATE: After calling and speaking to the manager, the entire tip amount is being refunded as this was an error on the part of the server.

Really good spot, the sweet potato tots are next level and I love their assortment of sauces you can order to dip them In. I highly recommend the garlic sriracha aioli sauce! They have a ton of burger options as well and my friend got the PB&J burger which was way better than I expected it to be. I however got the bacon and blue burger which I do not recommend. It has the blue cheese and bacon cooked into the burger and that's all. No toppings or sauces so it was really dry! While I like this place I would advise against this burger! Also get the pretzel bun it was the best part

I'd had Rehab bookmarked on Yelp for awhile and finally got to go check it out this weekend. My friends and I arrived around 1pm on Saturday afternoon and were lucky enough to snag one of the last two open tables. 

We were greeted right away, given waters and informed of their happy hour specials. Yes, you read that right, happy hour on a Saturday! Rehab has HH seven days a week, from 11-6 I believe. I was a little disappointed to see the discounts applied mainly to booze. All appetizers are $1 off, which isn't much, in my opinion. But that didn't deter us from ordering a huge plate of chili cheese fries for the table to share. (And we saved $1, woo!) 

On to the entrees. Us girls ordered burgers, one rare and the other two medium rare. The "rare" burger came out med-rare, not really a big deal, but mine and my friend's "med-rare" were without a doubt overcooked. Mine came out mid-well, and my friend's came out well done. Mine had just enough juice/pink that I ate it anyway, but my friend sent her dish back. For a place called Rehab Burger Therapy, you'd think the cooks would know their way around a grill and proper temps?! Also, on the menu's description of our food it said our burgers were served with condiments; my Poblano burger was supposed to get spicy ketchup and my friend's was supposed to get a chipotle aioli. Both were absent from our plates and we had to ask for them. Weird. Or maybe I'm just a condiment freak. 

Our server, Devon (sp?), was super nice, funny and energetic throughout our experience. He apologized for the kitchen's mistake and fixed the situation for my friend. 

All in all I'd be back. The pretzel bun I chose my burger to be housed in was delish, and Rehab's fries are slightly addictive. Perhaps I'll try again at a less busy time when the cooks can pay more attention to the grill temps.

The Burgers uniqueness I would give a 5 star too. The quality of burger itself, i would give in-between a 3 & 4 star.
 One thing I was not happy about, on two separate occasions, they were out of several beers on draft. I don't think my situations were luck of the draw, it seems like a management/ordering issue.

This place is amazing! Walking by we weren't sure how great it would be but when we came inside at 1:45PM it was packed. We were immediately greeted by a silver fox of a gentleman who cleaned us a spot at the bar. Rian was very friendly and helpful with the menu! He provided great service and could tell he wanted us to have a wonderful experience. 

I ordered the 5oz Mac n cheese burger with a pretzel bun and Mexican corn. OMG....I am so full and it was DELICIOUS! 

We will be back!
Loved the poblano burger fun atmosphere and terrific wait staff. Keri had a yummy messy salad with carnitas. Langton liked the kids macaroni & cheese.

Listen, if you're in a rush.. Maybe order carry out. You are supposed to enjoy the experience here. We came in on Saturday afternoon. We all want to sit outside, but let's get real, we are HUNGRY. We sat at the bar and had some drinks and the chips and salsa. It didn't blow my mind but it is what it is.. What kind of chips and salsa is really to die for? None.

We eventually were both able to sit at the bar so we decided to dine there. The bartender working was a hilarious brunette who kept us laughing and of course happy. 

I got the hangover burger, my fiancé got the PBJ. The siriracha scared me a bit on the PBJ.

Look at me right now.. (virtually)... GET THE PBJ. It was the most amazing thing I've eaten when it comes to burgers. You won't regret it.

Overall good was amazing, service was great, and we left happy. 10/10 would come back.

I have nothing bad to say about this place. We found it because o the yelp deal. We had the calamari and the quesdaillio which were both delicious! For our entrees I had a Caesar salad and my friend had the chicken sandwich. Huge servings perfect for left overs.

I also have to give a shoutout to our waitress Cheryl from jersey. She was hilarious and always kept my diet coke filled.

The atmosphere is great and the place has awesome positive energy. Will be back soon.

Cool place with fun vibe. My friends ordered PBJ burger and the Mac Narly burger...both said they were great. Then it went off the rails....my Backyard Burger was a no show for about 15 min. Waitress apologized and said someone had touched my burger so the kitchen felt it needed to be redone. While I appreciate not eating something a stranger touched, my friends were completely done when mine finally showed and then....it was cold and overdone. The waitress was cool and adjusted the tab.
Damn good burger, especially if you're nursing a hangover! Huge portions, great food!

CAUTION: Only eat here if you want to be throughly happy! 

I'm from out of town and found this burger haven on yelp. We started off with the chips and salsa yelp check in offer. The chips has a really good seasoning with a hint of lime. The salsa was fresh, had a good bit to it, thick so it stays on the chip and satisfied that little spot that needed instant filling before our burger! 

After looking at the pictures I decided that it would be best if the other person I was with and I split a burger because we didn't think we could finish one on our own! My assumption was correct. We got the PORKSTER BURGER and it was delicious!! The perfect amount of meat, you definitely get your money's worth. We got the Sweet Potato tots that are extremely addicting!! And the sauces that accompany it are very complimenting. I enjoyed the Chipotle sauce while the person I was with liked the pineapple Teriyaki best. 

The service was excellent. Everyone there was happy, helpful and attentive, which was refreshing! The vibes are laid back and allow you to "chillax" which is written on the TV screens of floating fish. 

We will definitely be back! :)
Love love love this place! Have to go on a regular basis to get my fix! Staff is friendly and helpful. Food is incredible. Cool little joint! Highly recommend!
Did not disappoint! Delicious burger and unique sweet potato tater tots. Cold can of Modelo for only  $1.75. Cool place, great vibe, great food and cold beer! I'm sold!

A friend of mine told me that Rehab Burger Therapy was better then 5 Guys.

Yeah...right.

But I thought I'd give it a try. So my best friend and I went down on a Tuesday afternoon.

What a cute place! It reminded me of a place I bar-tended at in Florida! Very relaxed, reggae on the speakers...awesome! Our waitress was the best! I didn't get her name (and I meant to!) but she was knowledgeable, entertaining, and patient with us...and super fast, though we were there at around 3:30 PM in order to avoid any rush.

I ordered the Know Poblano Burger (Relapse size) on a pretzel bun with the Sweet PoTOToes...it was out of this world!! Cooked to order, in this case medium, and covered in these spicy, grilled onions and a HUGE poblano pepper!! Our waitress brought us each 2 different dipping sauces as well...Spicy Ketchup and Chipotle Aioli. Both were excellent on my Sweet PoTOToes, which are sweet potato tater tots!!

My bestie ordered the Hatch Chile Cheeseburger (Rehab size) on a pretzel bun with the skin on, homemade/cut fries. He LOVED his burger so much I think he bgan a serious relationship with it!!

For dessert (we really ARE pigs!) we shared a Pot Brownie...O...M...G...!!! Two brownies with marshmallow cream in between, baked, and coated with Hershey's Sauce!! It could not have gotten any better!!

This place is a gem! We adored EVERY minute of our time there and we will most definitely be back...as many times as our waist sizes allow!!

Wundabar!! My friend and I both got the PBJ bacon burger on a pretzel bun and I have been dreaming about it ever since! It was a treat to the tastebuds and so messy it was awesome. I got onion rings and my friend got sweet potato tater tots and both were amazing. Our service was great and our waitress promised is that this burger would change our lives and it did!

Amazing burgers!! Saw this place on yelp and went there for date night and it was awesome! I got the bacon cheeseburger and my boyfriend got the porkster burger and they were both phenomenal! The bacon was so good & the pork on his burger was absolutely delicious and the perfect hint of spicy! Can't wait to go back soon! Definitely recommend this place!!!!

Came here alone for a super late lunch. I waited up front for a few minutes before someone finally recognized that I needed to be seated. The place was not busy as I came during a weird time (3:45pm). My server, Kristin, was really attentive. She was informative about the menu and paid attention to when I wanted her to come by. Loved her.
I ordered the spicy Mac n cheese burger with a pretzel bun and sweet potato tots with the spicy ketchup. The options for burger toppings are pretty superb. 
My biggest disappointment was that the food came out at different temperatures. My burger with the Mac and cheese spirals was warm, but my sweet potato tots were cold. How are deep fried sides cold? I ate the burger as is but told my waitress about the tots. I got new tots, and these were hot almost burnt. The spicy burger was not spicy at all. There were a couple of small chunks of chile, maybe, in the Mac n cheese.
Overall, this might have been better had I come at a different time maybe? It was tasty, but kinda disappointing as I keep hearing that it's the best place in Phoenix.

Was visiting Scottsdale on vacation. We were all craving a hamburger and wanted to try somewhere new, so started doing some research of Yelp and found this gem.

Such a cute place, feels like your in Cali! The burgers are delish and the service was great! So glad we came here. We will be back the next time we come to visit Scottsdale!

My favorite burger place!

I have tried almost every burger and I swear each one is better than the last!

They posted a photo of their meatloaf with mashed potatoes the other day and I cannot stop thinking about how delicious it looks and how I need to get it!

My favorite is to get their sweet potato tots and pineapple dipping sauce! I could probably drink all of their sauces they are so good!

They have the best staff between both of their locations and always play the best music!

I'm addicted to their burgers and sweet potato tots! 
Their medium wings are delicious!
David is our favorite server!

This is now my go to spot in Old Town! Came in for the first time today and was alone and in a hurry... Well I sat down and ordered my drink planning on just staying long enough to eat and run.. Then one server sitting down the bar from me was making jewelry, Robin. She was so nice and friendly so we meet and she gave me 2 bracelets made while I was waiting on my food and had an awesome belt she made that I bought right there!! Be sure and ask for her if you like cool and vintage inspired accessories;) she's awesome! So after I meet her I am introduced to almost everyone working tonight, which I think is really cool and makes the visit much more fun;). I met Jon, who was so nice and welcoming also, I believe he is either the owner or manager, and my server was a super cool chick named Chi Chi I believe, at least that's what my recipt said!! She helped me choose what to order and I got the Relapse or smaller version of the build your own burger with sweet potato tots!;) AMAZING! One of the best burgers I've ever had, not too big, perfect for me and those who like a thinner, smaller burger! You can get big ones too! That's the awesome thing about this place, each and every sandwich can be made as the smaller version for us light eaters or huge for those wanting more! Great idea! I hate it when I get a huge thick burger and it's falling off the bun and just feels like trying to eat a brick... Not here! You choose between 3 buns, pretzel, wheat, and I believe brioche.... Wheat was perfection! I loved the peach margarita that my bar tender made, and we talked a bit and later she brings me a glass of what looks like a milkshake with whipped cream on top and says to try this and tell her if I like it... I was a little nervous because that can either go really wrong or really right, but it was great and sweet of her to bring me free desert;). It turned out to be a Fireball milkshake!!! I hate Fireball but this was really good! It was really nice to meet so many of the staff, and they were so nice and said I need to be a regular since I live walking distance away:) I think I will do just that! My favorite place in Scottsdale for sure so far!!

This restaurant is such a fun environment and the burgers were amazing. Our server Kaye was so helpful and knowledgeable. I can't wait to come  back again because there are many burgers I want to try.

PUT. THAT. BURGER. IN. YOUR.MOUTH! Lost a * for no guac on the menu.. but I ordered the BYO (build your own) Hot Dog w chili, cheese n chicago relish; hubby got the Hash Burger on a pretzel bun. Did I mention the Sweet PotaterTots and Adult Milkshakes?! Get your discerning Snobsdale ass over there!!

It was hot and humid inside and the communal bar top seating may it awkward to catch up with friends on a Sunday afternoon. The food was alright, but I will try another place before I return to Rehab for a burger fix.

Rolled out of bed on an idle Sunday afternoon, and my head felt like someone hit it with a hammer. I must have had a few more brews than normal the night before, and I felt a hunger for something different. I worked my way through Yelp, and found this place. We drove to old town, and parking was easy to find for this location. It was busy, but we got seated right away. There are an assortment of wild burgers on the menu, and the one with "Hangover" in the title was calling my name. After ordering, the food took a good 25 minutes to come out to us. We ate, and the burgers were ok, slightly under seasoned in my opinion. Fun little place to try, but I doubt I'll make my way back again.

So I needed to go try out the most ridiculous burger I could and this was the place. You know what, it is more of a kids place than not on one hand, and yet again it is not due to full bar and higher quality/prices. 

So the whole party was adventurous, but I went with the PB&J burger Rehab Size w a side of onion rings. So it came in, and I have pictures, and I was impressed. Now the PB ran down the sides and invited for a messy meal, so I went for it with knife and fork as a proper European. It was good. I mean, it was interesting on a novelty level. The peanut butter was powerful, and the jelly kinda just provided a sweet tone. The burger itself was amazing and the pretzel bun was stellar. The 5 massively onion rings was a little disappointing at first, but they delivered. They were huge - in my opinion a little too big actually. I mean it looks great, but the onion becomes slightly underdone this way and provides the crunch to a thick breading. But back to the burger. This place can cook burgers for sure. It was a big meal. I was full all night on this one burger - I didn't even finish all my onion rings. 

I will come back here, for the burgers alone - but then I will go for something else. PB&J burger was interesting but will never become a staple. So burger was a hit, the onion rings were not my style. Too big. Fries were good though. And everybody was happy with their burgers. 
 
Our waitress was cute and personable. She gave her opinion on food and drinks when asked for it, which is something I really like. But besides that she was quite confused. She mixed and matched up orders on the bills, and then she lost a credit card - but found it again. Just one of those things that doesn't impress.

Holy cow!! This place is simply magnificent! The burger was over the top and delish. Their burger choices vary from the expected to some crazy combinations. I mean... A PB&J burger with bacon & siracha???  Whaaaaaat??? I will certainly return, and I think I just may try that PB&J!!! Give an idea how awesome this place is? To get a table had a 30-minute wait at 2:00 on a weekday!! Be sure to get Kaye at the bar, she is fantastic!
Possibly the best bacon cheeseburger I have had this decade! Nice cool Blue Moon beer on draft to wash it down.  Restaurant was clean.  Wait staff effecient and courteous.

This place is my new all time favorite!! Amazing food, atmosphere, and service!  They have every burger creation that you can imagine and the quality is excellent.  I haven't had one thing on the menu that wasn't good!  I hope they open a Rehab Burger Therapy in Gilbert! I recommend the PB and J burger, and the Pig Wings as an appetizer.

Spicy mac and cheese burger. Nuff said.

Seriously though, this place is delicious. They have a lot of great options, from salads big ass burgers and turkey sandwiches. I've tried the Japaleno Popper burger, Spicy Mac and Cheese burger, and the Veggie burger. All were very good, but I'd recommend getting some spicy sauce to go with the veggie burger, it's a little plain if you have a zesty palate.
Really good.  My wife has the fish tacos, I had the bacon cheeseburger.  Quality was excellent, portions huge, price reasonable.

This place is amazing. The peanut butter and jelly burger seriously might be my favorite burger of all time. The sweet potato tots on the side are to die for. Their dipping sauces are all awesome as well. Such a great place and friendly staff.

Was hoping for more. Had the Ghost burger. Was expecting something more spicy. Burger itself didn't have much flavor or seasonings. Guacamole also didn't have much flavor. Everything was just very average for me. 

We also tried Mac n cheese with bacon and it was pretty good but still average.

Absolutely amazing burger. I tried the Hatch Chili Burger and it was perfectly cooked. The Sweet Potato Tater Tots were an excellent side. 

I highly recommend any burger lover to try this place.

I have dreams when I am out of town about the Cuban here...I realize how ridiculous that sounds but I literally crave it. The service here has always been top notch and they have great drinks. You really do have to try it once and then you will be like the rest of us.....5 pounds heavier because you keep coming back! The burgers are amazing too, cooked to perfection.

One of the best burgers in downtown Scottsdale.  Hangover is a must. Enjoyed the music, misters and service. If you're not in the mood for a burger try the taco trio with fish, pork and chicken. The spices they use make you thirsty for a beer or two. Can't wait to go back.

Service was slow and the burger came out on a soggy bun.  Asked for a fresh bun but took forever so ended up just eating the meat.  Also, the place was super hot.  Everyone at our table was sweating.  Maybe they were just having a bad night but I wouldn't go back to this place after this experience.
Great food great vegetarian options food came hot and fresh love the Frys and tots come here off hours to avoid busy times

Horrible experience a few weeks ago with bad and slow service and them throwing a fit because my aunt wanted a different bun. Will NEVER be back to this location. The one in downtown Scottsdale is much better!
Fantastic Food and Service! The Mac and Cheese burger is the best!
Yummy! Definitely a place to share food. Perfect time to try something different.

This place never dissapoints. 

Big portions,lots of flavors! Staff are always friendly and ready to help.


Great job guys.

Want a fun burger that you can't get anywhere else? Here we are. 

PB&J on deck with an extra patty to boot. Sweet potato Fries on deck. The look on your face when they bring this monster to you - and it actually tastes amazing? 

Ya. I came back.

Excellent service! Food was great! Nice laid back atmosphere. Don't have anything negative to say! I had the hangover burger with half fries and half sweet potato tots. They came with a few sauces that were good.

Expensive and One hour waiting time but told only 30 minutes and then took nearly 50 minutes for 4 burgers and 1 hotdog to go to the table. I will not be back. The waiter was not friendly either. Not a good experience and was really expensive. Food is ok but not special.

This place is really cool. Definitely a fun coastal vibe about it. My love of burgers brought me here. Initially we had about a 15-20 minute wait. The hostess seemed very distracted or overwhelmed with something so probably could have been seated within minutes of getting here. I had the PBJ burger with sweet potato tots and it was pretty amazing. Definitely saving this as one of my go back to places.
Love this place, you will NOT be disappointed!!! Great food, fun vibe and awesome service!!!

The closest your gonna get to Kuma's Corner of Chicago. The burger was incredible. Not only is it 10oz. but it's affordable and perfectly cooked. I got the chili burger which is no joke. Pretzel bun all the way. Chili was real freaking good too. Rehab has the best burger in Arizona.

The burgers here are excellent and so are the sweet potato tots.   They are especially good with the sauce they serve them with.  I tried the jalapeno popper burger, which was fantastic.  The burger itself is so flavorful and there are so many options to top it with.  Will definitely be back to try others.

Come here with a ravenous appetite because you will definitely be served a nice hefty burger! 

We came to this beach-themed restaurant on a Sunday around noon. It was already buzzing with hungry rehabers. Wait time was only 15 minutes and we were seated at a communal table bench which is always fun!

We ordered calamari and mac n' cheese to start. The calamari was very heavily breaded, almost like fried fish sticks, but our friend loved them. The rehab sized mac n' cheese was delicious, but we could not even finish half of it between 3 people. I can't even imagine how big the relapse size is. I split a pretzel bun Hangover Burger and just half was a nice hearty and heavy meal for one. But because the slab of meat is thick, the inside wasn't as juicy as I hoped it would be. French fries and the tots were pretty standard. Overall, a pretty decent experience. 

If you're hungry, Rehab Burger Therapy will definitely get the job done! :)

Went to rehab for a burger with the family. There is ample parking next to the restaurant in a public parking garage which is easy.
We opted for burger (what else) and took the mac-n-cheese and mac gnarly burgers. I had the sweet potato tater tots as a side.
The burger was super delish - cooked to order, full of taste in patty and fresh toppings and a great bun. The tatter tots were also great were sweet and well flavored.
Service was attentive and prompt.

Overall - super yummy w good service. I'm hooked. Will be back every time I'm in town.

I love the burgers here! I had the spicy Mac and cheese burger and it was heaven on a plate. I love the atmosphere at this restaurant as well. Would recommend to anyone and have recommended to many. Will definitely return in the future!

I love it I have tried three different burgers with sweet potatoes tots all delicious had a margarita Corona drink in honor of Cinco De Maya at Rehab the service is amazing they aim to please you must come by and enjoy the moment Alice Gibson  PS they said the peanut and jelly burger is to go bananas for top seller but I did like the Gost Burger it rocks!
Everything was amazing. Food incredible, service great, and good beer selection. If your in town, you MUST go here.

OMG!!! First and last stop on our trip to Arizona. Fun environment, great staff - and crazy good burgers.

We knew we were ordering too much - but we couldn't resist. The burger combined with the ribeye, cheese and poblano chilies, accompanied bye sweet potato tarts and onion rings accompanied by a beer and a glass of wine.

Winner, winner - chicken dinner!!!

One of the best burgers I've had perfect cooked to my taste and I had the ghost pepper burger with ghost pepper cheese. The burger was spicy of course lol but it wasn't too bad I enjoyed it. My lady had a lettuce wrapped jalapeno popper burger and that was too. The food was really good the place was a nice cali surfer beach style spot and I loved it. The margaritas were good as well. The only reason i don't five it more stars is because of the long wait to get served. We sat at the bar to avoid a long wait and still at the bar it took a really long time to get a menu then to get our drinks and even longer to get our order taken. It was Friday afternoon there was a good size friend but the wait was kinda crazy even for old town. Definitely a place I'll go to earlier or during the week to beat the crowd and get better service.

Delicious!!  By far, the peanut butter, jelly, and sriracha burger is my favorite but all of them are amazing!  I also love the sweet potato tots with all the various aiolis.  Hands down my favorite place to get a burger in Old Town.

On our way to Dodgers spring training we decided to stop at this popular spot, it was a great choice indeed! Menu options with fun names: gourmet burgers (10oz or 5oz)/sandwiches/pasta/salads and dessert. We tried the P&J burger/Meatloaf burger/Philly cheese burger/Tony Montana sandwich.  The burgers are HUGE & come with regular fries or sweet potato tots. Tip: skip fries & go for tots....YUMMM YUM! The sandwich is a black forrest ham with pulled pork on overly toasted bread (sigh), but still pretty good. We left very stuffed & satisfied. I'd like to go back & try other items, overall food is pretty good!

Okay i've only been twice but everytime has been awesome! Right behind RNR and everytime I go they have an awesome bar and waiting staff! You can't go wrong with their burgers or sweet potatoe tots! Warning Rodrigo Da Vinci salad is the most unique and awesome tasting salad i've ever had! It is always busy which tells you something and the people are all around my age also seen some pi phi shirts inside that I had no complaints about haha definitely a must go!
Great experience and delicious burgers.  My wife's was BYOB but I took the plunge and went for the Porkster Burger.  Wow!  Will visit again next time in PHX.
Best burgers in the valley, best frozen margarita in the valley, with a fun and relaxed vibe. This is one of my new favorite spots.
Awesome vibe, comfortable casual, delicious burger topped with pork!!! Great/friendly bartender(Courtney) made the night even better. Overall great experience.

Best burgers in town and reasonably priced! Good service too. Try the Know Poblano Burger.....Its wonderful! Be ready to wait though, the place is not huge, but has a lot of people who love it. I've been sat right away and been waiting 45 minutes depending on what time you go.

PB&J Burger, Thank me later :) A very cool, laid back restaurant with a creative menu.  I am a burger fanatic and Rehab is a must try!  The service was very friendly, they have a full bar and I've tried burgers with peanut butter before, but never with jelly and I must admit, the jelly takes it to new heights.  My kind of place - casual, fun, friendly and unique menu items.  BOOKMARK it!!

Ordered medium burger and it was on the medium rare to rare so I ate half. The waitress was nowhere to be found. She was either dancing in the kitchen and chatting with coworker's at the bar. Still tippped her 30% only because I was a waitress in my college days but she didn't deserve it and she was old enough to know better for good customer service
This place helped me get over my double cheeseburger addiction and after 2 weeks I was a vegan

Popped into Rehab Burger after a busy shopping day at Fashion Square.  We arrived for an early dinner and were immediately seated.  The decor inside is cute... definitely surfer/California vibe.  I like it.  It was a bit hot inside... could have used the AC turned down a notch or two.  Service was great... our waitress offered her recommendations and was very friendly/helpful.

The burgers were great... messy, but great.  I had a standard cheese burger with thousand dressing (I don't remember what it was called).  It was fab... everything you'd want in a burger.  The Hubs had a burger with pulled pork on top.  He ate every bite and was in 7th heaven.  Both of us felt our sides were pretty cold... fries for me and tots for him.  They would have been much better hot, but they were still pretty good.

We were able to get some beers on happy hour, which was great.  We will surely hit this place up again.  Next time, I want to try that pot brownie... sounded delish.

Got a PBJ &  Bacon Burger since they were out of the Mac and Cheese burger special. The PBJ burger was well cooked, the PBJ was a different combo but enexpectedly tasty, I would get it again. The sweet potato tots and the dipping sauce were a nice change from the usual fries and ketchup.

The downside to the restaurant was the wait. We were seated in under 5 minutes, but after that we waited almost 45 minutes from seated until our food finally showed up! There were people seated after us who got their food before and the same time as us. Not sure what the big hold up was.

TL;DR - tasty food, long wait. I'm not sure it was worth a 45 minute wait.

While we were definitely coming during a lunch rush, the total time for full service was definitely a bit longer than I would expect of what is ultimately still a burger joint. 

Our total time from the moment we sat down, at the bar till the time we left was approximately 1hr. That was for 2 burgers & 2 waters. 

The burgers were quite good, and filling. Portion were not overly large, but still large enough to leave me completely full. The sweet potato tots were moist on the inside and crisp on the outside.

It's definitely 5 stars for the food, but 3 stars for the service. I don't know if it was because of the weekend, or because they were supper busy but the service wasn't good. On the other hand, the food is AMAZING!!! We enjoyed every single dish and every single bite.

Overall the place is really good.

A gem in old town!!!

This was a roll of the dice tonight. We wanted a burger and we were around Scottsdale. It came up on Yelp with great reviews.

My only complaint is that there is not one closer to my home in QC.  

The food was great!! Burger cooked perfect.  Had an appetizer of the Pig Wings.  A must!! They would be a great Happy Hour order. 

In the mood or a burger and don't want the standard fast food, don't let the Old Town Scottsdale scare you away from trying this place!!

BTW... The owners are the same owners as Oregano's Pizza...

Really good, but be careful. They have two size burgers, and if you don't specify, guess the one you get? The big one. Even with a big appetite this burger was TOO big. Get the smaller one (5oz.) plenty big and cheaper unless you are REALLY REALLY hungry. 

Also note, other than fries, the sides cost extra, but the side salad was pretty big. Overall prices were a bit high, even for Scottsdale, and the reviews for the sweet potato tots were not good at my table. Also service was friendly but also slow. On the plus side, they split our bill without even asking. I would go back, but definitely get the smaller burger, and stick to the side salad or coleslaw.
Aside being out of the pretzel buns, everything was really good. We purposely went for the pretzel buns, and was disappointed to find out they were all out by 7:00 pm.
This place has a great atmosphere.  This place has A great variety of burgers and beverages.   Is a great place to have some food and some beverages and a good conversation.

Amazing! PBJ Bacon burger and Spicy MAC n Cheese Burger. Seriously best ever. Great waitress too! Atmosphere was pub like with indoor or outdoor seating. Fair prices. The 5 oz burgers were plenty and I actually put some in a to go box for midnight munchies. 
Don't know if any other burgers could top them, but from what we saw passing by on plates, I'd be willing to find out!
Great atmosphere, lots of locals frequent here. I had the cobb salad and hubby had the blue burger and food was delicous! Look forward to coming back when we are back in town.

This was a surprising find...newly opened in a location of several other restaurants, this place has great food at reasonable prices. Offering both 10oz and 6oz burgers, along with a complete menu. The burgers were great. Prepared exactly as ordered, mine med-rare. They offer set burgers, plus, a build your own option. The fries were first rate, fresh and hot. The atmosphere is fun. The staff was efficient and friendly. They offer both patio and inside dining. I would definitely go back...

This place is absolutely incredible. I'm seriously considering trying to find a week in Phoenix just so I can try more of their fantastic burgers. The fries are also amazing, and even the pickle here was good, something I almost never enjoy. It's a laid back and unapologetic vibe, serving up probably the best burgers I've ever tasted. Don't miss it!!

So a friend introduced me to Rehab. burger when I came to visit Scottsdale and she couldn't stop talking about the PB&J burger and sweet potato tots. At first I was skeptical at the sound of such a burger but then decided since I love beef and also love PB and J and let's be real, who doesn't love sweet potato tots, that I would give this burger a try. The Burger was Amazing! It was cooked to perfection and blended well with the PB and J and oh I forgot to mention, Siracha! The burgers we ordered were ready in a timely fashion and the service there was great. The menu had many great options, and was very fairly priced. Would definitely recommended Rehab Burger to all my friends.
Amazing place!!! Highly recommend! Amazing manger Phil, and great service!!! Everyone is super nice!!!

GREAT FOOD!! Great service!! Relaxed atmosphere/bar setting. I had asked the waitress what was good and she praised the PB&J bacon burger on a pretzel bun, so I ordered it with with sweet potato tots, it was good but def have to love pb&j to enjoy it, next time I'd say light PB! The tots were great! My husband ordered the Ghost Burger, BEST BURGER EVER!!!! I can't even!!!! The grill taste of the patty and oh the CHEESE!!!! He had onion rings with his, they were huge. We're from Texas and LOVE hot and spicy food, I got the chips and salsa and it was HOT and the chips were so crispy and yummy!!! We would def eat here again!

I can't believe the negative views on here about this place. Came here mid-day and sat outside. This place offers tons of choices on burgers. I had the Spicy Mac-N-Cheese burger and it was too die for. While it was messy, after you cleaned up the sides of the burger you were able to cut it in half and eat it without it falling apart. I would definitely come back to this place next time on vacation.

Sooooo..... We had the chips and verde chicken to start and that was the shizz!!! I had the macaroni and cheese burger and my husband had the pb&j burger!! Both were super yummy and very filling for 5oz. Our server Laura was on point and most friendly! We will be back for sure!!!
Always a wait. Honestly the place should be bigger they could just buy out the pawn shop next door and open the place up a lot more. There is a queso bean dip that is outstanding! Best thing there.

Any time I'm in town I go to this place now. Their menu selection is really awesome! I ate the PB&J with bacon burger my first time here, and don't let the description fool you, it was awesome! They usually have good beers on tap too. The wait staff was SUPER knowledgeable on everything from what extra sauce goes great with every burger, and even what dressing is best with what! A must if you're in the mood for a great burger!
Great place.  Been there twice and will go back again.  Try the peanut butter and jelly hamburger.

I was going to go with 2 stars but since in the past I have been here several times as this used to be one of our favorite burger places.   I am so disappointed in our entire order of food.  I took my family from out of town bragging about how good their burgers are. Boy I was shocked at how downhill the food has gone.  The burgers were dry and unflavored.  I had to add salt which I hate doing.  I ordered the chili burger, super bland.  The fries were not fresh. My niece ordered a turkey burger and they brought a vege burger. My nephew ordered no tomato and they brought him tomato. They didn't bring his onion for a very long time, service slow and it wasn't busy at that point. Plus he told them he has a tomato allergy.  Brownie is super hard and dried out and the pineapple dessert tastes awful.  I'm super disappointed.

We were in the area and I wanted a burger, so I checked Yelp and I found this great burger place that had great reviews. Now that I ate here, I know why..... The burgers are cooked to order, which is something I haven't gotten in a while. We sat at the bar and the bartender was friendly and informative. A glass of red wine and a delicious burger is perfect on a Friday night. This place is hopping tonight.
Good food and fun atmosphere. Highly recommend it!
We will be back.
Had the Veggie Noogie was really good and the Sweet Potato Tots were good as well. Food was a little slow getting out, but I would come back and try more off the menu.

Well, I thought I had walked into Hooters.  The waitress was showing off all her goods, as were the other two.  One was pregnant with shorts on and the other was obviously a mother.  Funky decor was fun, food was average. In Rehab people should wear more clothes.
Ordered burger medium and it was rare, service was good- if you could keep your eyes off Hooters in training.

Great food.  Great service.  THIS is how a burger is supposed to be cooked and taste. If you come here and order a Veggie burger OR eat your burger cooked Well Done, please skip this place and patronize McDonald's. Had the Jalapeño Popper burger w/ sweet potato tots. Awesome.  Anyone who rated this place less than 3 stars must be a high maintenence P.I.T.A!

First time in today and we had a fantastic experience! The food was great. I highly recommend the PB&J burger. The service was even better! It's hard to find good service now a days but the manager, Michael made us feel so welcomed and made sure we had everything we needed. We will definitely be back!
Ate there last night, excellent burger and salad. Even better service and the beers were cold
duh Y do you answer every booties questions on dee Facebook just not mine yo'lo? sum lee. i hee the fut is gut here but i have de questions yo'lo

I don't think I have ever had a more enthusiastic server in my life.
A short brunette helped my girlfriend and I out, and obviously loved her job.
The burger I got was huge and delicious.  The fries and tots were great, too.
The patio was perfect on such a beautiful day.  
This is a great spot to relax with a burger/sandwich and beer.  Enjoy!

I am definitely a burger snob as funny as that sounds. That being said, I know Arizona is not known for its food, it is very hard searching for an amazing place to eat out that is also consistent. I found some ok and above average burger places like delux and zin burger, both very good but Rehab Burger holds the crown hands down. 

My only complaint ever is the wait times can be that of were ancient asian meditation techniques are required to contain the hunger wrath from the scent emanating from the kitchen, that place gets PACKED. 

My absolute favorite is the McKnarley Burger with a side of onion rings - you must try this!

I can't wait to try the other locations, the location in Tempe now offers Yelp cash back at 5% to that place is locked and loaded in my crosshairs.

Excellent job from the service staff and chefs! 5 times over and not one let down. Keep it up!

My girlfriend took me here for the first time today. So I'm one of those people who likes his meat well done lol trust me people I know I here it everyday that you loose all the flavor when it's well done but that's how I like it. Nevertheless I ordered my burger well done and when I received it it was medium at best I'm not one to complain so I didn't say anything and I ate it. Wasn't bad but I would still rather it been well done still a great place
You know it's the best when you wake up craving a Jalapeno Popper Burger. I'm headed there now because it is just that amazing.

Great little spot in old town Scottsdale!  We went there midday and the wait was quite long (~30 minutes).  It's so tiny that we had to wait outside...thankfully, the Arizona heat had not hit its high since it was only about 100 degrees.  At any rate, we finally got it and was worth the wait.

The service was great, the loud atmosphere fun, and the food was yummy.  Our waiter was very attentive and quick the get ice cold waters and even colder beers.  He made his recommendations and we did not oblige.  We ordered our style of burgers...in true LA fashion :/  They made us our burgers as requested and we were happy.

Will definitely stop again on a future visit!
Best sweet potato tots in the world and the burger with Mac and cheese on it? Epic! Great bar and patio seating that's pup friendly!

Good vibes all around at Rehab! I loved the atmosphere of the beach bar, decorations were spot on. The service was ok. Our waitress was decent - she kept the drinks full and always asked how we were doing when she walked by. She seemed a tad stressed, but rightfully so as she was also helping a table of around 20 people. I was craving mac and cheese, and decided to go for it on the mac and cheese burger. DELICIOUS! The fries, burger - everything! Definitely planning to come back and experience the food again!
Great burger joint.  Party of six and we all had something different . The two best burgers (my opinion) were the bleu burger and the bbq burger. Big portion sizes and friendly service.

I had the best burgers here.  So good I went back the next day.  Very nice place.  I have been there twice and ordered the same burger because it was so good.  It was the bacon and blue cheese burger.  The second time I was there I also ordered the sweet potato bites.  So good.  I know I will go again and promise myself to order a different burger.  The atmosphere is amazing.  The music is also great.  Service was good.  It is a very nice place to have great food and a great time with your friends.
They all know me at the bar. Save today no one has ever rubbed me the wrong way.  The pb&j burger is amazing. I always come back

Rehab Burger is one of my favorite burger places in the valley. The food is delicious, the staff is friendly, and the environment is inviting. I have been to the Scottsdale location as well and everything is the same. The only reason why i did not give this a 5 Star is because I requested to have no jalapeños and green chilies on my Mac N Cheese burger, and the waiter gave my another customers Mac N Cheese hamburger with the green chilies still in it. To be honest it was not that big of a deal and the place was not busy at all.
I had a wonderful experience here ! The staff was friendly and welcoming. For food I got the Mac n cheese hamburger and boy was there a lot of Mac n cheese on it, but it was delicious!

Everything tasted delicious. Staff went out of their way to accommodate us. Cook sent out some avocado and pineapple for our baby. Female bartender was a sweetheart. Waiter was awesome. We will be back.
GO HERE!!!  Great vibe, great veggie bean burger you can change the toppings on to any of the regular veggie options.  I love this place, the bar is great. bartender is nice! Thanks girl

Ate here after 3 months of hardcore dieting and I couldn't have made a better choice to expand my waistline. Ended up with the pulled-pork burger but was really debating the mac & cheese situation. Had to eat my food with a fork and I was all delicate and soft and small after 3 months of salads but I managed to put that delicious wreck down into my gut. So amazing. 

Boyfriend go their weekend special, the Elvis. It sounded really awful, being topped with a Hershey Bar, Reeces Cup, and like peanut butter &  jelly... but it was stinkin' great. Holy fricken cow. 

Drinks are waaay expensive (weeak Coronaritas) but honestly you wonder why you even got a drink as soon as they put the food down... no room for beer!

I've been trying to get over to this place since we moved to Arizona 2 years ago. Finally I convinced my wife to go because it was Father's Day. I was not disappointed.

Starting off I think the beach bar was fun and not over the top with the surf boards and Tiki bar decor. I noticed a very reasonably sized bar right when we walked in which is very convenient if you just want drinks and a little food.

The place was packed and we only had to wait a bit because all the low tables were in use and we had someone in a wheelchair with us. It wasn't too long of a wait and the food would have made a longer wait worth it.

I'm a beer snob so the selection was pedestrian at best but their specialty drinks and hard liquor selection makes up for the lack of high end beers (I didn't show up for the booze though).

We ordered the pig wings appetizer which were melt in your mouth good. We ate the appetizer so fast that the timing for the main entree seemed long but was, in reality, reasonable. 

I ordered the spicy mac n cheese 10oz burger and fries with the pretzel bun. My first thought when the plate arrived was that the food pics I've seen match the grandeur with which I was presented. Also, my burger was cooked medium which may be too much. Next time medium rare (and I usually like meat well done). I also think that the 5oz option is more sensible unless you are 20 years old and really hungry. The fries with the chipotle ranch were cooked well and complimented the whole meal ( I didn't have that "I loved the burger hate the fries experience I was expecting"). There was even a huge tasty dill pickle spear served on the side.

The service was great. The only oddity was how soon our server asked how things were. Just so they know you don't need to ask how things are when you have such epic creations. The service was so much better than what I've experienced in many other restaurants in Arizona and that alone will keep me coming back. 

The next burger on my list will be the PB&J with Sriracha.
Great Burger place. Good service and great food. Hard to beat. Popular and can get very busy. So be prepared to wait. It`s worth it.

Sorry, this is a tad late!

I met up with a good friend recently to hang outside and have a burger...since I only have 3-4 a year, it's kind of a big deal.  This place is tiny with a great patio and horrible parking but that is a minor hassle that ended up being worth it.

We got seated and began looking at the menu.  My friend is cutting a lot of things from her diet and was able to get a GF bun.  She was happy that the staff was able to recommend some things she COULD get.  Our waiter was fabulous that way!

I love 1000-Island burgers but Rehab doesn't have that sauce so I opted for fish tacos instead, with a side of sweet-potato tots.  OMG, they were heavenly!  The order was huge so I took them home and had leftovers for a week.  The tacos were great but messy.  

We had a lovely time visiting with our neighbors at the next table and I noticed a lot of first-timers and was able to compare notes with them and even share some tots.  All seemed happy with the ambience and food, which says a lot about Rehab's menu selections.

The prices were very reasonable, which is always a reason to go back.  I could make a meal out of the tots alone and will become a regular when I can get a cheeseburger with 1000-Island.  Remember, it's a big deal!

Note: Flavor Explosion

Not for the faint of heart. These unusual concoctions will leave you with an euphoric peaceful experience that may send you into a food coma. 

Must try's:

*PB&J cheeseburger 
*Hawaiian cheeseburger
*Mac&Cheeseburger
*sweet potato tots "lil pillows of goodness" - Tim Thurell

WARNING: These burgers have been proven to be additive, thus making the name of the establishment ironic.

Most drinks are not for woman who are or may become pregnant. 

Enjoy the company as you may imbibe as a community at one table.

This establishment is Jason E. Lee approved
Got to try the pb&j bacon burger , so good.. I was impressed and have to give them the #1 ranking now and did tuckered goes to #2

If you've been around Scottsdale for a while you might remember Pischke's Paradise which was a casual, beach theme, Jimmy Buffett, style restaurant where you could go without having to feel like you were in "Snobsdale". Rehab has that same vibe, although it focuses almost exclusively on burgers and doesn't have the same menu selection that Pischke's had.

However, the burgers are really good, so that makes up for it. If you're really hungry, get the Rehab size burger and if you're not so hungry get a Relapse. However, either way, get a side of sweet potato tater tots to go with them and you'll thank me later.

Service is fast and friendly, seating is ample, and there's rarely a wait to get a table. If the weather is nice, go ahead and sit on the patio. But most of all, just relax, rehab, and have a great time.

This place is great!!! The customer service is fantastic and the food is great. I bring any friends visiting out of town here and they're always impressed. Also rian was our waiter this last time and he was great

Rehab Burger has time and time again given me great tasting burger combinations with wacky toppings that I enjoy. Everything I've had here is flavorful yet very distinct from other burger joints - not an uncommon cuisine by any means - with reasonable pricing and a cool vibe.

I like the environment, with the chill surfer decor. With tables and high tops it doesn't feel crowded at all. Although I find it extremely difficult to fit large groups - most tables are arranged for a size of 4. I just eat here with a couple friends so not my concern.

Back to the burgers - fantastic. They have innovative toppings like the PB&J Bacon Burger with sriracha and Ghost Burger with ghost pepper jack. Ghost's my favorite, and the pepper jack is definitely elevated compared to jalapenos but not like sign-a-waiver hot.

My favorites here have been off the menu specials. They have a Mac and Cheese Burger with hatch chill M&C pouring off the patty - twice the radius of the burger itself. And the weekend burger that's essential egg's benedict on a burger. 

Get me a 10 oz Rehab size of any of those with my sweet potato tots and I will always leave super satisfied.

This is a great spot for lunch in Scottsdale. It's conveniently located with free public parking next door. We arrived a little before noon on a Friday and the place was already jammed. Definitely worth the wait . Beer at happy hour prices available at lunch was a first for me! The burgers were awesome. The small was pretty sizable and the pretzel roll fresh and delicious. A  crunchy pickle and sweet potato nuggets or fries came with. The nuggets with a pineapple teriyaki aioli were very, very tasty! And the service was great. Our waitress ( from Wisconsin ) was friendly and quick, great combo when your in a hurry!

Yep...this was yummy stuff folks.

We had supper here before heading to The Sugar Bowl for youngest son's first birthday celebration.

Our crew started with the Pig Wings. Mine is a family of carnivores and they were all super happy with these little pork nuggets. I tasted them and they were so good! Very tender and the sauce was amazing.

We all had burgers or some sort. We had the smaller sized burgers since we were headed for ice cream next and they were more than enough (for me they were at least!)

My favorite at Rehab was the sweet potato tots. Pure genius. Served with a little pineapple sort of dip. My baby boy and I loved them! 

The decor was relaxed and the service was EXCELLENT!

If you are in Old Town Scottsdale don't miss it!

Amazing burgers with a wide range of unique flavors that surprise the pallet such as the peanut butter and jelly and  sriracha.  A surprisingly amazing burger. Well worth the 30 minute wait for lunch. The classic burgers were delicious if not one of the best, but you must explore the different and unique other flavors that make this place amazing. Let's not forget the French fries with the skin. You must! Eat here at least once!

Wanted to love this place.  Service was slow, but the place was packed.  Asked for onion rings but was told they only had enough for the burgers that had onion rings on them.  

Opted for a Hawaiian burger.  It was good, but they didn't bring the aoli that was supposed to come with it.  Finished 1/2 my burger before I was able to flag down the server.  (He never came by to check to make sure everything was okay.)  

While waiting to flag down the server for my aoli, the table next to us received a basket of onion rings!!  I guess they decided they had enough now.  They offered to bring us some... if we paid for them.  We were almost done with our meals by that point... we declined.

No drink refills were offered.  We were without water and soft drinks throughout most of our meal.   Overall the service was very lacking...being busy is not an excuse for virtually no service whatsoever.   Even if we lived in the area, we would not return.  Very disappointing.

Killer!  Almost literally.  I had my burger with Ghost pepper cheese.  The burger was really good, but the ghost pepper was knocking me down.  It's hard to fully enjoy your food when the pepper is burning.

Otherwise great burgers.  Tried a bite of the peanut butter and jelly bacon burger.  Really good, but it also had a bbq flavor that threw me off.

The sweet potato tater tots were delicious!  Overall great place and I would recommend going.

Oh. My. Goodness. 
This place is incredible. All four of us LOVED our burger. Including one notoriously picky kid who said (after 2 bites), "This is a 5-star burger."
Service was great! So glad we came!

NOT your average burger joint... Great burgers when you want something different!

ALSO... impressed that management called the police when a Ferrari was blocking the handicap spots!!!!  LOVE IT!!! THANK YOU!!!

FYI--- Peanut Butter / Bacon / Cheeseburger... Just DO IT and thank me later!

I'm so sad! Everyone - literally everyone - raves about this place. We've tried to check it out several times, but it's always been packed. Fortunately one day we got off of work a little early and were able to beat the dinner rush. I got the Jalapeno Popper burger and it was such a disappointment. I was expecting fresh fried jalapenos, but they were the frozen/pickled peppers with no taste and to top it off the burger was dry and bland. And then the final straw was the soda was flat and not enough syrup. I mentioned that to the server and she replaced it with a different selection, and even that was flat. We were super hoping to love this place like everyone else, but just didn't meet par with what we'd expect from a burger place. However, the music selection was great - and if we were craving the SoCal vibes and there's not a long line, we might try it again, but I'll just stick with the basic burger next time.

Amazing food. First time there I had the ghost burger (rehab edition) with fries and it was amazing. Very bold flavors and fresh ingredients. It's very Island like with island music so if you don't like that kind of music it may kinda throw you off. Other than that very good food. Thank you for serving delicious food!

I've been to this place several times and I'm never disappointed. It's become my go-to place when people come to visit. The portions are kinda large so it's nice to share or take home the extra.  I've had the burgers and the salads...all very good!

Truthfully, my rating lies somewhere between 3 and 4 stars. I came here recently on a business trip. My deep love of cheeseburgers and the high reviews here had me convinced that I just HAD to pay a visit. 

We arrived around 7pm on a Wednesday night and the place was pretty packed. After a 10 minute wait we were seated. Our waitress was friendly and quickly available. We ordered a couple drinks and a burger each. I opted for a Corona-rita and the Hatch burger, my friend ordered a Mike Tai and the Hangover burger.

The drinks were alright, my friend felt that hers was sickeningly sweet and mine was good, but nothing to write home about. Our burgers arrived quickly, hot off the grill and each with a large serving of fries. The burgers were good, although the bun on mine was fairly burnt in a few areas. I was happy with the food, but I wouldn't consider it amazing.

OMG!! So delish. We shared the Hangover burger, salad, sweet potatoes tots and the corn. Everything was excellent. Paired with a great beer. Wish I lived here to be able to come back more often. Great decor, service and atmosphere.
Great food and drinks! So happy to have Rehab burger in the neighborhood. The staff was friendly and the patio was perfectly comfortable with the misters. The temperature was in the high 90's!

THE BEST BURGER PLACE!!!! We went to Rehab after a hike and we were so glad we stopped.  The staff could tell we had not been there before, so our waitress took it upon herself to tell us everything there was to know.  It was wonderful to be welcomed that way.  We got our food quickly and she even brought over different sauces for our fries/ sweet tater tots that were far beyond the usual ketchup.  The sweet tater tots with pineapple sauce was to die for! Salty and sweet and it hits your tongue just right. (I don't even like pineapple and I ate it up!) The chipotle ranch is amazing and not too spicy for a wimp like me.   The burgers are giant, def order the smaller size, and the pretzel bun is a MUST. We also enjoyed some of the best calamari as an appetizer with the chipotle ranch.  The atmosphere is so fun and it seemed like a vacation within a vacation for me.  I wish there was one close to where I live, I would be a regular.

I don't particularly enjoy eating out. But this place was a pleasure!  I don't recall the last time I went to a place where every item brought out was stupendous. I ate with two others and we all shared, so I sampled three burgers, four sides (one person doubled up), and all the sauces. I loved every single thing!  I just moved here from Chicago and have been rather disappointed with the food here but this place gives me hope.  Also, our service was amazing.  Not just our waitress, but the entire staff went out of the way to make our table comfortable. Super impressed.

I'll be back!
Amazing place....great atmosphere and incredible burger.  My son got the fettuccine with pesto and he loved it.  It's a must go to!!!!!!  I'm from NY and very picky...this is a winner

I had a bacon cheeseburger from at this place the other day.  That was my first time eating here. I am huge burger aficionado and am always on the lookout for the best burger ever. Hodad's in San Diego is my #1 and has been for a long time. This place would probably make my #1 in Phoenix. I will definitely be going back. I would order the fries over the onion rings... you pay extra for rings and I only got 4. I did try the fries on my friend's plate... they were good.

We had a reservation and sat down for 10 minutes and then the waitress came over and said you have to move to the bar, we have a party of 10 coming in and we were a party of 7. We moved to a smaller table, it was very hot inside, then five other people came in and sat at that table we were moved from, i went up to pay for my drink and asked if that was their party of 10? She said that they tried to call the party of 10 and the party of 10 and could not reach them. They could have moved us back. We left, they will never get our business again. Bad business practice on them.

Stopped in there with a friend for the first time and was very impressed!
Plenty of parking, fun and friendly vibe as soon as you walk in.
Had the ghost burger which was delicious and the bun fit the burger size too.
Since we sat at the bar we thoroughly enjoyed the fun banter with our bartender Courtney! 
Since I eat out a lot this place seems to have gotten it right with the fun dining concept. I'll be back!
Had the turkey burger with avocado and aioli and it was great! They also have a decent beer selection.  If you really like burgers and beers, give this place a shot!

Came here last weekend with some family and friends.  We were surprising someone who didn't know we were in town, and the staff was more than willing to help us surprise this person.  Besides the staff being really helpful and hilariously playing along with our prank, the food is soooo good.  We had a side of chips/guac for an app, we felt the side of guac was a little small, but we are all from Cali, so maybe we are just spoiled.  3 of us had the BBQ burger, which was delicious, and very very filling.

We would definitely come back if we are in town again.

Whoever came up with adding Sriracha to the PBJ burger is a genius!  The Sriracha added just the right amount of heat to let you know it had come to the party without kicking the door down with a pink wig on and screaming, "I'm here!"  Great stuff, love this place.

The food is delicious! We ordered bacon cheeseburgers and I got a chocolate shake that was so good! The young hostess seemed a little aloof at first as she didn't make eye contact, but she was nice when we asked her a question and a hard worker as we saw her multi-tasking between clearing tables and greeting patrons. Our server was super friendly and down-to-earth and a woman who appeared to be the owner or manager also stopped by to check on our experience, which was nice. There is a mix of a young hip crowd as well as plenty of people over 40 (thank goodness!) and there is a cool, fun vibe here. Not a major deal, but the women's restroom was the tiniest one I've ever seen with barely room for someone to wait without being hit by the door. It's located in Old Town Scottsdale so it's fun to walk around and sightsee in the area as well.
Nice place, really laid back feel, reminds me of cali which im sure was the intended vibe. we'd go back one day. Friendly waiters, good food.

The PB&J burger has flavor unbounded!!! It has been by far the best inventive burger I ever tasted. If you love peanut butter you will be in love with the combo of peanut butter bacon and jelly! Definitely
try it!

My friend and I had lunch here today. It was 110 outside, and we were looking for relief from the heat. Sadly, it did not feel much better inside. When I mentioned it to our server, she actually said yeah it's 92 degrees in here, our ventilation sucks... So apparently this is an everyday thing, not an a/c on the fritz. 92 is not an ok temperature to have lunch indoors! Temperature aside, the service was friendly but VERY slow. I ordered the Beijing Beefstro salad. It was greasy and just not appetizing. I can take partial blame for ordering a a salad at a burger joint, but wow this salad was just gross. They did take it off the bill when I said it wasn't what I expected, so that's the bright side. My friend liked her chicken sandwich and sweet tots. I tasted the tots, and they were good. I don't think I'll come back here... definitely not in the summer.

Just stopped by for chips and salsa and a coke while waiting for hubby at surgery center. Food looks amazing and smells good too. I will definitely come back and try a burger!! Never mind customer service stinks!!!! Chips and salsa is good thou! OK so I had to go ask for my check...I told the manager of the bad service I experienced...She apologized and offered to cover my bill. I told her I was happy to pay for my order as the food was good. But she politely asked that I let her take care of it and that poor customer service is not the normal there. I thanked her....So I'm upping to 3 stars until I go back as see how the normal really is!

Not impressed. I ordered the turkey burger - which I guess, who does that at a burger joint - but I was looking for something semi-healthy, and a good turkey burger done right is pretty good! This patty was rubbery, garbage meat from Frozen Foods of America straight off the truck. To cover it up, they used a pound of shredded cafeteria iceberg lettuce. Woof. Although the portions are big, I'd rather have smaller, better quality. In addition to the crappy food, we had a crappy service. We were a party of 8, so larger table and I get that. But it took an hour (literally) for the server to take our order- after I had to go tell the hostess we were ready to order (also, they weren't busy on a Tuesday night at 7pm). And it took an hour (literally) for our food to come to the table. The atmosphere is fun, and the menu items sounded good, but I don't know that I'd go back. Not even to try the PB&J burger!

We came in on a Tuesday night a group of about 30. Our server was training a new server both girls were very attentive. Service was fast, helpful, and friendly. Food came out fast and all cooked correctly. I tried the Hawaiian Burger this time. Meat was cooked perfectly, the Pineapple Teriyaki Aioli and grilled pineapple made the burger both sweet and savory. Fries cooked nice and came out hot. Great job on everything.
Yum, yum! Food was delicious and the all day Happy Hour on a Saturday didn't suck either. Had the PB & J & Bacon burger... Ridiculous! I'll be back FOR SURE!

I went to Phoenix this weekend and my brother told me I needed to try this place. I wish I would have listened to my brother's suggestion and ordered the "Beefstro" burger. I ordered the "Mac Gnarley" burger, which was good, but not as good as some of the others. My boyfriend ordered the a pulled pork burger, that was Delicious! The Beefstro my brother ordered was apparently amazing (I didn't have the chance to try it, he eats really fast!) The salsa was pretty tasty, but I would have liked some better chips. 

The place has a fun atmosphere with mostly high top tables, there are plenty of TVs to watch sports, and our server was super sweet and helpful. 

When you go, get the fries. I had the sweet potato fries, and they were a little too sweet for my taste, and were in the tater tot style (little pops or pieces I guess). 

Oh and beer was cold. Very important. :)

Good burgers, fun menu, large portions and friendly service! I was there in a group of five, two of us were interested in Hatch burger, so we ordered larger portion (rehab size) to share - they didn't have a problem with it, brought an extra plate with the order and it looked like they actually added more fries.
Great food. The chicken wings were good. Loved the hangover burger with a fired egg, bacon, and a hatch chile. The sweet potato tots were good as well.

The burger was good but EVERYTHING was cold. Cold burger, cold fries and SLOW service. The house salad had a ton of cheap shredded cheese on it.?The key to a good burger place is to server HOT fries and a hot burger.
