Might be the best hamburger we have ever had. Great selection. We had a poblano and a hatch burger and split them to taste both. The hatch burger was very good but the poblano won out. The sauces for each were very tasty. Atmosphere is more of a bar so it's probably not what I would call a family restaurant, nor is it meant to be. Prices are reasonable and service was top notch. This was our second time there and won't be our last. Was it worth the drive from Gilbert  just for a burger? Absolutely! Have to try the mac and cheese... looks yummy.

I travel for work and always try to hit local places. Took the recommendation of the waiter to try the PB&J burger with bacon and sriracha. It was amazing. An odd combination of flavors that work. Place has a cool laid back vibe and lots TV's. I highly recommend it if you are in the area. A great find for this business traveler!!!
Great inventive burgers and love the casual laid back vibe. Customer service was great too. The tropical theme made me want to plan our next beach vacation!

I've heard from a few friends that Rehab has some of the best burgers in town. I was in Scottsdale & decided to give it a try.

The atmosphere is beach-like and I got a table outside. The menu is pretty extensive, but I decided to get the Rehab Bacon Cheeseburger with Fries & a side of Spicy Pineapple BBQ Sauce. 

The food came out and the burger was massive. It was pretty intense and I was unable to finish it. The burger was cooked medium just as I asked and had great flavor. 

I would definitely go again!

This place is awesome from The service, food, drinks, & atmosphere.  The best happy hour every day from opening til 6! Great menu options and if you are gluten-free like I am they have great tasting gluten-free items and a large variety to choose from. I ordered the byob burger on a gf bun with the pineapple bbq sauce and it was cooked exactly the way I wanted it and it tasted so good. If you are gluten-free you know how difficult eating out with your family can be and your choices can be very limited,  but not at rehab! 
Definitely try the sweet potato tots, they are amazing! The service was excellent from everyone we encountered, the hostess, the manager, the server, and the bartender. My bloody mary was perfect and my husband's beers were ice cold. The decor is very relaxed beach vibe, makes you want to hang out there all day. I'm definitely going back!
Big burgers. clean restaurant. Beers for 1.75 cents during happy hour. Andy was the bar tender he did a great job knew the menu and was proactive making sure I had everything I needed.
I had the PBJ burger like 7 months ago and it is still in my dreams. I want one so bad haha!
This place sets the bar of what a burger should look like and taste like. This place is great fries are good. The burger is the star here.
Favorite Burger Joint!! The poblano mac and cheese burger makes my arteries cringe and my tummy rejoice!

This is a great burger place! Dont get overwhelmed with the many burger/sandwich options-just give in to the idea of multiple future visits! 
The jalapeno popper burger was ok (i wish the popper had more jalapeno-less breading), but the Hangover and the ChiliCheese burger was a big hit with my family. 
Our server Cassidy was fantastic, had great food suggestions, AND makes an AMAZING caramel shake. The restaurant had pretty clever sayings on their employee shirts, which we will look into buying when they restock... i guess we are just gonna HAVE TO go back,  *sigh*

love rehab.  Found this place a couple years ago with a "group" dinner.  We have beenn going back ever since.  We love the burgers..and to be honest..the calamari is EXCELLENT..didn't think I would ever say that about a hamburger joint.  LOVE IT

Pretty good burger! The meat was really tender. Of course I asked for it rare but it tasted delicious and wasn't rubbery like some red meat tends to be. Delicious sauces they add to the burger and pretty good fries. They're very salty which I love!

This was my first time here and it was pretty good. The service was pretty slow but the food made it worth it. I used to work in the restaurant industry so service is a big deal for me. I understand if it's busy the server may be doing several tables but tonight wasn't that busy. It took over ten minutes for us to be greeted... that's pretty ridic- if you're busy at least stop by and say hey I'll be with ya in a few. Took another five min for our waters to come, then five more for drinks from bar. Once I had my ketel one I was alright tho since our burgers were ordered too. For how slow the service was I thought the food would've been slow too, but it was the opposite. It came really fast so I was happy. I had the hangover burger and man was it good. Slap any burger with a fried egg on it and I'll be sure to try it at least one time.

I haven't ate here yet, been awaiting for it to open. But after reading Kristy's review I now will totally go. Because any place that treats a bitchy lady like that, has my business. 

Will update after my official meal here.

*Update*
I stopped by here Tuesday after work for dinner. Parked in the back and walked through their sliding, automatic doors. 
This place has a great little neighborhood vibe. Greeted by a few servers and I think management who were all very pleasant and told me I could sit anywhere. 
Ended up sitting at a high top. Our sever was very quick, ordered a beer and right after management asked if we would like to see the Diamondbacks game on the tv in front of us. (Hockey game just ended), "hell yes". 
Took a look at the menu, definitely packed with all sorts of burger arrangements. I hear their pbj burger is amazing. 
But I'm stubborn and a picky eater so I went with a build my own burger. 
RARE (aka, the only way one should eat a burger/steak, up to medium rare). 
BOMB.com
Burger was juicy, and a pretzel bun. 
Needless to say, I slept like a baby after dinner. 
Can't wait to go back and try the wings.!
I really enjoyed this place. Burgers are super yummy. Atmosphere was  chill, lots of energy and people. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Try the Ghost burger.

Dinner.   Great burger.  Had the P.B.and J Bacon on pretzel bun with the sweet potato tots.  Weird combination, but was surprisingly tasty. The combo of P.B., Jelly and bacon together was a unexpected flavorfull surprise.  Tots were great.  Great bar service.  Will be back.
First time here and won't be the last. Amazing! They were out of onion rings though :( so definitely will be back to try those!

I arrived and was the third person in at opening. I was greeted very warmly. I looked around at all the cool tvs playing all types of everything except news. The decor was great. Surfer, bicycle, RC Planes and snowboarding props all around. The music was beach themed and fun. I decided to sit at bar to look at some basketball. The bartender was very friendly and knowledgeable. She let me sample a beer that I havent had before. She was very helpful in helping me decide which burger to choose. I went simple and got the huge burger with 1000 island, The MacSomething.  She upsold me to the onion rings which looked great. I also ordered the pig wings which I knew were going to be too much, but I wanted something to munch on later that night. The food arrived and looked fantastic.  I jumped in on the onion rings first, they had a nice golden brown to them. I got 5 with my order.  I picked one up and it was cold. That put a disappointed frown on my face. They were ice cold. I waved down the bartender and explained to her my problem and she said she would take care of it and get me some more. I said no problem. I decided to go to the burger next. I cut it in half and it was perfectly cooked to med-rare. Happy happy. It taste great too. You could taste the smokeyness of the fire on the meat. Darn good. I tried the pig wing, it was alright. Alittle overcooked in my opinion, but good enough. I received my onion rings and "Viola", they were the same ones I had originally except they were re-dropped into the fryer and came back dark and burnt, black on edges. Very un-cool. To the owners, is it really going to kill your food cost to re-cook 5 slices of onions? That wrecked and really affected your scoring.  I was the second person to get my food, it wasnt even busy yet. If you are having staff upsell something, make sure the product is delicious. Sounds like kitchen staff made onion rings before burger, and they sat in window along time. I made sure the bartender and, I think she was the manager or owner, see that I was not pleased with onion rings and left them in clear view. They never said anything. Kinda disappointing considering it was a upsell. By the time I was ready to leave, the place was packed. Understanding the business, I know it takes time to get check. I even stood up to get their attention and the bartender finally came over after 10 minutes and asked if I needed anything else.
Place needs 2 bartenders. The woman working cant take drink orders and food orders and then run food. She is not Superwoman, and Superwoman couldnt handle that rush either. You get bad customer service. Which I received. 
Damn good burger though. If onion ring problem didnt occur, probably would have given a 4 or 5.

Excellent burgers with an amazing selection.  I had the smaller (5 oz.) Poblano burger.  Outstanding.  Many of the burger joints that will prepare a rare burger (and many won't) do not know how to do it.  This was a rare burger - crispy on the outside, pink and chewy in the middle.  Perfect.  The much-discussed sweet potato tots were bland, but there were plenty of them.  The beer was cold, and Thursday was all-day happy hour.  Overall, this is an excellent place for an affordable and interesting burger experience.

I know it's trendy now to make a burger that has everything but the kitchen sink on it. Too big to pick up and makes a mess of everything to try, (Thanks Guy Fieri) but it just isn't for me. I ordered a burger with Thousand Island and it looked like a 55 gallon drum of Thousand Island dressinf was dumped on it. "We go big here" is what the waiter told me as I sent the inedible mess back. The service was good and staff helpful and courteous but it's a burger not a construction project.
The vibe in this place is amazing. From the music, the staff to food, this joint is the ultimate beach bar right in the heart of Old Town Scottsdale...and they do they're burgers RIGHT!

Great burgers at this joint in Scottsdale. The beef patty was cooked to perfection and they offer a nice selection of specialty burgers to choose from or just the traditional. Staff was friendly and the prices are fair. Like the sweet potato tots... Definitely try this place out if you are hungry and in mood for a burger!

Over-rated burger joint. How much can they put on a burger..or the real question is how much can they take out of your wallet and let you think that a hamburger was worth it. I had to eat outside and spent all my time shewing flies and the service was poor.

Unique place any Burger that you can think of and want it is there open atmosphere great service enjoyable music food was very good if you can think of the burger that you have in mind from a mac and cheese with jalapenos on a pretzel roll to a bacon cheeseburger with blue cheese and gouda this is your place to go ahead and check out and explore very unique area in Arizona don't sleep on it.

I would recommend that you get there early school is back in session so the college kids do crowd this around seven or eight nice stroll down Mill Street love this place make sure you continue Explorer restaurants and bars are all over everywhere.
The peanut butter and jelly burger was life changing! Mac and cheese burger was also good. Pretty cramped inside, more bar atmosphere than restaurant.

Gotta tell ya....every single time I go to Rehab Burger Therapy, I'm thrilled with my decision to go back.  From the laid-back and welcoming atmosphere; to the delicious burgers (can't find one that my friends or I don't like), to the great wait-staff (Megan was our awesome waitress on my most recent visit).....RBT is the kind of gastronomic and dining therapy I want over and over again.  

IMHO: this is the best burger place in the Valley of the Sun.

This restaurant is easily five stars. The restaurant is a good burger place. Plus this place has salads if you are a vegetarian. Also this place has really good beer, and has GREAT appetizers (chips). I would recommend this restaurant to everyone. Bomb.com!!!!!!
2nd visit there and wonderful again.  The burgers are great and the sweet potato tots are the best!  Highly recommend

There are no words about Rehab... but let me attempt anyway. This is burger nirvana. And whatever they put in that pesto voodoo sauce/aoili they serve should be illegal. 

Always a great atmosphere and the burgers are always on point! We love Rehab and always take out-of-town family to this crazy, hopping little joint where they care about their food, their customers, and their reputation. Bon vivant!
Good people good is good. I take my family here although My sister could use less burger and more  Rehab.
My favorite burger place in town.  All of the burgers are great and even their wings are amazing.

They have the best burgers anywhere in Phoenix!  Great seasoning and excellent varieties.  Very creative with flavors that I haven't seen anywhere else before.  

One drawback was cold fries.  We complained and happily got a new batch.  They were cold, too, so we just ate them.
Loved the beach vibe.  Burgers were as described with creative options as well as build your own. Yummy sweet potato tots and a generous portion. Fun outdoor patio
This. Was. Amazing!  PBJ Sriracha burger has made me look at life in a whole new way!

I had the PB and J burger with sriracha and bacon - GREAT!!!!  I have to go back now to try the sweet potato fries!  The bacon was high quality and cooked just right!!  I wish I could have had a beer with this, but had to hit the road back to Tucson.  The burger was cooked just right, and it the oozing pb and j ran onto my fries for dipping.  It had the perfect combo of sweet and spice.  Good service, nice ambiance - I kinda felt like I was on vacation on the beach - a nice desert oasis.  I want to go back and try more of the burgers - there are so many to choose from!
Love their burgers, It can get super busy but it's a sign that they are good, right? Great friendly service too

We had a wonderful dinner! The Cobb salad was fantastic. My youngest and her friend had the pbj with fries. My oldest had the alfredo. A friend of my oldest had the bacon cheeseburger. All 4 kids had chocolate shakes. We were all very impressed with the food, service, and ambience.

Excellent for out of towner. I give it a five for the food and portions.  No way could I eat the entire burger at one sitting.
The atmosphere is more relaxed casual pub which is why it only got 4 stars. Service for water was fast and as soon as we got low it was refilled.
The food did take a while to come out though.
One of the best burgers I've ever had! The mac n cheese burger was unbelievable, the poblano was equally as good and the service was incredible. Great experience!
Delicious!! Back yard  BBQ burger , bloody  Mary was on point! And the Jalapeño Popper Burger!! Mmm..

Definitely lived up to all the hype! We came here after receiving multiple recommendations. Husband got the PBJ & Bacon Burger and I got the Spicy Mac & Cheese Burger. And woah. We were blown away! Especially at the PBJ one, which was also widely recommended. It's one we would have never thought to order, but did because of how many people, including our server, told us it was amazing. My husband already had really high expectations for it, and it even exceeded those. The spicy Mac one was also delicious. Both the sweet potato tots and the fries were great - we got an order of each. Get the chipotle aioli with the tots!!! Their ranch is also really extra good. Highly recommend. Will be back! Oh, and it's also extremely reasonably priced! We were actually very pleasantly surprised by the prices. :)

Welcome to the hood! 

The place was pretty busy. Full of old people and families, which just seemed weird to me. (My neighborhood usually seems to be young adults 28-35 year olds) 

After waiting 10 minutes to get seated we were warmly greeted by our server, placed our order and waited 45 minutes for our burger. I was literally starving at this moment. The place isn't THAT BUSY.. but I'm sure they don't have a groove yet..another 15 minutes, no burger. 

LITERALLY turning into a snickers commercial..

WHY DIDNT I GO TO ZIPPS? SANTAN? I'm morphing into the crying baby next to me.. FEED ME. 

The burger comes. It's boring, cheese, medium rare like I asked..but no jalapeños, no lettuce, no tomatoes..a super lame pickle and the pretzel bread is kinda hard.. and the onion straws were burnt to a crisp..I don't mind burnt food, but would've liked more onions. *see picture*

Let's just say I'm not impressed. However, I've been to the other locations and know how good it can be..

Our server was 5 stars, but I have plenty of friends.. I came here to EAT. 

3 stars for amazing service. 
Rule for all restaurants.. Don't make me eat carbs I don't love.  

I'll give you another try. TBC..

Oh my lan. The food at this place was soooo yummy. We walked into this small, quaint place got a table and had the sweetest Hostess ever, Sarah. 

The burgers were well portioned and well priced. They all come with the option of fries, sweet potato tots, or onion rings. 

The service and food was prompt and they were really busy. 

Let's just say I loved this place. And would so come back my next trip to Scottsdale.

Rehab is by far the best burger joint in the Valley. My favorite burger there use to be the Mac and Cheese burger. Best homemade mac and cheese I have ever had until recently. They seemed to have changed the recipe because when I went there this last time it was horrible. It made me nauseous. I'll never order that again, good thing they still have a menu full of other amazing food.

The atmosphere is hip and fun. As a native of San Diego, I felt like I was home by the beach! The service was fantastic and the food good. My burger felt a little dry and flavorless but others at my table didn't have that problem so maybe I need to go medium well next time :) Oh, and their fries and ranch dressing are amazing.

Oh.....my......god. The PB&J Burger was the best burger I've ever had in my life, I think. Peanut butter, Jelly, Siracha, and Bacon on a pretzel bun with a delicious, perfectly cooked patty. I think this place will be a regular stop when I'm in the Tempe area. 
Not to mention, the service was good, and the vibe was relaxed and fun, reggae music playing loud enough to be fun, but not so loud to make conversation hard. We sat on the shaded patio and it was just great.

Rehab burger was an enjoyable atmosphere. The music featured rock ranging from The Eagles to Sublime. I enjoy the warm feeling and concept they are going for. I thoroughly enjoy a good burger. I was not particularly blown away from the meal. The French fries tasted like the oil needed to be changed in the fryer. In all fairness we didn't go out until 8pm at night: the burger was not bad just not something I was happy paying $14 bucks for. I'll attach some pics. We had the honey medium wings and they were better then the burger. The wings were not fatty, had plenty of meat on them, cooked perfectly, and tossed in a great flavor sauce. It's possible the wings set the bar too high. I chose the rehab hangover burger. This included, bacon, fried egg, 10oz patty, Colby cheese, chipotle mayo, and a very fresh flavorful hatch chili. The idea behind the burger was perfect. The execution was not there. The patty was cooked medium but had an over char to it, giving it a burnt taste, the fried egg was over cooked, I was really looking forward to bursting the yoke! The bacon was over cooked. The bun had good flavor but should have been toasted longer and was a bit tough like it had lost some of its freshness. The hatch chili had great flavor! Ultimately, I will go back on another day perhaps when it's slower to see if the execution is better. The servers and bartenders were polite and friendly.

What a fanatic fun place. Last night was the first time there. We had a party of 11 and got seated right away. Waitress was so nice and checked on us often. The food was so good. We ordered many different plates and we all where happy with the food, I  had the basic buger and it had so much flavor and the frys where great also. This place was in old town Scottsdale, love the feel of the place. Will come back again.
They have table service.

Vettes and Rods Car Club has a GREAT time at  Rehab Burger Therapy this last Sunday! Awesome food and AWESOME service! We had at least 35 members there and we could not have had a better time! MOST COOL! And - I heard a few friends say "I think we have found our new favorite place" :-) Thanks again for a great time!

This place was average. We made a trip down here to old town Scottsdale due to the great reviews. The place was very busy and we luckily got a table. The server was nice but the wait for the food to come out took a while. We had the hangover burger with sweet potato tots. The bread was not super soft. The green chilies in the burger were not spicy at all. The burger was also a bit dry and lacked flavor. The tots were really good. With all the hype and reviews we thought this place would be amazing. It was average at best. Won't be back...

Visiting Scottsdale this weekend and had the best burger ever!! The place was way over-crowded, the wait was long and the waitress had too many tables.... but the friendliness of the staff and the amazing food was worth the wait and the crowds. Gluten-Free option for one kid and the bun was delicious. Turkey burger for one kid and it actually tasted great. All fresh and homemade. We'll definitely be back on the next trip

Ok. I watched a review of this place and my friend at work dared me to try the PBJ Burger. I'm a little adventurous and did it. AMAZING!!!!! It did NOT disappoint. If you want to have fun and explore a little, they have flavor combos that really will blow you away. Try it!
Great food, casual environment and good drinks!  It gets crowded at lunch so make sure to come early.

Made it out to Rehab.  It was Friday night and it was busy.  We waited about 30 minutes and were seated inside.  Our waitress looked super high but was very nice.  She took our drink order and came back with them promptly.  Then she took our order.  

Then we waited, and waited, and waited...and... waited.   I dont know exactly how long we waited but it had to be close to an hour.  I understand you are busy but Im talking wings, fries, and burgers.  Did the blazed waitress forget our order?  Finally our food comes out.  She forgot a couple of our requests but we were so hungry we were just happy to eat something.

I had the hangover on a pretzel bun sweet potato tots and some wings.  The bun was awesome.  The burger was a good size and above average.  The hatch chile was almost flavorless.  The tots were not good.  The wings were hot, crisp, and excellent.  My wife had the hatch burger and fries.  She was not happy with her meal and couldnt even finish half of it even though we were starving.

We both agreed the food is drastically overrated and the service is poor.  So then we wait for our bill, and waited, and waited...and wait...theres our stoned waitress doing some kind of charades with another table laughing and hugging them.  We watched her for at least 15 minutes chat and visit with them.  I finally waived her over and paid and left.

I have been wanting to come here for a long time and have heard great things about it.  Maybe it was a bad night.  Maybe a bad waitress?  Maybe I ordered wrong?  I'm not sure but the food was very average.  Actually reminded me of Islands Burgers.  Both the decor and the taste but with a terrible wait time.  

If I was in the area and wanting a burger I'd consider giving it another try but its not at the level of recommendation or top burger joint at this point in my life.

I had heard such good things about Rehab, but with expensive, mediocre food and dismal service I was very disappointed with my visit.

My friend and I decided to stop here before a Giants game at nearby Scottsdale Stadium. It was totally packed and there was an estimated 20 minute wait. Not bad, we had about an hour before the game started. Once seated, we all decided on our food quickly, but no waitress was to be found. It had to be at least 15 minutes of sitting alone in our little corner table before the waitress came. I ordered the smaller relapse backyard BBQ burger. 20 minutes later we finally had our food. By the time we had finished our meal and paid the check, we were late to the game. 

The food was bleh. No flavor, my burger was cooked well-done when I had asked for medium. The spicy pineapple BBQ sauce was gross. Whoever thought of that flavor combo should be fired. It just didn't work. The onion ring on the burger was soggy. The fries were bland as well. My friend wasn't happy with his bacon cheeseburger either. His burger too was overcooked and flavorless. For the quality of food we were served, we way overpaid. Our total was around $35 for two people. 

We came to Rehab thinking we could: A. Save some money, by eating before the game. and B. Have a great burger. Neither of those things happened. We should've just had eaten at the game. Maybe they had an off day, but I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.
This was a great experience.  The beer was excellent the menu and burgers were great.   Service was fantastic.   Try the mac and cheese burger. It is great

So just got back from "Therapy" I'm cured! That Mac an Cheese with bacon, and siracha  burger was killer! So freaking good and our waiter / bartender Andy says the PBJ burger is even better. So next time I'm all in on that. My wife had the Philly cheese steak burger and loved it also. The beer was nice and cold and Andy was super helpful, we can't wait to go back.
Saw it.  Tried it.  Probably won't go back.  Bacon cheeseburger was a 4 out of 5. Big. and burger was cooked well.   Bacon was burnt.  Fries were sub par.  Server was pretty good.  Cool atmosphere.

This is an outstanding burger place! I looked up best burgers in Scottsdale on Yelp & Trip adviser. They suggested Rehab Burger! Let me tell you this is an awesome hamburger restaurant! Waitress are awesome, service is outstanding! Loved everything! Wide choice of burgers! Casual dress, mix of people. My husband ordered the blue cheese burger, that is infused with blue cheese, ordered extra blue cheese on top, I ordered the hatch burger, yummy! Will definitely go back!

Rehab burger needs to go to rehab.... All these great reviews but I don't know, are these people to drunk to notice that there's a lot of things going wrong because of it being close to old town maybe it's the liquor and they just don't care about anything. Well I was fully sober coming into this place. The girl upfront is clueless let's just say that I really don't want to be mean but they really hired a girl who doesn't know anything about a simple job of "Hi welcome to Rehab burger! How many do you have with you?? Would you like to be seated outside or inside???" I walk in and she was busy so she tells me she will be right there to help me when she's done so instead of blocking the door because the desk is right in front of the door and it being such a tight place I walked outside thinking she will help me. Two other people walk in and the girls at her desk just waiting.. So I'm like okay I guess she's don't doing what she's doing so after the people in front of are done I walk and she doesn't even take me before them which one makes no sense and she tells me 25 minutes of wait.... I perfectly see 3 tables open.. She also had a low voice so she mumbles and you have to ask her a couple times to repeat herself. She just shouldn't be doing that job I guess it's so hard to do (Sarcasm) so she said 25 minutes my friends getting mad because he sees the tables himself but I say I bet it won't take 25 minutes and he agrees. So we wait outside and she calls the other group in 5 minutes and us in 10 minutes and those tables still being empty she asks me if we wanted to sit at the community table.. I think that should of been a question before us waiting because there were multiple open spots so we took them we didn't even care. We sat and our waitress was very nice and was quick I give her props she should maybe switch positions with the other girl but I think that would make it worse i would probably order a cheese burger and get no cheese and she would probably ask me if I wanted cheese after getting the cheeseburger I ordered... Sorry for the joke let's put all jokes aside. I ask the girl what's the most popular and what's your favorite and to both of those was the Peanut butter jelly Sriracha sandwich. So hey why not let's try it.. One, way to much peanut butter that you can't taste the burger meat.. So what's the point of the meat?? And I didn't even taste Sriracha either it had no spice to it at all.. Maybe less peanut butter so we can enjoy the meat because if not just serve it with just toast. My fries were also cold with it being busy should I have fresh fries?? I was really confused. The prices are good the waitress was cool but the burger I got recommended was kinda disappointing..  And the girl in front just needs to find something else to do maybe make sense.. Next time I come here I'll make sure I'm drunk.
I split the Donut Burger & PB&J sriracha burger with sweet potatoe totts OMG!!! Amazing!

I was stoked to check out Rehab--I'd heard really great things about it from a handful of people, it's close to my house, and they offer happy hour every day for those jabronies who work M-F, 9-5 (don't worry, I'm definitely one of these jabronies). But the experience as a whole was pretty underwhelming. 

So to begin with, Rehab is on a pretty busy corner of Mill. Totally fine, and not at all a complain, just something to note if you're planning on driving. The restaurant itself is pretty spacious, with a huge bar, plenty of inside tables, and a sizable patio--bonus points for tons of TVs so you can shout at your favorite sports team from wherever you're seated. 

We came here late afternoon on a Saturday, so it wasn't very busy at all. In fact, there seemed to be equal number of patrons and employees in the building. We were immediately seated and our drink orders taken pretty quickly; all standard stuff. But then our waiter didn't come back to take our food orders for probably another 15 minutes. Would've been fine and understandable if they were busy, but they definitely were not at all. After placing our food order, it didn't come out for another 40 minutes. What? It's a couple o' burgers. Again, would've made sense if they were slammed, but we were one of a dozen tables in there. Our server was very nice, but overall we were pretty disappointed by the lack of attention... And we are not typically people who want a whole ton of chattin' with our servers. 

As for the burgers themselves, they were fine. I had the Mac Gnarly, a pretty simple burger in comparison to the rest of the menu, but I was feelin' it. I got the relapse (smaller) size because I am a small human, and it was still a ton of food for me. And super messy, but I can't hold my lack of grace against Rehab. It was a perfectly fine burger, just nothing particularly special. I feel like if I'm ever going to pay $10+ for a burger, I'm expecting it to knock my socks off. It was just fine. And a little bit closer to well done than my request for medium doneness, but that's not a huge deal. The fella had the Know Poblano on a gluten free bun. He had a pretty similar summation of it: perfectly fine, but not mind-blowing. He did, however, say it was one of the better gluten free buns he's ever had. 

I will say that I really enjoyed the fries. Seasoned, but not too salty, and very crispy but still with a good amount of potato in there, they were very tasty. Pro tip: dip 'em in dat chipotle mayo. The sweet poTOToes were also tasty, and I don't generally care for them. 

Overall, we were just expecting more from Rehab. Maybe we just happened upon an off day for them, but it's hard not to be a little bummed to pay a little more than standard for a burger that's a little lacking. At this price point, I'll be sticking to Cold Beer and Cheeseburgers.

After reading all of the reviews, I had high expectations of the food and what a disappointment. First, the good. The ambience is fun, good vibe. The food was disappointing. We had chicken wings with sauces on the side, as recommended by the waitress. The sauces were good. The BBQ hamburger on brioche bun was supposed to come with onion rings, cheese and BBQ sauce. There was one huge onion ring (too big for the burger and not flavorful),  the cheese was a little sprinkle of grated cheese (next to none), sweet potato tater tots which were flavorless.  All the food lacked seasoning. Too many good restaurants in Scottsdale to go back.

2 thumbs up! Our server, Tina was great! I am on a continuous quest for the best , according to me, hamburger. I wasn't sure which direction I was going to go in and Tina directed me to the Hangover burger. Perfect! I always like my burgers rare and again perfect.
Definitely within my top 5 burgers. Thanks
The Rehab "Hangover" burger is awesome. Cool spot and super friendly staff! You won't be disappointed whatsoever.

Best burger I have ever eaten!  Wasn't brave enough to try the pb&j, but the Hawaiian was excellent. Perfectly cooked, soft pretzel bun, good fries and great staff. Loved it!  Will definitely come back next time I'm in the area.
I give 5 stars for a reason. Everything I've ever had at Rehab is like a party in my mouth.

Once again a visit to burger rehab therapy. The best food the best service. Thank you Roco for once again the best service ever. Not a glass went dry, when the kids are taken care of first and fed fast. Everyone left happy and full. I've never had a bad meal and there were 16 off us and like I said we were well taken care of. And the food was amazing as always. Peanut Butter and jelly burger, chili burger, mushroom and Swiss, bacon burger, quesadilla, Mac and cheese and a spicy Mac and cheese burger, fish and chips. Sweet potato tots, onion rings, French fries.  That's how my friends from Colorado roll .  Yum

Tina was my ideal server (friendly and attentive but not overbearing). The place is clean. The weekend special Philly burger with ghost pepper jack cheese was spectacular. My girlfriend (EXTREMELY picky) ordered the bacon bleu burger and loved it. My only complaint was a 20 min wait (packed house). Bravo Rehab Burger!

Based on reviews I was excited to try this place out. You can't really go terribly wrong with a burger. The menu is great. I like when places think outside the box with their food. My man ordered the Mac N Cheese Burger... He was less than thrilled the Mac N Chz was cold and the burger just was. I ordered the PBJ & bacon burger. You have to be adventurous but I like that stuff. It was again just ok. Nothing spectacular. Maybe because it was cold or maybe because they messed up our buns. The chips and salsa were pretty good. I can't get overly thrilled about it. Would I come back? Possibly just to try something else but I would split it with someone because the price is not worth the food.

This place is very good.  The burgers are fat and juicy with unbelievable brioche or pretzel buns!

The bar is kinda small but has great craft beer.  I love the decor which has funky old radios and TVs with a DVD playing of a fish tank!

YES. This place was great. Big juicy burger with a bunch of great fixings. I had the BBQ burger and their sauce was excellent. Service was great and this place was packed. If I'm ever out here again, I'll be back!

This place is officially too crowded and food quality is suffering. A recent burger eaten by dining companion was greyish, looking more fast food color than fresh meat color. My pasta dish also suffered from under seasoning and not enough alfredo flavor. Seems like every tourist that still remains in Scottsdale is trying to eat at this tiny restaurant.

To start with,  the hostess and server were very attentive.  Server knew his beer list well. I ordered the jalapeno popper burger and it was delicious.  I'm loyal to a burger place back home so it's difficult for me to order burgers elsewhere.  This was worth it. Burger was cooked perfectly, spiced well and delicious.  The sweet potato tots were very good too. Fast service and great food.  Would definitely recommend to others.

Oh burger! Came in and sat at the bar on a Sunday evening. There was baseball on TV and burgers to eat.
The PB &J burger. I was a little skeptical of how this was going to be but with the umami of the beef and bacon and the sweetness of the peanut butter and jelly it was such a surprisingly amazing combo. The only thing I wish they had done was have a better separation between the peanut butter and the pickle. Not my favorite combo in the world.

The hatch burger with a turkey patty was also a great combo.

Try the home made mustard!

Great burger place right in old town. It has a nice patio and it's not that big, but it was packed. I got the 10oz hang over burger with sweet potato tots and had to add the corn on the side as it looked amazing and it was good. The atmosphere is very cool with bikes hanging from the ceiling and cool signs all over the place. I highly recommend this place.

GREAT food!

Had the bacon cheeseburger, sweet potato tots, and pork.  Killer awesome food!!!  I will definitely be going back to this place!

got it to go and the food was still super yummy, bacon not soggy, etc.

can't go wrong here!!!

Rehab Burger Therapy helped me turn over a new leaf. It honestly changed my life!

My name is Bobbi Billard and I was a Boring-aholic. I went to the same restaurants and I ordered the same thing every time. I was about as vanilla and predictable as it gets. And then I went to Rehab Burger Therapy and expanded my horizons. Mind blown! BOOM! 

What?!? You mean there is a place where you can go to that actually combines a burger with bacon and adds some oooey gooey peanut butter and grape jelly with sriracha sauce to it (PBJ & Bacon Burger) and you will try it out and not only will you not get sick, but instead you'll think it is out of this world AMAZING? Like it will become the stuff you dream about and can't get out of your head, until you go back and partake in it again? No flippin way, guy! I'm "Same Girl"! I go to the same places and order the same thing, every time, like a broken record... I'm scared to venture off the beaten path. I may get lost and never find my way home. Yep, I was a real snoozefest! *Zzzzzzzz!*

It took a little coaxing for them to get me to realize the errs of my ways & maybe it was the fact that I was feeling adventurous because I was on vacation, but once I got on the same page as these people, my life, as I once knew it, was never going to be the same! I've seen the light! This place was so magical that pigs can even fly here. Im not kidding! Order the Pig Wings and you'll see for yourself. 

No going back to Boringville now. All it took was a little trust and faith and I've forever changed, 100% for the better. I am no longer "Same Girl" and I'm now a recovering Boring-aholic. Admitting that I was one was the first step. I owe many thanks to John (the bartender) and Rehab Burger Therapy. Special shoutout to the other Yelpers for suggesting this place and what to order in the first place! Jon... Black 13! It's on! See ya soon dude! And THANK YOU for saving me from my boring ol' self!!!!!!

Wow! The food was amazing! Peanut butter and jelly burger with bacon (sounds gross) was amazing! The salad we had was even better.... Wish I remembered the name of it. But it had tortilla strips and chicken and a whole lotta goodness! Can't wait to go back!

I'm so glad I gave Rehab Burger another try after my less-than-stellar experience on my 24th birthday. 

This time, I came during peak dinner time on a Friday, and I went again on a Saturday for their special maple bacon donut burger! Both times we were served without a hitch. We had great customer service and I was really REALLY happy with my food. Their sweet potato tots are so good and I love that you can order TONS of sauce.

I am meticulously checking their social media to see if there are any fun special burgers coming up, because I don't want to miss out! They usually have a special or unique burger that's only available on Saturday/Sunday. (I learned the hard way that they don't serve the special burger on Fridays... hence the reason I went 2x in one weekend, lol!)

The only thing I noticed going two days in a row is that their rare/medium rare cooking is a little inconsistent. On Friday, the medium rare was already a little bloody. But on Saturday, the medium rare was different. Just something my boyfriend noticed. (I got rare both times and had no complaints.)

I also wish they validated parking!

Stopped by here on an early Sunday evening. Placed was pretty packed, however they managed to get us a corner table. Burgers were delicious but they really should season their offerings just a bit more. My burger was a bit under seasoned as was my son's mac and cheese. All in all, I would come back to this place. Bonus points to our waitress who brought us milk for my son in a styrofoam cup with a lid, and didn't fill the damn cup all 24oz!! So my son was actually able to eat his dinner without filling up on milk.

Great food and drinks!  The service was a bit slow but our waitress was extremely nice and the place was packed.  My burger was well prepared and delicious.  The fries are tasty and the sweet potato tater tots are interesting (eat 'em with the spicy ketchup).  It's quite loud but it's a great atmosphere.

I have eaten lots of burgers in my travels, and I have to say that Burger Rehab Therapy is one of the best I have ever had. The meat is fresh, seasoned and cooked perfectly, the buns are fresh and soft, the toppings are fresh and the service is great. This is the burger that I will forever judge all burgers by. The other patrons are very friendly too. Lots of burger knowledge in this place.

Holy Schnikees this place ROCKS!!! The burgers are a dream, the atmosphere was fun and they have a great beer selection. The manager checked in and made sure we had a good time. Servings, sauces and selection give this 5 stars! Solid!!!

I stumbled on this place as I was in Scottsdale for business. Didn't have a taste for burgers but wanted to swing by because of the high ratings. I'm pretty adventurous, so to see a menu filled with all kinds of burger combinations I'd never seen or experienced peaked my interest more. I ordered to PB&J burger with sweet potato tator tots. The burger, to my surprise was pretty good. I really didn't know what to expect but I'd definitely recommend to a friend. It's one of those things that you loved while in the moment but wouldn't try again, like Mardi Gras, lol. The only reason I gave this place 4 stars instead of 5 were the employees at the bar (2 men) where I was sitting. Let's just say they were way more attentive to the hot blonde sitting 4 seats down to pay the other folks at the bar much attention.

Went here last night. They didn't seem busy - however our waitress stopped by at most twice. Didn't ask how anything was, if she had, we would have showed her the medium burger that came out absolutely undercooked and mentioned that I didn't really care for my meal either. I would give 0 stars but that's not an option.
I had the Hatch Burger and Spicy Mac and Cheese Burger. Great food but the service is a little slow.
Love this place!!!!!! awesome food especially if youre hungover...

Our waitress was awesome... The burgers are awesome and huge.  Definitely get the burger on the pretzel bun.  French fries and sweet potato tots are both good, hard to choose between the two.  Adventurous burger combinations, someone let me know when they try the one with PB&J.    One plus to their beer selection they have a tasty Maui coconut porter, which isn't as gross as you may think.  Nice and stout with a hint of the coconut, add a shot of Vanilla Stoli to give it a bit of a flavor and alcohol boost.

Thanks to Yelp we found this little gem and oh boy! My husband's medium rare burger was perfect and my Wedge Salad with grilled chicken was piled high - crisp and fresh, it was too big to finish! 

For a family of 3 to dine for under $50 was great!
Never had a bad meal here. Every burger is an art. 2 people can be full from a burger. So watch your potion size. Mac cheese burger is to die for :)

I really want to like this place, having seen a couple restaurants come in and out of the building. It looks kind of like the Bonfire did inside (previous restaurant), but it has a surfer vibe, and upbeat atmosphere. 

My boyfriend ordered a standard cheese burger, and I had a green salad and garlic bread because I wanted to eat light. My boyfriend eats A LOT of burgers, it is one of his favorite foods, and when he got the burger the bun on the bottom was soggy. As he checked out the sog, I helped myself to some of his fries, which weren't piping hot. It made me suspect that the burger had sat for awhile before they brought it (note to owners). 

My salad was pretty standard, I mean, I did order a green salad so what should I suspect? But, the one thing was that I felt they could have done was sliced the tomatoes. I could tell the tomatoes were the same ones that they used on the burgers, and they just cut them in half, meaning that I had to cut them into tiny pieces myself. I also thought that the cucumbers could have used a chop too. I would suggest cutting the cucumbers and tomatoes into smaller bite sized pieces to make a better salad since that is one of the only fresh/healthy things on the menu. On the first bite of the burger my boyfriend said it was good, but 3 bites later he said something tasted funny and he was not happy. We think it was the onions. He didn't finish the burger. 

I might give this place another try, but I am not sure...
The Mac and cheese burger was fantastic. I highly recommend it! The service was attentive and the restaurant has a cool beachy vibe

The burgers here are absolutely outstanding. Definitely give the Sweet Potato Tots a try. The tap is a bit small for my taste (I'm a beer guy), but there's enough available that you can find what you're looking for. We'll be coming back.

Had the backyard bbq burger (pineapple bbq, onion ring, cheese) which was amazing. It is served with a choice of side and I chose Jamaican sweet corn also delicious. Also had Philly cheeseburger the best Philly cheese steak in AZ. Cannot wait to come back and try other burgers and bring the rest of the family and friends. Nice island vibe. Should play ialoharadio.com even better.

The whole experience was terrible from the food to the waitress. We sat outside and waited 15 minutes till Arrow our waitress came out to take our order. Once the food came out everything was cold so we didn't even get to enjoy. She didn't check on us one time after we finished eating so we just sat there until I went in an asked for the bill. I waited another 5 minutes till I went back in and saw her cleaning her tables. I went to the bar and had the bartender print the receipt. I wish I could of enjoyed the experience

I believe I have went once or so but I order a hot dog with fries and just eat that plain. No complains just a simple girl- simple order. No condiments, no likey. Customer service could be a little better, mostly getting distracted or just busy but overall great.

I have been here twice and both times have been great. They really have a nice service staff & very Attentive! Food is pretty good as well! They seem to be always busy but super glad you are there with them. Well done!
I really enjoyed rehab burger. The quality of the meat is excellent and their burgers are HUGE.  Service is excellent! If you're ever in ritzy Scottsdale I recommend trying Rehab burger.
Great spot for AMAZING burgers. You can dress super casual, even wear flip flops. Thanks Dave for such good service

I attempted to dine-in but the wait time to be seated was insane. Figured that was a good sign of how tasty the food was so I ordered a Hawaiian burger (rehab size) to go with a side of sweet potato tots. I wandered around town until it was ready, about 20 minutes later. Took the burger back to my hotel. It was HUGE. I'm embarrassed to say I ate the entire thing in one sitting. Super juicy, and the aioli on the side was amazing. The tots were a bit soggy...was like eating fried mush. Also, this experience cost me somewhere around $12-14. A little spendy. But, it was an awesome, juicy burger. Would do a relapse size next time.

This place is great!  Fantastic burgers with a hip atmosphere, reminiscent of "Hodad's" of ocean beach, ca. Not because of the hundreds of different burgers, but because of the decor, etc. 

I would say this is the second best burger joint I've ever been to. Number one being Hodad's, and number three being the old Bobcat Bite that used to be in Santa Fe, nm. 

My favorite items are the relapse green chile burger, the street corn, and the onion rings.  Definitely try the pretzel roll buns.

Always fresh, cooked right, and great service, even when it's packed. 

(I hear they may be opening a second location...  lets hope!)

Omg omg I can't wait to try everything on the menu! They have some very interesting burger combinations that are worth going out of your comfort zone to try! I highly recommend trying the pb&j burger.. sounds gross but seriously just try it before you judge. I was surprised surprised at how weirdly good it was. Also the chili burger... YES! And lastly the mac and cheese burger... So. f'ing. GOOD! I'm afraid ill never be able to order anything else ever again haha. Try this place! Large portions, nice service, comfortable atmosphere and delicious food!

Place to go if your hungry. Huge burgers that are actually cooked to perfection.  Wings were so delicious we could not stop eating them (Smoky BBQ) I love the turkey burger with side salad and rita. This place was a bit challenging to locate but defiantly worth the drive. Our server did a stellar job as we sat on the patio and enjoyed our Labor Day Weekend. 
Patio with mist-
Dress is casual-
Kid Friendly-

Rehab Burger Therapy is all about the Southern California, beachy, laid-back surfer vibe in the middle of Downtown Scottsdale, AZ complete with palm tree and surfboard-esque decor- which is cute. I mean, they tried it. Overall, I felt that everything was "fine." The 5oz Relapse bacon cheeseburger is a good portion size for me to share and it was pretty standard in terms of taste. Nothing I have to run back to have again. Their fries were very good and they had a little bit of seasoning which I appreciated. Probably the best thing I had. Overall, this place is A-OK, but nothing I'd rush out to take friends to. But they do have off-brand Jawbreakers at the door when you leave.
Had the jalapeño popper burger and the Jamaican corn ! Delicious ! Will definitely be returning , service was great and good amazing !

Wow! Truly an incredible burger! Visiting from California and came across this place on yelp and had to check it out. I'm so glad I did because it did not disappoint! I ordered the Porkster burger and added deep fried jalapeños. Was loaded with bbq pulled pork, so much I was glad I ordered it with the relapse (5oz) patty. This was the perfect sweet/spicy burger I was looking for! Awesome house made bbq sauce to match. Would definitely be back if I was looking for the best burger spot. Cool vibe as well but super busy. Get their early to put your name in.

Best place ever. We try and eat here once a week. Love sitting out on the patio. Food is great and the service is even better. The owner is there often and you can truly tell they care. Really fun place.

An overdue 5 mo old  review. The place was chill & relaxed, fun decor, frart music, & the service was excellent. Attentive & fast. Good selection of beers & The burgers! Oh so delicious, the exboyfriend & I both agreed it was one of the best burgers we both had in awhile. I can't recall the name of the ones we ordered, I remember one had peanut butter. Yes. Peanut butter! Don't knock it until u try it! The pb just added another taste level to the already tasty pretzel bread bread & flavorful juicy beef burger. Along with the onion rings ...oh my.  I wish this was in my state near my house so I could get my once a month burger fix. I have yet too find a place that delivers one so scrumptious.

Great burger and great service!  We had 4 people that ordered a different burger and they were all cooked perfectly to order and tasted great!  Staff was fun and kudos to Aurturo for the awesome blue cheese sauce!

LOVE LOVE LOVE the food, the vibe and the crowd this joint reels in! Out of 7 visit, this is the only time I dealt with impatience, mostly because of how short staffed they were for Friday around 3:30ish. My server forgot a couple of requests I put on my order, and it took a good 15 minutes to get his attention because he was so occupied with every other party in the room. There was one server taking care of the entire floor, literally (besides the bar). It was unfortunate for the server cause he was bustin his balls, and for my tummy because I waited for my extra add on before eating! My only suggestion would be extra staff on Fridays. Cause I know this place gets packed every Friday, better to be prepared with more staff than having one guy run the show!
The PBJ and bacon burger is by far the best burger I have ever had. Sounds weird but worth the try for sure. Great prices and great service too.

This place was great.  They went above and beyond to make sure we have a great experience and made sure our drinks were always full.  Burgers were great as well as the drinks and service.  Love the drinks.  Drinks were great.  Have to get more drinks.  And burgers more burgers.  They should make a burger drink shake.  That would be a drink I would get.  Love the drinks here.

And two hours later after my dinner I cannot move from my bed. Not for any other reason that I am completely full and satisfied with the meal I had tonight here at RBT. 

OUr server was perfectly attentive with the right amount of chill, so we felt comfortable in a new place. We were five seconds away from happy hour ending and he let us sneak in our orders so we could knock a few bucks off the bill, score! 

To start we shared the chicken chile lime dip, I think it was called. So good and spicy. Their homemade tortilla chips were really great too. 

I ordered the hangover burger with the sweet potato tots and my man ordered the porkster burger. Thank goodness we ordered the smaller, five ounce ones, because we hardly finished what we got. I wasn't crazy about the tots, but  I did enjoy the sauces that were brought out with them. 

Major props to our server and this place for standing out in this town.
Fantastic burger and sweet potato tots. My only complaint is that I wish they had a bigger beer selection. It has great service too. Very happy I found this place.

Kay, is the best! I've never heard of this place and so me and my friend decided to try it out, absolutely one of the best hamburger joint ever, every bite into everything they have to offer is nothing short of amazing.

Fantastic burger? Sure. 
Great atmosphere? Absolutely. 
Friendly wait staff? Yes sir. 

We enjoyed our meals. I had the No Poblano Burger "rehab 10oz" and fries. She had the turkey burger with onion rings. Both meals were delicious! 

We were engaged in great conversation with our server, Devon, (a local AZ). I am glad we were here before the spring training crowd, because I doubt we'd get the chance to talk. 

We will be back to try another burger ASAP!

2nd and last visit to Rehab.  Horrible service and average food. All 3 meals were delivered with mistakes- none of which were addressed. I'd only come here to have a drink and enjoy the music. You can get a comparable burger at Denny's or much better at Hop Doddy, Shakeshack, or zinburger at a similar price.

Pleased to help this place edge closer to 1,000 great reviews.  And it was the reviews that drew us here, although we were a little suspicious at first.  Next door to a pawn shop?  Check.  On the very outer edge of Old Scottsdale?  Check.  Looks like a bar room?  Check.  Twenty to thirty minute wait on a Tuesday evening even though it looked like there were some empty tables left?  Check.  Would we be disappointed??  NO!  It was FANTASTIC!  Our waitress was very attentive and the food was all great.   The onion rings were some of the best we have had and the burgers were cooked perfectly.  I had the chili cheeseburger and my husband had the bacon cheeseburger.  The sweet potato tots are delicious, as are all of the various dipping sauces they offer.    Caution:  the burgers come in two sizes.  Do not overestimate the size of your appetite.  We both brought a good chunk of our meals home, too stuffed to continue.

Visited again and again.
Rehab Burger is my favorite. 
Had the PB&J burger and as weird as it sounds... It is perfect. The sweet and savory complimented each other perfectly. 

I also tried for pesto sauce for my tots and it was amazing. Another plea... Sell your sauces by the bottle! I'll be your number one customer.

4.5 stars
So we arrived here for lunch after getting off a plane from Detroit.  With surfboards on the wall and TV's with videos of the beach looping on flat-screen TV's, it felt like we had landed in Hawaii and not the middle of the desert! Loved the open-wall style of the restaurant, so you could eat inside but still feel warm breezes. 

Hawaiian and Know Poblano Burgers were tasty.  Almond vodka margarita was strong and helped to reinforce the island theme.  :)  Chipotle aioli was fantastic with the fries.  Sweet potato tots tasted like fried bits of sweet potato pie (too rich for me, and I have a sweet tooth).  I'd recommend if you get a smaller burger ("relapse" portion) you make sure to get it medium-rare or rare, not medium, if you like your burger juicy.  Service was somewhat slow at the early side of the lunch rush on a Friday (40 min or so to get food).  Our server was attentive and did a good job with recs.

Very good food! Sweet potato tots are to die for! I was looking forward to trying a burger that I has seen on yelp in a picture, to find out that it is a Sunday special only, but the pulled pork that burger that I did get was amazing, I had a yummy lunch the next day too! Service was good, I was surprised by their uniforms or spaghetti strapped belly shirts, but I guess that is what adds uniqueness to an establishment. The place was packed, so obviously they are doing something right. Very upbeat establishment, but parking was hard to come by.

Burger quality is great and these things are massive. I ordered a 5oz but was brought, and charged for, a 10oz.  If you have a normal-person appetite, split the 10oz with someone for a reasonably priced meal.  The fries were pretty awful though. They should be hot and crispy; these were not. Sweet potato tots also seemed like they had been sitting out for a while. I like my tots with extra crunch. The beach setting was a bit forced and over-the-top...cmon you're sitting in the middle of the desert! Put some good games on the screens instead of electronic fish swimming around.

Burger was delicious , add pretzel bun ! Well worth it! Although it was a Saturday night at 7:00 pm and  the kid working the front told us it would be an hour plus wait and it wasn't . Either people left or he underestimated . But we were seated pretty quick.

Oh so good. HUGE burgers with any twist you'd like. I often do the grilled chicken sandwich which is on amazing bread, or the grilled portobello (Veggie Noogie). If you get a salad instead of fries, you might as well call it two salads, as the sandwiches have loads of veggies too! Fantastic stuff. Biggest drawback is the place is always packed. Tip...Ask to sit along the rail on the outside patio. That's up for grabs and you can sit immediately! Works fine for 2-3 people. Patio heaters make it very comfortable during the colder months. Love it.

Great burgers and great service. I got the mac and cheese burger and boy was it a monster! I loved it and even though I got the relapse, there was no way I was finishing it. My friend got a regular cheese burger and it was very simple (lettuce, tomato, cheese, etc) and she couldn't finish her's either. . And we're big eaters. We visited on a Tuesday night and the place was packed. Definitely coming back soon!

Ok, if you are looking for something healthy here just don't. That being said , one of the best burgers I've ever had!  I got the Porkster and it was insane. BBQ on top of the patty, inside a delicious pretzel bun with sweet potato tots on the side. Pretty sure my life expectancy dropped 5 years after eating it but I would do it again tomorrow. Every bite of everything I ate was heavenly.  Definitely give it a try! I didn't give it a 5 because nobody is perfect but it's very close for what it is!

Really good burgers in Old Town Scottsdale. We went on a Wednesday night so it was full but not long wait times. My Backyard BBQ burger was great. My wife's salad was enormous. Don't need appetizers, and you will leave most of potatoes.

I had the PB & J with bacon and Sriracha burger and much to my surprise it worked pretty well. No lack of flavor there or on any of their other options from what I could tell. You would have to go in with a serious appetite to finish the rehab size burger but the relapse size was about right - hearty but not so big that you feel sick when you are done. Another thing they did well was the aioli sauces. Creative but not overboard.

I went here based on a recommendation from a friend. I had the bacon and blue burger with fries. The pretzel bun was very good. The burger was average, but the other burgers on the menu sounded good, too. I will go back to try the others.

I've gotta say...this place is pretty good! Huge burgers and the sweet potato tots are to die for! 
Great causal beachy vibe! I had the mike tai (pretty strong) and the bacon and blue burger on a pretzel bun! 
Great quick service!

This one place I've seen & heard about for some time. I was nervous that the experience would not live up to the hype... But they definitely did. 

The rather small space made for an awkward wait in the door way... But the hostess was insanely friendly and answered any questions we had while waiting. 

There were 3 different meals ordered. First mine was the PB&J bacon burger with sweet potato tots. I have to say that the tots were awesome, and dipped in their teriyaki pineapple aoli made them a perfect side. I highly recommend that combo. The burger was delicious. Sweet, spicy, salty & nutty. I personally loved it... But I know not all will step out of their box for this kind of burger. It was juicy and messy just like a burger should be. I ordered the small which was a 5oz patty and couldn't even eat half. The Ghost burger (10oz) & regular fries were yummy... The best part about the Ghost burger was the generous melted gooey cheese & avocado. I don't know what sorcery they used to make the huge burger stay together & stacked when eating.. But that was great. The fries good, but nothing special in my opinion. The last meal a large Mac Gnarly burger and Jamaican corn. The corn was delicious... But for me it needed more of the seasoning blend & salt. The burger had a great 1000 island dressing, messy, delicious.. And again stayed together very well for a huge burger. 

I'm definitely going back and if you're looking for a great burger check them out.

Man, is this place good. We found them because of a Living Social or Groupon coupon (I don't remember which) and we've been back at least a dozen times. We've tried most of their burgers, and they are to die for. We've never had a bad experience!
Great ambience & really cool & fun burger selection.If you wanna feel like your by the beach in Az this is the place for you! Good service great burgers!
Food is bomb, but so one needs to tell Aaron it's not the customers fault he hates his life #gtfoh
The burgers are awesome. They have so many unique options and all the ones we have tried so far are great!!! The service is always good. Their sweet potato tots are Amazing!!

The staff is amazing! 
The food is to die for! 
The ambiance is so fun! 
Best Burgers in town, best service around!!!!
Best burger  & great sides !!!!  Huge and crazy selection like peanut butter & jelly burger.  Nummm!
Very good burger, had bacon and blue burger on Pretzel bread. I usually don't eat many buns, but had all of this one. Had a Pale Ale with it. All Good!

Hangover & Porker burger so good !! perfect sweet tater tots Awesome Burgers !!! 
Burgers are around $10 a plates ....fries included  :)

Seriously the best burger in Phoenix. HUGE portions! It's like two meals in one, so well worth the price. Even on their busiest days the service is fast and friendly. It's in a great location in old town, lots of parking!
I ate at rehab! It was fantastic! Nicole was my server and she was absolutely the best! I had a great time and I will be back to see her again!

Tried after reading reviews on yelp for burger places.

It was good, not amazing, but good.

The Mac Narly burger is a spin on a Big Mac, I give it a 3 out of 5. It's got nothing on Culinary drop outs Mac burger.

The onion rings were to heavily battered as I tasted the flour.

The chicken, dip,cheese , soup was ok, like soup with tortilla chips, mah.
Two words- the best!  Sweet potatoe tots with cajon mayo dip awesome!

After months of hearing about this place, we finally got tinted it this past weekend with some friends.
The wait was quite long, on a Saturday night in March, during spring training, we waiting an hour.  After getting anxious, hungry, and a little hangry, we finally got seated.
Obviously a burger is what we ordered.  Our table ordered the PBJ burger, which had a nice blend of peanut butter, grape jelly, and siracha...and bacon.   We also ordered jalapeño popper burger and a build you own breakfast burger.
The burger itself is a quality piece of meat that hasn't been frozen.  This is one of the best burgers in Arizona, and trust me when I say that I have tried a lot of burgers.
I was a little hesitant, but orders the sweet potato tots...they were nothing short of amazing!
I'm already planning our next trip here...I can't wait!!

Friendly staff. The burger was kind of dry. We ordered the hangover rehab and asked for medium rare but got medium.   We also ordered the chips and salsa with the guac.  The quac was under seasoned.  I had to add more salt to it.  The salsa was spicy but was pretty good.  

I give it a 3.5.

Disappointing.  Medium rare burgers requested were Cooked VERY well done.  I even considered returning it (which I've never done before) but it took 25 minutes for us to get it in the first place (no wonder it was so dry!) and my stomach was already  grumbling.   The service overall was okay but one weird thing was the waitress ran up to us when our mouths were full and said "how's the first bites? Delicious? Okay!" And then walked away before we could say anything.  Maybe we came on an off day but it seems like they are just hiding poorly cooked burgers with a lot of fancy toppings.  I want to add a pro so I'm not just being negative because the staff was nice:  very dog friendly patio, we had 3 different servers bring us water bowls for the pup.
We love Rehab burger the burger are always great tasting and the sweet potato fries a great compliment. My wife and daughter's favorite is the peanut butter and jelly with sriracha.

I have been waiting to try out Rehab Burger! Food and service was fantastic. I came with some friends for happy hour before a spring training game and we had a fabulous time. Drinks were awesome!! And apps were great also. We split the fries, chips and salsa, as well as quesadilla. Can't wait to come back and try more!!
Best burgers in Arizona! Can't go wrong with the jalepeno popper burger with a pretzel bun

I love this place! If I lived closer I would be there all the time! Doesn't matter if you get a salad or a burger, you never leave hungry. Very relaxing with a wonderful staff. Even the regulars go out of their way to talk and say hi.  This is one if my favorite spots if Im with my son or just having a beer at the bar. 
Thanx Rehab! :)

This place is off the hook good. I tried the peanut butter and jelly hamburger and it was actually good!. You're kind of stuff in there like sardines when busy. That's really the only bad thing I can say about it. I've had several hamburgers from there and they're all good.

This place came highly recommended and definitely didn't disappoint. We survived the 20 min wait out in the corral as this place was packed. But mercifully our food was quick to arrive. Bring a healthy appetite, these burgers are freakin good - and huge. One of the best we've ever had. The blue cheese burger has the blue cheese cooked inside the patty and I honestly had a hard time finding it, but it was still delicious. Verdict -our party agreed it was worth it to find this place.

Way over hyped. I was expecting greatness and didn't really get it. Bar is way too big for one bartender to handle plus server tickets for an entire restaurant. Burgers were alright kind of bland though. Order the spicy Mac and cheese and both the burger and macaroni was lacking

My husband and I stopped in while in the area and were very pleased with our experience. Our surver Devin was on his game, friendly, quick and responsive. My husband had the PB&J Bacon burger, super messy, loads of peanut butter and delicious! Worth the mess, the Sriracha gives a little heat with the sweet. I had the Hawaiian burger and modified to my preference with a turkey patty.  Great atmosphere, friendly staff. They were busy however our wait was super short. We'll definitely recommend Rehab Burgers to our friends.

Good-to-very-good burgers at an appropriate price.  It was mayhem to get in (don't hope for a nearby parking space on Farmer's Market mornings) but we did enjoy our burgers.  We both ordered medium well but my wife's had more pink than mine (and she shies away from pink in the burger).  Mine was unique and tasty but not blow-me-away tasty.  My wife said she thought it was very similar to Cild Beer and Cheeseburgers (the restaurant).  We may go again but are still searching for our "favorite" new burger spot since relocating to the area last summer.
Only been here once but ambiance was good and staff was very friendly. I got the Mushroom burger with pretzel bread was delicious. Also, get the sweet potato tater tots!!!!!
Wow!!! Fantastic Burgers! Helpful friendly servers! Great atmosphere! Can't go wrong here!

Being from outbid town we try as many places as we can when we visit. This place was fantastic.

My gf and I ordered blue cheese infused burgers that were out of this world. Add that to a yummy CaronaRita and cheerful service and you're well on your way to a great meal.

We visited early early for dinner but when we left the place was packed. Looks like a great spot for tourists and locals alike!

The best burger joint EVER. Wow I was so impressed! My boyfriend and I stumbled across this restaurant after our flight and we were starving. I wish I lived in Scottsdale or could ship it up to Seattle. 

 Has it been awhile since you had amazing service? Well it has been a long time for me. My streak ended here. This was hands down the best customer service I had ever recieved. We were greeted at the bar with a big smile and recomendations. We were served our drinks promptly and Bar tender was amazing. Our drinks were fantastic! Our Bar tender was very informative with her menu! She was nice and attentive and the same with the patrons around us. Thank you so much!

I had the Know Poblano Burger with a Lettuce wrap. The spicy grilled onions were delicious. I ate the whole burger it was so good. I'm so happy they have the lettuce wrap option. I'm a low carb type of gal and they made it so easy!

Drinks were also happy hour priced! Lucky us! Our lunch was somewhere around $30 for 2 meals and 4 Drinks! We left a hefty tip since we were so pleased!

You can't beat the taste, atmoshephere, service or price. If you want a great burger and a great experience, Come here!

If you're craving a burger while in Scottsdale I recommend this place. We started with an order of chili cheese fries; the plate was piled high with fries smothered in cheese & chili. The fries are skin on fries, the appetizer was delicious. He had the backyard bbq burger, I had the jalapeno popper burger. The backyard bbq burger was like one you would get at a family gathering, it was full of flavor. The jalapeno popper burger was good, the cream cheese under the cheddar tasted so good; we both had sweet potato tots, make sure you order a side or 2 of their sauces for dipping. A server at a table next to us took time to go over the menu & told the table about their most popular burgers which our server did not & I wish he would have because I probably would have ordered the pbj burger.

My poor review of them on Facebook was deleted, and I was subsequently blocked from their page.  So here it goes...  This place had the WORST service that comes to my mind in the past two decades.  My wife and I walked in when they opened for lunch.  (Keep in mind they were not busy at the time.)  Not a single welcome from the staff, so we sat ourselves.  When some of the other staff finally decided to finish hanging-out from behind the kitchen, our order was taken from some obviously hung-over dude who was WAY too cool to take off his sunglasses.  Not only did it take forever to get our food, but the sweet potato tots were bland and terribly soggy.  The burgers were sub-par, and left on our plates not worth taking home.  Our server came to our table exactly three times; to take our order, deliver the slop, and drop-off the bill.  Our drinks were NEVER re-filled.  There is NO HYPE to checkout at this place.  They don't even deserve a single star.  Spend your money elsewhere if you want better food and service.

Thought the burgers were pretty good! Usually not a fan of old town crowd, but this felt more low key and relaxed.  Also had good service, even though it was kind of hard to hear our waiter with the loud music. Dessert was yummy and drinks were good too.  I would return for sure!

In a nutshell...Friendly & inviting ambiance, outstanding customer service, owners work along side staff to give you a great dining experience, peanut & tree nut allergy considerate, a menu that satisfies everyone from the meat-lover to the health conscience to the vegan to the youngest member of your group, reasonable prices & PHENOMONAL FOOD!!!  Try Rehab Burger Therapy & you'll become a regular!  

For the reasons behind these comments click on "Filtered Reviews" at the bottom of the review list.
Awesome calamari, awesome burgers, awesome drinks and awesome service. Loved the Reggae music and laid back atmosphere too!

This place offers a variety of different styled burgers, but just because they're unique looking doesn't make the taste any better.

I loved the atmosphere, customer service, and appetizers. Although this specialty burger joint doesn't deserve 5 stars... the burgers were just "okay"
The Burger was pretty awesome! For $16 I thought it was a little pricey but that's just my personal opinion. I would definitely go back, and I do recommend though!

Wow! This place is soooo delicious. Great prices for the amount of food you get. It's a fun atmosphere, never too crowded!! I had the tuna salad on the wheat roll with cheese... so yummy! My fiancé gets the peanut butter and jelly and bacon burger with siracha sauce!!! I've only had a bite but oh my gosh!!! Everyone needs to stop in and go to Rehab... lol! Best thing since slice bread! :)

Sprint training is here! It was crazy insane in here on a Saturday afternoon. Wait time for a table was 1hour. We sat at the bar; which turn out to be a pleasant experience. We spoke with several vacationers. 

The bar service was prompt; staff were courteous. I order the relapse bacon cheeseburger on a pretzel bun. Yum! I had a choice of sweet potatoe fries, tater tots, or regular fries. I choose the regular fries. What a burger! I was stuffed halfway thru the meal!

I enjoyed the meal, the atmosphere, and the service!

We got the bacon cheeseburger and the "kid-friendly" mac and cheese, and would totally go back again! The mac and cheese was probably the best I've ever had. Service was prompt and friendly. Would recommend 100%!

Absolutely awful!!!!. This was my third and last visit. 

First two visits everything was ok. No complaints. But this afternoon 12-6-16 the burgers were overcooked and cooked unevenly. Asked for medium and got well done to rare. Must have been frozen. Had the jalapeno burger and bit into an avacodo shell. A slab of avacodo placed on the burger was not cleaned all the way and it was suppose to be quacamole. My girlfriends burger was cooked unevenly and she could not eat it. The burgers were plain garbage for place that specializes in burgers

We informed the server several times and shortly after a cook came out and began staring at us. This made my girlfriend uncomfortable.

What is more disappointing is that i am on a diet and only have a  burger every now and then. Needless to say we will find another burger place.

This place has really good service and the burgers are tasty. Lots of flavor combinations to appease your palate. We came here with two large families and the waitress was accommodating to the group on a busy sunday afternoon. I would def. eat here again when in need for a great burger!

Service - Excellent
Side Salad - Nothing special
Calamari - Skip it!
PBJ & Bacon Burger - A MUST!!!

PBJ = Peanut Butter and Jelly, and yes, as a burger with bacon and sriracha. It sounded awful and my bf isn't a fan of peanut butter so he wasn't anxious to try it. But the reviews and our server made it hard for us not to try it and it was AMAZING. The peanut butter part is a bit decieving, it tasted more like a Thai peanut sauce that usually comes with satay. For some weird reason, this combination works very well. Delicious!

Our waitress helped this group of first timers navigate the menu, select three burgers that were somewhat shareable, and then helped us coordinate our sides so we could try as many as possible! We tried the macaroni and cheese burger, the bacon peanut butter, and the pulled pork. All were stellar!! Will definitely be back when I'm craving a nice, big, flavorful burger! Plus our out-of-town guests were pleased!

We eat here at least once a month. I have yet to have something I don't love and the wait staff is like family. Their Sunday surprise burgers are always amazing and fun.  Simply the best Burger and food you could ask for.
