I absolutely loved the PB&J Bacon Burger.  I would return to Scottsdale just for this burger, no lie.  As odd as this mixture sounds, it was amazing.  The staff was wonderful, prompt, and extremely efficient. 

If you, however are not a big fan of very sweet meals, I wouldn't choose this burger.  (There are plenty of others to choose from).

Rehab also offers a variety of drinks, plus a happy hour!

I'm not sure about the parking as I took an uber here.

Our waiter Rian went above and beyond to accommodate us and the entire staff provided amazing service. I never leave reviews but we are so impressed and satisfied! We are visiting from California and have our puppy with us. We asked to be seated outside but it began to rain.. we were invited in--and even given bacon for our dog. Thanks for the hospitality and excellent food!

While they have fantastic happy hour deals, I have been both pleased and unimpressed by my food. The first time I had a breakfast burrito and sweet potato tater tots (fantastic) and the second time I had an overcooked, dry veggie burger. Their drinks are extremely well priced on happy hour (which is practically all of the time). My friend had a burger that she was pleased with. 

The atmosphere was fantastic! I highly recommend this for day drinking or meeting a friend. Great for both family and a good time.

I love the wide selection of burgers and the service is always on point! I always make sure to get the jalapeno martini! There's two valley locations to check out and i always have an awesome time here!

Love, Love, Love this place! Its the day after my dinner at Rehab and Im still thinking about it...maybe I am addicted, cant wait for my next fix! The service was on point, our waitress had lots of recommendations and suggestions on what to order. The inside was decorated with a really fun vibe. The food was bomb! I substituted my burger for turkey burger and it was still awesome. My favorite part was all the dipping sauces the waitress brought over, around six to choose from. I cant wait to go back and recommend this place with 5 stars!
This place is awesome! I had the cheeseburger on a pretzel bun and it was sooo good! Can't wait to try it again

All I have to say, is the PB and J bacon burger is .  We sat at the bar, bartender was super helpful and took really good care of us.  She suggested mixing two wing sauces and it was amazing.  Overall loved the laid back/beach vibe and the food is on point!  Pretty reasonably priced.  Will definitely be back!
After years of hearing about this place, I finally was able to experience it. The ambience was perfect for our loud group, the drinks were strong and the burgers were great!

Our experience with Rehab started before we even got near the place. Meg was organizing a belated birthday get together for myself that turned out to have a lot more people coming than expected. Our guest list topped out at 21 by the time we were ready to set up the reservation. When we found out how big it had gotten, we began to worry we might get turned down. I mean a small place like this reserving 21 seats on a Friday night? Most places would've turned us down or charged a fee to reserve the space. But when Meg called in three days before the event Wylie, one of the owners, made it happen without a single hitch! No charge for reserving the space and no gratuity despite the size of the group. A good way to start an excellent experience.

Once there our server, David, went above and beyond to take care of us. Extremely friendly and took time to chat with us whenever he got the chance. He didn't have any problem splitting the checks for such a big group and did a great job of making sure everyone got the right bill.

The food itself was fantastic as well! I got a Ghost Burger (minus avocado) on a Pretzel Bun with onion rings instead of fries. This thing had a bite to it! Definitely spicy but not to the point it was inedible and the burger was cooked perfectly. The onions were very good. Admittedly the substitution price as a little high for five rings but the rings were very good size and fried just right.

I also got to sample the Reese's Pot Brownie as well. If you order one of these things, I hope you're sharing because four bites and I was beyond done. Lots of brownie and tasted amazing but very very rich in flavor. Would not order this for myself but perfect for groups to share.

All in all we had an amazing time there and the service was spectacular. I love the surfer vibe decor and all the unique burger combinations there were to choose from.  Would come back in a heart beat.

Prices here are great... we got an incredible chicken green chili dip for $9.   Burgers can be made with a 5 oz patty for two or so dollars cheaper... my build your own was $8.75... with a sod Carla's.  Great place to stop when you are in Old Town Scottsdale... fun atmosphere with a relaxed vibe... just loved it.

Been here a few times and enjoyed myself. Both times I had a great bartender named Courtesy who is friendly and helpful. The happy hour is great and both food items I've had have been very good. First visit I had a burger which was awesome and a lot of food. Courtney gave me a few different of their house sauces to try and they were all tasty. Second visit I had a wedge salad that was great on a hot day. Maybe just a tad too much dressing but that's my only complaint. I'll be back when I'm in Scottsdale

After a full day of walking around Scottsdale, we were hungry for a great burger and discovered Rehab Burger on Yelp. We were not disappointed! Great variety of burgers and plenty of other options for those wanting something else. We were there on a Friday around 7, and it was fairly crowded and noisy, but the great vibe overcame all that. 

Our waiter provided great service, and I really appreciated that he told me to best order my relapse-sized burger cooked medium. I prefer my hamburger not have pink in it but sometimes when I ask for medium-well, the meat is too dry. Medium was perfect. I had the poblano burger with sweet potato tots and it was all delicious. My husband really liked the hatch chili burger.

If we lived in this area, we would make this a frequent eating spot.

Really wanted to try this place today. Had a burger already picked out and everything. Called in to place a pick up order but their phone just rang. We figured they were busy so drove on over at 1pm on a Sunday only to find they were closed. Their hours said they were open and Yelp showed as being open as well. 

*if they were going to close unexpectedly it would've been nice for them to update that on a voicemail message or something

Great trendy hamburger restaurant.  Great place to people watch in downtown Scottsdale.  Lots of great hamburger combinations with a speciality pretzel crust. I really recommend the appetizer Nelson's Verde Con Pollo, i get every time I am there

Literally the best burger place in the world!  Their burger meat is very juicy and tastes amazing and they have a long list of unique burgers.  My personal favorites are the spicy Mac and cheese and the PBJ & Bacon burger (I know the latter sounds odd but it's amazing).  I always chose to have mine on a pretzel bun with a side of sweet potato tots.

Love this place! The burgers simply can't be beat and its beachy no-fucks-given vibe is refreshing in old town Scottsdale. Bonus points if you get David as your waiter, been here a million times and service can vary. 

I also suggest BYOB with chicken breast if you're not feelin a burger but honestly you can't go wrong with your order!

I was disappointed given the very strong Yelp reviews. My opinion is clearly in the minority since we arrived on a Tuesday night in July to a restaurant so a full of patrons that we had to sit outside. Perhaps the combination of the full house and the 4.5 stars on 792 Yelp reviews raised my expectations too high.

The service was a bit slow, which may have had to do with the big crowd in a weeknight, however I wouldn't say it was terrible. The food menu had a wide variety of choices but as a craft beer lover I was disappointed in the beer choices. There were mostly macro breweries with a sprinkling of craft beers, which left limited choices for my taste.  I ordered the pablano burger, which was good but I didn't see why the place was rated so high as I can think of several other places in town that make a better burger. 

None the less I indicated to my girlfriend that I would go back and had already decided on a "3 star" Yelp rating as the food was good but didn't blow me away and the service was a tad slow but acceptable.  Then I went to the restroom and discovered that THERE IS NO MEN'S ROOM. They have a ladies room and a family restroom. So I had to wait a LONG time to use the restroom. I will not go back to a restaurant that expects me to spend my money there but will not provide me with a restroom.

Some of the best gourmet burgers around, made and served by people who care.
We've heard of Rehab Burger Therapy for a while now, and finally got a chance to try it out. Wow! The service and the food are absolutely top notch. 
We went on a Sunday night and parking was not a big issue - there is a large free lot right next door. Located in the heart of Old Town Scottsdale, Rehab gives off a relaxing beach vibe with the décor - it's like a cantina in Montego Bay that serves hamburgers unlike any you've had before. Great laid-back ambiance that is enhanced by the friendliness and approachability of the staff. The place is not that big, but the table arrangements are so that you never feel cramped, there is room for everyone to be comfortable.
We told the hostess it was our first time, and they just jumped at the opportunity to treat us like VIP's - even the owner, a super cool dude named Wiley stopped by to say hello. You can tell this is a place where management truly cares about every guest that walks through the door. It's not a corporate or franchise atmosphere - it's a local family-style atmosphere, where you feel like they care more about you as the diner, than just getting you to pay the check. This is rare in today's fast-paced high-turnover restaurant industry, and it sets Rehab apart from the others.
Our server, who was very attentive and funny, took our orders promptly and got us our beers really fast. We enjoyed the funny stories he told us, especially about some guy who ordered 3 10oz patties and topped that burger off with pulled pork & a fried egg and ate the whole thing! Yikes! While I will never order anything like that, I wasn't quite prepared for the monstrous sized portions you get here. While the prices are in the $10-15 range for the burgers, you definitely get value for your money.
We started with some yummy appetizers - chicken wings and "pig wings". The chicken wings were the smaller sportsbar variety but they were nice and crispy with a delicious spicy pineapple bbq sauce. I like that the sauce was more of a zesty kick than a burn-your-mouth hot wing. It was perfectly balanced. The pig wings are basically bone-in pork knuckles and are out of this world! The meat was incredibly tender and tasty. We also got a side of the pineapple teriyaki aioli, which was fantastic. I would definitely order those again without thinking twice.

My girlfriend ordered the Chili burger - it was cooked medium as she asked, and she loved it. While I'm not a chiliburger guy, I tried a spoonful of the just the chili and it was quite good, perfectly seasoned.
I ordered the Mac Gnarly burger, medium well and it arrived cooked-to-order (this is important as so many places either under or over cook their patties), and omg this thing was a MONSTER. It was two 5 oz patties, with a bun in the middle too, smothered in aged cheddar & 1000 island dressing. Seriously the largest burger I have ever seen in my life - it was a masterpiece. You'd think this was a fork n knife meal, but being the experienced burger eater that I am, I was able to eat most of it with my two hands. I cannot overemphasize how hugely massive and tasty this burger was. Definitely one of the best I've had. Wow factor x1000. 
The dessert menu has 1 item, and after tasting the pot brownie, they don't need anything else. This was a supremely decadent and carefully prepared delicacy. As stuffed as I was after the Mac Gnarly, this brownie was just too darn good to let my girlfriend eat alone! Needless to say, we went home absolutely satisfied with our meal. 
I highly recommend Rehab Burger Therapy - the quality of the food, the value for the money paid, the quality of service, and the fun relaxing ambiance make this one of the best burger joints in the Southwest. No surprise they keep racking up the awards! When you go...arrive hungry!

Came in here on a random mid-week night with a few friends. When we got there, we were greeted and seated immediately. Our server was very bubbly and explained every aspect of the restaurant and menu to us. I was incredibly impressed. We all order our food. I got the Rehab BBQ burger (11 oz) and our server recommended the pretzel bun. Food came out quickly and it was soooo good. Hands down one of the best burgers I've ever had. They also had a bunch of awesome dipping sauces and another bottled sauce that's to die for. Everyone I was with loved their food. I was only able to finish half my burger, and I have a big appetite. The fries were great too. It's so nice to find a nicely priced restaurant and bar in Old Town that also has great service and great food. I've already brought friends in again to try it out and they loved it too. Can't wait to go back.

Pretzel bun wasn't worth the risk. I had never had one and decided to try it but I now regret it. I got the jalapeno popper burger but it wasn't that good and I thought it had too much peppery spices on it. It wasn't too spicy, but overpowering taste.
Great place for an amazing burger! Atmosphere was relaxing, felt like was on a beach somewhere. Margarita was delicious and the staff was on point. Very speedy service.

Plus: the burgers are excellent

Minus: the soundtrack switches from 311 to Rebelution

Plus: the burgers are awesome

Minus: beer selection is putrid 

Plus: the burgers are amazing

Great burger, I had the Philly Cheesesteak burger. The 5 oz is PLENTY! My buddy had the PB & J burger and the sweet potato tater-tots! He said next time he would go with regular fries because the jelly and the sweet tots were too sweet

Where to begin... This place put me in the deepest food coma my consciousness has ever been (that is a good thing). I ordered the bacon cheeseburger with avocado (rehab size) with a side of sweet potato tots and French fries. While this is a pretty standard order in the food industry, there was something indescribably different about this place. Maybe it was the seasoning, maybe the vibes or music; regardless my experience here was great and I will be returning in the near future.

A little island feel in Phoenix.  Enjoyed the background music mix of Sublime, Bob Marley, etc.  If you want quantity in a burger, then this is the place.  I had a mushroom and swiss with an added fried egg.  It was pretty tasty.  We also ordered the peanut and butter and jelly burger.  Different and unique with a crazy burst of sweet and savory in each bite.  The sweet potato tater tots were pretty amazing though.  The service was excellent.  I just with they had more variety in their draft beer.  I feel in this type of place should have an extensive list of beers on tap.

We ate here during our vacation in Arizona. It was better than I expected. Good food and good atmosphere. The food came pretty quickly but we arrived around 2pm and there was plenty to watch on the flat screens while waiting.

This place is wonderful! Ask about the secret menu! I had the Jalapeño Popper Burger! It was delicious! The waitress was extremely attentive and very knowledgable of the menu. She made a few recommendations about what we were ordering and what worked well together. She right on the money! The sweet potato tots were so yummy dipped in the pesto sauce or the pineapple sauce. Best part....they have the option of a pretzel bun for all their burgers!! I can't wait to bring my husband back to try another burger and enjoy the relaxed, cool atmosphere! I live completely the other side of the valley from Scottsdale, but I think this will become a regular spot for me! It's just that good.  Oh, and the bathrooms were way cool too. Actual towels to dry your hands and real tp, not the scratchy stuff! Impressed!

Brought my friend here earlier tonight and she loved it! My burger was so delicious as always! And I'm obsessed with the sweet potato tater tots, they are my fav! The vibe here is so awesome and I love everything about this place. Oh and it's always busy so just plan on there being a wait
Great burgers, awesome sweet potato tater tots! And great service! They have gluten free options too. We have eaten here 2 times and will definitely be back.

Bottom line: The most incredible burger I have ever eaten.

Got the Mac and cheese burger, and it far exceeded my expectations, but be ready because it comes with a lot of good homemade Mac and cheese.

Other than that the margaritas are also good and the bartender was very friendly and attentive even though the bar was packed.

Went here yesterday with a couple friends and to be honest, I was quite impressed. 
The staff wasn't too in your face and their burgers were phenomenal. 

We started with some chicken wings that were scrumptious to say the least and didn't last long between the 3 of us. 

A friend and I shared the "Rehab" size of the Chili Burger and it was delish. With the Pretzel bun and sweet potato tater tots, I was in love! Although her and I both agreed " WE WANT MORE CHILI!" on the burger next time. 

I am now addicted  and the only treatment is more Rehab.

The PB&J is off the chain, don't do it
On your first date unless you can do no wrong in there eyes already

Great food, awesome service and place was very cute. We sat in the patio and they had water sprays that maintained the area very cool. I ordered the Hawaiian burger with the sweet potato tots and they were amazing! Would definitely come back next time I'm in town.
Yummy food, good service, and great atmosphere. Relapse burger is a good size, Rehab is huge.

My boyfriend and I are regulars here and we LOVE it!!! Denise, one of the owners, is amazeballs! She's always smiling and making sure everyone's experience is a perfect one. I love the vibe! I forget that I'm in the middle of the desert when I step indoors because it feels like I'm on a vacation at the beach. Rumor has it they're opening another location on Mill Ave in Tempe... I wish them all the success there that they've seen in Scottsdale. The place is always packed and I love seeing small, creative business owners succeed! Oh yah, almost forgot... The food is awesome!

Wasn't a huge fan of my burger. Ordered the bacon cheeseburger. Didn't think the meat had enough flavor. Really wish they offered American cheese because the cheddar didn't bring enough flavor to the already bland meat. The only "okay" part of my meal was the sweet potato tots. Those were pretty good. The fries were pretty bland as well. Nothing to write home about here.

Best place for service. My daughter has many food allergies and the staff accommodated everyone of them. Our server Andrea was a STAR. I recommend this place without hesitation. Food was fresh, hot and absolutely delicious.

Great burgers in a laid back atmosphere.  The burgers are creative - we ordered the Spicy Mac-and-Cheese burger and the Jalapeño burger both of which were cooked to perfection.  The burgers come either in 5oz or 10oz sizes - we got both in the 10oz, which was a bit much for lunch - would recommend the 5oz unless your really hungry.

The fries are good - but would suggest substituting for the sweet potato tater tots.  They come with an aioli dipping sauce which is a nice combination.
I have to admit this is a fantastic place!  Ambience, burgers, fries, service. It was all good. I came here with a client and wished I was here hanging with friends having a beer. Very comfortable!

This is my second time around at this place and I must say it did not disappoint. The last time I came here was on my 40th birthday but for some reason   I remember the burger having more more flavor back then. The burger tasted a little bland so I added some salt & pepper and that fixed the problem. I ordered the Relapse Hatch burger medium well and it was Huge, juicy, and delicious.  My wife ordered the byob burger, mayo, tomato, onion, cheese, and she said it was great. I went there with my whole family and they ordered all kinds of stuff it was ridiculous. The peanut butter and jam sandwich was huge/delicious, hot wings- good and so was the Alfredo San Carlos pasta. If you go here make sure you bring your appetite because there are no small portions served. The best thing about it was the price because there was 12 of us and the bill was 110 bucks and we had 4 to go plates left over. The only thing that I can complain about here is the wait and bathrooms. Sometimes the wait is 30 mins long or more and the bathrooms are small.

I first came here over a year ago.  I was super excited about the gluten free buns and the sweet potato tots.  It was delicious.  I've been several times since then and the past couple of times, I have been drastically disappointed.  The burger has been dry and the sweet potato tots have been sgggy and smooshy.  The fries were good, so I switched.   I have recommended this place several times, but I'm hesitant to recommend it now, especially to out of town guests.

I'm not really a burger guy, but I was with a bunch of guys who were probably not into "ethnic" food.  We were in Old town Scottsdale, and as much as I was trying to steer everyone to italian food, they weren't going for it.  We ended up here.  It's kind of weird place, I thought it had a great vibe, but the rest of my group didn't.  One guy ordered the peach beer which was terrible.  I got the sweet tots for an appetizer, which were really good.  You could also get it as a side for a burger.  I ended up with a turkey burger, which was okay.  I got a side of onion rings with it as well.   The rings were only alright.  The rest of my group had burgers, which they said tasted pretty good, but nothing out of the ordinary for the cost of the burger.  My group didn't like the beer selection, I'm a fan of the four peaks beer, so I wasn't complaining about that.  All in all, it was a pretty average experience.

Great burgers! Fab onion rings! Great servi ce. I would make this a definite return place. We started with sweet potato tots and dips. The know poblano burger was great...best burger ice had in years.

Place was great - communal table was fun - service good.  Food tasted just fine - THEN 1a.m. both of us were sick sick sick sick.  Not fun anywhere especially in a motel, while traveling, and needing to hit the road by 7a.m.

What can be said that hasn't already been said? Great food, fun environment, good service - there really wasn't anything bad about it. We had a hot dog, a plain ol' cheeseburger and a hatch burger  - all if which were delish. The fries have a unique salty/spicy flavoring that drew me in and I couldn't stop eating them. Also tried the sweet potato tots and the chips and salsa. The chips and salsa was some of the best we've had in Scottsdale, hands down! The tots were a fav with our kiddos. Our daughter told the waiter she was giving this place "21 stars" -- We will definitely be back!!

If you go home hungry, its your fault.  This place reminds me a little bit of Hodad's, a hugely popular burger joint in the Ocean Beach neighborhood of San Diego that emphasizes a laid back beach style atmosphere with crazy burger concoctions.  Seems like owners Ken Likewise, Denise Nelson, and Wiley Arnett had something like that in mind when they opened this place in 2012.  And being that all three owners are former Oregano's execs, the food portions at Rehab are (like Oregano's) somewhat ludicrous.  Seeing that so many fellow Yelpers have been here with such positive results, a lunchtime stopover seemed long overdue.

Located in Old Town Scottsdale on 2nd Street just east of Scottsdale Road, Rehab is hard to miss.  The beach style decor, outdoor patio, chill background music, and stacked bar all beckon you in (you could be forgiven for at least initially thinking you were walking into a tourist trap).  I came at opening expecting the Saturday lunch crowd would quickly swell (which it did), and grabbed a spot at the bar inside.  There's seating for probably 75 inside and another 25 out on the patio out front altogether.  Plenty of TVs here if you want to come and watch a big game.  Otherwise you can just admire the surfboards, beach cruisers, and other beach themed decor on the walls and ceiling.

As other Yelpers have noted, Happy Hour extends from opening all the way to 6pm so plenty of opportunities for cheap eats and drinks earlier in the day.  They also have a $4 chips and salsa Yelp check-in deal (just over $1 cheaper than their normal price), but I wasn't here for chips and salsa.  I did grab a $1.75 can of PBR, well, just because.  But the burgers were the real driving force here.  Take your time deciding though as there's at least two dozen burger options by my count.  And that doesn't even count the different burger sizes, buns, and sides options.  One burger that immediately leaped off the menu for me was the Porkster.  I like pulled pork, I like BBQ sauce, I like beef, and I like cheddar cheese.  And yes I would very much like to try all four at once in between a bun, thank you very much.  I chose the house brioche for my bun as I love brioche.  My side of choice was the sweet potato tater tots.  Total cost for the beer, the food, tax and tip came to $20.

I should note that I ordered the Relapse size burger, which is the smallest size they offer. The Rehab size is twice the size of the Relapse for only $2 more, but after seeing my meal, I'm sure glad I stuck with the regular.  This thing was huge.  Overloaded with pulled pork and copious amounts of cheddar cheese.  The bartender alertly gave me a big stack of napkins with my meal knowing this would be messy.  I had to chip away at some of the loose pulled pork (which was solid by the way), before I could attempt to grab the buns with two hands.  That first big bite was awesome.  Great mix of beef flavors and the bun was perfect.  I also liked the tater tots (including the sauce it came with, which I believe was a chipotle ranch).  I had absolutely no room for dessert this go around as I was totally stuffed.

So I'll reiterate what other Yelpers have said and confirm that yes, the hype is well deserved.  The portions are huge, the staff is friendly, the atmosphere is super chill, and the menu is as inventive as it is expansive.  If this is what Oregano's looks like in burger form, chances are the owners of Rehab will be here for a long time (and likely opening more locations in the near future).  Time for me to go to rehab, for a food coma.

Literally, top 5 best burgers I have ever had.

I had the macaroni and cheese burger with green chile. It was phenomenal. I go back through my pictures on my phone to glance at this burger because I am constantly craving it. Also, my first time having mac and cheese on a burger, and sweet potato tater tots. 

I am from New Mexico, so I can't tell you how happy I was to hear that they use green chile from Hatch, NM! The burger was cooked perfect, the mac and cheese was amazing, and the green chile had a nice kick. I was pretty determined to finish the entire meal, but ended up only eating about half (Yes, I took the rest to-go and finished it later). Service was great, I believe our server's name was Lauren, or "Lo" - she was awesome. Probably some of the best service I have experienced in a long time. She was super attentive, always filled our water cups quick (it was hot), and made great suggestions. We didn't have to wait for a table either, and we went on a Friday night around 7pm. I think I will make the drive to Scottsdale specifically for this burger.

This was the first time I have ever been to Rebab, and as I sat there looking at the menu and saw other people's burgers coming out, I was super excited and impressed at the size of the burgers. However, when my Hack Burger came out, it was HALF the size of the others, dry, overcooked, the bacon I requested was missing (as well as the extra aioli sauce I requested) and the waitress brought me the wrong beer as well. She didn't earn a good tip that's for sure, since apparently refiling water was too hard as well. 

Although I was not impressed with the service or the burger they brought me, I will say that I think I just had bad luck because my boyfriend's burger was amazing and much more what I had originally expected to get. If I had gotten his burger, I would have been leaving 4 or 5 stars. Give this place a chance, but don't be surprised if you have mediocre service or have to ask them to fix your order.

Rehab was the first place I discovered the art of putting fried egg on your burger. The hangover burger (Fried egg, bacon, colby jack cheese and hatch green chili) is on point--whether or not you were overserved the night prior. Great staff and comfortable (albeit island inspired) setting. Extra credit for it being a local business!

Believe the hype, this place is 2 legit to quit! Went here New Years day, with my massive hangover in tow,  because LOLO's had a 45 min wait. Lucky for me we were sat immediately.  Our server was pleasant and quickly brought all our drinks. The most notable of drinks were the chocolate milk shake and bloody mary; both were exceptional. 
Our table ordered a Poblano burger (relapse size), Hatch chili burger (turkey patty) and hangover (rehab). 
All burgers came cooked to order and were A-mazing. I had the relapse size Poblano burger with onion rings and couldn't finish it so don't worry about not having enough food! 
I had a bite of my husbands Hatch turkey burger that was equally as good! He said he didn't miss the beef one bit because the turkey burger was just as juicy and flavorful.
If I had to complain it would be about the onion rings and lemon pepper on the fries. 
The onion rings are thick with more batter than I prefer as I like a crispier onion ring that is more about the onion than batter. 
The actual fries are great but they sprinkle lemon pepper on them. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't good either. 
Both of these complaints are just a personal preferences and have nothing to do with the way they were cooked or quality of the food. 
Next time I will just get the fries without the lemon pepper : )
I would love to see them add regular tots to the menu for those who are not a fan of sweet potato tots.
All in all, it was a great meal and I will definitely go back.

This burger joint is pretty awesome. Very casual, family friendly, yet at the same time got the beach bar/sports bar vibe. Friendly staff and lots to choose from on the menu. Got some crazy burgers like spicy mac n cheese, pb&j, the hangover, etc. I went with the jalapeño popper on pretzel buns, 5oz, with potato fries. My burger came with guac and fried egg. Mm mm, SO good. 4 different sauce they give you on the side are amazing too. My favorite was the spicy ketchup. Overall, I left the restaurant feeling full, satisfied, and happy.

I really liked my burger.  Good quality.  My husband got the larger "rehab" size patty while I got the smaller "relapse" burger.  His burger seemed a little bit too large and was extremely messy.   Since my burger was also a good size + a lot easer to eat I was glad I went with the smaller option.

Call me a stickler, but I was really bothered by the fact that some of the employees were wearing flip-flops and other open toed shoes in the kitchen.  I know that laid-back beach style is sort of a thing here....but really?  What other gross health code violations are going on back there?

All in all I liked the place, I like the food, but I can't make myself go back in light of that one little thing (inappropriate footwear) especially when I can find many other burger places to get a good burger.

Last Sunday I went here for the 2nd time. This place seems always busy. The burger was so good and the sweet potato tots was absolutely amazing!!! Rocco was our server. He is the best. He was really nice to us and I usually have specific order but he got it right. Definitely come back to this place !!!

5* Customer Service is Exemplary/Awesome here!!

Stopped by on a rush lunch near an appointment only 45 minutes out. When we asked whether we would be able to complete our lunch in the allotted amount of time, we were informed that, after ordering, it would only take 15 minutes to receive our food. So, we went for it. After a table was cleared and care taken to properly clean it (very nice touch) we ordered drinks and looked through the menu. I ordered a Hatch chili relapse (single) cheeseburger (which comes with a choice of sides like onion rings, salad, etc.) and hubby ordered the fish tacos. His was the better dish. While my cheeseburger was really tasty (the beef is incredibly good) the chipotle sauce got lost on the pretzel bun (sauce was only found on the top bun) and I could only taste it in one bite. Overall, I would say that the burger was nothing special. However, the fish tacos (the byline under this menu item states, "We don't need no stinkin' badges!") were excellent!! We went over our allotted time by only 2 minutes; everyone who served us went out of their way to get us in/out the door in a reasonable amount of time, and we enjoyed our meal. The only cautionary note is that the noise level is `quite loud' and one toddler who came in with her parents seemed not to be able to tolerate it well and added her crying to the general noise level.

Best burger joint around.

Ever been to Slater's 50/50 for the PB&J Bacon Burger?  Thought that was good?  Wait until you try it at Rehab!  Oh yeah, they added Sriracha to the mix...what a great idea! 

What else - how about the spicy mac and cheese burger?  Wow!  You could make a meal just with the spicy mac and cheese that comes with the burger, and you would say, 'That was great!', but add it to a burger, and a side of sweet potato tater tots with dipping sauce pairings?  Amazing.

Cool vibe in Old Town Scottsdale - park in the big lot east of the restaurant.

This is one rehab where you want to check in - not check out!

This is a really nice place for chilling and eat, my friend and like it so much.

Environment: it's pretty chill in here, I decide to sit outside for my meal, the lights and high tables are cute. 

Appetizer: I ordered the onion ring. I would say the onion ring here is a must have if you come over, I haven't seem this huge of onion ring in my life, super satisfied!

Burger: I order the spicy Mac&cheese burger, side with sweet potato. Mac&cheese has crunchy bacon on top, the burger portion was so huge, 5 oz is definitely good for 2 people. Sweet potato is so good with their homemade special sauce.

Service: my waiter was so friendly, he come to check on us like three times, he gave advices on the choices. I left my cigarettes on my table, he ran and gave it back to me. Love him! 

I'll recommend this place to all of my friends.

Would've have given it four stars but:

1) I placed an order for pick up. Got there and waited for the server, Lexi, who didn't show up for 10 mins so another server tried to help me and got me my food. Then kept waiting because apparently only she could take my payment! I was annoyed so in fact I asked another server "do y'all not want me to pay?".. Finally a third server took my card over to Lexi who then took my payment 

2) they didn't give me any plastic ware or napkins or anything 

3) disappointed with the sweet potato tater tots

The veggie burger was delicious! I asked them to give me crispy onions instead of lettuce and tomatoes. Loved it!! It came with some sort of dipping sauce - I think cilantro lime which was super duper Yum as well!

I probably paid about $12 for the burger excluding gratuity. 

Got to the place on a Wednesday evening at 6pm and it was packed! Looked like a fun place to hang out at. Very very casual decor.

We were in Scottsdale on business and took our casual client here.  The inside is a fun decor with a smiling wait staff. Most of us had different kind of burgers, fish sandwich & pasta.  All the food was delicious.  There is a good selection of drinks and beer.  Even though it was a business dinner this place certainly made it so much fun!

Great service, great menu, great quality. In town for few days. Took a shot from Yelp! suggestions. Highly recommend. Only thing - if I had to find one....I got a choice between a 5 ounce and a 10 ounce burger. I chose the ten because the five was just too small for a guy my size. Whoa nelly, that was a hunk of meat. Probably more than I needed. But boy, I left there well fed and happy. Also, my wife got the black bean burger. Said it was about the best she's ever had.

This restaurant was tasty for lunch. My husband had a burger and beer, and I enjoyed a delicious salad. The salad was large and each topping was fresh. It's not always easy to find a place that makes a sizable and yummy salad. I would happily dine here again. The weather was so pleasant when we visited that we enjoyed lunch on the patio, another highlight.

Yes! Love the scenery and the burgers were amazing! I have to get gluten free options which they had. Gluten free bun was good, it doesn't just fall apart like at other places. Burger was huge and it seems priced well. The French fries were really good as well. Our sever, Hanna was very nice and accommodating. 5 stars, we will be back to enjoy drinks and burgers!!! Come here if you are hungry and want to be full/satisfied.

Ok. 
Just had a crazy good burger. Here it is:
10oz of beef, pretzel bun, delicious good thick bacon, sirachi, and .... Wait for it .... PEANUT BUTTER AND JELLY!!!  
Crazy but off the hook good!! The spicy nutty sweet flavor was harmony! My son Jack (PB&J and burger guy would love this)
Love it!
Ended with really bad food poisoning from it. The reviews were great and the food was tasty but not worth it with such bad food poisoning.

Seriously good food!! The French fries are okay, but the burger was stacked high, juicy, well cooked to how you ask, and delicious! Truly a gormet burger joint. The ideas and amounts of burgers are amazing! A little hard to locate at first, but once you find this gold mine, it'll be worth the time and money.
Salty...every thing. I was not impressed.  Service could have been better but was not badd.
Tasty burger and the tots are amazing!  Service is good, they have turkey burger options that are quite tasty.

THIS PLACE ROCKS. Eat there about once a week now. The Hangover Burger on a pretzel bun with deep fried corn on the cob and $1.50 PBR's cannot be beat. I travel a lot, I always come here the night I get home. The staff is the best. The food is the best. The atmosphere is the best. Instead of a bowl of mints at the door, there is a bucket of jawbreakers. Classic!

Had the Jalapeño Popper burger on the pretzel bun with the sweet potato tots. Overall tasty. The peppers didn't bring much heat and the guac was a bit heavy on the burger. But would definitely recommend and eat again.

I swear I used to LOVE this place.... it used to be amazing, but fast foward to three years later I really feel the quality has gone extremely down hill. I'm  sure I will probably never come back. But if you're new to it, and don't know what it used to be, you might like it. I might go into detail later, but all I will say for now is...you can do better
Last thing... do not be fooled by the sauteed mushroom swiss burger!!! They do not know what Sautee  means,  they actually mean warmed up mushrooms
I had the BBQ burger with pretzel bun and  tater-tots sides with spicy ketchup. Good food, kid friendly environment. Lol like the beach atmosphere. Staffs are awesome.

discovered this place while waiting to pick up a friend from Scottsdale Healthcare!  Amazing place!  We only had a short time sort we ordered appetizers.  We had the quesadilla with chicken which was HUGE and cheesy, and the calamari.  Calamari is for me sort of a barometer of how good everything else on the menu might be, and usually I'm disappointed, but not here.  It was a little different than your normal calamari in the breading, but it was perfect!  Cooked perfectly, not too chewy and had a really nicely flavored marinara sauce to go with it, and two lemons, which is nice.

I saw some of the burgers go by our table and they looked amazing, big and juicy.  I wish we had more time so I could have had one.  Will definitely go back.

Well...FINALLY...made it to Rehab! (That sounds funny) Been wanting to drop in for a while but it took my daughter and her boyfriend inviting me to actually get it done and WOW was I floored. The place is my kind of joint, beachy casual environment with friendly service.  My daughter got the Hangover (love the egg), he got the Macncheese burger (insane) and I got the Elvis....Win!  All the burgers were great but we all agreed the Elvis was the hands down favorite. Double patty with PB, chocolate, and caramelized bananas.BAM!!  Pretty sure it's only served on the weekend. Get the sweet potato tots...you won't be disappointed.

This place is a great find! A bit off The main strip of Old Town Scottsdale, which makes for a great location, free parking round the back to boot. My boyfriend got the Pescado Barracho and he loved it, his only complaint was that they gave him a lot of fish, so he had some left over, which isn't a real complaint. I was a bit adventurous and got the PBJ Bacon Burger and it was awesome! Great service, great food - we'll definitely be coming back.
Place was so awesome. You felt like you were dining by the beach. Staff was super nice and friendly. Peanut butter/jelly bacon burger was delicious.
Fun atmosphere with great food. You can't go wrong with any of the burgers. Good happy hour. Don't eat at a chain of this is nearby.
First time and loved this place in hooked you get what you paid for I will be coming back

The food was amazing. The burger quality and size for the price is top-notch. I left completely full which rarely happens at restaurants. I wanted to try their dessert brownie but was so full after lunch that I went back the next day just to get the brownie and a beer. Great food, friendly staff. I highly recommend Rehab Burger.
The Porkster plus green chili, you'll never go back to another burger. Side note, the Sweet Serrano dressing is phenomenal.

I love me some burgers and this place has some great burgers! It can get busy at certain times and its not very big so if you don't want to wait plan accordingly. 

If you are a fan of a good burger this for sure is a place you should try out.

We stumbled on this place after going to a museum.  It was delicious!  I had the tacos with pulled pork, the pork was tender, moist and soooo good!  My husband tried the Philly burger..he did end up eating the philly cheese steak portion separate from the burger as it got a bit messy, but told me it was delicious all the same.  Would definitely go again. They had an extensive burger menu with lots of interesting choices.

Rehab fully embraces the idea that fried foods play a critical role in comforting society from hangovers and bad days. I showed up because Pig & Pickle had a gas leak, and quickly scanned Yelp for an alternative.

Rehab lets you throw a veggie patty, or any patty (turkey, chicken, etc.), on any burger. So the menu felt expansive. Look closely enough at the huge menu and you'll find endless puns about rehab. 

The ghost burger wasn't spicy. Maybe because it used "ghost pepper jack cheese" instead ghost peppers. I'm not even sure what that is. The "relapse" (two patties) was too much patty; I'll put that one on me. 

But the patties themselves were not so great, which was disappointing because the menu called it hand pressed. The guacamole was a disaster, too, emblematic of the American avocado craze gone too far. I only finished about a quarter of my burger before calling it quits. 

I will say that the bun was decent and the sweet potato tots were worth the upgrade.

My favorite part of the night was when I was talking with my friend about kids while eating at the bar. A complete stranger waiting at the bar looked over and said, "Whoa man you don't want kids. See that girl over there? I knocked her up and now I gotta support her, and she isn't even that hot." I looked over at him, then down at my burger, uncertain how to respond. I guess burgers and alcohol bring out the honesty in people. It also made me realize that Rehab was probably more bar than burger.

The service was pretty slow . One bartender had to manage fifteen people's food orders, plus all the drinks for the restaurant. I felt bad for him; he was certainly overworked.

If I come back, I'll take the burger into my own hands. I expect to request some toppings combination of fresh jalapeno, onion rings, BBQ sauce, extra ghost pepper jack cheese, hot sauce, etc. Maybe that will do the trick.

Yummy. My son's first burger and he's 14.  He ordered the mac and cheese burger and we split it. The mac and cheese was so good.   It had a kick to it.  My younger ones had a grilled cheese and bbq wings.   Both were so tasty.   The wings also had a kick. It was sweet, tangy and spicy.  Just the way we line it. The outside had a crunch yet moist inside.   The grilled cheese was in thick pieces of bread, like Texas toast.  Great crunch. Cheesy. Your choice of any cheeses. We also had a side of sweet potato tots.  Those were also very good.   Very good customer service. It was busy and our waiter kept up very well.  No errors at all and friendly.
Found this place on Yelp. We had the mushroom and Swiss and the poblano burgers. Both were very tasty and yummy. The interior has a beach like atmosphere that makes you feel like you are on vacation.

A-M-A-Z-I-N-G Burgers here.  Cute atmosphere and great service.  Will definitely be visiting again soon!!!  Wish you had a location in N. Phoenix.

THANKS!!!

Eh, wanted to see for myself what the hype was all about. The burgers here are normal and nothing to scream about. They do have pretty insane flavors like a PB&J burger, which was pretty good. However the meat is mediocre and the ingredients are alright. I was hoping it would be fresher. The side salad was mostly lettuce and the pomegranate dressing just tasted like vinegar. Service can be better also.

My husband wanted a good burger and we decided to branch off from our usual favorite, ZinBurger. Rehab is quite a drive for us but well worth it!

Fun atmosphere, although a bit warm inside for us. The hostess and waiter seemed to really enjoy working there. The hamburgers and chicken burgers were fantastic! How great that there are bun choices, the pretzel bun being a unanimous favorite. Three of our group liked the fries, but I didn't particularly care for some spice on them (chili powder?), which is a slight bummer since I'm the fry-person in the family. But I was very happy with the onion rings and will try the sweet potato tater tots next time. The waiter even said he'd let me try a tater first to see if I liked it... what great service! Too bad I was way too stuffed to shovel in another bite. We will definitely be back; only wish it were closer to home.

We have tried about 4-5 of their burgers now. First off yummy!!!! The unique varieties make it an experience. 4 stars because I personally ordered medium rare but the burger felt dry to my taste. My colleagues all loved their burger and did not have the same complaint. Also 4 stars because the burger architecture made it so it did not hold up well while eating, the burger was half in my hand and half on the plate. 

Overall burgers were good not great and no where near my favorite place. You should patronage this establishment for sure, I will continue my search for the beat burger joint elsewhere.

Rehab burger is your total local dive bar but has a cool vibe to it as well. They offer great drink specials, and have a great burger menu. I had there Hangover burger with the sweet potato tots and to me it was pretty mediocre plus I ordered my burger medium rare and received a well done burger so of course I am sure that had something to do with the taste. Would I go back and give em another shot? Probably not considering there are alot more great burger joints in Scottsdale.

This is a great place to grab beer and a delicious burger.  There are tons of burger selections and you can expect it to be busy.  
Def come with friends and hungry cause you'll leave satisfied.
Fantastic burgers and service. The wait is usually a little long but for great food that's understandable.

This is hands down my favorite place to grab a beer and burger! The atmosphere is perfect and the music can't get any better. Their burgers are huge and amazing and food/drink prices are on par. 

FYI their porkster is the best damn burger!

Rehab Burger Therapy is fun.  The atmosphere is very bright and friendly and you feel good as soon as you walk in.  The service is quick as well.

The food is great.  I had the hangover burger and it was fantastic.  The food is in no short supply either, as I was unable to finish my meal.

Prices are appropriate for what you get.  It's not a steal, but it's not overpriced either.  Overall, very happy with my experience.

Ok so this joint is pretty good. The atmosphere is more of a Cali scene. With Sublime playing and surf boards all around.. it's a small space but they do have outdoor seating available.

Side note: I found out they do not take reservations for a party of 2 for indoor seating. But I'm assuming for large groups there is reservations available.

Now on to the burgers. I got the Philly Cheeseburger 5oz, and Hubs got the Ghost Pepper 10oz. We loved the burgers. Nice and juicy cooked the way we liked/wanted The Philly is amazing basically what it sounds like. I definitely paid more attention to my burger than my fries. But they were good too.

Surprisingly the ghost pepper had a kick to it for the hubs. Which is very rare. This is the guy who likes triple jalapeños on his sandwich and burgers with them being stuffed jalapeños and pepper jack cheese. So he gave it a thumbs up!

Now I know where to go, to get some good burgers!
Just about the best place to get a burger in Scottsdale!  Fun environment with friendly bar staff. Can be tough to get a table but you can't blame them for being awesome!  Everyone should go!
Wanted  to try something different what a Very nice surprise. Enjoyed a Porkster with Dennis a great share burger
LONG wait that really wasn't worth it. I liked the idea of the pretzel bun but it wasn't executed well. Poor service.

I recently went on a trip to Scottsdale and hit this place up again.  I can't even say enough about this place it seriously is so good.  Everytime I go to Arizona the family wants to go here.  This time I got the pbj&bacon burger.  I know it may sound gross but it is so good I crave this burger.  My hubby got the Mac Gnarly burger and he absolutely loved it.  My boys got classic bacon cheeseburgers and they were in heaven.  Trust me this place is so so so so amazing!!!!

My first time at Rehab. A stranger that I met months boasted about this place having one of the best burgers in town. Specifically she told me to get the PBJ which I thought sounded gross. I tried it anyway (smaller version) and it was interesting and fairly tasty. Unfortunately, the burger that I requested to be cooked "medium-rare plus" was more medium-well (see pic) so I didn't enjoy it as much as I probably would have had it been cooked as ordered. Nonetheless, the onion rings were good and the service was cool so giving it 4-stars. Total bill (including $4 tip and almost $7 Stella that I ordered) was $24.24. I would take a 1/2 star away if I could since that's kinda a lot for a meal that I didn't fully enjoy or consume.

The. Best. Burger. I've ever had. In. My. LIFE! The boyfriend and I were in Phoenix for a vacation over Memorial Day weekend. Burgers are our thing so I looked into what Arizona had to offer. I came across Rehab on Yelp and saw it was the highest rated place around us -- of course we decided to come.

We sat outside on the patio, it has a laid back and welcoming ambiance. For starters, we ordered the Chili Con Fritos and Nelson's Verde Con Pollo. Both to die for! The Chili Con Fritos is a dream for anyone experiencing an oh-so-unfortunate hangover. Nelson's Verde Con Pollo is SPICY! But the flavor that comes with it is well worth it!

I ordered the Spicy Mac & Cheese burger on a brioche bun. I forget the name of my boyfriend's burger but in addition to the 10-ounce beef patty, it was topped with shaved rib-eye and a wasabi ranch dressing. He ordered his burger on the pretzel bun. And as I mentioned before, both burgers came with a 10-ounce beefy patty. You can choose a 5-ounce patty, "the relapse" if you prefer a smaller portion.

As soon as I took a bite of my burger, I looked at my boyfriend and said "This is the best burger I've ever had in my life." Something I never thought I'd say, just because I eat so many burgers! But man, this burger had everything. The flavor, the texture, the crunch, the bursting spice of the poblano peppers --- I couldn't ask for more!

Each burger comes with a side --- sweet potato tots or fries are included in the burger price. You can upgrade to various other options if you wish. I chose the sweet potato tots and I am SO GLAD I did. I also had the pesto aioli and chipotle aioli for dipping. They tasted best dipped in the pesto aioli...or maybe the chipotle aioli...I can't decide! It was all just so good!

We topped off the night with the Pot Brownie. It was made with both Hershey's chocolate and Reese's peanut butter cups, topped with marshmallow fluff and ice cream. Oh my goodness. Who came up with this?! Genius, I tell you.

Later on that night, as I was doing my own random burger research (yes, that's how much I love burgers) I came across an article that listed the best burger joint in every state in America. Funny enough, Rehab was the best in Arizona. :)

Needless to say... I WILL BE BACK! I will refer anyone and everyone, and I will gladly speak HIGHLY about my experience at Rehab.
Scottsdale location messed up our take out order for the 3rd time--I'm over this restaurant.

The worst service of my life! If I could give them less than one star I would. It took thirty minutes to get a waitress and forty five minutes to get water. Tons of waiters and waitresses but nobody seems to know what is going on. I am never coming back and would never recommend this place to anyone.
Great sized burgers, large Dr. Pepper drinks, and pretty good fries.

This place is amazing!!!! Burgers are huge!! and absolutely delicious!!!

The service is always impeccable, and the staff is super friendly!
They are usually packed, but even then, food still gets delivered in a couple of minutes. About 10 minutes.

I go to school nearby so I try to come here as much as possible!

We waited an hour to get in to this joint the other night but the wait was worth it. The burgers were excellent. Our server, Shawn, was friendly, funny, and very capable of dealing with a hungry crew of 10. The restaurant was packed so the service was a bit slow, but the food was worth the wait. We recommend the PBJ burger. I had the chicken sandwich which was excellent. Another friend said the Caesar salad was AWESOME. Lots of choices for even the most finicky of eaters. I wouldn't recommend it for the kids though. We bought our 3 year old and although the choices on the menu were ok for him, there is no kid menu. The restaurant is loud and raucous which is great for a night with friends, but not really for kids. Outside where we sat is mostly high tops so it's hard for kids to sit on chairs that high without worrying they are going to fall off. It's like constantly worrying about your drunk friend falling off the chair, except they aren't drunk..and is 3. LOL. Anyway, we are looking forward to going back for a grown-ups night soon! :)

1) service was mediocre. 
2) I did not receive my meal, the owner, not the waiter, had to come and tell me that they didn't have what I ordered after an hour of waiting. 
3) the owner didn't actually make up for anything and said that he was "sorry" 
4) I left hungry and the original waiter never came back to the table after the food was brought because he knew that he had screwed our table over.

I'm giving Rehab Burger 5 stars, first off because their staff is awesome!  Probably the best service I've had in Old Town.  My 3rd visit, and twice Melanie has been our server, she's the best.

Wings, burgers, fish tacos, and the spinach salad, all delicious!  But you have to try the 'Chili Verde Con Pollo' appetizer!  Make sure you bring a friend to share!

Great Happy Hour & patio, cool decor, best of all, no smoking patio!!

Great fun, great atmosphere and fantastic burgers. Just like the story goes, this is a great place to unwind and enjoy friends and ridiculously amazing food after a tough week at work. We will be back!

Horrible service today. Love the burgers but service was terrible and left with no food. Had the Aloha festival this weekend and thought I would get a burger instead of standing in long lines at the festival with my son. I sat down and ordered a burger right away. Server brought waters and never saw her again. Asked the hostess after 25min if the food was going to be longer and she said she would see. Another 10 minutes go by and still no one comes by or checks on us again. Ended up leaving after 35-40minutes. I could understand if it was busy but there were only two other tables with people at them in the front and only couple people outside. Don't think I'll go back again after being disappointed by the service.
Been here 3 times now and this burgers just can't fail,  best in town for sure,  great atmosphere,  great service.

This place is AMAAAAZING. Every time I go I am more and more impressed with their food. Even beyond that the atmosphere is awesome and the staff is always the best. One server in particular stands out above the rest....if you have the opportunity you need to sit in Nick's section. If you can't find him ask for Pickle! He'll make you feel like family and his happy mood is contagious! After eating here and seeing how this place runs, I don't think I can ever go to another burger joint again. If you're looking for a great time and some tasty grub this is definitely the place :-)

-Missy

This was great!  I got the PB&J on a pretzel bun which was everything promised and more.  I'm not used to the siracha heat, so the sweet potato tots were a good pairing to take down the heat in the first few bites.  We sat outside on a very chilly night so we were alternately frozen and then thawed by the heaters.  The server, Kassie, was really nice and ran the whole patio very easily.  We had the brownie to finish off the night, which was a mess (too many layers) and not very good in the end.  But it didn't ruin our night and the whole meal for 3 people was very reasonable.  We'll be back!

Rehab Burger is known for its creativity when it comes to burgers. They've got some crazy concoctions. I'm a traditionalist when it comes to burgers - just give me ketchup, pickle, tomato and lettuce. Their buns and burgers are top quality, the fries are amazing, and the service is very good.

Not too bad.  Lotsa hype, other also commenting they heard about it on the internet.  Service is excellent.  The corn is a treat.  We got the PBJ burger, just what you'd expect it to taste like.  Also, the beefstro with shaved ribeye.  I though I ordered the double, but only one patty plus shaved meat.  Burger meet was ok, this is about toppings. And quantity.  Not bad.  Then again, I may not be in the burger mood.  Ordered rare, although it seemed medium rare.  Slight gastro trouble later in the eve, couldn't swear it was caused by that meal.  If I lived here I would try it again.

I took my friend to dinner here, it was her first time. The food was amazing as always! However the service not so much, which is why I'm giving it three stars. 

I always come during lunch and get great service and I thought it would be the same during dinner. It wasn't. We had an elderly server who seemed very forgetful and flustered. I arrived at 4:30pm this past Friday When I first walked in letting my friend, it took her about 10 mins to realize I was there to take my drink order. 

We ordered our entrees right away, however when our food came out, she didn't bring any napkins or utensils. She came by and asked if everything was good and I asked for some silverware, she said she would be right back. She never came back. 15 mins later, she comes back to refill by water but no utensils. I couldn't eat my side salad cause I had no fork! Not to mention no napkins to wipe my greasy hands! I went to the hostess and asked for some. 

The server took a bit to give us our check, we asked for two checks, she came back with one check. Okay fine, we'll split it no big deal. But she took a good 15 mins to get it, my friend moved it to the other side of the table for her to see we were ready. Another 10 mins go by and she hands us the check... We then realized there was no merchant or customer copy, she never swiped our cards! So we had to wait again for a while until we got her attention again to swipe our cards. Her response was, "I've done that to two other tables just now too!" Good thing we're nice people and didn't dip out due to her mistake. 

I will still come back but I hope I get better service.

Haven't been here in about six months and am wondering why. We ordered the Hawaiian and Jalapeño burgers and they were on point! Burgers came out quick, hot and prepared exactly as we ordered. Frankie, the manager, was excellent as was our server. We will be back, and it won't take 6 months!!

They have a lot of burger options but I wouldn't say any are outstanding. I ordered a burger medium well and it wasn't cooked. As a burger place they should know how to cook a burger properly to how it is ordered. They eventually corrected the order and gave it for free. The service was good but overall experience disappointing.

I gotta say, I was not expecting such great service!  The place was packed so we decided to sit at the bar.  Luckily the hostess followed us because we couldn't find 2 seats together like a fellow customer had thought she'd seen.  She put us in between a couple groups at the long table, one was about to leave anyway.  Service was prompt, food was prepared in a reasonable amount of time and served hot.  Is that too much to ask for?  In Scottsdale, so often it is.  It was refreshing.

The burgers are solid.  I had the chili burger with sweet potato tots.  Love the tots.  They were cooked perfectly.  Burgers were done to order.  I really liked their creative sauces - chipotle(?) aioli, pineapple aioli, spicy ketchup.  We also had the calamari which was great.  The prices are pretty solid too, but the portions make up for it I think.  

We also did the Reese's pot brownie with ice cream.  Get a dollar off if you check in on Yelp btw!  Paid for the ice cream addition.  :)  Its a brownie on top of Reese's I think in a bed of marshmallow fluff topped with ice cream if you add it.  Very sweet, probably nice to share with like 2-3 other people to get a good portion without feeling sick.

All in all, its a worthy establishment that justify the pricing with great service and solid food.  Happy hour deals are mostly just drinks at this point.  A buck off appetizers too, but not great for food as far as happy hour goes.

Updating my review to add the backyard bbq burger - its awesome!  Burger with bbq sauce and a fried onion on top.  YUM!

Great selection of burgers, even build  your own, I had bacon and blue which was mixed in with the patty, son had poblano burger, it was very spicy, he had to take out the spicy onions, fries were excellent and offered with ranch and ketchup, just wish they had better beer selection
Always great. Never just good. Excellent service, clean surroundings and best of all - amazing menu.

Every time we order take away something is cold and the whole meal feels limp.  I've always enjoyed my meal while dining in.  If you want it to go, avoid calling ahead and instead order on the spot and relax at the bar while you wait.  Pineapple aioli and sweet po-TOT-oes for the win!
Best burgers in Scottsdale. Love that pretzel bun easily handles my chili cheeseburger. Burger is flawless, sides are great, service is exceptional

Great all around. The atmosphere, service and food is exceptional. If you're lucky enough, you'll get Kay or Jon as your bartender. They are very good at what they do and truly enjoy your company. Must visit!

Such an original place. Go with an empty stomach...preferably don't eat for a day or so prior because you will be happily stuffed afterwards. Food is awesome, variety is fantastic and a must to visit if you are in the area. Staff is also super friendly.

This is one of my favorite burger places in Tempe! Their sweet potatoes tots are so tasty and you get your money's worth with the HUGE portions. Their drink list is also delicious, and I would recommend the Mai Tai!

Finally got to this location yesterday.  Had to pay a meter to park out front.  Put in an hour but it took longer than that for lunch and dessert.

Had a smaller burger with blue cheese, avocado and a fried egg.  The egg should have been skipped.  I am an egg snob and this was neither a quality egg nor was it prepared well.  The rest including the tots and the dipping sauces was delicious.

For dessert we had the pot brownie with Reeses cup, peanut butter, marshmallow, ice cream and chocolate syrup.   So good the way you burn your mouth on some bites while cooling it with the ice cream at the same time.
Creative burger joint with a cool ambiance. Fun music, tap beer, miss the old style onion rings (extra crunchy) they changed them up so....Regardless, the burgers & fries are great!

Visited the Tempe location today with my boyfriend for the first time and was very impressed. This location was much more spacious. The food was great as always, I actually think they did a better job preparing our food than they did at the Scottsdale location. Our quesadilla was less greasy and more flavorful than the one we ordered last time we went to the Scottsdale location. Our waiter Brandon was awesome. He was very efficient, and courteous. Probably one of the best servers we have had. Both locations are great, but I was very impressed with the new location and the service we were provided with.

Overall, less than impressed. Having been to great places in Chicago, NY, ATL, LA, basically everywhere, my expectations are always high. Food was overcooked and dry. Sauces were all over the place and weren't anything special. The one with pineapple was just weird. 

Highlight of my meal was sweet potato tots. I'm a fan of tots and sweet potatoes. Not sure if they made them in house, but they were good. Beer selection was not focused on quality micros, mostly all main stream junk. Had a Four Peaks that was decent, but that was literally the only microbrew that they carried. Disappointing. 

Overall, would definitely not be back unless I had no choice. Pick another place. Underwhelmed.

My first time here let me tell you it did not disappoint, had the burger with shaved prime rib on it, juicy delicious bomb burger cooked just right ordered it medium and it was really juicy they also threw those delicious southwest chilies on it I love, wings and onion wings were really good too they combined two sauces for our wings that really went well together sweet and savory, beer bar the works, and our waiter was great, can't wait to come back when I'm back in the AZ, from Chicago where we have lots of great burger spots and this is in my top 5....

I went here twice on my visit to Scottsdale! The first time with a group of gals and the second time with my husband. The outdoor patio is cute. The hamburger menu is creative and the 2 different choices I had were both really good. The fries and beers (maybe a few more draft choices?) were good too! Good burger spot!

Great atmosphere but we felt the food was average. The burgers were dry. Served without veggies (unless you ask for them). Fries and sweet potato fries were both ok. Gluten free bun was cool but so dry that I took it off. I'd recommend lettuce wrapped over the GF bun. They have lots of sauces which were fun to try. I wouldn't rush back but might try it again if we were in the area.

I had the chicken sandwich here when I was with my family and was pleasantly surprised! The chicken was tender and flavorful, and the bun was great. 
My family all had burgers and really enjoyed them, although they said it wasn't the best burger they had ever eaten. 
I loved the fries but my sister said they were a bit too salty, so if you like flavorful fries these are for you!

This place is wonderful! I will definitely be going back. The PBJ, bacon and sirracha burger is worth the return. The sweet poToToes are also delicious. Fun atmosphere with friendly staff. What a gem in the heart of old town Scottsdale.

Friggin awesome spot! Great service. Ridiculous burgers. Come hungry!!!!! We got
The pulled pork burger, the ghost burger, and the dude next to us got the double decker monster. Obnoxiously large burgers. So good.

We are in from out of town, and despite being extremely crowded with the Spring Training/Spring Break crowd, the service was excellent and the food was delicious. I don't remember the name of the burger I had, but it was the one with ghostpepper jack cheese, and it had the perfect amount of kick. The onion rings are huge and tasty. Definitely recommend!
The food is good. We has a nice waiter, however... The hostess' were beyond  rude... Smh

Rehab burger is a great place for a burger and wings in Old Town Scottsdale. The patio is small but on a beautiful day is a great place to enjoy a drink. We typically order the Gold Medal Wings and the BYOB. This is the perfect place to eat prior to a spring training game. Enjoy!

This place is awesome!  Went last night with a group of 9. Fun atmosphere, great, quick service and everyone loved their meals. Only minor complaint was the bbq burger was hard for a friend to eat (he said he would have ordered the sauce on the side next time bc the flavor was spot on, just super smothered). I had the Mac n cheese burger-- to die for! My husband had the ghost burger and our kids had plain burgers. We all loved everything and the staff was all on point and very nice.  Sweet potato tots were so good too!  The bill was only $112 for a group of 9, and we were convinced there was a mistake-- nope, just super reasonable prices!! We are on vacation but will be back next time we are in Scottsdale!

If you want a killer burger, this is the place to go. I've never written a restaurant review, but this one is worth taking the time. The sweet potato tots are crispy on the outside and melt in your mouth on the inside. The BBQ burger was insanely good. I can't  wait to go back and try another burger.

We visited the Phoenix metro area from California and I can honestly say my first experience with a Arizona burger joint did not fail to impress.  

The decor is something straight from a typical So Cal beach boardwalk: Lots of wood, surboards, bicycles, VW mini-buses, tiki torches...  All they were missing was the sand!  Plenty of flat screen TV's playing everything from surfing competitions, downhill MTB'ing and other various sporting events.  The overall atmosphere is clean, well presented and very laid back.

We had the Poblano and Mac Gnarly burgers, both of which were HUGE, cooked perfectly and very tasty.  The sweet poTOToes with Pineapple aioli recommended by our waitress were awesome.  The food was excellent, prices are very reasonable and the service was great.

Overall, a fantastic experience.  We'll be back!

We just had to go since we were in town for a therapy conference. We sat down and immediately saw a Rose All Day sign with sparkling rose for $20 a bottle. Then we had some really great service, kind, fun and attentive. We ordered spicy Mac and cheese burgers which were super rich but good. Had a great meal and lots of fun.

Our GO TO place for awesome incredible burgers!  So many options, and all that of them in big or ridiculous big size!  Get there early, very popular and the wait gets long quick, but if you have to wait, it's worth it!!

So what do you want to know about this place.  You walk in and you think yourself at a beach bar in the Caribbean or maybe the Texas coast?  Surf Boards and fish surround this place.  Sadly I didn't not imbibe in their mixed drink selection as I can only tell by the fare they'd be luscious as well.

I forget my Waitress' name but she had this attitude and spunk that was perfect and was packed with tips when asked.  That tells me she at least had eaten something there.

So there's two way about stopping your colon, the 10 oz or the 5 oz.  I went the 10oz route with the Porkster and Tots.  Well everyone got the tots.  My Step-Dad got the Ghost, and girlfriend the Mac and Cheese...oh that mac and cheese was delish, like word.  Maybe I'll just sneak back around and get some of that sometime.

I had been waiting to come here after a long workout and am glad I did so this day.  That Porkster was delicious, 10oz of prime ground juicy beef with cheddar and 8 oz of luscious pulled pork all on a pretzel bun.  Just nom.

Can't go wrong here.

Can I give this place 6 stars?  We had a great experience here the other night. We arrived with a toddler who was really hungry and the owner bent over backwards to accommodate his needs despite having a packed house on a Thursday night.

I had the PBJ burger and my wife had poblano and both were excellent. At first I thought PBJ would be a little gimmicky, and though I'm always seeking out highly-regarded burgers wherever I go, I felt this was something genuinely innovative and well executed.

Visiting from Austin, this place reminded me of a many of our local favorites: Hut's Hamburgers (menu), Hula Hut (tiki bar atmosphere) and Freebirds (decor/quirkiness) with an extensive bar on top of that. 

I returned to get something to go on a Sunday at 3p and every seat at the bar was full along with half the tables so it's no secret that this place rocks.

Fantastic.

If you can put up with the typical Scottsdale vibe in the area, this place is a must! Awesome burgers, fries, and service. This little place does it right. 

The BBQ burger is amazing, but I get the onion rings on the side. It's the perfect setup.

lunch 6/29: 3 of us had wings with "medium" sauce - just right. all had burgers; mine hatch burger - cooked perfectly med-rare, brioche bun and sweet potato tots which were great. one of the best burgers i've had in a long time. grandson had the big 10 0z burger - huge! didn't fade him ate the whole thing in minutes. great place, will be back regularly'
,
We stopped here after a couple drinks next door and the burgers and HUGE and delicious!!  I would strongly recommend tying it out.  Good price too!!

I was her last night, this would have to be the best burger ive had. The atmosphere of the restaurant was cool,chill back like a bob marley theme just made you eat and enjoy the best burger. I orderd the ghost burger with unions rings, pretty spices but enjoyable, i had it made medium well and was brought out exactly that. It was soft and delicious as it had ghost pepper cheese and guacamole, great combination. If others think its expensive dont listen its well worth it, i will be coming here soon again .

So many burgers, so little time. Tried the Hawaiian burger because I've never seen anything on a menu like it. Boy was it good! Topped it off with sweet potato tater tots and the orange creamsicle shake to put me in a food coma. :)

Came here on a Saturday and it was pretty dead at about 10.. the location is great and the food was decent. The portion sizes were huge and we weren't able to take any home since we were checking out the rest of the bars in the area. All in all, it was cheap and portion sizes were huge.

Fantastic food! Amazing service! Quick tea refills! The chicken was the best I've had. Rich flavor! Mac and cheese was very flavorful and spicy. This was our first visit! We would recommend it to anyone or guests for a delicious burger! Tons of options on the menu to choose from and an extensive wine list!

Pretty good..but not amazing?  Then again in NY we are spoiled with tons of great burger options so maybe I'm biased?  Though I will say that I am a fan of the ghost pepper burger and it is not spicy!  Definitely a good use of the pepper in this burger so bravo for that!

Went here for the first time on Saturday. They were decently priced, especially for how big their burgers were! It was a nice little area, it had plenty of parking across the street. Husband had the PB&J burger which he loved. I was the simple soul and just got a cheese burger. We both loved our choices!

IS THIS REAL LIFE...? Y'all... pretty sure we found the best burger place in the valley. The spicy mac n cheese burger was OUT OF THIS WORLD  the staff were all so nice, accommodated us and our puppy, Goose, and were so great. y'all over at Rehab Burger Therapy.... you outdid yourself  20,000 out of 5 stars.

If you're craving a burger, well then you need to get your booty to Rehab Burger Therapy. Super fun vibe and lots of energy in this restaurant. Get their early, it gets busy at lunch. Great people watching too.

I came here last week and ordered the pulled pork and ham sandwich, could only eat half of it, so filling and so delicious. 

Wouldn't recommend bringing kids here, lots of high top tables and chairs, more of an adult hamburger joint.

This was my first time here and I was so impressed. Amazing food and atmosphere. I had bacon burger on a pretzel bun with fresh avocado and sweet potato tots with two awesome dipping sauces. Can't wait to go back with friends.

Absolutely an amazing burger. I decided to go with the ghost pepper burger. Oh man! Delicious but I now know the true meaning of rehab. That lasted a few days. I guess the sweats were pretty noticable because I was brought a cool tall glass of milk. I told them I was a man and didn't need milk! But asked if they could make it chocolate milk. That was the manly thing to do. She threw down on some Hersey's. I was able to save some dignity while putting the fire out. All and all, an outstanding burger and will definitely be in to get some chocolate milk again.

Best burger i have ever eaten!!  PBnJ burger...sounds bizarre but holy canoli...DELICIOUS!  And our server Tearin was great!  Very friendly and knowledgeable.  The sweet potato tater tots r really good too!

This place is so good! Went here yesterday and found out they have happy hour everyday of the week from 11 am - 6 pm, can't beat that!
