Not only are their burgers good but I think that they have the best onion rings in all of Arizona and my boyfriend said the same thing about their sweet potato tots. I got the relapse size chili cheese burger, and my boyfriend got the relapse size of the porkster burger (yes a burger topped with pulled pork lol) and both were still huge and so delicious. This isn't typically a regular spot for us because we leave in a food coma but we love it every time we come!

My Arizona experience continues. Was craving a really good hardy burger at the end of class today and this was one the first places that came up on Google. Called in a to go order for the Rehab Burger Mushroom Swiss style on the pretzel bun. Didn't realize how far this was from my hotel, but it was worth it. They really do make a very tasty burger here! I will have to make at least two more trips to this place before I head back to Southern California.
Great food but the ac must not work. Sweating while eating is no bueno. Wont go back till winter for sure. Veggie burger was ok should not deep fry it. Corn on the cob was super but that's about all

Loved this place!  Was even able to enjoy sitting outside on a cold night.  Had one of the coupons for an appetizer, 2 entrees and dessert.

Tried:
skin on fries - GOOD

Shelby's Spinach Salad - huge, beautiful and GOOD

Hatch Chili burger on Gluten Free Bun- He was in HEAVEN

Sweet Potato Tater Tots- SERIOUSLY AMAZING.  I don't even care for sweet potato french fries but something about this being mashed up in the middle and crunchy on the outside with salt.  I can't wait to have them again.

Pineapple Teriyaki Aoli - SERIOUSLY AMAZING 2.  I am slightly allergic to pineapple and don't like mayo at all so I almost never like aoli.  This dip with the tots is the bomb.  

Ketchup - what's there to say?

Spicy Ketchup - okay.  what you would expect.

Chipotle Ranch - My second favorite dip.

Chocolate Lava milkshake with a shot of Bailey's - YUMMMM

They had run out of pot brownies by the time we wanted dessert and that made me really sad.  I guess it gives us a reason to return soon though.

*This is not a fancy burger place! Come here in sandals or feel super over dressed.

I came here for a work event recently, and I know it's been in Scottsdale forever but I somehow have never stopped by. The interior is like that of a beach shack, they specialize in burgers clearly, but they also have a lot of other options like fish tacos and some fried appetizers. 

I ordered the margatini which was pretty much everything I like in a glass, a fancy martini glass at that! I don't really know where my aversion to frozen beverages came from, but I hate frozen margaritas, and I'm so happy they have a different option. But, that being said, all my coworkers loved their frozen drinks. 

We ordered the calamari and chips and salsa to start. The calamari was excellent, the chips and salsa weren't anything special. For entrees many people did the BYOB and sweet potato tots, they all looked amazing! I ordered a turkey burger with a lettuce "bun" and their onion rings. I loved the turkey burger itself, but the lettuce wrap was more like a bunch of little lettuce pieces, like a salad. The onion rings with the chipotle aioli are a must! 

We as a group skipped dessert. I will say this was reasonably priced and the serving sizes were huge. For a super casual vibe and quick service I'll definitely come back.

Worst Service Ever our waitress was rude to me because I had a hard time hearing her when we were ordering.  They brought our food and no utensils or napkins. My burger was raw and my husband ordered a second cocktail that didn't show up until our bill came. We came here last year during Spring Training and thought it was wonderful my how things changed in a year!

Love the service! 

We were immediately seated upon arrival. The environment made us feel like we were next to the beach and having a burger. Our server was so adorable and very friendly.

We ordered the spicy mac and cheese burger with regular fries and I ordered the Hawaiian burger with pretzel bun along with sweet potatoe tots. We waited about 5-10 minutes and our delicious looking food came to us. My server also included different sauces for me to try. 

The sweet potatoe tots were yummy with the Ketchum and by itself. They weren't crispy tots but a little on the soft side. Our burgers were hard to hold and eat so we just cut them up. My Hawaiian burger was a little bland, so it helped that I had a pickle to kick in some flavor. My friend couldn't find her patty under the mounds of mac and cheese she received between her hamburger bun, but she said it was pretty good! However, the amount of carbs were getting to her. What I liked most was our burgers were not disgustingly greasy and I didn't feel the nasty heaviness you usually feel after eating an epic burger.

Would really love to come back and try the other burgers though :)  love the friendliness and the ambience.

I've heard so many good things about this place, and so I was super excited to try it out. Went there today and ordered a Mushroom and Swiss burger and fries. 
Burger was over cooked and not even exceptionally warm anymore. Fries were good. Server looked like she was either having a bad morning or still waking up, at 11:30am. 
The grilled cheese my boyfriend ordered was pretty solid, but the milkshake could use something more than Hershey's syrup and milk with a scoop of vanilla. 
Overall a pretty meh experience :/

First impressions mean a lot to me and when I went there I was disappointed. The flamboyant guy who sat us down was rude  to us. First he skipped us and waited on the people behind us. (Mind you that there's always a long line to get in.) I simply asked him how seating works and he raised his voice to us, then he sat us in the back by the restroom isle. 
Our waiter was extremely great though. He introduced us to the place and went over the menu with us. He's the only reason why I'm giving it 2 stars. 
The food wait wasn't that long given the huge amount of people in there, so that wasn't an issue. Now the food just lacks flavor. I am from New Orleans and I am used of flavor. My bacon burger on a pretzel bun was just bland. I only enjoyed the side order of onion rings. Overall my burger was messy. 
I'm going to stick to David's Hamburgers and Mexican Food on Main Street.

Thought the rating here on yelp was too high. Great service but the food was not worth the high ratings. Pretzel bun lacked that pretzel flavor (probably not enough salt in the dough) and the Jamaican corn was wrinkly and missing that plump juiciness you expect from corn. Also the mushrooms on my burger tasted like they came from a can... Pretty disappointing.
Fantastic atmosphere. Amazing food. Well priced. Very slow service- good thing the setting was great.

Horrible. As an out-of-towner, very surprised that this place was PACKED. Sat outside, comfy. Then the server scratches HIS BALLS with NO SHAME in front of us. Not just a quick scratch, but a lengthy one so that we can actually notice him doing this IN OUR FACE.
I don't know why we stayed to eat, probably because someone else brought our food. It was greasy and unflavored. Just horrible. Especially since I went off of the reviews on Yelp to pick this place.
Would NEVER recommend!!!

My son and I came in for a burger based on the reviews and they didn't lie.  The burger was amazing.  The server, I wish I could remember his name was super funny and guided us through the house specials and best options.  They have banquet style seating for big parties and smaller 4 personal tables for smaller parties.  Out door patio if you want some fresh air Highly recommend!

Divine burgers, great bar staff (we sat at the bar and the bartenders were friendly, accomodating and fun).  Hubby had the Hangover Burger and raved about it.  I had the Chili Cheeseburger which was yum and also had the sweet potato tator tots. 

Also, the bartenders are very, very generous with their pours which was cool.  The atmosphere, decor, food, music and vide was fun.  We had a great time and hope to return someday soon.  Living in Denver, where there are a lot of fantastic burger places, this was a gem and highly recommend.
my only problem with the place is the Margarita's were way over priced and should be in a Margarita glass not a tall soda glass bartending 101 the food and service was perfect
Turkey Jalapeno Mac-n-Cheese burger with Green Chilis, Siracha Mayo, and Poblano Peppers on a Pretzel Bun. Or some combination of all of that.  This place is ridiculous!
Spicy Mac N  cheese burger is so ono!  Would have loved to have had the moco Loco burger they are featuring this weekend.  Winner winner no matter!  Ask for Alyssa, she's awesome!

Thursday's are all day happy hours! Went here for the first time last night, it was great! I got the PBJ and Bacon with a turkey burger instead and the slaw. The burger was amazing, the slaw was very blan- I wouldn't pay the up charge for it again. Our server was super peppy, smiley and helpful. We will be back!

So, the reviews are spot on...this place is amazing!  We stopped by today right when they opened and snagged a great table on the patio with our pooch...the host recommended a super dog friendly table and brought out some water for her.  Our server was great - friendly, efficient and so nice to our dog.  The food was fantastic too...we tried the chili cheese fries to start (don't judge...we went to the gym that morning) and each of us had the hawaiian turkey burger - one on a pretzel bun and one on a wheat bun with sides of fries.  The portions were really large (I took half of my burger home) and everything was made fresh.  This is a great spot to enjoy the nice weather on the patio with some good food and drinks or inside to catch the games.  Definitely worth a visit!

A friend and I decided to try this place out since the staff at Scottsdale HonorHealth highly recommended it. 

We were staying at the hospital for training, and it was great that this place was just around the corner from us. The interior decoration is like a beach hang-out theme, which I totally digged, but I felt like this would appeal more to party-goers and college students... ANYWAY, we were totally blown away with the amount of choices this place has to offer. I couldn't decided between three items until I finally settled for the turkey burger. (There's actually a PBJ and bacon burger on their menu ) IT IS HUGE! And it was very good for a turkey burger. I really liked the sweet potato tots they gave me, I was totally hooked.

I wouldn't mind coming out to this restaurant again in the future and would say this is definitely a place to check out at least once when you're in Scottsdale.

This place is so good! Great food great vibe. Overall a super enjoyable experience, servers are great super friendly and helpful. Food is delicious, burgers are grilled and delicious, fries crisp and addictive, and the best onion rings I've ever had! 10/10 would come again!

The bacon cheeseburger was very good except the bacon. Even though it had good flavor, it was closer to beef jerky than bacon.
My friends swiss mushroom burger was killer.
Other buddy's gargonzola bacon burger wasn't. The cheese and the bacon were suppose to be in the beef paddy but we never saw either.
We got a side of onion rings and they were very tasty but they had more hard breading than I like. I prefer a thinner more delicate  breading. 
The fries were top notch; nothing to complain about. 
Over all, if you are in the mood for a great big burger and fries, you can't go wrong with Rehab.

I'd give this place a four star review, with the deductions coming from service and partially the food. This time I ordered the ghost burger rehab style which is only one patty. The burger was plenty spicy and I enjoyed it, however, the burger was not well done as I requested. There was some link in the burger and the fries were cold. Aside from that it was a great experience, although I anticipate Wait staff to be a little more attentive and bring out hot sides. I personally  convinced a friend of mine to come and he was pleased except for the service. Gentlemen serving us seemed complacent or Like he was ready to go. I understand as we've all been there, although if you want to attract repeat customers you have to show them attention. Just a thought....

Holy moly!!! If you get a cheat meal, this is the place. Every calorie is so worth it.
We had the BYOB with peppers, an egg and the sweet potato tots.
And a ghost burger... Again with the sweet potato tots, even though the fries looked good too. The burger wasn't even that spicy, but had a great flavor with a generous portion of avocado. 
Order the spicy ketchup too!

Service was absolutely stellar! We were seated sooner than anticipated and even though the place was packed, we were served in a timely fashion.  Having read previous reviews I was anticipating a euphoric experience with a juicy, tasty burger.  The burger itself was a little dry and was not seasoned.  French fries were frozen shoe-string and sweet potato tots (also frozen) were very tasty.  I want to give this restaurant a 3 1/2 star rating but Yelp doesn't do half-stars.

I actually wasn't a huge fan of this place. The food was mediocre. They have a lot of options but I didn't think either my fiancé or my burger tasted great. I had the mac and cheese burger and he had the ghost pepper burger. One plus is that the ghost pepper burger was hot. Also, the hot wings were good. 

I was also disappointed that all their salads had so much junk in it. Not one single healthy salad option on the menu. I ordered a side salad with my burger and the lettuce tasted dirty and unwashed. 

We also ordered a Bloody Mary which we never got. They seemed understaffed and this was a Monday night. 

Wouldn't come back but didn't hate it or love it.
Great burgers, great service, and delicious fries! Will definitely come back again! :)

Just had a great lunch. Bacon cheeseburger added a onion ring and 3 Coronas. My wife had a BBQ burger and a Bloody Mary. Everything tasted great. Service was spot on and a friendly staff. The atmosphere was a fun tropical vibe and very clean.

If I could give zero stars I would. I ordered the spicy Mac and cheese burger, which I've had in the past, tonight it was so spicy there was no flavor so I asked to sub it out for a different burger. I took one bite of the Mac and cheese not even the burger. The manager came over after already putting in my replacement burger and actually shouted in my face that I ordered wrong and he would charge me for both burgers but would not take the first burger off. When I asked to cancel the new one he said they were already making it and I would have to take both. He continued to yell I did not know how to order and this was not his fault in front of every. I cried and I will never go back.

I'm not too easily impressed by burger pubs, but this place was really fantastic. My grilled chicken sandwich was exceptionally delicious, the sweet potato tots in honey mustard aioli were great, the server was helpful and funny, and the atmosphere is chill with cool decor and great music that isn't too loud. Highly recommend!

This is one of my favorite places to grab lunch! 

My boyfriend and I always start out with a basket of fries (half regular, half sweet potato). It's great because it comes with sauces - I think you get to choose three - and the fries are always so crispy and delicious. Sometimes we come JUST for the fries. 

If you're feeling adventurous, try the mac n'cheese burger. It's cheesy and messy and might give you a heart attack on your way home (they don't call it Rehab for nothing), but it's soooo good.  Another thing I love is their Gluten Free buns - they don't crumble or fall apart while you're eating your burger, which can be hard to find. 

The burgers are really rich in flavor, so I tend to split one with friends. It's usually really busy, but if there's a wait, it's worth your time! Parking isn't the best, but there's a lot nearby that you can park in and just walk over.

Rehab Burger Therapy is a really good burger place in Scottsdale.  A bite expensive, but well worth it.   We ordered the Mac and Cheese Burger and a Philly Cheese steak Burger.  Both are excellent.  Mac and Cheese has just enough spices to make the burger sit up and take notice.  And the sweet potato tots are to die for.  The Philly Cheese Steak burger is very tasty.  It's a lot of meat.  It comes with a burger patty and Philly Cheese steak on top of it.   I will definitely come back here.  The Onion ring is not as good.  It has too much batter for my taste.

Great burgers, great fries, sauces, and drinks. So far, my favorite burger in the Valley - this includes in-n-out, the Stand, paradise valley burger company, and the other familiar franchises.

The service was outstanding. Some of the best i've experienced in a long time
The burgers were huge and they have pretzel buns! I had the veggie burger and the patty was yummy and not too crumbly. Sweet potato tots delish! Fast and friendly service too.

Another one of my favorite places to bring guests from out of town. They have great appetizers, beer and food! I got their wings with golden sauce. Everybody LOVED them. The atmosphere is like going to and island. It's awesome. There is lots of free parking nearby too.
Amazing!!! If you're in the Scottsdale area this place has really good burgers. The Mac and cheese burger with the tater tots was awesome!

Tried out Rehab finally for a nice Sunday brunch with some friends. The atmosphere was fun and beachy, which is a nice twist for Old Town. Parking is tough so expect to wait a little bit.

As for the meal, the burger is huge and absolutely love the pretzel bun twist. That might have been the best part of my meal. I tried to BBQ burger and it was decent, a little over cooked for my liking.  I also highly recommend the onion rings as a starter for the table to share! Lastly, I ordered a beer with my meal and I waited, waited, and it never came. The server finally realized but at that point I was almost done with my meal. If some of these things get fixed, my review may be able to get to 4 stars.

Great burgers, sides, and staff. Went here for lunch with my family today and we will be going back for sure. This is a family friendly restaurant with reasonably priced foods. I had the PBJ and bacon burger and it tasted exactly how I imagined. A+

I have been to this restaurant 3 times, each time bringing friends that haven't tried it. The first experience was great! The second and third time have been very disappointing. The food has always been really good, but the last 2 times we have waited over 40 minutes for our food! Both times they have not said anything about the long wait. Both times, other tables that arrived after us have received their food first. I actually asked the server about it this last time and she just made excuses. No apology! I'm sorry but it shouldn't take 40 minutes to make 4 burgers! I won't be back! BTW, we were there at 3:00 on a Sunday afternoon so it wasn't like it was super busy.

This is a bar type atmosphere like Cheers but the food is out of this world. Within 15 minutes I had met the owner and head chef and they were really great people. Then I got the Calimari which is meatier and better flavored than any I have ever had. I thought that was great but then the pulled pork sandwich with fries showed up along with my wife's bacon cheese burger. My mouth was druling over the Bar-B-Q sauce on the fries when my wife made me try her hamburger. WOW! Finally I dug into my pulled pork. In order to understand how good this is you need to know that I am a true redneck that smokes pork, beef and poltry weekly at home. This Bar-B-Q  sauce was so smokey and delightfully spicy that I told the owner he should get it bottled. He then brought me a 20 Oz cup of it to take home for free. Seriously I just went into this place due to the name and I wanted a beer. I will make the 60 mile round trip here regularly because this makes my Bar-B-Q suck in comparison.
This place is great. Amazing patio, delicious burger. Place is more than packed on sat after spring training game and still phenomenal service with a smile from our server Lauren!

it rained and we were outside was put into another table with another couple; but overall food was good and experience and interaction with a different couple was good... So over all was a great eating experience and the food was good!

I had the turkey burger and it was awesome! Not dry at all. Our server was really cool and the tator tots were delicious! Great atmosphere and great food! The reason for the four star was the the burger was almost too big. It was hard to take a bite because it was piled high with stuff. Most people enjoy this but I like food that I can actually bite in and not food that I have to cut down. Food was delicious though! I will be back!

I don't think I've ever been addicted to a burger joint before. I've never categorized myself as a "burger person". This place has converted me! I've decided one of my life goals is to try every burger on the menu. 

So far my favorite is the PB&J bacon burger--it sounds insane, but it's just insanely good! The Mac and Cheese burger is bomb too! I love the pretzel bun. Sweet potato tots with their special sweet sauce is heaven. The fries are delicious too, so either choice is a win. You can eat lighter and choose healthy subs like a salad for your side, and a smaller patty with a whole wheat bun.

Last time I was there, I wasn't sure what I wanted to drink before heading out to a comedy show with friends. I just knew it was cold outside, I was getting sick, and I needed a boost of energy. The bartender custom made my drink: coffee, peppermint liqueur, whiskey, and whipped cream. It was one of the best Winter drinks I've ever had! Every server I've encountered here seems to enjoy working here, they are helpful figuring out what to order and always friendly. 

The bathroom offers fresh hand towels, perfect for freshening up after a hike at nearby ASU mountain. Reggae/rock music for an awesome island vibe. A full bar, outdoor seating, and tucked away from the noisy nightlife of Mill Ave, but close enough too all the action that DT Tempe has to offer. 

I'm hooked! You just have to try it!

The sweet potato tots were amazing! All the different sauces they have are really good too. The burger was good but nothing too special I've definitely had better being from Chicago. I'd go back again to try different burgers though, I had the hangover.
Their burgers are amazing...you won't be disappointed!  Bartender was cool and staff was very engaging.  I'll be back!
I had lithe ghost burger but substituted chicken for beef. It was Amazing! Highly recommend and will be back again.

The "porkster" burger with the fries is absolutely delicious. I would recommend Rehab Burger Therapy for lunch or dinner. There are 2 different sizes of burgers. The patio at night is great even with cooler weather with the heaters. 10/10 recommend!!!

AMAZING!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! 
This is a fun place with great food. The owners are there and come over to say hi, the wait staff was friendly. A lot of people have gien bad reviews because it takes a little bit to get your food, this is a BUSY place, and the food is cooked fresh. So it will take a little bit of time, NO DRIVE THRU, this isn't a fast food place. Come in sit down, relax and enjoy the people you are with and have a GREAT meal!
Oh my god I love this place! Fantastic Mac and cheese! PB&J BURGER TO DIE FOR! Great atmosphere!

This place is awesome. Craving a burger and fries spot in Scottsdale? This is it.  The atmosphere is chill, the food is always great.  I highly recommend the Backyard BBQ Burger and their sweet potato tots with the chipotle mayo - so so good. Only drawback to this spot is that service can get a little slow on a slower night - but we never cared because the staff was so nice, the food was so good, and the atmosphere was so on point we didn't want to leave.

I went there the first time with two of my friends who had previous been.  The environment is very laid back, with serves in jean shorts and boat shoes.  The place itself isn't very big, and there's outside seating available, but we sat inside.  
Despite the waitress not looking old enough to drink, she gave me a good recommendation to go with my turkey burger and sweet potato tots.  The burger itself was perfectly done and delicious, but not knock out amazing.  My friend has the PB&J burger, which, if I go back, I think I'm going to indulge in.
The onion rings are HUGE and perfectly done and the side sauces are pretty inspired.  
Definitely stop by if you're in the area and craving a burger.
Dig your toes in the sand and sink your teeth into one of Americas best burgers. Not big on TV's, beers are cheap, and service is always on point. Relax and Rehab

One of the best burger joints I've ever been! With their specialty burgers every Sunday and their amazing staff, it's hard to stay away. It gets busy fast! And seats are limited. So I'd advise getting there early or expecting a little wait. To recommend, the Spicy Mac 'n Cheese burger is so good and gooey and the Jalapeño Popper burger is a favorite. Good fun place for singles, families, or couples. Always recommend when friends and fam are in town.

Went here with a massive hangover....left feeling great!! The onion rings were legendary.....I ordered the Mac gnarly burger, and it was the size of a human head. Leftovers for dinner! A definite thumbs up!
Bacon PB & J burger on a pretzel bun was amazing! Wow. Their fries are delicious as well. Reasonably priced, too for the quality of food you're getting.

Second time coming in to visit Rehab Burger Therapy.  During the first visit we were largely ignored by the server - he only stopped by our table after we had been sitting there for 10 minutes, didn't check on us after food was delivered, didn't refill our drinks, and only came back to drop the check.  The fries came out cold so we had to flag down another server to get fresh fries.  To their credit the manager/owner ended up comping the meal for us.  She asked that we give them another try to correct their shortcomings.

The second visit the fries came out cold again (I even tried a fry right when the plate hit the table).  The same manager replaced the fries for us, but again this server didn't check on how we were doing after the food was delivered.  The burgers themselves were okay, but for the price I expected something special.  I've had better at other burger joints in the area.

Burgers: 6/10
Fries: 3/10
Service: 3/10


I wanted to like this place because of all the other positive reviews, but I can't say that I'll be back.

My family was in town for spring training this weekend and when I read the menu for this restaurant online we HAD to stop in.

The wait for a table was about 15-20 minutes so we decided to just sit at the bar and eat. The bartender/server was super nice, attentive and had a great sense of humor!!

I love all the TVs in the place. Very fun tropical atmosphere. The bar area was just super cute.

I had the chili cheese fries for my meal and wow the chili is amazing!! I believe they said it was their own recipe and it was soooo good. I'll definitely be back the next time I'm in town!

Tractor pulled pork is my favorite permanent menu item, as their sauce is rich and tangy but sweet enough to balance it well. Sweet Potato tots, are you kidding me? So amazing! And their happy hour is one of the best in Scottsdale! Pb&j Sriracha burger is not for the squeamish, it's messy, it's spicy, and it's daring, but a must-try for any gourmet burger lovers.

Went for son's birthday dinner special treat...there was hardly any wait...got seated quickly and orders were taken promptly...great service and attention to customers...food was decent...I tried Zinburger and was not particularly impressed with it...I am not big on eating burgers and compared to five guys; in-out this would be OK burger spot based on the taste of food...would not really seek it out to eat next time but would not be averse to trying out another time with different selection from the menu..kids friendly and ample parking outside....lines start to form after 6:30p

The food was alright. We ordered chips and salsa they never came. The waitress took it off the bill. I had the pulled pork, the bun was soggy and there was no taste of pineapple in any of the sauces. There was too much meat on the sandwich when it came but that's just personal preference.  The sweet potatoes tots were disgusting, and soggy. Perhaps they were undercooked. The place was crowded and very noisy.

I've been wanting to try Burger Rehab for a while. With so many positive reviews, I was absolutely sure it won't be a disappointing experience and it was indeed a very good one. 

My husband and I were in the area so we decided to finally try it for lunch. We went pretty late, it was around 3:00pm when we got there. Restaurant had some occupied tables inside and outside. The first thing you'll feel when you sit and start looking at the menu is how relaxing the atmosphere is. The laid back music & staff contribute to this feel,
I like it! 

I checked in on Yelp and I was happy to find out there was a free chips and salsa offer for checking in. Our waitress (who was great) asked if we'd like to add guacamole and we did. Soon after that, the drinks and chips, salsa and guacamole came out. I must say, their chips was fresh and the guacamole was great! It looked and tasted like it was just made! Great job you guys. 

We took our time to look at the menu. My husband ordered their mushroom and Swiss burger, I with so many limited choices due to dietary constraints now, had to go for a less exciting option which was he build your own and I say less exciting only because of what I am allowed to pick! My burger was basically your standard burger with tomatoes, and a small twist, grilled onions. On the side both my husband and I decided to order fries and I asked for some spicy pineapple BBQ sauce on the side. 

The burgers came out after a little while and we dug in. The taste of the meat was great. You could tell it's meat (vs fat!). The fries were cooked fresh and the BBQ sauce was super! Overall I enjoyed the burger but wasn't absolutely wowed and I say that and insist that it's not because their burger is not good but because I would have liked a funky burger rather than my basic one. This is how I'm impressed usually! 

My husband enjoyed his meal a lot and was very pleased with his choice. 

Definitely worth going to especially if you could try their mouth watering options. Oh and by the way, their salads (which a lot of ppl decided to order) looked amazing! I might try one of them next time! 

Good food, great service and a relaxing atmosphere! Well done!

Just had the porkster with sweet potatoe fries. The burger was cooked perfectly. Pork and BBQ said we as good but not great. Friend had the Hangover. Said it was fantastic. The egg and green chile were cooked perfectly. Service was great. Sides came out wrong and they gave us an extra side. No questions asked.
Not your traditional burger. Great selection excellent atmosphere and fun environment!! Great for the adventurous eater!! Try the macaroni and cheese burger!! Would recommend for the entire family!!

Hike up Camelback Mountain, been on a super healthy kick the past 2 weeks. 
Enough Turkey and chicken, I need a burger and I told my girl i knew EXACTLY where to go. I've eaten here 4 times now, good solid burgers. 

Sat on the patio, ordered a couple of Hop Knot IPA and waited for our burgers.
Now I don't want to under sell my poblano burger, which was good, but my wife ordered the Peanut Butter and Jelly Burger with THICK cut bacon.

WTF???  The combination of these 3 flavors work so incredibly well together it made me dizzy. I didn't even want to eat mine. Mind blowing good. All the melted peanut butter and jelly that dripped out of the burger and onto the plate made a great dipping sauce for the fries too!!

Out of all the burgers I have eaten in my 40 year old life, this will make my top 3 of all time. Shout out to our awesome waiter Pickle for being so awesome too!

Oh my gosh! Burgers are giant! And so was the club sandwich I had. The fries were awesome, love fries with the skin on. Just wasn't crazy about the sitting. Wish they had more booths. But the long table counter type doesn't create much eating enjoyment because kinda impersonal. The prices were very good  considering the amount of food you get. I would come back.

Discretion: this place would likely get a solid 3 -4 Star likely if I had ordered what they are known for and that is their BEEF...


Great service great atmosphere and great fries.. only reason these guys get a 3 is due to the fact  I ordered a turkey burger and it was easily the worst turkey burger I have ever had .... seasoned with who knows what .way way over the top..

Will be back to give it another shot with a burger this time

i don't ask much in my search for the perfect burger. Yes, it's nice to dine in a well kept restaurant. It's also enjoyable when the staff is interactive and friendly. A buzzing atmosphere is always a nice touch. 

But when it comes down to it, when I'm looking for the Taj Mahal of burgers, it all balances on what is served. And let me tell you, RBT knows how to serve a burger that will satisfy your deepest bovine desires. 

The menu is full of unique and staple burger offerings. The one that caught my attention, however, was the PBJ and Bacon burger. Upon reading the burger's description,  I felt more conflicted than a Southern Baptist at a Castro District drag show. 

"Wait a minute, PBJ does not belong on a burger!" 
"What?! The patty is drenched in sriracha?!" 
"I can get it with a pretzel bun as well?!"

The universe, as I saw it, was collapsing everywhere I looked. None of this made any sense to my respectable burger palate, and I yearned to taste this forbidden concoction of beef, bacon, thai hot sauce, and pb&j. Not to be outdone by the unique burger, I forewent the pedestrian side of fries and ordered the Jamaican corn to accompany my otherworldly dish.

What happened when dinner was served is somewhat of a blur. No, I was not intoxicated (in the traditional sense) - I can only compare it to the moment when you first meet your soulmate. That moment you will never forget, but cannot remember to the fullest detail. With my very first bite, my synapses were firing at a rate that a M134 Minigun couldn't match. My eyes bulged with intense fulfillment, my skin emitted a cool sweat of indulgence, and I could have sworn I heard the faithful tune "Take my Breath Away" ringing in my subconscious state of euphoria. I had found it, the perfect burger was in my grasp and I felt unworthy. 

The burger, like most fleeting romances, was gone before I could sincerely take in the magnitude of this event. Fortunately, the Jamaican corn was still at my disposal, and may God turn me into a horny toad if that side wasn't an outstanding compliment to the burger. Now the Jamaican corn wasn't from the same metaphysical realm from which the PBJ and Bacon burger originated, but it was more like a swan song for my recently departed dish, an ultimate tribute for the tantric experience of RBT.

RBT delivered when it counted most, and I'm not talking about a swift thrill, I'm talking about the kind of satisfaction that is almost melancholy, as if my burger pilgrimage was finally complete. Time will only tell if this is true, but until then, RBT is the home of my favorite burger.
P-Nut Butter Jelly Burger w/ Pretzel Bun . Don't forget to get the sweet potato tater tots .

We stopped by Rehab Burger Therapy for dinner before our Segway Tour and it did not disappoint!  It has a surf vibe decor and a large bar. I can't remember the exact prices, but we hit a good happy hour deal on Thursday around 5pm.  My veggie burger came with sweet potato tots which were delicious! I would definitely recommend.

Great place, great service. 
My Poblano Burger was perfect, and I enjoyed the sweet potato tots. Ask for Courtney, she was amazing!

Went for lunch today and everyone was pleased with their orders! We all shared the homemade nacho chips and salsa! Very crunchy and tasty. The salsa had a little bite to it but good! I hid the piglet Wings and they were delicious! They are actually riblets and the pineapple salsa is baked into them. They are more than enough for a meal! My husband had the chili hamburger and he enjoyed it very much! The chili was coming out the sides and he couldn't finish the whole sandwich! Onion rings huge! Service was attentive and friendly!

Solid drinks, great food. Burgers are huge, sometimes messy, but always satisfying. You'll need a nap after the food here...happy zzzz's
Chicken wings are awesome here, so is the calamari. All the burgers are great here. Sweet tots are also a great side option.
Vibe is chill and friendly. Small place though, so expect a wait during prime times and days. It's worth it!

We picked this restaurant passed on the Yelp reviews and were not disappointed.  Walked into a busy restaurant on a Monday afternoon of Spring Break.  The hostess was great about getting a table cleaned off for us quickly though.  We were seated and immediately greeted by a friendly server.  We ordered the Corona Ritas because why not!  There were great.  My son had the wings and mixed 2 sauces on our server's recommendation.  He LOVED them.  My daughter had a plain burger and I had the Hatch Chili Burger.  The burgers were so good!  The meat is very favorable and tender.  Fries were good but not the best I've ever had.  Love the vibe of the restaurant too.  We almost went back while we were in town but didn't want to be lame.  Ha!  Wish we had though.

Situation:
- Dinner with friends (October 2017)
- One of my friends ordered a burger, I ordered the Grill Chicken Sandwich
- We are at the bar

Pros
- The service is fantastic
- Large portions of food area nice
- Not a bad beer selection
- My friend really enjoyed his Burger

Cons
- The grilled Chicken Sandwich was just okay, which makes sense at a burger place (the bread that was used was really nice, the chicken was a bit overly cooked)
Looks like a surfer joint.  Great decor.  Fantastic staff.  Delicious burgers!  Each come with a side and a pickle.  Whatever you order, put it on a pretzel bun.  Yum!!!

This is my husband favorite place to eat when we fly into AZ. This visit didn't disappoint. The place was packed mid afternoon but the wait wasn't long. Took a while for our server to actually get to us but the sun was shining and we soaked up the heat from our seats on the patio. We had the mac and cheese with our P&J burger: delicious!
Service was very prompt tonight & food very good.. Excellent drinks..menu is large with many choices..different size burgers available is always a plus

They were able to get our large party of 13 in on a Saturday night; this is not an easy task for many places in Scottsdale. 80% of our party got burgers and not one complaint was heard... I got the spicy mac and cheese and wowza, was it spicy. You better like spice if you order this one - I really liked it a lot.
The staff was very nice and they did a good job getting our food out to us all about the same time, this is important to me since it's nice to start eating together.

Fantastic experience in Old Scottsdale.  I had the mac n cheese burger and it was incredible.  You can't eat like this too often if you're over 30 or you'll be 400 lbs.  But for that once in a  while throw-caution-out-the-window decadent burger experience, it's awesome.  Also the management and staff are unsurpassed in service and hospitality.  It's worth the wait.

Sat outside because it was a cool day, not sunny, unfortunately the misters completely wet my pants and toes, so I don't recommend sitting outside. 

The waitress was very nice and attentive, so good job on the customer service for that visit. 

Fries and sweet potato tots were the best of anything else we ate. I was not raving about the burgers, and I wanted to try this place out because it was considered to be best burgers, unfortunately I asked for my burger medium and I got well done, it was so dry and I could taste the burnt spots throughout my burger. That alone ruined the taste of my basic bacon cheese burger, because there was no flavor at all or juiciness to it. 
The ghost burger was decent but also could've been made a bit juicier and less cooked. But atleast the flavoring of the cheese and guacamole overcame the dryness. 

Just wouldn't recommend going if looking for a good flavorful burger because they are overlooked and have no flavor to the patty.

Visiting family and we were looking for a place to grab some food in the Scottsdale area.  Found Rehab Burger Therapy on Yelp and decided to hit it. 

Very cool place.  Definitely has personality here.  Bicycles hanging on the ceiling.  The staff was great, lots of beer selection.  The burgers were fantastic!  I had the Hangover Burger Relapse with their taters.  Let me tell you, the relapse size was perfect bc then I had room to eat the taters dipping them into the various sauces they have.  The spicy ketchup is delicious!  Everyone at our table were very happy with their choice of burgers.  Big, juicy, and perfectly cooked all of them.

This place is great if you want a casual burger joint in the Scottsdale area.

After hearing lots of people rave about Rehab Burger therapy I figured I would take my family and try it out .. it was Mothers Day so sort of busy but we got seated right away on the patio .. our server brought us waters quickly and we ordered .. he brought my kid's drinks right away and some how forgot my drink and my friend's drink.. so after we reminded him he finally brought us our order .. food was good I got the PB & J burger and it was pretty good .. I thought I ordered sweet potato fries as did my daughter and we were served sweet potato tots.. oh well .. 
never heard a Hppy Mother's Day either lol ..
Anyway it was good but I think I'll try a few other places before coming back ..

I've become a regular at this place, and for good reason. If you want a new take on burgers, rehab is the place to check out. All of the staff keep a laid back and chill mood. Very nice and they deliver great service. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Plus, they have a great happy hour and bar selection.
I have only been here once but I am always trying to get my girlfriend to go back.The burgers are great, as are the sweet potato tots. The margarita was also delicious. I recommend the pretzel bun!
This is a red meat lovers paradise. I could not have asked for a better meal for the price. We got the Rehab Jalapeño Popper Burger, Tony Montana, and sweet potato tots to share. Delicious!

Had a veggie burger. I was not crazy about it. Seemed to be flavorless and there were cold spots due to the avocado. Lots of bread so it appeared to look really big but it didn't measure up to it. The sweet potato tots I didn't care for. However I do love regular potato tots but these didn't Measure up. I left the meal Unsatisfied.

I was very satisfied with the service. Very attentive, happy and outgoing. Fun atmosphere with sports on the TV and music
Correction, they now have hot wings that will burn your face off (if that's your intent).  Thanks for hearing me guys.  Love them!

Amazing!! Finally went there today after talking about going for a long time. The food was so good but unfortunately we had to take home boxes because we just couldn't eat everything  we even brought home a hatch turkey burger for my mom and she LOVED it! Hands down we will be back for sure!!

Pretty disappointing. $17 burger I had to eat with a fork and knife, the buns came out so soggy it was gross. The meat would have been pretty good if it was seasoned better. The water tasted so terrible I had to order a soda, the bartender agreed with me, lol...gross. I'd give this place a second try but for a $17.50 burger it's just not worth it, should be top notch.

First visit to this location of Rehab. Worth a try! 

We sat at the bar. Service was a little slow, but the place was pretty busy for Sunday lunch and we are always happy to see that. Lindsey at the bar is sweet.

Tons of menu options and I loved that you have a choice between different burger patties, buns, and sides and sauces! So awesome.

Our food was ready from the kitchen window and waiting to be brought out for us for about five minutes with at least three different servers looking at it until one brought it our way. 

I got a poblano burger with a turkey patty. Very good! The turkey had a ton of flavor. Sweet potato tots were awesome. Husband loved his Mac burger with a generous serving of Mac. They forgot to add the sriracha (listed on menu) and the other server was a little confused why we asked for a side until we explained it. Then she grabbed the side of it from the kitchen but didn't realize Lindsey had a bottle of it behind the bar. Kinda funny.

They have a great happy hour, so will probably be back to check that out soon. Otherwise, I think we will need to order the 5oz burgers next time - the 10oz were monster!! Very good.
Had lunch on Wednesday- not crowded at all. Service was very slow..25 minutes for food to arrive. I had the Tony Montana, it tasted good but was very dry. Sweet potato tots are excellent

The 4.5 star reviews convinced me to try this place. Pictures of burgers looked amazing. I'll never know how good they were because we never had a chance to order. My brother and I sat at the bar, ordered beers right away, got menus then were ignored for 20 minutes. I tried to get someone's attention behind the bar but I guess they didn't hear me. The bartender finally stood right in front of us and I said we were ready to order whenever he was. He looked at us with no expression and after a few seconds he said ok as soon as I serve these beers and he walked away. Not sure what these employees think, but there are lots of other places to spend my money with better attitudes.  We went next door. Had great service. Spent our money there. Now I realize that the $45 Rehab didn't get from us won't put them out of business but if enough patrons are treated like this it will eventually make a difference.  We won't be back.

Great burger!! I had the hangover burger with pretzel bun and sweet potato tots.  The burger was full of flavor and almost too much to eat (5oz).  Not only was the food great the service was even better.  There was limited seating when I arrived, but the hostess made a spot for me at the bar area.  The waiters and waitresses were all exceptional, equal to what you would expect from a high end steakhouse.  I will definitely come back the next time in in town!

I have been waiting for a good burger joint in uptown forever! Been to a bunch of restaurants all over the area and have yet to be impressed with any of the burgers.  Went in and was immediately seated. The service was spot on for being such an young business! I must say I was impressed! They seemed to have even an abundance of servers which I suspect  because they are feeling out the neighborhood. Probably a good thing because they were busy! We were  immediately greated by our server Sara she told us that they were still on Happy hour for another 10 minutes and recommend some signature drinks. I got their version of a mai tai, it was boozy and delicious. My friend ordered a frozen strawberry margarita which was also delicious (except the brain freeze haha).  

On to the burgers... They are juicy monsters and delicious. I ordered PBJ and Bacon and was blown away! Who would have thought peanut butter and jelly  would be so good on a burger but you gotta try it! My boyfriend ordered an old Americana classic Mc narly burger which is rehab's take on a big mac. But jumbo sized with secret sauce and everything.  As soon as we had finished eating a nice woman who I believe was the manager, Jamie came by to check on us and was very sweet and made sure we were enjoying ourselves and everything was great.  We told her it was fantastic and what other drinks do you recommend? She was very helpful and recommend the Kimmy special, a vodka mix with fresh lemon and lime. Give it a try! 

All in all we had a great experience not sure why other people are saying Zipps and San Tan burgers are better.. that's a flat out lie. And cold beers and cheese burgers, don't even get me started. 
The staff was great, the atmosphere was relaxed, and the drinks were strong! We will definitely be back!
Great patio, food, beer selection and service staff.

This is my favorite burger place...ever! I have tried multiple burger bars and counters and nothing outshines rehab. The food is great and the atmosphere is really cool. The pricing is very fair as well. I always get the Mac gnarly burger, and I just love this place.

I really hate to do this. I know that writing this will only bring more people to this gem that my wife took me to. Simply put, this place is awesome! Its a little place on the South End of Old Town in Scottsdale. My wife had the Blue Cheese Bacon Burger and I had the Hawaiian Burger. My wife is not a burger person per say, but really like her's which she ordered on a pretzel bun. I on the other hand love my beef, and the sweetness of the pineapple was perfect. The Pineapple Teriyaki Aioli sauce brought it together nicely. The sweet potato tater-tots where the best!

The restaurant is done in a "surfer" theme with one TV showing surfing competitions and the rest showing a range of sporting events. Sitting in the bar you expect to walk out onto the beach.

If you are ever in Old Town and want a large choice of beer and a great burger, this is the spot. But shhhhhhh, don't tell anybody.

This is by far the best burger place I have found in all of Arizona. Amazing!! Excellent food....excellent staff. I have nothing bad to say about Rehab Burger!!  If you are looking for a great burger in Arizona this is your place!

Met a friend for lunch and tried Rehab Burger Therapy.  Had the bacon cheeseburger (Relapse size) with optional onion rings.  Both were really good.  The burgers are cooked to order so I got a medium rare cheeseburger just the way I like it.  I opted for a pretzel bun which was crispy on the outside and soft inside.  The onion rings were really king size with a tasty batter.  Service was as good as one could expect given most all the tables were filled.  No complaints.  The decor is sort of California surfer which is kind of weird in the middle of the desert but I guess it works.  We ate inside but Rehab has a nice outdoor patio.  Would definitely come back again.

Food was good, ambiance was an annoyingly overdone beach theme. (I admit I'm probably not their target demographic.) I had the Hatch Chili Cheeseburger with onion rings. It was good, and the onion rings were decent, too. They served the burger with their spicy ketchup (decent), their barbecue sauce (weak and thin), and their smoky aioli (really good). 

I was disappointed that they only had two local-ish beers on tap and the one I had (the Four Peaks Eighth Avenue) was not very fresh. Service was decent. I probably won't go back as there are too many other better places to eat in Scottsdale that aren't as aggressive with their decor theming, overly loud music, and multiple television screens blaring from every wall. I liked the food but hated the ambiance.

Sooooo yummy..  the atmosphere, very local pub feeling.. food was fantastic.. as a vegetarian they had lots of great options for me..the staff is friendly and attentive.. try this place I promise you will not be disappointed...

This place is simply amazing! I came here during lunch, luckily the lunch rush had not hit yet, so there was plenty of room. The service was friendly enough, and the food was beyond good.

I ordered the PB J burger medium rare. When it came out I cut it into 4 pieces just to make sure I wouldn't make a mess (this is one messy burger) It was cooked perfectly medium rare, which is apparently harder to do than it sounds. Words can not describe how good this burger was, its a must try. The fries were pretty good as well. 

If your looking for a good burger and your in the area, stop by, you will not be disappointed.

Stopped in to check the place out. We ordered a dozen wings with the golden sauce and a couple of burgers. Our waitress couldn't have been nicer! I don't know what subdivision of heaven that golden sauce came from, but holy crap it was good! The wings were perfectly cooked, not too dry. We were jet lagged and groggy so we ended up boxing up the food to take back with us. The burgers are huge! We will definitely be back!

Dear sweet baby Jesus this place is amazing! We make the trek up to Scottsdale from Gilbert at least once every two months for these burgers. The peanut butter & jelly sriracha burger is to die for! We usually try to switch it up every time we come and the specials are delicious but we always go back to ye olde favorites....pb&j or hangover. Try the sweet potato tots with the Chipotle aioli.... SO GOOD. Decent beer selection too. Sometimes you run into your douchey Scottsdale bar goer pre-gaming on a Saturday but the burgers make it worth it.
Sitting at the bar. Courtney is the best bar tender ever! Loving the service and the food and the happy was great. We come every year for spring training... hope to see Courtney again
Too bad all the staff here hates their lives and pretends you don't exist. But the food is not that special either so it's a lose/lose situation.

Drove 45 minutes for a burger based on a friends high recommendation. 
I ordered the bacon and blue burger on a soft pretzel bun. I added extra blue cheese crumbles on the burger. 
I need to say, I am a burger snob. I know what a good burger is, in fact I've been known to drive 5 hours just to eat at one of my favorite burger joints. 
This burger was one of the best burgers, if not THE best burger I've ever eaten. 
The portion was huge (included fries) for $12.50
This burger has bacon and blue cheese mixed into the patty and it was outstanding. 
This burger was way better than I expected and I love the fact that I only have to drive 45 minutes to get an outstanding burger. 
I also need to say that the service was excellent. I went it just a lunch rush started, the server visited me at least 3 times to check in on me. She even gave me a soda refill in a "to go" cup for the road   
Great burger! Great service!
Good service. Nice beer selection. For a place that "specializes" in burgers, the burger was just ok (but cooked to perfection).

I was looking forward to eating here, then at the end of the night I immediately regretted my decision to even show up here. It had nothing to do with the food... the burger was good... It all had to do with the terrible service my friends and I received. We sat down and waited a little longer than we really should have to place our drink order. She then returned with our waters only to tell us she had forgotten what we had ordered for our drinks. We then had to repeat the various drinks we all ordered 5 minutes before. We put in our order and sat and waited for over 45 minutes for our food. While we sat there waiting... And waiting... And waiting... We watched as table after table who ordered after we had get their food. She also came by and tried to force another beer on me. She then brought my friend his burger, then went to check on the table next to us while the rest of us sat there for another 5 minutes waiting on our food. My friend told her just to cancel his order (I believe he has also written a review). The burger was good... But would have been way better had I gotten it about 25 minutes earlier than I actually did.  I forget my servers name, but she was an older woman, a lot older than the other waitresses there. P.S. They were out of Mac and Cheese!!!!! Ridiculous!!!!
YUM! Oooooohhhhh yesssssss. Yes. I could eat here everyday if my wallet (and stomach) would allow it.

It is a cool space with lots of TVs, neat decor and an EXCELLENT FOH staff. Really fun environment. Great bar with a great list of drinks.

Had the Backyard BBQ Burger. Pineapple BBQ sauce is a treat. Really enjoyed that. Otherwise the burger pretty  bland. Needed work. Fries were great.

There is a saying that says "you can put it on the walls or you can put it on the plate". If you are looking for great food go elsewhere but if you are looking for a great place to hang out, have drinks and eat decent food, this is your place.
It was just ok. The staff was really friendly and the food came out timely. I've had better burgers, not my favorite but the atmosphere was cool, kind of like a beach side joint.
Found a shard of glass the size of a silver dollar in the bottom of my glass.  The manager took $3.50 off of our bill. I've never been so shocked by such terrible customer service
Once again the experience was fantastic. Turkey burger was great yummmm. And their wings were even better. I never ever been disappointed.  I highly recommend this spot.

I've been meaning to try this place out for a few months but my problem is that I rarely find myself in old town Scottsdale. Well the stars aligned the other week when a charity event my wife and I were attending at Scottsdale Stadium was cancelled so I was driving around and spotted this place next to the parking complex.

I had the bacon burger which was huge and delicious. My wife had the grilled chicken and loved it. They give you a choice of two different size burgers. I had the larger burger which I believe was 10 ounces. I probably should have had the smaller one because I was completely stuffed for several hours after lunch.

The surfer motif is tastefully done and they have a ton of flat screens all over the place. And a big THANK YOU to MANAGEMENT for not blasting the music. It was definitely at the right decibel level so you can carry on a conversation. In addition, I really dug the music as well. They also have a great patio space so I'm sure this place will be rocking during the Spring Training season. The service was excellent even though they were slammed due to that charity event being cancelled. Our server explained that the kitchen was backed up. It wasn't a problem for us and it was nice to get some communication from the server as well.

This is definitely my go to burger place in South Scottsdale.

Burgers are divine! You can even get a donut as your bun choice which I did not do because I already put my order in! But any place that offers tots on the side is pretty much a winner in my book. Burgers were a little messy but let's be honest, you can't really fit it in your mouth. Give your taste buds what they've been asking for!

This place is awesome. There tends to be a wait as soon as the door opens for dinner, but it's definitely worth it. This was our second time at BR. My fiancé got the PB&J burger... It sounds kinda weird but it was delicious. I got the Mac N Cheese burger and it was one of the best burgers I've ever eaten! Huge portions too. I could only eat about half my burger and took the rest to go. It was still good for lunch the next day! The service was very good and even though it was a packed house, our food was out in 20-25 minutes. The guy that walks around cleaning the tables is so nice too... Always has a huge smile on his face and speaks to everyone. It's a friendly and enjoyable place with great burgers. Definitely recommend!

Rehab Burger Therapy, located in downtown Scottsdale, goes for a beachy, laid-back surfer vibe  - there are surfboards mounted on the walls, reggae music playing on the intercom and employees dressed in shorts and trucker hats. For seating, there's a small bar area as well as both inside and outside seating. 

A friend and I ordered the Bacon Cheeseburger Relapse size (4oz of meat) on a traditional Brioche bun with a side of fries and an order of their Onion Ring appetizer. The burger was just alright, nothing spectacular. BUT their onion rings were so good and massive too. The beer batter makes for an extra thick and crispy crunch. It comes with a yummy chipotle ranch sauce for dipping. Yum! 

As for service, our waitress was nice but a little slow in checking up on us periodically, so it took a little longer than expected to get our check and pay. This didn't bother me though because I assumed service would match the informal, laid-back atmosphere Rehab is going for. 

Overall, OK experience. I might come back for a beer and their onion rings but probably not to have a full meal.

Service and food were excellent. Our waitress Robin did an amazing job with us and our 3 kids. Port-a-Burger burger and sweet potato tator tots is a great choice. We also tried the PB&J burger, which ranks very high on my personal burger chart.
The food was good not great and the place was busy for a Sunday. If you are in the area it's worth checking out.

Ordered Hatch Burger mid rare with sweet tots. After about 20 mins it comes out minus the aioli, and overcooked to the point it needs the extra lube, and tots are ice cold..I tell the server the Burger is overcooked, and missing the sauce. Here's the important part, all I wanted at that point was the sauce. Not the management attention, not the rolling eyes of the judging server, not compensation, free food, sympathy, or a hug, just the aioli that was promised on the description. They took it very personally, like their elderly grandpa was back their flipping those grisly hockey pucks..long story short I got the sauce, the burger was comped. The tots remained frozen to the plate. I left, never to return.

Awesome atmosphere, great food and friendly staff. Perfect combination!  Some of the combos on the burgers will sound odd but trust me they work. Don't substitute and go for it, you'll love it!  
My favorite is the PB & J Bacon burger with fried egg on pretzel bun with sweet po tots for my weekly cheat meal.  Pure heaven! Makes eating clean all week worth it.

Normally I don't go to eat in downtown Scottsdale because my experience has been overpriced, overhyped food -- served with a side of attitude. It's as if they assume because of their location or the head-twitching house beat in the background, the food and service don't matter all that much. 

No so with "RBT". I loved this place. We've already been there twice and we will definitely be back. The menu is creative (I recommend the "pig wings") and the burgers are high quality for the price. I especially like the "pretzel" burger rolls, although I wish they were offered on both the small and large burgers, not just the large.

The ambiance is casual beach-boardwalk with a touch of Maui, complete with fishtank HD screens and tropical slide-show picture frames. It's well done but not over-done. The wait staff is friendly and easy on the eyes to say the least. The beer is extra cold and crisp (no "old tap" taste like some other Scottsdale establishments - yuk) and they are good at keeping an eye on the level in your glass. I also appreciated that one of the owners came to our table to chat.

I am somwhat stingy with my five-star ratings, but this place earned one easily. Overall, it fits everything I'm looking for in a casual dining experience.

Our first real meal post 202 miles with my team. We were a table of 11. We got there towards the end of 9p and they were closed at 11. We waited an hour for our food because they had printer problems. As you can imagine 11 starving people wouldn't be too happy, but they tried to keep us busy. Which was nice of them.

I feel like if any restaurant I go to offers Hawaiian anything I have to try it. I love pineapple in my food. Period. My Hawaiian burger came with a turkey patty, ham, and a FRESH pineapple. You can tell that wasn't a can pineapple. They also gave you a teriyaki aioli of some sort. It was yummy. My fries are a bit cold and stale, but I'm forgiving.

I don't plan on ever coming back to Arizona, but I would recommend this burger place.

Amazing burger and great prices on happy hour beers! The service wasn't the best, but it wasn't awful either. I look forward to coming back and trying other burgers as well as their large tequila menu
These appetizer ribs, piggies something?, are fantastic!!! The pineapple  dessert is to die for! This is a must stop by little stop!!!
The atmosphere and service were excellent. I had the Hawaiian burger which was OK but the mac & cheese burger looked awesome so I'll be having that next time. Definitely worth checking out.

Only reason I'm giving 4 stars instead of 5 is because my expectations for the PB&J burger were much higher than the delivery. However, the food was delicious, service was certainly exceptional, and it was jam packed at 11am on a Tuesday (which can only mean great things). I wouldn't personally get the pb&j burger here again, but I would without a doubt come back for another round of burgers. The roommate loved his burger just for the record! If you're in he area - I definitely recommend dropping in for a bite! Food is cheap, but high grade food and delivery! Thank you!!
Best burgers ever, my favorite place. The staff is really nice, relax get a beer order your favorite burger and must try the Jamaican corn
Second visit two stars for service which was outstanding.  Food is just average at best. Old town has way too many options to ever go again.

Pretty crappy service for us unfortunately. Came in on a work trip with a couple of my peers(4 total) on a Monday night. Service was awfully slow. We ordered and waited about 30-40 mins for our food. 2 parties came in after us and were both served before us by a large margin of time. Our waitress didn't come check on our drinks or ask how our food was, which was OK at best. She messed up a couple of our burgers by trying to memorize and not write our orders down and that was a bummer because we already waited so long. They weren't busy so I am not sure what the deal was. Maybe she didn't like that we all wanted separate checks, but its a business trip. We're from Vegas so we know how to tip, but she sort of ruined that for herself. Shame when people don't do their jobs and then will complain about a crappy tip.

Being from SoCal, we found it humorous to have a beach themed restaurant in Scottsdale!  Great relaxed atmosphere, casual dress. Staff was friendly and quick to serve. My husband had the 'pig wings' which were pork riblets that he said were amazing. They were tender, almost fell off the bone tender and the sauce was incredible--sweet with a bit of heat on the backside. 

I was extremely please to find a burger joint with gluten free buns!  My first time ever--usually have to order protein style. Kudos for this wise choice!  I ordered the hatch burger but with a turkey burger instead of beef with the Jamaican style corn on the cob. The flavored were absolutely fabulous. But that heat on the chile...wow, I need ice cream!  

We are planning a return trip before we go home.  I highly recommend this place. Great for our picky teenagers as well!

I consider myself a burger connoisseur and this place definitely ranks up there. Great selection and great quality of burgers. Unless you are a huge football player, the 5oz will suffice. Brioche bun has good integrity. Patty came as ordered (medium) - not overdone as found at many places. Onion rings are epic as are the chicken wings. Will definitely be back!

The food was delicious and not too expensive, I especially enjoyed the vibe from this place. The staff were very kind and attentive, but not too attentive to where they became annoying.  This is my second time going and I'll continue to go.

Came here on a Thursday at noon and the 3 of us were seated right away. 2 of us shared the PBJ and bacon burger with sweet potato tater tots!! It was soooo good. We all shared the pot brownie for dessert, also very good. I definitely recommend this place.

Stopped into this place a few ago. 

Had to be one of the best burgers in Scottsdale.

I order a regular bacon cheeseburger, until the waiter the waiter mention a burger with peanut butter and jelly? 

I tried it something new experience. You would think, how would that make a good combination? But it worked! Majorly best burger I had . 


A bit pricey , but for the quality very well worth it ..

The Manpanion and I are BIG on burgers. In the week that the Manpanion was here, we visited this awesome burger joint TWICE! Of course, I'm definitely making my way back. The atmosphere is extremely friendly. They really treat you like you're part of the family and as a newbie to the area, this really means a lot. 

During our first visit, there was a glitch in the kitchen, which delayed our order. Our waitress explained what happened and said that we'd get a slice of key lime pie on the house. We thought this as a really nice gesture... until we realized how LONG this wait was going to be. (Note: The Manpanion and I came in HUNGRY, so to have our meal delayed made us really CRANKY.) Since we finally received our burgers near closing time, we took the key lime pie to go.

The burgers (both times we went) were absolutely delicious! Yes. They were SO good that we were able to forgive the long wait during that first visit. The regular sized burgers are pretty hefty and consistently tasty. So far, my fave is the Hawaiian burger. It's meaty, so next time I'll opt for the smaller size. The Manpanion is all about the Hangover. You MUST have the tots or the fries. A major plus is they give you different sauces! Tip: The pineapple sauce goes perfect with the tots!

This is a yummy place and I give the folks major kudos for winning me over, despite a not-so-stellar first visit.
Probably one of the best burgers I've ever had the pretzel bun was excellent you must go to here to have a burger and chillax read on the back of the menu of the guys come up with the burger joint

Stopped by with a friend since we were walking the downtown area. The decor is very much a beach setting with the bike cruisers and surf boards. Love the story on the menu of how the place was created. The menu is very hilarious to read. It was not too busy when we got there, so we were given choices of regular table, high top, or outdoor seating. The place is not too loud to have great conversations. 

The food was super yummy. The burger was cooked to order. The sweet potato tater tots were a smaller side but they cooked up really nice. 

By the time we left the bar was packed. Note this was a Sunday afternoon, before a holiday so they must be bringing in business.

The waitress we had was very funny, her personality was great. I think the service team here helps to make the place outstanding on top of everything else it provided.

Heard about this place on Yelp. With all the great reviews I had to try it. Went on a Saturday after spring training. The restaurant is tiny so when it's busy you have to wait a little bit. We only waited five minutes. Got a great waitress who was very down to earth. She offered good recommendations. I ordered the PBJ burger. Kinda crazy. But believe me, it was awesome!  The blend of peanut butter, jelly, bacon, and a sauce was awesome! Messy but tasted wonderful. Then the tater tots are so wonderful. My boyfriend also got a burger of course and loved his! I recommend this highly. Awesome place and the best burgers in town.
The food here is absolutely amazing! The pb&j burger is phenomenal! You can never go wrong the with sweet potato totes and any of the amazing dipping sauces. Definitely recommend!

This was pretty good. The calamari was pretty good. . . a bit heavy handed on the batter, but over good. I got the Pablano Burger which was excellent! The chicken wings. . . eh, ok. The view and seating is very nice.
Unbelievable burgers!!!!  The combinations are so creative and tasty. Great service too!
Place is very busy on weekends, plenty of burger selections and very good GF selection.
it's the best and biggest burger I had in a long long time. the sweet potato tots didn't disappoint as well. I had the pobalano burger and it rock. margaritas and beer are good
Great food great atmosphere!  Love to bring my guests here for a casual fun time.
Visiting from California. We had wedge salads and bacon cheeseburgers. They were spectacular. Cooked to perfection, and the fries were crispy delights.

This is an update to my previous post.  I strayed from Rehab and tried Cold Beer and Cheeseburgers just up the street.  MAJOR MISTAKE!  It was way over priced, crappy food and nothing special as far as ambiance.  I actually left Cold Beer and Cheeseburgers and went straight to Rehab for desert.

 I'll never cheat on you again Rehab!
Crazy good!  We love bringing family and friends here.  Service, employees, quality of food are all fantastic.

My birthday party at Rehab Burger was so much fun. Nine ladies kept Rocco busy, he was charming and quick to take care of us. Most of us had burgers, and I had the mushroom and Swiss and it was perfect. The fries were crisp and tasty, same with the onion rings. One of the dipping sauces has pineapple- it's light for a hot day! Rocco brought me a brownie with toasted marshmallows, ice cream with chocolate and caramel drizzled all over. Perfect for a party and atmosphere is summertime happy!

I don't know how this place isn't rated higher! The burgers are amazing and the staff is always friendly. The sweet potato tater tots are my favorite things on the menu. Its a causal place with good burgers and the first place I take people from out of town to. The burgers are really big! I usually can't finish the smaller one!

An above average high end burger place.  The burgers here run to the thick style. I personally like thinner burgers with more charred flavor so these were not in my sweet spot.  That being said, they are done well and interestingly topped.  I had the Jalapeño Popper Burger which was tasty but surprisingly un-spicey.  The Backyard BBQ burger had a tasty pineapple based sauce and a huge onion ring on top.  The last burger we tried was simple with bacon and tomato and onion.  We had the regular fries (pretty decent), sweet tots (sweet potato tater tots that were a little sweet for my liking). Fun atmosphere that can get loud.  Overall I like the place but due to the price ($50 for 3 with one beer) I expected more.

I have a love hate relationship with Rehab. First time I went I thought it was the best of the best and then it wasn't. I have been chasing that experience ever since. Today I had the special Meatloaf Mash and it was the bomb! It needs a permanent place on the menu. 

The 10oz burgers (or larger) are infinitely better tasting in my opinion. They are more flavorful and more moist. I order medium rare and the 5oz always seems dry. I almost quit going, but you know...chasing that first date fun is a hard thing and I couldn't give up. And of course the 10oz are too damn big for an average human, hence my love hate relationship. However, due to this issue we have discovered a few other treats they have to offer and highly recommend both the tuna and the club. 

Oh and the sweet potato fries with teriyaki pineapple sauce means you don't even need to order dessert.

Stopped here for lunch on St Patty's day. The wait was about 30 minutes but we were lucky to even get a table because they were really busy. The service and food were both AMAZING! Our server was so sweet and attentive even though she had a lot going on. Happy hour from 12-6 every day?! Hell yeah. We ordered the backyard bbq and the hatch chile burger and both of them were dynamite. They give you the option for "relapse" or "rehab" size burgers, the relapse was the perfect size for us. The fries and sweet potato tots were delicious too! 

It's right next door to some other cool restaurants and bars and had a cool atmosphere. We were in town for spring training and super glad we stopped in here.

Everyone needs Rehab now and again.  Check in to Rehab Burger and Check out any burger on a pretzel bun.  Their pretzel bun is probably the best I've tasted.  It has that full, salty, pretzelly taste!!!     The sweet potato tots on the side were good too.  Good drink selection and awesome wait staff.

I cant express enough how much i love this place!! Andy the bartender is phenomenal always suggesting new things to try and he never lets us down!! This is a great hang out spot great staff and the food is amazing! Ill be a customer for life!!

It's like a Jimmy Buffet themed restaurant, the only difference being that these cheeseburgers really are paradise.    Relax, enjoy the casual vibe, and don't think about the requests for therapy that you will receive from your dietician when you inform them that you are a regular.

Great place for unique and incredibly delicious meals!  I love the jalapeño burgers and the ambience is wonderful.  Very rustic atmosphere and genuinely friendly staff.  It is a place I recommend to everyone who wants a great hearty meal to fill your appetite.   Drinks are great.  Make sure you also try the peanut butter and jelly burger. Outrageous

Loved the bacon and blue cheeseburger, but would have liked it more if the burger had bacon on top of the patty and not just in it. The bacon flavor got a 'lil lost. Overall great atmosphere and service. Be careful not to go at high-customer times though, or you might be stuck with a long wait or a seat outside.

Just went here yesterday for my friends birthday. I love this place this is the third time I've been here. Last two times I had the PB&J burger and I just love this one. Yesterday I had the Ghost burger, I love spicy and this wasn't super spicy but it was just right. Get the sweet potato tots with their jalapeno dipping sauce I believe the waitress told me (wish they had honey mustard but this sauce was delicious.).  Our waitress was on point and I plan to go here again for sure.

Oooooh man. I had the mac and cheese burger, I felt like the lady from the life alert commercials. I bit into it and fell to the floor and couldn't get up. Who thinks of these combos???? Best burger...I....have....ever....had. Hands down. Will return for the others, for science.......
Cool staff.  Tasty food.  Fair prices.  Check it out.  Nice atmosphere.  Cute servers!!  I like the sliders.

Great food. Try everything! Our server, Andrea, was super accommodating & sweet. Our burger wasn't cooked to order and she was quick to fix it and keep us happy while waiting. The misters were a nice touch, great music and just a nice first time experience.

Oh my goodness! I visited Arizona and on my last week there I ate at Rehab Burger Therapy twice... it is that delicious. My favorites are the PB&J burger and the Spicy Mac 'N' Cheese Burger. Service is exceptional and the atmosphere reminds me of a burger joint near the beach.

This is a great, casual place for some filling food. I really appreciated that they had a delicious vegetarian burger--a panko crusted bean patty. It was one of the best veggie burgers I've ever had. I wasn't a fan of the sweet potato tots. They were kind of bland. Wish I'd gotten the fries. The service was wonderful--very fast and friendly.
It is awesome food. People who work there are nice. I do burger wrapped in lettuce. My husband favorite restrant. It's has 2 location tempe,az and scottsdale,az.
