Been here a few times now. Told the server to pick which burger I got, as long as I hadn't tried it yet. Every burger was probably the best burger ever.

I've been here three times. The food is just alright.  Burgers aren't bad by any means - they are good burgers but they just seem sort of average.  I am a fan of the chopped salad which I was not expecting from this place.  It's a good location with a colorful atmosphere.
Huge burgers great sides choices of bones and eclectic mix of pretty much whatever you want to burger highly recommend it

My friends and me decided to hit this Old town burger joint this past weekend night. The wait to seat 4 people took over 30 minutes which was understandable seeing the large crowd and limited seating available.
We still decided to wait and explore the food options. After a long wait we got seated, offered drinks and our hostess Lauren was very friendly, suggestive from the menu list to choose our food.
We started of with the chicken wings in medium and gold sauces and some onion rings. Both appetizers were really good, wings being made to perfection. 
The real attraction were the big list of burgers on the menu.
I went with the Hawaiian Burger (medium) on pretzel bun. The burger was just perfect with little pink inside and it was a huge burger. Along with the sweet potato tater tots (best tots ever. Hands down) this burger has to be among the best I ever had.
Altogether this joint made me a big fan and I will be visiting here often from now. 
Thank you for the wonderful experience.

If you're hungy this is the place to be. You get the choice of a few different buns (go pretzel) along with two different burger sizes and sweet potato tots, fries or both.

When you're not in the mood for a burger than the fish tacos are a must! Seriously so good.  

Aside from this place being occasionally busy the service is top-notch.

If you are in the Phoenix/Scottsdale area this place is a must! It was hands down the best burger I've ever had. We ordered the Chili Cheeseburger and the PBJ & Bacon Burger and both were delicious. For the sides we got the fries and the sweet potato tots, which I highly recommend. 

We went on a Wednesday night and the wait was only about 10 minutes. Regardless of how long you have to wait, this place shouldn't be passed up. The atmosphere is fun and casual and was a good time with great food.

I've been here twice now. Both times were good!

I ordered the turkey burger with a side salad.
My boyfriend ordered the mac n cheese burger with sweet potato tots.

All the food was good....but the sweet potato tots were AMAZING!!!

Wait was only about 15 minutes for 2 of us. We got there right before the dinner rush on a Friday.

This place gets packed and has a long wait. The restaurant itself is pretty small so plan accordingly!

the bartender was awesome, it was so crowded but he was very accommodating to our large party. From what i remember the burger was huge and i couldn't finish it. All servers were great. Burgers and Beer, eat here if your in the area!

Waiter on the patio was great. Attentive, knew the menu and answered questions. We ordered wings and the burger with brisket and wasabi mayo and a few drinks. The food was amazing! The Serrano vinegarette was hands down the best vinegarette I've ever had. Gonna stalk you to get the recipe. The burger, although we were missing the wasabi mayo due to being bun less I assume, was hands down best burger my husband has ever had. And this guy is picky! I had the wings, which I always order and seldom like, tasted fresh and juicy. All in all I would definitely come back and recommend to friends. Great job Rehab Burger!

OMG this place is amazing and the staff was fantastic.  I asked what they recommended and they gave me the top 3 most popular burgers.  I had the bacon, peanut butter and jelly which I was nervous about but it was the BEST.   You might as well skip the fries because the small burger will leave you so full you can barely walk out of there.   One of the best burgers I've ever eaten.

We ate here on 11/20/17 during happy hour. Our waitress Jori told us about the discounted beer options. My husband ordered the $1.75 can of Modelo. After getting back to our hotel room I noticed that we were charged full price for his beer. I called and spoke with a gentleman who said he was the manager. He apologized for this mistake and told me he would refund the full $5.00 to my husband's card. Well... here we are almost 2 months later and still no refund. Extremely disappointing.
The food was adequate. Service was average. And the lack of accommodations for someone with a small child was impolite. I'm suppose to change my child's diaper on the restroom floor. Are you kidding me?!

What a fantastic restaurant! I am from out of town and continue to come back here as much as possible. The burgers are amazing and giant portions. The best item on the menu is the sweet potato tater tots which are truly unbelievable. Service is great, but there can be a wait unless you get there early.

As we walked in this fun 'sports bar' like restaurant, it felt like we were in California with the surf boards on the wall. 

The staff was very welcoming and friendly. We were immediately offered the happy hour specials. 

There were so many burger options!  We settled on the Mac Narly double burger. I split it with my sisters. I was totally satisfied with 1/3d of a burger on the pretzel bun. 

We tried the sweet potato tots. They melted in my mouth. 

I can't wait to come back.

Since there isn't any Hodads in AZ this place will have to take the reigns for best creative menu and Pb&j Burger..........sounds disgusting but WOW, if your not living on the edge you are taking up to much space...JJ

Fantastic quality greasy gut bomb food!  When you are in the mood for that kind of thing, you cannot beat Rehab. The PB&J burger is awesome, try it. Wings are good, onion rings are good, fries and sweet potato tots are good.  You won't be disappointed as long as you aren't looking for health food.
The burgers are this place are some of the best I have ever had. The atmosphere is really cool. The restaurant itself is pretty small, so expect a full house on the weekends and during happy hour.
Lively atmosphere....great burgers....I enjoyed tacoders...cod tacos. Sit inside or outside.. Happy? hour all day....will come back soon.

This place is like I designed it as my own restaurant.  Cool beachy theme. The sweetest servers in Scottsdale. Not just one server helps you they all make sure you get good service.  The food is cool too.  Burgers with hatch peppers my personal favorite.  And then sweet potato tatortots.  Who ever thought of something so cool.  And too top it off home made fresh pretzel rolls for your burger.  Now all I need is a banana shake.  Which they probably have with rum. I just didn't ask. They have dietcoke which is hard to find is most phoenix restaurants so I just had one of those. Which I think they filled twenty times.

Started off with the $3.99 yelp check in chips and salsa. The salsa and the chips are very fresh, but in reality the burgers were so big, I probably didn't need the chips! So full! 

I ordered the backyard BBQ burger, one of my favorites with the sweet potato tots. They come with this yummy sweet sauce. The BBQ sauce is nice and tangy and its topped with a giant onion ring!!
My friend ordered the Mac and cheese burger, I've had this before. It's pretty amazing. Spiced with Sriracha, poblano peppers and green chiles. The Mac and cheese taste homemade! And the pretzel bun is a win combo with all those flavors! 

My third trusty favorite is the hangover burger. You can't go wrong with bacon, egg and beef! 

Be sure to grab a jaw breaker on the way out!

A very popular place in Scottsdale. We've come here twice and it was packed both times (inside and outside). The burgers here are average at best. I had tried both the Hawaiian burger and the BBQ burger. Sadly, the burgers were overcooked both times. I always like to eat my burgers medium rare...not medium well :/ I do have to say that the sweet potato tots are very tasty. Being from the tri state area, I am a bit spoiled when it comes to burgers...rehab is one of the more decent burger spots in Phoenix/Scottsdale.
I loved this place. It was fantastic. If I could have I would have eaten two Rehab burgers. So delicious. I will be back when I get back to Scottsdale in October.

Wow.... Wow... Wow.... this place is gooooood!!!! Had a bacon and blu burger with pretzel bun. The burger was delicious. Far exceeded my expectations. Let a friend has a bit of my burger, and I almost didn't get it back from them. Just Amazing... have to come back here again.

Only come here if you want a good pickle. 

I was really excited to try this place after its 4.5 star review from over 1000 people; however, it didn't live up to my expectations at all. 

We ordered chips and salsa and for an extra $2 you can get guac, but don't do it, it was bland, the chips needed salt and the salsa had no real heat.

I ordered the hatch burger which came with a hatch chili on it and cheese. That's it. No lettuce or veggies or even a spread (menu said chipotle aioli but that came with my tots, not the burger). The burger and the tots were luke warm at best. 

Service was mediocre at best.

I booked a 20 person reservation here for a work group and they were fantastic to work with.  The service was also great once we arrived and everyone was blown away by how much food each plate had.  I was told to try the sweet potato tots and I loved them!  They accidentally had given me fries instead, so to fix it they brought out a giant plate of the tots - very generous!  I have to say I wasn't overly wowed by my burger (I did a create-your-own), but it definitely was delicious.  My co-worker ordered the mac 'n cheese burger; I got to try it and I loved the little bit of sriracha spice it had.  That thing was overflowing with mac 'n cheese everywhere; it was quite the sight to see! Loved the atmosphere there with its fun vibes.  Definitely recommend!

Best burger in AZ hands down.  If you are hungry this is the place for you.  Rehab has a wide variety of creative and imaginative burgers.  There beef patties are cooked to perfection.  The burgers i recommend there are the spicy Mac n Cheese burger and always choose the pretzel bun for your burgers.  The mac n cheese has a nice little sriracha kick to it which pares great with the meat of the burger.  The second burger i recommend is the PB&J burger.  Yes, i said it PB&J.  By far the best burger on the menu.  Be sure to get the sweet potato tots with the pinapple aoli.  Wow knock your socks off.  There Onion rings are massive and super crispy and the dipping sauce is a chipotle ranch which is on another level of awesomeness!  If you have room for dessert you have to get the pot brownie.  Nice warm brownie with the with the cool feel of the ice cream which is drenched in chocolate, peanut butter, and marshmallow.  You cant go wrong with the menu.  The food there is well worth the wait.  So WAIT!!!

BrandonFitFoodie

My husband and I love this place when going out for a burger. The mac n cheese burger is awesome as well as the Macnarley (I think that's the name) burger. We have tried several more and they've all been good.

I LOVED Rehab. Came here after an Angel game during Spring Training and it wasn't busy at all. Our server was on point and friendly, and the food came out fast. I had the PBJ & Bacon burger (no sriracha for me) and loved every single bite. I got the sweet potato tots too, and they were amazing. This is the perfect place to watch a game, get a drink, and eat a big juicy burger. I will definitely be back next time I'm in AZ.

Burgers Galore!  Very large portions and jumbo burgers.  I purchased my 1st ever PB&J burger here, and it was delicious. If you like a more traditional burger you might not like how sweet the peanut butter is. Burger was juicy and bacon was thick. The Arts festival was going on, so walking 2 mins off Mill Ave was easy. 
The Beach theme is cool, and staff Friendly. 

Definitely worth a visit. 
$13 for the larger 10pz Burger Option. Came with sweet potato tots, and large H2O. 

Cheers
The best way to describe this place is WOW!!!!! The sliders and Bacon is amazing.....if you are in the area and pass this place up......you have really missed a special treat.

Was really looking forward to trying this place after reading the reviews from previous patrons.  Similar to a previous review, upon arrival we were informed of a 20-25 minute wait.  No big deal. However after ~ 45 minutes and seeing 4 parties be seated who arrived after us, we decided to ask how many people were ahead of us on the list.  The employee informed us there were still 4 groups ahead of us on the list somehow.  Unfortunately due to this individual's lack of any idea what is going on in the world, we decided to leave.  The food did just look like an overpriced cheeseburger anyway.
Awesome burger and cooked just right.  Friendly staff and excellent service on a busy Wednesday afternoon.

The previous restaurant in this space didn't last long, but Rehab Burger Therapy hit the nail on the head!  They have a great menu of food and drinks and some really tasty beers. There are about a dozen different burgers on the menu and the cool part for me (not a beef eater) is that you can sub in a turkey burger or chicken breast, instead of the beef, for no charge! You also get your choice of bun, and any place that offers a pretzel bun is a winner in my book. Burgers come with skin-on fries or sweet potato tots, both of which are really tasty.  They also serve up a half dozen or so different dipping sauces for your potatoes.  

I had their wings on my first visit, in 2 different flavors ... the medium and the Gold Medal sauce.  Both phenomenal!  On my next visit, the server suggested to a friend that his favorite was to mix those 2 flavors for one amazing sauce. I believe it... I'm still sorta day dreaming about those wings.  Mmmm, wings. On this visit I also had the wedge salad as a cooling agent to the spice. This was probably the largest wedge I've had in a while.  It also had about 3 pieces of bacon in large chunks all over it. So good... 

Second visit I had the Porkster burger ... I felt like a porkster after eating it! This burger is topped with a heap of pulled pork in their peach-habanero bbq sauce (I subbed in the chicken breast) and cheddar cheese. It is nothing short of magnificent. I ate the whole darned thing, but had to sacrifice and not eat my tots. 

The happy hour pricing could be better, but their margarita is pretty delicious and warrants me ordering it again. This is a fairly small place, but its intimate and not too noisy.  I like that they have serene underwater footage playing on the tvs and not just sports blaring at you from every angle. Its pretty peaceful.  And the service here is outstanding.  Both times my servers have been uber-friendly and eager to get you anything you need.  I will be back!!

A solid four stars for this Old Town Scottsdale burger joint.  

I went with the Porkster Burger which was basically a pulled pork sandwich with a cheeseburger inside.  5oz of pulled pork piled on top of a hamburger with cheddar cheese and bbq sauce.  

Yup.  Damn good.

I've eaten at the best bbq joints all over the country and, honestly, the pulled pork sandwich would have been great even without being included as ingredients in a novelty burger.  

The sweet potato tots were also pretty tasty.

I'll be back.  There were several other burgers I've got my eye on.

Great food! Love this place!!!i i do not eat meat but my family does! The veggie burger is amazing! The dipping sauces are amazing. The sweet potato tater tots are amazing! We all love our food every time we eat here.

For the number one burger in Scottsdale I was a little disappointed in the food. I ordered the hawaiian burger which came with pineapple and ham in addition to your normal hamburger. I've had hawaiian burger where the pineapple really set off the flavor chemistry but at Rehab, they didn't use a ripe pineapple and didn't properly grill it to carmelize all the sugar from the fruit. 

The sweet potato fries were actually sweet potato tater tots, but I loved them with no reservations. 

The service was pretty prompt and friendly, all of the servers looked younger. I really liked the atmosphere too, good music and nice decor inside (it was too hot for me outside).
Fun, relaxing atmosphere, with great crazy tasting burger combinations!

1 star is what they deserved. No spinach, no steak, food came out cold and bland. Not impressed, at all. Brought some of our friends who are out of state and they were also very displeased with the food and service. Bad, bad.

Love this place! The food is amazing and the atmosphere is a blast. The staff are all friendly and outgoing, I don't think I have had a single bad experience with any of them. My boyfriend and I practically lived at this place during a particularly rough semester when we needed to treat ourselves to some good burgers and drinks on a more regular basis. The owners are extremely friendly and can always be seen walking around making sure everything is up to standard. The chef is an awesome guy, we had the pleasure of talking to him for a bit during on of their slow times. I love meeting people who are passionate about what they do and no one has more passion than a good chef. He was excited to hear what we had to say about to food and even gave us samples of some of the dishes we had not been able to try yet. If you go on a weekend or during lunch time, expect a little bit of a wait. But trust me it's worth it. And if you go on a Sunday, I would HIGHLY recommend their Benedict Burger! A thick slice of ham on a patty with a nice big egg on top, tucked into a pretzel bun and drowning in home-made hollandaise sauce!!! The next Sunday I have off will be spent devouring one of those bad boys.

A winner in Old Town Scottsdale.  Sure it is a burger place, how good can it be? Well, I am telling you it is pretty darn good.  

The vibe is a laid back kind of beachy shack, not huge with half of the seats outside. We had a great waiter who was helpful, friendly and checked on us often.  

Good happy hour. Decent beer selection and the burgers are legit!  I had the hatch burger on the pretzel bun (beyond yum) and fries.  I loved it completely!  

Really fun, laid back place.  I would come back!
Most flavorful burgers. If you like sweet potatoes, try the tots and ask to try all the sauces. I'm a Chipotle aioli kind of guy.

We shared the Hangover and it was really good. Burger cooked exactly MR the fries were hot and yummy, no extra charge for extra ranch OTS and the place had a super cool vibe. Happy we finally tried it and will be back for sure with the rest of my family.

Okay,  ya know when you walk in before noon and it's pretty packed AND there's a table with tired,  looking,  hard-working crew (maybe landscapers) all seated looking full..it's gonna be plenty to eat!  

So,  two in our party ordered the PB&J, bacon & Sriracha burger.  I ordered the Bbq burger with the chef's creation of spicy pineapple bbq sauce. So you need to know the "Rehab" burger is 10oz of flame broiled deliciousness and the "Relapse" burger much more manageable (but still plenty) with a 5oz patty.  You get a choice of a brioche or pretzel bun..we all opted for the pretzel bun which was perfectly soft but held together well for the burger that definitely is smothered & covered in the respective sauces. 

A bit after ordering we realized waitress hadn't asked us of the size of burger & after checking,  she'd assumed the guys wanted the larger size (one didn't) & mine the regular size.  So,  PB&J burger had plenty of thick, crisp bacon, no skimping there!  The grape jelly & peanut butter melt with the hot burger creating a bit of a slippery handful!  One in party said too much pb...he said would order again, without the pb. The other said would absolutely order again.  Mine,  absolutely smothered in tangy bbq sauce, not too spicy & cooked perfectly!  Sauce everywhere! 

They did great job with correct meat temp. All had the sweet potato tots-delish! The sweet & savory dipping sauces also very good.  We had elsewhere to be so couldn't take leftovers but was stuffed full! 

Ok,  so this is a little thing but in the restrooms they had actual towels to wipe your paws off..this was very nice! 

Fun,  surfer - dude decor, good music and bar! Fun place!
Awesome place to chill and have delicious burgers and food!!!  Burgers are so big you can share them!  This place never disappoints!

Hands down the Best Burger in Town.

Was in the mood for a burger and had to try this place.  I went for the Mac Gnarly Burger and upgraded to a side item of Jamaican Corn (grilled).

The corn was really good fresh corn on the cob.  Yummy.

The burger.  Oh my goodness.  So yummy and the ingredients tasted so fresh and healthy.  It was not a grease burger.  Lean beef that looked and tasted very fresh.  I orderded it medium and it came out perfect.  The pretzel bun was a nice touch to it.  This is a remake of the Big Mac, or should I say the way a Big Mac should be.  $12 bucks for this sandwich.  It comes with 2 5 oz. slides of beef.  None of the the burgers here are cheap.  That is the tradeoff.

These people know how to do burgers here.  The staff was wonderful.  Very friendly.

This is not a fast food burger joint.  You have to wait 15 minutes for your burger.  It's more like a bar and grill restaurant.

Bartenders = just annoying as can be - the type of people who you intentionally avoid eye contact with in hopes they don't speak to you - kind of like you would with a crackhead that is on a muttering, ranting binge attacking anyone who comes too close to them.  Boynerds on a self-manifested coolguy pedestal  dancing to their own tune (read: Rebecca Black's "Friday"). If you do sit at the bar, please make sur eto take note of the tool pool (read servers) that feed off every move the tenders make - like groupies at a One Direction concert. Except it's all guys. all guys.

Wings = Quite good actually, though the menu says they were supposed to come with celery, which for some unknown reason really upset my girlfriend when the celery didn't show up. 

PB & J Burger = 2 words (food poisoning) - yep, thank you Rehab for allowing me to enjoy my first bought of this wonderful gem. The idea is controversial, but from the common opinion from staff and patrons alike, we went for it. Maybe they are good when cooked properly - but that's not what I got. I got a hot pile of slop in the shape of a burger. All I could taste was mushy,warm peanut butter and the juices of meat that I suppose was the burger. My gf and I split 1 burger. I ate 3/4 of my half, she ate 2 bites. I already had a lump in my stomach. We paid and got to safety.

PB&J burger all day.  Peanut butter, Sriracha & grape jelly.  It tastes like a spicy sweet bbq burger.  You will not regret it.  We moved to Scottsdale 3 months ago and have already visited multiple times and will continue to do so!

This place is awesome! Great service and the food was excellent!! 
Couldn't decide what to have and our server Cheryl was very helpful with recommendations. Highly recommend this place and super laid back environment!!

I've eaten here a bunch and they are consistent with great service. I'm super critical when it comes to burgers and I think the meat could be more flavorful. Atmosphere is great and everyone is always happy here. Nice place to hang out.

This place was overall great with very reasonably prices considering the portions. This was honestly one of the best burgers I've ever had with some amazing fries on the side. The fries do not cost extra like some places and the place itself is nice. Very friendly staff and we were seated within seconds. I would definitely recommend to anyone.

Love this place!!

I'm gluten free, so I love that they offer gluten free buns, and lettuce wraps for all burgers and sandwiches! 

They're sweet potato tots are sooo good!! And all of their dipping sauces have been amazing so far! The pineapple aioli is to die for!!

I've yet to taste anything I didn't like! 

The staff is very friendly, and you hear several "byes" and "have a great days" upon leaving - even when it's busy!! Awesome place!!
always good food and good service! My boyfriend had a hawaiian chicken sandwich and I split the wings with a friend. Soooo good! Can't wait to go back.

One of my favorite burger joints in the valley. Love the vibe that I get when I walk into this place, the great service and the wonderful selection of beers. FINALLY got my first pumpkin beer of the season being that everyone has been out!! I have been here several times and bring someone new every time. I will continue to come back and support this lovely, laid back, local eatery. Keep doing what you're doing Rehab, you guys are amazing!!

Probably the best service and friendliest people I ever met (and they were busy!) the food was absolutely amazing and I can't wait to go back! I had the turkey burger which was huge. Tons of different burgers to choose from or build your own style.

Best burgers around!  We went there for the first time today, recommended by a friend, my wife and I both looooved it. 2 thumbs up!  Staff was super friendly, attentive, atmosphere was fun like at the beach, and the Backyard BBQ Burger was amazing!
Thank you Rehab for the great experience, we live way down in Gilbert, but we're definitely heading back up there again :)

Get the pretzel bun. I had the hatch burger, which was good, but really its all about the pretzel bun so just get whatever burger sounds the best! Also the sweet potato tater tots were good and i'm not a big sweet potato person so thats saying something.

Super friendly staff and I loved the laid back atmosphere. 

Right when I walked in it was packed but I was offered a drink and it ended up only being a 5 minute wait.

I got the bacon burger which was pretty satisfying and not overcooked. My girlfriend got the PB&J burger with bacon. She said it was definitely different but she did enjoy the burger. Just be careful because it is VERY messy. Also I got the normal side of fries which were excellent. 

Andrea was our waitress and she was SUPER friendly and helpful as this has been our first time there. I am a big burger guy and I wasn't disappointed. 

Also reminded me of being at San Diego which I had just came from which was awesome. Beachish atmosphere with super relaxed music. Honestly no complaints here!

Had a late lunch here today (2:30). Place was pretty busy, but were seated right away. Service was friendly. Don't understand what the big deal is, though. Food was average at best. Had a bacon cheeseburger, couldn't taste the cheese, although I did see it. Burger itself had very little beef flavor. Sweet potots were ok, would rather have actual potatoes. Also, they were cold when arrived at the table. It was no problem sending them back for a hot batch, though. Onion rings were cold also. Ghost burger is HOT! Women's restroom is odd, and poorly arranged. All things considered, not worth the drive for me to go back. There are plenty of good burger spots nearby.

BURGERS BURGERS EVERYWHERE! This is a burger lover's heaven. They have pretty much any type of Burger you can imagine. Mac n Cheese on top of a burger- CHECK, Peanut Butter & Jelly Burger (it is amazing) CHECK! If you like sweet potatoes TRY THE SWEET POTATO TOTS- They will blow your mind! It is worth the workout that you'll have to do after! The staff there are all wonderful and nice!

Delicious sweet potato tots!! Highlight the sweet potatoes, and order those! We had the backyard bbq and the porkster burgers. Service is fast. Burgers are cooked to order with custom buns. Lots of meat. I thought the chocolate milk shake was just okay. Love the side sauces to choose from, excellent addition to the food.

I love Rehab Burger so much. It's my favorite all around restaurant in Old Town and it's also a great place to take guests and friends. The atmosphere is friendly and the service has always been on point for us. 

The menu is amazing, the variety of burger options is so great. We always start with the calamari - it's exceptionally yummy for a burger spot (order a side of buffalo sauce with it if you love hot sauce, their buffalo sauce is delicious). I've tried at least four of their burgers if not more and they are all perfect. My roommate always orders the PB & J burger and won't have anything else. I usually just get a classic burger with bacon, yummy cheese and a pretzel bun. Always get the pretzel bun, people. I love everything about Rehab besides the nap I need to take when I leave ha. I'm not kidding, go to Rehab Burger! And try all of their sauces too :) -- forgot to mention that above.

I have been to 48 of 50 states.  I'm a foodie and love trying the local restaurants.  Hands down this is one of the, if not THE, best burger I have ever had.  Staff was great as well.  I went in at 8:30 not realizing they close at 9 but they were still happy to serve.  It was so late and they were so busy earlier that they had run out of french fries but they were happy to sub some delicious onion rings.  If I'm ever back in Scottsdale I'll be back at Rehab Burger Therapy!
Excellent burgers and great service. Would have liked my medium rare to be on the rarer side that's all.
Awesome experience! The peanut butter and jelly hamburger was really good! Little scared about it when I ordered it but it was really good. Will be back again

I'm so sorry that I'm just having Rehab two days before I'm leaving to go back to Los Angeles. I got the pbj and bacon burger, I was feeling adventurous and I'm glad I was, my burger was amazing. The peanut butter, jelly, sriracha and bacon are an epic combination. 
The sweet potato tots were so tasty, I could have eaten an entire plate of them especially with the pineapple teryaki aioli. 
I might just have to eat there for lunch tomorrow before I leave.

REALLY enjoys this new addition to our area. The burgers were very good! We had the PB&J and bacon burger, the hatch chili and cheese burger and the green chili and cheese burger. They were all delicious as were the sweet potato tater tot's. Very friend and efficient servers and fun atmosphere. We will be back!

I dont remember the last time I had a really good burger, Oh wait, yeah I do, It was here at Rehab Burger!    

I had the Hangover burger and it was pretty damn perfect, a fried egg, bacon, colby jack cheese and a hatch green chili! Let alone on a pretzel bun and choosing between the large RELAPSE size or even larger REHAB size.  I got Sweet poTOToes on the side with the chipotle ranch sauce and ive never had better.  I highly recommend this place, plus it has a great happy hour and its in old town but the crowd is nothing like youd expect when youd say that which is a plus.  I cant remember my waiters name but he gave awesome service and will be back again!

Jesus* has returned as a savior and fry cook and in Scottsdale, AZ turning ground beef into patties of bliss. I know this because no one else can make as epic a combo of perfectly cooked beef and just the pepper bite as their hatch chile burger. That more places don't have sweet potato tots is a crime against man. Do yourself a huge favor and get the tots.







*Jesus Ramirez from Tempe

Biggest down-side is they need to admit they have outgrown their current location. Food was amazing!  Started with pig wings. The sauce was sublime. Had a margatini. Excellent cocktail. No watered-down margarita here.  The burgers exceeded our expectations. Husband had the porkster - a perfect blend between a cheeseburger a and a pulled pork sandwich. He loved the pineapple the waitress recommended to add. I had the jalapeno popper burger. Cool avocado and spicy poppers on a great cheeseburger. Sweet potato tots for both of us. Where have those been all our life?  Hubby was driving, so I enjoyed a second margatini - and then a nap when we got home. This place was super!  Service was great, and we will go back.

This place is the absolute best! One of my favorite restaurants in Old Town. The food is so darn good whether your eating healthy or splurging. The vibe is chill, music is great, and the service has been fantastic. Bartender Kaye is awesome.

Disrespect. My girlfriend and I chose this place because of the menu and the reviews, we came in very optimistic about it. Unfortunately we had the opposite experience. It's been a long hot day and my girlfriend and I were craving a ice cold beer. My girlfriend had a question about the size of a beer and he insulted her intelligence and told her she's acting like a 19 year old. This obviously upset her right off the bat. He also mentioned that because of our California license being vertical that we cannot order our drink. Major let down. Must be the law, but we double checked and the law passed April 2016 that it IS accepted. The second time he came along we showed him the law article just to kindly ask if we could order now. He came off stand offish and threw his hands up in the air and said "idk man" and then we ask for the manager and he threw his hands up again and walked away. No one came. We felt so disrespected as customers and he made us feel like we were being jerks. We looked at each other and walked out equally feeling pissed off and really ruined the excitement. This guy had a buzz cut and arm sleeve tattoos and really needs to be mindful on how his words and actions come across to others. It really gave us a bad taste in our mouths.  Now we're enjoying our dinner down the street and along with a delicious cocktail.

Never been here and was the first time checking it out after hearing all the good word about it. I got the pb and j burger. Ahhh man what a good burger. I will have to definitely come back and try some of the others some time.
Super bomb but wanted one of these awesome burgers after 9pm! Gotta stay open later, you're on mill!
Awesome!  Professional.  Great food.  Great service.  So glad to have finally got a chance to dine here.
Cool place, feels like it should be on a beach. Laid back and casual. Usually a wait to get a table. Great happy hour. It is not possible to leave hungry! The burgers are huge!
Peanut butter and Sriracha burger is the best burger I've ever had. I go back to this place just for the sweet potatoes tater tots.

I'm here on vacation and was excited to try this place based on the yelp reviews. I love burger joints and always seek them out when I travel. This place had a five star vibe, but for me the food I sampled was a little more average than that. PBJ burger (which I usually love) was way too sweet for my taste. The sweet potato tater tots were paired with an odd, sweet sauce when I was looking for something savory. As a major plus, however, they accommodated 10 people on a busy Friday evening and they were very nice to the children.

Needed a "dog friendly" restaurant in the area after a vet appointment and they certainly did not disappoint!  Easy parking right next door, fun and quirky atmosphere, and EXCELLENT food with huge servings.  The pulled pork burger was amazing- even with us both working on it there was no finishing that sucker!  The service was very friendly and went above and beyond to make my pup feel welcome.  My boyfriend and I will be adding this place to our regular date night rotation!

Sat at the bar and had a perfectly made swiss mushroom burger and sweet potato tots.  Just great.  Bartender was friendly and replaced a beer I wasn't thrilled with when he saw me slugging my way through it.  Nice.  Staff genuinely likes each other and is having fun.  Good management, great atmosphere, solid food.  Decent value too.  Can't beat it.
Amazing and unique menu with a great vibe. Sweet potato fries/tator tots were amazing! Busy area so parking is always annoying but thats not their fault.

I love this place!! Awesome beach vibe and chill little spot for drinks and tasty food. Service has been great every time. The PB&J Burger is seriously out of this world! TRY IT! Get it with the pretzel bun...You'll be hooked!

I had been meaning to check out this spot for a while before finally getting to it tonight. Having tasted many great burgers over the years, I have very high expectations, and I can honestly say, they were met with flying colors!

First, the service was absolutely pleasurable. Our server was super chill, nice guy and did not bug us every five minutes. He was friendly and helpful.

The food: I tried the PBJ and Bacon burger after some hesitation and man, it was a real great treat! I think everyone should be adventurous enough to give this one a try...be dangerous and live a little! Sweet and spicy, the peanut butter jelly and chili really had a surprising twist - a very much BBQ like taste...very delicious. Instant favorite. I had a bite of my friend's cheese burger and it was great, but of course not as adventurous as mine haha!

The sweet potato and skin-on fries were both delicious, rounding out for a great epic burger dinner. Will definitely be back!

This is a great place.  Seems you always have a wait to be seated, but it's worth it!
The variety of burgers and fixin's is great.  I've tried several and never been disappointed.  Because of it's uniqueness, it's a great place to take folks from out of town.
Terrible cut of meat, too much fat in the pulled pork.  Taste was meh, I could have heated something from safeway for half price.

I brought my haircutter here today to thank her for a nice job. We started off with the Calamari.  Large portions and very tasty. The marinara sauce could use a little more punch with more herbs.  

I don't think I ever had a bad burger here. Great little place to grab a burger in downtown Scottsdale.  Burger was perfectly cooked.  Good bread that doesn't fall apart when you start grabbing your sandwich.  I think I've eaten most of their beef burgers except the PBJ (Peanut Butter and Jelly) burger.  PBJ on a burger doesn't really thrill me, but I've heard it's really popular.

My haircutter had the Hawaiian Burger and she loved it, but I think she would loved anything after finishing off three frozen margaritas.  I pity the person who gets their haircut after I drop her off at her shop. LOL.
Amazing burgers, good atmosphere, super super friendly staff, large drinks. It's a recipe for a good night.  try the brownie!!

Came again on a weekend (Saturday) and I will not be coming back. The service was horrible. The hostess could not estimate a wait time to save her life and didn't say more than 3 words to us. The server couldn't remember our order although he was writing it down and then didn't bring us our appetizer or drinks. We pointed this out when he brought our burgers, he seemed annoyed at us and didn't apologize. He brought us our check mid-way through the meal (I kinda wanted dessert) and disappeared. Also, is it a rule that none of the people that work here are allowed to smile? The burgers are good, but not good enough for me deal with the poor service. :-(

I looked forward to Tempe opening for weeks. They have a good reputation at least at the Scottsdale location. My family and I went recently. My daughter and I both ordered well done burgers, not burnt. They served us both extremely over cooked meatloaf on a bun. It was so dry I had to drown it in ketchup to eat it. My daughter only ate a few bites. They were very expensive which made me feel extremely disappointed. My daughter and I always get our burgers well done anywhere we order them and they are still juicy. For the price they charge they should teach their chefs to cook a burger right. Just don't order well done and you should be fine. Loved the atmosphere and the music! So much potential. Could be a new chef but Im sorry those kinks need to be worked out before you open for business and charge on the high end.

Great place to go if you want to be adventurous and try something different. PBJ burger was good and fun to try. Boyfriend had the mac and cheese burger which was also good but the mac and cheese was kind of bland. Sweet potatoes tots are killer and come with interesting sauces. Great location. Parking can be difficult at peak times.
One of the best burger joint in town , the quality of the patties is top notch . Get the poblano burger !

This is keeping up my streak of amazing restaurants I've tried in the past month or two, loved it! Was surprisingly busy when we went, which was on a weeknight, there were no tables available inside. Sign that this place has got to be good. Also I love the California-type decor and vibes going on, cool looking!
We sat outside and the heat lamps were like burning us so when I go again if it's cold I'd probably wait it out and sit inside haha. Our server was awesome, very attentive. Wait staff deserves a high five! The menu was huge, and once I realized you could substitute a veggie patty for any of the regular burgers that made my decision a little harder. I decided to just get the regular veggie burger though because it comes with avocado! My boyfriend had a tough time choosing between the turkey burger or the bacon burger, but he couldn't resist the power of bacon. Another nice thing is that you can choose what kind of bun you want, wheat, pretzel, or brioche. We went for the brioche, but I'd like to try the pretzel! Was feeling indecisive for my side so I asked for half sweet potato tots and half regular fries. Was an excellent choice, best of both worlds haha. They were both perfectly crisp and yummy sides, the tots were especially good when I stuffed a few into my veggie burger. Oh and the veggie burger was phenomenal! It was kind of unique too which I love! White beans, black beans, and panko crusted, yum! Also the avocado on top was so fresh. I usually refuse to cut my burgers in half but this one I had to because it was massive. And messy! But so tasty. I liked the aioli it came with too, was the perfect touch. My boyfriend enjoyed everything as well and we both ate way too much haha. Can't wait to come back!

Best burger in phoenix! Love the atmosphere, service, and people too. Laid back scottsdale burger joint/bar. I had the poblano rehab burger and cajun corn. Went the extra mile to give us refill cups to go. A place that many professional locals go to lunch and will be back for happy hour!!

Such a cool spot in old town, and one of the best burger experiences I have had! We waited about 40 minutes during prime time on a Saturday night. We ended up sitting on the patio (table of 7) during an awesome AZ Winter night. It is not a huge place, so I am guessing a wait is pretty common. I like the semi-tiki theme and am kicking myself for not trying a mai tai or one of their cocktails. I went with a bottle of red stripe from there decent beer menu. My 5 star rating is all about the food. There were at least 8-10 burgers I considered ordering. I went with the spicy mac and cheese burger. Mac, bacon, jalepenos- whats not to love? It was everything I thought it could be and more. Everyone at the table had a burger, many varieties, and they were all a hit. Big flavor, quality toppings, and solid fries on the side as well. When I get that burger craving, the hangover burger is the next one I am crossing off the list. Thanks for the rehab!

My first ( last) time visit. Fri 2 pm. 

I wouldn't recommend this place unless it's 11 pm your already drunk and you want warm food that's half way decent.

First, Its very small inside. The bathroom was dirty, and nothing to wipe hands on.

Waitresses, All haggard. Seem like they have been burnt out of the business and couldn't get employment other places than Dennys. ( being 100 percent honest)
My waitress was horrible, not attentive, Never brought napkins or refills,  forgot items etc.

Food came med warm, sent fries back because cold. 

I wouldn't repeat. I do suggest the health dept do a food and cleaning check.
Consistently great food and service.  I enjoyed a wedge salad with a bbq burger and it was really delicious.  Awesome stuff!!

If your looking for a good or unique burger this would be the place to go. This was my first time there and I played it safe and got the mushroom swiss burger, which was very good and tasted like a good burger you can get most places. The people I was  with though really went all out and got some of the crazy unique burgers on the menu. Like getting a friend egg on the burger. If I ever return I will def be trying something more unique. I am not usually a sweet potato fan, but the sweet potato tots were actually extremely good and the sauces paired with them really gave them a unique but awesome flavor.

Whenever I visit Scottsdale this is where I go. Great burgers and the best wings ever. Hoping to be back in June. Great atmosphere and service and prices are not bad. Cold beer as well which is always a Plus in Arizona.

3.33 
The laid back atmosphere was perfect for this flip flop wearing type of guy. 

The service was amazing, not so much our server, but the rest of the staff were on point. The hostess (with too much eye makeup) was by far the best employee they have on today. She was running around and helping everyone, while doing her job perfectly. 

I ordered the 10oz Hatch Chili Burger, medium rare, with fries and a Dr Pepper. The bill was $13 or so before tip. The burger was cooked perfectly, red and juicy. The burger was not seasoned or very little. I tried a bit of salt but it was still lacking. The chili and the cheese were good, the brioche bun was good. The whole thing as a burger was a bit bland. I used the Chipotle Aioli to season the flavor a bit.

The fries were forgettable and were on the colder side when we got them. 

Overall, I did like the place, I would go again. I would just ask for salt and pepper on the burger and a salad indstead of fries.

Very satisfying burger! Definitely one of the best around the old town area. Drinks were okay. I ordered a frozen margarita and it was mostly just tequila with nothing much. Overall, I've had fun experiences during the day and night and would definitely  bring family and friends.
We ate a couple great burgers and the chili cheese fries all amazing.  Happy hour is almost all day on Thursdays.  When we come back to AZ we will find ourselves back here.
This was a great place to get something different. All three of us had something different and they were all excellent. Sweet potato fries with dipping sauce were fabulous.

Verdict: Yes to this kind of therapy. Just stick with the single or you might actually need some rehab.

Okay, so I got the the PB&J burger with the pretzel bun. It's a crazy combination of peanut butter, jelly, bacon, and burger. Right about now, you're probably saying ewww but don't knock it 'till you've tried it. That burger was great and the pretzel bun was sturdy enough to keep it together.

They have a lot of creative options if what I got isn't appealing. For any burger, get the single or split a double with someone. It's a lot of food. My friend got the fish and that was huge too. You won't leave hungry.

The sweet potato tots were underwhelming for flavor but the burger made up for it. Maybe try the regular fries. Either way, I'd totally go back here. Too bad I don't live anywhere remotely nearby.

My fellow AA members (affordable alcohol), you need not worry about your massive hangover!

For it has become a burger, yes The Hangover is not just a movie & a state of "man I'm never gonna drink like that anymore" feeling; you know who you are Mr. Patron!
Now a Hangover is also a burger served at the Rehab Burger Therapy!  When I first walked into this bar I thought of Bar Rescue on Spike -- where's Jon Taffer!?  The place had some pretty cool decor and design; surfboards, guitars, and an aquatic background.  

Anyways, I sat at the bar where I was greeted with a smile.  Great service here I must add!  Read the menu up and down and decided to go with the Hangover.  Boys, I saw her first!  It was DE-licous with a capitol D!  For Damn!!! That was good!  Medium done with bacon, fried egg, colby cheese, and green chilies - Yum!  I went with the Relapse, which was a smaller version of the regular sized burger.  HH everyday till 6pm so if you can make it I definitely would stop by.  

The place has the rock n roll, surfer, tiki ambience.  Reminded my friend of Hawaii she claims.  I've never been to HI, but personal I'm content with being at the Rehab for now with a few drinks and enjoying a Hangover - yes I said enjoy the Hangover. - Enjoy!

Rehab has the best burgers in town period. I  have tried almost every burger and I have yet to be disappointed. The burgers are always fresh and delicious. I love their bar and happy hour. The staff is also super friendly. If you want to have the best burgers in town, you need to come to rehab! You won't be disappointed!

Cool atmosphere, thick/juicy/tastey burger, delicious sweet potato tots, and my bartender/server/possibly-owner ended up being a pretty nice fella who supports both Uber and Lyft (a wise choice since many people leave here intoxicated). Rehab definitely has a San Diego, beachy vibe, reminiscent of Hodads. I'll return to try another of their wide array of burgers for sure.

If you're wanting to get a good quality burger then come here. The burgers are huge and everything they have on the burgers is over flowing! I got the Mac N Cheese burger and it had jalapeño and poblano peppers on it. It was so good!!! The service is quick and the staff is very friendly. Definitely a place to hangout with friends if you're in Old Town!

Had the Spicy Mac n Cheese burger.  I was not prepared for the mound of mac n cheese that accompanied my burger.  It was just the right amount of spicy and absolutely delicious.  Went with onion rings on the side--equally delicious, and everything was served with ranch and ketchup.  Trivial to some but a great touch to me:  the ranch was fantastic.  Our server was wonderful and was really knowledgeable about the menu, answered all our questions, and was generally awesome.  I'm only in the area for a few months, but I will definitely be hitting this place up again before I leave.

Over 900 reviews? I was excited about trying this place.  When we walked in, I saw a few open tables but was told 15 mins wait... (It wasn't lunch or dinner time, i think it was around 3pm on Sunday).  After perhaps 5-7 mins wait, our table "became" available... but it seemed that particular table was available from the moment we walked in..  This place was very busy and slow service was expected.  When our server spilled a drink, she said "that's why I brought extra napkins..."  

If you check in on yelp, it's $3.99 for chips and salsa.  Chips were thick and I wondered if these were homemade at this restaurant.

I ordered mimosa with cranberry juice. Never had one before and I thought I would try it. I think I prefer one with orange juice.  Now I know..

The burger I ordered was very big, I ate about 1/3 of it and couldn't eat anymore.  Very huge. Perhaps I wasn't that hungry, but I thought I had better burgers before.  Perhaps it was a bad day for me.

RBT is the place to be. Full of eclectic fun and outstanding food. The burgers are larger than life and made with love. 
We ordered the chips and salsa which came to us as a thicker tortilla chip and a sweet salsa that complimented well. 
We ordered the Porkster and the Bacon Cheeseburger both Relapse sized. I ate the pulled pork first thinking I could eat the burger next, but I was foolish! Add the sweet potato tots to that mess and I was so full there was little room for breathing. 
Also keep in mind that Relapse size is still as big as your face, so order wise. Also a good time to go to RBT is in between the dinner and lunch rush. Even though the place serves the biggest burgers, the actual established is small. Lines form fast and in a blink. 
We had great service and I also recommend the pretzel bun, just because I can and because it was delicious.

I finally made it in after seeing the incredible Yelp reviews... and wow, they did not disappoint! The depth and breadth of the menu is fantastic! You honestly cannot go wrong.

Hopefully the amazing Kay is working the bar, and you have made the proper choice of ponying up to the bar.... she is remarkable. She will even answer questions you didn't even know you had!

Enjoy! #yum
Awesome. Chicken breast version of Poblano Burger. Great fries. Service was top notch. Thanks!!

Met some family at Rehab Burger and was very excited to give the place a try. Upon entering, the vibe is lively and the setting is eye popping. Impressed at this point. Our server made her way over and took our orders and again, impressed to this point. She was outgoing and offered a few recommendations. We started with the guacamole and chips. Nice to see a little yelp discount on the chips but not very impressed by the item. Chips and guacamole were both just okay in my book. For our burgers, I rolled with the PB Burger and others had the Blue Cheese Burger and the Burger covered in BBQ Pork I believe (sorry forgot the name). As for my burger, I loved it. The PB was oozing out and oh so yummy. The recommended bun was on point and the fries were good. As for the other burgers, the Blue Cheese filled Burger just missed the mark. It was very dry, I mean very dry and felt bad for family who ordered it. The Burger covered in BBQ Pork was good. Again, burger was a little dry but the pork was good. Overall, the PB Burger was amazing but the others just missed. I would give the spot another try but at this time, won't be giving any super praise.

Excellent burger, ambiance and service. Laid back place to hang out. Not a date night place 
Had the hangover burger 10 oz. w white bun rare. Very good - done perfectly. My wife had the ghost burger. Spicy w the perfect amount of heat.. Not overwhelming. 10oz is big not huge. Will come back next time I am in AZ.

Delicious. I love that you can get the different sizes, and the different fries/tots options. 
I had the Relapse Hangover Burger - and it was plenty. Couldn't have finished a Rehab if I wanted to. 
Husband had the Rehab either Hatch Chili or Poblano burger. Either way, it was delicious. We both ordered our burgers med rare, but his was more on the medium side. 

Would definitely come back; parking is the only drawback.

Hands down one of the top 2 burgers I've had IN MY LIFE. Fresh baked bun, well seasoned meat... I had the mushroom and Swiss with grilled onions. Sweet potato tots were awesome. The place was completely packed and we still managed to get a great seat and fantastic service!

What a great burger I had at rehab Burger therapy. Down-home place with absolutely spectacular burgers and sweet potato fries. I highly recommend it. If you ask for your meat medium rare you get it that way. If you asked for your bacon crisp it shows up like that.

Beachy feel to this place!

Just off of Scottsdale ave, without that Scottsdale feel...thankfully.  

Anywhoooo...great beer selection and...they have corona-ritas! HOLLER!

Ok...for the burger.  I got the Hangover Burger.  Green chile (could have been hotter), Bacon (OH THE BACON!), EGG..yeah...an egg!  This thing was delicious!  Onion rings...kinda felt like I needed a crane..these things were HUGE!  The burger had a great flavor and cooked perfectly medium.  Just how I like it.  My bff got the PBJ burger.  Peanut butter, jelly, sriracha...yeah I know right? But damn that thing was good.  Very much like that one dog at Short Leash!  Try it...you'll see!

Wandering old town Scottsdale and felt like a burger. How lucky we stumbled upon rehab. Lots of great drink specials! Burgers were really yummy - I had a bbq burger and my hubby had the special, a jalapeño popper burger. Sweet potato tots were fun and the regular fries had great seasoning. Service was great, super friendly. Nice patio seating area.

Service was good, food was delicious. I never would have expected that peanut butter and jelly with sriracha could possibly work on a burger, but somehow it does. I would order it again in a second. Tater tots were great too.
Soooo good. Enjoyed our visit. Food was great and so was the service. We made modifications to our meal and our requests were met with a "can do" attitude. We will be back.

Great food, great service... Awesome beach vibe! I have the hangover burger and shared some wings. Both were phenomenal. I really enjoyed the reggea playlist! Great spot to chill and eat after a long day at work!

I love this place! We were lucky to find two open seats at the bar upon arrival and skipped a longer wait on a busy Saturday night. It's a small place so be prepared to wait if you visit during peak time. A highlight for me was the ability to sub out any one of the awesome burgers for a chicken breast. Tue Mac n cheese burger subbed with chicken was one of the best things I've ever eaten. We will definitely come back if we travel through Scottsdale again.

Wow, one word discerned the food the service and ambiance. Poor describes the restroom situation. Had to wait in line 20 minutes to wash my hands, if you don't to use the facilities great if you do terrible.

The burger was juicy and hot until I was done. I added the onion rings which were not greasy at all and the only dessert they serve the brownie with ice cream is to die for.

Can't wait to go back next week with my daughters. My wife and I sat outside and enjoyed a perfect afternoon.

I really liked this place, especially liked the name of the place, very clever. A friend of mine and I stopped in for happy hour and enjoyed a couple of drinks that were both good and reasonably priced. We came on a Monday at 1pm and left around 2:30ish. There was quite a crowd there during that time, many of whom were enjoying some really nice looking burgers. What I liked most was that the patrons were made up of people of all ages, young to old. The ambiance is inviting and easy to enjoy, they have indoor and outdoor seating with shade. The waiter we had was great, no complaints. The only potential problem I can see here is parking. We parked directly north of the restaurant in a dirt patch. Other than that, it didn't look like much parking was available.

Truly the best restaurant i've been to thus far since moving out to AZ two months ago. I got the pulled pork sandwich & it was not a normal pulled pork. The flavoring/sauce was SO GOOD. And the portions are huge! My boyfriend got the barbecue burger and he said it was one of the best burgers he's ever had.

The decor, music, & overall vibe was what really got me hooked though. I'm into the whole surfing/beach life so finding a place like this in the middle of the desert is beyond perfect. I will definitely be back!

I was looking forward to checking this place out after reading the reviews on Yelp.  It's decorated in a beach theme and seems like a fun atmosphere.

I sat at the bar and it took a little while to get my menu.  I ordered the bacon cheeseburger.

And then I waited.  And I waited.  A half hour after I sat down at the bar I still didn't have any food.  I put a couple bucks on the bar for my Sprite and walked out.
Stopped in while in Phoenix, had the Mac and cheese burger, it was very good, cool restaurant and fun atmosphere

Awesome burgers! Definitely recommend the jalapeño popper burger on a pretzel bun. Fun environment & nice staff. The dessert that had hot brownies, ice cream, marshmallow fluff and peanut butter was AMAZING. We split it amongst 3 people and we all enjoyed it!

Hey!  Wanted to stop by and say Thank you from the bottom of our full bellies!  Last Wednesday night, I brought a friend from Colorado to rehab, as part of her journey.  She was here on business, and coming there was, as always a great visit and vibe.  We were chilled on the patio... But the staff scrambled to heat up the patio.  My guest had the pesto pasta, I had a bacon cheeseburger, subbing for blue cheese crumbles.

As always... You didn't leave room for any disappointment.  Thank you!  See you again soon!

This is a hidden gem. We live out of town and found this on yelp. We ordered too much food. I don't even remember what we got. Something with a pineapple bbq sauce and something with macaroni and cheese. Excellent food. The service by our waiter could have been a bit more friendly, but the food was great.
Swung through here for lunch while visiting AZ.  Super chill spot.  Service was good and food was on point.  Would go back for sure.

My wife & I stopped in for lunch the other day....been meaning to try this neighborhood gem for some time ( some of Rehab's staff hang @ our club : Karsen's Grill , right around the corner ). Totally satisfied with the burgers .....my swt. pot's were great ! Our server was totally cool; she was knowledgeable about everything in the restaurant......we're definitely coming back for the pineapple desert !

Visited Scottsdale for the first time in late February. Went for an early dinner when we arrived after our flight. Waitress very helpful and accommodating. Place was very laid back and fun. Was not busy (we went early). Food and drinks very good, and very reasonable for burgers, especially for Scottsdale. Try the PB&J burger- sounds odd but delicious! The sweet potato tots and fries are both delicious too!

Seriously some of the most unique and delicious burgers I've had. They should come with a warning sign that you're going to need about 40 napkins and maybe a fork, because some of these burgers are really stacked. Mac and cheese burger was exactly as awesome as it sounds. If you've never had a PB&J burger, this is the place to try it. Sounds weird but was really good. Fries and sweet potato tots are both amazing. Went back multiple nights in a row just to try different burgers.

Décor is really fun, too. It's small so it gets crowded fast. I tried to go early, around 4PM for dinner thinking it would be emptier but it was just as packed. 

Staff was super friendly and attentive. The only thing I didn't understand were the way they set up the drink specials because it was like a "pick your own" alcohol plus soda but it never really worked for me. I'd stick to the regular drink menu.

If happiness is derived from a great meal, then I am the happiest man in the world. This place was awesome. The BYOB with lettuce and bacon was mouthwatering. The service was quick to respond and very friendly. The atmosphere was relaxing and I will be a valued customer from now on. Burger please, I do believe. I am now an avid fan of this great little nook in Scottsdale.

Really 4.5 stars but the half isn't the option. Only a half because it is a little expensive for a burger. 

First off, gluten free and customer service are my issues and this place is solid on both these issues. The creative manner that they can make a burger is spot on. The servers were helpful and professional. 

Definitely try the spicy Mac and Cheese, my son absolutely loved it. 

Parking can be a little challenging but the lot next door was available. I would also suggest the outdoor patio seating.

One of the best burgers I've had the pleasure of eating.  Service is prompt, friendly and more than willing to offer suggestions for neophytes.  Pricing is about what you would see at the other "gourmet burger" chain, but this place is a better bang for the buck.

Had the chili cheeseburger with onion rings - a true fork and knife burger, but everything was great, down to the brioche bun.  The onion rings are about 1" thick and beer battered, and well worth the upcharge.  Other options include sweet potato tater tots as well as conventional skin-on French fries.

Most definitely will be back for more.
5 stars for everything I tasted. Onion rings, know poblano burger, salad with and awesome spicy sweet vinaigrette!

This is probably one of my favorite burger joints in the whole US!! They have a really great variety of amazing burgers. I've been here several times and I still can't wait to return every time. You can't go wrong here! This is the first restaurant I recommend to anyone asking for a bite to eat in Scottsdale.

I was seriously craving a burger while I was in AZ and decided to come here and check it out.  My guy and I came in around noonish and were promptly seated outside.  It was a nice day out but the sun was beating on us so we decided to move inside.

As we were looking at the menu, we realized there was happy hour til 3.  Sweet.  We ordered a couple of beers and the hangover burger burger (rehab) to share and regular fries.

The burger was a perfect medium with all the juices, cheese and sauces blending together so deliciously.  I could taste a hint of the hatch green chili which gave it a nice little kick.  Loved the fried egg, loved the bacon= great burger!  I'm glad I shared it though because between the beers and fries, I was barely able to finish my half of the burger.
Omgeeee!!! The FOOD is Delish... BUT the service is THE BEST EVER... is there a better word for best?! K AND BEETLE RULE!!! Come here ALOT and show them how much you love them!

Great food, great service and we loved the décor and atmosphere!  I don't live in the Phoenix area, but visited a lot over the years because my father and grandmother both moved there a while back.  This place caught my eye while I was with my MIL and daughter on a spring break vacation.  What a fun place - lots of neat, cool and just plain bizarre stuff for décor, which is just what I enjoy, and we all were very happy with our food and with the service.  We were there on a weekday, just after what's considered prime time for lunch.  I'd recommend it to anyone who likes a variety of foods [prices were reasonable, as well] and likes funky places.

This is a must hit when I visit Scottsdale. Awesome little place in Old Town, which is a super attraction in its own right. I've always sat outside and since I'm from MN I consider this a distinct pleasure. They usually have New Belgium "Ranger" on draft. Love that beer. The burgers never fail. I had the "Hangover" on this visit, but I can swear by several others too. Then there's the chill atmosphere with an impeccable music playlist. Restrooms with towels ...awesome and very clean. Can't wait to see you again in late March.

I know this is a burger joint. I went in to try out the burgers. They were decent. The fries too. Sorry to report, the burger was not the star of the show. This review is all about the Pig Wings. I have had some in Orlando a while back and they were my first encounter. The Pig Wings at Rehab are more of a Hawaiin Fusion BBQ sauce. In my opinion is an improvement from the first ones I tried in Orlando. So, needless to say, I'm hooked. So much so that I have had them for lunch more times than I would like to admit.  The service was great. The place gets busy so be sure to keep that in mind during lunch or dinner times on the weekends. The menu is extensive and they offer beyond the burgers and wings mentioned. It is for sure a spot that anyone can find something on the menu to sample. Check it out.

Rehab is one of my favorite burger joints in the valley. The variety of burgers is great, can opt for a pretzel, white or wheat, get to choose if you want a "relapse" or "rehab" size and then the lovely choice of sweet potato tots or fries. For the price, you can't really ask for a better burger or portion. Cheaper than Zinburger and also superior.

Brought friends from out of town. 

Chips and salsa were great! Chips seemed to be homemade. 

Burger was HUGE! My wife and I shared, it was AWESOME! 

Parking can be nuts, and it's a small joint.
Great Friendly staff, Food portions and quality Great. Jamaican Corn is a MUST Try. Best Bloody Mary I've ever had (it was the spicey one) Not too hot just right ;)

Second time visiting this location, I am always intrigued by their extraordinary menu and love that they have a variety of options. My meal today just felt like it was done before my partners because nothing on my plate was fresh, however, I still ate it. On the bright side the corona-Rita made up for the burger's shortcomings. Hopefully if I visit again this won't be an issue.

If I could give zero stars I would. Service was awful. We were seated right away and our drink orders were taken. The server forgot half of the two of our drinks and never brought the other one until our food was there. They forgot to put in our food order. We waited 20 minutes for them to ask us what we ordered because he forgot. They then brought us the wrong food from a table next to ours that arrived after we ordered. By the time they were done eating and paid we almost got our food. Five more minutes went by and we got chard burgers. We had also ordered ranches with our meal and asked again when he brought it. We finally got that 3/4 of the way through eating. I wanted to like this place since I've heard such good things but it was an awful all around experience.
My burger was tasty but not spectacular. The pretzel roll was actually the best part of the burger. The decor and vibe were cool.
Awesome burgers! Gotta try the PBJ, bacon hamburger! Staff was very friendly, manager was awesome! We live in Washington, if we are ever back we are definitely going to this place again!

Best burger of my life. My coworker and I came here on Tuesday for dinner. This time I had to bring my crew of six.
I asked the server what she recommended and she suggested the PB&J bacon burger with scirracha (spelling?)  sauce and a pretzel bun. 
Best burger of my life!! Sweet, savory, spicy, salty. I wanted to try something different for this trip but I couldn't. I knew I would regret it. So I tried to convince my partner to order the jalapeño popper burger, but lo. 
I also love the sweet potato tots. Again, I wanted the Jamaican corn, but lo. 
Will be here again the next time I find myself in Arizona. Perhaps they have a room to rent I the back.....

I returned home here in the east last night, from visiting old friends in Scottsdale, AZ last week. One of the things I like to do is eat at local places that are recommended by local people. (They always know best!) So on Friday evening, they brought me to Rehab Burger Therapy.  I must admit, the name had me just a little worried. But my friends said "You WILL love this place!"  I am SO GLAD they brought me here. The atmosphere is exactly what I like about these local places. You could tell the people were locals who came often - because it was good! This isn't a fancy, overpriced restaurant. It's a great local establishment that is obviously busy for a reason! Even though it was busy, the service was friendly and attentive. The burgers are SUPER! I also enjoyed the sweet potatoes - heck, everything was good. If someone from the business reads these, THANK YOU! Next year when I visit again, I WILL BE BACK! After we left, I told my friends that we have to come back next year and they said they go there all the time. I'm going to recommend some Burger Therapy to anyone I know who is heading out west to Scottsdale! Thank you again!

Absolutely loved this place. It is all the hype. I got the philly cheeseburger (5oz) which came with either fries or sweet potato tots. Those toys were just amazing! Especially the dipping sauces for the tots. Burger was huge and I only finished half but it was sooo good. They had a wide variety of burger options too. Definitely gonna come back to try other burgers and appetizers, despite the long wait (30min or so). 
And service was great. Our waiter Sam was really nice and accommodating and funny.

For a place that prides itself on being a 'burger joint' & has a large menu of fun burgers, the actual patties are pretty gross. They are dry, poorly cooked, flavorless and way over sauced. I wouldn't be interested in spending any more money here, especially for what you get at this price point. But at least the fries and the aioli were decent. Granted, they also might have only tasted good because of how bad the pulled pork burger I had was.
Best burger in a long while. Great job with Hatch Green Chili even for those from New Mexico. Also great Sweet Potato tots, never had such before, unique.

Probably my favorite place for burgers. The place is always busy and the staff has always been great. The burgers are creative and more than filling. My favorite has gotta be the Porkster, relapse size.

Besides having a waiter high as a kite and our orders being wrong and cold, the burgers were okay. We tried the Mac n cheese burger and the poblano, both were cold whenever they came out and I'm sure that's because our waiter forgot our food. Once we had it, he asked us how we were doing every few minutes when he didn't speak to us very much in the beginning. Probably not going to visit this location again but we might try somewhere else.

This place is amazing! Awesome food for reasonable prices! Staff was very friendly, we will definitely be back!   Very unique burger choices, their sweat potato tots are the best! This restaurant does not disappoint.
The picture says it all really good food, great service too. Will come back whenever im in town

Been to Rehab several times this year, I go to Scottsdale about once a month to play and I think this will be my new go-to spot!
The first time in I sat on the patio....waited 15 minutes for a waitress, then went and found her and asked for a beer....never saw her again. But I am very glad I went inside and tried again. The bartender helped me, apologized for the poor service outside and proceeded to make me a convert! I have been back several times since and the staff and owners are great. John and Reno the bartenders, as well as Denise, one of the owners and a very pretty addition to the place, have all been very friendly and made me feel at home every time. The food is great, the atmosphere is relaxed and welcoming. Absolutely going back!

I was not impress.  My daughter asked for fries and corn with her cheeseburger and the waitress even repeat the order and forgot her fries.  I ordered the hatch burger with sweet potatoes tots and when I went to the restroom these other table had more tater tots than I did.  I was pissed off.  I had like 9 pieces and I didn't say anything.  Then my daughter went to the restroom and noticed the same thing and told me mom how come you only got little bit of tater tots and the other table theirs are over flowing with sweet potato tots.  .  I didn't say anything because I don't have time to get upset over tater tots.

I just can't tell you how much we love this place!  We tell everyone about it and they always thank us for the recommendation.  
If you don't get the PB&J burger, you'll be sorry.  Seriously.  Sounds weird but it's just that dang good!  The staff is fun and friendly. It's an absolute must visit place for us every year during our spring training trip.  Sometimes we go two days in a row. ;)
This is hands down my favorite burger place in old town. Definitely get the pretzel bun and if you like hott then ask them for the ghost pepper cheese for that extra kick that's on the secret menu!

With a daily HH from 11a-6p... this place is def appropriately named. With hippie, beach vibes, Rehab provides a great escape for guests looking for a quick drink or a hearty meal. 

Drinks:
Personally, I like a beer with my burger, but their HH feature a number of alternatives if that's what your heart desires. 

Food:
**disclaimer** Great burgers are one of two things holding me back from being a pescatarian so I'm slightly biased.

I asked the bartender and the waitress about their faves & worked my way down the list...

The PBJ & Bacon Burger: 
A- amazing!
B- better try one ASAP!

I traditionally loved peanut butter on a burger, but was def hesitant about the jelly - I hate grape jelly & adding the J felt like overkill, but it worked marvelously! Plus, the pretzel bun sealed the deal for me. Show your kindergarten self some love & try it! 


The Spicy Mac-N-Cheese Burger:

Another combo of things everyone loves. Things to note with this one:
A- the mac'N'cheese is fab! It made my super Southern, super picky heart smile.
B- the burger is ginormous! I think it took me three sittings to finish it. Come hungry, leave happy! 
C- about the spiciness... As a NOLA native, I know spicy. I love spicy. I live spicy. There's def a kick to it, but it's more like a tiny toddler throwing a tantrum kick than a black belt karate kick. Expectation management is everything. 


Most burgers come in relapse (10oz) and relapse (5oz) sizes to fit your hunger level.

They offer an assortment of accompanying sauces for pairing.

Fries were standard. You can go halfsies on fries/ sweet potato tots if you like.

One of my friends loved the Know Poblano and my vegetarian friends raved about the veggie burgers. The food is def the highlight at this spot.


Service:
Expect goldilocks service at this place- not too great, but yet not terrible. They'll prob get your order right, but don't expect much as it relates to attentiveness. 

Ambience:
Vibrant. Youthful. Neighborhood bar vibes. Great for solo sipping at the bar, table for two, or group outings!

In town for a long weekend with ma' boys for spring training.  Dodger game was sold out so we wound up going to the Giants game which is a few blocks from Old Town Scottsdale.  Snuck out of the game in the top of the 8th because all the starters we're out.  Wandered those few blocks back into town and stumbled into Burger Rehab Therapy.  Got a table just in time as the "after game rush" was a few minutes behind us.  The place was buzzing.  Staff was pleasant, fun and attentive.  Reasonably priced drinks were ordered, served quickly, and tasted wonderful.  Second round was ordered immediately and again served in a flash.  For me, music can add or subtract from a dining experience. For this encounter it was a big plus.  Good classic rock & roll, the Stones, U2, the Eagles, and for good measure they threw in some Beach Boys.  The only thing missing was Stairway to Heaven and Free Bird. The place was filling up fast with the "tardy goers" but I didn't notice any change in the pace at which our troop was being taken care of.  We reviewed the menu and discussed the many choices with each other as well as the servers.  They were happy to outline the choices in detail and include the "extras" locals (not us) usually enjoy.  This was a big help in deciding.  Among the squad we wound up going all burger.  No shrubs or calamari for these cavemen.  Again the service was stellar.  Quick and on point. Burgers were cooked as ordered.  The man-boys had the Porkster, the Hangover and the B.Y.O.B. We had onion rings, skin-on fries, sweet potato tater tots and Jamaican Corn.  I went way off the radar and had the PB& J Bacon Burger on Brioche.  Oh my word! It was sloppy. It was sweet. Couple that with bacon, cheese and a well cooked beef patty and it was hands down the craziest and one of the best burgers I have had in a long time.  It was a sticky, sweet, savory, tasty, mess of a burger. I felt I needed to take a shower afterwards because that peanut butter was everywhere.  Even found a little behind my ear the next day at the Angels game.  I wholeheartedly recommend this place to anyone that wants to relax, enjoy a good meal, enjoy some music and make new friends.  Can't wait for spring training 2019.  Save a taco, eat a burger!
