Best burger I have had in a really long time. They come in two sizes, the largest one was the perfect amount of meat, filling me up without me wanting more. Hawaiian burger used real pineapple, not the canned kind. Swish and mushroom was also very tasty. Good quality beef, cooked to perfection. A nice array of dipping sauces that the waitress brought out without us even asking. Variety is the spice of life
The burger was excellent, and so was the service!  I had a "Know Poblano Burger", and it was very tasty and creative!

We are huge foodies, and we are so glad to have discovered Rehab Burger Therapy! Here, we had one of the best burgers we've ever had, and we've tried a lot of burgers.

As extreme food fans, we're always looking for a good burger with a twist, and we found it at Rehab Burger Therapy. We ordered the server's recommendation, which is their 'hangover burger', and we customized it.  This burger has a fried egg, bacon, colby jack cheese and a hatch green chili. We customized it to include their ghost pepper jack cheese and crispy onions with a side of hot sauce - and it was simply fantastic. No hot sauce was needed, the burger stood on it's own merits. :-)

Instead of ordering standard french fries, we opted for the Jamaican Corn, and WOW - phenomenal! I could order that every day. Our server told us that their Jamaican corn (which is a Jamaican-spiced corn-on-the-cob) is deep fried - and cooked this way, it was perfectly done, juicy and perfectly spiced. We've never had fried corn before, but it was definitely some of the best corn we've ever had.

Try their corn at least once when you visit - you will not be disappointed. And the burgers? You can't go wrong! Loved it!

Came here the other day around 5 pm. The inside area was completely sat (maybe because it was 110 out) so we decided to sit on the patio. I had the Mac and cheese and a burger, the food definitely made up for the scorching heat. Great place to grab a burger if you feel like having a cheat day.

Three stars is good by my standard and worth the experience. 
Hit: Fun, energetic Saturday afternoon atmosphere. Great people watching with an essence of Mission Beach (San Diego).  Burgers were great, I had the hatch green chili burger and it was phenom. Service was quick and to the point. .

Missed: Wasn't as big a fan of hubby's PB&J burger, but it was definitely a fun experience to try. They were out of the famed tater tot so we had to miss out. Also, worth noting that it definitely feels more like a bar than a restaurant - "not that there's anything wrong with that..." but make sure you get in the mindset. 

All said, a good experience and fun to try something different. .

Just ate here for the first time and it was amazing. Great ambience and very very friendly staff. The service was great and the food was even better. I had the bacon cheeseburger in a pretzel bun with sweet potato tots. I've had my fair share of the sweet potato tots but these are by far the best I've ever had. They come with two dipping sauces, spicy ketchup and garlic aoli. I found myself alternating between the two sauces every other tot. Delcious. I heard about this place thru word of mouth and will definitely be spreading the good word about this establishment.

The place for a really good hamburger!  I got the taco hamburger and its enough for two people.  It cam with fries..........which seemed to be home made.  will be going back for another kind of burger.
So much food! Service was great food was great! No wait for a table! Try Mike Tai! Won't disappoint.

This burger place is one of the under meat and eateries of Valley. 

Rehab ranks higher in my over The Grind. Portion Con-trol or Outta-control are some the nice perks of rehab. Their pretzel bun game is hella strong. 

For only being here for the second time ever, this place needs to stay on the rotation of yum.

Our burger was cooked to perfection. Fried calamari dish was well done. The size of both dishes was very big. 
All day happy hour on beverages is unbeatable.

Overall I was not impressed with this restaurant.  The Burgers we had were decent but they were all lacking something to make them amazing.  Maybe I have just been spoiled at other burger bars but attentive service here and decent food.  I probably wouldn't go back here when visiting the area.
Like to switch up your burgers? You've come to the right place. PBNJ burger? Jalapeño popper burger? Need I say more? OK, Ghost pepper burger was my choice and let me tell you...it was superb!!!

Food (4 stars): After consuming so much food since we are on vacation, I wanted something on the lighter side, so I opt in for the Shelby's Shpinach Shalad. It is a spinach salad topped with walnuts and blue cheese and drizzled with a sweet/tangy strawberry vinaigrette dressing. My fiancee got the Chili Cheese Rehab burger. Note: the rehab burger is burger than the relapse burger. The chili cheese burger was not bad, however, I still prefer chili cheese burger from Tommy's in Los Angeles, CA just because there was nothing spectacular about the burger from this restaurant. We substitute the fries for the sweet poTOToes. The sweet poTOToes were a little under cooked so the outer shell of the tots were not crispy and the inside was soggy. 

Sauces: We tried Pineapple Teryaki Aioli, Chipotle Aioli, Chipotle Ranch, and Pesto Aioli. We were not a fan of the pineapple teryaki aioli since it was too sweet but if you are looking for something interesting to try then this sauce would be it! The sauce we liked the best was the chipotle ranch. 

Service (4 stars): The server checked on us every so often to see how we were doing. 

Ambiance (4 stars): There is in and outdoor sitting area on high bench chairs with umbrellas to provide shade. This is a chill place for those who are looking for a place to hang out after work or on the weekends. There is a parking lot next door. 

Overall, I would come back for the salad and to try the other burgers.

I have been to the Scottsdale location and I wanted to try out this location. First off great location. They are located off of Mill Ave and there is parking super close. The staff was awesome. The general manager greeted me at the door and she also made her rounds checking in on her guests. My hamburger was super good. I had the Tractor Pulled Pork. The BBQ sauce was delicious and the meat was so tender. I would get again. I had corn on the cob as a side and it was amazing. They added some seasoning on it and I loved it. I would eat it just as an appetizer it was that good. I enjoyed my food and will for sure come back for some more. I can't wait to go back to Rehab.
Creative and amazingly delicious food!  Get the sweet potato tots with teriyaki dipping sauce.  I love the peanut butter and jelly, bacon and sirracha burger.  So good!

Maybe the best burger places I've ever been, and I can't wait to go back. Inexpensive drinks full of flavor, solid staff who went the extra mile, and outdoor seating right in the middle of it all. Had to wait 45min to seat 3, but it was worth it!

Came here on a Friday night and shared the PB&J Bacon Burger 10oz! So. Much. Flavor. Sweet jelly, spicy peanut butter and crispy bacon. Cooked to perfection, huge portions, and quick service. We were in and out within 30 minutes. We sat on the patio which was decked out in surfer themed decor.

Really Good.  Went with a buddy and his couple of younger kids.  It was loud and they are loud.er.  Perfect place for them.  Food was good, drinks were good. Had the Hawaiian, cooked perfectly.  Sweet Potato tots are always a good alternative to simple fries.  Will be back

So before my favorite burgers where from delux on camelback. Then my friends took me to this place. This is now my number one place in az. Amazing atmosphere, service is a little slow, but food is the best.

This is my new favorite burger joint.  The BBQ burger was outstanding.  The 10 oz rehab patty was more than enough for 2 people.  The service was great as well.  Try this place, your going to love it.
We decided to try Rehab because it smelled good.  I can not ever remember having a burger that was this good.  Service was fantastic.  We will be back

So far so good. I had the Mac & Cheese burger on pretzel bun. I ordered the smallest one but it was still huge and i could not finish this burger. It was so so delicious tho, i had the regular fries with it. My fiance had the BBQ Burger, we ordered the smaller one and that was still a big burger also. He said it was very good also and had regular fries with his. The place was so Cali surfs up style but clean. Everyone was nice we were greeted as soon as we walked in.  Im hoping to go today since i have to drop off my rental car in Scottsdale. Im really wanting to check out the PB&J bacon burger i have been hearing so much about and jalapeño popper burger. This time ill try the sweet potatoe tots. I will be doing another review for the other burgers if i end up that way today.

We went here for lunch over the weekend, having heard great things. The place was absolutely packed, which seemed a strong indicator of the quality of the food, and the service was great. Naturally, I was expecting the burger to go hard (this place does have the word "burger" in the name, after all), but, wow, what a disappointment.

I had the Know Poblano Burger. First, let me say that the combination of grilled poblano and manchego cheese was excellent. If that had been all I ate, this would be a different review, though. The problem with flavorful toppings is that you cannot use them to disguise an under-seasoned burger, and that's exactly what I got.

There was virtually no salt or pepper on the patty -- a big issue when the beef is 3/4 of the actual burger. Does anyone in the kitchen have basic culinary training? I'm not even a trained chef, and I know that if you forget to season the main ingredient and attempt to cover it up with ingredients that are seasoned, the whole dish comes out bland. You can't put spicy poblano and salty, melted cheese on top of a flavorless puck of beef and expect me to like it.

Even the bun was soggy, which is mind boggling. How does a place that specializes in burgers not know to put some sort of leafy green between the meat and the bun? This is textbook stuff.

Also, the place was hot. When there's a weekend heat advisory, you might want to turn your thermostat down a few notches -- especially when the restaurant is packed with warm bodies.

By the way, that second star is for the fries, which were perfectly cooked.

This place is so great there is a line outside the door!  Staff is friendly we were seated quickly and the environment is totally casual.  The menu is pretty extensive with plenty of burger choices as well  as sides.  My bbq burger was great, the sauce was sweet and smoky, and the onion rings I ordered were perfect.  I received 5 huge ones.  Wait staff is really friendly and makes you feel completely comfortable.  I'm definitely going to be back.

Best burger in town!!! 
Amazing service, delicious food!! 
This is a must try if you are in the mood for a burger!
Go right now!!!!!!

We bought a groupon a few years ago and loved it and went back this past weekend and it is exactly the same as I remember...delicious! The buns on the burger are amazing. We brought our three year old and the server was so sweet with her. Will go back over and over again! They have a great happy hour time frame :)

We USED to like this place, then ......Lunch @ 230pm, my party was all returning customers.  Good service, the waitress was very knowlegable.  I got (2patty--$14) Ghost burger, huge, made my stomach feel bad, & too spicy!  My dad got the same thing he got lasttime, Black &Blue burger. He asked the waitress "is there any bleu chz in this?"  she said "yeah it's stuffed inside the patty"---he even said "well it seems theres hardly any"---she did nothing to reconcile this.  My bf had one of the (single-patty, med-well) burgers w/peppers on it (undercooked in some parts!!)--plus he got the mushy sweet potato tots (bleh). For 40$ (no alcohol &not incl. tip) 3people, you might as well go to Carls Jr

Gotten take out order twice now, and both times service has been speedy, complete and kind. Last time the bartender gave us extra sauces to go because he thought that we would like them. My wife and I love this place and are looking forward to our next take out! Go for the hangover burger with sweet potato tots + the gluten free buns are AMAZING!
Amazing food. Will be back again. Had the sweet potato fries, onion rings, and regular fries. All we do good. Pulled pork sandwich huge and so great.

Rehab was just what we needed, without realizing it! Were searching for a place with a local feel and they certainly delivered. The food was fresh and varied; everyone at the table sampled. The onion rings were especially delicious. Best of all, free parking at the surface lot next door!

Pretty good, would have given it more than 3 stars if they had fresh SEASONED turkey burger patties.  Their patties were from a pre - packaged store, like Costco ' freezer section...I could do that bland at home. I had the Hatch Chile Turkey Cheeseburger (I don't do pork or beef) and it was good; the toppings and the pretzel bun put the bland formed turkey patty to shame. My sister had the Know Poblano Burger (turkey too), she liked it and LOVED the pretzel bun. O'rings were good and so were the fries; better than most.  I was a bit disappointed because of the use of pre-formed turkey patties because it didn't really appear that they seasoned the patty and they charged extra for the choice of turkey. I understand it's a burger place, I know their speciality is beef...but pre - formed turkey patties...meh!  I will say, the other diners looked like they were enjoying their chow.  Don't know if I will go back, unless they figure the turkey patty thing but I will say...looking at the other diners eating their beef, they looked pretty happy. So...you eat beef...go! Turkey....just don't be shocked about the bland pre-formed patty...BYOSpices! 

Tip: Get the Pretzel Bun...it is nice and light...D-licious!

First time here and I do have to say that they hyped up this place way too much. I got the mushroom Swiss burger and the Mac and cheese with bacon. When the food came out, the burger tasted very plain and to be honest it did not have a fresh taste and it wasn't juicy like I expected it to be. Very dry and tasted microwaved. Our waitress was very distracted. She was taking our order and her focus was on other things. Our Mac and cheese that was supposed to be our appetizer, came out the same time as the burgers which irritated me a lot. The look of the Mac and cheese looked tasty but as soon as k tried it, it tasted very plain as well! Overall, I do not think I will come back to this place but it's always good to try new places.

I love Rehab burger. I had my birthday party there and it was the best. The staff was the best!!!! Only 15 people said they were coming, but 38 people showed up. The staff went with the flow and had no problems seating everyone. I was really impressed when the staff brought the right food to the right people! There wan't any confusion of who ordered what. The staff is super friendly, personable and  take time to help you order when you're unsure of what will crunch your hunger. The food is amazing too!!!! I would eat there any day of the week. I love burgers and they are on the top of my list of places to eat. If anyone has a large group of people and not sure where to go, this is the place to go!

We had a late lunch here and it was delicious! The pig wings - I can't even describe how amazing they were. You must have the pig wings, they were so tasty. I wish that they serve the pig wings on the East Coast because I would have those every week. I also had the peanut butter and jelly burger which I know sounds questionable, but it works. It's different and you should try it once you get over the fact that there's peanut butter on your burger. Swing by if you're in Scottsdale because this was definitely one of my favorite restaurants we ate that during our trip.

Loved the mushroom & Swiss as well as poblano if you want something spicy...
Very hip atmosphere, feels like on vacation.

This burger joint has my favorite cheeseburger in the universe! I could eat there daily but I eventually wouldn't fit through the door. We came here for my husband's birthday, our daughter got the peanut butter and jelly burger and liked my cheeseburger better. So, remember that sometimes what you know is better than the excitement of the unknown. Joe's birthday dessert was a double brownie with Reese's peanut butter cups melted between the brownies, toasted marshmallows, vanilla ice cream drizzled with hot fudge and caramel. I took a picture for you! The food is amazing. It is a little loud in there due to its popularity and it's a very casual place. Shorts, t-shirts and flip flops are the norm and they have a full bar. You can't go wrong! It's a small place not really set up for babies and toddlers, so leave them with a sitter and enjoy the cool vibe of this gem.

I have been here twice, both times we sat at the bar.  Both times not stupid busy but busy enough.  Our burgers are always amazing and I love that they have so many other options to choose from for people who do not eat burgers and such (like my vegetarian sister)  So if I were to come I could get my burger as usual and they could have all the time in the world to read up on the rest of the menu.  I like the hangover burger the best because I love eggs especially over easy on my burgers.  Kind of a constant staple for me lately.  I have to go and try their shakes and pot brownies still. so once I try more and the desserts I will add more to this review. But if you are looking for a great burger spot in Scottsdale this is my first choice for this city!

As far as service goes, nothing worth raving about but its never horrible. Consistent is the word for their service but not persistent if that makes any sense. So if you need a refill...Speak up.

This more a review of bartender "Kaye" than the food.  Ordered wings which were (actually) delicious but watching Kaye in action was great. Super attentive, communicative, enthusiastic and cheerful.  Really sets a great mood for the place.

I  LOVE LOVE LOVE Rehab Burger!! The food is awesome, there are two sizes, Rehab (bigger) and Relapse (smaller), the smaller burger is really big! I always get the Bacon cheeseburger, mainly because I am to scared to try new things....but....the other day my friend tried the PB&J burger...I know, that's what I was thinking too, how gross peanut butter and jelly on a hamburger, disgusting.  OMGawd!!!!!  IT WAS AHHHHHH-MAZING!!!!  It was so good! The sweet potato taster tots are awesome too.  Feels like it's always super busy when I go there, but I guess that speaks to how good it is.  The wait staff is not the best, every time I go no matter what day or time of day, the wait staff is pretty slow and sometimes forgetful.  If you can overlook the so so waitstaff (they are always friendly) and go solely for the food...you will NOT be disappointed !!

We were not impressed with our first visit to rehab burger!  When we got there for an early lunch, they weren't busy at all, but the hostess tried to sit our table of 6 at a table for 4, just squeezing extra chairs in.  We had to complain to get moved to a bigger table.  Service was SLOW!! We waited forever to get our order taken, then after 30 minutes when the food finally came they hadn't even put my husbands order in to the kitchen, so he had to wait FOREVER to get his food, we were all done eating when it came out.  The food was ok... I wanted a lettuce wrapped burger but they were out of lettuce so that was kind of a bummer.  Also I ordered well done and my burger was really pink in the middle.  Overall not impressed, will not be back.  I'm not sure why so many people like this place! 

*** also to those asking if this place is kid friendly I would say it depends on the kid.  They have no kids menu, and it is LOUD in here.  My almost 2 year old didn't like the loud music.  Also they tried to seat us as a bar height table and stack 2 high chairs for him to sit on, I don't see how that is safe.

What a Great Clean suprise in Scottsdale , with all the over done facades, this place KNOWS HOW TO PLEASE the customer right from first contact !   This burger place is awesome and the great selection for a burger is the best hands down !  Hatch Green chili , out of this world , Thanks for the recommdation from the best wait staff in this Scottsdale !   The tabel side visits were frequent , and a visit from Willy , (owener ) Top of the class in Customer service !  

Thank you for bringing  a true fresh burger place ALIVE in Scottsdale , and stay strong , Love to keep YOU and the Rehab Burger Therapy around for a long run in the valley .   WE WILL be back to treat ourseoves to the rest of the menu after WE REHAB from the monster buger we just ate !

Hubby had never been here before and had been wanting to try it so we decided to go on our way to the aquarium. I had already been here before and knew how good their burgers or so I was looking forward to it. I also knew to come hungry so it was a good thing that I skipped breakfast! This time around I opted for the Philly cheese burger on a pretzel bun. The shaved ribeye paired with the provolone cheese and sautéed peppers and onions was a match made in heaven. The burger was cooked perfectly and the dollop of cheese whiz they topped it with made me think I was back in Philly. Hubby ordered the Chili cheeseburger on the traditional brioche bun. We decided to split half-and-half and I'm glad we did. The chili was full of flavor and topped with cheese and sour cream. One of us got the sweet potato tots and the other opted for  onion rings and I would be hard-pressed to say which was my favorite. Both were delicious! Neither one of us could finish all of our burgers so we had a pretty good size takeout container to take back to our furry daughter back home. Service was really good and even though they were extremely crowded our server did a good job of checking up on us every now and then. Hubby enjoyed it (as I knew he would!) and can't wait to return to try one of the other many burgers that he wanted.

Seriously creative burger menu! I mean, when have you ever seen a macaroni & cheese burger or a P B & J bacon burger? Well, they have it there and we ordered them! Well I didn't, but people at our table did...  And I think they were 10 OZ. burgers. You had your choice of 2 sizes; rehab or relapse. We're talking some big burgers here! They said the mac n cheese was very good and the pb&j was very interesting. Both plates left not a crumb, so that tells you something, right? I especially liked the choices of buns & sides and the sauces to accompany them were great. 

We started with calamari which I thought was a wimpy thing to do since they serve it everywhere. However, they proved me wrong because it was really good! Breaded strips of calamari steak with a fantastic marinara style chunky sauce. Yum!

I opted for a lighter fare - or so I thought, and ordered a salad. Here's the lowdown on it:  Rodrigo Da Vinci -A spanish masterpiece created with a blend of iceberg and romaine lettuce, tomatoes, cilantro, scallions and corn tortilla strips tossed with chipotle ranch. Then topped with spicy grilled chicken sauteed in peppers and onions, more tortilla strips, shredded cotija, cheddar jack cheese, a dollop of sour cream and a sprinkle of cilantro. it's art for your hunger! it was really tasty. My only complaint was that it was way too overdressed.  I should have thought to say light on the dressing or order it on the side.  Next time...

All in all, a terrific place and the service was great too!

Bought lunch for my employees here last week to try it out for the first time we all loved it.  Had the spicy Mac and cheese burger for lunch and was so full only had half.  Ate the rest for dinner that night.  So amazing.  
Will be back!!!!

Been going to Rehab Burger for months now and absolutely one of the best burgers joints in town and plus the owners come to table to table asking how is your food and feels great getting to know there customers, I will definitely be coming back!

Finally found the best burger place in town! The burgers were perfectly cooked and absolutely delicious.  According to my 10 year old the fries were the best ever and I agree. Amazing onion rings and wings too. Plus, the service was outstanding. Words cannot describe the pot brownie. Heavenly doesn't quite do. We cannot wait to come back!

I've been to rehab burger therapy several times and enjoyed it. I've even recommended people go there. It isn't the best burger in town but it's okay.

We had family plans to go last night and made a reservation a week in advance because there were going to be 8+ of us and I know how busy it would be on a Saturday.

When we arrived at the time of our reservation, we were told we hadn't made a reservation. When my mother persisted that we had made a reservation a week in advance she was yelled at the night manager and told that they only had one reservation that night and that it was filled. 

... He was extremely aggressive, condescending and frankly ridiculously rude... he didn't even take the time to actually check the reservations... 

... when he did, he discovered that we actually did have a reservation and came out trying to apologize for the wait... offering no explanation. 

Turns out they had given our reservation out to another group and when he (night manager) found out about it, he yelled at the waitress who had made the mistake. 

Listen, mistakes are made... that's easy to forgive. 

... But there is NO excuse for the way we were treated and particularly the way my mother was treated my the manager. 

They did hustle to accommodate us and gave us free appetizers as an apology for the wait... unfortunately the damage was done.

I'll now actively not recommend burger rehab therapy and certainly won't go back.

I have yet to find a better burger! They're delicious and you have to try the spicy mac and cheese!! I'm from out of state and every time I come into town I have to stop here. We were recommended it by some locals and were not disappointed! Definitely worth stopping by!
By far my favorite local eatery! I love the food, it's delicious!! I've tried everything there and life be it all! I recommend it to everyone.

Just awesome! We started with the pig wings which were just the best! I had the poblano burger, which I subbed for chicken. It was so tasty and spicy, I loved it. My bf had the pescado sandwich. I took a bite and I could actually smell and taste the beer. It was so good! Lo was our waitress and she was awesome! We will be back very soon!!!!!!

Based on the yelp reviews, I had to check this place out during spring training.  Place looked like an awesome joint to have a burger and hang out. I ended up ordering the bacon cheeseburger on a brioche bun with jamaican corn. Definitely one of my top 5 burgers I ever had, the only regret is that I ordred a small patty instead of a large. (I felt that the bread to meat ratio was a little off.)  My friend ordered a swiss and mushroom burger on a pretzel bun.  The pretzel bun isn't really my thing, but tasted delicious otherwise. Would and will definitely come back here if I'm in town!!

I love coming to this place. They always have reggae playing which I enjoy. The servings of food will never disappoint. I think your getting a huge bang for your buck as the quality is there, huge serving, and happy during the day makes it even better.

One of the better burgers I've had. The unique burgers they create keep the basic burger relevant. I had the pb&j burger and enjoyed every bit. I will definitely be back to try another interesting combination!

Great burger! 

We passed through Arizona on our road trip and this is one of the more popular place and I can see why. We got the 10 Oz. Burger and I barely finished it. You can get the 5 Oz if you want, but you might as well go big or go home! Well... Actually I can imagine the 5 Oz being just fine, since you do get a side with it. 

I got the hangover burger and the pepper was grilled, the egg wasn't oozy, the meat was juicy (medium), it was a good burger. I would say it's more on the pricey side, but it's worth it!

Stopped in to eat dinner at Rehab Burger while visiting my sisters fiancé with my family. It was amazing! The atmosphere is very cool- causal and fun, and the outside seating would be prime if we came during the day. 

The hostess was very friendly and our waitress was so nice. She was very knowledgeable about the menu and even helped with suggestions when we weren't sure what to try. She checked on us numerous times throughout our meal to make sure we were doing ok and to make sure we didn't need anything. 

The unique variety they have for burgers is awesome. They have mac and cheese, PB&J... you name it they have it. The PB&J burger is amazing. You would think it would be a little strange but it's awesome and has a great taste to it. 

We ordered chips and salsa to start and the chips were very fresh and crispy. The salsa was great but it had a little bite to it. I'm a plain jane so I ordered a cheese burger but it was absolutely delicious! My sister got the mac  and cheese burger and it was great. 

Overall great restaurant, cool and causal atmosphere, friendly staff and great customer service. Would definitely recommend!
AWESOME - JUST AWESOME!! One of the best gourmet burgers I've ever had. Great service. Now.... The wings could be the best in Phoenix. We will definitely be back when visiting next time.

Excellent burgers that are very unique for the menu. Such a "Chill" atmosphere with plenty of bar tables and decent size bar. Perfect place to start and end your happy hour. Andrea is an excellent server and you can tell everyone helps out with the guests. The food is made exactly as I expected and asked the first time!

What a cool hamburger joint. We found Rehab Burger when we were leaving dinner at nearby restaurant. We could smell the food coming from Rehab and knew we had to check it out. We were not disappointed. They have so many way to make a great burger, greater...  I had the Porkster Burger. Very tasty pulled pork and a great hamburger, it was awesome. We shared the Rehab size, 10 oz patty, with Sweet potato Tots and side of fries. All were really good. Beer selection is, ok. Would have liked to see more micro brews on tap. We'll be back on a game day.

I've went to Rehab Burger twice and both times had absolutely AMAZING food!!  The first time we went the bartender was so nice he made the experience really fun while we sat there and ate.  The second time I went was last Wednesday for lunch and the young girl waitress with the long brown hair had the worst attitude, she was very snyde & not very helpful at all... which is too bad because I brought my friend who had never been before and he got a bad impression of the atmosphere.

Hangover Burger - My favorite!!  Love a fried egg on a juicy burger.

Chili Burger - Also delicious but not as good as the Hangover in my opinion.

Definitely check it out but don't sit in the snotty girl's section if you want to enjoy your experience!!

So everyone in Scottsdale raves about this place, and when we by chance wandered past it, we had to stop and see what all the excitement was about. 

First of all, this place feels like a bar more than a restaurant - just some to keep in mind if you're bringing the young kids.  It's not an obnoxious bar though, but possibly not a place for babies if it's a busy weekend. 

Peanut butter and jelly bacon burger on a pretzel bun?  This is the standing "burger of the year?"  Definitely not something on the menu in my hometown.  Ordered the petite size with tater tots. 

The food arrived quickly, after less than 15 minutes. Taste and quality were good, but perhaps less explosive than what I expected after hearing so much raving about this place. Fortunately it wasn't overly greasy, which is surprising considering it was covered in bacon. It's def not on my normal healthy diet, but this was a special weekend for friends so what the heck.  

My verdict was that it was pretty good, and I can check it off the list - but don't need to go out of my way to return here again, and it's still simply a bar that sells burgers and has friendly service.

The table was too tall for us tiny gals but the burger.. wow! Yum. PB&J won my heart. The decor had a very relaxing and casual atmosphere, kinda sporty. The staff was very friendly, and prompt. It was a very clean place, and it felt good having some water (like 10 glasses) of it on a hot day while waiting for my coke, and my wifes beer. The selection of burgers was nice and large, and while we shared the PB&J, others jumped out at us too. We will definiately be back now that we live in the area!
Had high expectations after all the reviews and wasn't disappointed .  The mac n cheese burger is to die fir, better than PBJ one, which was amazing.  Fun and great food.

This is our current favorite burger place and has held that title for us these past few years.  That's saying a lot, since we eat burgers in Nashville, Dallas, California and wherever else we may end up.  I could classify my husband as a burger connoisseur.  Burgers are one of his four food groups.

This Reggae playing, Island Beach themed establishment is one busy place.  Get there early if you have a preference for inside or patio seating.  The wait for the food is always worth it!

Rehab has a large selection to choose from and they don't only offer Burgers, which they serve just about anyway one could dream up, (i.e. PBJ Burger, the Farmer, the Porker), they have salads, sandwiches and awesome service by an excellent, humorous, and attentive wait staff.  

I usually build my own burger, choosing the Brioche Bun, which is always fresh and not in any way a bland old white burger bun.  One may also opt for a Wheat or Pretzel Bun, which I want to try every time, but I can't seem to refuse the yummy Brioche.  My husband ordered an 'un-hinge your jaw' humongo burger which he thoroughly enjoyed.  To name a couple of their quite delightful sides:  sweet potato tots and deep fried Cajan and Butter seasoned fresh Corn on the Cob.  This isn't an ordinary nor a boring burger place. 

It's a good thing Rehab is 4 states away from us!  This is the kind of restaurant where most
everyone leaves wishing they hadn't eaten SO much.  Good is not the proper adjective to describe this 5 Star Burger Bar.

We've been going here for years, it's the best burger I've ever had. My husband, whose favorite food is burgers, agrees. I get the 5oz Jalapeno Popper burger (best one!) with pretzel bun and either fries or onion rings. Onion rings are great with the spicy pineapple bbq sauce. It's not good for you but man is it tasty!

I arrived on Thursday night it was not busy which surprised me.  They have happy hour all night on Thursdays.  I ordered a spicy Mac burger and it was huge and very good!   You have a variety of sides and dipping sauces.  I chose the sweet potato tots and could not pick a sauce so the bartender brought me his four favorite.  They were all good!   The staff was very friendly.

Great place and great food! Loved it! Burgers are amazing! The service is good. Just be aware the place is small. So if someone has a party reservation of at least 15, it can take up the whole restaurant. We had a party of 6 but Rehab was waiting on a bday party so we had to sit at the bar. I think they shouldn't offer huge party reservations on Saturday evenings but  it happens.
The service was a little slow at first. I wasn't impressed with the burger. I was disappointed we drove 40 mins when we have better burgers closer to home. Will not be returning.

We were looking for somewhere new to try so we came to Rehab Burger Therapy last night. It was Saturday about 7. We were welcomed and got seated right away. It took about 10 minutes for anyone to come over to our table to ask about drinks or anything. We ordered a chili burger, build your own burger and a hot dog. The chili was very plain with lots of tomatoes. I'd have to say this is the first restaurant where my kids didn't devour the French fries. They have an odd seasoning salt of them. 
The food was okay. I thought the prices were reasonable. The service could have been better. Our server was super nice. Overall super slow. We may try again, not sure. Definitely worth at least trying once. 

The easiest way to find is to access 6th street off of Mill Ave.  They are next to the parking garage.

Last time I was here I took my daughter and I made a big mistake. I should have shared my burger with her, we had a lot of wasted food because we don't eat a ton of food. What we did have was really great, the burgers were cooked great, the fries were really great...it's hard to mess up fries but it happens...

It was the middle of the day and it was slow which is the way I like it. We were in and out quickly, the service was friendly and the place has a great eclectic atmosphere. Check it out.

This place has such a chill vibe!! Always greeted warmly and gave great service. Burgers are giant of course, and plated very pretty - awesome photo op! Tasty tasty too!! Been several times and always can only eat half.. so if you can agree on a burger with someone, best to go splitskies. If you follow then on Facebook, you get the inside intel on the special weekend burger creation they always have- stay tuned, there's some pretty cool stuff! Both fries and sweet potato tater tots are fantastic, you won't go wrong with either! Keep up the great work, Rehab!!

Excellent burgers. Quality beef makes a difference! We split the 10 oz for lunch and it was PLENTY!  Sweet potato tater tots wierd and not very tasty. Cannot recommend those.

Nice selection of beers. Liked special offerings to dress burgers.
Great location right before a game at Scottsdale Stadium. EZ walk. 

Service good. Young crowd. Burgers took a little while, but worth the wait.

Being raised within New Mexico and in contact with hatch chili, the Hatch Burger was surprisingly spicy! It was good but it would have been much better with some lettuce tomato and onion, which is offered in the menu. 

I did notice a woman order a mac and cheese burger, which is why I will be going back to try such an intriguing burger. Do not order your burger with water. A root beer or a beer would definitely leave you feeling full and satisfied.
This place rock super hard . Try out the PB&J burger sandwich , it will blow your mind. They have a variety of burgers, so come in here and blow your burger mind away.

Fun place with tasty burgers!  We were here two years ago and happy to stop again. Twenty minute wait went quickly people watching outside. 
My husband's plain ole burger was cooked just how he likes it...rare. My poblano burger, medium well, had some kick to it!  Friend's Swiss and his wife's ghost were a bit off in how  done they were cooked. (Her medium well was pink.) Three giant onion rings were tasty as were the fries. Fries were a bit on the cool side. 
Drinks were refreshing.  Mine had some coconut and pineapple juice in it...mmmm. 
Great service and a friendly atmosphere made for a great place to stop. Free parking next door is a bonus in the public lot.

The burger here did not disappoint. Hubby and I were in the area and have wanted to visit this restaurant for awhile now so we were pretty excited. The restaurant was not very busy to our surprise. We decided to share the ghost burger with fries. The plate was definitely enough for two because the burger itself was pretty big. Our server was also pretty friendly. Very happy we tried it. I definitely recommend if you are in the area.
Good atmosphere. Excellent food. Good service. Thanks waitress Cassidy!! Definitely would suggest to a friend or even a stranger!!!!

This seems like a place to go if you want to feel like a hipster.  Turns out, I have no desire to be a hipster.  The food was only subpar and the service matched. The only way I'd go back was if it were on a weeknight so hopefully both my food and myself would get more attention. Not worth the half hour Friday night wait.

Here's the deal: I only went for happy hour and thoroughly enjoyed my Mai Tai. The menu had many selections and a wide variety of burgers. My friend ordered the Hangover Burger and it looked amazing. 

The chips & salsa/guac were not my favorite but overall I loved the fun, vibrant west coast ambiance. It's a great place of your looking for something casual, laid back and satisfying.

Pretty cool place and good burgers. I liked it because it's different from the rest of Scottsdale. Staff was friendly, tables and silverware were clean and the whole vibe was casual and inviting. Our burgers were huge and tasty. There are many varieties on the menu. It is also reasonably priced. There was nothing negative about it and that's why I gave it 5 stars. I love these little places like this one. Local, small, inviting, casual and amazing food.

Let's get this right off the bat, Rehab serves up one of the best burgers in AZ. The lean/fat ratio, seasoning, and cook on the burger patty is always on fleek. Your ability to choose what delicious bun is unique. Burger toppings are high quality and unrivaled. On this particular visit I ordered the PB&J Bacon Burger, and was a bit surprised how well the flavors blended together. I also had a bite of my dining partner's Hangover Burger which was also delightful. 

That being said, their sides are AWFUL. French fries - so over cooked and bad that I almost broke my sobriety. Sweet potato tots - so soggy and bland that no treatment could help them. Onion rings - enough grease to fill a few shot glasses.

The service was awesome and not your typical Scottsdale vibe. Expect a 5 star burger and service but stay away from the other menu items.
Absolutely love this place.  Food is always consistently fabulous and service is great tool

I've come to this location over a dozen times. It truthfully depends on where you sit I've noticed on how well or how terrible your service is. I've had one gentleman that is amazing every time I've gotten him. Every other waiter has been ok to horrible. The food however? Amazing. This is my second worst experience I've had at this location. Today I came in, after waiting over 10 minutes for someone to ask for our order, we asked a random waitress & inquired about the weekend special burger. The waitress had no idea there was even a special burger today. The worst part was when she asked who our original waiter was, she didn't know, turns around & simply blurts out "what do you want?" I'm not a waiter or waitress but the tone of voice which this was said in, atrocious to say the least. I drive all the way from Laveen to come eat here the times I do. This may very well be my last. Even with the food being as amazing as it is.

The burger was outstanding. I had the pb n j burger. I would of never thought in a million years that I would order that kinda of burger. But it was awesome. It also had bacon and sirracha on it. It was just a little heat to go with the sweet. This place was awesome the wait was a little long for 5 of us, but well worth it.

Came here during the Tempe Arts Festival and lucky for us because they are not right on Mill Ave. we got a patio seat for 4 right away.  I am always looking for a great HH place for my work group as I work down the way and was excited to try the Rehab.  The burgers were excellent/delicious/juicy/pretzel bread bun/awesome!!!  The service was over the top compared to the previous establishment just a few doors down.  We tried the green chili burger and it was delicious.  I was very impress with everything and the price for a 1/2 pound burger is around 10 bucks, which you can split with someone easily, it's more than enough.  Very happy with everything and I will be back.

This is my 3rd time at Rehab in 1 week. The ambience, staff, food & location all add up to AMAZING!!!

I could go on & on about this place, but I will try to sum it up succinctly:
If you want a comfy environment, people to interact with that also serve food/drinks, sports on the big screen, a central location, full satisfied stomach/liver...this is your place. Locals & tourists align perfectly. Come here. You'll be back.

Big shout out to CW, Kate, Stefi, Robin & the rest of the team.

Great burger spot. Unfortunately I was there too meet family & friends for drinks. The girls had ordered a burger with pb & j & siracha?  I love burgers. I couldn't do it altogether tho. Love siracha. On the burger:awesome. Pb & j? Not on my juicy burger please. Separately it was fantastic. Sweet potato tots or was it fries? Ohmy!  I can't remember. Did I mention I was here for drinks?  In all, I would come back again. The menu looked delicious. Tip: public parking lot was just around the corner.

Let me be clear. Best. Hamburgers. Ever. Period.
Go try them and see if i'm lying. I think you can still cook a better burger at home if you are serious but let's be realistic in today's times. Amazing awesome unbelievable. Believe it. Go there.

This place is is the best! I had a veggie portobello mushroom burger, vegan style (I'm not vegan, but try to eat more plants). My server brought out 4 vegan sauces, but I found I didn't need to add sauce, as the mushroom had a nice marinade. The burger was packed with fresh veggies. It was served with a side of sweet potato tots. The portion was so huge, that I'd recommend sharing dinner so you can share a milkshake for dessert. Mmm.
Excellent combos and beef. The brioche bun is the only way to go! Service is great and the place is nicely decorated with cool music. Patio is nice. Sweet potato tots are great alternative to fries.

I love the crazy burgers you can get here.  We asked the waiter for recommendations and he said that as crazy as it sounds the PB&J bacon burger is a top seller.  I went for it and it was good.  I would like to try it again.  The burgers are very large and filling and the service is good.  I have tried 3 other weird burgers here and they have all been great.
Definitely lived up to the crazy burger photos that they post to Facebook. My burger was great and the sweet potato side was great. Certainly an unnecessary quantity of food for lunch but who cares.

Not Bad, not great.  Typical trendy burger place.  It was a lot of food, I'll give them that.  Our server was a standard Scottsdale waitress with little patience and crappy customer service.  I could take or leave this place.

Need a good quick dinner and did not want to pay exuberant prices.  This burger joint filled the spot.  Lots of varieties on a classic burger.  Awesome fries and great drinks.  It was super busy when I was here but I sat rather quickly at the bar and made some new acquaintances.  I had a very delicious burger.  I do not recommend the sweet tater tots...too sweet, not sure how that happened since I love sweet potato fries.  I will likely be back next time I am in the area.

This is my new favorite burger place. I had the PBJ and Bacon Burger and it was absolutely the best burger I had in such a long time. The fries were really good as well. We went during happy hour so we had a mimosa for $5 (regular $7) and that was pretty decent as well. The service was nice, not too loud, and just an overall really great experience. Can't wait to go again!
My family loved this place!  Cade was an excellent waiter, and we had a great time.  The dessert was fabulous, and the burgers were awesome.
Must have the pb&j burger it sounds odd but so incredibly good! The tots are yummy as well!

Rehab is the best burger bar in Scottsdale.  Service is great, and the food always comes out perfect.  The only doeskin is the wait.  Typically it runs 10-20 minutes to get a seat.  Off-hours, tables are always available.

If you want a quiet place to eat, with minimalist  decor, and inexpensive burgers, go to McDonald's. If you want a hoppin' joint, funky and eclectic atmosphere, fun crowd, great service, with ginormous burgers that earn the title Best Of AZ, go to Rehab. Great flavor to the burgers and condiments, heck even the fries were delicious! Decent selection of beer. Not as much as some other local places, but you came here for the burger anyway. They also have non beef and vegetarian options for their burgers. It's not a super cheap place, but it's not outrageous, and you get MORE than your money's worth. 
Added bonus, there were two Pokéstops within range of our table, so the kids were extra happy!

Rian the bartender ROCKS, "Serious Mike" seems cool too! My husband and I are new to the area and this was our first time here. Had a few drinks at the bar and onion rings, YUM!! will be back for sure. Thanks Rian and "Serious Mike" for a fun time!!!
Great, burgers, great waitress and great beer! The bacon burger was decent along with he chicken wings, the cute waitress was nice and the Kilt Lifter beer really hit the spot!!!
Super good food. Great service. They even made me a jalapeño vodka margarita. Delicious burgers.

Omg this place was awesome!!! Their poblano burger and sweet potatoes tator tots were delicious!  Service was great and the waitress Selena was very personable and informative!  We are from California and will definitely recommend this to our friends that will come and visit!!

As far as California surf town joints go, I am a fan!

This location creates the complete surf town ambiance with its beach cruisers, surf boards, and flat panels with aquariums and beach scenes.

You can expect to find bar food here such as chicken wings and chili cheese fries.  And of course there are the burgers.  You can choose from about a dozen burgers, as well as the ability to build your own.  You also have the option of a "rehab" and "relapse" size.  The smaller of the two, happens to be the perfect size and portion.

Rehab offers a variety of unique dipping sauces, such as their pineapple aoli, chipotle ranch, habanero ketchup, sweet habanero, and their stone ground mustard.  The pineapple aoli is perfect with the sweet potato tots, the mustard outstanding with the burgers because it has a very mellow sweet and tart flavor.

I ordered my burger medium rare, and it was cooked to perfection.

Despite the restaurant being quite busy, food and drink orders were delivered very quickly.  All food tasted fresh and made to order, and temperatures of the cooked foods were perfect.

There were other options on the menu such as sandwiches and pasta, even smaller portions for kiddos - but this definitely is a burger joint.  With the average burger costing $7.50 for a small and $10.50 for a larger version, the prices are very competitive with other burger joints.

This place can become your local hangout with weekly specials such as thirsty Thursdays where domestic pints are $2 and premiums are $3 as well as $4 drink specials and a dollar off on appetizers.

Furthermore, Happy Hour is 7 days week, until 6p.  You don't get huge savings on the appetizers, but you can definitely drink on a budget here.

Started out with the onion rings with various sauces  delicious! I was in heaven with the ghost cheese burger and the spicy Mac and cheese, it had fried red onions and some amazing sauce. Yum! Bring your appetite the burgers are Colossal.There was a 25 minute wait but me,my man, and our son ate every last morsel! Highly recommended

My husband and I recently moved to the area and stopped by this place on Friday night after reading Yelp reviews. We absolutely loved it! The atmosphere was laid back and had a great vibe. In addition to having an incredible burger menu, they have a great bar/beer selection. I had the jalapeño popper burger and my husband had the hangover burger. We loved every bite and cannot wait to return!!!

We started the meal with onion rings which were perfectly crispy on the outside with moist non-stringy onions inside.  I then ordered the veggie burger, being from CA I'm a sucker for a tasty, in-house made veggie burger.  It wasn't the best I've ever had since it had a two bean base without veggies but I enjoyed ever last bite of it on a pretzel bun.  If I had anymore room in my stomach I would have definitely gone for the "pot" brownie.

After researching burgers spot, I found this place. One of the best burger joints in town and they did not disappoint! I ordered a bacon cheeseburger and it came with fries. The burger was delicious. The problem came with the service. I watched the gal take my check and money and run back to the cash register. Then I watch her chop it up with staff and just kid of stand around. So I had to go and get her to get my change. She goes, oh yeah your change. I was thinking, how can you forget that. Then she asked her coworker to give her some change  for my bill and hands me 8 bucks no receipt. I then ask for a receipt. As I was walking out, I looked at the receipt and it showed total charge, $9.45. I gave her a twenty and got 8 bucks back! I go back and say how did you short change me so much? So, then she hands me ten dollars...and I look at her like, where's the other 45 cents? She and her coworker told me that they don't keep or give our CHANGE! I said, well your not keeping it! Then she hands me a whole dollar and I look at her like, Are you serious? I hand her back the dollar and told her to keep it. I then called and complained to management which said, shes been here for a long time and we haven't had any problems with her service. Really?? I'm scared to go back for fear of my food being harmed...#Rehabbing from being pissed right now!

Rehab Burger Therapy is an example of how sometimes 2 rights can make a....not so right. Burgers? Yes! Mac and Cheese? Would doesn't love it! Jalapeno poppers? Delicious! But everything together? It's just not a burger to me, especially if you have to eat it with a knife and fork. Isn't holding in your hands a delicious piece of fresh, ground cow between buttery, fat buns half the beauty of a burger?

I had the Spicy Mac-N-Cheese burger, and our table also ordered Ghost burger and the special burger, the Loco Moco. My burger had mac n cheese spilled everywhere, and it felt like eating a decent burger with a side of mac and cheese. The Loco Moco burger had rice spilling every where...and rice in a burger? Not sure if they even thought about the logistics of it. The burger itself was mediocre....if you're a high end burger joint, you should have a very excellent burger patty as a base. 

Service was ok, I think staff could use a bit of training on at least their specials (I overheard at least 2 servers not know what the daily special was). It is, however, very conveniently located in walkable distance from the Giants Scottsdale Stadium, and a nice post-game restaurant to head to. In the end the food felt like messy combinations of anything they can think of putting on a burger. Fun place, but far from being the best burger I've ever had (Fergburger takes the crown on that, and all burger joints need to take note), and not really a 4.5 rank in my book.

Holy crap, this place is re-DONK.

We came by here starving and damaged after Tough Mudder the other weekend. Our waitress (bless her heart) was the sweetest lady, and even went out of her way to cut an aloe vera branch from the plant outside for my friend to tend to his wounds. Seriously, is that excellent service or what??

I tried the know poblano burger (grilled spicy onions, manchego, and roasted poblanos) which was absolutely mindblowing. The burger was cooked perfectly, the flavors were unique and punchy, and I finished the whole damn thing despite being full 1/3 of the way in.

And on that note, if you're debating if you're hungry enough to get the 10oz vs the 5oz....seriously, don't be a pansy, get the 10oz.

Great burgers.
Ordered the frito app and ate the entire thing before I could take a photo!  Well worth it!

Reminds me of going to one of those places on the boardwalk that has surfer appeal. The burgers are excellent. I had my first ever ghost burger with ghost peppers because I wanted to live dangerously. Full of flavor and sneaks up on you. While I could only eat half my leftovers were just as good the next day. 
The place is small and the wait can get long so get there early

We love rehab burger and eat here every couple months. The staff is nice, great, cool, on top of their game, and everything else positive you can say about a team of servers and bartenders. The food is out-of-this-world good, especially the side sauces and sweet potato tots. I try to have something different each time we go.

I don't know what else to say other than you'd be doing yourself a disservice if you didn't come here.
Do not hesitate to order the PB&J burger! And our mushroom Swiss burger was perfect too. Service was awesome...can't wait to come back next time I'm in Scottsdale!

I grew up in Scottsdale and when I come to visit I have to come here 2 or 3 times. I love this burger place but don't let the name fool you. The pasta, appetizers and salads are phenomenal. They never disappoint. I highly suggest the calamari and pot brownie if you have room for dessert.

Boom!   A big ol burger, funky flavors, something a little different and great service.   You gotta try this place.   

I've heard about this place that mixed peanut butter and jelly, sriracha sauce on a burger made of choice, and no, it wasn't from someone who was pregnant.    I scoffed, but the look on their face showed they were serious about how much they liked it.   I had to try.    

We rolled in and gave it a try.    The place has atmosphere, which I liked immediately.    The service was johnny on the spot;   friendly, and fast at the end of a work day.  

Our waitress was funny and was spot on.   We liked her immediately.   Then the food came out.  

BP&J Bacon Burger:   its ridiculous.    I like to think I know my way around a kitchen, and am a bit creative bit this thing changed my life.   It was epic.   I didn't even know you could do that, but they did.    It was seriously sloppily delicious.   I'll go back, but next time with a knife,  fork and a giant napkin that won't be big enough to to wipe  the smile off my face. 

The only star I can knock off, is the chef wasn't quite paying attention to the difference between medium rare and well done.   A couple burgers had to go back, and still weren't right.  Don't ask how you want your burger, if you're not going to cook it that way (or the chef doesn't know what the difference is as it pertains to his brain and when to flip the burger). 

You guys almost have it nailed!

Nicely Done Rehab Burger!

Let me begin this review by asking you this: you remember that kid in "Daddy Day Care" that would throw fits and would immediately become docile and mesmerized when someone handed him a dollar? If you don't know what I'm talking about then I'm sorry that you don't have the same love and appreciation for great cinema that I do ;)

If you do remember that kid then this is exactly what happened to me during my first visit. We came here on a whim. Sunday night trying to figure out what to eat, looked up burgers on Yelp. The pictures by Yelpers looked great and this place was offering a Yelp deal. 

When we got there parking was easy, and the place looked neat and clean inside.  We got in with about 40 minutes 'till closing time. The staff was really welcoming and friendly. Ordering was made easier with great suggestions from our server (I took the Hangover with fries while my gf took the Poblano and sweet poToToes

We were set, then waited for our food. About 10 minutes into our wait (maybe less) our server informed us of an issue in the kitchen that would delay our order. She also told us we'd get some key lime pie to compensate for the extra wait. That's good service folks! Our food ended up taking quite a bit. But when it finally arrived we were NOT disappointed. 

The burgers are BIG. Each burger comes in two versions rehab and relapse (10oz vs. 5oz). While I was able to handle the rehab I think I could have been satisfied with the relapse version of this monster. The flavors of the egg, bacon, cheese and chile complemented the savory beef well. The patty was juicy, despite my penchant for well done meat. I also had a taste of the Poblano and thought it was very tasty. The cheese used on this burger stood out for me as I like a sharp cheese.

If you are in the area consider giving this place a try. I know for certain, future rehab sessions are in my immediate future.

This place is awesome! The chicken sandwich and burger was delicious. We really liked the vibe and how we were treated. Best place I've been to recently! The only thing I thought they should have is a kids menu but that's it really. I mean the sandwiches were big enough to share with my nephew but overall, great place, awesome workers and location.

They give a LOT of food and their service is great! I think I got the bigger version of the burger and basically was in a food coma half-way through. I chose the sweet po-tot-oes and they were soo good, but again, WAY too much! Their burger was delicious and I will be going back. :)

Didn't start off so well (they forgot my friend, and my order)...so they compt our meal, which we didn't expect cuz it was no big deal.  Atomosphere is great, burger is great,...will definitly go back, well runned restaurant and friendly.

Absolutely amazing! I can't say one bad thing about this place.  The inside decor is very cute, made me feel like I was on vacation. Every menu item that came out of the kitchen looked great. This was my first time here and it will not be my last.  The portion size was big, but thats never anything that bothers me! The pictures speak for themselves!

I've got to say I am quite disappointed.  I ordered a Hawaiian burger and it was pretty much tasteless. The ham must've been really poor quality because you couldn't even taste it on the burger.. I ordered it cooked medium and it came well done as did the other three burgers at my table.  They did bring us new burgers when we requested it. The waitress was very nice.

This is an perfect place to burger and chill. The Tots rule! The chili, Mac and chz, and hangover burgers were very very good. The ambiance is also what makes the place. This place is on the small side so the wait my be long. The larger burger is the way to go, the smaller one has a tendency to get lost.

PBJ burger is the main attraction here. And sweet potato tater tots.

Not sure if they invented it first, Slater's 50/50 chain in LA, or whoever, but they do their PBJ burger right and it's only $11 for a small or so (plenty big with a side of fries/tots) or $13 for a big on avg for all their burgers.

Lots of TV's, outdoor seating, good drinks at the bar. If you're in Old Town definitely a burger and drinks spot to watch sports too. Service also excellent.

This is one of the best burger places I've been. Every time we are in Scottsdale we come here for burgers.  Believe it or not the peanut butter and jelly with bacon burger is to die for. It is the best tasting burger. I make it at home too but it's not the same as Rehab burger. Highly recommend trying it you will not be disappointed.

Visited this place in Scottsdale recently and it was so good! They were packed even at 4pm on a Sunday. They have some really unique menu items (I had the peanut butter, jelly & bacon burger), delicious!! They need to bring some locations to Dallas/Ff Worth!

Met a friend there early evening. The margarita I had was  great, but a bit sweet. Similar to the Belini at Oregano's.  Great veggie burger. Got part of my order wrong but i didn't mention that as it was only the bread and I didn't care. Was very warm and dark inside. Temperature outside was 110 so the AC might have been strained. Hard to find home made veggie burgers so for that reason I would go back if i were in the area. Server was great and did not hover. Fun place to go in cooler weather to sit on patio. We got there early so there was no wait, but by the time we left, the line was out the door. Not sure it would be worth the wait but it was definitely good enough to try again.

OH MY GOD!  By far the yummiest burer i have had in a long time!  What a great menu!  The sweet poTOTo tots were amazing with the pineapple dipping sauce.  Not too sweet but a perfect combo with these perfectly sized crunchy tots!

Cold beer, awesome drinks and their happy hour rocks! EVERYTHING here is amazing! Get the pretzel bun!!!!!!!!!

Will definitely be going back and i can't wait!

This place rocks. Great food. Great owners. Great prices. No bullshit.    

I have been here a few times.  It looks like San Diego or a place you would come in on right off the beach.  

The owners are always there and they seem to love what they have created.

They have clams on the menu which I have yet to get to, but so far I have had variations of their Turkey Burger and have yet to be disappointed.

The staff is real friendly, love to talk and have a good time.  They also care about making sure you are being taken care of.

I wish more places in Olde Town had the quality of people, food, and service this place does.
Great burgers, service and vibe...  We both received perfectly charred medium-rare burgers with crispy onion rings.  Keep up the good work, Rehab.  We will be back!

So I went to Rehab Burger Therapy... I really liked the name and the burgers looked DELICIOUS on other yelpers photos.
My hotel is close by and it was walking distance, but for some reason I didn't know where anything was because it was so dark out in Old Town. I'm from Houston, and we like a lot of light. 
Anyway I walked in and loved the decor.. It kinda gave me that fun playhouse surfer type beachy feel. (sometimes when I explain stuff it sounds weird, but you'll get it when you see it)

I sat at the bar and read the menu, I decided to order the Bacon Bleu on a Pretzel bun togo. 
It took like maybe 10 minutes. 

When I got back to my hotel. the burger was okay... It was my fault for not asking for lettuce and tomato, but the burger was okay... Not the best but not the worst either. I'll go back again to try a different burger, and give you guys feedback on it!!

I also wish hey had given me napkins for my togo order though.. :-(

Sidebar: there was this girl that worked there, she sounded like and kinda looked a little like Lindsay Lohan... (I'm random I know).

Well... I've been here a few times and have to write a review.  This place is amazing.  Somehow it seems to get better every time I go.  First couple times I just had like a Hang Over Burger and it was darn good and a little unique with the chilis.  Then I had a BBQ Burger.  Hard competition because ya know, everyone has one on their menu, but I was impressed with their own BBQ and of course, the pretzel bun.  Then I tried the PB&J Burger on a whim.  OMG.  Fricken Amazing.  I mean like amazing enough that I will crave it and have to go for it.  All their sides and tots are great and then I tried the Jamaican corn.  Also amazing and totally unique.  So good I went again last night and totally went PB&J w/ corn.  I had to go back though because I was in NYC and someone who travels to Scottsdale says, oh have you heard of Rehab...  YEAH I HAVE.  Tells me to try the Medium/Gold chicken wings.  So that happened.  Cooked perfectly, sauce was spicy and mustardy and delicious.  Off the charts.  Someone else got the pig wings where were also great.  I'm thinking they ought to put that medium/gold sauce on some pig wings or pulled pork too, it would be great.  At this point, it's going to be hard for me to be in the area and go somewhere else.  Also, I should add that every time I've been the crowd has been good and the service is always great and the people are very friendly.

It was really really good! Food was yummy and service was excellent. K was our bartender and server and she was on it.  Tried the hangover burger and it was out of my comfort zone but really good. Pretzel bun was good but I would do a regular bun next time. Wings were our starter and they were good with the homemade Wing sauce (bomb) It was a fun place to try !

Stopped by on a Saturday afternoon while waiting for an oil change. Just wanted a good burger, and was definitely pleasantly surprised! I got the Turkey Burger, which was phenomenal, and not dry at all for a turkey burger, and my boyfriend got the Bacon & Blue. Both were amazing! P.S Get the sweet tots! Conner, our server, was speedy and personable! Definitely a good vibe if you're looking for a chill island-type burger joint.

Ok... This may be my second review for this place, but all I can say is AMAZING!!!  The food, the atmosphere, and Kay... Was amazing!!!  She could sell ice to an Eskimo. 

I had the Elvis burger.... Bananas, peanut butter, chocolate on a bacon hamburger.  It was like cocaine & whiskey on the toilet... To die for!!!!

Thank you Kay for an amazing time at Rehab Burger!
Wow!! PB&J Burger and Mac & Cheese Burger over the top!! Most importantly they killed it on the service. Come hungry my friends!!
My favorite Burger Joint in all of Arizona! Sweet potato tots are always on point and service is constantly 5.  Burgers are always cooked as ordered, never any complaints!

I understand why this place has such a high rating. When we first walked up to the restaurant I was a little nervous. We were seated immediately and our server greeted us shortly after that. Our server was amazing, super attentive, kind and funny. He offered suggestions and recommendations for what was good.

My mom and I both started off with corona-ritas. They were delicious. You can tell they were not made with a mix, but fresh limes and lots of tequila. Very good choice and worth the price. 

With each burger you get to pick a different kind of roll and either French fries or sweet potato tots. Taking our servers suggestions, I got the PBJ & bacon burger on a pretzel bun with French fries. My burger was amazing. Don't be afraid to try this burger. I made my whole family try it and it was the best burger at the table.

My sister ordered the bacon burger, my dad ordered the BBQ burger, and my mom ordered the patty melt. Everyone enjoyed their burgers and how they were cooked, but the PBJ &a bacon burger was still the best. 

Overall food is delicious and the prices were reasonable! Definitely give this place a chance!

pig wings - gots some kick to it.
chile verde con pollo - good.
hatch chile burger - good.
sweet poTOToes - good, on the sweet side.
the atmosphere was really nice.

Arrived with a friend at 4 pm. Perfect, not busy seated on patio, greeted by waiter.  Ordered the onion rings as appetizer and they were good. Burgers next. I ordered mine rare, it came medium well. When you have a burger joint, I am the only customer, you charge $10 for a burger and you can't get it right, three stars is my max.
They kill it, best burgers in old town. Great menu, great staff. Pb&j is a must for first timers or people out of town

My husband and I ordered two different burgers to share. The PB&J burger was delicious! I held the siracha on the side because I'm not a fan but once I tried a little on my burger I wish I would have left it on, it intensified the flavors. We also got the Hawaiian burger but it was really dry.  If they add some sort of Hawaiian BBQ or other sauce it would help the flavor and dryness! Overall, pleased with service and experience.

This place was super fun. The burger was larger than my face but I still enjoyed it. They have an outdoor patio which looked lovely but I ate inside. They have a great variety of condiments, an essential for a great dining experience in my opinion. Our server was so nice.

Super yummy food and fantastic staff (we like Mike!) Their dipping sauces are bomb, especially the wasabi mayo. Outdoor dining has heaters, seemed to be a fun spot for a group although I was there on a date. Great prices on beers!

After months of waiting to try this famous pb and j burger....I was in the area and gave it a go.

I was working, so I ordered pickup. I got sweet potato fries instead of regular...and they were the ish! Customer service was excellent as well. High energetic place which it seemed, the little time I was inside of course. 

I told them that it was my first time, so they put all of their sauces in my bag to try as well. They were all great. Scottsdale was a little out the way for me, but I will definitely be making my way up their again for this burger. They won me over, easily.

If you like thick beef patties, then maybe you'd like this place. I asked for well done for my beef patty, not burn it so that it's bitter and nasty. The chocolate shake tastes like it was made from Hershey's chocolate syrup and low quality shake base (disgusting). I prefer sweet potato fries over sweet potato tots. The tots taste like regular potatoes to me. We got the BBQ pork wings and some of it was good, some were dry. It was also way to barbecue-ee for my taste. The place was way too loud.

The service was TERRIBLE!! Our servers name was Ben and he was awful! He basically ignored us the entire time we were there. All he did was set our food down and walk away. The food looks good in pictures and even in person but the taste is just ok... My husband got the Bosa burger (Bosa doughnuts as buns) the bottom doughnut was literally sitting in liquid when it arrived and as my husband picked it up it disintegrated in his hands. I got the burger with pulled pork on top and it was swimming in spicy bbq sauce which, if you like spicy bbq sauce probably would have been really good however, I don't like spicy food and it said nothing about it being spicy on the menu. If it did I wouldn't have ordered it. As the manager walked by and asked how everything was I explained that I didn't really like spicy food and was unable to really eat any of the burger she said "Aw, I feel bad" and walked away. So we paid $14 for 2 bites of a burger. I live in north Phoenix and would never drive all the way back to this place. It's not worth the time out of my day.

A good hamburger is one of my favorite meals.  Throw in some good sides and done!!  I ordered the Know Poblano burger and my wife ordered a basic salad with chicken.  Also got sweet potato tots and french fries to go with it.  The burger was amazing-perfectly cooked and the toppings did not outweigh the taste of the meat.  And the tots were on another level.  No complaints whatsoever about Rehab Burger.

Wow, had the PB&J Bacon Burger...and I would have never ordered it had it not been for what I saw in the other YELP reviews....it was amazing.   The combination of PB&J with Sriracha and bacon is out of this world.   Very messy but worth it (not first date food.)    My husband had the Porkster Burger and he also gave it a thumbs up.

Do not miss Rehab if you are in downtown!

Not to be a douche, but meh. I wanted to love this place, but the fries were soggy, that was my first bite. Second bite was a cloyingly sweet tot. Not my thing.

Burger was huge. I'll say that. A Rehab, got three meals out of it. Fair is fair. But unremarkable taste.

Service was slow, if vaguely friendly. Again, not terrible, but a $14 burger? Umami it wasn't.

Very disappointed this visit. We drove an hour to get here today and they supposedly ran out of the father's day special  burger at 11am.. on father's day. Also out of gluten free buns as well. Been coming here for years but this was a disappointing visit. Ironic cause they open at 11am on Sundays and our server said they ran out of this burger at 11am... then she laughed and said "great father's day marketing on our part". The greasewood burger.. how can you "run out"? Has all the same ingredients as the other burgers you offer. Poor planning. One of us in our party is gluten tolerant and when a place who specializes in burgers with buns runs out of gluten free buns and only was open for 4 hours..? Management is going down hill here. I counted 3 parties of 2 walk in and leave cause the wait was "25-30" minutes yet there were open table tops. Time to find a new burger place. 

Edit: went once more, same terrible service. Went from a 2 star to a 1 star.

One of the best burgers I have ever had. My fav burger is in Pittsburgh. But most def the best burger in phoenix. I love the sweet potato tots. They give you so much food. I love the breakfast burger.

I love the burgers here. Always make my burger right, medium well. Great fun atmosphere. sevice is never lacking. the servers are attentive and quick. they are always smiling. manager always checks on each table. restaurant is clean as well as the bathrooms. easy to find parking. overall excellent experience every single time.

First of all, service was awesome! I was so pleased with our waitress, she knew it was our first time here and gave us suggestions and was patient with us. She gave us different sauces to try with our super yummy sweet potato tots, and even though I don't like ketchup...the spicy ketchup was really good.

I got the Backyard BBQ burger, relapse (5 oz) size and my boyfriend got the PB+J 10 oz size because our waitress told us it was the most popular and he wanted to be bold.

Well anyways, the PB+J burger was actually good. What?! Life is full of surprises. The menu says there's sriracha in it but he couldn't taste it at all. 
I substituted my onion rings w/ pineapple instead and it was very hawaiian tasting. 

The menu is very creative. The burgers were good but wasn't amazing. The sweet potato tots were verrry delicious. I love anything sweet potato. And the sauces made it better.
I love this place!!! A great addition to the neighborhood- fun vibe, cheap and refreshing drinks, yummy food. Been here several times since they opened and will keep coming!

Got two stars bc have been there in the past (4x past year) and loved it. Today was a BIG disappointment. Premises (inside and out) seemed uncared for. Sat on patio... and with this heat, would expect wait staff to be prompt with waters, instead we had a long wait. Once we ordered, staff neglected to ever bring table settings until we requested three times! And by the end we KNEW what to expect; got carry out boxes for ourselves.
Great atmosphere!! The service was phenomenal!!  Good beer selection and the food was awesome!! Sweet potato tater tots and the burger with pulled pork on top was great!  Can't wait to come back!
Cool burger place. Asked waitress for recommendations on unique burger to choose and it was excellent. Will visit again when I return to scottsdale.

Love this bar!! Me and my boyfriend come here all the time and it's so close we just ride our bikes and come for a great burger and the pig wings!! The staff is great and it's such a great place to just have a drink and chill

It's 9pm on a Saturday night and you've just gotten through roughly six stoutly beers and the drunk bees in your stomach are making it known they want company. This is the place to go. 

I start off with the fried calamari, which were cooked to absolute perfection, not a soggy piece among them, a whole meal's worth by themselves. For my main course, the Hatch Chile Cheeseburger with a turkey substitute and the pretzel bun, and an overabundance of sweet potato tots with a chipotle aoli sauce to dip them in.
