I am in food heaven here. THe chiles gave the burger such a good amount of heat and the flavor...intense. 

My companion and I then split one of the Pot Brownies, reese's style, cuz you gotta have peanut butter with chocolate to cut that much chocolate. I'm not sure if it's because the dessert was thought up by a pot head or because of the cast iron EasyBake pot it comes in but this darkened brick of brown love is delivered, swimming in a lake of what I soon discover is mallow creme, and topped with (you have to mention you want it or you'll sadly go without) two scoops of vanilla ice cream. It's not a dessert for the faint of heart or with diabetes, because if you don't already have to take regular insulin injections you probably will after consuming it.

Whether stoned, high, drunk, or just come down with a super case of the munchies, this little gem in SoSco will hit all your right buttons.

We went here right after a spring training game and it was packed, as expected. We had a 45 minute wait but were able to stand at the bar and have a drink while watching the NCAA tourney. The staff was very friendly despite is kind of being in the way!

When we got seated we got our food pretty quickly which was surprising given how busy it was. The burgers we had were great and you can choose a pretzel bun which was amazing. 

I couldn't resist and had to order the mac N' cheese burger. It was good, a bit rich but it did have Mac N' cheese on it. Overall it was much easier to handle than I anticipated and I was very pleased. 

I'll be visiting again while in Scottsdale. If recommend it to anyone in the area looking for a good burger and good prices.

Did I ask them to cook my burger perfectly... no, but they did!!!

As a matter of fact they never did ask me how I wanted my 10 ounce burger cooked, but when it came out and I had my first taste I knew it was love at first bight! I dont think I have ever had a better cooked or tastier burger in my life! The carmlized onions were bliss and the pretzle bun had just the right heft to hold up to this massive burger

The place was only 11 days old on our visit so when the Pig Wings didnt fly, that misfire was excused, but with a tad more work this intersting cut of pork could soar. The "wings" were just a tad dry and the sauce was one dimentional, but I like the concept. 

Our server offered the wedge salad $5 and said it was good- she was flat out lying, it was amazing! By far the very best wedge I ever ate, made myself, or served any one of my customers. Our group of 3 were still talking about it 3 days later, and we are all foodies that work in the Biz.

One of the owners stopped by the table to chat, that was a nice touch and her crazy beautifull smile was a more then welcome addition to our lunch.

Is this the best restaurant in town... Heck No! it's far to cassual to compete with the very best, but its my new favorite place in Old Town.
jv

Since the last review I wrote over a year ago (it was delicious then), I can now say this is one of my favorite spots in AZ. The service and food are both amazing. I have yet to order something here that hasn't been delicious -- my favorites (besides the burgers, which are all amazing) are the wings, sweet potato tots, and the chili cheese fries.. SO good!!! The place gets very busy so get here early, also, all day happy hour on Thurs!

This place is AMAZING!  My favorite burger spot by far.  I've actually tried a lot of the menu items and have never had a bad thing.  The PBnJ Burger will not disappoint.  Also, staff and service are always on point.  I go here at every opportunity.

Great burger joint with a good music playing.  I tried the PB and J burger, which is surprisingly pretty good.  Girlfriend had the veggie burger and said it was delicious as well.  We came at 1pm on a Saturday, which happened to be the time the farmers market next door ended.  Things were pretty hectic but we squeezed into some open seating outside on the railing.  It took a little bit to get service but the waitress was pleasant and kind.  Hostess could use s little guidance and some slight tweaks would make things run smoother, but either way we would definitely eat here again!

Holy Dirty word Batman!  These burgers were amazing.  I had the PB and J Burger and I loved it!  I wasn't sure what I was getting into but it was worth every bit. They had a great beer selection and the atmosphere was laid back Marly Style. I highly recommend it!  The guy next to me had the macaroni burger and was in heaven.  He was making A lot of obscene noises rivaling that of "when Harry Met Sally"'s famous Diner scene.  Definite stop when your hungry!
Super satisfying gourmet, fresh burgers. The ambience is relaxing. Service is great. The food tastes like its from scratch. Prices are reasonable.

We found Burger Therapy quite by accident.  And although it broke very dietary rule .. it was well worth it.  I don't remember the name of the burger  I had but it was pepper jack cheese, with hot peppers, with hot sauce, with a grilled poblano on it and a stack of crispy o'rings.  2 drinks and the check and it was great.  And that outside in 120 degree weather ... the menu reads like a piece of heaven.  Very casual laid back atmosphere. Put on your list - no regrets.

The only downfall to this spot is the location, it is small & seating is limited, and they don't allow call ahead reservations, so you can end up waiting for a very long time. Worth the wait, but still frustrating. We love the sweet potato tots & the PBJ burger...yummy!
Outstanding service and food. Our waitress was very welcoming and courteous. The atmosphere is perfect and goes well with the music/beach style vibe. Love it here!

My husband, 6 year old son, and I came here last Sunday and am so happy we tried it out! Large portions are served here, so make sure you come with a vengeful appetite! We arrived at around 3PM and the place was packed. We waited for about 20 minutes. No benches to sit and wait indoors. Not so bad to wait outside around this time of year in AZ. But waiting outside in the summer heat for that long... Yikes! Yeah.. No, thanks! Anyway, we ordered my son a hot dog and fries. The hot dog was massive for the little guy but he put up a good fight. They charge extra for fixings. Luckily, he's a plain old ketchup and mustard kind of kid. I ordered the hangover with lettuce and tomato on a wheat bun and the husband ordered mushroom and Swiss with lettuce and tomato on a pretzel bun. Well... Boy was it tough to wrap my mouth around that giant burger! It's like I had to strategize on how to approach it. Should I take a bite from the top, then a bite from the bottom? It was massive! But so so yummy! Egg was perfectly fried. Runny yolk and all! Oh, yeah! Sweet potato tots were crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. Delicious. In spite of the long wait to get in and get served... We all walked out 10lbs heavier and 10 times happier.
Great place for burgers. Sometimes can be a pretty long wait, but between bar/outdoor patio its no prob!

It's finally open! I'm doing the first Yelp review! Great food! I got the porkster burger and it did not disappoint! The burgers a little pricey, but great quality. Totally worth it! Lots of fun libations too.
Just so freaking good. The peanut butter jelly burger absolutely took me by surprise but holy cow (haha, get it?) it was phenomenal.

Happy Hour: 11am - 6pm daily and all day Thursday
HH Specials: $1 off Party Starters, Wines by-the-glass, and any Rapid Relief, $2 off Special Treatment & any Skinny Remedy, $1 off Special Treatment
YELP TIP: check in for chips and salsa for $3.99 

This is tucked between RNR and a pawn shop. It has both patio seating and inside. You check in at the front door and wait outside. You can also grab a drink at the bar but if it's busy then  pull have a hard time doing so. We arrived on a Sunday afternoon around 1pm and there was a 25 minute wait. The sun was kinda brutal and shade was scarce but we were lucky to find some. 

Granted, I'm here during my spring break so I figured other people are too cause it's like a scene straight out of a college movie. The islander/beach decor and loud groups bring me back to Spring Break In San Diego or Florida.

We got the 10oz spicy mac and cheese burger, pig wings, and sweet poTOToes. I wish the burger lived up to its name because it wasn't spicy at all. Yes there were jalapenos but when you call something spicy I was hoping the bun would also have a kick. The mac n cheese was an interesting and yummy addition. The pig wings were really my favorite because it was tender and a good combo of savory and sweet. The sweet pototoes were crunchy but I got tired of them really quickly. 

All in all, this is a great place to go for a hearty burger and to get that Spring Break vibe.
not worth the wait to get in here. Service was slow,host unfriendly and food taste like everyone else's hamburger.  Giant tourist spot! I guess they don't have McDonald at home!
Really good burger! Some can be very big so don't waste your money if you don't think you can handle it. Try the sweet potato tots.

Deserves every single star. Seating was super quick despite being peak lunch hour. The hostess took us to the patio but we ended up grabbing a seat right inside the building (so still got the great breeze). 

Our server (Rian) made some suggestions for drinks and pointed out the happy hour selections. 

We ordered the PB&J burger- tastes like it sounds and was A LOT but definitely good. Also got the Jalapeño popper burger (substituted with black bean burger instead of meat). AWESOME!!! Both came with sweet potato bites (but there's an option of fries, etc) and a variety of sauces. 

Such a great way to end a holiday weekend. Will definitely be back!!!

First off, my burger and tater tots were great. I got the large Porkster burger which is a hamburger patty topped with BBQ pulled pork - 10oz of meat overall. It came with cheese on a brioche bun and I could only finish half! The sweet potato tater tots were a nice side, especially with the pineapple terriyaki aioli sauce for dip. No complaints here!

My 10oz burger with tots, mom's 5oz burger with tots, and a lemonade came to just under $30. 

However, had a big disappointment with the lunch time service. Our server was nice but way too much of a space case. He was really attentive until we got our food and then went MIA as the lunch hour started to pick up. Never got another refill on my drink, had to grab the usher for a to-go box, and when we finally got his attention after waiting for a bit we asked for the check and to try out the dessert ("Pot" brownie). Instead of dessert, we just got our check (sans dessert listed, with no mention of said dessert) so we just paid and left. Ain't nobody got time for that!

I'm a huge fan of Rehab Burger! Happy hour seems to be all day, everyday, so who can complain about that?! And the burgers are really creative and delicious. I always get the peanut butter, jelly and sriracha burger, and although that sounds like a crazy combination, it is really delicious! Great vibe and service too.
Great burgers... I've been a couple times already and the burgers have been consistently good!

Perfect. Great atmosphere. Spectacular service, at least at the bar where we ate. Outdoor seating with heaters. Fantastic burgers. Every option you ca think of or make your own. Location is nice. Right next to free public parking. The bartender even rings up an extra drink to get in on happy hour but delivers it later when you are ready. Music not too loud so you can talk. If you are in the area and want a burger, GO!  I think it was well worth the trip

It's a good burger. But nothing out of this world amazing that I need to pay $15? It just feels forced. Nonetheless if you go, you'll get a good burger. I just feel like I can get a better one somewhere else with a better beer selection and atmosphere.

Wow!  Sweet potato tater tots are the bomb!

Wow!  Sweet potato tater tots are the bomb!

Wow!  Sweet potato tater tots are the bomb!

Yes, they deserve three call outs!

Bacon and blue burger was big, juicy, tasty and enough to make me want to return again to try more!

There are lots of great restaurants within walking distance of this place.  Don't discount it because you think it is just another burger joint.  They offer a whole lot more!

When visiting for a bachelorette weekend, we stayed in the Old Town area and were looking for something low key and delicious for dinner. Since I know on of the managers here, this was my suggestion.

Love the kitschy beach theme and that there were tables long enough for our whole group.

Everyone at our table tried something different, and thankfully there was something for everyone. The swimmers got their salads, the southern girls got their chicken sandwiches, and I got my ever holy PBJ & Bacon burger. Seriously, dont knock it til you try it. Im from MA, so I grew up eating peanut butter on burgers, but with jelly? And BACON?! I had to have it. Ah-mazing. Messy, but amazing.The sriracha is a nice touch too. It cuts through the sweetness of the grape jelly.

I highly recommend stopping in here. Thank for having us , Dave!

Definitely a new favorite! I had the poblano burger and it was so good! My husband had the Mac Gnarly burger and even though it took some technique to eat the monster size double patty burger, he really enjoyed it. 

Service was great! Our server was very nice and took care of us well. Happy hour is daily until 6pm

Definitely going back!

FUN place with good burgers and fantastic sweet pot tots!  Patio was too busy so were inside and it was loud but nice, fun décor and excellent service.  The regular and turkey burgers were outstanding and the pretzel buns added to them.  Lots of choices on sauces.

Definitely some very tasty food at this place! My old uncle is cautious about new places but after the experience, he has no problems coming back! 

My brother and I ordered the Spicy Mac N Cheese Burger, Rehab size and the portions of the burger did not disappoint. Everything there that we tried was really well made, especially the onion rings that can be substituted in. 

Our other family got BBQ pulled pork sandwiches and the pulled pork was amazing! Definitely a good choice and there was quite a large amount of pork justifying the price. 

My main complaint is that the location is pretty small which would not be a problem but the time we went there, it was packed! Which in the end is a good thing since everybody knows how good it is. The service was also really timely and observant of our drinks and helped specify some items on the menu. 

My major complaint is that the Spicy Mac N Cheese Burger was not spicy! It had only a little dollop of sriracha on a bit of it but they definitely could have done better with the spiciness level. Still tasty though!
I got the spicy mac and cheese burger and it was AMAZING. you really get a ton of food. good service and we will definitely be back.

The burgers here are best in town . The sweet potato tots are reason enough to go here . They have an array of different dipping sauces to choose from to accompany your dish . I really like the chipotle ranch and chipotle aioli.  I've tried just about all the burgers and my top two by far are the Bistro Burger and the siracha peanut butter burger .  If you're on the fence about ordering a peanut butter burger or maybe you've had one in the past and didn't care for it , pull the trigger on this one . The flavors are excellent and it will change your whole perspective on what you thought a burger should taste like . Service is always great and they always have good happy hour specials. If you're in town and looking for a great burger you have to check this place out . You won't regret it . Just make sure you don't order the rehab size burger if you plan on going out drinking and walking around . Rehab size will put you in a good coma and you'll be in Netflix and  Pajamas mode in a hurry . Not that it's a bad thing ...

Super fun place and OMG the burgers are fun, creative and memorable. Definitely a great place to step out of your comfort zone.

Hubs had the PB&J with a side house salad. It was messy in a wonderful way. I dared the McNarly (see photo). It was huge! Totally doable if you pass on the buns. I'd probably do salad instead of fries, or maybe tater tots. 

It was Sunday brunch and the brunch bevy's were also great. We will be back soon.

Customer service was over the top . The burgers were imaginative and downright fabulous! I have never had sweet potato tator tots but now I can't wait to have them again . Ask for some of their dipping sauces or the spicy ketchup. We will be back!
So you go there with hopes and expirations of getting a hamburger to maybe even for for the Super Bowl. To find out they're closed. Closes on the Super Bowl specially a hamburger joint? These guys
Great! Love to see out on the patio. Bring your appetite, the burgers are huge and the sweet potato tots are to die for!

Stopped by Rehab on a Sunday afternoon. It was pretty busy but after a short wait we managed to snag a good spot on the patio.

I really liked the big selection of burgers and toppings possibilities that they offered. I ended up doing a BYOB (Build Your Own Burger) with cheddar, lettuce, tomato and thousand island dressing on a pretzel bun, along with the sweet potato fries. My boyfriend got the mac and cheese burger without the hot peppers and regular fries. 
Our orders came out quickly. Mine came out with regular fries and when I mentioned that I had ordered the tots they brought me the tots with no hassle at all.

The burgers are big, even the smaller size. But they were very flavorful and the ingredients were fresh. The bun was nice and soft too - good bun to burger ratio. 

The mac and cheese on the burger was a fun combo. They really load it on! And the tots and fries were good too. 

Overall it's a lot of food, a cool laid back vibe and solid burgers for sure.

Not sure what all the hype is about.  The toppings for their burgers are interesting for sure (pbj, or Mac and cheese, etc)-- but the burger itself?  Not so great.  Best part of the meal was the fries.
Best burgers I the city absolutely love this place the new location is much bigger than the one o.k. Scottsdale which is nicebut both locations are AMAZING

Very laid back place. Fits with the area.

Burgers are the thing here. They don't disappoint. Also, I am a fan of pretzel buns, which they have here.

They are huge and two of us in our group split one. Servers are friendly and good atmosphere.
Amazing place! It is definitely a hot spot in downtown Scottsdale. We waited almost 40 min for a table but it was worth the wait. Even though we waited that long,the food was fast and very tasty.

Tried this place for the first time because we originally went to Cold Beer & Cheeseburgers and the wait was over an hour.  We are so glad we didn't wait.  Besides the burger being excellent (and it was), the service was amazing.  We were seated immediately and opted to sit outside.  They have a great mister system and even in June, in Phoenix, we were actually a little chilly!  The burgers come in 2 sizes (10 oz & 5 oz).  We opted for the smaller because I don't think I could eat 10 oz.  Burgers come with a choice of side (unlike the "other" place mentioned earlier) and were delicious.  Every single server went out of their way to be nice and helpful.  Will definitely be back

The food was great but the server we had with the Detroit tattoo was a total dick. He rolled his eyes when we asked for water. Someone at our table was once an alcoholic, I feel it's completely inappropriate to whine because your bill won't be higher than what you want since alcohol isn't involved in the initial drink order.

Then once the other members of the party decided to have a celebratory drink, he asked how we wanted it and interrupted us to let us know it's one way or no way. I'm sorry, who's paying this bill? 

Your food could be free and it excuse the awkwardness at our table from one of your employees. Not sure if he enjoys attempting this hard ass front but it's not cute.

I can't understand why this place gets such high ratings.  The burgers are just not good.   The meat was flavorless and tasted low quality.  The fries and tots were ok, but nothing special.  The worst part was the service-we waited an hour to receive our burgers.  The only highlight was the Jamaican corn side dish.  I would not return.

Their wings are the bomb!!
Good pricing
Their burgers keep you sooo full cause they're so big
Oh and ps bring back the loco Moco burger pls
It was gone before I could taste it
Rehab is my fav for burgers thou! 
And I love that they play rebelution and iration. They play my California reggae music
Makes me feel home !

What an eclectic environment...I love the décor, it's fun and whimsical, which usually means this place is going to be fun.  Well, I was right, medium size dining room and additional seating on patio available.  Good size menu with all kinds of signature burgers to choose from.  This was my first time visiting, and I ordered the Spicy Mac N' Cheese Relapse size (5 oz).  All of their signature burgers offer 2 sizes (Rehab 10 oz-basically 2 patties, I believe).  You can tell their mac is made from scratch and it was tasty with chunks of fresh jalapenos and bacon.  As the waiter says, "don't be afraid to get messy," but flavorful and delicious.  The fries are good as well, thick cut and seasoned to perfection and crispy.  My waiter (Ben) was nice and attentive.  And, I watched other servers interact with their tables and it appears all of the wait staff is that way, which makes for a good place and nice environment.  I will definitely be back to try other things and bring others...

It would be silly for me NOT to give this place 5 stars! 
My husband and I decided to spend the day in old town Scottsdale, when we chose to eat lunch at this local gem. We walked in and were greeted right away, and seated. The place was moderately busy. Our waiter Ryan was over right away, with a great personality and a big smile. He took our drink orders, and gave us time to look over our menus. They have two sizes of burgers to choose from Rehab is the bigger one, and relapse is the smaller one. I chose the relapse Hawaiian burger. It came with pineapple slice, ham slice, cheese, sweet mayo, and I chose a gluten-free bun. I chose the sweet potato tots for my side. Our good came out in a reasonable amount of time, and was delicious! My burger was cooked perfectly, and the sweet potato tots were very good. We started with the chips and salsa, as they were only $3.99 with the check in offer! The chips were homemade as well as the salsa and both very good. Ryan made sure our drinks were never empty. The decor is beachy, and there is ample seating inside, and outside on the patio. They have a bar. I can not wait to stop by here again to try another 5 star burger!
For awhile the name scared me but wow, great burgers and fries. The onion rings looked good too, next time...

Relaxing, Jamaican beach vibe. Best food my husband and I have had since we moved here from the Midwest. Sky high burgers, great pasta dishes with added hatch chili to give it just the right amount of kick. We even ordered food to take home since everything looked good! Great drinks! Wide selection of Tequilas to chose from. We are telling all our friends about this hidden gem, and will definitely be going back!

I have been saving this place for a special occasion. Well 18 pounds lost, and I am so happy I left this for my celebratory meal! We ordered the green Chile appetizer and it is a must! A tad spicy but full of flavor! I ordered the Spicy Chili Mac & Cheese burger and although it was still amazing... the Mac and cheese lacked flavor and not really spicy. But, the burger patty being perfectly cooked and seasoned made up for it. Their Coron-Rita is strong but super good! Overall a great place, nice and attentive staff. I'll definitely be back to try their infamous PB&J burger!

This place makes me happy. Great burgers, so many varieties, laid back atmosphere. The famed is the Mac and cheese burger. We have yet to try it. Recomending the Swiss and mushroom with sweet potato fries.

Came here for a brunch/dinner spot that had a happy meal menu.  This place is large, has an outdoor and indoor seating area.  Servers were nice and attentive, spending time answering our questions.   They took care of our needs with haste.
We ordered sweet potato fries, regular fries, and onion rings as well as a margatini.  potatoe fries I didn't care for.  The sauce didn't make it any better as well, which is disappointing.  The fries and onion rings were good, nice and crunchy but not oily at all.  The sauces were good especially when mixed with the hot sauces they had there.  Then we ordered a to go ghost pepper burger which was really spicy.  Didn't care for that too much. The margarita was strong and hit the spot most definitely.
Overall the vibe was nice.  Cool little hangout for th3 college kids there.  Service was excellent.  Food made it a 4 out 5 star rather than a 5 starbut overall it was q nice experience
Try the porkster burger, just remember to bring some wet naps

Great chill burger place in Scottsdale! Love their décor and music (think various reggae, alternative, classic rock, etc.). A well-misted patio w/ample umbrellas defending the harsh Sonoran sun always is appreciated!

Shared their fried calamari - wonderful! Big chunks in a delish coating of herbs. Served w/lemon wedge and aioli sauce.

Good Happy Hour prices - $2 for Bud Light drafts? Can't complain - I can dig for that under my car seat. 

Service very friendly and attentive. Recommend outside on patio but the flies are driving me batty! Maybe consider adding some citronella candles?

I had been wanting to come here for a long time because I heard really good things. I finally got the chance and came here for lunch with a co-worker today, but unfortunately I was kind of disappointed. We got there and there was a short wait which was fine and to be expected, but there was literally no where to stand to wait without being in someone's way. (It was raining outside so maybe people normally wait on the patio? There are no chairs or benches or anything.) We got our table within a few minutes and our waiter got our drink order pretty quickly. He was helpful and knowledgeable about the menu, made some recommendations for us, and we placed our order. 

The lunch rush was starting to end shortly after we ordered, so there were plenty of open tables after being there for 15 minutes. But somehow it took a good 25-30 minutes to get our food. When our food did come out, our waiter dropped it off and didn't come back to check on us for quite some time. I wanted to ask for a side of mayo and another side of chipotle aioli (which was really good) but he disappeared. I finally saw him seating another group and I tried to make eye contact with him several times but he just kept going back and hanging out at the bar. I finally got him to come over and he brought my sauce quickly, but then it was the same thing again with our check. Because it took so long to get our food (which was just 2 very simple burgers and tots, nothing too fancy) we had to get back to work quickly. We finally got his attention and we asked for our checks, but it seriously took another 5 minutes for him to bring it. Kind of frustrating. 

My burger wasn't that great. I got the hatch burger and it was just a green chile and a really thick piece of cheese that was not even melted. Nothing else, which made it pretty dry (hence my desire for more sauce). I wasn't really impressed at all. I love the mexican burger at Lenny's and was hoping for something similar but it's really the opposite. The sweet potato tots were pretty good though, I did like those. And I liked the atmosphere of the place, they played a lot of Pepper which is one of my favorite bands, so it wasn't all bad. Overall I wasn't impressed and I'm much more interested in trying some of the other burger places around here than coming back.
Salyna was amazing! The food was just mediocre but would probably come back just to hang out with her! If you get her as your waitress you're a lucky table for sure!

Had an amazing time w friend at this place.  Fun atmosphere, great service and amazing food.  10 oz burger was huge.  Couple have got 5 oz n been enough food.  I definetly recommend this place.  Get here early as it was busy. Dog friendly.

We went to Rehab for a late lunch today and while it started out with good intentions, in the end we were extremely disappointed. On the bright side, I loved the decor. It's very well done with the surfer vibe and the sweet potato tots are some of the best I've had. 

The real issues were coming out of the kitchen. As I was people watching, I noticed tables coming in. I also noticed table by table, food was coming out for them before ours. Shortly after we ordered our second round of drinks smoke did fill the small restaurant and we made jokes about our food being on fire, so we chalked it up to our order actually being the cause of the smoke. It was a late lunch so by this time it was past well past 1 p.m. Our server cruised by and said we were waiting on the wings one of us ordered.

Finally the food arrived and it couldn't have been the wings, since they were cold. Both burgers had burned pretzel buns, and one side of tots was half a serving of cold tots. The server said he would bring more, then never returned. The restaurant was quite busy, so we took matter in our own hands and asked someone to bring the tots and fill our drinks, but the burgers weren't great. We ate them anyway because at this point we were just so hungry!

Finally we were waiting for our check to be split and who I assumed is the manager came by our table and asked how it was. We were honest and told him it wasn't great. He arrogantly replied "Not great? But you ate all your food" I looked at him and said "Yeah because I waited a long time for my food while all these tables who came in after us were served their meals" It was ridiculous, I watched many of those tables leave as well while we were dealing with our tab. 

He pressed the issue, even though we didn't want to get into it because a) it seemed petty and b) we just wanted to leave, but he insisted . We told him our issues with the meal and 10 min later he returned with the food removed off the menu. The weirdest thing was his delivery. He pinned the checks on the table facing us so we could read it, and goes, "How are we doing this" holding our cards in his hand. I  pointed to my check and said "I'm the blue card, so that's mine" He just stared at me. I repeated, "I'm the blue card" and reached over to pull the card out of his grip, and he goes, "Okay, so the $2 on the blue card and the $6 on the red card" 

It was sooo rude. His demeanor was that we were being ungrateful, when we honestly just wanted to leave. When he returned he was full of excuses, (we're a new restaurant, we are very busy, etc.) which is FINE. I eat out all the time, and new restaurants all the time, and I expect growing pains, so I told him I liked the place, I would be back to watch a game, grab a drink. He replied, "Well we are not a bar with good food. We are a restaurant with good drinks." 

What the hell? First of all, I wasn't even drinking, so I was just trying to be NICE. Thanks for not taking our constructive criticism YOU ASKED FOR then making us feel BAD about the discount you gave us that we weren't looking for. It was such a turn off, we talked about it the whole ride home and all day I've been telling people what a nightmare it was when they asked me about it due to me checking in on social media

So I lied to the manager... I won't be back. There are plenty of other mediocre burger shops around town that I can give my business to, and if I do end up there again, I'll be ordering the wings and tots. Their burgers are average. For a place with BURGER in the name, there is just absolutely nothing special about their signature menu item. Shoulda gone to In N Out.

The food is the only thing that saved this review. 
Just my experience here. I am sure there has been better and worse but this was mine:
We put our name in and we're told it would be a 15 minute wait. No problem, went to the bar for a drink. 15 mins go by and a party of 3, just like ours, walks in and gets sat immediately. I bring it to their attention and they get us sat at a different table shortly after. Confusing a mojito with a margarita, no silverware, forgetting condiments. Maybe just a bad day..... I'll go back again though, the food was that good.

This is my favorite burger place! I love there bacon cheeseburger, vanilla milkshake and the sweet potato tots! This is mine and my boyfriends go to place for a date. The patio area is the best place to sit!
First time here, and my mind was blown, outstanding, I have never seen a burger menu with such different combinations

A Tiki Lounge meets burger joint! What a cool concept! Rehab was pretty quiet when were were there for an early dinner. The TVs had a mix of aquarium scenes and people are awesome videos playing.

I had the mushroom swiss burger and the fries. The seasoning blend they use on the fries is killer. Add some of the Aioli sauce and you have a wild flavor combo. The burger was cooked perfectly and the buns are so fresh and tasty.

For the gluten free crowd they have several options. You can do a lettuce wrap or they have a gluten free bun too. 

My biggest regret is filling up on the burger and fries. I would love to go back and try the pot brownies. I bet they are worth the pain of over eating.

Went to dinner with my girlfriend and her mother. Our waitress Jennifer was awesome and most of the other staff checked on us frequently. Thumbs up for the customer service. Now on to the food... 
This has to rank as one of the better burgers I've had in my time. I had the Bacon and blue burger which was cooked perfectly. It was seasoned correctly so the burger developed a crust on the outside and hot and juicy on the inside. My girlfriend had the hangover burger which was as equally delicious... I only know because I stole some. It was nice and relaxing on a Tuesday evening. Give this place a try and you won't be disappointed.

Burgers were absolutely delish and were definitely worth 5 stars, but unorganized service caused me to take away 1 star. The place has a very casual, beachy look and feel to it, quite nice! There are two choices in sizes for the burgers 1: the Rehab which is 10 oz of angus beef. 2: the Relapse which is 5 oz of angus beef. But for only a couple dollars more, my husband and I decided to go "Rahab" for our burgers and take home leftovers. Well when our burgers came, mine was noticeably smaller than his and I asked the waitress. She said yes that what I received was a "relapse" and that she would go check the computer to see what size I had ordered even though I told her  .  I had ordered the "rehab". When she came back, she said that the smaller size was what was written down but that she will go and have them make me a Rehab. That was fine with me, I don't usually get upset easily. But she took away the wrong size burger so I was left staring at my husband eating his gigantic chile cheeseburger and nibbled on his yummy tater tots and my onion rings that came with the burgers. 15 minutes go by and another waiter comes by and asks if we would like boxes to take home leftovers! I told him that I have not received my burger yet due to a miscommunication. He apologized and said that he would bring my burger out as soon as he sees that it's ready. 10 more minutes go by and I my burger comes out, but by then I was not hungry anymore and my husband was done eating. So I took a bite just to taste it and to appreciate the freshness. It was so delicious!  Then our waitress came by and I asked for a box. She took a look at my almost untouched burger and actually said "Stuffed huh?" I just smiled cause it was actually quite funny how she didn't even acknowledge that my appetite and dinner were kind of ruined because of her mistake. I understand that that mistake easily happened because the place was packed and the music was loud and that "Rahab and Ralapse" can sound the same. I just wished they had tried a bit harder to make up for the mistake. Perhaps they could have left me the first burger to eat at the same time as my husband and let me take home the one I ordered? Or maybe discount my check? Idk...but we did think the burgers, tots, and onion rings were delicious and the prices are great.

Took the family while in Phoenix. Great atmosphere. Background music was perfect: reggae, kick back tunes. Food was great. Burgers huge and kids sizes were large. Nice local feel.  Wait staff was excellent.
The best burger I have ever eaten, the next time I'm in Phoenix I will definitely stop there again!

We are a huge fan of the Scottsdale location, so decided to foray into Sun Devil territory to check out the new location.  It's bigger, but louder.  We are used to loud, but it wasn't that crowded yet and had to repeat ourselves a lot. 

Same amazing menu.  My favorites include their Pig Wings, and Hawaiian Burger. We love their sweet potato tots. A nice feature is selecting your dipping sauces. We like their pineapple teriyaki aoli.  Patrick's favorite menu item is the PB&J burger. 

We love the option of two sizes of burgers and salads. Relapse vs Rehab. 

On a whim we tried a different burger. It was our first time ordering the Pablano burger.  It had spicy onions on it, which were a little overwhelming.  But otherwise very tasty. 

The service was great.  Good teamwork. I love that they want your food to come out the way you want it and sincerely check on your satisfaction.  

We will be back.
Always such good food and their mixed drinks are to die for! Plus super friendly staff and the restaurant is always clean!

Found this place on Yelp of course. What a find it is too. Easy parking, fun place as soon as you walk in. Our Server, Cathy was super friendly and made sure to explain the menu choices to us. I went with the Poblano Burger and it was one of the better burgers I've ever had. Wifey had the Mushroom Swiss and loved it. The Sweet Potato Tots are awesome. Our friend got the Hatch Burger and said it was great. We also tried the Frito Chili appetizer, so good. This is a great restaurant and can't wait to return.

The pb and j burger is definitely something to try! I added a fried egg on mine and it was truly a glorious mess, maybe not too suitable for a first date unless you want your partner to know you can get down and dirty. The sweet potato tots and chili cheese fries were lit! It was happy hour so the Mai tais were flowing and were also delicious and strong. My boyfriend got the large bistro burger and plain fries and said that the taste after a while got boring, because it was so big. I just had one bite and it was pretty tasty! Our server was super helpful and nice! I definitely recommend coming, especially during happy hour, if your ready to go to town on delicious food.

This place knows burgers at least while I was there they cooked mine perfect I like it still medium rare and it was exactly that portions are big for a good price brought family from out of town and first time myself and it was quick service and waitress was on point with ordering and getting food to table will be bringing my husband

I forgot about this place until my friend suggested it as a less busy dinner option. We still had to wait 20 minutes on a Saturday night but that was probably less than other spots.

We decided to get the chicken wings appetizer and our server suggested we mix the medium sauce and Gold Medal sauce, a Southern BBQ mix of vinegar and mustard. Those were delicious and we finished them. For our burger, we ordered and split  the jalapeño popper with the veggie patty. The description sounded promising: guacamole, cream cheese, cheddar, and jalapeño poppers on a pretzel bun. However, all together it was bland. The flavors didn't stand out and there was no kick, the jalapeños weren't spicy and I had to add salt but it didn't help. It needed spice and heat for sure, maybe something sweet to balance too.

Not sure I'd rush back anytime soon, considering how many other dining options there are in Old Town, but the wings were worth it.
Great is followed by burgers, sides, service, menu, and decor!!  I can't wait for the Tempe location to open near my work!!! It is called Rehab, but it is addicting!
Great food, pig wings and spicy mac and cheese burger are fantastic. Next time I have to do the pb&j burger.

Wow! I've never had a better burger.  Cooked exactly to my request and phenomenal taste.  Cheryl was an awesome waitress,  tentive,  friendly and fun.  If you're wanting a burger,  RBT is the place to go.

I had the jalapeño popper burger (relapse size!)-- the flavors were pretty good, but the meat itself was ordinary.  I think this place depends on its toppings to provide flavor, and they aren't wrong, but I really prefer it when I can't get enough of the meat itself.

The sweet potato taters were just okay- I'd stick to the fries next time.

All in all, I wouldn't go out of my way for this place but I wouldn't be opposed to eating here again.  Its a cute place to hang out too and the wait/bar staff were really nice!

We found this place due to such high ratings on multiple reviews. Not sure what everyone is smoking. The decor, menu, and service are akin to an Applebee's. Guess what? The food is about the same caliber. Shared the pork wings which were average. I had the hangover burger with fries. The fries were a dingy, brown color and mediocre. The burger on a pretzel bun was uninspiring. If you're looking for a good burger... Keep looking

So this is the second time I had gone to the Tempe location. We even had the same waitress, anyhow we had a great experience. My burger was cooked perfectly; med rare and I was astonished, since my last experience was not cooked to how I ordered. These guys especially our server made an incredible effort to make our experience great. Thanks guys and we will be back for sure

Let's just say nearly 24 hours after eating the ghost pepper burger my insides are still on fire. The burger and tots were delicious and made for a very satisfying lunch. Also, the service was unparalleled in friendliness and speed. However, things went awry as I was performing oral sex on my partner and my insides could simply no longer tolerate the heat. The untimely projectile vomit incident inflicted terrible spicy heated pain on my face and lips and of course on my partners genital area. I'll certainly be returning to this location but I'm sure I'll go for the mac n cheese burger next time.

This does not happen often that I completely disagree with the rating of the "masses" but I really struggled to see what's so great about this spot. I have been in the past to a number of spots specializing in throwing literally anything on a burger (peanut butter, chocolate, sardines, etc) and attracting a crowd just because of that. My genuine impression of Rehab was no different.

The decor is junk yard meets a restaurant, but has some recurring themes to it and tries to be badass with the bikes and all. It reminded me a bit of the theme at the Vortex in Atlanta, just not satanic. Stuff like that does not get me excited, but perhaps some people enjoy it. I'll just skip that and go straight to the one darn thing that matters, the food.

Onion Rings were mediocre, but huge. The Fish burger was quite disappointing, the fish itself was tasteless, but the burger was huge. So just picture getting something huge that you aren't really excited about eating. I've had better ingredient quality at airport restaurants. The pretzel bun was kind of cool and the only reason I'd give this spot more than 2 stars. I presume the idea is to eat this thing like an animal, as there was literally no way to fit it in the mouth. I was fine with that. My coworker had one of the beef burgers and was also rather disappointed by the meat quality. If you do come here, I'd suggest doing it more for a beer instead of food. If you want a damn good burger, hit up Relish Bistro at the Phoenician.
Been here 4-5 times now and the burgers keep getting better and better. Best burgers in Old Town!

I'd like to give a review but never saw a server.  Sat down and nobody ever stopped by to welcome us our offer a drink. As we walked out b/c we were tired of waiting for a server the hostess just smiled at us?  She was 5ft from our table and never stopped to ask us if we needed anything. We stopped at AJ's on the way home and will grill our own burgers.  Shitty service, won't go back.
Dog friendly and chill patio. Burgers are awesome and they have pretzel buns.

So of course I had to have a PB & J  burger and am I glad I did! So good so much interesting fun in every bite. Something they leave out of the title is that there is a small bit of sriracha mixed in and as crazy as all this sounds (peanut butter, jelly, sriracha, burger) it is SO GOOD. If you know anything about food experimentation, the oddest combinations make some good tastes.
Cheese and chocolate, bacon and syrup, cottage cheese and chili cheese fritos. The PB & J Burger is up there with it! But this iconic burger is not the only thing to come here for, all their unique burger choices sound amazing. I literally had to ask the waitress to come back two different times because I was so undecided on what to get! They all look so good and so do the appetizers ( be warned though. The burgers are huge and filling so only order apps and burgers if you're really hungry or eat a lot usually).
The only reason I didn't give them 5 stars was the decor is dated and just screams "Islands Burger knock off" and the tables around ours were pretty filthy and set for people to sit down. 

Also, REHAB BURGER EXEC CHEFS: please make a 4-6-8 Slider plate that can serve almost as a taster so we don't have to decide on one of your delicious burgers but can try a multitude for different kinds (great for sharing too) so when I come back I won't have to gamble on a burger I may not like. Just a golden idea I'll pass along for free

This place is really chill.. the servers are all pretty casual, but attentive and helpful.  I've been twice now; the first time I had the Hawaiian burger which was reeeally good.  If you're a fan of pineapple, give it a go.  The sweet potato tots are a great side.. I haven't tried their fries yet but I hear good things.  Last time I went, I had the special, which was a burger with PB&J, bacon and sriracha.. WHAT.  It was a combo that I had to try--when else would I have the opportunity?  It sounds crazy but something about peanut butter and beef was magical.. haha.  They also had this Jamaican jerk-covered cob of corn that was excellent.  Seems like they have a pretty solid happy hour.. all around, good experience!

I've never been much of a quitter but I'm thinking I may need a longer stint in Rehab.   This place is great.   These people made one of my other fav's so why not start anew.  

We started with the Pig Wings (the sauce will be my new favorite on everything), YUM.   We proceeded to have the burgers (Hatch Chili Burgers and Mush/Swiss).  The hub ordered a 1/2 Shelby Spinach Shalad (he wasn't sharing).   We enjoyed the Fries (I did not see a Mermaid) and Tots (oh so good).   I recommend the sauces in this order  Peach Habanero, Spicy Ketchup, Chipotle Aioli, Stellar Mustard, Teriyaki Pineapple Aioli.    Like we really needed more so we had the Key lime pie.   

The team at Rehab are great!   Everyone is helpful and engaging.   

Whatever your addiction, they have the Therapy!   See you soon.

One of the best burgers I have ever had. And fantastic frozen margaritas I could easily drink  alllllllllllllllll night long! Staff are excellent and good fun, if you need some therapy from the stresses of life, come here and feel rejuvenated!

OMG (regarding wait time complaint). Yes it takes a few minutes to cook 10 oz of beef to perfection. Slow down, order a specialty drink and enjoy this place!! Yes, I tried the wings (I always do) They were awesome. They call them medium but they were pretty hot, I ordered a side of hot sauce and that was great,  No complaints. But you must try the PIG WINGS!!! They are like bone-in riblets, pig drumettes, whatever... with spicy sweet peach hot sauce that is just worth the trip. And the burgers are great, 10 oz is HUGE, Everything cooked as ordered. The Hatch Chile burger was especially good. Staff was fast, fun, environment was full of energy and a very ecclectic clientele which I crave here in the desert. The beer was cold, and the bartender whipped up some specialty frinks that would knock even a seasoned drinker on their A-S-S. Try the blue rufie if you're a wimpy drinker, tastes like candy. Also good is the blueberry martini. YES, FULL BAR. Burger buns were really good, maybe they flew em in from Jersey but AZ never gets bread this good. No complaints ...will be back. Oh, and girls hula hoop in the parking lot if you get bored. They will share.
The PBJ burger was very good. I was hesitant to order it but it did not disappoint. Look forward to trying some more of their burger creations next time I'm in Phoenix.
Great burgers and tots.  Wife and I split a burger and it was more than enough for two.  Busy but friendly staff!! Would go again

Food is ok. My first time was excellent. This time it was dry. They give out catsup in tiny dishes so couldn't choke most of the meal down. Service is sloooooooooooow. We came on a Sunday close to 145. It was almost 3 by the time our food came out. No apologies no explaining. Just a bunch of workers looking and dancing and messing around. Too bad food is good but dealing with the place is not worth the wait.

Place is just over the top for burgers. We tried quite a but and everything was phenomenal. Extremely messy so bring some wet wipes. 

I had the Mac and cheese burger and !

The food is delicious! My husband had the ghost burger and I forgot what I had but it had pineapple, onion ring and barbecue sauce - both were fantastic! And yes they came with fries and a pickle. For sure on next years visit we're coming back. Both service & food were fantastic! Thanks for a great meal.
Yummy BYOB, relaxing vibe, good music, friendly staff. Definitely perfect stop before our 5 hour drive back to Los Angeles

We went to the Tempe location recently on a Friday night at 6-7 pm. We were excited to try this place. I love burgers!! The place is fun looking.  After being seated and given menus our waitress asked is what we wanted to drink. When I asked what was in a tropical named drink she said "I don't know , probably tropically things like,pineapple or coconut". Now I think the menu should break down signature drinks but it does not, but the waitress should know. Now I know it was a new location and she's likely new, so I would have had no issue w her saying, sorry I am new, I'm not a 100%sure what's in it, so let me ask the bartender (now this would have been VERY simple  as we were at a table RIGHT next to the bar) she completely blew us off and did not even attempt to figure out what the drink was made of. I assume restaurants mAke a good profit off of the alcohol. We did not order any due to this. Next, I order a burger on brioche.... sorry they were out and only had pretzel or wheat . This seemed quite odd to me as this was early Friday night and I assume brioche is pretty popular. I didn't end up ordering a burger due to that. I know it sounds picky but I would think a burger restaurant would have that and it was what I wanted. The prices were good but service was not. Sadly I left hungry and disappointed. Maybe we will try again later.

Rehab is great. If you love burgers and don't mind taking an adventurous approach to your cuisine, then this is the place for you. From traditional burgers to burgers with two maple donuts as buns, this place has it all. Expect lots of options here, a fun environment, and a busy dining rooms, since it's on Mill Ave. There is a pretty generous happy hour with both drinks and food on the menu, so start your night out right and stop in at Rehab for a good dinner before a night of drinking!

It was jumping on Thursday night.  We had to sit at the bar which wasn't a big deal.  Would definitely recommend this place fun atmosphere. I had the mushroom n Swiss burger which was excellent.  My boyfriend had the Hawaiian burger.   Quick service, other than waiting for our mojitos.   Bar tender needs to be more friendly, seems patrons were a bother other than two woman he knew at the bar.   All of the female employees were very attentive and made sure everyone at the bar was happy.  Would go back but get a table next time.

Fun and hip.  Great atmosphere.  Great service.  Loved the old bicycles hanging from the ceiling.

The burgers and fries were delish.  We also ordered the Mac & Cheese.  HUGE portion.  Ended up bringing half of it home which was fine by me because it was also delicious.  Spicy and flavorful.  Not your ordinary Mac & Cheese.

The drink menu is rather basic; nothing exceptional.  But you don't go for the drinks; you definitely go 'cause you're craving a burger.

We went on a Friday night.  Very loud and busy and fun.  Plenty of little crying kids in the restaurant too, which can be a good (or annoying) thing, if that's your thing.

Our first time.  We will definitely return.

My 2nd time at this spot and it didn't disappoint. My husband got the peanut butter and jelly burger and I got the burger with onion rings and BBQ sauce on it. He really liked his burger. I am not a PB fan so it was weird to me. My burger was delicious! The sweet potato tots were the bomb.

Service was great! The corn on the cob was delicious but the burgers were just a little too much! I got the Mac n cheese burger but it was literally overflowing and I was unable to pick it up. I think you could share a burger for sure!
The burgers are all original ideas and you must order the pretzel bun!  The beer and cocktail selection is excellent.   What a great locally owned restaurant.  We return often.  Highly recommended!

Rehab Burger Therapy has been on my list for a few years now. Unfortunately, my girlfriend and I rarely venture into Old Town Scottsdale. And sadly, the only therapy I'm familiar with focuses more on speech than it does on meat.

Honestly, Rehab is a little different than I expected. I fully anticipated that it would be presented like all of those other "high-end" burger joints that are opening up on every street corner. I expected to be able to order a basic burger, and then proceed to have my bank account raped via upgrades, such as grass-fed beef, pretzel buns, premium ingredients, and all kinds of ridiculous tactics to raise your end price. 

Surprisingly, none of that is to be found here. Rehab Burger is about showcasing both traditional and unique creations that are executed incredibly well. You can pick your bun and choose how you want your burger cooked, and at least from what I could see, there were absolutely no sneaky "upcharges" for any changes we opted to make.

The place itself is decorated in what I'd describe as a beach house. It kind of reminds me of some chain you'd find on the Las Vegas Strip or at a tourist destination. I was prepared for the stereotypical twenty/thirty-something hoity-toity crowd to be out in full force, but surprisingly, the clientele is a vast mix of different people. Everyone from bikers, families, teenagers, working professionals, and those guys that look as if they eat here on a daily basis. It was quite a buzzing, yet oddly comforting environment.

The menu itself is somewhat bloated and can be a little intimidating at first glance. I opted for a Spicy Mac and Cheese burger in a Relapse (5oz), while my girlfriend chose the Hangover in a full-blown Rehab (10oz). We did this so we could split the Hangover in half and I could sample both burgers.

Meat, which we both requested to be cooked medium well, was done perfectly! Great quality and flavor that clearly puts them right up there with the best we've tried. I was skeptical about the mac and cheese, as subpar mac could be the equivalent of dumping ketchup on a juicy steak. Thankfully, it delivered as promised. The spice was present, while not as overwhelming as I had feared. My girlfriend enjoyed her Hangover, but removed the pepper due to her dislike of spice. Realistically, the Relapse is more than enough for one (normal) individual, so after I finished mine, I was only able to have a few bites of hers. I thought it was done quite well, honestly.

Fries were good quality and while sweet potatoes are not my thing, the tots were just okay. I enjoyed the variety of dipping sauces that our server brought out for us to sample.

Overall, I thought their burgers were excellent and we fully intend to come back in the future to sample some other offerings. While my girlfriend wasn't quite as enthusiastic as I was about the food overall, I still feel that it's one of the better options you can find in the surrounding area. 

A full five-star bump will require that we return to sample two other burgers and their dessert, which looks quite promising.

Highly recommended!

Fun atmosphere, great downtown old Scottsdale area. We arrived around 2pm had a bit of a wait. Seems like it's always busy. Great food, beer and service. Only complaint was the desert. Ordered the brownie sundae and it was awful. Everything else was great!
The burger components, sauces and accompaniments were all good. I just don't feel the quality of the beef was that great or stood out in any way.

We chose the B.Y.O.B burger, always a fan of keeping it real! The B.Y.O.B. burger stands for build your own burger, and our only addition was the cheese. They have plenty to choose from so you can find one to suit your taste. All burgers, and sandwiches , come with your choice of Skin-On-Fries or Sweet PoTOToes, which are sweet potato tater tots. Definitely go with the tots and ask for a side of the teriyaki pineapple aioli. They make it in house and it is to die for. Perfect for the tots. You can thank us later. If you do choose the fries, get the spicy ketchup to accompany them, its' also made in house.

Read our review here...
http://schmoozeaz.com/blog/?p=894
Best Burger of my life. Hangover relapse. A single patty with cheese, bacon, and fried egg on a pretzel bun.
Burgers are soo good, especially their pulled pork. But lately the service has been slow... I think they're just short staffed. For the most part though defintely a good bang for your buck.

Came here for Sunday funday, brunch, dinner, happy hour, and this place never seizes to satisfy! Burgers are all great, wings are to die for, let's just say everything on the menu is great, come here with my BF and friends and we always have a good time!
You have to try this place! We had the PB&J burger and the Mac&Cheese burger and both were worth coming back for BUT the winner was the pig wings. Ah-mazing!

HOLY PIG WINGS!!!  Seriously, if you like pork, you don't LIKE PORK, you just heard of it PORK... whatever...U NEVER HAD PIG WINGS BEFGORE!!    These addictive morsels of                       "FOOD CRACK "             are a must try...whoever you are try the pig wings, you won't be dissapointed.  It's a full lb so may have to share to leave room for the amazing burgers!
We love going to this place.  The burgers are phenomenal. If you can't be in a surf shack on the beach listening to Caribbean tunes, this is a great alternative.

This is such a fun place to check out and eat at. I am surprised by all the different burger combinations. The burgers are big enough to share for sure. I was blown away by how delicious they are for how weird they sound but it works. My partner had a PB and J burger and I had Jalepeno popper burger and they did not disappoint at all!

Burger rehab, has such a great vibe in such an exciting feeling inside I'd rather eat inside and out.

The staff is wonderful. And I do mean wonderful. They are very efficient and fast paced and yes I'm sure they get lost in the weed sometimes but I've been here twice and I've had a great time both times.

The first burger I ordered was the gnarly burger and I guess it could be best described as your regular ordinary double Dekker burger but it's huge. Next I ordered the spicy macaroni and cheese burger it was smaller than the gnarly burger but it was very good, and you get macaroni and cheese all over the place and it's actually tasty macaroni and cheese.

This is going to become a regular spot for me is I really like the vibe it's adult yet fun.
Awesome place, great staff, very accommodating of our group and 2 young kids, and the food was fantastic. Hit them up!
Outstanding burgers and sweet potato tots. The place has a great vibe as well. I felt like I was on a Carribean island.
Amazing sweet potato tots, and I don't even like sweet potatoes. Burger was done properly, parking can be a little bit rough during peak hours tho.

Always amazing.  Never disappoints. The bartenders are always super friendly, helpful, and give great recommendations. The PB & J burger is one of the best I've ever had. I've been here about 10 times and have always been impressed. Thanks Rehab, keep up the good work!

Not knowing what to expect, we entered this run-down looking joint after free parking in the Parking Corral next door.  What a surprise!  Thanks to the flat screen TVs giving us views of tropical aquarirums, surfing movies, bicycles suspended from the ceiling and surfboard memorabilia everywhere, we felt like we were at a beach hut!  The platters of delicious burgers coming out of the kitchen predicted a burger phenomenon!  Our server, David, was very laid back and made some excellent recommendations for us, so we split one of our favorites, wedge salad (dressing was especially tart and savory,) and each ordered a "Relapse" (single) burger.  My wife went for the poblano burger, cooked medium as David recommended, with a grilled poblano with provelone cheese and spicy mustard and spicy catsup, on brioche.  I went for the hangover relapse, which included a fried egg, provolone, bacon and spicy catsup to dress it, also on David's recommended brioche bun.  We drooled as we ate they were both so tasty!  For a side item we both selected the Jamaican corn on the cob, a full cob grilled with island spices and wonderful.  Top this off with two happy hour beers each, the local Four Peaks 8th Street draft pints, and this was a perfect meal and we were seated immediately (kitchen was a little slow,) but got our bill and got to the theatre two blocks away with time to spare.  Can't wait to go back and try another taste sensation!

In a world of extremely good burger joints, Rehab is a place to try.  I wasn't "wowed".  I thought it was a good burger, mediocre fries, and not enough parking, and too high of a price.

Does not come close to knocking The Aioli Burger off the top mark, but I don't think this place would be a disappointment to anybody.  Id be a fan with better parking.

We moved here from a city known world-wide for its food (Go Saints). Without question, Rehab Burger makes the best hamburger I've ever eaten, and that includes the time before I was forced to eat gluten-free. Their gluten-free burgers are addictive. Get the bleu-cheese infused offering, and you'll need a 12 step program if you decide not to eat one again (but why would you? The thing is amazingly good).
Great chili burger and porkster burger, super onion rings....ya gotta try this place!

I've only gone here for lunch, but I can assume it's just as great for dinner or an evening drink. I've taken co-workers here for lunch and thought the atmosphere was fine for a super casual lunch. The wait staff and bartenders always seen friendly and accommodating.
PBJ and Bacon burger is  heaven sent!!!!  No Joke!  Don't be afraid because it sounds funky... it is DELISH!!!!!

First time here my buddy told me about it ...right around the corner from us. This place has a casual and relaxed atmosphere with a big garage door that rolls up and connects the inside bar with the outdoor patio. There are plenty of tables and some nice comfortable booths. If you like ska or long beach dub, the music is great (tribal seeds, slightly stoopid, stick figure, irration) that kind of music, it will be playing continuously (best part for me). The PBJ hamburger is a good item to order (get the small one it's plenty) and get the sweet potato tots for the side (they are dynamite). There is a decent selection of beer (when I went they had moon juice, ranger, a few other IPAs and typical domestics). The waiter (he) was great and the service was excellent. He checked on us several times, kept our waters full and the beers coming. (He even found and held something at the bar for me after I realized I had left it after leaving and went back). I will definitely go back to Rehab!

One of scottsdale's many hidden gems. Burgers are amazing! We had a classic cheese burger and their chili cheese burger. Needless to stay, we left with our taste buds bursting and bellies full! Highly recommended!
Very good food, incredibly friendly, helpful staff! Love this place.
Seriously wicked burger for carnivores and vegans alike! Who knew going to Rehab to be awesome?!?!  Lindsay Lohan would have stayed stayed all 60 days if she would have made it to Scottsdale.

I ended up here because the place my group wanted to go was closed, but it turned out to be amazing. I'm vegan so I wasn't thinking a burger place would be my scene, but the veggie burger is delicious. The waitress was very helpful about what was vegan on menu and even gave me a heads up that the buns have an egg wash on them. She put my veggie burger in a lettuce wrap instead and it was so good! My meat-eating friends were happy with their meals as well. Definitely recommend.

Service was great, despite being busy. Had the mac n cheese burger. It was very good. But I've had better: Guy Fieri's place in Vegas dominates the domain of mac n cheese burgers. 

If it weren't for my loyal devotion to Paradise Valley Burger's weekly special, I'd have given Rehab 5 stars. (If you're reading this PVBurger guy, I'm sorry for being infidelitous. Forgive me.)

Amazing burgers! I've tried about 1/2 of their burger menu and NOTHING tops the PBJ, bacon, and shirachi hot sauce! Sounds strange but is incredible. Service is also great, everyone is friendly and welcoming, especially Trisha. Go try this place!

A resounding yes!  I have been a couple of times and sat on the porch.  It is definitely worth the wait!  The service is spectacular and the menu is fabulous... even the pasta!  The serving sizes are huge so come hungry and come often!

There are so many burger joints all over the place and this one does not disappoint at all.  Super laid back and easy going. Not quite fast food, but not high end.  

The sweet poTOToes are excellent, but warning: you get a pound of tots and they aren't the greatest warmed up if you take them with you so I advise sharing.

The burgers are enormous and they offer a wide variety of options including different types of meats, buns, condiments, etc.  

Happy Hour deals are mediocre, but if you want a good burger and you are in the area, this is a decent spot.

Holy mother of God... when I die, please spread my ashes (secretly) in Rehab Burger. I don't even.... where to begi.....how do I..... Down boy! Burgers: Bada$$, tasty, creative. Fried stuff: unique, delicious, rings are kings. Apps: Pig wings..?.... shut the front door! gimmie a plate of pig wings, a beer and leave me alone until I'm done, then bring more of everything. 

It's a classy joint

I expected a lot more for the hype. My sweet potato tots were a bit burnt, and the service was just okay. The waitress seemed like she really didn't want to be there. She wasn't rude or anything, but she wasn't particularly helpful.

The decor and ambiance of the place are really dingy. You'd expect from such a popular place that they could put a bit more effort into presentation. It wasn't like the food was cheap, either. I think I've been in nicer McDonald's, actually. The whole restaurant was uncomfortably hot, everyone smelled like they'd been in the sun all day, and it was as loud as a bar you go to find a one-night-stand. But it was 1pm on a Sunday, so that was really bizarre. Would it kill them to turn up the A/C? It is Arizona, after all.

I wanted to order one of their spicier menu choices, but I could barely stomach any food at all because of how stuffy the place was. I stuck with a fairly bland cheddar burger with thousand island dressing. I did not have any complaints about the burger, but it wasn't anything to write home about.

My brother ordered a frozen strawberry margarita to cool off. I'm glad I held off ordering one myself until I tasted it, because it tasted like that cheap corn syrup mixes you get on the bottom shelf in the liquor aisles at Walmart. I can make better at home, thanks.

I really expect better from Scottsdale than this, especially when this place has so much hype. Maybe it was an off day, or maybe not. There's dozens of awesome places in town to get a burger, and this one -- despite all the raves -- doesn't make my list.

The food here is AMAZING and the service is fantastic.  Huge portions, one burger was enough for two people to share. We ordered the PB&J bacon burger, and the Porkster burger. Both were delicious! Try the Quesadillio it's a meal in itself, kinda spicy and super tasty.

This place is a must.....we ordered the McNarly Rehab burger both of us with sweet potatoe tots..yummm & we shared an order of onion rings which were huge, crispy & delish. Wow....the McNarly was a double patty so juicy..piled high with lettuce, tomato, onion & cheese....with just the right amount of thousand island. I could only eat half b/c this is a BIG...Definately this is a burger you could share!! 
We ordered take outsince my friend had her pup with her but we will try again & next time we plan on eating in on the patio.
 I do wish this place had a bigger patio. It's a little pricey but worth every penny. This is the best buger that I've had & you will be very satisfied...Can't wait to go back & try some of the other burgers & some wings baby!!  
Happy Munching
Good atmosphere with great sandwiches!  Try the Porkster!!  It's definitely a one of a kind burger with cheddar and pulled pork on too!  So good!
Great food, awesome workers! Loved the environment! The best wings I've every had! :)

I'm really disappointed because I've heard this place be hyped up so many times. I'm sure a good experience can be had here, but we did not have one. 

We got to the restaurant around 8 on a weekday, a little close to closing for me, but it wasn't busy & they took us. We sat & it took about 5ish minutes for someone to come over & take our drink order which is pretty average for me. We took until our server brought the drinks back to order because we were a little indecisive. After we ordered (Know Poblano Burger & Veggie Noogie), the wait began. In total wait time, we sat for close to 55 minutes waiting on our food. The average wait time is usually 23 minutes (and my fiancé being in the business knows places usually push for that). About 40 minutes in, we asked how much longer the food would be (let me say in a really nice tone) and the server just told us when it's ready. I really wanted to leave & just go to Whataburger, but I was trying not to be a jerk. Our drinks didn't get refilled until we had our food on the table. The food wasn't the worst, but I wasn't impressed. The wait time had already created a lackluster experience. The fries were cold on both of our plates, the eggplant on my sandwich was so tough I just ended up removing it, but his burger was fine. 

I don't think I would ever return as a sit down customer, maybe takeout, but that's pretty out of the way for us, so I don't see us driving out there to come home with cold food (especially since we could've gotten cold food there).
This place is so good! Great service and wonderful food. Definitely coming back for these weekend burgers

If you want a burger and cold beer, mission accomplished. Awesome burgers. Best in Scottsdale likely. Some unique burgers and sides are awesome too. It's exactly what you want in a burger joint. Love it!
Best sweet potatoe tots I have had. The PB & J plus bacon burger is infamously delightful.
Little joint with Hawaiian decor, good music, and stiff margaritas. We had great service and the sweet potato tots were good. Burgers and fries were fine, but peppery.

Can we talk about these burgers for a minute?  I love a good burger place and this ranks right at the top of my list now.  They have a very wide selection of unique sounding burgers.  Their burgers come in 2 sizes and the portions are very large.  Thankfully I ordered the smaller size but even at that I couldn't finish my meal.  My husband got the pb and j burger and I had the hangover burger.  Both were awesome, as were the fries and sweet potato tots.  

I love the decor and funky island vibe.  Without a doubt I will be back when in the mood for a bomb burger!

wow, I don't eat burger much, so not qualified to say this would be the best burger so far.
but based on what I had in the past from other burger places, this one hit the spot as one of the great burger.

Headline: Mac N Cheese is a push up bra for burgers...if you have to use it, you're probably flat.

I have come to believe that if a burger joint needs to add things like Mac N Cheese and Jalapeno Poppers to their burgers, it probably means their burgers just aren't that great. This holds true for Rehab. I went with my parents and we got the Bigger Beefstro, Black & Blue and the Grilled Cheese (odd choice by mom, but I still love her). The bigger Beefstro came oozing out with havarti cheese and shaved rib eye. It was a beautiful site. But once I dug in, I realized that it just was flat. I could barely taste the burger itself and the pablano peppers were no where to be found. The Black & Blue was the same...I would simply describe it as bland. Overall, definitely not worth the hype or the wait. Even though there are cool shops around to help the wait go by pretty quick.

On a positive note, we were all happy with the chili verde appetizer. It came with great chips and was a delicious creamy mix of green chiles and chicken. 

True Rating: 3.4
(Ambience-4, Taste-3, Price-3, Uniqueness-4, Chub Meter-3)

The best burger I've had. They buy there meat daily from a local butcher which means it's never frozen. I had the blue cheese and bacon burger on a pretzel bun cooked rare. Also the customer service was great. They were fast and very friendly. I will definitely be back!

By far one of the best burger places I've ever been to. It's not healthy by a long shot but it is amazing. Their sweet potato tots are too die for. The portion sizes are huge and it's very reasonably priced. I would definitely recommend this place to try at least once!
Well worth the wait.  We arrived on a Saturday at 1:30pm for a group of 7 and we waited over 30 minutes.  Server and overall vibe was enjoyable.  The burger and the speciliteis are really huge.

I've been to the one in Scottsdale and had a pretty good experience, so decided to try this location as it's closer. Burgers and sides are great! Service was pretty awful. I think our server was new as he kept forgetting things and the tables around us seemed to be thinking the same thing. Besides the sub-par service, I was really looking forward to trying the pot brownie dessert and it looks and sounds delicious. It was very disappointing. The brownie tasted like something you'd buy frozen and microwave :/ I wouldn't say that I will never go here again, but don't see myself going out of my way. Definitely worth a visit for some good burgers if you've never been!

Came in at 11:15 am on a Friday. Started out NOT busy. Within 20 mins., it became quite busy and much noisier. Acoustics contribute to this. I'd say they have a good tasty worthy burger. There are options to satisfy the most finicky burger patron connoisseurs! Served on a very fresh lightly toasted bun. I opted for the regular nicely cut fries. Also, freshly made. You can have the REHAB 10 ozs.! Or, half that size, 5 ozs. (a RELAPSE). They didn't disappoint and the staff is friendly. The young waitress didn't seem all that familiar with their menu, but she was quite pleasant and apologetic for this. Table service was above average. Go when it's not peak hours for better service.

I like everything about this place! From the food, drinks, staff and atmosphere I've never had any complaints. I'm a burger guy and the burgers here are better than most in Scottsdale. This is a tough location and several restaurants have failed here in the past few years. I see this concept staying here for a long time as it's always packed.

Go check this place out!!

Stopped here 2 nights ago last minute.
Started with a 35 minute wait to get in but was worth it.
Meals are huge - beers are cold and service is good.
Forgot to take pics but had the PBJ & bacon burger - wow. Never thought PB&J would find its place on a burger, but this is definitely a surprise and a little unexpected..
The Hatch and Hangover burgers were quite similar and the sweet potatoes tots were scrumptious..

We decided to swing by on a HOT Sunday afternoon.  When we walked in, we knew inside was the only option.  Even though they had a nice sized patio with misters, you could tell they would not help on a day like today.

It was a busy day, for sure.  We watched all the burgers being served while waiting and got pretty excited for what was in store for us.  While waiting to be seated, we noticed a long table in the middle of the room.  There were roughly 8-10 empty seats at this table.  So we were naturally wondering why we weren't being seated at this table.  

There was also another couple standing next to us that had finished their meal and waiting inside.  They had commented that it was just too hot outside to wait to pay for the bill.  And the waitress was taking too long to bring their bill.

The hostess let us know our table was now ready (about 10min wait) and seated us.  So we sat down and started going over the drink menu first.  We needed to cool down!

Once our drink order was placed, we couldn't help but notice how hot it was inside the restaurant.  At first, we thought because it was a hot day and we were waiting by the front door.  But now that we were seated, it was just plain hot.

After carefully mulling over the menu, we decided on two burgers... one Turkey burger and one Spicy Mac N Cheese burger.  Both with the sweet potato tater tots.

While waiting for the food, we loved the vibe in the place.  The cool beachy decor, and 90's jammin tunes... all made for a neat chill space to hang in.

The burgers arrived in good time and looked fantastic!  The tots... perfection!  Though, I think it would be nice if they offered the various sauces in a sampler setup, to dip the tots.  Ketchup was the only sauce brought out.
