The mac n cheese burger was great.  The trick is to eat all the mac n cheese first.  It's almost like an extra side meal in itself.  The lil hits of Sriracha were a great flavor adder.

The turkey burger was HUGE.  It was fresh n juicy.  Too many places serve something small and dry.  Rehab does a great job avoiding that pitfall.

So in summery, to get up in that 4-5 star range, Rehab should be offering seats when they are available and be cranking up the AC and fans on a hot summer day.

Was visiting from Seattle and Rehab was our first stop. Unfortunately it was a big disappointment for us. the burgers are grossly over rated. mind you we hail from a city that hosts Paseo and Red Mill (in Seattle) and Rehab definitely tasted like much hype about nothing. Also I must say the place is relatively expensive (cashing on their popularity) and are not very kid friendly.
Headed there for lunch today with mouth watering thinking how good it was last time we were in town!

This is a good place to grab a burger and drinks with friends. The burgers are not the best, but are good. That combined with the cool environment make it a quality joint. We sat at the bar so we could watch the games while eating. Our bartender was attentive, knowledgable and friendly. They have good drinks specials. Also, they have special burgers off menu so be sure to ask about them.

I ordered the PBJ & Bacon Burger. It comes with peanut butter, grape jelly, Sriracha sauce and bacon. The burger meat its self is just ok. The toppings made the burger very good. The flavors combine extremely well together. It is a rich burger with the peanut butter, but well worth it. My only mistake was ordering the 10 ounce burger. The five ounce would have been plenty of food for me.

For my side I chose the Jamaican Corn. It is grilled and then briefly fried. It creates a very interesting texture. The flash fry hit some of the flavors. If I was to go again I would add some sauce at the end to give some of that flavor back.

This place is delicious! My boyfriend had a Hawaiian burger and onion rings and I got s side of fries and the spinach salad with chicken. His burger was cooked perfect, nice and juicy. The French fries were well seasoned and a lot. I like how they already have you a side of ranch. It was perfect. My salad was fresh and delicious. The only tip I would suggest would be to order the dressing on the side. We had this tall waiter and he was on top of us, gave us to go drinks. Just great.

Maybe my review isn't fair because I haven't eaten yet, but it's the first Saturday of March Madness and all tv's are on. Golden State San Antonio NBA game. We have asked several people to switch one tv but were told that there is a table here that will throw a fit if they change the channel. The food needs to be the best ever or I won't come back.

Rehab is reliable and consistent. Great, tenured staff, always delicious food, and the most relaxed, fun atmosphere. Definitely our favorite burger place in Arizona. Try the PB&J burger-- you won't be disappointed!
Huge fan or their burgers. Can't really go wrong with any of their options and definitely get the onion rings. I also enjoy how friendly their staff is.

Had a good burger here forgot the name but it was quality 
A couple of friends had recommended it 
Im glad They did
Went there for lunch time, enjoyed the service prices were not too bad
Would definitely go back anytime I'm in the area

Amazingggg. Hands down not only best burgers that are creative, but allll the food is good here. We've had the pasta, chicken wings, calamari, fish tacos and more. All the food has been amazing. 

Recently one of our visits the manager was a little bit of a jerk. It was a Friday night and they were swamped, but still... he came off as very irritated and made us a little uncomfortable. Only complaint we've ever had and only issue with staff yet. Servers are always very nice and helpful. 

If you want some amazing food with a great atmosphere give this place a try!
Love rehab they are always busy, because it is so good! It's nice and convenient in old town!
Had a delicious PB & J burger!  Sounds crazy...crazy good!  The atmosphere was fun and the service was great!  I'll be back next time we are in town!

Bah humbug. I admit this used to be my fav burger joint in Scottsdale. Maybe they had an off night but all of our burgers were just so-so. Fries were nothing great and soggy onion rings. And to top it off, asked for lettuce and tomato on my burger and they served it on the side, not a nice crisp leaf of iceberg but shredded browning wilted lettuce. How somebody let that leave the kitchen to sit on a table. Embarrassing. Let's hope it was a misfire but not sure I will return anytime soon. On a positive note, cheap happy hour beers on draft all night (Thursday in Dec.)
Amazing burgers, atmosphere! One of my favorite spots in Phoenix hands down!

I don't know how anyone can give this place a negative review. The burgers were DELICIOUS. The wings were AMAZING. The service was AWESOME. And the atmosphere was SUPER FUN. David was our server and he was just about perfect. We can't wait to go back!

Very laid back surfer burger bar.  Enough burger combinations to suit any preference.  The Hatch Chile burger was an awesome pairing of a medium spicy large chile, thick cheddar slice, and cooked to a perfectly requested medium rare 10 oz patty.  Had to resist the fries so I could put it all away.

This was our first time here and it was very good. The place is clean, and mellow. A nice spot to hang out on a patio. Our server Mike was outstanding. We couldn't ask more from him. He was friendly, helpful, informative and suggestive. He got everything right and was always prompt. The food was very good also. We had the tractor pulled pork, and the big beefstro burger. I highly recommend the big beefstro burger!! And the Vidalia onion rings!! Can't wait to come back.

You need rehab, admit it, go get rehab.

Worth the wait for a table!  This place is not too big, real casual, friendly and busy.  Started with the Pig Wings.  Sooooo good!  Crisp outside and moist inside.  The sauce was incredible with just enough heat.  Two person portion size.  For a burger I settled on the Spicy Mac-N-Cheese Burger at my son's recommendation.  I was not disappointed.  The homemade Mac with the peppers made the burger explode with flavor.  Very filling.  Go there now.

Fantastic experience with Rehab Burger Therapy from start to finish! 

With lots of work travel and Dude starting a new job, we missed out on holding a get together for his birthday with all the Yelpmigos in July. 

He decided on this joint, so away I went to post a UYE! 

When I saw our guest list hit 21, I was a little concerned about being able to get a reservation on a Friday night in a smaller venue. 

Wiley the owner made it happen and was nothing short of freakin' delightful and pleasant. 

Rehab's team had a space set up for us upon arrival. I loved the stoner and surfer vibe of the place, brought me right back to Santa Cruz, CA. 

David was our one and only server for our massive group, and MAN he ran the show like a boss. Did not miss a beat with the food and drink orders, hilarious guy - and was a hit with my younger sister! 

Which, since she accurately guessed his age (and was underage), guess who got to drink the "shot prize"? Thanks, Lolo, for fueling your big sister's night of liver killing! ;) 

As for the food, absolutely delicious. 

Dude ordered the Ghost Burger, which I got to take a bite of. Ghost Peppers, yes, but not so blazing your face hurts. 

I decided to live ridiculously, and ordered the Rehab size (smaller) PB&J Burger after reading Mar L.'s review. Bacon and sriracha also included.

Don't knock it before you try it; this thing was the perfect blend of sweet, salty and savory. 

And totally required a fork and knife. Prepare for ooooeeyy goooey messiness, folks. 

Wasn't too impressed with the fries; immediately regretted not ordering those Sweet PoTOToes! Next trip . . . 

Also, our buddy Joe B. ordered a Reese's Pot Brownie - Which unfortunately wasn't packing actual POT, but came in a giant pot. 

Sweet, melty delicious Reese's all wrapped in a brownie with vanilla ice cream, this one is sure to please. Get it if you have a large group to share! 

Have to comment about the service, we weren't the only large group. There was a group here having a rehearsal dinner, and not once were there any hiccups. 

We had an absolute blast here. Can't wait for my next stint in REHAB! 

Thanks Rehab, Wiley, David and Co for making this a fun night for all!

It's worth a trip here to experience the burgers.
They are legit serving sizes - I eat a lot and I have trouble with the big burgers here.
I'd actually suggest going smaller burgers on a date or something because you'll be waddling around town afterwards.

It's a nice vibe here as well. Space isn't very big and it's been crowded the times I've gone, so there might be a wait.
Brittany was absolutely amazing! She was so personable, friendly, and attentive- she is an absolute jem! Definitely coming back to see her!

It's true what they say... Rehab is as good as it gets! I recently dined in for a second time, and just as the first, I was fully satisfied. I don't know what it is, but their food is spot on. The service was really great as well. You'll love this west coast vibe burger joint! A Scottsdale hidden gem, and one of the best burgers in AZ. I will keep coming here for different occasions - lunch, dinner, large groups - you name it and I'm certain they will accommodate.

For my most recent visit, I ordered a turkey burger. SO delicious! I really liked how my server asked if I was enjoying the turkey burger specifically because they can sometimes be a hit or miss with me. Thank you Rehab for another delicious dinner!

09/26/12

3.5 stars.

For my second visit, I brought Mom, her two sisters, and a cousin along to take advantage of a Yelp deal I bought for Mom.  We couldn't sit at the community table we had enjoyed before, since it was reserved for another party, but we were able to get a five-top by getting two tables next to each other.  The weather was much cooler than on our first visit, so we were comfortable in that aspect; However, the music, which had gone from tropical/surfing sounds to loud contemporary/rap/rock music, so a few of us (at least an aunt and me) were annoyed.

Rehab now offers Four Peaks' Peach ale on tap!  Sheryl (sp?), our friendly and energetic server, informed me that the bar began to serve it this past Saturday-- hurray!!  I'm so happy this has come to pass, since I've only seen this peach ale offered at three other bars/restaurants BESIDES Four Peaks: Tempe's Lucky Break (during a Yelp event held there), Vincitorio's, and Mac's Grill and Bar.  Rehab offers $3 draughts during happy hour!  Be wary of their happy hour food menu pricing though, as they're only $1 off apps...

Since Mom and I had just eaten brunch right before our massage session, we weren't hungry, but I had planned on at least enjoying a half-pint of peach ale or a little bit of wine while my aunts and cousin enjoyed their burgers.  We decided to order the app Sheryl suggested, the Pigs' wings ($9/HH) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/3l54GTr8-E3XPbIxnF_sAA?select=KZrg3VgZMoHE0xJgASMR8Q#KZrg3VgZMoHE0xJgASMR8Q, her favorite, which comes with a peach-habanero BBQ sauce made in-house.  An aunt spied calamari ($6.50/HH) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/3l54GTr8-E3XPbIxnF_sAA?select=Ewn0r0HcfU9xW_7-481BgQ#Ewn0r0HcfU9xW_7-481BgQ on the menu, and since that is also Mom's favorite app, I asked Sheryl to bring some for the table, as well.  Mom and her two sisters decided to split two Rehab-sized burgers (mushroom and swiss, $11, and green chile hatch, $10.50) and their sides of fries and sweet po"tot"oes.  My young cousin thought she was ordering a sandwich when she went for the Chile Con Fritos ($8).  Since I had been disappointed with the chocolate milkshake sample we were given on our first visit, I decided I'd take up Ken's offer to try one of their alcoholic versions on this visit.  Ken was absent, however, so I asked bartender John what my options were, and we decided on a vanilla-based liqueur, Frangelico, and Kahlua concoction ($8).   http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/3l54GTr8-E3XPbIxnF_sAA?select=hP3IwyweWGHoAHexT4OhHw#hP3IwyweWGHoAHexT4OhHw

My aunts enjoyed the calamari!  The pigs' wings were also good-- I enjoyed the outer crispiness and the sweet spiciness of the sauce.  I don't think I'd order it again, though, and the same goes for the calamari, which weren't as crispy as I like them to be, plus I wasn't wowed by the "original marinara."  Personally, I'd just concentrate on the burgers.  I waited too long on trying the fries (as I mentioned, I wasn't hungry, and I concentrated on enjoying the sips of peach ale and the milkshake), for they were already soggy.  My aunt had sliced a portion of the hatch green chile burger for me to have, enough for two or three bites, and I still found it very tasty, even though I'd forgotten to add some chipotle aioli.  I don't think cousin enjoyed her Chile con Fritos, which didn't look very appetizing to me (and corn-based Fritos isn't something I can eat any longer) and she, the aunts, and my Mom didn't find the kitchen's idea of using a Fritos bag instead of an aluminum sheet to line the platter amusing.  I thought it showed Rehab's playful side, but you can't please everyone.  Come to think of it, I don't think it's wise to use a bag with so much ink as a liner when food's involved.  Hmm...

Last, but not least, the milkshake, which was much thicker, and that's a very good thing!  I enjoyed the first few sips, but the sweetness started to get too cloying by the mid-mark, and that's with all of us sampling.  I would only order this if I could share it with one or more people, and if I were to crave for alcoholic ice cream, I'll just head over to Lee's Cream Liquors!  :))

Props again to the management/owners on stocking up on Four Peaks Peach ale.  It's nice to patronize local bars/eateries local-based beverages and food!

Probably the best burgers we've had since we've moved to this area.
The atmosphere is totally casual. It's comfortable, The staff was friendly. The burger options are plentiful, including (of course) a make your own.
I should have done this review at the time, it was a VERY stressful day for us and I can't remember what we had. I know we each had burgers, we were each happy (and they were cooked PERFECTLY). He had the sweet potato tots (which he enjoyed) and I had their fries (also yummy). Unfortunately, that's all I remember. But trust me when I tell you that we liked our burgers. We commented on it a few times during the meal.
Rehab Burger Therapy is a nice little restaurant ran by locals. All staff are very nice and food was excellent! This is definitely going on my list of quick, good food!

Holy cow, literally! One of the best bacon cheeseburger I have had. I don't know if it was the bacon, the burger, the pretzel bun or just the combo. Mmmmm.

Portions are very large as described in other reviews and photos. No kids menu but my little ones shared a hotdog and fries and left very full. My other daughter had the pasta alfredo and said its the best she has ever had. Even said it was better than olive gardens which is HUGE for her. 

Not a lot of parking up front but a parking lot next door. The restuarant itself was smaller. We got there around 5:30 pm on a Tuesday and it was already busy. Luckily we didnt have to wait but if we had arrived 20 minutes later we would have been waiting awhile. We almost didn't come here because another yelper said it wasn't that kid friendly due to sitting. Sitting is rough and I would partially agree with not being kid friendly but defitinely somewhere you can take your kids if they can sit still. 

You can get 7% cash back and $3.99 chips and salsa for checking in. 

Staff was also super friendly and can handle a big crowd. 

Can't wait to go back.

Love Rehab Burger.  Great atmosphere, service with a smile.  Love their fish tacos, and the peanut butter/jelly bacon burger is unbelievable.  Beers are super cold, great prices.  Get a seat on the patio and people watch.  Enjoy
Really great burgers. Fresh buns. Great service. I prefer this location over Scottsdale. I had the hatch Chile burger. You have to get it. Sitting on the patio was the best.

Pretty good burgers. Their influence from Oregano's is clear. Good food, fair price.  Limited seating We have been here several times.  One block off of Scottsdale Road.  Fresh bread makes the burgers good.  Many toppings available from cheese to peanut butter!

Rehab is a little gem that's big on flavor. I have been here a couple of times and have always had great good and a good experience. I think the staff is very nice and tremendously accommodating. 

My husband thinks the peanut butter and jelly burger is the bomb, he often talks about it in his sleep. I prefer the veggie burger and really appreciate that Rehab extended the menu to include many vegetarian items. The portions are huge... as in gargantuan. You can easily split a burger and be a happy camper.  

Go here, it's totally worth it.

First off , the service . Fantastic. Everyone was so accommodating . Drink were refilled without EVER asking . Straight up, Lo rocks ! She was our server and she's on point ! She was on top of EVERYTHING . When we ordered she helped with the choices .Kudos to her..so laid back and in the cut , even though the place was busy we felt like the ONLY table.  

That's just the beginning. The food , wow ! I get it - it's bar food ,but wayyyyyyyy better ! The Pig Wings , dear lord - fantastic ! I'm a complete wing snob admittedly and these were unbelievable. The crispness ,the flavor ,the size ,the sauce(sweet with a little heat) ...absolutely great ! Next time I'll try the regular wings . 

The main meal was Pescado Borracho and Poblano burger. Both were fantastic ! The choice of condiments, pickle and sides were plentiful . The food was ALL at perfect temperature. you can smell and taste the beer with the fish dish . The tartar sauce was a perfect compliment . Also , the portions...hell yeah !! BIG portions , no filler -all killer . $40 and a little change was the bill . COMPLETELY worth it .

Burger joint in the heart of Old Town with a surfing theme.

I don't eat red meat or pork so I'm always search of a good turkey burger and Rehab did not disappoint.

The menu is pretty extensive and offers everything from your basic fries and sweet potato tots to clams to wings to beef burgers to fish and chicken burgers.

When I'm starving, my eyes are often bigger than my stomach so I opted for a side salad, half order of buffalo wings, and turkey burger with cheddar on a wheat bun. 

The salad was made with mixed greens and tasted really good.  

I had the wings cooked extra crispy and they came out perfectly.  They were cooked in a buffalo sauce that had really good flavor.  It had little pieces of garlic mixed in the sauce.  So far, these are definitely the best wings I've tasted in Scottsdale.  

The turkey burger consisted of a really good size patty that was super juicy (uncharacteristic for turkey burgers).  It was definitely the best turkey burger I've had in Scottsdale.

If you are search of a nice, tasty burger joint with a beachy, hipster vibe, then look no further.

Definitely check out this place!
Wow, this place is awesome. The burgers were incredible and the waitstaff was funny and engaging. A definite must stop if you are in Scottsdale!

This place is great! Decided to go here on a whim when family was in town and was not disappointed. I had the "Hangover Burger" (the one with the fried egg) and it was delicious. Had the sweet potato tater tots as well and couldn't stop eating them! Great atmosphere and fun environment for all ages. Even if you don't like burgers, there's something for everyone. The kids got quesadillas and enjoyed them as well. The Long Island iced teas were spot on, and our waitress Kaye was super attentive and friendly. Her hair flip wasn't too bad either.  I will definitely be coming back here and can only hope they expand to chandler and tempe as well. My one recommendation would be to put the Long Island iced teas in the bigger water glasses. Ha ha. But seriously, check this place out!

I've been here twice before and every time I've received top level customer service whether they were slammed with people lined up out the door or just wandering in and getting seated immediately. Yesterday I came in a little early thinking there might be a wait considering it would be what peak happy hour is (happy hour is all day Thursday!) But instead I was sat immediately, the waitress was so nice and brought me some water while I looked over the menu for a drink. I chose their New Belgium seasonal IPA which wasn't bad for an IPA but I can feel really hit or miss on IPAS, I drank about half of it before asking for a blue moon instead - defeated by feeling adventurous. Never once did she rush when my friend was late, when it took us forever to order as we were catching up, and she was nothing but patient and accommodating the entire time - I was impressed because we definitely sat there twice as long as the other patrons. I ordered the Hawaiian barbecue burger, rare, with the tator tots. Everything was PERFECT. Burger rode the line of rare and raw but honestly I can't even complain about that because there is nothing to me more annoying than ordering a burger rare and getting it medium well at best - kudos guys! She made sure our drinks were thoroughly filled throughout the entire experience and when the check came I was shocked to see she hadn't charged me for the IPA! I was definitely planning on paying for it considering I had drank just about half but that little detail was nice and it was even nicer to see that a year between both visits no amount of customer service, quality or value was lacking. Simply impressive!

Best Burger this side of anywhere!  Love, love, love this place except of course for the wait.  This time we went late, they were near closing yet staff did not seem worn out as one might expect after a busy Saturday night.  The food is consistently good and menu is so diverse, definitely not a boring, lackluster burger joint, just the opposite! We live a bit far from establishment which is a bit of a blessing in disguise due potential waistline damage from temptation of too frequent visits!

I remembered why I quit coming here just now.  Food has always been great, this is my third time with terrible service here.  I wish I could say I was able to enjoy the food this time but after waiting 8 mins to get acknowledged by an employee( over 4 employees walked by and looked at me didn't say a word) I decided to just sit my self hoping a server would acknowledge me.  The server came up 4 mins later telling me I couldn't sit there and that there was a wait with 4 open tables in restaurant. The only wait was 2 people that were waiting behind me and never sat down. Once I asked for a manager they said I was fine to sit and she would return for my drink order.  8 MINUTES goes by and not one single employee comes to ask if we want a drink.  I WILL NEVER RETURN TO THIS ESTABLISHMENT AGAIN. I can understand if it is busy but it was a Wednesday night with multiple open tables everywhere and no SPORTS playing.  I am 100% about customer service and this is the third time in a row I have had terrible service.

Rehab is one of the best burger establishments in Maricopa County.

I ordered some type of cheeseburger with thousand island dressing.  It was extremely messy and difficult to eat due to the thickly sliced pickles, but cutting it up made it easier to handle.

Some little sweet potato tots came with my burger and I also ordered a side of onion rings.

The onion rings were in my top 5.  No complaints there.  They automatically bring you ketchup, ranch, and a chipotle sauce for dipping.  Way to be on the ball, Rehab.

The sweet potato tots came with a yummy pineapple concoction for dipping.  It was good at first, but quickly became too sweet and I had to abandon it for the ranch and ketchup.

Everything was really good.  I would definitely go back.

Even their female employees were easy on the eyes.  Apparently, they are allowed to wear tight, revealing clothing to work.  Again, no complaints there.

In sum, go to Rehab if you like cute girls and awesome burgers.

One of my fave places to come get a burger, tots and enjoy happy hour.  

I waited quite a while to write a review though.  As an Old Town local, I've seen many restaurants come and go.  Way too many actually.  

But I waited because the same thing always happens.  When I find a great place, I need to keep it a secret because when I come back, it's bombarded with patrons and I can't get the same experience I had before everyone else found out.  

Honestly, I don't like crowded places.  I like to enjoy the experience and relax.  

Only 4 starts because I really like the food & the atmosphere, but the place gets too crowded.  The patrons are squeezed in so tightly that I feel like we're all dining together.  Not cool when other customers can breathe on the food you're eating.

Rehab Burger Therapy? 

I may Need to go to rehab soon because this place could get Addicting. 

Sitting there among the hanging cruiser bikes and surfboards, it feels like you've left Scottsdale and entered a beach bar somewhere. The atmosphere is laid back without sacrificing service. The staff is quick and friendly. Their efficiency was impressive.

I ordered the 5 oz. Backyard BBQ burger. It's stacked with two big, delicious onion rings, Colby jack cheese and loaded with bbq sauce (almost too much sauce, if there is such a thing). 

The fries were fresh, and crispy. The pickle spear that comes with the burger is no slouch either. It's not a limpy, weak pickle spear. It's stout and crunchy. Yup... I just complimented a pickle. 

If I knew therapy could be this good, I'd have gone years ago.
First time eating there! Great food and service! Cold beer! We had a MacGnarlyRehab Burger! It was awesome ! Fries and onions rings! Can't wait to go back!great atmosphere! Fun place and busy!!!
OMG.  there food is outrageously wonderful!  Its not just burgers.  you can replace the burger with Turkey meat or chicken.  A Must go to place.  The service is great.  everyone is friendly.

Wouldn't have known about this place without Yelp. Thanks guys!

Interesting restaurant, with a sort of Island/surfer attitude. The burgers were great, although my Hangover had a bit too much Hatch chile--it dominated the flavor of the burger, so it would've been nice to cut it up into slices rather than a huge layer. The fries were awesome (especially the dipping sauces). Best burger I've had in Arizona.

Nice place in Tempe just off the beaten path of mill ave. Burgers are good and staff is friendly. Walked in 15 min before kitchen closed and still got great service and a fast turn around on my order. Not a lot of the college crowd so you can actually hear yourself think

I feel awful that it took me this long to update my review, I'm sorry Wiley! Rehab Burger is now one of my favorite spots to grab a great burger, and a cold beer! The staff is always nice and funny, the music makes you feel like you're on the beach in Cali, and the food.... Well the food is awesome! I love the Mac Gnarly burger as well as the PB&J burger! Check it out, you won't be disappointed! Oh, be sure to start out with the Pig Wings!!

Ahhhh, the burger craze. New burger joints seem to be popping up on every corner and at some point the beef frenzy will subside and we'll be left with empty restaurants. However, I think Rehab has staying power that would even keep Linsey Lohan here!  The patty and condiment combinations aren't that unique but the ingredients are fresh and the sauces are good enough to eat with a spoon. In fact, I really think it is the sauces that make the burgers here. I ordered a classic cheddar cheese burger which I know sounds boring but it was a great choice as it highlighted the yumminess of the chipotle aioli sauce. As many other reviewers have said, the "sweet poTOTatos" (sweet potato tater tots) are good but for me, it was once again the sauce, this time the pineapple teriyaki that made the dish.

This rehab center has patio seating complete with a zillion umbrellas, fans and misters. But vampires need not worry, as there is a great interior too that is dim and cool. Also, despite being a super casual place, the bathrooms were neat and nice.
This place absolutely rocks!  Great, friendly service and phenomenal burgers.  Can't ask for much more.

For a quick snack before going to the Tour de Fat, my son and I stopped here. 
We didn't get any burgers, though all of the ones and the rest of the food I saw looked very good. I'll probably go back to try one.
Instead we had a couple of beers and the Calamari app. Being strips I was hoping for some thick cut, lightly bread, tender morsels. Instead we got thin short pieces, heavily breaded and very over cooked. Include a Marinara sauce that is so thick it's takes a spoon to dig it out of the bowl, and you've got meal frustration galore.
We ended up asking for some Ranch and Blue Cheese dressing instead which help a great deal. Though to be very honest, a spicy thinner sauce, like a Thai Chili or even a good Salsa would have been much better.
The server was great though she took her time getting to us and checking on us as we ate.
If you go, try a Burger. They looked like the best option for something satisfying.

my husband and I found this on accident and now take anyone that comes to visit us! I also let my clients at work know about it, it reminds me of my home-state,California and the burgers are delicious! you taste the quality in the meat.
I just went here tonight for the first time! I ordered the hangover burger and medium wings! Everything was so good! The staff was really nice as well! They have so many cool burgers on the menu!
Sometimes the food I have here is 5 stars worthy, sometimes not as much. I really think it depends on the day but overall good burger experience. They have unique combos.

I was super excited to check this place out thanks to their creative list of burgers with crazy toppings. Our service was fine and food quality was fine, but it was mostly just that - fine. The burgers and toppings were average. The fries were average. I'd say the most fun I had was with their sauces! The sweet potato tots tasted great with all three that I tried (pesto mayo, teriyaki and chipotle ranch). 

Again, definitely not a bad place at all. It was laid back and is probably a great place to meet friends
Amazing burgers reasonable prices.   I finally find a great place to get a burger in old town.  Go here a try this place out you will thank me.

Sharyl waited on us and she was friendly and professional. Ordered blue cheese and bacon burger and my hubby ordered the special burger with tortilla bread and he was very satisfied. Will come to try different yummy looking food.

I must be a traditional burger kind of guy because this place really was just "OK" to me. If you're the type that likes a regular burger, this burger joint might not be the best for you. It didn't really stand out as amazing or wow, but I have to say that I would gladly recommend it to those who enjoy the new style of New American foods. The party I went with really enjoyed their PB&J burger so I'll go ahead and recommend that if you're into that kind of stuff.

Gluten-Free Veggie Noogie with Sweet poTOToes - Yes Please!!!

It was amazing and Ill be taking my foodie sister and brother in law here pronto!!! 

Make sure to sit in Nic's section....superb service!!!

This place made me feel like I was in a surf shack joint in Hawaii. It was a really fun laid-back, casual restaurant.

My burger was great and those sweet potato tots with the sweet pineapple sauce were the best!
The sweet potato tots are to die for!! And my boyfriend got the mac n cheese burger which was amazing. Next time I want to try the PBJ and bacon burger!

Been to this awesome burger joint in Old Town a number of times now. Never a bad time here. Food, service and atmosphere is always awesome. 

There is a wait to get a table from time to time, it's worth it. The bar topically has open seating. Both fries and tots are awesome, put wings are great and as always, the burgers rock.

Sweet lord order the pig wings now......(did you do it yet?) .... you get a pound of pig knuckles (like little ribs) with a little bark on the outside and crazy tender on the inside, saturated with an amazing homemade spicy pineapple BBQ sauce. You'll want this sauce on everything! We were lucky enough to have sat down next to one of the chefs at the bar, a super nice gentleman who suggested what I should order and I did not fail to take his advice. I got the PBJ and Bacon Burger which the menu said "will freak your mouth out with a ridiculously delicious flavor combination"........ the menu was right! Bacon, grape jelly, sriracha sauce and this amazing homemade peanut butter somehow combine to form a flavor nirvana. I paired this with their sweet potato tater tots which were dusted in some kind of brown sugar love. Yummers! At this point if your hangover is not fully cured, you have to try the toasted s'more milkshake made with dutch chocolate and toasted almond vodka. Next time I'm going to try the spa treated clams and the Jamaican Corn.

The service was a bit slow waited with empty glasses to get a refill for approximately 30 minuets. We knew they were new and working out the kinks. We waited about 45 minutes for our meal to arrive. The Burger I received the wrong burger topping and cooked rare, when I ordered well done. The waitress was very pleasant apologizing and exchanged it immediately. I thanked her she explained that it should not take long the kitchen was going to fix it. I thanked her and waited patiently why it was corrected. A Female manager came over pointed her finger in my face and said "was it you?" I asked her excuse me? You did you have the wrong burger? I said yes. "she stated well I guess I can comp it" we stated  she didn't have to do that, It was  was being corrected. We just hoped it didn't take another 45 min apparently this upset her, she turned away very abrupt walked away from the table. Several minutes later The Manager/owner of the establishment asked us how everything was. He asked about my order being incorrect and I started to explain, he immediately got on the defense cutting me off stating they have only been open 5 days. I said I understood but was just giving constructive criticism. I pointed to my drink and said there was no salt on the rim of my second drink. (No biggie but he was asking) The manager immediately got on the defense and started talking very nasty to myself and my husband. I told him I was giving him positive feed back so he could be successful in this heavily saturated area where everyone sells burgers. He stated he grew up in this neighborhood and this is a very successful Business. He took a step back from the table and told us to "GET THE FUCK OUT OF HIS RESTAURANT" I asked if he was serious when he yelled again to "GET THE FUCK OUT" so we exited the restaurant. He followed us out into the parking lot yelling that we didn't pay for our food, and we should be proud that we were the first to get 86ed, and if we ever return he will call the police. 

The one bite of my corrected burger wasn't enough to make a decision on the quality of the food

Went to Rehab this past Sunday around 6PM and it was PACKED! I'd been a few years back and I know the burgers were very good so when my friend told me he wanted to try for his first time I was totally IN!  When we arrived we were advised of the 35 minute wait and waited with no problem. The host was a bit snippy so I didn't really appreciate that but I let it go since he was probably overwhelmed. Once we were eventually seated I ordered the Yelp special chips and salsa right away and they took forever to come. Once they arrived we ordered our burgers since the server was often gone for long periods of time. Don't get me wrong, she was extremely nice and efficient I just feel she was too busy. They should've had more servers IMO. Anyway.. the chips and salsa were very good.  Chips tasted fresh and home made and the salsa is as mild and flavorful. I ordered the hatch burger and my friend ordered the backyard BBQ burger. Both were phenomenal and the small side of onion rings set it over the top. All in all it was a great ambiance and very good food. 4 stars for the snippy host and the Fact we had to stay there for 3 hours because the server hardly came around :/.

Short and sweet. Passing through and found this place on Yelp. Friendly service but don't look for fast. I had the rehab sized Know Poblano burger - 10oz on a brioche bun with sweet potato tots. The burger was huge! I was super hungry and barely finished the burger and only ate 1/3 of the tots! The manchego cheese paired nicely with the roasted poblano and beef. The 10 oz patty was lean and flavorful! It was a really good burger. The tots were average. They served it with a side of a chipotle aioli that was decent. I only used a tiny bit, in full disclosure! 
I sat outside on a beautiful evening so all in all a good experience. I'd come back. Knocked off a star for attentiveness and the average sweet potato tots. Burger is a stand up 5 stars!

Nice place, if small and loud at times. Patio is nice in the winter, bar is always good. Staff has been great every time I've been in and more than willing to offer advice on the menu items...even suggesting items off-menu now and again.

Burgers are all pretty solid. I've tried a few, mostly on the spicy side, and none were all that spicy that they would scare away the average consumer. I would have liked a little more kick, but I can always add to it.

Tots are great. Other sides have always turned out well and their complement of dipping sauces are really nice.

Definitely worth a visit or two.

The burgers here are a1 and the hot wings are just as delicious! My first time in I decided to sit at the bar. David was my bartender and he's the only reason I go back!!! Takes excellent care of you and will recommend his favorite meals. Cool atmosphere and amazing food.

Absolutely love this place. I just wish I could go more often!!! There is a lot of fancy burger joints popping up, all over Phoenix and Scottsdale. Place is hip, clean and the burgers are down right delicious. I always order my burgers medium rare, only hoping that it will at least come out medium. But as always it will come out just perfect. I love bacon & blue cheese, but I need to expand my horizons!!! Can't wait to make this a regular spot, especially with my hot wife.

It's my son's birthday and he wanted a great but unconventional burger. The Peanut Butter, Jelly and Bacon is the top seller. If it wasn't for Serena's awesome customer service he wouldn't have been open to it. He loved it! We all loved what we chose.

It was a rainy Sunday and you can say we were craving some good old burgers and fries. What we discovered was the good, the burgers, and not so old food. Let me explain! We had some NEW...creative style burgers...the Hawaiian and the Hatch burger (Relapse). Both were delicious. Robin, our waitress, is awesome. She brought us extra sauces so we can try them as it was our first time there. Although her recommendation to get the mix strawberry/chocolate milkshake didn't quite turn out as well (can't blame her...we were imagining a chocolate covered strawberry mix), she was a good sport. Robin offered to get us a new one or to try their Pot Brownie without us even asking. She definitely went above and beyond. 

Go!! Great service...good food...prepare to have a food baby o.O!!! AWK
Excellent first time visit.  Cold beer and fresh onion rings, can't go wrong.  Thanks Rian and "Serious Mike"!

3.5 stars

It's still one of the best burgers in Arizona, but after going back to the East Coast, I've realized it's average in the burger world.

We tried the Bacon blue burger and Hawaiian burger. Our medium rare burgers were a little over cooked and not as juicy as we had remembered it. The toppings were pretty good but the meat lacks flavor. 

Service was fast and friendly, and the wait wasn't as long as estimated.

Rude hostess, holding tables but they don't take reservations???? according to host?? Take a class on hosting - call a heads are the same as reservations!?!?  Team of 10u baseball families from bel air.... Avoid this spot. Rude
The food was delicious and was presented well. Servers was efficient and nice. The atmosphere is a lot of fun, a great beach vibe!
Great selection of burgers. Mac and cheese or fries are amazing. Huge portions so should probably order accordingly

If they tried to make me go to Rehab Burger I might say Yes Yes Yes! I actually tried to go to the Scottsdale location a few months back but the wait to get a table was so long that we decided to eat somewhere else. We were in the area and saw that the Tempe location had just opened so we figured we should check it out!

The location is a bit hidden, right next to the Brickyard garage exit off of 6th Street. There is outdoor and indoor seating and in the winter they have heaters out if you do decide to eat on the patio. It was fairly busy when we came here on Saturday in the afternoon but we were able to get a seat with no wait. 

The menu has an extensive selection of burgers and drinks. They have a daily happy hour from 11-6 which includes discounted drinks. Every burger can be made into a 5 oz relapse size or 10 oz rehab size, and there are multiple protein options, such as beef, turkey, and veggie patty. Feeling in a spicy mood, I opted for the ghost burger, labeled as such due to the inclusion of ghost pepper cheese. I tried some of the chili cheeseburger as well.

Since it was pretty busy it took some time for our orders to get out to our table. Service was good though as we were waiting and drinks were refilled as needed. The plates were impressive looking. The execution though left something to be desired. Our burgers were supposed to be medium rare but came out more like medium to medium well. The burger itself had a dense tough texture, not very juicy, and didn't have a lot of flavor in it aside from a faint taste of char from the grill. I did enjoy the guacamole but the cheese wasn't fully melted in the center of the burger and had a slight grainy texture. The ghost pepper in it was actually not too spicy. I'd say it was about the spiciness of a jalapeno. The pretzel bun was decent but I didn't really enjoy it with my particular burger. 

The chili cheeseburger was admirably smothered in a large amount of chili. The taste itself was OK, nothing spectacular, and I had the same problem with the beef patty being too densely brick-like in texture and lacking in flavor.

The fries were light and crisp, dusted with some seasoned salt and very plentiful.

Since it was so busy they seemed a bit rushed for us to finish and get our table cleared. Everyone here though was friendly and attentive.

I'll give them another try; maybe another type of burger will taste better.

This was my second time trying Rehab burger but at a different location (The first was the newer Tempe restaurant). We had a 15-20 minute wait which wasn't bad at all. We had actually tried to go here months earlier but there was a two hour wait so we went somewhere else. We browsed around the pawn shop next door to kill time and came back in about 20 minutes. Timing was perfect because they were just finishing up cleaning our table. 

The check in offer on Yelp is for discounted chips and salsa ($3.99), the regular price is $5.50. We decided to forgo the offer since it was just a discounted price and go straight for the burgers! I forgot how many different choices there are on the menu, so many of them sounded good it was hard to decide. Finally, I spied the word Hatch chile... I can't resist anything with Hatch chile in it! The smaller 5 oz size automatically comes on a beef patty unless specified differently but if you get the 10 oz size you can get a different patty. I also spied beef chorizo patty... Chorizo and Hatch chile, what a perfect combo! Our server recommended the pretzel bun and anything up to medium for the doneness of the burger, so I went with the pretzel bun and medium rare patty. You also have a choice of sweet potato tots or fries but can upgrade to chili fries for an extra fee (I got the tots).

It took quite some time for our burgers to be made. I got hungrier and hungrier and the din from the other customers seemed to increase in volume as it got busier. Finally... our burgers arrived! Mine was piping hot with a generous serving of sweet potato tots. Biting into the burger, I liked the pretzel bun and the cheese was nicely melted over the patty. The actual patty was disappointing though. It had a very mild chorizo flavor and was like eating a hockey puck it was so overdone. I pulled back the bun and noticed the chile wasn't your typical Hatch chile color and was a very very dark green instead of light to medium green. It also didn't have the same flavor and texture as a Hatch chile...perhaps they pulled a switcheroo on me and used a Poblano instead? 

I liked the sweet potato tots which had a soft sweetness with lightly crisp exterior. They did taste more sweet than your usual sweet potato though... Perhaps they mix in a generous amount of sugar in the sweet potato mixture?

My burger was $11 and I felt it was very overpriced for what I got. I haven't been really that impressed with their burgers so I suppose there's no need for me to go into burger rehab for Rehab Burger!

2.5/5

Ok.. So let me tell you first before you get the wrong idea because I put 3 stars. It has nothing to do with the food. They may just have the best burgers I have EVER tasted!!! This is my second time coming to this restaurant. The first time I waited about 35 min to be seated. Which was annoying but! I stayed because with that long of a wait, it must've meant the food was good. I gave it 3 stars because of the wait the first time and the 2nd time was the service! Service first time was great! The guy at the bar was awesome! But the 2nd time of me going I feel like within the first 2-3 minutes I should be addressed. Asked for a drink, or acknowledged at least! And I wasn't. I waited about 8 minutes before someone came to my table. And didn't get a "sorry for the wait". It was just like... Ok what can I get you.. And even more bothersome, the couple that came in and sat next to me was addressed immediately.. Hmmm. But she did have a different waiter. Other than that. I would give 5 stars. Food is excellent!!

We stopped in on a whim while visiting old town Scottsdale and were very pleasantly surprised.  The burger was excellent!  The place was packed, even on a Saturday late afternoon, so the service was a bit slow, but the staff was friendly when we did interact with them. If you are a burger aficionado, and I would definitely suggest a visit if you are in the area.

My boyfriend and I shared a Popper Burger and Spinach salad.  It was one of the best burgers I have ever had.  The fries were good - but the burger was outstanding.  The salad was also top notch.

It was crowded so we had to sit at the bar - but that ended up being OK.

The burger was perfectly cooked (medium) and loaded with cream cheese.  Melted cheddar on top of that.  Deep fried jalapenos on top of that.  It was loaded and luscious.  

The salad was huge - plenty of strawberries, goat cheese and pecans.  I wish I lived in Scottsdale because I would definitely return.
Great burgers and the calamari is awesome! I'm looking forward to trying their pig wings next time!
One of the places I miss in Scottsdale. Very good burgers, typically friendly service.

Best burgers in town. Hangover Burger is the ultimate, only burger I ever order.  They once made me try the PB&J burger, sounds weird but it's strangely amazing. They spoiled me on getting burgers. Everywhere else I go the burgers just don't compare. I stopped ordering burgers everywhere else because they just disappoint me & make me wish I would have just gone to Rehab.

A. Great barbecue burger.
B. Great service from Megan.
C. Fun atmosphere inside and on the patio.
D. Kilt LIfter draft beer was perfect !

My Regional manager loves burgers and was pretty faithful to Culinary Dropout whenever he was in town. I pleaded him to venture out and took him to Rehab. Our waitress suggested the PBJ and after some convincing, we decided on that and the Blue Cheese. My manager took a bite of his half of the PBJ and I asked him how it was... Silence. He continued to eat his half and then stared at my half. He said it was the most mind blowing experience he'd ever had. I took a bite into my half and immediately knew what he was talking about. It is definitely unexpected. The mixture of creamy, sweet and spicy....there are no words!

This is the second time I've been to Rehab Burger and it never disappoints. Great food, I went untraditional this time and had the BLT. Outstanding with sweet potato totes. Only reason I gave 4 out of 5 stars is waitress was a little disconnected, she seemed a little overwhelmed so her service suffered. But definitely should be on your must try list.

It's been a while since I have eaten here, but I thought I should review it anyway. 

We started with the chips & salsa. Nothing special, just wanted something to munch. I wouldn't recommend getting them. For our meals, I had the Jalapeno Popper Burger and my boyfriend had the Spicy Mac-N-Cheese Burger. The star of each burger is in the name: jalapeno poppers and mac-n-cheese, respectively. I loved the creamy texture of the cream cheese in the burger. For obvious reasons, my boyfriend loved the mac-n-cheese burger (there's also bacon). Both were a good size. I don't remember the fries being remarkable. The real star of the show is the creative burger.  

Good burger place. Worth trying out if you don't mind the heartburn afterwards.

I was worried a bit when they opened this location hat it wouldn't live up to the reputation and. Quality of the old town Scottsdale location but I must admit I was very wrong. As a matter of fact I thought this location was better! I was with a group of three and we arrived at around 12pm for lunch and got seated right away. Service was prompt and our waiter suggested and brought out multiple dipping sauces for our fries and sweet potato tots, DELICIOUS!! I recommend getting a burger your first trip, more specifically the rehab size!

Great place! Obviously all the burgers are top notch. The Rehab burger is over a half pound of juicy deliciousness. You can also get a half size burger thst is still plenty big.  They cook the burgers the way you order them. Too many places ask how you want your burger cooked than completely ignore your choice. Plenty of non burger choices too, delicious salads, yummy sandwiches and wonderful pastas. Awesome milkshakes, fries, sweet potato tots and pig wings (just try it). Great drink specials and happy hour for the cocktail and beer drinkers. Last but not least is a friendly and knowledgeable staff eager to please. Run, don't walk over to Rehab today!

I was in Phoenix on vacation and came across this place online. The atmosphere was cool. The bacon cheeseburger was good, buffalo wings were average. My issues were that it took almost 45 minutes for my burger and my server seemed to be more interested in socializing with other patrons that he knew. Another server ended giving me a to-go box and taking care of the check. Overall I's say my experience was average.

Great happy hour times. The service was off the charts and the burgers are excellent! I had the hangover burger which had bacon and eggs and other good stuff. The burger was cooked to perfection. I will definitely be coming back!

Recommended by a friend and this place did not disappoint. I got the fish sandwich and it was delicious!! It was a huge portion and I got it with their sweet potato fries. It also came with a few sauces for dipping. My husband got the rehab burger and he liked it. He said it was a good version of a burger and very filling. 

My only negative was the lemonade. It had a real funky aftertaste. Maybe it was the plastic cup it came in but not sure..

We came early on a Tuesday afternoon and was seated right away but it fills up quick. When we left, there was a huge crowd out the door. We sat at the outdoor patio and it was a nice lunch. I would definitely recommend if you are in the Old Town Scottsdale Area.
This is a super fun burger joint with great burgers! There is a burger for everyone here. Atmosphere is cool too. Great location and easy parking with great service. I will be returning.
I was really excited to try this place. The burger was "OK" but definitely not worth the hype. The sweet potato "fries" are basically mushy tator tots.

So glad we didn't go for the Rehab (10oz). Relapse (5 oz) was wayyyy more than enough for our two day worth of caloric needs. $2 more to double the size of beef patty sounded really appealing. But your arteries and waistline would thank you. 

My husband and I almost made the mistake of not accounting the crazy amount of toppings and sides included in our burgers. The nacho taco burger had enough taco meats to make at least two tacos. My beefbistro had enough rib eye to make another hearty sandwich. Topped with ooey gooey cheese, oozing condiments/sauces - we struggled to even lift our burgers. And who could forget the sweet poTOToes - stuffed to my the brim from the burger alone, I couldn't leave these sinful, bites sized treats alone. "They are small, I'm sure my stomach has room for one more". 

You honestly can't go wrong with any of the options. Very fun combinations, explosive flavors. Wished we have a Rehab back in LA for us to try more of the burgers!
Pretty great spot for a burger. I had a chicken burger with sweet potato tots and I went to watch the game which was filled with big screens. Such a laid back atmosphere.

Incredibly pleased. Prior to coming here I thought, it's just another gourmet hamburger place, boy was I wrong .Allow me to paraphrase my visit.
Snappy, knowledgeable staff, and a menu that is so awesome for so many reasons. Let me just say this, we all know there are lots of great choices available in this part of Scottsdale, but mark my words you will be impressed and will walk away saying to yourself " that was just a great experience" I will defiantly return. Your place shines brightly! Good job.

One word "AMAZING".....read a lot reviews and they live up to the hype. I had the hangover with sweet potato tots and it did not disappoint. I will definitely be back to try the PB&J burger. My wife had the Mac and cheese burger with green chili which was a dream burger.
Awesome burger!  Had the Jalapeño popper burger.  Great flavor definitely worth revising on a future trip.  Service was great and the staff friendly.  Was also good for the kids!

This place is great! Compared to their Old Town location, this one feels bigger and more open. The vibe is pretty relaxed which is nice. I've yet to have a burger that I didn't like from Rehab. I also highly recommend their fries. So much flavor!

Definitely a place I will come back to.

When we travel, we want to hit up a highly rated pizza place and a highly rated burger place wherever we go.  The reviews and the menu for Rehab looked solid, so we went, and the only conclusion I can come to is that there are a lot of really crappy burger places in Scottsdale.

The food was passable.  The patties were fine and cooked correctly but unremarkable, and the toppings were varied and included some interesting choices.  The potatoes (sweet potato tots and regular fries) were more of the same.  Not bad, but nothing terribly interesting.

But the service.  My God, the service.  I don't know that I can remember all of the things that went wrong, but I can assure you this stands out in my mind as one of the top three worst service experiences I can ever remember having.  We were seated for about 10 minutes before anyone came by to say hi.  We had some salads and burgers and we were here for over an hour.  This is not a fine dining establishment, and we were not loitering.  My burger came out with no fries.  Nothing, just a burger on a plate, and no one thought "Hey, that looks funny."

And it wasn't just us!  The couple seated next to us sat down about 15 minutes after we did.  They probably sat for 15 minutes before anyone came to take their orders.  They got a couple beers about 15 minutes later, and by the time we left, they STILL had no food in front of them!  We told our waiter when we left that these poor people had been completely ignored all night, and we hoped that would maybe get some attention to them.  For all I know, they're still sitting there silently, waiting for someone to give them some food.

The food was fine, but not in a million years would I come back here to be disrespected and ignored just to have a burger and fries.
This is one of the best burgers I have ever had.  The buns are baked fresh daily.  The meat is cooked perfectly.  It was a flawless burger.  The pork quesadilla was also quite good.

The burger was the best I've ever had, had the Poblano. Everything from the pretzel bun to the meat and toppings was top notch. Unfortunately I waited 35 minutes for my food during a slow period, the service was abysmal. But, I will be back for the burgers. If not for the service, would have been five stars.

Well, after many chances i have given up on rehab. When it opened i gave it my best burger award, sadly, no more. If my burger is cooked correctly half the time i would be lucky.  Just tired of having recooks. This is not a one-off or random occurrence, this has been the case for over a year. This burger was supposed to be no pink.
Special burger experience. Once you are there definitely a recommendation. Try the ghost burger - hot but the guacamole made it perfect.

Solid burger place. Got the chili cheeseburger with sweet potato tots, and had to waddle myself out of the restaurant. Food was tasty. Restaurant is super small, so you feel like you're sitting on top of other people. They should really consider expanding. Our server could have been a little more attentive with refilling out drinks, but no real customer service issues here.

OMG!!!!!!!  I got the mac and cheese burger when I visited this place about 2 months ago and I LOVED IT!!!!!!  It was an amazing mac and cheese dish on a burger!!!!  I cannot believe how amazing there food is!!!!  I even loved the fries and I am hard to please with fries!  EVERYONE should go here and try as many burgers as they can!!!!  The atmosphere is awesome and the service is fantastic!!!  I cannot wait to go back!!!

How Rehab won a Phoenix magazine award, I'll never know. I had a vegetarian option, the Noogie, and it was loaded with grilled eggplant, portabella and havarti but lacking in flavor. Beer was pricey at $5 Pacifico bottles, and my friend's green chili burger looked horrible and tastes mediocre. 

Service was way too relaxed, and everyone looked unimaginatively dumpy.

Came here based on a recommendation from one of our favorite Pattie's bartenders and boy was he right.

First, my biggest problem with Burgers today - a half pound burger should not be your standard size!!! When I was 10, the half pound burger was a novelty item for pigs to order and bring half of it home . Now places just assume "oh, they want a hamburger? They must want to cry from how full they are..." 

Now back to Rehab - sure, they have the ten ounce patty for soft suicide, but they also have the reasonable, tasty, cooked perfectly 5 ouncer, or 1/3 pound burger that most people remember. It was cooked right, juicy and not bland. I liked it so much, I went there twice during my vacation, and everything was fantastic - the fries are fresh, and shocker - taste amazing with the skin still on them. All their sauces are home made, and their wings are great. Then the burgers - I got pretty similar ones, the second day getting what I call the breakfast burger - with Bacon and a fried egg - combine that with the pretzel roll, and it was most likely the BEST one of those I've ever had! 

My friend had some fish tacos that looked screaming and I think he almost lost a finger when eating them. 

I never had a Scottsdale burger place I had to stop by - I had pizza (Grimaldi's) Italian(the Italian Grotto) Sandos (Defalcos) and steak (Don and Charlies)... Looks like I now have my burger joint! 

Service: 4 stars
Atmosphere 5 stars (cool servers, awesome laid back music, outside couches)
Food 5 stars (All Good - Burgers, Wings, Fries and Fish Tacos!)
Price 5 stars

Best burger in town!!!!  I'm a pretzel bun kinda guy.  Try the clams too, you'll thank me! The calamari portion is huge as well!  Burgers are cooked to order, I always get the large on a pretzel bun with the works.  A go to place for us. Burgers are $10-12, comes with fries, sweet potato tots, or a small salad (not the greatest salad).  You will leave full! Full bar.  Service is good-great, especially at the Bar. Or ask for Kay!

Can you please roll me out to my car because my food baby is killing me!!! This location in Tempe is just as awesome as the location in Scottsdale. Great food (as always) and wonderful friendly staff. It is located right behind Casa, right off Mill. I think it is a great addition to Mil Ave. The inside feels a bit bigger than the Scottsdale location and they have an awesome outside covered patio. They kept the same menu and decor as their other location, which is perfect because if something isn't broke, don't fix it! Rehab, you guys are my #1 burger place! Keep it up! :)

PS if this is your first time here, get the smaller burger, because the larger ones ARE HUGE! I recommend the Jalapeno Popper burger or The Hangover burger. Their fries are scrumptious AND if you have a Gluten allergy ask for the Gluten free bun, it actually taste great!!!

This place is fantastic. I went here a few days ago and was really blown away. It looks "ok" from the outside, a little ran down and kind of shoved back behind RnR off the corner, we weren't expecting much. Little did we know when we walked in how cool, fun and delicious this place would be. It's definitely got the Cali feel to it, with pics on the walls, bikes, surf boards, and fish tanks on the TV! It's really neat the way they gave this tiny place such a big Cali feel.

The place was packed on a Sunday early afternoon, so we sat at the bar. I ordered the chicken pesto pasta and my friend ordered the hangover burger. It didn't take long for the food to get out to us, while waiting we people watched and enjoyed our beverages! The food was AMAZING!!!! The pesto had a weird mix to it, when I ate a bite with no chicken it was meh, on the ok side, but when I added a piece of their marinated chicken in the mix my taste buds went bananas! It was crazy! I started laughing so hard because the chicken brought out so much more flavor of the pesto sauce! Man am I becoming a foodie. Their hang over burger was to die for. It sounds weird at first, but then when you think about it, you're trying to figure out why no one has combined eggs, bacon, colby jack cheese and green chili on top of some deliciously cooked hamburger before! I had one bite of my friend's hamburger and I was hooked. We both started chowing down like we hadn't eaten in days! I didn't think this lunch could get any better, until I checked in and noticed a coupon for their brownies! Ahhhhh man that did us in! The brownie came out super hot (watch your tongue ouchy) with some recess chocolate pieces in it, with of course ice cream on top.....DELICIOUS! I literally don't remember the drive home because I was in a food coma from this place! My friend was lucky they didn't have to roll me out the door!

I can't wait to go back! This place is awesome!!!! Keep it up Rehab, you definitely showed me what I have been missing out on!

PS - Staff was fantastic! Everyone was so happy, smiling, courteous, and helpful, it was awesome! Not one sad face in the whole house! You don't see that much anymore! You're staff is awesome!
Great service thank you Ben and the staff here but most of all the food was very off the chain delicious, the Rehab Beefstro! Yummo!! We will be back and have more amazing mouth melting greatness
This place doesn't seem like much from the outside but GO HERE! The spivey Mac n Cheese burger is out of this world. Service was top notch. Highly recommend this place for a casual dinner!

BEST BURGERS EVER. 
When I first went here, they had mentioned a PB&J Bacon burger.. Instantly as most would think, I thought "Gross." But one of the waiters were saying it is their best seller, so I thought fine, it cant be THAT bad right?
SO GLAD I took that chance, it was easily one of the best burgers I have ever had. I recommend Rehab Burger to everyone!

We came to Rehab Burger because of the great Yelp reviews and maybe our expectations were a little high as a result. It wasn't a bad experience but not quite as fantastic as we expected. The food was good and our server was good. The atmosphere was interesting with lots of stuff to look at and admire on the walls and ceiling. There are more than a few televisions that also act as a distraction. The menu has an interesting (I use that term loosely) collection of burgers, including a Peanut Butter and Jelly Burger. I was quite curious as to what that was like but not curious enough to risk ordering it and I couldn't convince anyone in my party to order it either - so I guess I'll continue to be curious. The food we did get was all good except for the sweet potato gator tots...our server said they wouldn't be mushy and alas, they were mushy. Bleh!

My favorite burger place! I used to work near it but now I go anytime I am up near it. The food is great and the service is fun. It's a hole in the wall joint that not many people find, but I will always go for this place. I wouldn't say its health food by 10 miles, in fact I would make sure you're not on a diet and head over here, you will not regret it! The food is just so great, and the spicy ketchup is a must!

Decided to finally visit the highly talked about restaurant and loved it! It was suggested that I try the mac-n-cheese burger. It was good, but it was a little too much for me. I still really wanted to taste the "meat" of the burger not just the mac-n-cheese.

But even with that comment, I would still definitely go back to try everything else on the menu! :)

Finally went to this place after many people told me to check it out.

We left thinking about all the people we plan to bring back. There are all the wild and crazy burger options that fit the needs of everyone. The most popular burger is the PBJ burger and my husband had it-- was good he said! I tried the veggie burger with the onion rings and BBQ sauce topper. I liked it! The veggie burger is a fried panko bread crumb and black bean patty. It was a bit hard to judge the flavor since it was doused in BBQ sauce (which is how I like it), but I do wish it weren't fried. 

Tip for kids: They don't have a kid's menu, but you can order half orders of PBJ or grilled cheese (what we ordered, and also mac'n'cheese and other items I can't remember). They are HUGE portions and I would've been full on the half order of grilled cheese or PBJ! The even come with fries and were only like $3.25 each. 

I changed my mind and upgraded my fries to Jamaican corn at the last minute because I saw it come out on another person's plate (was DELISH, btw) and they brought me that WITH the fries at no additional charge. Super kind of them considering I was the one who made the mistake in ordering late.

The portions are huge, the food is pretty good and the prices are super reasonable considering that burger is very likely to serve as two meals for you!

Can't wait to head back!

Wanted to try something new, this place didn't dissapoint. Tried the spicy mac-n-cheese burger and the PB&J burger! Not a fan of the Hawaiian burger though. Topped it off with an orange creamsicle shake. That is a must have!

Swell place indeed!  Awesome staff and holy gamoley! Crazy burgers! Our party had a little bit of everything. ..
Sweet potatoe tots with ALL the dipping sauces 
Onion rings
Macaroni and cheese
Macaroni and cheese burger
Mushroom and swiss
Hangover burger
Jalapeño popper burger. 

Summer Shandy on draft as well :) 

All quite splendid!

Oh my gosh, this was only my first time eating here, but it was sooo good you guys. We decided to come here thanks to you fellow Yelpers, and ordered the much raved about PB&J with bacon burger. I ordered it with the sweet potato tots, and the Chipotle aioli. The sauce alone was amazing, but then with the tots, it added some great spiciness. And okay so the burger was AMAZING. I could not even finish it all, and I got the 5oz (other option being the 10oz). I was hesitant at first, because what a weird combination! But PB&J is a classic, and when you add bacon the smokiness takes it to a whole other level. Our waitress was attentive, and the ambiance is fun. I went on a Sunday evening and didn't have to wait, but I imagine this place can get super packed because one visit just isn't enough!

The peanut butter jelly burger is so gooooood!!! The salads are huge and yummy! The service was a bit slow but the food made it worth it. Who thought jelly and peanut butter would go good with a burger
Looooove this place! Awesome atmosphere and friendly staff. Get the PB&J Burger!

Our server Alisha was on the ball big time. She kept walking by keeping a solid eye on every table in her section. It was nice to have a rock star, professional server taking care of us.

We've been here many times. We often come here when we bike to Old Town Scottsdale, especially for spring training games and general #barcycle rides.

Tonight, I had the Bacon and Blue. The burger has the blue cheese and bacon embedded in it. Does make it a little less messy while eating. I had the kaiser wheat bun. Everything was delicious. I ordered the burger medium rare and it was spot-on. The flavors were amazing. Because, umm, cheese and bacon and beef. Also, try the spicy ketchup. Yum. 

Love their fries with the skin on. Beer was cold. There was oxygen in the room because we didn't pass out. This is a great little place right off Scottsdale Rd. Highly recommended.

So love this place. Took co-workers, while we were in town working, and we all had the PBJ Burger, Awesome. You have to try it to understand how yummy it is.  Have it on the pretzel bun with sweet potato fries. You won't be sorry.

I meant to go here a few weekends ago but because parking in Old Town is occasionally horrible, we passed and went somewhere else. I was back in the area a few nights ago and decided to get dinner here with a friend after manicures. The super friendly server seated us and was very attentive throughout the meal. We didn't get any appetizers, but we both had the Backyard BBQ burger with regular fries. The restaurant has a very low-key relaxing vibe, my only (minor) complaint was that for a Wed night when it wasn't brimming, the music was pretty loud. We got our burgers and they were very good. I had the spicy ketchup and if you have your doubts, it is most certainly spicy, but I loved it. Since Old Town isn't really my scene I'm not sure how often I'll be back, but I'd definitely return.

We decided to go to the tempe location because the last time we went to Scottsdale the wait was very long. We went on a Saturday night and it wasn't that busy, we didn't have to wait at all. I gave it 4 stars because our waitress was rude. The chili frito pie is so delicious. Im not really a burger person but the burgers were good but could of use more seasoning. Nice atmosphere and very busy area.

Waited about 25 minutes to be seated which is no deal and expected on a Saturday. It was cooler outside on the patio under the mist then indoors. I ordered mac n cheese burger (med well) which was ok. The mac n cheese was good but the burger was bland and well done. My 13 y/o son ordered their hawaiin burger and he said it was very good and seasoned. His was cooked med well. Their pineapple sauce is pretty good. I would like to come back and try a different burger.

Service was very disappointing for me a few days ago. I asked for a table and the lady pulled the menu out of my hands and told me there was no tables available outside or in and would be a twenty to thirty minute wait. I looked at my coworkers and decided to to go to another place to eat and as we approached the patio we saw two empty tables and a whole bar stool area empty ... was very upset because I was looking forward to the tator tots and onion rings.

Love the atmosphere and the food is great! The sweet potato tots are really good. I went one time and the terrible service and when I mentioned something about it to the owner they immediately addressed it and bent over backwards to make sure my friends and I left happy!

The service was awesome. Our waitress Tina was friendly, and so great with recommendations. I had the Rehab Burger. I split it with my daughter and still couldn't finish my half. We have so much extra to take with us. The brownie dessert was worth saving room for. Warm chocolate and peanut sauce with two warm brownies topped with ice cream. Great vibe and music makes this a feel good place to come to. We sat outside with the mister keeping us cool. If I'm in the area next time will definitely come back.

Deliciousness - 4/5
Happiness - 5/5

Wow! Talk about blowing you away. 

Right off the bat, this has to be one of the most ideal Happy Hour possibly. 11:00-6:00 most days, and one all-day happy hour on Thursday. 

That wouldn't matter if this place weren't SO good. The food is high quality and lots of fun burger combos. Plus it has bucked the trend of high-end burger joints by refraining from shoestring fries (a bane of my existence) and instead, offers nice medium-cut fries that look like they came from a potato. The burger was out of control - a hamburger topped with prime rib and horseradish sauce. Obviously not designed for a healthy lunch, but a real plus for total satisfaction. 

Best yet, they have multiple sauces. I love sauces, particularly aioli. I was able to taste 3 (horseradish, chipotle and pesto) and all were wonderful and summarily devoured.

But what really puts this place over is the wait staff. They were all very friendly and attentive. But most of all, constantly busy. I was so surprised to watch the bartender cleaning the shelf they have their display bottles on. In all my years of bar-sitting, I don't know I've seen anyone do that. Seeing how hard working and nice the staff is shows that they are being treated well by the ownership and love what they do. I will never turn down a chance to eat at a place like that.

Two small minuses. I really want to try a shake or dessert, but the burgers are ridiculously filling. And then, the beer selection was underwhelming. But neither remotely earns this place anything less  than 5 stars.

Going to keep it simple. The BEST burger I've had. I mean that as in a fancy burger, not one I made at home. I ordered the Sunday Special "Mac n Cheese" burger. AMAZING! Also, sweet potato tater tots. YUM.
The service was great and friendly too. Only 4 stars because I wasn't able to order any adult beverages since I was going to work... But it was a nice place, cheerful folks and GREAT food. I'm totally coming back.
Awesome burgers and pleasant staff. It does get crowded,  so recommended checking it out weekdays.

Considering Ive driven past this place a billion times and i love burgers...I was anxious and starving once we decided on lunch here. To start with the hostess threw off a vibe like she was annoyed with everyone. She didnt even try to mask her aggravation. We werent even sure if we were suppose to be following her when she seated us, Im still not sure. Because after we chose our little corner on the patio she didnt leave menus and walked away and sat another group (with menus). The food took quite a long time. And was just ok. I can say I tried it, and thats done with

It looks better than it tastes.  No amazing combination that makes me say I have to go back there for that burger. The onion rings were good that was the only item that was good. Frozen burger patty. Nothing special. Costs as much as a burger at Hillstone but no where near the quality. The restaurant is also very dirty. It serves the hangover late night crowd who does not notice the dirt. Our thoughts.

This place was founded by the same people who started Oregano's Pizza. It has some of the same type of vibe, but a burger vibe instead of Italian. The hamburger was very good, but I probably wouldn't call it great. Mine was a little over cooked and therefore a little dryer than I like. I didn't go with the fries, so I can't comment on them. Instead I went with the onion rings and they were also very good. I look forward to going back and trying some of the other items on the menu.

HH very marginal.

Extremely sub-par beer selection. 8 taps. Blue moon, Coors Light, 1554, Dos X, Bud Light, Corona Light (!) and two Four Peaks. Ok, you say, they make up for the big, national, unoriginal taps with a great bottle selection. Nope. Mike's Hard Raspberry, PBR (12oz!), Red Stripe, Negro Modelo, Heineken, Corona, Corona Light (!!), Pacifico, Dos X dark, Landshark (?!). Seriously.

Husband and I went a bit overboard at the pool so we woke up late and needed good food ASAP - burger rehab was the closest answer without a wait. BOOM SOLD!

Luckily in the desert there was this funny little place with super great service and a menu filled with creative options.

Usually my husband is pretty apprehensive about trying new, weird food combos but we were on vacation so I think he was feeling adventurous - we got the bacon peanut butter & jelly one and the spicy Mac and cheese one with sweet potato tatter tots and whoaaaaa we were not disappointed!

Please note: This is NOT DATE FOOD! 

It's as messy as it is delicious and it really takes commitment to a FULL BITE each time in order to get the fully balance of the flavors. The portions are huge too!

The menu was put together with much  creativity and the staff was really passionate about being welcoming and kind. We sat at the bar and noticed several regulars they called by name - a good sign of a good place.

Highly recommended!

Let me just say that if I was ever in a burger rehab therapy clinic these would be the burgers I'd want for my meds. I bookmarked this place on Yelp a long time ago but since we live in Maricopa and work in Chandler we rarely ever venture to Scottsdale. But the other day we were like "F-it, let's do it!"  There were no wait times when we arrived, which is nice. They have patio seating but the décor was so fun we opted to sit inside. This place was completely decked out in beach décor. We truly felt like we were sitting in one of our favorite food shacks in San Diego off mission beach. We ordered some chips and salsa to start since we had our Check-In coupon from Yelp.
