If you've read my other reviews you know how super picky I am about chips AND salsa. To my surprise both were great!! Usually there is always one I'm a little "eh" about but at Rehab both were really good! For the burgers I ordered the Hawaiian Burger and added guacamole and my boyfriend got the Ghost Burger and we both decided to try their sweet poTOToes. (Yes that's how it's spelt!) Holy beefy amazingness batman! These burgers were delicious! They were perfectly cooked to order and I love the traditional buns they use. The tots came with this chipotle aioli sauce that was a "I'm-ganna-just-drink-this-sh*t" kind of good. My only regret is not being able to finish all my food! You know where you're eating and you know you're too full but you keep saying to yourself "just one more bite..." Yeah...that was me. It was so good but it was so much food. We all know burgers and fries/tater tots don't reheat well at all so I knew even though I was taking leftovers it wouldn't get eaten. So sad... At least my boyfriend ate all of his. Service was great too! Drinks always stayed filled, food came out at a normal time frame and the staff was very friendly. Overall this was fantastic experience and we'll definitely be making our back here soon with some friends. So should you go here? Yes. Should you come hungry? Yes. Should you expect to feel like an overstuffed thanksgiving turkey ready to bust? Yes. Will you love it? Absolutely.

My husband took me here for Mother's Day lunch. I have to say we almost left because of how it looked but stayed because of the reviews and DO NOT regret it at all. This place has the BEST burger I have ever tried. We had the chili fries, the chips and dip(don't remember the name), the chili cheese fries and the PBJ & bacon burger and OMG everything was perfect! I totally recommend this place!
Amazing!!! Burgers were awesome! Tater tots were awesome! Blood Mary was spicy. Love this place!

Burgers were amazing, service was fantastic, atmosphere was laid back - I honestly couldn't ask for more.

We were seated the moment we walked in the door and our waiter (oh I wish I got his name!) gave us the rundown of the menu since it was our first time there. Crowd favorite: PB & J, his personal favorite: spicy mac n cheese. I love that he offered up his recommendations so of course, I went for the spicy mac n cheese, with sweet potato tots and say what, it comes with a fancy sauce too? I couldn't decide for the life of me, so he offered to give me three different sauces, which was greatly appreciated. The hubby got the bigger beefstro and fries and I believe, chipotle ranch.

Both burgers were phenomenal, cooked to a juicy medium. Not to be biased, I preferred my spicy mac n cheese. Let's be realistic here, this burger is overflowing with mac n cheese and unless you're some sort of burger magician (what am I saying) you're not going to get any mac n cheese on that burger. So dig in with that fork and eat up all that mac n cheese. It was so cheesy, and this is an understatement, but I am a fan of cheese, so this was right up my alley. I was really hungry going in, and as much as I wanted to wolf down my burger, I had to stop myself and just savor each bite. It was that good.

I'm just going to stop myself there, I'm getting too hungry thinking about it to continue. But a word of advice: Get yourself that spicy mac n cheese burger, and no sharing!
Great food very juicy burgers everyone just loved them and can't wait to come back for more

Worst customer service experience. The hostess needs to be trained or replaced. Walked in and there was no hostess, waited 5 minutes and an employee came over took our name for first available seating. 20 minutes later and several groups seated (some that arrived after us) were seated. The hostess came out and asked who wrote our name down and I described the employee and she told me since she didn't write the name we had to go to the bottom of the list. That's poor customer service.

Great place for a fabulous burger and a beer. We had a salad and the Hawaiian Burger and left very satisfied! There are many options on the menu especially in the burger category, allowing you two sizes of meat patties and three choices of buns Loved our server, sorry I didn't get her name, who was very attentive! Great decor and atmosphere as well!

One of my favorite places for a burger. So many choices, and all are awesome. The fries and onion rings are fantastic. They offer a large variety of sauces for them. I recommend asking for a little of each until you narrow down your favs. 

The service is always good and I love the fun beachy decor too.

We have been here twice and both times had really good food and decent service.  It is a small place but never has felt closed in.  When the weather permits they open the front doors to the patio to give it an open feel.  I really like the decor also.  We will be back again!

Am amazing mix of flavors, that are delicious. My server suggested the PB&J burger which I was not interested in. She let me know it was their most popular and her favorite. I did ask what I HAD to have there and that was the top dog. 

PB&J burger sounds gross to me but I forged ahead and damn glad I did. The sweet with the kick of the Siracha was totally on point. I was totally blown away and stunned that I liked it.

I also had the Mac n cheese burger that was phenomenal. The server said "you might look weird eating two burgers!" She also didn't think I could do it. I finished the burgers in principle and was full for two days!!!
The fries are great the tots are delicious and the soda cup size is large and appropriate. I also liked the Jimmy Buffet feel to the place really chill and welcoming.

This place has enough reviews but I had to put my two cents in, it is a fantastic burger spot!!!

The decor is like your at the beach reminded me a lot of a beachfront So Cal location!  I love it!  Took the dare and tried the peanut butter jelly and bacon burger!  It sounds weird but once you taste it, it's freaking amazing!  One of the people with us had the hatch burger, I found it to be a little plain.  I sampled the porkster burger as well and I have to say fan freaking tastic!  The pig wings make a super tasty appetizer too!! Def will be making this my new burger hangout....sorry zenburger

very nice service, friendly people, fast delivery to the table and very good food; the only thing keeping it from a 5 star is the price...a little high for a burger place and very small so during busy nights it would be tough to get in.

Super fun atmosphere! We chose inside dining and had a group of six. We ordered a couple of appetizers - onion rings and the chicken verde dip (don't remember exactly what it was called) and both were good. Everyone had burgers and all were great. Portion sizes are BIG. We went at happy hour so had drinks as well. It's a college town and it's a bar so it was loud. We didn't find it an issue and enjoyed our meal and company.

Great burgers and cool environment.... Love the stuff all over th place. Super beachy.  The staff and very eager to help and make sure the dining experience is on par. 
Nice large portions , so left overs for next day. 
Had Hatch burger, patty melt, cheese fries and beer. Really great place, our first time here and we will be back.

Awesome food and the best service I have ever had in any restaurant. Make sure you ask for Robin...she is the role model for anyone in the service business! We'll be back but only if Robin is here. Thank you Robin!

We saw the restaurant reviewed on "Check Please" a local program on places to dine and looked interesting.  The place is fun, indoor and outdoor seating with a large inside bar,  and right on the edge of Old Town in Scottsdale so easy to walk.  There was parking across the street as only two cars can park in front of the restaurant.  The food was outstanding!  The PBJ hamburger was my husband's favorite of all he's tried, a friend had the Philly burger, salads were fresh and every bite was eaten.  The sweet potato nuggets are baked and exceptional!  We saw the mac n' cheese burger on the TV review and it was being ordered by several people - if you like mac n' cheese, one to try.  Lots to choose, wings, salads, etc.  Add to your list of "must try!"

Seriously you can't go wrong with anything here.. but the fish tacos and sweet potatoes tots are the bomb! Ask for marshmallow fluff with your tots and prepare for heaven. 

Wait staff is always extremely friendly, too.
I love Rehab! Their food and drinks are always delicious! The service is always great too! They have happy hour all day on Thursdays

Great Place, lively atmosphere. I had the mushroom swiss and my date had the healthier turkey burger and salad. Our waitress Cheryl was wonderful and brought us alll the diff sauces to try...my sweet potato tots were delicious with all the diff aoili's and I snuck a taste of the pomegranite vinegarette my date had which was very tasty too.  Hurry and get to Rehab burger to try their delicious menu. Patio misters going full blast if you like to sit outside.
Food was delicious, service was quick and friendly. Everyone seemed happy and satisfied. Will definitely be back!

The food is usually good here but should not take a whole hour for a burger. When I mentioned how long it took the server pretty much ignored the comment as she kept walking away. The restaurant was pretty empty which added to the frustration. Luckily lots of other choices in the area

I have probably been here 10 times, and every single time I have had a great burger. Their regular bugers are great, but I love how there is a different "specialty" burger every weekend. They come up with some amazing stuff. The icing on the cake is their sweet potato tots!.... I am a big guy and I can't finish their smaller bugers size. Great portions at a very reasonable price.

This place is great
You have to try the pig wings they are amazing.
The ghost pepper burger was great they actually cooked it the way I asked portions are huge they are not cheap at all
Overall a great location great Ottmus fear great people the service was good I would be definitely coming back and I would highly recommend
Burger was so good and huge. Also got a salad which was massive. Salad was average. Great burgers fun vibes.
Hair in my fries...and the burger was just okay. I've been here a few times and enjoyed it but now I think I'm going to pass. Not a fan.

I've been here a handful of times. I LOVE the sweet potato tots. I always get a burger with swiss cheese and blue cheese with some sauce. I've never been disappointed, they are so delicious and I TOTALLY recommend. This is my favorite place to get a burger in the valley

I really love the service at this local spot. I pop in for lunch and they are fast and friendly. The burgers are amazing. I suggest trying the hangover burger with the fried egg and the poblano pepper. Even the smaller burger is huge. I love the assortment of buns and the spicy ketchup. They have a nice relaxed atmosphere where you will want to stay a while and relax. The decor looks like it belongs on a beach and the people are fantastic. It is always clean and food arrives quickly.

Based off of Yelp, we decided to come here. We were not disappointed:

Pros:
(+) Were seated right away by a friendly hostess
(+) Our waitress was very friendly and attentive
(+) Had some kind of peach beer that was absolutely delicious
(+) My boyfriend and I both had the porkster. He added egg and bacon on it. Both on the white bun. (I really wanted the add-ons but was trying to make it at least a little healthier, lol). Half pulled pork half beef, with a super yummy bbq sauce and cheddar cheese. mmmm so good. Absolutely no complaints.
(+) The sweet potato tater tots were amazing! I could eat those all day. And I chose the spicier of the sauces, super yummy
(+) Cool funky decor, nice atmosphere

Neutral:
( ) The Pig Wings (Pork on a stick doused with peachy bbq sauce) - it was just okay. The sauce was a bit too much (completely doused, the menu description wasn't lying). The pork was tender, but I wasn't blown away.

This place was delicious. Top two burger places on my list (first is Holsteins in Las Vegas if you would like to read my review).  I would definitely come here again when I'm in the area, and looking forward to it!

Kinda layer back, beach vibes place.  The food is good but my only complaint is that it can get very loud in there and is the summer time people come in to wait to be seated and they leave the front door wide open.  Like come on, totally not fair.  The staff should at least say something when the door stays open for a long time a nothing but hot air gets in.  The food is good and I guess it could be worth the hot air blowing in as long as u have a car parked outside with cold air conditioner when you leave.

We ate here and loved it, I actually had the grilled chicken sandwich and it was awesome, everything fresh and yummy, my brother had an appetizer which was also very good , the server was on point which made everything perfect!!
Loved it here! Our server was very friendly and it was my first time there and didn't know they closed at 10pm and he offered us water to go after a few cocktails.

This place has such a fun atmosphere and great food! Their pig wings are amazing and I have never been disappointed with any burger that I've ever ordered. If you want to escape the desert for a little, come by and grab a burger at this little beach shack!

OMG. Do yourself a favor and go here when you need rehab or just want a relapse. 

I shared an order of chips and salsa, as they gave us a check in offer. The chips were hefty (thick goodness) and the salsa tasty. I made a comment at the time we were eating these that they were almost like pita chips. 

Then my Hawaiian burger arrived. I had ordered the pretzel bun on the recommendation of our waitress (who was very helpful and attentive), and then I worried about it until the moment that I took my first bite. Wow. The blend of flavors of the Hawaiian with the pretzel bun was perfect, and those sweet potato tots were addictive!

The place was packed on a Thursday evening; maybe having happy hour all day long on Thursday had something to do with it, but my guess is the tasty food brings people here. The decor on the walls and ceiling gives the place a real beachy Ron Jon feel. I'm not a big fan of the high chairs and table arrangement, but there are "normal" tables and chairs here too; we just ended up with the high ones. Big patio outside and plenty of space inside.

I didn't see a lot of parking spaces other than a few right in front. Most people were parking on the street, and the line stretched down a few blocks.

Went on a golf trip and found the best burgers ever!!!   Had the Mushrrom Swiss on a pretzel bun.   The burger was disgustingly great. The fries were fantastic and are waitress was funny and fast.  I will be back twice next year!!!       Oh, and our waitress recommended the PB&J and I thought she was just being cute, but lots of people(locals) around us were ordering it and I think I must have it.

5 Star for scene...fun great vibe...it's like a beach bar.
5 Star for Staff...friendly, helpful and accommodating.
4 Star for the food.
I had the bacon cheese burger and Buffalo Wings.  Cheese burger was cooked medium and was fairly large if you order the 10 ounce.  It was served with these amazing sweet potato tater tots and plenty of them that are worth going there alone for.  They are light and not greasy.  My Brioche bun was a nice compliment to the burger nice and fresh.
Wings were  fine but I would say stick to the burger...AKA  why it's called Rehab Burger Therapy...it's a burger place.  Don't forget the margarita...high quality!  Check out the place if you are looking for a fun spot and be beach like spot.

Why does this place not have a/c? We were sweating like crazy in this joint. It was PACKED and I think it's because it's one of those places people want to love. 

Gotta say, however, I wasn't impressed. I see a lot of "burger snobs" in the reviews. Hmm... I love burgers, it's my favorite food, but I wasn't impressed. The kitchen also messed up our orders and the waitress did, too. She did try to correct it however, so I'm not complaining too much. 

The food was good, the atmosphere is very college-sports-bar place, just like everything else in the area, but as far as a hands down fantastic burger? Hmm... I'll say it's 4-stars, but not 5.

My bestie and I live in the neighborhood and frequented this bar before it was burger therapy. We love it the new way! We don't eat meat but they were super accommodating! They have happy hr until 6! The menu is diverse (except the salads) and is reasonably priced! I got the tuna salad sandwich and she got the veggie burger, both were amazing, and the server brought us some of their amazing sauces to try!

Service was a bit slow considering it wasn't very busy when we were there but our waitress was very friendly and helpful, giving us insights into what we might like. I ordered chicken wings and they were fantastic! Drinks were excellent. My sister had a burger, which she thought was good. I will definitely come back to try something new!

My boyfriend  and I checked this place out for the first time today. We ordered the Pig Wings- GREAT DECISION! I would come back just for those alone! Most of the places we check out have happy hour that ends at four, but we were pleasantly surprised theirs was until six. The staff was friendly, the food was great. Definitely ask for the pretzel bun, they are delicious.
I love when a burger joint can live up to just a simple burger... There is so much more for me to try but let's just say they have tots. Tater tots.

This is the best burger I've ever had. I had the porkster burger and a Mexican beer. The beer was cold. And the burger was fabulous. Highly recommend. Enjoy. Also, my step father had a salad. It was also amazing. Highly recommend. Enjoy.
Solid food with trendy vibe.  Great burger, average fries and good people watching in a convenient location.

We were celebrating a friends birthday tonight so I thought I would honor his aging with a little child like ordering of my own. I had the PB&J Bacon Burger. It is exactly what it sounds like: creamy peanut butter and grape jelly melting over a juicy beef patty with hearty bacon slices. There is also a little sirano chili in the mix to further confuse your taste buds. It was served with sweet potato tots and a pineapple dipping sauce. I washed it down with a Corona Rita. I probably won't do this one again, because there are so many other great burgers on the menu I want to try next but if you are a little brave and very hungry, give this one a go. It will make you feel like a kid again.

Visiting Phoenix for a Cardinals game and my husband found this place on YELP!  When we drove by it looked a bit sketchy and I was a bit leery to go inside.  I checked out the pics on YELP and boy was I glad I did!  The burgers are fabulous!  The place is small but the atmosphere was fun and the food did not disappoint!  I would definitely make Rehab Burger a go to spot when we are back in town!
Gold Medal Wings!  I know it's Rehab BURGER but if you haven't tried the wings you are missing out!  The sauce is simply amazing melt in your mouth delicious. The best wings in AZ
I loved  this place. It was amazing the food was fabulous and Michelle is the best   First time there will most definitely be back the bloody Mary was wonderful

Escaping the cold weather in the North East , my wife and I saw great reviews for Rehab Burger and decided we would stop there for some lunch. Who doesn't love a great burger? It is very cool looking almost to the point where it reminded me of a Senior Frogs. It seems they spent more money turning the place into a tourist trap and forgot they were supposed to be selling a top notch burger. But that's ok - after eating the dried out patty - I went back by the pool which was the real reason I was in Arizona.
A must try & unique menu offerings. Portions are huge & we couldn't finish our meals but everything we ordered was delicious.
Excellent service and the burgers are some of the best in the valley, outdoor patio with the party vibe makes rehab the perfect place to go for food or fun with friends

Wow. So many choices here. I ended having the jalapeño popper burger, very good. Hubby had fish tacos, huge and couldn't finish. 
The caramel shake was delicious. I had onion rings, average.

Located off Mill Avenue this burger joint brings in a fun crowd .. outside patio seating has the much needed misters or plenty of indoor seating .. 

We were invited to a private taco party and I am so happy we made it .. our group shared fish, chicken & pork tacos (only the fish tacos are on the menu), huge guacamole, salsa & pico de gallo.. we ate family style .. 

The battered cod fish tacos were my favorite .. served with cabbage & a sprinkle of cotija cheese, tomato, cilantro and salsa.. squeeze of lime .. yum

Summer drink specials were very good.. the strawberry crush with jack Daniels was my fav..

Servers took excellent care of our group.. looking forward to our next visit... thanks again for allowing us to celebrate at your spot!!
Did not disappoint at all best onion rings I have ever had in my life, burger was excellent love this place would highly recommend

Yay we have ReHab Burger in the Central Phoenix Corridor! ( it moved into where The Garage used to be). 
So happy to see it open. Popped in today. 
Wish I was drinking today because Happy Hour All Day Thursday from 11- closing. 
Alas I had to stay awake today. 
Greeted by several employees with a cheery welcome! Seated promptly and ordered some cokes. 
Inside is fun.... less cramped than the one in Scottsdale. I really like it!! 
Ordered the Hangover Burger for Husband... 10oz and I got the Mushroom/Swiss. 5 oz! 
Sweet potato tots and onion rings. 
Everything came out perfect. Hot and fresh. The lettuce/tomato/red onion were crispy!  Nice touch! 
Can't wait to come back!!

Well, the reviews dont lie! This place is the shit.
I had to go all out and get 2 meat patties. The burger was as big as my head. Not only that but ooooh so good! The fries were on point as well as the ranch! I admire this place. The staff are extremely friendly and so nice. The burger comes with shredded letuce which ive always loved on a burger and the cheese is soo good it looks like it would belong on those grilled cheese commercials where they pull it apart and you can see the cheese just pull but not break. Ughh this place has my heart. This is soo not a good thing for me. 
The chips and salsa were good too!
Ill be back!

Delicious, fun and unbelievably perfect margaritas. Our waitress made every detail great. We had four kids with us, and some of the food was a little spicy for them -helped figure out a solution on the fly so they were filled up and we didn't buy four additional meals. Quick tip...call ahead for large parties. We had our table waiting for us upon arrival.
This place is magic!! Try the pb&j hamburger!! I was very scared at first but it was really good. I wanted to order 10 more!! The service was great and the pawn shop next door was fun too!
Excellent burger. If you are gluten free be aware that the sweet potato tots might be coated.  Would return.
Best burger joint in Scottsdale!!! Food is always great and staff is always friendly!!! Definitely a must when deciding on places to go!!!
Burgers are pretty good!! Very unique and tasty but huge!! Been here a few times it's a good place to go for some comfort food.
Service was great.  The food was amazing. We had the spicy Mac n cheese and the hatch chili.  Both excellent!  Sweet potato tots are really good.

Grabbed dinner here and was not disappointed. Our server was very pleasant and personable with just the right amount of check-ins with us. He seemed to really enjoy his job which was something nice to see in the service industry.
I was torn between trying the PB&J Burger, the Poblano or the hatch chili burger. 
PB&J was out because that only came in rehab size & I wasn't that hungry. (The rehab is a pretty large burger, so either come hungry, share with others in your party or plan on bringing leftovers home.) Our server recommended the poblano and I was NOT disappointed...it was done perfectly and very flavorful. The sweet potato tots were tasty and came with a selection of dipping sauces.
This place is worth return visits.
FWIW, we went on a Friday night and when we stepped inside to check in the ambient noise was pretty high. We ended up getting a table outside which seemed to have a much lower noise level.

Only bad think I can mention about this place is the single bathroom. One for Men/Women and one for Women so if you have to go on a busy Friday night, you'll need to get in line. But not a big deal. 
Service was quick and friendly. Burgers are great. Big and juicy with your choice of different buns. The fires are good and plentiful. My wife like the sweet potato tots. 
Get there early on the weekend as there is usually a line but it moves quick. Been here 8+  times and never disappointed. I like the McNarley burger. Be prepared, the Rehab burger is two patties, hugh and messy. Ask for extra napkins.

This place is great! The food was delicious, and the service spectacular.  We came here for lunch and sat out on the patio. About 10 minutes in, a Roto-Rooter truck unexpectedly pulled up next to the restaurant and began doing its thing - think loud noise and terrible smell. The staff of Rehab quickly moved everyone inside and shut the doors to keep the offending noise and smells out. They were apologetic (even though it wasn't their fault) and the rapid response to an unanticipated interruption during the prime lunch hour was impressive.  Food came out and was amazing. I'll be back next time I'm in Scottsdale.

This place is soooo good. I love the burgers, they are awesome. The menu has a wide variety, and I have tried a few other things, and they too were delicious. Happy hour is also great. Love the place, the atmosphere and the help have always been great.
Great food and amazing service, had the Philly cheese burger; it was really good. Great atmosphere, definitely a must try!

Fantastic burgers and really tasty tots and fries! Tried the spicy mac n cheese and the ghost burger, both were really delicious. The mac n cheese on the mac n cheese burger could have gotten serious props on its on, but being on a burger just elevated its creamy, cheesy flavor even more. Ask for the diablo hot sauce to try on the ghost burger (SO FREAKIN GOOD). 

The fries and sweet potato tots were also super yummy. Great potato-y flavor in both, and they went really well with the huge variety of sauces the waiter brought for dipping. Speaking of the waiter, the service was also very good, with the manner being a little casual and brusque, but everything we ordered and subsequent requests were treated graciously, and brought out very quickly. He also took the down to sit down (casual manner I was talking about), and explain which were the best and most popular burgers. He said the PBJ bacon burger is the most popular, but my friend thought it sounded gross so we didn't order it since we had decided to split them. 

We got the smaller (relapse) size on both, and they were more than big enough, especially given the VERY generous portions of mac n cheese on the spicy mac burger and guac on the ghost. 

Overall, a very well-rounded establishment with very good food. If you are a burger lover, you'll love this place, and it's easy to see why it was voted best burger in AZ last year. It was even most recently featured on the travel channel (last Sunday I believe). 

PS Get the burgers on the pretzel bun!!

Came in for the first time today. Oh my god. I had a salad. A Ceasar salad. And it solved all of my problems. The coronarita took me back to heaven where I met the gods of all things beautiful. And the gods brought peanut butter a jelly bacon burger and I said ohmygod god thank you this is so freaking good. I think that the peanut butter and jelly burger could stop somebody from committing suicide. I think it could turn Ganondorf from demon to saint. I think I might come here for dinner for the rest of my life. I'm so passionate about this place now idek.

Screw engineering. I want a degree in rehab burger therapy.

Awesome funky laid back surfs up dude vibe.. I opted for the classic grilled cheese ( crazy right ?) , I know I was in a burger joint but I also know if anyone can make a mean grilled cheese it's a place like this. Pair it with some jumbo onion rings and a crisp dill pickle chased with a local cold draft beer and I'm in heaven

Awesome place for burgers in Tempe!

I've been to the Rehab burger in Scottsdale, and this one in Tempe does not disappoint as well! In fact, it's a lot more spacious than the original.

We ordered a couple of burgers and I also got the signature spicy Mac n cheese! Everything was phenomenal!!!! The service was great!

If there is one thing I urge you to try it's the spicy Mac and cheese. The flavor of it is amazing, and it's actually not that spicy! I would highly recommend going here again! 

Tips:
1) get the sweet potato tater tots, they're the best! 
2) parking here is scarce since it's on Mill, you may need to find a spot anywhere and just walk here
3) get the spicy Mac n cheese, it's sooo good! If you get the "rehab" size, it's definitely easily shared with 5-6 people

Holy Smokes!!!!! These are some BIG burgers!!!! 

We came into rehab burger excited to try these CRAZY looking burgers based off the pictures we keep seeing on yelp and Facebook, and we were not disappointed! 

The Scottsdale location gives an island vibe to the restaurant and was packed even when it was on a Sunday night. We waited for around 30 minutes but this place was definitely worth the wait. 

I came in hungry and I ordered a bbq pulled pork burger win sweet potato tater tots!  I also ordered some spicy Mac n cheese! The burger was HUGE and it was also super tasty! Be ready to make a mess cause you will definitely NOT be able to fit the whole burger in your mouth when you bite into it.  The sweet potato tater tots are soooo good too! They are SOOO much better than getting regular fries that I need to get this every time I come here! 

The spicy Mac n Cheese was also sooo delicious! I know you are probably gonna come in here craving a burger, but if you're with a lot of friends, order the Mac n cheese cause it's sooo good! 

Overall this place is awesome for some big freakin burgers that taste great! I'm so excited to try the one in Tempe now! 

Tips:
Come hungry, cause these are are HUGE burgers
Get sweet potato tater tots, they're the best side you can get with your burger
If you have some friends with you, try the Spicy Mac n cheese, it's sooo good too! 
Be expected to wait if you come for dinner, it's pretty packed in there

I went here for a solo lunch, sat at the bar and had a great time. I ordered the Cobb salad (my typical favorite) and it was huge and awesome. It's one of those salads that gets piled so high you have to really be careful when you first start eating it or it will end up over your table--and that's a good thing if you ask me.

I also ordered the mac & cheese, and if you like mac & cheese with a kick I would highly recommend ordering it. Even the smaller size is pretty large so it's good for sharing. I ended up taking at least half of my meal home which was great for lunch the next day.

When I'm back in town this is definitely on my must visit list!

Losing a bar that has become such a big part of your life is hard to swallow. 5 seasons of 49ers football on Sunday, rehearsal dinner for our wedding, countless date nights & happy hours... The Garage was a home away from home. I say this only because it leads up to the understanding that, so far, Rehab Burger Therapy has done a incredible job moving into the neighborhood. The staff is outstanding, food is on point & the adult beverages never go wrong. If you were a garage regular, I 100% encourage you to come in. You might just see some familiar faces. If you're apart of this great neighborhood, rehab will be a home away from home. I'll definitely be busy on the Your Phix In Phx Instagram posting plenty of pics.

Unique flavors that wow the taste buds.  Peanut butter and jelly burger?  Sounds weird but it works so well.  Every burger I have tried is amazing.  

Meat and ingredients are top notch.  Ambiance is casual, service is friendly and efficient. 

During busy spring season line is out the door for good reason.  I'm a local so I get to go when it's not so busy.  I almost always recommend this place to friends coming to visit.

I was craving a burger--a REAL burger--and Rehab was everything I wanted and more. It is truly rare to have one's expectations met so well!

Every menu item looks great, but I needed something spicy, so I went with the Know Poblano burger, with manchego cheese, actual, actually grilled poblano peppers, and sauteed onions. Because this wasn't enough spice for me, and I felt brave, I went with the beef chorizo patty. 

It was everything I wanted and more.

The chorizo itself was surprisingly lean without being dry. It was basically a burger loaded--LOADED with spice. Like, it only burned my tongue a little bit, but the whole thing was so full of seasoning that the steam would make my eyes water every time I lifted it to take a bite. That's not a complaint, that's freaking amazing. On the side were *perfect* fries seasoned with garlic salt, as well as some sriracha aioli. 

I washed it down with a large margarita, which was discounted thanks to Thursday's all-day happy hour. It was definitely not weak, and for sure not too sweet. Spectacular, just like everything else. 

If you're not into (red) meat, there are legit fish tacos (I tried a bite! They're good enough!), as well as veggie burgers. 

So there. You have no excuses to avoid this amazing, amazing restaurant. Enjoy!

Delicious as always !!! Lunch date with my husband which was nice. $34 for two!!! No alcohol, just one soda and a water. I got the turkey club but the middle bread makes it too much. I took that out right away and got a box for the other half of my sandwich. Much to large to eat. Husband got the McNarley and the bartender suggested he omit the middle piece of bread which helped. I will get that club again but on smaller bread. She said they have a marble rye which is smaller. I will go for that. Waitress was super helpful and friendly!!! We got there at 11:45 and ended up sitting at the bar to eat because it was going to be a 25 minute wait!!

Worst burger I have ever had. Asked for my burger medium, it was so burnt i tried to eat it but felt sick, and had ZERO flavor! after half of the burger it was so bad I let my friend take it for her dogs.  So food wise I would say a 0 but we did had good service (even though a little pushy) which made me give this places 3.. pretty disappointed cuz I was so excited to try a new place!
Thanks Mike A for being A1 can't wait to come back for some exotica!!!request for Mike A!!! GO CUBS GO!

Fantastic! 

I have seen and heard about this cute burger joint for a long time and finally tried it the other day. We wanted to pick up burgers and fries for the championship march madness game and this place did not disappoint! 

We had:
2 bacon cheeseburgers (one with an egg) 
Poblano burger 
2 orders of crispy fries
onion rings
wedge salad 

Every single thing was delicious! The burgers were cooked to perfection and the fries as well as the bacon on our burgers were crispy and yummy. The only reason it doesn't get 5 stars is because I didn't get the egg on my burger and the food wasn't ready when I was supposed to pick it up. 

A great place for good food and a cool atmosphere; they have themselves a new frequent customer.

If you're looking for a chill spot, this is it. Super friendly staff. They talk to you like you are one of their friends! Great food! I personally suggest the pulled pork with the pineapple teriyaki aioli. Or just some fries with that as a sauce to dip it in. They also have a really good happy hour (11am-6 or 11am-Close in Thursday's). One of the top places to be at on Mill Ave for sure.

Today I took my kids and my husband to this restaurant. I got the sweet potato tater tots they were literally the bomb! Also our server was Sam she was really kind. She did really well and it was only her third day!!!! This restaurant had some "bomb" beers. Also if you are a vegetarian they have great salads. The burgers were normal size and good tasting. #bomb.com!!!!! Hahaha tell your family and friends!!!

Outstanding burgers, I had the backyard BBQ, the others in my group had the Swiss & mushroom, bacon cheeseburger, and hatch chili burger. We all agreed best burgers we've ever had. Fries were fresh, the sweet potato  tater tots are good, the onion rings were excellent. The staff was attentive and friendly, the owner popped over to check on us. Overall a very we'll run burger joint with excellent food. I will definitely visit again.

I had the mushroom swiss burger and my husband had the turkey burger. He absolutely loved his! Mine was good but the fries were not hot. Not the biggest deal breaker. They were super busy and our server was awesome! But I'm sure it's hard to get everything out hot when under super busy conditions.

Great service! They seated our party of 8 with care. Took our toddler's order first. Great service! We ordered a different burger and all were great. Hit of the table was the PBJ, which was delicious. I have no idea why it works... But it does. Order with tots and Chipotle sauce and you won't be disappointed! Only downside was the crowd noise. You literally cannot hear what the people on the other side of the table are saying. Probably best for younger crowds as we had varied generations with us. Overall great food and good service.

Would have liked to try it today. Was meeting a friend for lunch. The reviews didn't say anything about paid parking. We already parked the car in the underground garage when we read the sign that said that they closed on Mondays. Darn it. So we went to the taco place next door which was great but a little expensive
Good burgers, but super greasy! The French fries were alright but nothing too great. Good customer service though
Amazing burgers! Highly recommend the Hangover burger with the chorizo patty! Very very good place!

Terrible take out experience - we did NOT get what we ordered the barbecue burger got home with a basic burger with cheese (take out order) and soggy beyond belief fries that I am trying to reconstitute in our toaster oven. Will not go back not worth it!

Great burgers ! Way to much to even finish solo. We recommend maybe sharing a burger and fries. Chili  cheese  fries  are out of this world. This is definitely a spot you got to try while in Scottsdale

Really awesome burgers! The atmosphere was kind of hawaiian barish.  The staff are really nice and attentive.  We got the pb&j burger and I really forgot the second one.. he said it was like a big mac.  

Pb&j- SO good, gotta say it has super umami flavoring.  Has to be the peanut butter and shiracha.  A warning though it can get overwhelming so I would share this. 

Big mac?-  Nothing special just a burger with lots of toppings and overwhelming sauce.  So I guess not knowing the name of it isn't that bad.  

It can get crowded so I'd come early if you dont want to wait.  I remember these people right behind me and up in my personal bubble.. felt so weird. But I guess the awesome burger made up for it
Great burgers and fries, also surprisingly good fish tacos. Cocktails a bit overpriced for size and strength. Service was very friendly. Music is too loud, sit outside of you can!

Came in for my sons Birthday on April 19th. It was a Wednesday & this place was "packed" we had about a 40 minute wait. 
Nevin was are server. Great customer service. It was our first time in and he explained the "run down " of how this place operates! Either you're gonna Relapse or Rehab! 
Had the wings, offer a few different flavors and options, they were good! 
Outstanding burgers, the best order in our party was the Hangover & BBQ burger. Suggest ordering your patty medium! I also suggest- getting the onion rings, a little more costly, but well worth it! 
The atmosphere here is really cool, kinda a beach style scene! 
Only downside: an extremely long wait after placing our burger order. However , do to the service we received & how often our server check in with us, we'll let that slide! Also, I wasn't to impressed with my Gnarly Burger. It was sorta plain, nothing special  & just average tasting. When we come again I'll try another burger they offer as they have many different options.
Simply amazing the pbj burger is by far the best I have ever had. Parking is simple. Service is good. The place is pretty busy with a small wait but the burgers do not disappoint.

I'll go ahead and add my 5 stars and spare you the 2 cents - other than to say the food here is fantastic, the place is clean, the staff is nice, the decor is cool, the location is awesome, and they had jawbreakers in the candy basket on the way out. 

Definitely go here and eat.
Love this place.  Unpretentious, delicious and affordable.  Some of the best burgers in the Valley.  Ask about their secret menu!

First night in Scottsdale and tried Rehab Burger on a whim.  Couldn't have picked a better place!!  Both my hubby and I thoroughly enjoyed our burgers - he had a Philly Burger and I had a turkey burger.  Both were bigger than we could eat!!  Service was excellent.  We are outside and they even had the warmers on to keep us toasty.  This will not be our last visit while we're here!!
Good burgers and decent service.  If try it again to check it out.  Good assortment of burgers.  Good quality food

This place was so good. I had the pbj bacon burger and it was mind blowing hands down the best burger I have ever tasted. There located in the heart of downtown Scottsdale but there prices for the amount and quality of food you get for under$10 I feel like I was ripping them off. I know it sounds weird but if you want to step outside the box and try there most popular burger you have to try the pbj burger.

Awesome burgers and fries! The wait staff were efficient and super friendly. They have everything from a regular cheeseburger to a peanut butter and jelly burger. NIce patio to sit outside with mist blowing  to keep you cool in the heat.

I've always wanted to try this burger joint and my kids wanted to too. So we came here on a Saturday night. I figured it's a burger joint and Yelp says no reservations which makes sense. It's just a burger. My son got here a little earlier than us and tried to get a table inside but found out you have to make a reservation to sit inside. So he got us a table outside. 

Outside is not that big with about five tables and chairs on the railing too. Almost all is high top tables. They had the misters and small fans for the heat in the afternoon. I think they turn those off around 6pm. All I know is the outside cause I never made it inside. First time this has ever happened to me. 

I ordered the Spicy Mac n Cheese rehab burger. There are so many options. Rehab 10oz. Relapse 5oz. How it's cooked, bun, and potatoes you want. So I got a pretzel bun with sweet potatoes tots. Man was this good but really filling. Thick and juicy 10oz burger cooked perfectly with huge serving of Mac and cheese falling off the burger. Mac n cheese had bacon bits and it really wasn't that spicy at all. I was barely able to finish it all. Tots were good and love the different selections of dipping sauces they have. Really good. Really filling. 

My wife and mom got the Hawaiian burger. Had pineapple and ham between the burger. My daughter got the Hatch. Everyone enjoyed the burger but no one could finish their burger but me and my son. Oh well. 

The service was great. She brought out our water cups and drinks right away. Kept tabs on us and our food came out pretty quickly. Can't complain about that. 

It was pretty fun eating outside. Nice breeze to keep it cool and watching the traffic go by was pretty interesting especially those traveling bars where you have to pedal while drinking. 

So great burgers. Filling. Fresh and don't forget lots of options to make your burger special. Service was great and if you like the outdoors it's great. Otherwise I suggest you make a reservation to get inside. Oh yea there is free public parking just steps from the place so you don't have to worry about where to park especially in Old Town Scottsdale. 

Enjoyed it a lot and will most definitely be back.

Great service but we were unhappy that the burgers did not live up to the Yelp hype.  They were dry and dense, you could tell they took the meat and used a machine to compress it into shape rather than hand forming the patties. Also practically had a whole head of lettuce on my burger. Beer choices were pretty pathetic and dominated by the big brands while ignoring local craft beers (sorry Four Peaks does not qualify as craft anymore since they are owned by Budweiser.)

I really like this place. So many good burgers to choose from. The PB &J burger is something everyone should try. You won't be disappointed! For a burger place I really have to recommend the pasta too. Amazing. The mac and cheese is so yummy. Their appetizers are good as well. I haven't had anything I didn't like. As a side try the Jamaican corn, wow. When in Scottsdale this is a must.  Their brownies are amazing. Such a fun laid back atmosphere that everyone can enjoy. Great food, great drinks, great service! Wish we had one in Tucson!

I'm new in town and was looking for a good place to eat so I decided to try this place out. It was actually really good! I god the Hawaiian burger which had ham on it so it was different than any other Hawaiian burger I've ever had. I went for the smaller sized party and was still stuffed. The sauce was also delicious and our waitress was super nice. I would definitely go back.

Best Burgers in town. They are HUGE!!  they have some funky options but all are good. The pretzel buns are great. Fun atmosphere, great service and awesome food.
Try it out you will be back!

Also das war ja mal ne Überraschung, die ich ohne Yelp nie gefunden hätte. Von außen echt eigenartig, wollten erst garnicht rein. Aber drinnen wie die Tardis. Irgendwie größer, als gedacht und voller Leben.

Die Bedienung war amerikanisch typisch äußerst aufmerksam, zack schon hätte man die großen Becher Gratiswasser. Burger gibt's ohne Ende - wer nix findet macht sich einfach selber einen. Zudem kann man sich auch die Buns noch aussuchen + Bratgrad + Beilagen. Probiert die Süßkartoffel Tots, der Dip ist zum Reinlegen.

Die Burger gehören zu mit dem Besten, was ich bisher zwischen zwei Brötchenhälften genießen durfte. Am Ende kam die Rechnung, 25 $ für zwei Personen. Da fällt Dir nix mehr ein. So wenig zählt man hier bei keinem Fastfood-Kettenladen.

Wer Burger mag und hier vorbeikommt - absolutes Pflichtprogramm!

Awesome find. Loved all the choices, loved that you could get large and small portions. Great service, great atmosphere, great prices, great food. Oh we didn't mention the awesome draft beer choices and prices! We'd be regulars if we lived here. This is what yelp is all about... thank you Yelpers for helping us find this place!
This place is a gem in the southwest...We Buffalo people know food and this place rocks...I would suggest the pbj burger...phenomenal... just saying
Jon the bar tender gives amazing service!! The food here is off the hook! Highly recommend this place!

I went out with some friends and most of us had burgers, but all of us had fun!
Even though the night we went there was a big group of people having fun too and it was a little loud at times, we were still taken care of. I saw all ages there.

Burgers are GOOD and could SHARE, but why would you want to??

David our server was absolutely great, especially for us newbies to Rehab.
I had the BBQ burger with wheat bun, another had the Mushroom with pretzel bun. The "outlier" had fish tacos, which to them were just okay. 
I prefer the wheat and it was great but I did try the pretzel bun and it was good.  Everyone LOVED LOVED LOVED the sweet potato tater tots!!! I was quite full after eating just the burger.

One tip I have to share is there are 2 types of burges, the regular sized rehab and the smaller "relapse". The bun comes in one size (the big rehab size) so the relapse can look kinda odd being small on a huge bun.

Parking is, I agree, kinda weird, but you still gotta go here!

All in all, the burgers, atmosphere and busy yet attentive waitstaff are worth it. I would definitely go back!
Tried the spicy Mac and cheese relapse burger. It's like a side and sandwich in one! Very good, not too spicy. Skip the onion rings. Should have tried the sweet potato tots.

Where to start? The food is absolutely incredible. Pig wings and calamari are my faves from the ap menu. Chili is the name of the game of the burgers whether its the chili cheese burger, poblano, or hatch you can't go wrong. Fish tacos (not on the menu) are huge and tasty! Milkshakes (virgin or not) will hit that sweet spot.

What really separates this place from any other spot around town is the level of service. Ownership roams the floor greeting and conversing with customers. Nothing fake about it either. Wait staff is highly personable and the bartenders are friendly, knowledgeable and quick with a suggestion.

If you haven't checked out Rehab Burger Therapy yet, you are missing out!

Burgers are creative and big! Came with a large group and the service was great. Really enjoyed the music they played and overall it was a nice restaurant. 

I can't say that I'd come back just because the burgers didn't have great flavor. I got to try at least 4 off the menu as well and in this case, bigger isn't always better.

THIS. PLACE. GETS IT!

Awesome start to finish. It's so great to find a place that appreciates their customers. 

Success in the restaurant business is tricky. You don't buy food, cook it, serve it, get paid and go out partying........ Sadly...that is the attitude at 7 out of 10 places, regardless of city/state....

Rehab Burgers is wonderful. Starting with the extremely friendly hostesses, the exceptionally friendly waitstaff, the amazing bartenders, and the whole time, the owners ARE ACTUALLY THERE, asking if everything is ok?

What a concept! Are you listening Scottsdale restaurant groups? (you know who you are)............So many places serve cheap food with an attitude, and get crowded for  happy hour 2-for-1 well drinks, and the doosh DJ playing loud house music from his jump-drive, wooo freaking hooo.......yes I am over 25....

Ok, anyway, went for Sunday afternoon Burger Rehab. Cold beer, reasonably priced, fresh burger, cooked the way i asked, fresh bun, amazing sweet potato tots, and homemade spicy ketchup (are you kidding me?)

The most important thing ............... staff... Exceeded expectations...

The food is great and reasonable. The staff is exceptional...
THAT IS WHAT BRINGS PEOPLE BACK......Best, Duke .........

Love this place. Been here twice-once for lunch, once for dinner. The surfer/beach atmosphere sets a great mood. Love the reggae music! Staff has never let us down... Friendly & Attentive. The food is just off the wall. My husband always gets the McNarly burger which is what the McDonald's Big Mac in a 5star restaurant would be. I personally am addicted to the sweet potato tots. And they let you have whatever signature sauces you want. I love this place.
Totally unimpressed, was expecting a way better burger.   Way better burgers in town than this. Nothing special

Tremendous burgers... good prices.  This may be the best burger place I've ever been to.  Not much to look at but boy is the meat fresh.  Highlight of my visit to ASU to see my son.  Wish we had one back here in Boston.

You don't need my review to know that these burgers are delicious and creative. But what I will add is the fact that they have a GF bun. It's often a great inconvenience to have to find a place that's serves anything GF. I was going to opt for lettuce wrap but glad they had an actual bun. Their sweet potato tater tots are delicious! I was really impressed overall. Highly recommend this place to try.
Some of the best burgers I've ever had! The jalapeño popper burger is my favorite, but the mac and cheese is a close second!
Awesome fish tacos coming from a gal who does not like fish!!' Burgers are fabulously gigantic! You will not leave hungry!!

The only reason this gets 2 stars is because of our server, Sarah. She made the whole experience not suck! We went for my husbands 30th birthday, only the two of us, and after we ordered appetizers and dinner as soon as we sat down, waited an hour for the wings to come out. People say after us were served their meals before the wings came out... Thank god he liked them. Another 50 minutes later dinner came out and it was cold, not even warm. They offered to remake things, Sarah was lovely, but sitting for 2.5 hours to get food is ridiculous. We agreed to have it remade, and paid for the meal. By that time neither of us were even hungry...it was our first time in, not sure if we will be back. So bummed!

Rehab Burger has the best burgers in town in my book! From your simple cheeseburger to the most outrageous combinations possible. I love the selection of different buns and made in house sauces too. Can't beat the flavor of a fresh flame grilled burger. I knocked off one star only because once we ordered the clams as an appetizer (who orders clams in a burger place,i know :/ ). The white wine base wasn't reduced well enough, so instead of a subtle sweet hint of white wine was nowhere to be found, only the taste of acidic alcohol. Just remember to stick to their killer burgers and salads too!

We had a great visit here, even with an issue with one of our meals.

We visited on a Monday night and were seated right away. Service was great. We had the salsa and chips for an appetizer, while I ordered a frozen margarita and my husband had Kiltlifter.

The problem arose with our son's order. It turned out that they were out of the bread they usually use for a peanut butter and jelly sandwich. We were given a choice of sourdough--which our server said most kids aren't crazy about--and brioche. We were hesitant, but decided to go with the brioche. It ended up just being way too thick for the kid to handle. We let him pull it apart and scraped off a lot of the filling, but the thick bread with PB was just too much. He couldn't manage more than a few bites. We were very pleased that we were comped for that sandwich without even us requesting it. The restaurant handled the whole matter very well.

Meanwhile, the grown-ups were delighted with their food. My husband had the Hatch burger and was in complete bliss. I had the Shelby's spinach salad with added chicken, and loved the blend of flavors. The chicken breast was perfectly grilled and quite large.

We'd definitely come here again, and maybe our son could have the PB&J, too!
Peanut Butter Burger.... Yep, Amazing!!!  All of the Food here is great...
This place is always packed but somehow we always get a table.  The service is terrific and the food is really good.  Too bad the patio is so small!
Holy Cow this place is Phenomenal! Great Food, Service, Drinks, Atmosphere, Music...Great place to watch Football on a Monday Night! Definitely would recommend to anyone!
If you are gonna be closed for some nonsense football game, how about a message on your voice mail? Rookie  mistake my friends...

Rehab Burger Therapy was delicious. I got the Swiss mushroom burger, the burger was well seasoned and cooked a perfect medium. The restaurant was clean and had a California vibe. Overall this place was delicious and I would definitely come back.

I thought the bacon burger was very standard, so the 4 stars aren't really for that... the 4 stars are for the amazing wings!!! Best wings I've ever had! The service was great as well. We will be back!

I can literally say that I don't have one complaint about this place. I don't eat red meat but I can tell you that their turkey burger is to die for and the pretzel bun is one of the best things I have ever eaten. Also, best bloody mary I have ever had in my life, and let me tell you I have had my share of bloody marys. I even get virgin ones because they are just THAT good. The sweet potato tots are out of this world, I'm getting hungry just thinking about them. All food aside, the service is amazing! The servers are so nice and friendly and accommodating, I was absolutely stunned. One day I came in extremelyyyyy hungover, so obviously hungry and the waitress took one look at me and knew I was dying. She literally whispered and purposely sat me at the furtherest table away from the bar so I wouldn't have to see any alcohol. LIKE REALLY? Talk about going above and beyond. Not to mention that we got our food in like 10 minutes! Sooo basically: amazing food, amazing service, and amazing price. My favorite place to eat in Scottsdale!

PB&J burger you are life changing. Initially we came here due to the high ratings we saw on yelp. There's a wide variety of different types of burgers to choose from. Everyone raved about the PB&J one and I was skeptical at first but I figured why not...

Best decision ever. The jam and pb were oozing out every bite and it was the perfect combo of sweet and savory. I also ordered sweet potato tots and they were the best tots that I've ever had. 

I'm not from Arizona but that meal is making me reconsider my residency. Jk. But you get the point it's that gooooood!

Overall had a pretty good experience here. The service we had was awesome. We came in on a Thursday night around 6 or 6:30 so it was pretty relaxed and wasn't all that slammed aside from a company party sitting at the middle table. 

I had a Burger with a hatch chili on it and it was pretty good. One thing you always fear in burger shops in if they are going to cook your burger properly but mine was cooked perfect and so was the persons who came with me. The fries were good as well. Again no complaints. 

I know you are probably thinking, well you didn't complain about anything so why not 5 stars? Well the food was good. But it didn't wow me or anything. The food was good for the price and the service was great. Not the best burger I have ever had and definitely not the worst. 

The only caveat here is that if you are interested in just grabbing some food here it can be a bit of a pain because it is on Mill basically which means parking is extremely limited and you will more than likely have to pay to park to get here. 

Again, overall good quality place.
As a non red meat eater, I love Rehab. They offer many of there hamburgers with chicken or turckey. I personally love the Mac Gnarly Burger and sweet potatoes.

the pig wings!!! those were the best things there. the charred crispy exterior, spicy taste, complimented with pineapple sweetness, and then the meat just strips clean off the bone. UGH, it's like eating mini ribs that were cooked perfectly!!!

ya, the burger is good too. is it the best i've ever had? nope. BUT would it be a place i would come back again to order a burger from? yes. the burger wasn't overly juicy, the patty wasn't super thick so u can taste the rest of the burger, and the buns were good too. maybe if i ordered a burger with one of the house sauces it would have taken the burger to another level. that is exactly what i did when the server asked if we would like additional sauces so do it. ask for additional sauces. 

the sweet potato tots were pretty good. i'm not a sweet potato fan myself but my gf is so we ordered it. it wasn't as crispy as i would like it but it was crispy enough. i do like how they were perfectly bite sized though. 

the mac n cheese was alright but it's not something i would order again. it wasn't bad but it wasn't exactly great either.

service was very friendly and in a great timely manner. our server was very chill and attentive which pretty much set the mood. i wish they had one of these places in the bay so i can pig out on those pig wings with a beer while i watch a game.

The fiance and I had planned for a bike ride from Arcadia to Old Town and was searching Yelp for a good happy hour that ran on weekends too. So we came across Rehab Burger Therapy and we were sold since I had been wanting to try this place since its opened. The happy hour is pretty awesome, you can get domestic for $2 and premium beers for $3!! So we got a round of Blue Moons and I tried the Four Peak Peach ale while the fiance got the 8th street. OMG the peach ale was so good! We got hungry and decided to split a burger since we saw a bunch of appetizing looking burgers pass us to other tables. We agreed on trying the hatch chili burger and it was cooked perfectly. They had a lot of interesting sauces like spicy ketchup, teriyaki aoili and chipotle aoili. I smeared chipotle aoili on the burger and it was the perfect compliment to the charred taste of the burger. The fries were okay, we got half regular fries and half sweet potato tots. I will definitely return for more burgers, I am especially interested in trying their hangover burger since I love me some breakfast foods (it has a fried egg and bacon), and of course I'll be back for more happy hours!

Indoor and outdoor seating. We sat outside on the patio which has misters, a nice touch on a warm evening. I ordered the relapse size Backyard BBQ burger with french fries. It was great. For this being the "smaller" sized burger.. it was definitely still a decent size!! I was hungry coming in and ate half. Our waitress was super nice and helpful. The only thing that kept me from a five star review was I asked for added bacon on my burger and did not get it.. I would have said something to the waitress but didn't happen see her again until we were finished eating.

Tried this for the first time today after wanting to since I've moved to Scottsdale. It was well worth the wait! I had a bacon cheeseburger on a pretzel bun and it was fantastic. The fries are just as good but the sweet potato tots weren't the best. The service was above average but I found it impressive how much they knew about every burger on the menu. They made good recommendations to the other guests around me that I over heard. Overall, I had a great experience and will definitely be coming back.

This is the only gourmet burger place I'll go to. Not only is the food outstanding - but you get a crazy portion for the price. I love all the creative burger recipes, and I think I am addicted to the sweet potato tots. Great atmosphere as well. It can often be extremely crowded but I've never had a bad experience. The servers and bartenders are always friendly, working hard and are a fun group of people! This is a must do if you are visiting old town Scottsdale!

Went here for our first time! And it was delicious totally worth it!! Good vibe and chill waitresses.. Had Ariel as a waitress, really nice and chill.. Definitely coming back and is our new burger joint!!!

Second time coming here and won't be my last! This time I had the wings.. did not take a pic but let me say they are juicy and flavorful! We got the spicy pineapple I believe. And the burger in the picture is the spicy Mac and cheese burger! Second time getting that burger!! This place is so cute! Waitresses are so sweet. The menu has a lot of choices and the alcohol as well! If you're in Scottsdale and want great food, come on over!!!
Great staff, great atmosphere & fantastic food!  If I'm ever back in Old Towne, I will be stopping here again!

PB and J Bacon Burger... "Shut the Front Door" Hands down best burger! Did I mention I travel and eat out 150+ days a year. Can't beat this place. Must stop every time I'm in Phoenix/Scottsdale areas. Club sandwich is good and massive. About to devour a spicy mac'n chz burger:)

Average spot in my opinion.  Have been 3 times within the last year and normally order a fairly straight forward burger with some fries.  All 3 times the burger has been over cooked with not a lot of flavor.  2 times the fries were cold and limp.  It's not a terrible spot to put some food in your stomach if you're in old town, but there are several burger places well ahead of this one.

I think I may need to go to Rehab after eating this burger!  Just kidding.  I like the way they have a Hawaiian theme going on in here.  Guess everyone would like to rehab in Hawaii!

When I arrived, the host asked how many were in my party, I told him 9.  He said he's never seated a party that large before.  Hmmm.  Ok.  So, after discussing it with another person, they arranged to seat us just past the bar.  It worked out great!  They do have patio seating which might have been a better option, but I don't like any amount of warm weather, so I chose to be seated indoors.

The place was fairly easy to find, but it is located almost right next to the border of the ASU Campus. There's a parking garage on 6th Street (not free) if you can't find street parking.  

To dive into this place, figuring out what you want may be a feat in itself!  They offer so many types of burgers, some sound super crazy!  Don't worry, if you don't want a burger, they do offer salads, wings, pastas, and other sandwiches.  The Rehab size is a 10oz burger and the Relapse size is a 5 oz burger.  The cost difference is only $2.00, so it's worth it to get the Rehab size.  The burgers are just overloaded with so much stuff, it is almost easier to deconstruct it while eating it!  It's like getting an extra side!

I got a Hatch Burger (Relapse) with Ghost Pepper Jack Cheese.  They will make substitutions for you, or at least they did for me.  It was a very good burger because it was just like a cheeseburger with a chili, not over the top with toppings!  Everyone else seemed to enjoy their burgers, too!  You can change up or request extra sauces.  The Wasabi Mayo was killer!  Went extremely well with the Sweet PoTOTers!  Mmmmm!!

Here's a short funny... my Dad usually eats small items that are soft to chew.  He decided that a Tuna Salad Sammy would be harmless.  It was the tallest sandwich that was served!  Yes, it was soft, but he had to eat it with a fork to manage it better!  

Being right off the ASU Campus, there is a bar in here, too.  I didn't take a look to see what all they offered, but I'm sure you can get something to suit you.

They do take a little while to get your food to you, but it wasn't a terribly long wait.  We kept busy talking and visiting with each other.  This would be a great place to come to if you are in the area!
This place is the real deal! From the patio to the murals on the walls to the awesome staff it's all 5-Star worthy! My favorite burger is the Spicy Mac and Cheese! You have to try it!

Burgers, Babes, Booze & Beer. The 4B's. What else will give you that warm and fuzzy feeling inside.

The house decor is straight off the boardwalk. The guys and gals are laid back with that beach cruzer, surfer feeling.

The founders of Rehab Burger Therapy are Wiley Arnett, Ken Likewise and Denise Nelson, who had been with Oregano's Pizza Bistro for the past 18 years and decided to do their own thing.

The menu is small but the burgers are large.

The meat was fresh ground and not over worked with seasonings. The burger patty was formed perfectly, thick and very moist. The cheese was also perfectly melted. There was a double portion of fries.

To wash down this tasty burger, I ordered a Four Peaks 8th Street Ale. Poured into a clean thick glass, it has a clear amber color with a medium head that laced nicely. Aroma is mild, with some hops as well as a slight malt finish.

I believe the trio knows how to get good food to the table.

This is the second time I've been here and it's been great both times! Sometimes it gets busy and loud but the music it's good and the servers are super nice!

The first time I had the Jalapeño Popper Burger and this last time was the Spicy Mac n Cheese Burger. The meat cane cooked the way I asked!

The only reason it wasn't a 5-Star was that the tots came out soggy and the mac n cheese wasn't really spicy, but I'd definitely go again!
Yummmm yummy yummy yum yum Mac and cheese burger to die for. Split the burger  still stuffed tots tots tots we'll worth any wait time.

We came on a Sunday afternoon and had to wait about 25 minutes for a party of two. There is parking along downtown: there's a parking lot right next to the restaurant (with underground parking) and there's also three hour parking along the streets.

They have happy hour 11am-6pm daily and all day Thursday. You can check in and get chips and salsa for $3.99.

PIG WINGS ($11.50) - They give about 8 pig wings per order. I really enjoyed the tenderness of the wing along with the sweetness and spiciness of the sauce. It was literally fall off the bone which is always a good sign. 4/5

SPICY MAC-N-CHEESE BURGER ($15.50, REHAB) - There are two different sizes of burger patties: 10oz Rehab and 5oz Relapse. We got the rehab because we were splitting the burger. I expected the burger to be spicier than it was given that spicy is in the name of the burger. The mac n cheese didn't have as much cheesiness or just taste in general. There were a couple jalapenos but even those weren't really spicy. 3.5/5

SWEET POTOTOES - We ordered these alongside our burger and oh my goodness these are so addicting. I could eat these for days and would never get enough of them. I loved dipping them in the orange-colored sauce (don't know what it is but it was delicious together). 5/5

If you're from the SoCal area, this place reminds me a lot of PB Cantina and Cabo Cantina in terms of their decorations and drinks. Their happy hours are a lot better but Rehab has much better burgers and other foods and isn't only a place to get wasted but a family friendly place to get lunch or dinner (doesn't mean you can't get wasted here though because their margaritas are good and strong).
Had the pbj burger! It was so good glad I took the chance and tried something daring!

My mom and I visited Rehab during a recent trip to the area for spring training. It was crowded, and there was a wait, but they were extremely accurate with their estimate, and we were able to walk around Old Town a little bit before we were seated.

Our server was wonderful - that perfect combination of chatty and unobtrusive, helpful and not annoying.

We started with chips and salsa as something to snack on, and they were good. I loved that there were two sizes of burgers to account for all appetites. I ended up having the chili cheeseburger with fries. It was actually not so messy that I couldn't pick it up and eat it on the bun - a rare feat for a chili cheeseburger.

The beer was cold, the food was good, and despite the crowd, we never felt hurried or neglected. Rehab is definitely worth a revisit the next time I'm in the area.

Peanut butter and jelly...mac and cheese, burger sound good...welp it was! Tater tots fries are kinda a desired taste as they are kinda sweet maybe if they were paired with a spicy ketchup they'd have been better...but the mac was delicious! The drinks were good and there's a nice (when the sun is down) patio. There were lots of options and dozens of combinations yum! If you haven't tried it you should!
Best burger in Phoenix. The PB&J Siracha burger is delicious, even though it sounds weird, it's the best burger ever.

Probably the best joint to get a veggie burger in all of PHX. Nearly every burger can be modified to fit the needs of vegetarian and vegan customers and I'm never disappointed! Love that veggie items aren't an afterthought at Rehab!

BEST WINGS IN SCOTTSDALE. I'm not kidding. My boyfriend and I have been coming here since before we even lived in the state of Arizona. We've finally gotten our orders down. At first, we'd order a little bit of everything and be absolutely stuffed about halfway through. Now, we stick with splitting a caesar salad and each ordering 6 wings. I'm obsessed with the gold medal sauce (don't like spicy things); like...I'd like to take a bath in it. Such a fun spot, great location and Sunday happy hour! Do yourself a favor and stop in. Also, I don't eat red meat but every single person I've talked to about this place has recommended just about every burger, so I assume those are great too. They're also dog friendly!
Just get the PB and J burger.  It sounds crazy but it's probably one of the best burgers I've ever had.  Love it.  Pasta is okay.  I would just stick to the burgers.

Extremely disappointing.  I am really surprised by the good reviews.  The 5 of us were seated.  No napkins, silverware, etc.  We ordered 3 burgers, 1 chicken sandwich and 1 hot dog.  All three burgers were cooked above ordered level.  All three burgers were so dry, you thought  you were eating saw dust.  Also the flavor of the meat was nothing special.  Seriously people, you must be kidding if you think this is a good burger.  I bet if you try just the burger, without all the toppings, you will realize the burger is not so good.  Maybe this is why they offer so many burgers with toppings.  Oh, after our burgers came, and asking twice, our napkins and silverware came.  My son liked the hot dog.  My daughter thought the chicken was overcooked and dry (I could see burnt pieces).

The onion rings were excellent.  The sweet potato tots were really good.  This is why I gave it 2 stars, otherwise, I would have given this place a 1 star.  

We planned on ordering dessert.  The waitress came by, in passing, and dropped off our check while our main plates were still on the table.  We thus assumed she did not want us to order dessert, and we left.

Great burgers with many different options for toppings. I was torn between the chili burger and the PBJ & bacon burger. I went with the chili burger (10oz) and was not disappointed!  My wife, a vegetarian, had the pesto pasta and she said it was terrific. We will definitely be back to try the other imaginatively constructed burgers.

Went for lunch on a Friday in a small group during the workday.

Got calamari for an appetizer round.  Breading was great, good flavor, and dip wasn't half bad especially when combined with their special hot sauce (I guess they also sell it at $5 a bottle - spicy / sweet).

Each of us got a small burger (they're all available in large / small which is great), but unfortunately each of our medium ordered burgers came back well done.  I imagine such a smaller burger would be tough to cook appropriately, but I would hope that a place that specializes in burgers could figure out proper times on these things.  I had the same issue at another burger joint (not to be named in this review).  That sort of thing just blows my mind.

In the end, we'd prefer burgers cooked to order, but we're not terribly picky.  Everything else about the burgers was top notch.  Our server was very friendly, outgoing and helpful - when she overheard a comment about the burgers (seriously, we weren't ones to complain) she offered to comp the meals which we didn't want - ended up hooking us up with milkshakes (also quite good).

Oh, I can't believe I'm leaving this for the last item on my review - but the sweet potato tots.  Oh, the sweet potato tots!  I'll come back here often for those alone.  The texture and the taste, and the dipping sauces...  Amazing!
Oh, my g-d!! This is a major delicious burger! I had the Poblano Burger. Huge! Tasty! They have a big selection, if you can't find a good burger here you don't need one. Lol.

The best burger I've had in a long time.  I ordered the rehab burger with the egg.  It was amazing.   Great menu choices to be flexible to choose your own bun and substitute for chicken and turkey as well.
Love the food here! Some odd burgers like the PB&J with Sriracha burger....but it was amazing!! The desserts are simply delicious! I really enjoyed the pot brownie.... not what it sounds like lol
I stumbled upon this place through yelp and I'm glad I did. Great service, the bartender recommended the PBJ&Bacon burger on pretzel bun, amazing! Definitely coming back next time I'm in town!

I'd been wanting to come here for a while. Sadly, I was watching my diet so I did not get a burger, but next time for sure. I did however get the recommended tacos and was pleasantly surprised. You get three and can choose all three meat options. So of course I got them all. My favorite was the beer battered fish. It was definitely beer battered. Everyone I came with got a burger and was elated. So good job Rehab!

We came here on Cinco de Mayo for dinner.  The place was packed but they were ready us since we made a reservation.  It was a noisy and loud evening with several sports events on the television screens.  

Our group of five ordered several different burgers from their creative menu. My Hatch Burger was very good.  I got the 10oz Rehab not the 5oz Relapse version.  The burger consisted of 2 or 3 large pieces of grilled green chile peppers of the famous New Mexico Hatch variety, melted cheddar cheese and chipotle mayo.  I went with the whole wheat bun option.  Delicious!  The bun held together even with the juicy meat and mayo.  The fries that accompanied the burgers were also good

I tasted the Bacon and Blue which was a little dry.  The bacon and blue cheese are inside the meat.  I wished they had been on top.  

I also sampled the Ghost Burger.  It is made with two 5oz patties.  I was sure it would be too hot. The chilies are actually in the cheese and added a great spicy flavor to the meat.  An order of the tater tot like sweet potatoes were a very nice addition.  The are well prepared and tasted much better than I imagined they would. 

The place had good quick service even on a crazy evening like Cinco.
Amazing food! Great music! Even better service! Ryan was awesome! Poblano burger was the bomb.com!
PB&J burger is incredible. Outdoor seating was nice and the waitress was super attentive. Was very pleased with the experience.

I was so excited to come try this place with all the great reviews while on vacation . This place is nice also great music but with that said the mushroom Swiss burger wasn't very good , was dried out and not hot. Server was chatting away with other employees and wasn't doing his job/ bad service. One the good side the sweet potato tots were great !!! Maybe it was just the server and the mushroom and Swiss burger but I would not recommend this place !
This is a really goid place to bring friends and travelers for many types of burgers. I can't wait to try the drinks!
One of the best burgers I've ever eaten.  I had the spicy Mac and cheese, 10 oz burger (well done) and sweet potato tater tots.

We got take out from here, called it in and they said it would be ready in 20 minutes, got there in 15 and had to wait a couple. Drove home 5 minutes away and fries were cold and burger was over cooked ... It was OK
Either table service or sit at the bar to enjoy lunch, dinner or a late night meal.

Great burgers! When you ask for Medium Rare, you actually get a medium rare burger!! Not overcooked! Great price for such big burgers. Great onions rings and fries too!
One of the best burgers I have had in a very long long time!
