I had the peanut butter and jelly and bacon burger! It was amazing! Definitely recommend the sweet potato tots and the aoili sauce. I found the waitress funny and really kind. Definitely a place I will bring my husband to when we come back! Next time I want to try the mac and cheese burger
Stuffed Bacon and blue burger ALL DAY.  One of the best burgers I have ever had.  Oh, and the sweet potato tots.. get them.

Peanut butter and jelly burger with bacon and sriracha? Yes please! The burger was awesome but if I have one knock it would be the fries not being hot. Warmish is not good for fries, it was pretty busy so we didn't make a stink. 
Great place with a lot of character and attentive servers.

The burgers here are great and have an awesome and interesting selection. The sweet potato tater tots are delicious, and the decor of this place is great. The downside is the service was awful, the server I had had an attitude and the alcohol selection left a lot to be desired. Oh well will give it another shot later on when I get a chance, but won't be drinking here.

I had the Hangover burger (fried egg, bacon, cheese, and green chili). The relapse size was perfect, the rehab size would have been way too much. The burger comes with a side of fries or tots. I got the fries. They were good but nothing to rave about. I like to have my fries with a side of honey mustard but they didn't have any, so that was kind of annoying. No big deal though. 

There is outdoor seating. A lot of customers had their dogs with them. Super cute. 

I would recommend this restaurant to others. The food was good, the atmosphere was fun, and the service was quick and friendly.

Great food. Very busy so get there early. We ordered the pig wings which were so good I had to go back the next day for more. We also had PBJ burger which was pretty good too. The last thing we had was the pot brownie. The pot brownie I got to go and it was amazing. I can't imagine how good it would have been if I had it there.

This place is pretty damn good. I tried the mushroom and Swiss burger and it was very flavorful. The onion rings were just as good. We had to wait for about 20 minutes and our big boobed waitress was a little slow but other than that everything was great. Definitely recommend

Went there for lunch no wait required the wedge salad was excellent and I should have stopped with that my burger was not good at all the service was great for good service was very good what I go there again wouldn't be my first choice but I probably would give it another try it may have been an off-day however the price for what it is it's not worth it in my opinion

I haven't felt relaxed in a long time, but sitting down (wait was 30 minutes), outside with my glass of wine, hearing the familiar tunes of my home (Hawaii), I felt my body completely relax. Our waitress was amazing! She was so friendly and helpful, as this was our first time. We didn't get appetizers because we knew some awesomeness was on its way.  I chose a bacon cheeseburger with onion rings, hubby got the pbj burger with fries, MIL got the ghost burger with sweet potato fries and her boyfriend got the bigger beefstro burger with the corn on the cob. All of the sides and burgers were so good!! We saved room for the pot brownies with ice cream. Omg. Best dessert ever! Everything came at a decent time and everything was wonderful and relaxing. We will definitely be back to try new things!

Nice location. We enjoyed sitting on the patio.  Our burgers were cooked to our liking ( well done). My friend got the burger with peanut butter and jelly and said it was delicious. It sure looked good! 

My main reason for writing this review is for others with celiacs disease- I decided to try rehab burger after discovering that they had a gf bun and was able to access a list of their gluten free offerings online. I was excited to try! Unfortunately the waiter we had knew very very little about what was offered and that right off the bat made me nervous. All  he knew is that the burger patty wasn't spiced with anything with gluten in it. Otherwise I read off the online list- really the only options turned out to be the build a burger or salad.  I got the build your own burger...Fries were not gf so I subbed a side salad with my burger...after extensive conversation with the server the salad still came out with croutons on it :/ The burger was decent. Not something that would make me return in and of itself.  At the end of the meal and my salad was pushed to the side untouched the the server gave me a funny look then apparently realized that I ordered it without croutons. He was a nice enough guy so I just said don't worry about it (I was a little disappointed to see that he hadn't subtracted it from the bill however as it was an additional charge to have the salad instead or fries for a side).

Overall this seems like nice enough place, just not for those looking for gf options. It's curious to me that they offer a gf bun but are not very gf friendly otherwise.

Low-key, island-feel burger bar. Quite busy during dinnertime weeknights.

Mac-and-cheese burger is two meals in itself - pretty tasty with the Pablano peppers. Onion rings were a bit over breaded. Sweet potato tots were overly sweet for my liking, the island corn was tasty. Next time we'll try the PB&J burger.

Really great burgers with combinations that sound strange but are AMAZING!!!  Please try the peanut butter and jelly burger. 

Service was so-so - bartenders were good enough.
been great everytime weve gone, good wings too! just like organoes wings

Love the overflowing tater tots. My fave by far. Sometimes I use the big Baba Booey soup spoon to just scoop up about 6-7 per bite-nothing beats mouthful after mouthful of tater tots. I pretend I'm eating a giant bowl of oatmeal, only it's tater tots.

I came here after RnR was too busy and i ordered the quesadilla and portabello burger and both were delicious. The server we had was awesome and a riot. The happy hour is great and def choose this over RnR.

The service is good. Onion rings came out fast and are thick, juicy, and beer battered to perfection. They don't have kilt lifter anymore, but plenty of other beer. The hangover burger is really great. Just messy. The egg will pop when you bite in the first time. I will certainly visit again next time I am in town. Our waitress Melanie was fantastic.

Loved the beach-themed interior decor. Even on a busy, Fathers' Day lunch there was room at the bar and plenty of time to order. I absolutely loved what I saw on the menu; specialty burgers topped with mac and cheese, or peanut butter and jelly and all sorts of other crazy stuff that people must go wild for! Though we were apprehensive to try those ones, we did grab a BBQ/Onion Ring Burger and the Hatch Chile Burger (not sure if that's what they're actually called). The flavor was outstanding in both, but neither burger was cooked the way they were ordered. In fact, one of them was so dry it was difficult to eat. I am pretty confident that our overdone burger was an uncommon incident, so this place deserves a second chance. I'll certainly be back, and hope to dive deeper into the menu when I return.  Sunday was a memorable experience, for sure, however I wish we'd left the place with more in our stomachs than in the take-home containers.

This place has excellent burgers in two different sizes. All different combos that include the mouth watering PB and J burger. Their onion rings and tater tots are good. The cocktails are just so-so including watery margaritas. Stick to beer.    Its always busy so plan to wait during peak times, but you will enjoy it as you can get your burger fix on.

A good burger is hard to find - Flannery O'Connor

Okay, O'Connor didn't say this. . . but if she had Rehab Burger then I am pretty sure literature would be a bit different.

A co-worker and I decided to give Rehab a try after I read a few reviews. One thing about me: burgers are something I crave, not necessarily a frequent on my to-eat list.

My friend ordered the Porkster and I ordered the Hangover. 

   1)  Each burger patty was seasoned to perfection. 
    2)  The chef understood what a medium burger should be and it was perfect
    3)  The Porkster was great if you really enjoy meats. To be honest, I could have had  
          the pulled pork alone. The burger patty was just more awesome under a bun
     4) The Hangover was devoured by my co-worker (we split our burger in halves and   
          shared) but I felt like something was missing. I would have preferred to have      
          some sort of spicy...something on it . . .or a bit more cheese. Next time, I'll think    
          about the sauces they provide and request something different. 
      5) Order the sweet potato fries and make sure they give this white sauce to dip 
          'em. I am pretty sure that sauce is made from love and a dash of Heaven.

We arrived before the restaurant started pouring in with customers (around noon) so if you're wanting a quick in and out lunch, I am not so sure this is the place.

All around you get what you pay for. I couldn't finish half of my Rehab burger and had a lot of Tots left over. Go there and expect to be satisfied!

Had lunch here...Momster had a Turkey Burger and I had the Chicken Caesar Salad. The prices were reasonable, the service was fine and we wound up taking most of our meals home. The atmosphere was very relaxed, and the owner would check in on us to make sure things were going well. This was in addition to our server's inquiries. They have a nice, varied menu and you feel like you want to settle in. It was crazy hot when we were in Scottsdale and I love the heat, but it seemed like the air was a bit too much. That's a small quibble given the rest of the experience. Next time (and there will be a next time), we'll just sit outside and enjoy the misters!

The service was very very slow. The waitresses and hostesses were dressed very young and not very professional. (I get this is a chill restaurant with a chill vibe, but when the employees look like they just left the gym with tight spandex leggings, form-fitting tank tops, and messy buns, I couldn't tell who worked there and who was dining there). However, the sweet potato tots were TO DIE FOR (I found myself craving them weeks later) and the burger was really good. I will definitely be back to try the PBJ & Bacon Burger that everyone has raved about, but the slow service could absolutely use some improvement.

I came here with five of my friends. This place is normally pretty packed and you'll end up waiting in line a pretty long time. The burgers you get here are honestly the most unique burgers I've  Ever seen . They have a peanut butter burger and a bunch of other ones that I'm sure you guys have never tasted. So if you're down to try new stuff I love burgers got a pop into this place. I think this burger place was maybe just a little too much for me. That's why gave them only three stars it's a personal opinion. Sometimes I like my burgers more simple

A fine addition to the old town food scene. Top quality burgers, beer, service and decor. This is a relaxing place to hangout with friends/family. Try the chicken wings and the wedge salad (not on the menu). They also have a nice patio for the cooler months.
Rehab is awesome. What can I say that hasn't been said? It's all true. I love pretzel buns and the PBnJ burger will surprise you, it's actually damn good!
I was in Arizona for the weekend and happened to find this spot on yelp! It definitely didn't disappoint! I got the hangover burger....it was delish!
Absolutely delicious! My boyfriend had the Mac n cheese Siracha burger and I had a regular cheeseburger, but both were amazing. Definitely a must try place!

My friend would have given this a 5+.  I am sticking to a 4.  Whether you eat inside it out it has great ambience.  What a fun place to go with excellent staff and service.  The burgers were great.  I had the poblano burger and my friend had the blue cheese and bacon burger.  Both burgers were excellent. I am knocking it down one star for the wings. People raved about them.  Not me....mine must have come from a hen as they were what I would call skinny wings.  No meat and all bones.  I will definitely come back.  One other issue is that the head is a one staller.  Don't like to wait when duty calls.

Great food, great service, cool atmosphere! 

Came for an early lunch right when the place opened and all the staff seemed pretty cool. Built our own burgers and tried out all the sauces. Really good! Def recommend this place for a cool restaurant with a great burger!
Love this place! Burgers are outrageously great. Fish sandwich rocks too.  Service could be better but well worth the drive we make from QC on a regular basis.

If you are looking for a great place that has great food, then Rehab Burger is the place!  They have the friendliest staff and great happy hour specials.  I have been here several times and I have not been disappointed.  They have happy every day with fantastic specials.  I highly recommend their frozen Margaritas!  The Skinny drinks are amazing too.  

They have a great menu to make any customer happy.  They have a burger menu that allows customers to sub any Rehab Burger with a turkey burger or grilled chicken breast at no additional cost.  I am a huge fan of the Turkey Burger.  I tried the Bacon Cheese Turkey Burger with Sweet Potato tots.  The server recommended Manchego cheese and I thank him for this great suggestion.  The Mushroom and Swiss Turkey Burger was full of flavor and delicious.  The sweet potato tots are the perfect size.  They offer several dipping sauces for the fries and tots.  My favorites include Pineapple Teryaki Aioli, Chipotle Aioli, and , Chipotle Ranch.  

I think the secret is out about Rehab Burger.  It does get busy but it is worth the wait.  This is a great place to grab a bite to eat with friends.

After reading some of the previous reviews . . . this place was definitely one burger joint that was on my to visit list . . . loved the curb appeal, and the inside decor was great . . . the food . . . well, how do I say it . . . not so special.

I ordered the Hatch Chili Cheese Burger Rehab on a prezel roll with Sweet Potato Tots . . .  when it arrived . . . it looked unbelievable . . . but the taste . . . kinda bland, seemed to lack any kind of seasoning . . . ordered it medium so that it would be nice and juicy . . . kinda dry, and while it was cooked to medium, it appeared to be a much leaner burger than I was expecting, and the pretzel bun . . . tasted kinda stale.  The sweet potato tots we okay . . . but again nothing special.

Will I ever visit Rehab Burger again . . . probably . . . but maybe if I sat at the bar and had a couple of adult beverages first . . . the burger and tots would taste better.

I'm genuinely excited that one of my favorite Burger joints came to Mill!

I love Rehab Burger,  and especially their green chile version as well as peanut butter and jelly.

Don't let the location daunt you. It's hidden- but worth the hunt.

Please give Rehab the love it deserves!
Wow!  This place did not let me down.  Respect to whoever came up with the hamburger ideas and more.  I wish I had one near my house in Utah.  Bravo! Bravooooooo!

Tough week at work....had to have some rehab.....Rehab Burger that is!

Location & Aesthetics - Located on E. 2nd St. in Scottsdale which was a bit of trip for me from my usually stomping ground in the West Valley but it was worth the drive.
Parking is a bit of a mystery as I couldn't figure out where I was allowed to park.  There weren't any signs where patrons was instructed to park so I just followed the crowd and parked across the street where there was a large parking lot.  
The restaurant itself looks small on the outside and even the outside patio with its fans and misters was small and seemed crowded with the arrangement of the tables and chairs being in close proximity to each other.  The inside was the same - small.  
Another mystery was how customers were seated.  For example, from my observations, a party of two was sometimes seated at a table with four chairs with the two other chairs being unused.  On the other hand, I noticed a party of two with a kid was seated at the long table - a long table with a slew of high chairs on either side of it, where the couple was supposed to sit opposite each other and not side-by-side.
The couple with the kid had to put their kid on one of those high chairs which, in my opinion, didn't look too safe or too comfortable.
The way the chairs are bunched up together at the long table, was in close proximity to each other, meaning that on a day when the place might be packed, I could envision folks sitting elbow-to-elbow at said long table which is really not comforting in my opinion!  (-1)
Thankfully, when we went (on a Friday evening), there wasn't anyone sitting immediately next to us at this long table but rather a chair over from us on either side which didn't make the situation stifling.

Menus - The usual, given upon arrival and when you're seated.  Very large, self-explanatory, and easy to understand.  

Service - The staff was nice, friendly, warm, welcoming, and answered any questions we had about the meals.
Our waitress was prompt with introducing herself to us upon being seated, and was also prompt with the complimentary glasses of water (which tasted stale), and our drinks.
Despite having folks around us and having their orders taken after our orders, we did notice that our orders came well after theirs but it wasn't unnerving.


Food - The burgers were very tasty and creative.  I like the fact the have their own names, sizes (only 2 - Rehab or Relapse), their own particular and peculiar set of ingredients which I think makes each one a unique creation and a taste unto itself.
I ordered the BBQ Burger but couldn't tell if it was a Relapse size or a Rehab size as I had forgotten to mention it to the waitress but nonetheless it tasted superbly.
I also like you can choose the type of bun to go along with your burger.  Unfortunately, for sides, you're only allowed fries or sweet potato tots (two dipping sauces supplied with it); the latter was very tasty.

I can see the great variety in their burger creations can possibly bring me back despite the place being small.

Visited this establishment last night, my second visit. I had been here with an out of town friend over the holidays for cocktails but did not eat on that occasion. Last night we ordered burgers, my friend got the Chili Cheeseburger and french fries, I ordered the Hatch Green Chile Burger with fries, on a GF bun. It was really not tasty at all. I didn't even finish it. The fries were meh. My friend said his burger was ok but not the greatest chili burger he's had. I think this place really hopes you will down a couple of their tequila shooters from their extensive list so that you won't know how awful the burgers really are. Our server, although polite, was clearly paying more attention to other tables, from what we heard they sounded like regulars, or maybe friends of hers. The atmosphere is trendy and fun, too bad the food is not comparable.

I love the atmosphere of this place. The rehab burgers themselves are huge.  We ate the MacGnarly burger from the recommendation of the waitress (she said it was their version of the Big Mac).  It seemed like everyone in the restaurant gasped when she placed it in front of me since it was easily over half a foot tall.  It was messy, difficult to eat and the flavor didn't blow me away.  Now the PBJ burger was a different story.  I ordered it on the recommendation of yelpers and was very scared to eat this burger that was dripping with hot peanut butter.  I have to say though that I was pleasantly surprised and gobbled that thing up.  I also enjoyed my friend's pulled pork sandwich which was spicy and the onion rings.  The sweet potato tots were a little bland to me.  All in all a cool place and would love to go back when I'm in town again.

Happy hour is the way to go. $1.50 modelo especial in the can! And then $2 off signature cocktails and similar for appetizers as well. The green Chile chicken cheese dip was amazing and my turkey sandwich with sprouts, harvarti, onion and tomato on beach toast was sooo good and crazy big I could only finish half the sandwich. Also tried their frozen margarita which was pretty good, not crazy strong but it had good flavor to it(on the sweeter side). Alyssa was an awesome server! Attentive but not overbearing! Obviously their a newer restaurant so you gotta cut them slack, but there was nothing to cut them slack on. Everything was awesome! Will definitely back!

First of all my review is based on the service.  Not the food.  The food was AMAZING!!!!! Brought my husband and 2 kids. The drinks were not good. We had tea and soda.  Soda was thick n syrupy w little carbonation (coke) the tea looked ok but had no flavor at all.  I've seen more flavor in a Lipton used tea bag. The food came out as ordered in a timely manner. And beautiful. A feast for both the stomach and the eyes. So we start eating. And we'll our drinks was empty. For 10 mins n no refills.  Looked around the room and I also noticed that everyone else also had empty glasses with just ice. They don't check up on you during meal.  You have to get their attention and that's hard in such a loud room. So a while passes and our waitress is finally passing by and snagging her attention. But we was already done eating and also requested boxes. Note: the rehab size is a very ambitious serving, huge. So we get our boxes. And pack up the food.  But still so check.  So another 15 mins goes by.  And we finally have to ask for the check. The wait staff doesn't pay attention to their customers for drinks or checks.  Not rude. But definitely not conscientious. Or personable. We loved the food. But next time we gonna try the Tempe location. See how service is there.  As for here it's a one n done. Off note: those of you w kids that are picky, they do not have American cheese. Nothing to complain about there. Just FYI.

The PB&J burger is one of my favorite burgers ever and I always look forward to coming here. I also really love the Mac n cheese burger. The staff are friendly and helpful which is always nice. Oddly enough, the tortilla chips and guac are especially good for a burger place. Also, make sure you get the ice cream brownie desert!

Went here a few year ago as I moved to AZ. Their atmosphere is friendly and their Mac and cheese burger was all I wanted in the world. I enjoyed everything but the parking experience, which had to be done next door in public parking. Nothing wrong with that but I didn't really know what to expect!
The Hangover Burger is LEGIT- fried egg, bacon, colby jack cheese and hatch green chili. They also have a PB&J with bacon and siracha for anyone brave enough to try it.
Very good. Excellent service. The PB&J bacon cheeseburger was delicious! Had a very nice experience.

Last night was first time there and OMG I was craving a good burger and it hit the spot I sat at the bar and the guy bartender suggested I tried the Mac n cheese burger  and I'm hooked I'll be coming back and bringing some friends it's nice when the staff knows the menu!

Went to this place after RnR was too crowded, plus 45 minute wait.  Love the beach house decor, very friendly staff and great food.   Perfect place to post up for a sunday funday. I can remember what it was called, but I had a burger with an egg in it and it was Great!! I will definately be back.

AMAZING burger! I had the swiss and mushrooms, on pretzel buns. Perfect! I liked the sweet potato tots, but I would have  liked even more if they were crispier. I keep the 5 * for the outstanding burger
Great tots. Great gluten free bun.
We took our kids and sat on the patio. Very fun and the food was great! High quality burgers and fries. The sweet potato tots were yummy!!

The service was great. I was seated right away and everyone kept up with my table. The music and atmosphere were good too. The blue cheese burger I ordered sucked terribly. There was more shredded lettuce then burger and no blue cheese or bacon. When I called the waiter back he said it's cooked into the dry ass patty they served. So disappointed, the did bring me some blue cheese to put in it but come on. It was the driest hockey puck of q burger and if I wasn't 9 months pregnant and starving at the time I would've sent it back and ordered something else.

Easy going restaurant with few outside tables, Phoenix weather in October is perfect in the evening! Extensive menu. Chicken wings with BBQ sauce are some of the best we've had. The little stubby pork ribs are bbq-ed to perfection. As for the Burgers, they are incredible in taste, size, cheese, condiments, bread and dressings, the fries, side salad and sweet potatoes tats were great too.  Awesome service.  The lady was so nice.  The owner came and checked that we are happy with the food.

This is a feature of Phoenix and needs to be in all guide books and websites. A real Phoenix gem!

If you're into a huge variety of burgers (with ability to substitute red meat for a Turkey Burger, Grilled Chicken Breast, Beef Chorizo Patty or Veggie Burger) and BONUS, it doesn't cost extra, then you'll love Rehab Burger! I know if I come here hungry I'm going to leave with some leftovers; they do not skimp on the portions. My husband got the Ghost Burger and he absolutely devoured it as he loves spicy things and has gotten it twice in a row now; I got the Hawaiian burger and that with the pineapple teriyaki just bring all of the flavors together so well.

They have a huge variety of sauces, their french fries are out of this world, and their drinks are delish!

The place itself has such a cool ambiance. The way it's decorated-it's like you stepped into a restaurant off the beach somewhere, and the staff have such a laid-back vibe and are so helpful with menu suggestions, they definitely have our business and we will keep coming back for a long time to come!

Went here at noon on Wednesday with a party of 9 people. I ordered hangover burger 10 oz, pretzel bun, with onion ring

The good
-server is friendly
-onion ring is very good 
-hangover burger is pretty good even though the food not so warm on my first bite
-restroom has real towel

The bad
-food took literally an hour to come out even though place not so packed
-ordered medium rare, came out medium
Seriously one of the best burgers I have ever tried! I had the Hawaiian Burger, it was perfection! Also, their sweet potato tots- amazing, again the best ever!

This is a really well run restaurant, and creative. The host was really on top of his game during a busy dinner period,  and the service was fast. But, with so many great places in old town this just doesn't quite measure up.

The alcohol selection leaves a bit to be desired in terms of variety.   There are however, a lot of different, and unique burgers here. I tried the PB and J burger. I was hesitant to try it because I wasn't convinced the textures/flavors would win me over like it has for others who reviewed this restaurant.  Personally, the thickness of the peanut butter made it difficult for me to enjoy. I wouldn't order it again,  but it was worth trying.  

Overall,  its a nice place to stop in if you're feeling adventurous and craving a different kind of burger from the norm.

This was One of our favorite places to take friends and family. The burgers are great. We took my daughter and her husband and 2 small sons at Christmas time and received horrible service. We basically had to get up and get our own water, ketchup, and silverware. They wait for service and food was miserable and not pleasant with children. I hope they have improved service because I'm scared to go back. They gave all their attention to a table that was drinking continuously. Wow...how about us over here? Very obvious we were bugged but the more we asked for necessary things the worse our service got. I was embarrassed as I had raved about this place and they didn't deliver.
We love Rehab Burger Therapy!  Excellent food, great service and fun atmosphere.  This is my favorite place to have lunch with my family and friends..

This is one of my favorite places to not only eat, but to hang out. It has such a great atmosphere to hang out with friends. Their PBnJ burger is one of my favorites. The staff there is always friendly. Our last server was Kaye who is the depiction of a great server.

The  servers were friendly and all ,  the  chips and salsa were  pretty good  spiced up  just right,  the burger was present well  but  was very dry,  and not really tasty ,  Id probably come back for a beer or something  but won't overly  impressed with the burgers

If you eat here regularly and you eat a rehab burger (not a relapse burger) expect to gain about 20 pounds per week. 
The 10-ounce rehab burger, which comes in many mouth-watering disguises, is not a burger for the meek. It starts at about 5 inches in height and, if served with a pretzel bun and a variety of added toppings, it may reach a staggering 10 inches in height. You will find it a challenge to get your mouth around it and when you do be prepared to catch the juices that slop out of the enormous concoction.
You want fries with that? Of course you do, especially as they come automatically with your burger. You can have regular fries or sweet potato tots.
Chips and salsa--why not.
Beer-what the heck, go for broke.
Enjoy this exceptional burger joint with its surfing, motor-cycling and California style decor.
The waitresses are all very attentive and will serve you with a smile.
There is outdoor seating but I don't recommend eating there during the summer as it will be really hot out there.
This is a primo burger restaurant that knows how to serve you a man-size succulent repast. If you aren't that hungry order a relapse burger as it will only be five ounces and it will still fill you up.

We sat outside & had a really fun & tasty experience. They were very busy & managed the crowd very well. We ordered the specialty burger that's prepared with 5 oz of beef & another 5 oz of taco meat, Doritos, cheese & burger dressings on a pretzel bun!!!! Yum. We shared it & still had 1/2 left, it was huge! We also ordered the specialty corona/margarita, which was perfect. The staff was friendly. Onion rings are huge & wonderful!!

Burger Rehab therapy. I have been to your place three times and have never been disappointed. Your staff is friendly, you all are inclusive with your patrons and you make amazing burgers! What matters the most about reviews In a restaurant is the service and the quality of the food. If people give you bad reviews because it was too hot outside to wait for a check well guess what!!! Your in in Phoenix!! It's not your fault. I love you guys!!! Your the best ma and pa burger joint around!!! Keep up the great work!!!

I cannot believe we paid close to $40 for two burgers here. The burgers were tasteless and extremely undercooked. My "medium" burger was still bloody. There was no seasoning on the burger itself and the toppings couldn't help it. The bun was extremely soggy and fell apart. So gross. I will never eat here again! So dissatisfied.

They have a wide & wild selection of huge burgers and a really creative decor with surf boards, and cool things all over the walls and ceiling.  It has the feel of a young, hip bar & burger place where you'd go on vacation by the ocean.
Amazing PB and J burger!  Took an old friend to this restaurant tonight!  3rd time there. This place has amazing food.  Great service. Loved it.

The food and drinks are exceptional. The chicken wings medium hotness were perfectly prepared and delicious. We ordered 5 different burgers all outstanding the French fries are addicting, the beef is fresh and was cooked as ordered. 
If visiting the Phoenix area this is the place not to miss
Best Burger ever, and I love the pretzel bun. Great sweet potato tots. They always have great service, and great specials on beer and food.
Delicious!! Great service!! The bar was fun and the hamburgers are HUGE.  They have way more than burgers.

Very good burgers - big selection. Went with family & friends and didn'thave to wait too long on a Friday evening.

Had the Spicy Mac and Cheese Burger - tasty. Everyone in the party was pleased.

I'll be back!

"YUM" If you are a Burger lover, put this place on your list. The Burger patty itself burst with flavor, aside from building some creative Burgers they nailed the flavors of what a Burger should be! Aside from their lively ambiance the entire Staff is working endlessly to make your experience great!

Went here while in Scottsdale for the Goodguys hot rod show and it lives up to its yelp ratings no doubt!!! This is a damn good piece of meat stuffed inside a bun! Don't skip this joint! Stuff your face!!!

I got sick after lunch, I don't think I will ever step foot into this place.


Good luck

Had a chicken sandwich and was in pain for two hours after. Called-apologetically-to avoid writing a negative review to give them a head's up (on the chance it wasn't me suddenly becoming sensitive to chicken) and so nobody else needed to go through the trouble. The manager said he had had no other complaints and was quick to get off the phone. I repeated I was calling as a courtesy but it seemed like he thought I was trying to get a free meal. So yeah, according to my one chicken sandwich, you might have immediate onset stomach pain and subsequent bathroom badness. Also the manager didn't seem to care.
Large menu. Fair prices for the very large portions. Good wine prices & great happy hour. A great "joint."
Best burger in Arizona. Lots of choices. Very kid friendly, even for a 2 and 3 year old. A must if in a burger mood.

I think the words I am looking for are "HOLY HELL THEIR BURGERS ARE MASSIVE!" This place is always packed when I walk in but somehow they always accommodate us. Their service is attentive and the food! OH THE FOOD! Salads are huge, burgers are even bigger and I struggle to even eat half of it! Haven't been disappointed yet!

Cool burger place - fun ambiance, lots of burgers (and other stuff) to choose from. Shelby is great - super friendly, very attentive and just plain nice. Good crowd even late in the afternoon. If you're into burgers definitely check it out!

Ok, for anyone that has given a bad review to this place ... you either came on a very very off day or you are just too damn picky (or prefer to be paid for your good reviews).  This place has an amazing atmosphere and staff.   Hands down the best burger place in town.  You can literally make up something and they will make it, the ultimate have it your way place.  It's nice to know that you can come to a place that actually cares about its customers.  If you find yourself there while I am there, say hello.

New Rehab location!! Same great food, awesome atmosphere. When the garage doors are open and the weather is nice, great spot to catch a happy hour. Staff is awesome, super attentive, and the bartender never let my drink go empty (shout out to Rian, Lo, Kim, Jamie, Andy, David, Arturo, Samm, and of course the owners Denise, Wiley, and Ken... This crew never disappoints and always makes it a fun place to be). Don't be shy, try the PB&J (my go to burger). The parking in the back is super convenient too.  Definitely worth a pop in. Congrats Rehab on the new location!!
Excellent Burgers, friendly wait staff. Quality is there...will go back again! Thank you Rehab...
The wait was worth it!  Great food and Drinks.  Great wait staff.  This is one of the best restaurants I've been to in a while.  Met some nice people here.

This place has an awesome burger selection. Waitress suggested either the PB&J burger or spicy Mac and cheese burger. I tried the Mac and cheese burger. Meat was high quality and cooked as ordered. Burger had a full serving of Mac and cheese. Mac and cheese was so good I'd have ate it alone. I had a pretzel bun, overall, awesome burger. My father ordered the PB&J burger which he really liked, peanut butter was more of a peanut sauce. Service was pretty good. Place was packed for lunch. Would come back to try some of the other burgers.

Would highly recommend this place. Cool environment inside the restaurant, our waitress was nice and the service was great. One of the best burgers I've had, their happy hour today (Thursday) lasts all day so drink prices were very good. Overall, great service, great food, good prices, I would recommend this place and come here again for sure.

Sometimes THE BIG DOG HAS GOT TO EAT.

Enter Rehab. Glutton's Paradise. Gordo Nirvana.

Rehab Burger has caused so much plaque build up they could own a trophy shop.

Rehab Burger has made Scottsdale so fat they call it the Bounce Castle.

Burgers so fat they got a zip code bigger than yo mama's.

Burgers so juicy your farts will be sharts for days.

Burgers so thick Nicki Minaj got jealous and wrote a diss track.

Nuf said. When I gots to eats, I hits the streets and get my 'Hab on.

WHEN BIG DOG NEED TO EAT, HE NEED TO EAT THE REHAB MEAT

Really good food that was worth the wait. We had the chili Fritos and they were amazing and super unique. The atmosphere was also really cool. Our waiter was very nice and comfortable to talk to, he gave us some info on the town since we were visiting. I had the pesto pasta with chicken and it was amazing and the portion was huge. Definitely would go back again when I'm in town.

Rehab Burger reminds me of Hooters with more modern outfits. The food is ok, the waitresses are friendly, and the ambiance is sorta sports bar ish.  Service was fast, location was great. No complaints on those fronts.

I ordered a burger, but just when I remembered we had reservations for a steakhouse that evening, I quickly changed it to a grilled cheese sandwich. Unfortunately, the sandwich was pretty disappointing. The bread was 90% of the entree: huge one-inch thick slices that contained a couple slices of barely warmed (let alone melted) cheese. The sweet potato tater tots were fine.

I don't write reviews often. I really need to either be wowed or angry for me to find the motivation to do this. Having said that, I was wowed by my entire experience at Rehab Burger. The food was amazing. We were celebrating a birthday as a group of 7. The staff provided us with service that would make you think you were in a 5 star restaurant. The menu was diverse enough for everyone to choose something that appeals to their tastes and from the chicken wings to the sweet potato tots to the burger itself everything was done perfectly. I had the BYOB burger. I added avocado, havarti cheese, and a fried egg. It was delicious. To the staff at Rehab thank you for treating us like kings. Thank you for the excellent service (especially during the Friday night dinner rush no less) and thanks for the burger therapy!
Pretty good food but always a long wait to sit and a long wait to receive your food. Limited seating is expected.

On the advice of the other customers at the communal table I sat at and the advice of the waitstaff I tried the peanut butter and jelly and Siraccha burger... And as bizarre as that sounds... it was amazing!  Can't wait to go back and try a few of the other interesting combinations.
Great burgers and good sized portions for an excellent value. Nice beer selection on draft. Server was friendly and knowledgable of the menu. Great area & location.

I'll start with the positive, I loved the atmosphere, it was a cool vibe but that's all that I can really comment on that I enjoyed.  I found this place incredibly disappointing and I really wanted to like it.  I went there based on the yelp reviews and was really looking forward to it.  I ordered the patty melt which clearly wasn't a good choice.  I like to think of myself as a bit of a patty melt expert, it is probably my favorite cheat meal. This one was not worth the cheat.... a patty melt is supposed to be on "grilled rye" the bread was not grilled at all, it was simply dry lightly toasted marble rye, so disappointing, I pulled the burger off of the bread, no use in wasting carb intake on dry bread.  The burger itself was ok at best, I've had better at Denny's and that's pretty sad. The staff seemed friendly but not very accommodating, I don't like over anxious servers but maybe a check in occasionally would have been nice... bottom line, would I go back? Not a chance.
Excellent food and service!  We had 3 different burgers, fish tacos, fries, Tater tots, and a pot brownie, all were awesome!  This is a definate We will be back ASAP!

This place is the real deal. Had the spicy Mac n cheese burger with their fries. The burger is HUGE and absolutely delicious. The fries are seasoned very well and the portion is generous. Their sauce game is ridiculously on point. Definitely recommend the wasabi mayo, their medium wing sauce, and their honey mustard wing sauce. Service was top notch. We brought a puppy and all of the staff came out to meet him and bring him water. Servers were so nice and incredibly attentive. This place is a must visit. Can't recommend enough!
Great burger. Got a little smoky and hot inside but other then that no complaints. Amazing food

I've had a couple different burgers from this place always cooked to perfection. Was a big fan of the Mac and cheese they have as well. I would literally eat a bowl on mac and cheese with there burger patties right in top. It was pretty busy both times I went, but that always a good sign because it means GOOD FOOD! The waitresses were knowledgeable of the menu when I asked for suggestions the first time I went as well. Good place for just chilling and good eats. Kind of has a lounge feel to it. No so much a sports bar. Would recommend as a great spot to bring fam and friends who enjoy a great burger.

These burgers are the freakin BUSINESS. I love everything about this place, the building in itself is like a neat on the beach burger shack. It's very close, kinda loud, and very tasty. The chips and salsa changed my life, not sure what type of chips they used but I was funneling that junk in my mouth nonstop. It took a very long time for the burgers to come out but it was well worth it. On a busy day, if you have like 2 hours to spare, definitely come here and enjoy your much needed rehab!
Great comfortable and everyone welcomes you like a local. Try the PJB burger may not sound like something you want but loved it.

Went last Saturday night with a bunch of friends. (thank goodness we made reservations - there was a decent crowd waiting to get in!)  We had a variety of burgers and sandwiches and everyone enjoyed their meals. Service was fine. Sat outside and it was a perfect night for it. Glad we were outside as inside gets really loud. Only complaints -  the appetizers came out with the meals, and our burgers were inconsistently done. Three of us ordered medium, and they were all three different - from well done to rare. Guess I expect more from a place that specializes in burgers... It won't keep me from going back though!

Poor service.  Star is mostly due to immediate lack of greeting. I think need to take some lessons from their Canadian neighbors chain cactus club and get a better business model than actual hire enough staff and those that want to work rather than chat.  We waited to be acknowledged at door and then took another time to get us seated. Then once seated we were on our own for a good 15 minutes before any welcome.  Crazy.  Our server was super friendly once he spoke to us.  I expect to be greeted at door pretty much immediately.  There were three servers standing at register at back of restaurant chatting.  Do they know who is sustaining their job.  Obviously not.   Food cam fairly quickly with good recommendations. Server was very helpful and attentive.  Good food. Had calamari and poblano burger with onion rings.  We are pretty spoiled in Vancouver so can't say it was outstanding. Corona Rita was ok as I thought it was usually served with full size corona. At least it is in Vancouver.  So in a nutshell first impression was poor but overall I give it a 3 star.

Decent burgers.  Long wait.  Pretzel bun was good. Chili cheese fries was pretty good as well.  Cool concept and nice variety but the meat could use some improvement... Maybe five guys is just hard to beat.

Awesome staff, great fish tacos and guac! Fun atmosphere for small or large groups. This place is a hidden gem on Mill Ave. part of the fun Mill Ave scene but not part of the super young college crowd.  If you like burgers, tacos, and beers this is the spot for you!

Great atmosphere, good food and service, prices are reasonable...but why not GREAT ? My friend ordered her chili hatch  burger cooked medium and it was served rare. She did not notice until I did and was so hungry that she decided to eat it and  only bring it to the server's attention versus complain.

I had the grilled chicken sandwich and it came piled high on "Beach" toast with layers of avocado, tomato, havarti cheese and sprouts...it was a delicious monster of flavors and came with sweet tater tots (you also have the choice of french fries) which were to die for. Shame on me,  I also ordered a chocolate lava shake which was delicious and not too sweet. The shake was served in a tall glass topped with whipped cream and M&M's.

The restaurant itself is not pretentious at all and rather casual in atmosphere sporting surfboards against the wall and cycles hanging from the ceiling.

Overall, it was a nice experience, a good discovery and a nice change from the other burger joints. I enjoyed the fact that RBT is more of a sit down place versus standing in line to have to order your food. It's also nice that the burgers and sandwiches come with a choice of fries versus having to pay extra for them. The restaurant also has a full bar and a heated patio.

I've been in here a few times and had a good experience. The staff is friendly but not annoying. Prices are great. They have a ton of burgers to choose from as well. I think a few local magazines also rated them the best burger in the Phoenix area. They have opened two new locations in a little over a year so that gives you some idea about their success
Awesome environment. Slow service sometimes but I like to hang out there so it doesn't bother me. Best chicken sandwiches around

One of he best burger places in Scottsdale! Atmosphere is very beachy, makes you think that you are on a tropical island! Very friendly and helpful waiters. The food is absolutely excellent! I got the Spicy Mac n Cheese burger with the sweet potato tater tots. Both were amazing!! We came to watch football, and they turned the tv to the game we wanted. Highly recommend!!
Not sure what is up with the negative reviews. Some people just want to find something to complain about I guess. Great burgers, great staff and service, great location, great atmosphere.

Thanks to a Yelp search of "fries" after drinks along 2nd Street, my fiance and I stopped in to RBT for wings and fries, and they hit the spot! We were cutting it close to when the kitchen was closing so we appreciated that they were willing and able to take a late night eats order for us :)

Wow. So happy we tried this place out! New favorite! After some convincing, my husband ordered the PB&J burger. I ordered the Hangover burger. We both got the sweet potato tots. The PB&J burger was so different and SO delicious! I liked it more than the Hangover, but mine was good as well. Our service was amazing and the vibe is super chill. We will definitely be returning with all our friends!

It was late on a Friday evening and we didn't have a reservation, so we did have to wait a little for a table,  because we had 5 and they had very few larger tables.  But that was just our bad planning.  The hostess up front was so friendly and kept checking in on us to give us status which I appreciated, and once a table became available, their team rushed to get it cleaned up for us.  Their options are great, with something for everyone.  I had my 4 year old with me, and even though they don't have a kids menu, the waitress advised of the options they could make for her.  She had a chicken breast and fries, and she loved it.  Most everyone at the table had burgers and fries, which were pretty great, and the sauce options for dipping were awesome.  I had the Beijing Salad.  It was huge and like nothing I have had anywhere else.  Very spicy, but the waitress offered Ranch to cool me down.  I love hot, so it was very good for me.  We sat outside, and it reminded me of being in Baja.  Loved it. I will go back again.

I got animal style fries, my husband got the southwest burger. We drank their special drinks sweet samarozjia, bochys brew and a bloody mary (it comes with bacon). Everthing was exception waiters were so helpful and friendly, food was delicious and atmosphere was great!

I had heard several people rave about this place,  so my family and I decided to give it a try while out in the area tonight. 

The raves were justified.  While I am not a red meat eater, the menu caters to all types.  Veggie burgers,  chicken burgers,  chorizo burgers and of course good old fashioned beef burgers. 

I had a turkey Hawaiian burger on a pretzel bun with Jamaican corn.  They were simply incredible and complimented each other perfectly.   My wife had the turkey bacon cheeseburger with onion rings.  The onion rings were huge and flavorful. 

Our server CW was prompt, efficient and helpful.   When we were done,  we all agreed it would be worth the 30 minute v drive to go there again.

The service out of the kitchen is horrible.  We waited 20 minutes for appetizers, and 1 hour for 3 hamburgers.  Really, it's just a burger.  There's no excuse for an hour wait.  The waitress took 20 minutes bringing our drink orders over to the table, and by the time they arrived, the ice was melted, the beers were warm. When someone commented on the wait for the drinks, she made them feel as if it was our fault.  Rude, unprofessional, burgers poorly cooked.  Far too long a wait, and the price too high.  McDonalds would have been a better choice than this poseur of a "hip" restaurant.  If you want to pay too much for a burger, have shitty service, and a lackluster kitchen, by all means, waste your money here.

This place is delicious! I had got the PBJ and Bacon burger and my hubby had ordered the Hawaiian Burger. They both were big and delicious. They had outside and indoor seating. It seems to be consistently busy. I would recommend this place !

If you've read my reviews, you know I am in an endless search for a burger as good as Indulge Burger, which closed and broke my heart. I have heard really amazing things about this place from a lot of my friends. Although I prefer to only eat natural, antibiotic free, grass fed meat, the feedback on this place was so great I knew I had to give it a try. The location is great and parking not too bad. We didn't have to wait to be seated. Once we were seated though, it was 40 minutes before we got our food, which felt like a really long time. Our waitress was a really nice laid back lady, and the other staff seemed really nice. Sadly, my cheeseburger was good, but not amazing. I loved the bun and the meat was good, but it just kind of was like most other burgers, flavored with pepper. The fries were very good, but not quite amazing. The shake came out and was the consistency of chocolate milk, so I asked them to remake it. It came out thicker and colder, but was average, not great. 

Maybe I just am holding everything up to a standard from a place that I can't have anymore :) I will have to give this place a try again another day.

This place is amazing!!!!!! I've been going here for almost 5 years and never been disappointed. Best burgers specially Mac cheese burger HEAVEN. I absolutely recommend this place and whoever we took with us to this place, been satisfied as well! Like I said HEAVEN

Came here because if the reviews. Waited a short time and sat in the communal table. If you don't like sitting next to a stranger eating don't come here. Ordered the pb&j berger and split it with my younger son. Older boy ordered a plain burger and my husband order a spicy burger (can't remember the name). The burgers came with a huge plate of fries. The server was attentive and very interested if we like the peanut butter and jelly burger. It was fabulous. I know it sounds gross but it was super yummy. Everyone loved the burgers and we almost finished them. Lotsa stuff on the walls to entertain and play I spy. Next time I'm in Scottsdale again I will definitely come back!!

I have only been here once, but will surely be back! I'd be a regular if I lived or worked in the area. I can't remember what my burger was called, but it was the one with blue cheese. When someone orders a blue cheese burger, it's because they LOVE blue cheese and lots of it. This one did not disappoint in any way, shape or form! I wanted to cry over not being able to finish it from lack of stomach space (I tried really hard though). The sweet potato tots were really good with the pineapple sauce. I also had a VERY generous "Mike Tai" (their spin on the Mai Tai). I love it when a place gives you a drink you can feel! The service was outstanding and it seemed the owners were there working too (I can usually tell). They clearly have a lot of pride in their restaurant.

Now that the review of MY awesome experience is over with, I will say that my boyfriend's burger wasn't as good. He was a huge fan of this place already, so it's no big deal, BUT... the waitress that talks up the PB&J burger really should stop (I'm not the only Yelper who thinks so). Some things are an aquired taste. I love Braunschweiger but that doesn't mean I'd recommend it to everyone. The PB&J burger SOUNDED intriguing, but it just did not work for him. He really didn't like it at all and neither did I (of course I tried it!). It was also incredibly messy.

Beachy vibes and good burgers (including turkey and veggie menu options). The staff here (especially the waitresses) are incredibly personable and witty.  Would definitely recommend this place. Awesome service! Stop by if you're walking through Old-Town, and visit often.  We need cute, and fun places to stay downtown.  

And they have a patio!  Would be perfect to come here during the evening to have a few beers and hang out.

I went here on the 24th of Feb and the place was packed. The decor is awesome and the vibe is hip. The entire staff was friendly and met my needs. I thought the burger was ok. I was expecting a much better burger for the $13.00 price I paid. I went here because of all the great yelp reviews, however was a little disappointed. I will be back to try a different burger to see if it changes my thoughts on the food.

Loved this place - particularly the PB&J burger. Probably the most unique take on a burger I've seen, and not weird unique - like absolutely unexpectedly wonderful unique. 

Came here with a bunch of co-workers. As usual I couldn't decide on just one thing, so I split two burgers with a co-worker/buddy of mine: the PB&J burger, and the turkey burger.

I believe we got the PB&J on a prezel bun, and the other one on a focaccia. The turkey burger was pretty good (it's main characteristic was the massive 10 oz patty), but it was the PB&J burger that really shone. It mingled sweet and savory, with the textures of tender beef, hearty but soft/moist prezel bun, light jelly and hearty peanut butter into what I can only describe as a culinary journey to another world. 

It was gone before I could fully process what I was eating. 

Of course the sweet potato fries and the whole host of unique dipping sauces was great.

The other star of the night was the pot brownie (no there isn't pot it in), but IT'S in a large pot... of marshmallows, brownie, caramel, ice-cream... just overwhelming delicious and excess. 

Finally, there was a well rounded and delicious selection of beers. 

Definitely make the trip if you can.

The food is great. Their service on the other hand is horrendous. When I come it seems the employees do not know what is going on. They need to work on their structure to ensure each customer is attended accordingly. This will be my last time coming here.

We loved this place!!!  DELICIOUS burgers!!  I had the relapse size (5 oz) Porkster Burger, which is a burger with a TON of spicy pulled pork on top on a brioche bun. It was holy yum. I got sweet potato tots for the side and I appreciated how their sweetness cooled off the spiciness of the barbecue sauce. My husband got the rehab size (10 oz) Jalepeño Popper Burger with fries and he loved it. Service was great, all the staff was friendly, the music was good and not too loud - great place for our dinner!!!

Great burgers!   Cooked to perfection and incredibly nice service every time we go.  

The only thing I would warn about is their skillet brownie. It tastes like a charred burger because I'm assuming they use the same skillets for their brownies as they do their meat...so that was a little weird, but everything else made up for it.

Been here 3 times. First two were ok, but never going again after my last visit! In a nutshell - horrible service, cold burgers, no AC! This place has gone downhill ... Don't be fooled by the old reviews and ratings!
Salad was incredible, but probably twice as large as it needed to be. Flavors were great but a little spicy. Prices normal.
Excellent delicious and more than ample serving sizes for the burger,  chicken sandwich and salad we ordered.  If you're hungry go here!

"H-hey, man. Cou'I cop a bite of that? Nah, nah I ain't fiendin'! I mean, y-you know I got you next time..."

You tell yourself, "I could stop any time I wanted to." But you don't. You don't want to stop.

And this is how it starts.

You KNOW most people get just a cheeseburger OR a BBQ pulled pork sandwich, but you had to go and mix them, and now you can't go back. The interaction of ChB and B2Q coursing through your veins gives you the kind of rush that keeps you up at night. Your friends don't understand, but how could they?

"Just one more porkster burger... people do it all the time, right?" Once you've inevitably built up a tolerance to the BBQ pork-topped cheeseburger, and you're jonesin' for more, Rehab is there. You can start doing 10 oz. of patty a day instead of 5 oz. like it's nothin'.

As you spiral further and further out of control, speedballs of sweet potato tots mixed with BBQ pork, pineapple aoli, pretzel rolls, and brioche buns... the kinda shit you'd only heard about... it's all a part of your daily routine.

One day you're a successful young hopeful, the next you're pulling tricks for porksters.

Warning: Rehab once, Relapse forever.

I guess if you like burgers this is your place! They have really really great potatoes!! There veggie burger was alright but would i go back I don't know! Service was pretty good! But my partner enjoyed His!!

Rehab burger is my favourite burger joint in the Valley. My first visit was at the Scottsdale location and I was so excited to see signs for this place opening. I waited and waited... but still no burgers. Finally, months after they started construction, they were open!!! I was thrilled. I had high expectations and they've been met with every visit.

First the Food: Every burger provides mouthfuls of flavour and happiness. My favourite is the PB+J+Sriracha burger. It's messy, but it is AMAZING. I could eat this everyday. But... I probably shouldn't. Right? Also high on my least: the mac and cheese burger, the Hawaiian burger, and the poppers burger. All so good. 

There are two sizes. If you're into sharing, get the bigger burger and split it. It'll be more than enough food. 

Pretzel buns are the way to go. Dense and chewy, and oh so delicious. 

Also, sweet potato tots? Just say yes. Unless you like normal potatoes. They're good too.

Service: they're dressed in Hawaiian shirts. These guys are chill. 

Come and get a burger, you won't regret it.
Great atmosphere and great food. Burgers are really good, good beer selection, but the sweet potato tater tots are the best thing there!

Amazing!  Don't be afraid to leave your comfort zone.  I have wandered around the menu and have never been disappointed.  This is my go to place for a burger and beer (or 3).  A word of advice when deciding on relapse or rehab sizes (Rehab 10oz & Relapse 5oz)  - unless you are a competitive food eater avoid the rehab especially if you plan to have a beer or 3. 

If you can only go here once try the PBJ & Bacon Burger on the pretzel bun. Don't be afraid you coward!  Order the damn PBJ & Bacon Burger.

Rehab seems to be the answer to all my burger prayers. Huge portions, and the food is amazing. There can be a bit of a wait sometimes, and I'm actually not sure about the reservation policy. I have a really hard time deciding what I want because everything is so good. Seriously. The Mac n Cheese is awesome. I live further away from Rehab now, but I am already looking forward to my next trip there.

I went here for dinner with my mom and dad after seeing it earlier in the day. Our waitress Tina was amazing ask for her. We started off ordering the chicken wings (mixing 2 sauces medium/gold medal sauce) they were absolutely unbelievable! So we were pretty excited about the burgers we had ordered. I ordered a Backyard BBQ burger and it was fantastic. Cooked perfectly, great flavor, piping hot, and very well played. My mom got the hangover burger and my dad got the mushroom and Swiss burger.  They absolutely loved them. We went to Cold Beers and Cheeseburgers several days ago and Rehab Burger Therapy absolutely smashes that place. If your in old town Scottsdale and you want a good little hole in the wall feeling place go to Rehab you won't regret that decision.

When I want a big juicy burger, this is the place I go to! They have some tasty calamari to start off the meal and a fabulous selection of burgers to follow. My favorite is the hangover burger, and let me warn you, it gets messy! If you have no fear getting messy whilst eating, then that's the burger for you. Their fries are always crispy and delicious, not to mention they have a great dipping sauce (sriracha sauce!!).

On a day out splurging with a group of friends, we decided burgers were the way to go! What we received was much more than a burger it was a fantastic experience all the way around.

We bombarded this place bathing suits, pool hair, and flip flops and fit in like they made the place for us.  Super laid back, beachy, bicycle on the boardwalk feel.  Absolutely opposite of what we are used to in Scottsdale, thank you for the breath of fresh air....literally.....great open air feel with patio a patio as well.

This place was busy so accommodating 6 may have not been easy, but the owner made it happen. ( The owner alone deserves  5 stars) alright enough gushing... The Food!!!!

We ordered the chili con Fritos appetizer Fritos smothered in just spicy enough chili with cheese and sour cream...terrific!
Rodrigo Da Vinci salad~ zesty and creamy with huge chunks of Chicken.  Peppers onions, jalapeños!  Enough for all 6 to share 
The tractor pull burger ~burger was cooked perfect medium and the Pulled pork on top was fall apart and rich with BBQ goodness.
The PB&J Burger~ Ummmmm.. Go try this, I don't want to ruin the movie by telling you the best parts!
The McGnarly~ burger cooked perfect again, it is along the lines of a Big Mac.....yet so deliciously done right.
The Tuna fish sandwich~ the tuna salad was loaded with celery and onions.  It was fresh and cold and literally stood a foot high! It was a masterpiece made by cooks who show they care about what comes to your table!

I'm not usually this long winded, but if only one person sees how right these people have got it because they've read my babblings than hooray!
Absolutely love ALL the burgers at Rehab and the wait staff, management and owners I've encountered on my numerous visits have been awesome!

I was apprehensive about going there because it is on the other side of the valley and is a burger place.  I had no idea it was as good as the other reviews had provided and well worth the drive.  The atmosphere was great, staff was attentive, and manager really did show up at the table.  The beer was as cold and plentiful as identified, with all the favorites represented.  

The food was spectacular and I had the Hangover, with my wife having the Pablo, which was also awesome.  Who knew?

MMMMMooooo tasty sad cows. Very sorry mr cow but you're so tasty and this joint makes it so much more delicious ... :( Please do not go vegan for sake of the tastiness happening here.

Only issue is it's a bit dingy and the waitress seemed uninterested in the quality fo our experience, but actions comiserate said tip.

Don't order the 5oz burger because their buns are the same ones they use for the 10oz burgers. If you like bread order this burger... The bread smothers the burger. Tried the Mushroom Swiss... The tots are good though... The 10oz burgers look good and will give it another try
Burgers at Rehab Burger Therapy are just what the doctor ordered! Scrumptious!

I'm very shocked at all these nice reviews because mine is not so nice. Came here for first time expecting a great experience and great food and my trip was not even close to great. Out waitress basically forgot about us and even took care of the table next to us and never checked in. We had to ask another worker for the check. The waitress came to cash us out and never once apologized for disappearing on us. 

She wrote my order wrong and therefore gave the the bigger burger and charged me for it too- even though I ordered the smaller one. I can't believe I actually paid the check, I wanted to leave so quickly since the food and the service was so horrible. I will not be back! :(
Amazing and Yummy. Mac and cheese burger with bacon and a turkey party. Good night!!! Love it. Our server was bomb too.

Ok, you know how sometimes when you eat a burger you think I need a little more...just a few more bites? Well, that did not happen here! I ordered the 10 oz bacon bleu burger on the pretzel bun and it was huge! I got the onion rings and they are amazing compared to other places. I also tried the fries with the spicy ketchup which our server told us is based in habanero and it had the perfect amount of kick. If you want a good burger, give Rehab Burger a chance. By the way, never go into other places named rehab because A. Quitting is for wussies and B. The food isnt as tasty!

Great place for beers and a burger that's above the normal.

I writing this months after the visit- I remember a great bartender and enjoyable people on either side of me at the bar. With a couple good beers- not much else is needed.

Cheers!

So happy we found this place!  Great food, great atmosphere & Great waitstaff!  Loved that our waiter suggested to try the PB&J burger as an appetizer with sweet potatoes fries. It's fabulous!  PB&J with burger, bacon, sriracha sauce on a pretzel bun.  We will be back!

Service at the bar was great.  I ordered the spicy mac and cheese burger substituted a veggie patty and forgot to tell them to hold the bacon but the kitchen caught it and asked me before the order was done which was great teamwork because I didn't want the bacon.  I definitely recommend the pretzel bun and the side salad was clean and fresh.  I love that they will do any of the burgers vegetarian.  All and all if you are looking for a delicious gut bomb with great service look no further. :)

Legit, legit, legit! Could be one of the BEST burger spots I have ever eaten at. Ate there twice on our recent trip. Went Ghost Burger the 1st night! Money, can't go wrong. Then went PB&J burger 2nd visit. Before you say "huh PB&J"? It's a MUST try. The flavors mix together to provide an outstanding burger!! Modelo's were on happy hour from open to close too! $1.50 a beer, can't beat it! If You haven't been, go! You won't be disappointed

This place rocks!  I had a bacon cheeseburger on a pretzel bun with half fries and half sweet potato taters. All were flavorful and super yummy. The burger was amazing with the right balance of cheese and crispy bacon. Try the chipotle spicy aioli. It's wonderful on the burger. Lauren was my server and she was attentive, provided great service and smiled the whole time. It was a great dining experience. It's now my fav burger joint in Scottsdale.

OMG. I have never had better chili than what was on the Chili Cheeseburger at Rehab!! It was amazing!! Everything was great including the service. Our server helped us out with what to order from what kind of sauce to what kind of fries we should get!! He was such a great help. 

I had the Chili Cheeseburger with the Sweet Potato fries. I also got the Chipotle Ranch sauce and the Pesto Aoli. So good!! 

We also had the Bacon Blue Cheeseburger which was fantastic as well!! And the regular fries were delish too!! I would highly recommend this place. I loved it!!

Rehab burger totally lives up to the hype! They have a fairly extensive burger menu with the option of doing a larger Rehab size (two 5 oz patties) or a smaller Relapse size with just one 5 oz patty. I opted for Relapse because each burger also comes with a choice of fries or sweet potato tots (went with the tots) and your choice of buns (got the pretzel bun!)

I got the Know your Poblano burger and my boyfriend got the spicy Mac n Cheese burger. Poblano burger came with peppers and grilled onions plus a sauce of your choice (went with chipotle aioli) that comes on the side. Burgers are cooked perfectly and come out hot and juicy. Bf's mac and cheese in his burger was seasoned with jalapenos and sriracha sauce and sooo good. 

I also really appreciate a place that has pretzel buns (AND doesn't charge you extra) and also has sweet potato tots. 

Prices were reasonable. My burger with tots was just $8.75, which is probably how much a pretzel bun burger with fries at a generic fast food chain would cost.

Service was speedy and attentive and super friendly!

Shut up. Go Here. And get the Mac Gnarly Burger or any burger...yum.

Beachy vibe...awesome fries too man i'm hungry. Just do it.

Do yourself a favor and get the PB&J bacon buger. Absolutely delicious and they don't skimp on the PB&J (there is plenty for dipping). Happy Hour prices were pretty good too. Definitely a good place to kick back with friends and some drinks and enjoy Rehab's fun food and atmosphere.

One of our favorite local joints. If you're feeling adventurous, try the PB&J burger, which has peanut butter, jelly, bacon, and sriracha. Sounds kinda scary but trust me -- it's amazing. Great service, cool vibes, awesome food.

I love the casual beach ambience and the huge selection of the  burgers to choose from. You can select the type of buns you want, and pick fries, sweet potato tater tots, or do like I do and get half and half. Burgers are huge so we always end up taking leftovers or I'll split one with my daughter. My favorite is the PBJ bacon Sriracha burger on a pretzel bun. Today i had the beefstro burger which was humongous, greasy and messy to eat. Just the way a burger is meant to be. I'm in a food coma now.

Rehab Burger wins on all measures.  Customer Service - Spectacular.   Food - delcious!!  We stopped by for lunch today and had a time crunch.  We let the hostess know and she actually checked with the kitchen to see if they could accomodate us!!  That's service above and beyond.  We decided to take our chances and stay and I'm so glad we did.  When we thought we weren't going to make it, the waitress offered to make our lunches to go.  We got our food - gulped it down and made it back to work.  They even brought to-go boxes with the food just in case.   Now, we would have gulped it down even if we weren't in a hurry because it was DELICIOUS!!  My medium burger was perfectly pink and I want more!!  My friend's medium well was also perfect.  The onion rings were beautiful and scrumptious.  Fries were great.  I'm sorry none of us orderred the "tots."  They looked great walking by.  I'll have to go back soon to try those out.  So, environment (tvs, sports, surf board, flip flops) - Thumbs up!  Food -Thumbs up!  Service - I'm out of thumbs so they just get a good tip!!  Thanks for a great lunch and great service.  I have a new favorite place to eat in Scottsdale.

Rehab burger therapy? It sure is!
I couldn't wait to try this place out due to all the positive yelp reviews. On New Year's Eve, my boyfriend and I stopped in for lunch and we were blown away by the amazing customer service, quality of food, and happy/fun sheek environment. We had the bacon cheeseburger with a side of sweet potato tots. Yum yum yum. We also had the frito chili appetizer--holy was that delicious.

I will definitely be back and break my New Years resolution diet.

Just meh... The burgers my family had weren't cooked at the right temp, and when the waiter said he'd take care of the bill, he subtracted a total of $.50 for their mistake. They said the burgers were alright. The French fries and tater tots weren't anything special either. There's far better places in old Town to eat at.
Best burger place I have ever been to. This is my favorite place to eat I love the chill environment and the great service. I absolutely love coming here!!

Sat at the bar on Friday night on the far left side closest to where the employees punch in on the computer. My friends and I overheard them gossiping the entire night and talking crap about everything and everyone. It was kind of annoying. Our bartender was really nice but service was kind of slow. I got the turkey burger and it was extremely underwhelming. I tried a few wings that my friends ordered and those were delicious. I would be reluctant to come back here, definitely no experience to write home about.

This place is really hard to get into at lunch & dinner time, which is to be expected from anything in Old Town. The prices are on par with Old Town as well $$. My burger, fries, & drink were $14 (closer to around $20 depending on how you tip). They try to make the place feel like your in Key West or San Diego. The burger was OK, the service was average. I feel like, with this place, your paying more just because it's in Old Town, which is totally fine. I think there are better, cheaper alternatives nearby so I wouldn't make a special trip for the food. That being said, if your in Old Town & are looking for a burger joint, Rehab is a solid option.

You must try the new Chorizo-Beef Patty!!  There are rarely new flavors in the Scottsdale culinary world but today, with the discovery of the Chorizo-Beef  patty at Rehab Burger, I can honestly tell you that your taste buds are in for a brave and fantastic treat!

When I was a kid, my grandmother would wake me up with the smell of chorizo and eggs, frijoles and homemade tortillas.  Mama did not call for me, her food did.  The aroma and crackle of fresh chorizo and eggs beckoned me to the kitchen where I would enjoy the spicy flavors of her homeland. Today, with the style and flare that only Rehab Burger can muster, a new chorizo con beef patty replicates the taste that heretofore  only could be found in my grandmothers East Los Angeles kitchen.

You can order any of the burgers with the Chorizo-Beef patty, but I chose the Pablamo Burger.  Wow!!  Ken prepared my burger medium, and it arrived just as it should, with just the slightest pink in the middle. Served with an egg on top, bacon, cheese, a sweet Pablamo pepper, and sauce... the flavors were amazing!!  So many different tastes burst into my mouth, and the spicyness of the chorizo arrives late, almost as an after-taste... so subtle but unmistakable.  Normally I can't finish one of Rehabs generous plates, but this flavor was so inviting, I kept picking up that burger, bite after bite until it disappeared.

Want a burger you can truly call unique and special?  You must try the Chorizo and Beef Patty now! My Ma Ma is gone, but the special taste she produced each morning in her East Los Angeles kitchen lives on! Thank you Rehab Burger for the flavor and memories I thought were long lost!

Food is decent. However the waitresses here are worse, even more rude than at Dick's Last Resort, and I don't think that's the theme here. Maybe they call this place "Rehab" because the staff is on drugs?
Just as good as I remember, I used to go to the one in Scottsdale and it's fantastic. If you want a great burger and super awesome staff come here.

At 9:30 pm on a Saturday night, good dinner options were slim. My boyfriend and I decided to try this place out on a whim. We arrived about 30 minutes before they were to close. We were greeted by the friendliest bartender who was super cool with us taking our time to order. I love the laid back atmosphere! They had Four Peaks Arizona Peach on tap, which I decided to try. 

I went with the Port-a-Burger and my boyfriend got the Porkster. I've had a portabella sandwich at a few places, but it's usually nothing to write home about. This was the best portabella sandwich I have had in ages. Smothered in havarti cheese with lettuce, tomatoes and sprouts-all served on a delicious pretzel bun. The sweet potato tots were also quite tasty. My boyfriend enjoyed his sandwich as well, which was massive and covered with BBQ sauce. 

The decor is very Hawaiian/stoner-ish. The bartender kept us entertained with stories about traveling to different cities and the owner even asked us what we wanted to listen to! It was a pretty cool experience. Food was great, atmosphere awesome and we were there past closing time. No one ever rushed us. Overall a very good experience and I look forward to coming back and having another Port-a-Burger!

Nice ambience, great variety of appetizers, burgers, sandwiches, etc. I had the chili cheese fries - very good! Followed that up with a bacon cheeseburger - also very good. Had a couple glasses of Kilt Lifter beer as well. The place was fairly crowded at 1 pm when I arrived but the crowd thinned out a little by the time we left. There are also large and smaller sizes for each burger.

We had a work function in Scottsdale so we decided to have a late lunch/early dinner.  I was surprised when we walked in and found all the tables full but one. We were happy to take the last one. The decor has an island feel complete with the music and decor. The beer was very reasonably priced and there was a great selection. I opted for the coconut porter which was yummy. 
We ordered the chili con Fritos appetizer which took a while to come but it was worth the wait. The chili was good and just spicy enough. I opted to the special burger a bacon blue cheese burger. I ordered it on the brioche bun but it came on the pretzel bun instead. I'm going to call this a happy accident because I loved it. 
The service was a little slow but it was really busy in there. The food was reasonably priced and very tasty. I would definitely return and may be dreaming of that pretzel bun..

Visited Scottsdale for the first time, went here with 4 adults 2 kids ages 4 and 1... everyone was impressed... small place,  but I am sure when it's not as cold the patio is great.
