Hubby had the PBJ burger and couldn't believe how great the combo was. I had the spicy mac burger and it was also amazing... and I don't usually care for Jalepeno! 

Definitely a stop for anyone who likes good burgers!!

Stunningly good burger! I'm from out-of-town, it was my first time there, so I "bellied up to the bar". I had the "Relapse" (small) "Know Pablano" burger on a pretzel bun with their standard fries. I slathered about half of the Chipotle Aioli on the bun and left the rest for dipping the fries (Belgian Style...). I savored *every bite*. I drank some Four Peak 8th Street Pale Ale to complement the meal, and afterward had a pleasant talk with a local couple who frequent the restaurant. Friendly atmosphere, good music, clean establishment, and a nice surrounding area. I plan to come back and try their other burgers on future business trips!

I don't really understand the hype for this place... I had the Mushroom Swiss burger here and it was literally the worst burger I've ever had in my life. No, that wasn't an exaggeration.

It's too bad. A lot of the pictures Yelpers post here made this place's food look pretty good. Unfortunately, my burger was pretty disgusting with a grease-covered bottom bun floating in a pool of even more grease. Everything was made fresh, sure, but nothing was really outstanding here. Flavorless greasy burgers, mushy sweet potato tots, flavorless onion rings, all paired up with questionable sauces "recommended by the chef".

Oh, and our server was horrible too. Apparently we weren't interesting enough for her to give decent service to, as she let our food sit in the kitchen for five minutes while she chatted up with people at the bar... Then went right back to ignoring us after she had finally served us. Not all service was bad here, the table right next to us had a server that went back to them about 8 times compared to the 2 times our server wanted to grace us with her presence.

In summary: I'm not sure why this place seems to get the most love out of the 100 other burger joints you could hit up off of Scottsdale road, but to people who want something better than below average bar food, pass on this place.
Food was defiantly different. I have never ever tried burgers like they offered before. Honestly it was an awesome experience.  I will for sure go back again.
One of the Best tasting Burgers I have ever had. Service is excellent, recommend this place to Burger lovers!

Our 10 mile drive through rush-hour traffic is so worth every mile once I bite down on your burgers.  Great servers who always care that they get my orders right, but also take a moment to chit-chat when they have time instead of hiding behind counters and only being reactive servers.  Your cooks are always on point because the many times I've visited, never once has food come out less than perfect.  And best of all, the very reasonable prices are so appreciated.  I get the best quality burger I've found here in Phoenix, jumbo wings graced with outstanding custom sauces, and at prices lower most anyone else.  I seriously can't go back to Long Wong's, or even my past favorite, Buffalo Wild Wings.  Rehab is THAT good!

If I had to complain about something (and I had to grab at straws to find something); is that I guess I'd ask that you introduce a hotter version of your hot sauce, because I typically go with people who like things a lot hotter than I do.  Oh, and that I'm still looking for a replacement for a "Wild Wing Cafe" wing sauce flavor I'd had back in Charlotte, NC a few years ago that they called Jalapeno Cheddar.  It seemed to be a mix of Velveeta, chopped jalapeno pepper, and hot sauce perhaps?  Whatever it was it was fabulous, and I miss it something fierce!

This place has a very different approach from what most restaurants do. The nice colorful place with some unique objects inside and takes you to the ocean. I had the jalapeño popper burger and was really good. They have funny names for the menu items. Next time I come back, I will be in need of speech therapy.

4.5 stars, rounded up.

I'm a huge fan of burgers, and the food here is quite delicious. Their burgers are HUGE, and I very much enjoyed my meal. We ordered the Backyard BBQ Burger (swapped out the colby jack for cheddar cheese) with sweet poTOToes (so good!), and the Mushroom & Swiss Burger with a side caesar salad. 

The BBQ burger was amazing - the flavors were on point, the burger was juicy, and the onion rings added nice texture.

Mushroom & Swiss burger - good cook on the burger, but it lacked flavor. The meat was quite bland and under seasoned, especially since Swiss cheese and mushrooms are both very mild in taste. Not as good as the BBQ burger. 

The service is good, portions are very generous, and the prices are reasonable. The menu is extensive and there are SO many burgers, drinks, sides, etc. to choose from. I would definitely come back!

A perfect place after a night of drinking!! Love the relaxed atmosphere! Sat on the patio on a perfect AZ 84 degree day and watched the Parada Del Sol parade. Thank goodness my husband and I share. We had the backyard bbq burger  so good!!!

I just ordered a delivery, the driver is on time and the burgers taste good. The problem is they dont know how to follow simple instructions, i said separate the veggies and cut the burger in half. But its not what i received. Also the fries are too soggy.

I went to Rehab tonight to celebrate my last day of work for the school year! Also, we had a yelp deal...so that was cool too. The atmosphere is very casual, that I like. I got a frozen margarita and oh my goodness it was boozy. As I am writing this, I am still tipsy from that single beverage...wow. For dinner I had the hangover burger on a pretzel roll....it was delish! The burger was perfectly cooked and it had egg, cheese, and bacon on it...how could it be bad? It was super delicious. The sweet tots were just ok, but the BF's fries were really tasty. He also liked his turkey club. The service was prompt and friendly by our nice server Pickle. Anyway, I will most definitely be back and next time I will get a pot brownie :-D

I'm visiting family in Arizona, I have very strict dietary needs for health reasons. I was pleased to learn that this restaurant offered a gluten free hamburger and sweet potato tater-tots that are not cooked in corn or soy oil. I got my order to go, and called ahead to place it so when I arrived it would be ready. I show'd up 15-20 mins later and my food was ready in the time they quoted me. The staff was helpful although it did take longer than I anticipated to pay. 

The burger itself was nothing special, it was bland and had absolutely no flavor, they just grilled a meat patty and put it on a gluten free bun, which also wasn't that great. It's hard to find good food that tastes great when you have special dietary needs. All in all I would have been better off making the burger at home. This is a place hyped up by the locals and over all is OK for the price. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone that wants a really good hamburger. I would recommend this place to anyone looking for bland mediocre food that will fill their bellies but put their taste buds to sleep. Also if you have special dietary needs, you should be ok to eat here, just don't expect anything spectacular.

I'm new to Phoenix, coming from Southern Cal. I was looking for good places in Scottsdale. Went here yesterday, it was great! My husband and I shared a burger and it was huge! We did the build your own burger, we did a hamburger with portabella mushroom and avocado, it was delish. The cook added more mushrooms cooked in a wine sauce I believe. It was very good! Next time I'm in Scottsdale I'm going here. Oh and the staff is great and so is the atmosphere

Ughhh... I wanted to like it. I really did. I had my second visit and I possibly may try to push Rehab back on myself one more time just so I can say I really tried.

The place is a complete cluster. The staff looked stressed and unsure what they are doing.

Our server was flustered. Talked way too fast, kept calling me babe, hun and touching my arm. She was maybe 23? You don't call strangers babe. She couldn't keep up with her own words, only came by when she had to deliver something to us. Food took awhile and it flat out sucked. It was super bland and we all agreed we rather of gone to in and out or jack in the box, which is sad. Our server was too distracted with the little amount of tables she had to notice no one finished their plate or ate much. 

There's nothing special about this place and it honestly reminded me of a cheesy airport bar or tourist trap in ft Lauderdale. 
Maybe if the cooks learned how to use salt or any spice for that matter.
Great food and great atmosphere. One of the best places to get a burger in the Valley.
Delicious! Had a backyard burger. It was on a pretzel bun (yum!) a fried onion, cheese, and bbq sauce. Burger was done perfectly. Had sweet potato tots, and those were great too!

Where do I begin? The terrible service began waiting 5 minutes for a server to bring me water, the Arnold Palmer was weak and watered down. Now let's move onto the "burger" which is what their known for. Issued for American cheese but the server "corrected" me and said "that's not cheese", I said cheddar and he said yes. My burger came with no "cheddar"! It went back to the kitchen and they just threw on a piece of cheddar that wasn't even melted. On top of that the burger was "dry", no juices at all. Maybe I just had a bad experience nonetheless it was my experience. Worst $7.50 burger I ever had. Hard working people deserve better than this as are money should not be wasted on bad food and a bad experience.

Came here with my girlfriend's mom who came from out of town. This was the second time I have tried this place. The first time I had the mac n cheese burger and it was amazing. The second time, not so amazing. The macaroni and cheese was cold and the sauce was bland. My girlfriend got the MAC burger and thought the thousand island sauce tasted like Kraft. When I asked for bacon (from who I think was a manager) he came back with BURNT bacon. Not just in a couple of places, but totally black and hard. If he really was a manager, why would he serve a guest something terrible and inedible? We let the server know we were not impressed by anything very clearly and let her know about the burnt bacon, yet no manager came around or anything was fixed on the bill. Don't know if I'll give this place another

They take a long time but these burgers are really good with a good char yet still juicy. But 20-25 minutes is a long time to wait after ordering so get a drink and appetizers if you're really hungry.

I normally get a BYOB (build your own burger) on a pretzel bun, and it never disappoints!!

When I'm not getting that I try one of their salads. I've had them all and I love every one.

I like to end the meal with one of their "pot brownies" which is a brownie in a cast iron skillet with ice cream and marshmallow fluff. You can get it with Reese's or Hershey's, they're both amazing.

Meth heads are casing the corral parking lot and stealing stuff out of cars..park out front.no cameras or security on lot...happened on 10.5.17...lunchtime...very bad experience...dont care for food myself. Good luck

In town for a conference and a coworker had this place recommended to them. All I can say is I was glad we went!!

Had a choice between 5oz and 10oz burger. Went with 10oz cheddar hickory bacon burger and loved every bite. 5oz would have been enough but double the size for a few pennies more

And our server, Lauren, was the best!!  Ask for Lauren and make your stay in Scottsdale worth the time away from home!

So it's superbowl weekend at 11:15pm Saturday and we walk into this place that's about 75% full and sit at the bar ready to grab a burger.  We hope to just relax at the bar and grab some tasty grub after a long night but instead we are greeted with a bellowing and extremely unfriendly "sorry guys, we're closed for the night!" from behind the bar.  Really?? At 1115 on a Saturday night, the Saturday night before the Superbowl in Scottsdale? ????  I am neither a Seahawk nor a Patriots fan and didn't travel far for this treatment, rather,  this place is in my very own neighborhood and I have left an amazing review here once before.  I will tell everyone I know to steer clear of this place.  No excuses.  Nobody deserves this  treatment.
We ordered burgers at the bar, the menu is extensive.  We had a BYOB and veggie burger.  The burgers were OK but the sweet potato tots were soggy and under done.  Disappointed.
Great tasty burgers. I am so glad they offer the half-size version! Fabulous sweet potato tots! We'll be back!

Once again Yelp comes through. Over 1100 reviewers rate this place 4 1/2 star average. They were right on. One of my Yelp friends wrote a review that convinced me to come in for Therapy. My wife and I came here for lunch. First of all let me say parking shouldn't be a problem as there is a parking corral just behind the restaurant. The décor is tropical leaning toward a beach theme. We showed up around noon on a weekday and were seated immediately. Right away I got a coupon when I checked in for $3.99 salsa and chips. Our waiter brought them right out with our drinks.

I got the Ghost Burger. This comes in 2 sizes. The relapse size which is like a quarter pounder, and the rehab sized which is like the half pounder. After reading other reviews I knew I should only order the relapse size. The Ghost Burger rehab size comes with two relapse burgers grilled to order, blanketed in ghost pepper jack cheese and topped with crispy onions and fresh guacamole. The relapse size comes with one burger.

The chips and salsa were amazing. They use flour tortillas and deep fry them making the chips a crispy golden brown. The salsa is made fresh and has a little bite to it. The Ghost Burger is a fire ball of deliciousness. The burger was juicy and grilled to me specification perfectly. For a little added kick I asked for some siracha. I chose to have mine on a Kaiser roll. It's a little larger and held all the toppings well. We were planning to get dessert, but had no room. I will have to return to try some other unique burgers.
Great burgers and tots.  Seating isn't the most comfortable but a fun atmosphere.  Try the PB&J burger.  Sounds gross but is truly awesome.
It's a funny place - but that's it. The service is slow and the food is average. Don't order water, it tastes horrible!

That burger was the bomb (black and blue).  Would have been a great environment for a date.  Beer was good.  Staff was on it and very polite.  The sweet potato tots would have been better had I been stoned.  I'd go back for sure.
The sweet potato tater tots are heaven and the siracha pb and j burger is my fave, soo good :)

Not impressed. Their burgers are big but they weren't that tasty. I went there due to the raving Yelp reviews but was sorely disappointed. I tried them twice hoping the first time was just an off day because they were super slammed but no, I would rather go to hop doddy or in and out.

Excellent burgers are the standout attraction for Rehab.

PROS: the best thing about the burgers was the quality beef--very tasty and just the right balance of lean/fat to make for an excellent flavor. Brioche bun was fresh and lightly toasted. Service was friendly and efficient.

CONS: for me, a good burger must be complimented w/ good french fries.  Regrettably, the spuds came to the table barely warm, and they sure didn't improve as the meal progressed. This cost a star from my rating . . . Side salad came to the table looking like it had been stacked under 5 other similar plates when it was pre-made several hours before. The cheese and croutons didn't help hide the "pressed" salad, nor did they inspire the bland taste.

I'd definitely return to Rehab . . . the burgers are worth it. However, I'll be sure to ask for fresh and hot fries . . . 

Cheers!
RS

Food is really good. Don't miss the PBJ burger. The hangover would make a nice breakfast too. The atmosphere is chill good music not too loud thanks for that. A mix of people but more younger peeps. It's bathroom is a bit dirty but otherwise a don't miss this one place.

5-stars for the food.  Service probably only 4-stars at best.  Had the Ghost burger and the spicy Mac and Cheese one.  Both were excellent and the pork wings were tangy and awesome.  The place was so crazy busy and crowded that service just couldn't adequately accommodate everyone.  Staff were friendly though.  Will go again.

I absolutely love this place!  Very relaxed atmosphere. Surfer vibe but always full.  Price a little high for burger and fries but they aren't a little flimsy patty on a normal sesame bun.  I get the small 5 oz patty but they do have a 10 oz. omg!  Different bun choices like pretzel which really give it a unique flavor.  Never been let down but today we got the large "gnarly". Which is all u want to say! It's a Big Mac on steroids!  The most delicious burger I've had here but so big couldn't fit it in my mouth!  Yum.  I was thinking about giving this a 4 star simply bc the service was just mediocre   But the food is really why we go and that deserves a 6!
Burgers are enormous and delicious. Service was excellent & quick. Definitely coming back. Mac n cheese burger was spectacular!

This place is bomb.com!  So good and so many varieties.  I never thought a burger with peanut butter and jelly would be a good thing but it is absolutely delish!  Great service as well.  It is always packed so there is sometimes a little wait but nothing too crazy.  The spicy Mac and cheese burger is to die for....best, creamy, cheesey mac and cheese I have ever eaten.

We were driving around in Scottsdale and very hungry after a 4 hour flight. This place had a cute patio but was too full for us. The inside was ok and feels kind of tropical. I had the backyard BBQ burger (rehab) and the sweet potato tater tots. The burger was juicy and very saucy. Not the best burgers I've had but nonetheless very good! The rehab (10 oz I believe) burgers are bigger than my face and I had to take some tater tots home with me.

I was pretty disappointed in my burger! I had a B.Y.O.B. so maybe the key is getting something else on the menu? My burger was overcooked, the fries were nothing extraordinary. I did enjoy the atmosphere and had good customer service, it just wasn't as delicious as I'd heard. I'm always looking for a great burger and this just didn't live up to its reputation, not this time.

The service was mediocre and unfortunately the burger wasn't much better. It was my first visit and I tried the 'ghost' burger. The patty was nothing special and it had no spice whatsoever. I was meeting friends and the waitress just let us sit there with nothing to drink because we had already received our checks. I will not be back. So not impressed.
Best burgers in town.  PB&J burger is outstanding - you've gotta try it!!  Always busy and for good reason.

This place is freaking legit! I had the porkster burger on a pretzel bun with sweet potato tater tots and spicy pineapple bbq dip and my partner in crime had the pb&j and bacon burger and both were out of world. Now  I see what the hype is about. Also, the service was great. I would highly recommend it to anyone eating out in old town.

Rehab Burger has a great, laidback, beach-vibe environment. The staff are friendly and seem down to earth. They have outside high-top seating that's great for any time of the day. 
They have a huge menu and the burger options can be a little overwhelming if you're indecisive like me. I went with the turkey burger that had avocado, lettuce, tomato, and sprouts on top. It was huge and super tasty. The burger came with sweet potato tots that were warm and crispy and there's a unique selection of sauces to dip your tots in. Some of the burgers have the option of 5 ounces or 10 and the turkey burger only comes 10 ounces, so I wouldn't recommend eating it all, especially if you plan on drinking! I didn't drink here, but I hear the margaritas are strong and really good. I absolutely love this place and can't wait to go back!

Awesome burgers at great prices in a casual bar environment. The hatch burger (10oz) outsized the bun and had a generous amount of cheese and pepper slice. Sweet potato tots were amazingly good - why do these not exist anywhere else?! Great side sauces.

The burgers are large.  I could literally eat only half of it. I tried the green Chile burger. It was awesome. The only negative comment I have is that they always have a long wait. It's definitely worth the wait.

Best turkey burger I have had thus far from restaurant. I usually go for chicken because the turkey has little hard parts inside.... However this burger was amazing!!!!!!  The staff  is very attentive, anticipates the needs of customers and never left me hanging for a refill on my beverage, side sauce, or  a smile even. Everything was fresh, made to order and large size lol!!!!!
Every time I have eaten here it has been great. From the staff to the food. This is one of my favorite places in oldtown to go unwind with friends

First place we ate lunch the day we moved to town. Hot day but the place was cool and Hiphawaiian.  Cold Beers hit the spot while trying to decide on a burger as there are so many interesting and temping things on the menu..  We got the smaller size each and skinny fries and Tots.  The small burgers are really big and quite a mouth stretcher but oh boy are they tasty and cooked to perfection.  Exactly Medium!  Good Skinny Fries which are great with the many dipping sauces offered.  The Tots are popular but a little too sweet for us. Love that they use local beef and Fresh never frozen.   Overall a great experience and my fav local burger.  Got to try the PB&J one at some point.

I wish I could eat here more often.  I'm rarely in a good enough mood to buy a $15 burger.  When I am, I go to Rehab.  You can't make a burger like they do over at Rehab, unless you decide to put on your burger whatever you can find in the fridge.  That's pretty much how their Sunday specials work, but you won't make a Sunday special as good as theirs.  And always get your burgers with the pretzel buns.

While wandering around Old Town Scottsdale we decided to yelp what was nearby for something to eat. We found Rehab and decided to wander over there.

The place had a laid back hippy vibe (our waiter had an amazing mustache that the wife would never allow me to grow!) and a great happy hour special. The burger was to die for. The pretzel bun was one of the best I've ever had the burger and bacon were crispy and cooked exactly the way I like it.

The Yelp rating doesn't lie. This place is great! Small and comfortable. Island theme. The staff was friendly and informative. They explained that all the menu items are customizable which is great for a picky eater. Everyone in my party of 4 was extremely pleased with what they ordered. We'll definitely return and recommend!

A good burger but not great. Lousy lemonade didn't care for the fries. Colleague sent her burger it was way over cooked. They did offer to replace it it and took off the bill but not a place I'd visit agains.
Heavy burgers.  Not the best if you want something healthyish.  Probably 800 calories per burger
This has become one of our fam favorites! We love the peanut butter burger and the sweet potato tots. YUM!!! It's a fun laid back atmosphere. There's usually a wait, but it definitely worth it!
Damn good burger. Decided to try the pb&j burger. It was delicious. The service was good too. Definitely will be back.

This place was pretty great all around. Awesome burger selection, fun/friendly staff, and pretty timely service, especially considering we were in a group of about 12 people.

I had the pork wings to start and they were delicious. There were some rogue bones to watch out for, but they're definitely worth it over the traditional chicken wings.

For my main course, I had the 10oz hangover burger. I'm a big eater and the burger with fries was plenty filling. Really good tasting burger, although it did come out overcooked...I order medium-rare it was medium-well, but it didn't matter much.

I highly recommend trying this place out if you're in the mood for a good burger and fries!

Very cool burger joint, complete with a full bar and plenty of cold brew selections. The menu, however is the star of the show with a featured PBJ Burger that comes with Sriracha sauce...are you kidding me?

I joined some fellow Yelpers last night for a birthday shenanigan shindig, and we had to keep adding tables as our group of about 20 kept growing, and it seems like a popular party place, for an even larger group took up the center of this bicycle and surf board ceiling hanging therapeutic pub. Plenty of therapy was provided, too, as the servers were hustling, but also taking time to be a part of the crowd, friendly and personable...I like that. 

I inhaled the Spicy Mac-N-Cheese Burger, medium well, with a side of their sweet po "TOT" oes...so yummy. It wasn't too spicy, either, with just enough poblano peppers to give it a kick. Not usually a big-burger fan (size-wize), so I got the 5oz'er, which is referred to as a Relapse. A larger version, the Rehab 10oz was available if you happen to need that type of therapy!

My Speech Therapy (great way to describe the effect alcohol may offer) was the first thing on the menu, a Kimmy Special...a grey goose and lemon refreshment that went down smooth like water. I could have had about a half dozen, but thought better of it, for I was reminded of our county's' famous TENT Therapy, which is offered to those who forget how to drive.

Great spot to bring visiting out-of-towners for an original, and fun burger hangout!
Although this location is closer to home, I still prefer the Scottsdale location. Staff is more friendly there. Our waitress seemed pissy. Food and beer was worth the attitude.
Nice burgers love the music and the wait isn't so bad try and get inside to the back porch and have a beer in the meantime it will be worth it

So delicious! I had the poblano burger, it was spicy but really tasty. My boyfriend had the pulled pork burger combo, also super yummy. And we had the warm brownie, marshmallow, reece's, ice cream dessert, it was amazing! Super affordable too, a glass of wine, 2 meals and dessert for under $40!
Loved the jalepeno popper burger with no bun!  Huge portions of everything.  Our server Madeline was friendly and helpful.

I find myself coming back to this restaurant as it is a great place to go for lunch (and study). I had the relapse B.Y.O.B with lettuce and onions and it was one of the most delicious and juiciest burgers that I have had. The seasoning was tasty and the burger was cooked to perfection. The fries were also amazing - thick, crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.

The peanut butter and jelly burger blew my mind and was cooked perfectly medium!  Happy hour prices were good too.  Super friendly bartenders.

Rehab is located a few steps off the main street and is pretty small so if you are going during prime hours, be prepared for a wait.

TERRIBLE SERVICE! Was excited to stop in and try dessert. Came in at 8:58 pm, no one was willing to take us to a table finally a guy came and showed us to a table at 9:02 and a manager lady came out and said no we can't sit down because the kitchen was closed. Meanwhile someone was just coming out of the kitchen serving burgers to a table.

Great spot for burgers beer and a relaxed atmosphere. They have two size of burgers 5 and 10 ounce both are delicious. A good deal on specialty burgers around $10-13 for the 10oz, plus comes with a side. Has a theme to the place. Easy going friendly informative attentive staff.
I've visited this establishment a couple times with friends. It's always a fun time there's a lot of energy and friendly servers. Great time all around.

Funky looking place that is great for people watching.  The burger names are a hoot and you get good sized portions of food.  Although food was pretty good, I would rather go to 
The Stand for the best burgers.
Found this gem of a place when we were out in Scottsdale in January.  Great food and atmosphere.
Great food and great service.  Prices are a little expensive, but you can easily get two meals out of the larger sized burgers.

If you need a sloppy hangover cure this is the place to go. 

Their burgers fill your stomachs with happiness.
hostile staff when trying to place a pickup order for Postmates. It's not my fault you can't comply with the Postmates system
The food was amazing.  Cobb salad was a hit. Many sauces to choose from. Hamburgers are delicious. Went with the bbq.

Every time I leave Rehab Burger, I swear I'm going to check myself into Rehab... Fat Camp, actually.  Last time I was there, I managed to eat the Mac Gnarly burger, and we're not talking the "relapse" size (which is the size of a normal large fancy burger).  I'm talking the legit Rehab size.  You know, the double patty special that you stare at when it arrives, not even sure if you get get your muscles to pick up the thing.

I've also had the Jalapeno Popper burger, which is great if you're craving something fried and slightly unhealthy.  I love the Mac Gnarly, though, because the large amount of veggies makes it feel *almost* healthy...as long as you order the small size.

We've also split an order of the pig wings, which come with a BBQ sauce even better than it sounds.  I've been hoping to try the Pot Brownies sometime (no illicit drugs included - wrong state, people!) but have been too stuffed from the entree every time and haven't been able to order dessert yet.

I've made a promise to myself... next time I go to Rehab, I'll walk out a new woman, instead of being rolled out in a wheelbarrow.
Food is great! Service is mediocre at best. But again the food is great! Nice fun ambiance.
Had a Ghost Burger because the menu said limited time. This thing was wowza! The medium rare beef with spicy guacamole and caramelized onion is heavenly! My god it's good.

First time getting to try Rehab Burger Therapy. Went with this family on a Saturday afternoon and it was crowded but we were seated nearly immediately. The waitress asked if it was our first time and explained the menu to us and noticed we had kids and (since there isn't a kids menu) named some of the most ordered items for kids. She warned us that the portions were large and are usually split between children. 

We ordered the Spicy Mac n Cheese burger and the Jalapeño Popper burger, as well as the Quesadilla and a grilled cheese for the kids. I opted for onion rings and we also got fries and the sweet potato tots. The burgers were delicious as were the sides. The kids were happy with their choice, it was definitely a lot of food. You can't leave this place hungry. The waitress was nice and attentive, the food was great. Definitely happy we decided to give it a try. We will be back.

We were in the area so stopped in for dinner.  It was very busy but we were lucky to find a table.  The beer was frosty cold and the burgers delicious.  Our only complaint was the sweet potato tots.  They are mushy and not very good.  I should have ordered the onion rings.  The service was very attentive and we left happy.  We will return.

I love this place. The chicken chili verde appetizer is crazy good. They make their own tortilla chips, probably some of the best I have ever had!

I have tried their salads and burgers both are fresh and HUGE! I got a half salad and could not believe it was half! The large must feed an army.

Great drinks and service to boot!

You know when you have to wait 30 minutes on a Tuesday at 3 PM there must be something good going on. It's true. The food here was fantastic. The PBJ Bacon burger was my favorite, although I also enjoyed everything else we tried: calamari, chips and salsa, and the jalapeño popper burger. 

The service was a bit slow, but that's my only complaint.

Love the vibe and the staff is really friendly and seem to love their job. The burger was awesome. I had the poblano burger and hubby had the blue burger and both were perfectly cooked. Ian was our bartender and we will definitely go back to enjoy his  jokes and attentive service.
Fantastic burgers. I am impressed every time I visit. Definitely my favorite burger place.

Awesome chips and salsa, although the yelp 'deal' is only one dollar off or regular happy hour price...but I guess when food is as bomb as it is at this place they don't need to offer a great deal to get people in here. Due to the overwhelmingly fantastic reviews of the PB&J bacon burger, I gave it a (apprehensive) try. The reviews were definitely accurate. It was delish!! A little sweet/salty kinda deal...really great! Fun place to watch a game too!

Interesting Atmosphere. Good Burgers   

Friends had recommended Rehab Burger Therapy some time ago, but when I reviewed the menu online, it didn't hold much appeal for me. 

Finally, the other day when I had a taste for a Plaza Burger (burger with sour cream and chopped onions) Rehab was the only burger place I could identify nearby that definitely had sour cream on the menu. 

I walked in for a late lunch, and luckily found a seat at the bar. The place was packed both inside and outside. The staff was really swamped, but my server took the time to flash me a big smile when she came to take my order. I ordered my relapse (small, 5oz) burger medium rare with sour cream and onions. I was about to order sweet potato tots, but the woman to the left of me looked like she was really enjoying her skin on fries, so I decided on them instead.

When my server brought my food, she again smiled, and I noticed that she made a point of smiling at everyone. It was a nice touch. My fries were hot, delicious, crispy and perfectly salted. My burger, unfortunately, was over cooked (well done). I didn't take the time to send it back because I was very hungry, and short of time. I did mention it to the server and she indicated that the kitchen tends to overcook the small burgers. She suggested that the rehab burger (large, 10oz) is more likely to be cooked to the desired level of doneness, but I also might want to order the small burger rare the next time. (I appreciated the information) She offered to have it remade, but I had already nearly finished it. It wasn't bad by any means, just more done than I like. If I could have given an award to her for friendly service, I would have done so. 

Overall I liked the place and enjoyed my food enough to go back and take a friend a few days later. We ordered our small burgers rare (with lots of emphasis..) and we received perfectly cooked burgers, although our fries were barely warm. We were short of time and happy with our burgers and let the cool fries slide. She loved the Hatch Burger, and I stuck with my sour cream and onion burger again.
OMG the burgers were sooo good. A group of us all ordered different burgers and were not disappointed in any of them. The winner is there PB and J burger hands down.

Its been a while since I've been here so we decided to check it out since we all have had excellent experiences here. We walked in for lunch about 230 and it was pretty busy but we found a table right away. Cassie was our server and she was very busy but really nice. We got the bacon bleu burger, the cuban, the hatch burger, onion rings and mac n cheese for the little guy. They really dont have a kids menu but they can make a few things like PB and J or mac n cheese. Everything was super tasty but COLD. Everything. From the onion rings as an app, burgers, corn, mac. All of it. Cold. We all just ate it because we were truly enjoying everything. When the manager came by and asked, we just told her it was delicious but cold, her reply was.."REALLY? That never happens". This would have been a 4 star review had we not been accused of lying. They were busy, our food sat in the window...period.

Went to Rehab Burger and had the weekend special the Elvis Burger. 2 two hamburger patties.,Cheese bacon, fried caramelized banana, peanut butter, and a chocolate bar on a chocolate chip bun. Oh so Yummy!  Went great with the sweet potato tots.  Hope they make that again really soon.

This place has a ton of high ratings; therefore, I had high expectations. Unfortunately, my expectations were not met with their burgers.

I ordered the chile hatch burger with a pretzel bun with the beef cooked at medium. The pretzel bun didn't taste that special and the burger was not juicy. In fact, it tasted kinda plain. In comparison, I just went to Habit burger and their burgers had more flavor and juiciness in the burger. All in all, still a good burger, just not amazing. 

However, the happy hour (before 6pm) prices for drinks were a great price. I had the Blue Moon pint for $3.50. The servers are also very attentive and nice. The sweet potato tater tots were very delicious because they are crispy on the outside and moist in the inside. The two dips also made it taste delicious.

Excellent burger. Ordered it medium rare and it actually came out that way!! Fries weren't my fave but the burger more than made up for it. Sat at the bar and the bartender was very attentive. I'd told her I needed to get to work so a few min after I started eating she dropped the check. I appreciated that as I was in a hurry. The decor is great--beachy and fun. Reminds me of Jimmy Buffet. Great patio with misters. I'll definitely be back!
Great atmosphere and great burgers! Afternoon happy hour $1 off drafts. I would highly recommend the BBQ burger and sweet potato tots.
Seriously,anything on this menu will leave your mouth watering BUT my personal fave is the hangover on a pretzel bun!! Yuuuummmmyyyyy! :)

Love the vibe and wacky-cool decor but wasn't all that impressed with the food. I got the Hawaiian chicken burger (with pineapple and ham) and it was super dry and bland. The fries were nothing fantabulous either - kinda dry and mushy. My husband got the chili burger, which he loved. My kids didn't want anything on the menu - there's nothing offered for children. The hubs and I will come back sans kids sometime and see if I just ordered the wrong thing.
Loaded drinks, great service,  super friendly staff... burger hit the spot... stop by for some R&R

If you are in Scottsdale this is a must... I'm gluten free and they have the BEST bun... The service amazing there are so many options... The pbj and hangover burgers are two of my favorites... And the sweet potato tots are on POINT

First time in Scottsdale and did some research on a great dinner spot. This was hands down one of the best burgers I've ever had if not THE best.

The wait was about 15 minutes which wasn't bad at all for a Friday I'm guessing. Had to share a long table with another group but it made the meal more intimate. Our waitress was so fabulous and friendly and very helpful.

Appetizer:
You MUST order the PIG WINGS. Don't think twice about that. They are all meat (no fat at all!) and fell right off the bone.

Burgers:
- Spicy mac n' cheese burger was AMAZING! 
- The Porkster burger was even more amazing! Get this one if you can't decide between these two.
- Get the 5oz relapse size (rehab is way too big) 
- Order the sweet potato tots (SO DELICIOUS) 

Great food, great service, and great atmosphere. Would definitely come back if I'm ever in town again!

OMG I love this place...I finally found a place where I can have my baby brother, who has an appetite of football player, Tapout....hahah....burgers are huge....the taste is the bomb.com will be bringing all my visitors from out of state here!!!!! Servers are awesome!!!! Great service!!!!
Love this place!!! We always get the chili cheese fries and the hangover burger. Amazing flavor on everything!

I've been to the Scottsdale location but this was our first time to Tempe Rehab. It was Thursday all day Happy Hour so we enjoyed a couple of Four Peaks drafts for a decent price. My wife's Hatch Burger (she got the relapse size - 5 oz) was outstanding. The chile on top was grilled, with a bit of smoky flavor. I opted for the Hawaiian burger (rehab size - 10 oz). It was huge with a large grilled pineapple slice on top. 

I had ordered it well done and, unfortunately, it came out still very red throughout. If it had been close I would have normally accepted it but I had to send it back. The waitress apologized and quickly took the burger back. I kept the plate of fries so I would have something to nibble on while I was waiting. A couple of minutes later, the manager came out and apologized about the mixup. She offered me a side salad or something while I waited. Because I had the fries I declined. She also said, "of course, when you get your burger back this will be on me." The manager also came around a few minutes later to refill our water glasses. A few minutes later the waitress came by to say the burger would only be another couple of minutes. When it arrived it was cooked perfectly. 

I'm going into a lot of detail about this because this is how you want to be treated when things don't go right. I did not expect to be comp'ed for the burger but it was a really nice touch. BTW, the burger was delicious, especially with the pineapple teriyaki aioli.

I'm not a gourmet and so as long as the food tastes good, the thing that matters most to me is the service. This one was top notch.

I love Rehab, and will miss it! Best Mac n Cheese burger, Best Sweet Potato Tots, Best Pretzel Buns!

Always great food, the margaritas a little sweet, but overall great!

Staff all great, and the one that wasn't didn't work there too long.. 

For sure hungry for some food form here right about now!

This place has the best burgers around, with an awesome variety. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu, but I would definitely recommend an order of sweet potato tots...best I've ever had. Service at times is slow, but the food is worth the wait!

Just had the worst experience here and I will 100% not be returning. I waited over 15 minutes and the server did not come to my table nor even address me. I told the hostess I am leaving and am disgusted at the level of non-service. Train your employees better please. Completely awful service.

As I was walking around Scottsdale Old Town, this place popped up on Yelp...probably because one of my co-workers has written about it. He recommended the PB&J Burger, which sounded like an odd combination: peanut butter and jelly on a piece of meat? 

Well, I gave it a try and I have to say that I'm convinced: it's a good combo. Although, I have to say that I'd probably like to eat two smaller burgers: one with this unusual combination and the other one in a more traditional style...it was all a bit too much in the end. So, if you're here with a friend: share this one!

It's a busy place; luckily I was by myself and was seated at the bar right away, but I saw other folks who had to wait for a table for quite some time.

I have been dying to check out this place for awhile now! I was sooo excited when we finally got the chance to! The décor itself is really fun and busy. We were expecting them to be busy but luckily we got a couple seats at the bar which is open seating. The Bartender was fast with our drinks and very friendly. She was patient with explaining the burgers and the toppings. I chose the Ghost pepper burger and my wife got some mushroom burger with onion rings. 

It didn't take long before we were staring down what looked like almost a undoable task. The burgers were huge! We dug right in and my wife was absolutely in love with hers. She told me she could tell this place used real mushrooms, not the canned stuff. As for mine.. Damn, I underestimated the hotness of Ghost Pepper.. It snuck up on me and it was a constant burn.. The whole time. I enjoyed it though (However, I didn't enjoy it 6 hrs later). The burger was cooked to perfection and the toppings were amazing. I do feel like they could have salted and peppered the meat a little bit though. Other then that It was bomb diggity! I will def make it back and try another one of their amazing burgers.

This place is amazing Just as good as the Scottsdale location. The bacon and Bleu is the best burger I've ever had. It's so smoky and just....wonderful. I haven't tried their pb&j and Sriracha one yet but everyone raves about it. The owners are awesome and the waitstaff is always so friendly.  Great laid back atmosphere and decent prices too

Not impressed at all. Burger had a funny taste to me, and just didn't have the wow factor. Just not that great of a burger, for the hour wait to be seated. I had to ask for fresh hot fries because the first attempt were cold and burnt. Sad after waiting so long as well for the food. Nice environment and friendly staff, but that's it. Not worth it and Won't be back.

Rehab is in a great location and atmosphere!  We were looking to grab some food before heading out into Scottsdale for the day and fell into here.  The patio is cute and the inside has a great beachy feel.  A girlfriend of mine got the Veggie Noogie and loved the crunch from the sprouts.  I on the other hand went with the Venice Beach Club.  Note to self: IT'S HUGE!!!  It was a double stacked sandwich that was hard for me to even bite into, but I'll be completely honest...it was DELICIOUS!

Our other friends went for the massive burgers which they both loved the pretzel buns.  Seems that's what everyone raves about so I'm not too surprised.  The only thing that I was kinda bummed about was the beer.  All of our beers were luke warm.  I like my beer so cold it hurts my teeth so it was hard to ignore that it was warm.  

Other than that this place was great!  I will absolutely go back and take family/friends when they are in town from home.  How could you not love it ?!  I felt like I was on vacation. :)

Seriously some of the best burgers I have tasted.  Lots of variety and options to suit everyones fancy.  I love the laid back decor.  If you haven't tried it you need to, and if you haven't been in a while you need to go back soon.  I am getting hungry just thinking about it.

fantastic. reasonably busy on a saturday night. We were able to grab seats at the bar.
Food-
- portions are enormous. My wife's saladwas enough for 2 people to eat for 2 days.
- bacon and blue burger was amazing. perfectly cooked (med. rare) and flavor was outstanding.

Drinks-
- Margatini was great 
- drink service was prompt and quick on refills

Service-
- overall fantastic, prompt and courteous,

I was visiting Tempe from Georgia and, at a hotel employee's suggestion, walked to Rehab Burger in 109-degree heat. Worth it. Great menu options. I opted for a salad that had generous amounts of chicken, avocado, and pecans, all items that other restaurants tend to be stingy with. The salad was great, the grilled chicken was flavored well, and the bartender who took my to-go order was personable. Great experience.

These burgers are so damn delicious. I always have to get one to go. I drive from el mirage to Scottsdale to eat here. Why?  Because they are the best burgers I've ever eaten. I love burgers, but these just make me wet thinking about them. Holy moly I just can't contain myself here. Let's nor forget to mention that the staff is fabulous and they have a pretty nice bar too. I love this place almost as much as my husband. He also almost lost a finger the first b time we came here together. I don't think he will ever try to take a sweet potato tater tot off of my plate again.....

I'm usually not a fan of the island-bar atmosphere at restaurants like this, but their burgers and service are awesome enough to keep me coming back. The burgers are huge, served on soft brioche buns (the buns make the burger!) and super juicy. The pesto aioli is really good with both the fries and sweet potato tots, even though it sounds weird.

Called in a late night To-Go order. I chose the mac-n-cheese w/fries. They said it would take 15 minutes, but it took far less. Staff was attentive and respectful. The burger was amazing and not too heavy for the size. Only gripe is the price. $14 for a burger and fries is a bit much.

We arrived at rehab burger on a Sunday afternoon in late July- thought it would be not be crowded, but pretty much every table was taken.  We got seated right away, and the waitress came over pretty quickly.  We asked for water and some time to kook at the menu.  Took a few minutes, but got the water.  My husband ordered the hatch chile medium well with fries and I ordered the byob with mustard and pickles and onion ringsI ordered a glass of wine and my husband ordered a beer.  After a long time -10 minutes or so the waitress came back with a beer and a mixed drink- said no that's not mine and she asked could I repeat my drink order.  I did and about 5 minutes later it arrived.  And then we waited, and waited and waited.  Finally the food arrived.  Hatch burger medium RARE (not well) with sweet potato tots not regular fries.  No ketchup; aioli instead.  My hamburger arrived with lettuce, tomato, onion, mushroom and pickles, no mustard in sight.  I took it all off and asked the hostess for mustard - which she delivered quickly.  I was also given fries instead of onion rings because according to the waitress they were "still in the fryer," and would come out later.  By the time the rings came out I was full and didn't want them.  We then asked the waitress to change our tab due to the problems and she said she would send the manager over.  Well she didn't and we had to ask the hostess to send the manager over.  The manager came over quickly (guess the waitress didn't tell her) and was very sympathetic and accommodating.  She comped the whole bill, even though we were willing to pay for drinks and things that had gone ok.  I think the waitress was the problem here, not the food or the management, but it was hard to know since we didn't eat much.

Found this place by accident....and what a nice surprise!!  It was beachy...which I love, it was clean, the staff was all VERY friendly....and the Cobb salad......the best I've ever had!!

Note to management: great job on the staff training! I travel for a living and NEVER find staff members do much more than collect your money! Your folks engaged the customers in conversation, checked back on us...just the right amount....and made the visit very warm and enjoyable!!  Great job!!

This place excels on so many levels. I love both locations and it's worth the wait if you get there and see a line.

I don't want to go overboard in detail but I haven't had a burger here that wasn't amazing.
Top favorites so far are the PB&J (don't say eww just shut up and try it) and the mac n cheese burger. 
I follow them on facebook to see their limited time burger specials, this fills my fat kid happiness meter.

Wings- delicious
Corn- I don't order corn at restaurants, I order corn here
Chili cheese fries- must try
onion rings- huge!
sweet potato tots- wow, get the pineapple teriyaki or the pineapple bbq sauce with these
***Actually try all the sauces***

The staff is all really friendly but you can't beat Mike for a server or Bartender.

Been here twice before and came tonight because Paradise valley burger is closed on Sunday. Service was great the food not so much this time.
08/24/15- Wiley sent me an email and is sending me a gift card for my next visit! I am very impressed with his fast reply and eagerness to please his customers.

3/12/2016
I finally went back to use my gift card. It was a very crowded Sunday afternoon and my minis and I sat at the bar. The service was excellent the food was excellent (their wings are so amazing) and everyone was apologetic for my last visit! I met the owner and she was great as well. You have won us back!!!

I don't give many 5 star reviews but this place deserves it. It's our second time in Scottsdale and for this second visit our first stop before we even checked into our resort was the Rehab Burger Bar!

First of all their margaritas are the best I have had. Order one of those right away while deciding on what burger you want to eat. 

I ordered a bacon blue cheese burger, with everything mixed in the patty. Patty they make is huge! Burger was cooked perfectly and went well with my drink and sweet potato tots.

Atmosphere inside is great also. Very chill but a great bar atmosphere.

Only drawback is there are not one of these in Chicago!
Had the Hangover burger with frys and it was fantastic!  The burger was huge and cooked to perfection, loaded with bacon and delicious.  The frys are very good as well. Highly recommend this place.
Best and biggest burgers in Tempe, a must do when in downtown Tempe.  Build one in Ahwatukee!

Can't wait to get back for a dessert item I spied on the menu - some kind of delectable brownie concoction, but I digress. The place has the coolest beach vibe with groovy art, tv, and music making it work. Very friendly service, and the menu is ridiculously impressive. Their burgers cannot be beat and your choices/combinations are limitless. I had a pineapple bbq backyard burger with giant crunchy onion rings atop. I couldn't get the thing to smash below a 4" gap and had to make do with knife and fork. Hubby had the bacon/egg burger combo (can't remember the names of these bad boys) but they were both cooked to perfection, juicy, and the bun... oh my land. Don't miss out on the sweet potato tots - full of flavor and crispy good. Next time, I may share a burger so I can land that dessert. Will be SOON.

Wow, I am really sorry that I waited so long to try this place. And really, the only reason I did was because I had a groupon (Amazon Local, actually). It was a deal for couples where you get to share one appetizer and then you each get a burger and then share a dessert. Wow, that was a lot of food! We ended up taking most of it home because their burgers are huge. I ordered their special for the night which had sirracha, peanut butter, jelly, and bacon on it. I know it sounds a little crazy but it was incredibly good. And I loved the pretzel bun; a lot of burger places try to do a pretzel bun but are unsuccessful at it. All the burgers on the menu had a lot of interesting toppings and most of them sounded pretty good. The best part for me was the sweet potato tater tots. Those were fantastic! We also ordered wings which hubby said were pretty good (I didn't try any). And for dessert they were out of the pot brownies so we got a strawberry milkshake which tasted like it was made with fresh fruit. Mmmm good!!

I really liked the laid back island vibe of this place. They had a lot of surfer and beach paraphernalia decorating the walls. It was fun without being too corny. And I really liked the music, too. Some surf and some rock. While we were there they played a lot of Sublime which always puts a smile on my face since it takes me back to my college days. Everyone seemed really friendly and our waiter was awesome!

I definitely will return. I wish I had found out about this place while I was still working in Old Town!

Love, love, love this place! We were on vacation in Scottsdale and saw this place on yelp so we had to try it. We ate there everyday for lunch! Yes, it's that good. We tried several of the menu items and everything was excellent, but our favorite was the Rodrigo Da Vinci salad.  The service was great, everyone was helpful and friendly. The atmosphere was inviting, very trendy and comfortable. Wish I lived in Scottsdale just so I could eat there everyday.

I was torn between a couple different burger options, and asked Kaye (server) for a number of recommendations.  I ended up with the ghost-pepper burger, which was delightfully flavorful without being crazy hot.  She was extremely helpful, including some suggestions I hadn't read on the menu (e.g. pretzel roll which was really good).  Even though it was a busy and hot night, she stopped on her way by to offer soda refills before the glass was even empty.

The burger (larger "rehab" portion) was ENORMOUS, with a ton of cheese and a bunch of sautéd onions.  It was juicy and greasy, but in a very good/non-disgusting way.  The onion rings were pretty good, but not amazing.  I was intrigued by the "pot brownie" dessert, but had absolutely no room left to even consider it.

Really good food, really good service, and really good value.  If you leave there with any room left in your stomach, you've done something wrong. :)

This restaurant is located on a busy corner on Mill.  It's a rowdy area with lots of foot traffic and I would not recommend that you get here by driving.  I'm sure there's a parking lot nearby somewhere but I didn't spot it.

Booths are short and comfortably seat 4.  I ordered the mushroom and Swiss burger done medium with a side of sweet potato tots.  The burger comes with your choice of traditional brioche, wheat, or pretzel bun; all are excellent choices.  The waitress recommended the Chipotle aioli instead of Ketchup and I'm glad she did; it was a novel and delicious flavor pairing. 

Overall a delicious burger and large portions.  I had a bite of their fettucine alfredo which comes with buttered toast, but I would recommend against it.  If you're going to come here, then you should definitely get a burger!

If you go here, go hungry because the portions are huge.  Rehab has a fun vibe with a beachy atmosphere. We arrived early enough (11:30) to not have to wait for a table but there was a line when we left. Service was attentive with everyone working there chipping in to clear tables and get things moving. We had the soup- very hearty- the porkster and the veggie burger. I ordered the veggie burger thinking it would be a lighter alternative than the burgers but I only make it through half of it. It was very tasty. Our sides of onion rings and sweet potato tots were yummy and generous. We took half of our meals home and enjoyed the rest last night. They have indoor and outdoor seating.

I was not enthused! I was invited to come here for a friends birthday and was not very satisfied. The service was bad and the food was just there. I wouldn't recommend coming to this burger joint as there are many others that are more tasty.

Intricate burgers with a LOT of flavor! Their sauces are amazing. Restaurant is small and can get quite loud especially on nights/weekends. There are a lot of tables packed inside, but it doesn't keep this restaurant from being awesome. Definitely a place you should at least try once in Scottsdale.
Favorite place of our entire family! We love all their burgers and my personal favorite is the PB&J.  It is excellent!

Ben was great seeing us. The pig wings were incredible with the homemade pineapple barbecue sauce. We also shared the poblano burger. Cooked perfectly medium rare. Onion rings were crunchy. Sweet potato tots were ok. Happy Hour 11-6 every day

I love this place and have visited several times now. But tonight I ordered a burger and onion rings to go.  Everything tasted great as usual.

My issues were that if you order onion rings you expect more than 3 onion rings. Also, I ordered chipotle aioli and my order was dry with no aioli at all. Very disappointing experience

Best Bacon Burger in Valley!!!  

Onion rings--- 10 of 10--- out of this world good !!!!

Shake--- 10 of 10---old fashioned shake-- tastes amazing 

Hamburger---10 of 10--- the best for last. Just melts in your mouth. Delicious and amazing. Had their bacon burger but they have about 15 different specialty burgers

Get the PB&J Burger on the pretzel bun with the sweet potato tots! Seriously the best burger ever!!!! The only complaint I had was the the hostess girl, blonde, was a real bitch to us. Other than that we loved our waitress, bartender, and food!

I've never met servers who were so friendly, patient, and just overall cool people.  

Burgers are excellent. I've had the chilli and mushroom swiss and they were both exquisite. 

Sweet potato tots are mediocre.  I prefer the fries.

Came in simply because it was close to my hotel. Tucked away just off Indian School road, you wouldn't expect such a gem behind a simple, friendly facade. Themed like a Hawaiian dive, it is anything but. The staff was friendly, the music was always reggae, and the air conditioning was a kiss compared to the dry, desert heat outside.

I had the Know Poblano burger (small) with sweet poTOToes, caramel milkshake on the side. Delicious all around. The owner gave me some 1:1 service, suggesting the spicy ketchup, coming out also with a teriyaki dip as well. I can only recommend this place and will definitely be coming back next time I'm in AZ.

My 13 yr old son and I went here today for lunch.  He was craving a big burger.  I was craving a relaxing sit down meal w/vegetarian options.  We both got what we wanted (his, a burger w/double meat and mine a veggie burger w/no bun (sounds bad, but it was delicious!).  And, I also got one of the best bloody marys I have ever had!  When I walked into this place, I just got the feeling that they must make really great bloody marys and they do!  Yum!!!

Just a nice neighborhood burger bar!  Very low key, not the typical Old Town noise pounding restaurant.  The burgers were very tasty (mushroom burger, cheese burger and turkey burger) each were filled with flavors and perfectly cooked.  When we arrived there was a little bit of a wait and had to sit at a high top with two younger children; in the future I probably wouldn't come here with the kids as it felt more like a bar with really good food versus a restaurant with a bar.

Hi had a terrible experience dining at this location.  We ordered bloody mary's and the spicy one was not spicy, the horseradish one contained little if any horseradish, the mixer was watered down and the pour was light.  When we ordered a double for round two the waitress spilt most of the booze on the floor.  The chili cheese fries....  huge portion of not delicious.  Canned cheese product, kidney beans, and marinara sauce.  We nibbled on these for 30 minutes waiting on our burgers while they severed the rest of the restaurant.  By the time our main course arrived, we were so unhappy they comped our meal and we left.  My hamburger was raw.  I did not eat it, but I shudder to think what would have happened to me if I did.  Beware the coleslaw.  We took one bite and decided there was something sketchy about it.  We had been looking forward to trying this place for months and it was the worst dining experience of my life.  We only went here because the wait in Scottsdale was an hour plus.  There's a reason.

Was looking for a place to eat, since we were in town for a baseball tournament. Stopped here because of the Yelp reviews. I liked the decor of the place, laid back, surf atmosphere. We got a table rather quickly outside, with heat lamps. The guy that helped us was really nice kept checking on us to make sure we were ok.

Our waitress came and was telling us since it was Sunday they were out of alot of stuff.
Not a big deal. We ordered 2 appetizers and only received one. We didn't say anything figured food will be out soon so we'll just wait. WRONG! Don't get me wrong she was nice but slow as dirt! The place wasn't crowded at all. She never came to refill our drinks, the nice man that sat us down was the one checking on us. He even said good burgers but the customer service was crap.

The Burgers were just ok, nothing that would make me want to come back. Maybe if we came back when they had everything in stock, but the customer service tells me otherwise thanks but no thanks.

Had company from out of state and we were looking for someplace different to eat....we found it.  We all had a different burger. The most unique was the Peanut Butter & Jelly with Bacon Burger.  Not a normal combination for a burger....but it was AWESOME! I had a Patty melt w green chili....very good.  It was a bit crowded....but it was also lunchtime on a busy Saturday in Old Town. We only had to wait about 20 mins.  Waitress we had was great and attentive. Nice family atmosphere or great for a date.  Reasonably priced and definitely enough food for your money.  I'm ready to go back and try something else from thier menu!!!

I went with some friends and they wouldn't even let me order for myself. The PB&J Burger was what they wanted me to eat and that's what I got. I did get to order my side, sweet potato tots, great choice! The place was very busy and I can see why. I've heard a lot about the PB&J burger and to be honest, I was underwhelmed. Don't get me wrong, it was good, just didn't live up to the hype that I've heard. The burger itself was very tasty, the bun was great, I just think I'd pick one of their other many choices the next time I go, and I will go again.

I'm shocked that I have to give this place two stars. My husband and I were so excited to try it out but we were extremely let down. The drink I had -the margarita/Martini was not good at all and both of our burgers were extremely overcooked. We honestly could make a better burger at home! The vibe and the whole idea behind the restaurant is awesome but they really need to work on the burgers! We really wanted to enjoy this place but it fell very short :/

I was in town to see Jerry Seinfeld and wanted to try a few places for lunch. Christina J suggested this spot to me so I said I would try it out. The weather was so nice that I was able to eat outside in this college town. The food was very good. The burger was moist and the onion rings were crispy. The price point is terrific and if I'm in the area again I will surly stop in again. The staff is very friendly as are the folks that eat here.
       All said and done if you are in the area and want a quick but good bite to eat this is a place you must eat at. No disappointments had.

This is an intriguing place for sure. The concoctions of burgers here seem very odd when you read the menu of ten or so speciality bizzaro burger mixes. I mean a PBandJ hamburger with bacon and hot sauce? ( they insist it is great!)  A Mac and Cheese hamburger? Ha! However, our burger was pretty delish! We got the Ghost burger which has Ghost Pepper Jack Cheese on it. Pretty spicy but not burn your face off either. Not sure how a whole one would fare since the last bite of a half had my mouth pretty fiery. The serving was large enough for two people to share, which we did. The Onion Rings which came with it at an extra charge were only fair so maybe stick with the fries. 

The server was pretty cool, funny and talented. The place was packed. We were a large group of over ten taking up a lot of space. He handled it all pretty well and was gracious. I would go back to try some of their other unique burgers.
Very good burgers the only improvement i would recommend would be that the sweet potato tots were actually too sweet if that is possible. Other than that awesome burgers.

What a great place! The vibe is chill and beachy which I love! The servers are friendly and happy to be at work! Sarah and Marie took care of us and they were above and beyond helpful! Great cocktails, burgers were delicious..... happy you are on this side of town now!

First time at this location, been to the location in Old Scottsdale.

Ordered the Hangover which consists of fried egg, bacon, colby jack cheese and hatch green chili and we ordered it on a pretzel bun.

Very much enjoyed every bite and was cooked as ordered medium.

We decided to eat here before the ASU Basketball Game against UCLA, maybe it was our fault, but I expected to eat here an hour and go to the game, instead the service was extremely slow and took 1.5 hours and we were late to the game and missed over half of the beginning of the first half of the game.

I don't like bashing a restaurant for service, but this was extremely slow.

Burger and fries were very good and would come back again, maybe just need to communicate our plans to be prompt.

I will give really 3.5 Stars, so a 4 star, definitely not a 5 star

Have heard a lot of good things about this place and it did not disappoint. 

Was very busy for a Sunday afternoon and was told it would be 20 minutes but ended up around 10 minutes. We were seated in a community table, a long table that could sit maybe 20 people. Was not my first choice and then when a group of 12 came and sat by us it became more uncomfortable.  

I ordered the Hangover Burger which has egg and bacon on a Pretzel bun and sweet potato tots. The burger was huge and delish,  the tots looked to good to pass up even though I am not a sweet potato person.

The service was back and forth,  you would get swarmed one moment and then would not see anyone for a while. 

Nice patio area but wanted to sit inside, the decor was fun and one that you would see next to the beach. Reminded me a little of Hodads in Ocean Beach,  San Diego. 

Great place to eat with great burgers.  Will be back again.

Rehab Burger Therapy makes an excellent burger stop! We have visited twice and were pleased with the food and environment on both visits. The staff is friendly and the food is always up to standards. My new favorite is the PB&J Sirracha burger; sounds unusual, but the sweet and the heat really work well together! My only reservation is that seating can be a bit tight when the restaurant is busy, but otherwise highly recommended!!

Ok... Rian was our bartender... Dude was crazy amazing... Attention to detail... Burgers were cooked perfect... cocktails were amazing... everything about this place was great... Rian anticipated our needs amazingly... (no.. I have never met Rian before today)....

HIGHLY recommend!!

Since moving to LA I have rekindled my love affair with the hamburger.  We were in Scottsdale for vacation and I came across this place on Yelp - so we went.

The good:
- decor is great
- prices are reasonable
- food is great (side note - I tried the Sriracha PB&J bacon burger.  Yep, you read that right.  It was ok.  I thought the PB took over the taste of the burger but it was definitely a different taste.  My wife loved her bacon cheese burger)
- sweet potato tots are a refreshingly different option - tasty

The not so good:
- I wouldn't say our server was overly attentive.  When she came by she was very friendly and attentive but she rarely came by.  I had finished my water (prob a 26oz cup) and waited for a while to get a refill.  Most other restaurants you barely get through 1/2 of your drink before a refill is offered.  

The service wasn't a deal breaker and I would probably go back.  I think you should give it a try!

One of my favorite burger spots! My little family and I go here all the time! My personal favorites are the jalapeño popper burger the pb&j burger and the spinach salad they have. Great prices and always wonderful service. If you are looking for a awesome burger spot I highly recommend rehab!

We read the reviews so wanted to try it out.  We got there at about 11:30 and we're glad we did by 11:40 it was packed.  We had the jalapeño burger and tots, it was very good.  The servers were really friendly.

Nice environment, good location, decent service.

Food is quite overpriced for what you receive.  I recently paid $12 for a burger, plus upcharges for pretzel bun and sub sides...  And it was certainly not worth the money.  The meat was dense and somewhat bland.  It tasted like it was prepared well ahead of time.

There are better options out there for burgers at those price points!

This place was fantastic. The space is cool and the servers/bartenders are very friendly. Everything on the menu looked outstanding and worth trying. I went with their award winning PB&J burger. It's well worth the "risk". It was outstanding as were the sweet potato tots I got with it. They also have a great cocktail menu and a decent selection of beers. I would definitely hit this place frequently if I was a Scottsdale local.
